comment_Rating: Great Guy, Thank you!
Office hours were always constructive. Discussion-based class format; she values analysis and understanding over rote learning of content.
ratingTags_Rating: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment_Rating: Reed was (is?) an excellent professor. As usual, most of the negative comments here are complaining that he's too difficult. One person even griped that to do well on the test, you would have to know what the terms mean.. What else would you expect?! It's not a freebie class. You'll have to work but you'll also learn a ton.

Prof. Reed was incredibly interesting and made the subject matter interesting as well. Not gonna lie, the class was tough. But the material was interesting and Reed made it fun to learn. He's hilarious and jokes around alot. You can tell he's brilliant. If you have to take the class, take it with Reed. He's the most knowledgeable on the subject.

Okay TAKE THIS IN,take this class at another school. Unless your a legal major, this class is useless and to top it off, hard as crap. Unnecessarily tough tests with barely a curve. I got the average grades for the tests and ill probably get a B- or C+. He draws you in by saying he gives 2 pts toward final grade, not enough. Boring class GPA downer

HATED CLASS. Dropped after the first test because I could not take it anymore. I think it is really odd that he had a seating chart for 300+ person class. Such a bore, majority of test questions "which does not belong" you would HAVE to know what every definition meant. TAKE ANOTHER TEACHER!

O. Lee Reed is an American Badass. Best teacher I've ever had. he has more talent in his nub than all other teachers put together. His TA is a giant Douchenozzle tough. William Charles Hayes III AKA "CHaaaaaaAAaaaAad" sucks a big one. Go to class and read and you'll be OK. I wish this guy taught all my classes. (remember: CHAD is the ENEMY)

Great class, great teacher. Professor Reed is always interesting and keeps the subject relevant and entertaining with his wit. Tough class but worth it. Read the chapters and follow his outline and its not bad at all. I actually looked forward to this class and learning from him. Very fair and funny guy, not as intimidating as people think.

He utilizes a Socratic method of teaching, which was different but informative and interesting nonetheless. The tests are very difficult, so prepare ahead of time. His sense of humor is marred, and it is hilarious. Know what you're getting into and devote the appropriate amount of time to it if you want to succeed.

He utilizes a Socratic method of teaching, which was different but informative and interesting nonetheless. The tests are very difficult, so prepare ahead of time. His sense of humor is marred, and it is hilarious. Know what you're getting into and devote the appropriate amount of time to it if you want to succeed.

Excellent professor: Wry, rude, assured and interesting. Tests are very difficult and require critical thinking. Go to class, read the book, take notes. The material is very interesting because you see it around you everyday. Be prepared to work, but the knowledge you gain is invaluable. He doesn't give a crap what you think because he aint changin

Dr. Reed's class is VERY HARD. I studied a lot, but only pulled C's on the tests. The only people who do well are frat boys who have older versions of the tests. Know your vocab and be able to answer tricky questions on the exams. Overall, good guy but not an easy class.

Dr. Reed is an awesome teacher.  The man knows his stuff.  If you ride it out and stay with him, you will learn a lot, but it won't be easy.  Regardless of what your grade is when you come out, you are better off academically.  It's scary how smart he is and the command that he has over the material.  A+ teacher with horrible tests.  Just be ready.

Professor Reed is eccentric to say the least. He never failed to make me laugh, and he does a great job at making the class interesting. Most say his test are hard but I would have to disagree. The class is graded on a curve, which is good except some kids have stolen test. Be sure to read the book ahead of time and you will be fine.

This man is funny,rude, eccentric,and full of himself.He is missing a hand from when he tried to make a fireracker bomb.He will tell you to drop out of his class on the first day- class is hard.He'll say only foreign exchange student will do well-not true.Make sure you read for comprehension(analyze material.tests are hard.Worth it if you like law

HARD AS CRAP! People only do well because they cheat and have old tests. It is impossible to get a good grade in there unless you are a genius or a cheater. 80% of the questions on the test are like "which term does not belong?" It sounds easy but it's hard. He should not teach anymore. His time has come to an end.

His personality made me dread class, mainly b/c I do not care for smart asses. Other than that the material was interesting. Make sure that you study from the get go and know the material, because the test are comprehensive. The test are extremely hard so you can't wait til the last minute. If you are not looking for a challenge then dont take this

I thoroughly enjoyed this class.  Professor Reed is a great instructor who teaches an engaging and thought-provoking course.  That being said, the tests are extremely hard and seem several degrees more difficult than the material we learned in class.

Excellent instructor! finally a class that was interesting to sit through. Grading extremely hard, but I do find he tries to make it fair. You are pitted against your peers..and if your peers happen to have old tests, well, you will end up being average "C" student.
the only people who get As are the frat brothers who have old tests, everyone else competes for Bs, dont take

Crazy hard. top 15% get As but the problem is a huge portion of the class drops, so it winds up being like top 10% at most. It then goes on a 10 point interval from there. On the last test I took, the top 15% cut off was at 86%.. a four point curve on these tests is nothing. 33% of the class got a D or lower. All Qs on test are vague as possible

If you want to learn from one of the best at UGA, I would take his class. If you are looking for an easy A or even easy B+, I would definitely look elsewhere. His tests are incredibly difficult and even with the curve, you may struggle to get a B. If you like slightly sarcastic and smartass type teachers, he is the guy for you. Very funny.

Dr. Reed is a great teacher- he wants you to do well so he's always willing to answer any questions to help you understand the material. The class isn't easy, I spent a lot of time studying. TA's are available for help. Really glad I took this class because I learned SO much- Reed is incredibly smart, and very funny. 2 tests & final, know vocab!

The BEST professor at UGA- TAKE HIM no matter what.  I thought I was going to hate the class after what I'd heard but I loved it.  It's actually really interesting.  He is intimidating, but he's a great guy.

Reed is a great professor.  He is always prepared to do his job:  infuse you with tons of information.  This professor is the best I have seen. However, with that said, he IS a LAW professor.  This is a law class, and he teaches and tests like it!  The tests are law-style tests and very hard.  You must really know your subject in detail to make a g

OK I knew he was hard when I signed up. i stayed after he told the class the first day that he it was a hard class. I made a B- and I am pretty proud of it. This class was not about grades for me just about actually learning something from one of the best at UGA. BTW THIS IS A HARD CLASS!
Tests aren't easy. Study hard, but they are impossible. Go to class and study the book. An all-nighter before the test and you'll do fine.

Class structure is awesome, 2 tests and a final, but they are incredibly hard.  The questions are as vague as possible but ANY professor that is a lawyer is like that.  Aside from difficult tests, Reed is absolutely awesome.  Great guy, and possibly a genius.  Don't expect it to be easy buy I got an A so I'm pretty sure anyone can.

I failed the first two tests (like 50 and 55), everyone does, and he curves them like 2 letter grades.  I got a 97 on the final somehow and I got a B+, so if he sees improvement he will help you out.  DO NOT think this is an easy class, attendance is highly recommended.

Interesting but impossible, I am a good student and this class is rough to say the least.  If you are prone to anxiety attacks WALK AWAY ASAP! There is only attendance, 2 tests, and the final going into your grade so if you mess up once your done for.

DO NOT TAKE THIS GUY, DONT CARE WHAT THEY SAYS ABOUT HIM BEING ONE OF THE BEST TEACHERS AT UGA, CARE ABOUT UR GRADES. THIS GUY IS FREAKIN HARD AND AT ALL COST STAY AWAY. HE WILL TELL YOU TO DROP HIS CLASS THE FIRST DAY.... DONT TAKE IT

Two tests and a final are the only grades.  He has a TA walk around everyday and take attendance. The tests are very hard, but he gives the top 15% an A (Somewhere from an 80 to an 85 will end up being curved to an A). Do not bother taking notes; just read the text book. He knows the information very well, but he does not teach it well at times.

The lectures were semi-interesting but pretty useless. The only grades were exams (and they were very difficult). Attendance mandatory. Very nice grading curve. Unless you are Pre-Law, take another professor.
An excruciatingly hard and boring class. The tests are ridiculous, but do-able. I studied for 10+ hours for my midterm and made a 72, and was happy! I would take someone else if I were you.

A brilliant man and an excellent instructor. He takes what could be a boring class (law) and turns it into an enjoyable subject to learn. This class is NOT an easy A. His tests are difficult, but if you study the material and understand it thoroughly you should do well. This professor is the reason why I now plan on going to Law School.

difficult tests...Its really hard even though you think you know all the definitions and terms when it comes test time...he asks about the relationships among words and it is pretty difficult to figure a lot of those questions

THIS CLASS IS PRETTY DIFFICULT.  THE TESTS ARE HARD WHERE HE ASKS YOU MANY QUESTIONS ABOUT "WHICH WORD DOES NOT FIT" AND SOME OF THOSE ARE VERY HARD TO FIGURE OUT EVEN THOUGH YOU HAVE A PRETTY GOOD UNDERSTANDING OF THE TERMS.
Reed is pretty good at explaining things. His tests aren't impossible if you commit to studying a good bit for them, but they can be quite tricky.

Great teacher.  Explains everything very well.  Just make sure you understand everything he says, and you should pass.  I, personally, didn't think it was as hard as everyone else said, and came out with a B.  Good luck!

He is without a doubt a genious...Chicago Law Grad!!!  He will give you 5 mins before lecture to ask any law related problems you have.  He wrote the book the department uses and is extremely hard.  I can't emphasize how hard he is.  My advise, start studying even before you register!

Hard class, great teacher. He does not believe this class should be easy, which makes it hard to get an A. Still, he knows his stuff and is an animated lecturer. The material is specific and there is LOTS of it, so be prepared to study. Tests are hard, but they get better after the first one. Don't expect to make an easy grade, but expect to learn

Out of the 3 professors who teach 2700, Reed and Henkel are the hardest. Reed's tests are hard but everything is covered in lecture and in the book; there is no "surprise" material. Just come to class and you'll pass it with a B. He is probably one of the hardest professors/courses I had to take so far but I enjoyed it and learned from him.

He was a very interesting/fun teacher with hilarioius stories.  But he was very hard when it came to testing.  You'll do fine as long as you go to class/write down everything he says/read the book/and study a lot.
very good teacher, but his multiple choice tests are awfully tricky. definitely knows his stuff and makes it interesting.
No Comments
Best teacher ever if all you want to do is learn business law.  But if you care about grades then work will be extrememly difficult and A's and B's are HARD to come by.

I found this class to be very interesting.  I really enjoyed his ridiculous scenarios for explaining topics.  I did not find his tests to be that difficult.  The only negative is that he had an attendance policy and assigned seating (at least he did when i
He is very interesting and knows a lot about legal studies.
He had extremely challanging tests, but overall I really liked his class.  He tries to make a boring subject as interesting as he can.

I like Dr. Reed, but maybe that’s just me.  I think he’s one of the coolest onehanded teachers at the school.  He is difficult, but I learned a lot.  The top 15% of the class automatically gets an A and then 10 points under whatever that number gets a B and so on.  Extra points for attending class.  Hey, I got a B and it wasn’t that hard for me.

This was an extremely boring and difficult class.  I had to study SO MUCH for the tests- I put in way too much time studying.  Somehow I ended up w/ an A, so it is possible.  Dr. Reed does have a big ego, but I got used to it.  His redeeming quality was his sarcastic humor, which he used to make fun of the TA, etc.
not a bad teacher, but i think people would like him better if he didn't try so hard to make the class a mindbender. that type of class would need essay-based tests, which he doesn't do.

As someone who knew a lot about this topic before going into the class, I can tell you this class is extremely hard. 3 tests is all you get, and only 15% (by his grading method) will get and A. Easy to get a B though. As long as you read and go to class you're fine.  If you miss 3 or less days you get 2 points on your average, which u WILL need.

This guy only wants to give legal advice. He doesnt teach and is one of the rudest people ive ever met. He thinks hes all that and a bag of chips when he cant teach to save his life. Haha I did get a kick outta him explaining the invisible hand clause........oh the irony. In summary HE SUCKS.

I just took the final too, and I didnt think it was that bad. I only studied the night before any of his test and I think I have an A. But many people did find it challenging. I think it just depends on if your good at that kind of critical thinking.

Just got done taking his final.  One word: impossible.  I started studying for it three weeks ago, and it was still a difficult test. I don't know how the other teachers are, but if they are even a little bit easier than reed, take them because he has made this class unnecessarily hard.
he sucks
entertaining teaching method...makes class fun
horrible

not very helpful at all.  doesnt like students.  tests are very tricky. you cant argue any questions with him because you will always lose even if you probably had the correct answer.  nothing good about this guy.

His lecture style (can be interesting sometimes) is circular and not quite structured in a way that's easy to retain information. He's a nice guy that knows a lot about the topic...it's just getting the information from him to you that can be choppy.
hardest class so far, great curve!
i liked this class even though many people didn't. it's very useful and reed is really interesting.
Tough class, yet very useful... Also, Great curve at the end. I got an A!!
Very old-fashioned, attendance required in a large auditorium, seating chart.

Office hours were always constructive. Discussion-based class format; she values analysis and understanding over rote learning of content. Perceptively notices weaknesses in students Spanish and consciously makes an effort to strengthen them. I suspect she teach a class with less predefined of a schedule even better. Great overall.

Office hours were always constructive. Discussion-based class format; values analysis and understanding over . Perceptively notices weaknesses in students Spanish and consciously makes an effort to strengthen them. I suspect a class with less predefined of a schedule would be even better.

Office hours were always constructive. Discussion-based class format; Anghel values analysis and understanding over rote learning of content. Teach a class with less predefined of a schedule amazingly. Great overall.

I thought she was a very nice professor for my FYOS, which was about folklore in everyday life. We hardly took notes; we focused much more on discussion in class. You can tell she enjoys the subject, and that makes the class more engaged in extension. There is weekly homework and maybe an article or two in addition, but nothing too bad.
ratingTags_Rating: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment_Rating: This class is difficult, with a lot of reading and response papers due every week. However, she was fun and really cared about the material and helping you learn it. She tends to be sarcastic in her humor, and can come across as a bit snobby because of it, but if you pay attention she's really not.
ratingTags_Rating: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--SO MANY PAPERS

comment_Rating: I went into this class expecting her to be a really bad professor. Her class is pretty easy, just do your assignments and turn them in on time. Class is pretty boring most of the time, but it isn't that hard to get an a. If you need help with your papers, she's usually pretty good about helping out.
ratingTags_Rating: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment_Rating: The subject material (folklore) is interesting enough, but Dr. Henken presents it in a confusing way, sometimes contradicting herself or without clear definitions. She's also somewhat hostile and quick to jump down one's throat if you voice an opinion that doesn't align with hers. Be prepared for constant homework and writing assignments.

do NOT take. Especially if you are a Linguistics major, not only does this cross listed ling class have 0 linguistic information and background, she is the worsemeanest professor I have ever had. The other negative reviews are true. I was so interested in the class topic. I loved the work. She was so belittling and rude that I dropped. DO NOT TAKE

"Avoid like the plague" sums it up. Dr. Henken was rude, hostile, and outright malicious. The workload was massive and the final project over 20 pgs. Frequently disorganized. Blamed students for her mistakes. I love the subject (folklore), but dreaded this class due to her. Felt less like a student and more like a captive, abused research subject.

She encourages people to talk and then attacks their responses. She is rude and has no concept of technology. When she messes up she blames the class. I know the subject may sound awesome... but just don't do it. It is not worth it. Read it on your own.

I took her folklore class. I read the reviews prior and thought because I love the subject that I would enjoy the work. NO. She is a ridiculous teacher. I did 18 papers for her class. We had a huge paper due at the end along with a final. She gave horrible tests (only 2) but there was an 11 made on the first test, the highest being a low B.

Her explanations and handouts are almost completely incomprehensible. She is rude and condescending. She constantly expects us to know more than she has taught. Her understanding of grammar is limited to rule memorization. Anything I learn, I learn IN SPITE of this teacher, not because of her. You'd learn more on your own. AVOID LIKE THE PLAGUE!

Everyone in the class complained about the professor excepting myself. I found the class challenging but quite interesting. It is not the teacher's responsibility to hold your hand and Ms. Henken certainly does not.  I enjoyed the class and was able to make high grades on almost every assignment I completed and a high grade in the class.

Nice person. But prepare self for quizzes, midterms, and finals from hell. If you can swallow your panic and study your brains out, then you will be fine. Read everything, and if you want to do remotely well on the pop quizzes...study the heck out of the reading...memorize it!

I took Dr. Henken's folklore class more than 10 years ago, and still think about it often because I learned so much and was so interested.  She is very knowledgeable in her field, and this was a great class. Some commenting here seem to need rather a lot of affection and approval from their teachers--not really the point of education, you know?

Definitely participate in discussions.  And if you have a sense of humor, use it at various times.  It really helped me.  Essays are free-for-all, so make sure you check with her about solid topics.  The poetry is ridiculous, but after the midterm, things get much better.

She will make you feel stupid if you provide commentary to a discussion that isn't precisely  perfect folklore. Also, she is ****, I definitely cannot figure out her grading technique and I have yet to do a project that I actually understood how to do. She basically makes you feel unwelcome and stressed out. Especially if your a guy.

She is very rude, if the discussion is going somewhere she didn't already have in mind, she will act as though the comment some one made was completely irrelevant. Also, her instructions for projects are very unclear. It is honestly impossible to tell what exactly she considers to be folklore. True, she is very condescending as well.
She's great. Provided you are willing to do the work.

I found the subject very interesting. The professor, however, was the largest pain in my ass. She was rude, complicated, and very unconstructive. Her directions were very unclear, and her grading even more so. I ended up with a B in the class, but like everyone, I failed my midterm and scored low on almost all other assignments (despite my efforts)

I was scared of professor Henken on the first day.  But after that the class honestly wasn't too bad.  There are weekly assignments and a few bigger papers.  The final fieldwork collection project is a lot of work, but you can pick your own topic that interests you so it can actually be quite interesting.

I was extremely disappointed in this class. I was already interested and well versed in the subject matter, but am sorry I took her class. Confusing teaching method, frustrating remarks on papers; condescending and hostile during class discussions, then doesnt understand why no one wants to participate. I got a B+ but not sure how she figured that.

If you are male, not Jewish(NYCer a bonus), and/or not liberally minded, she will rip you apart. I managed ok as a liberal male, and I dicked around a lot in her class. However, I talked to her outside of class a lot b/c I could tell she was extremely feminist. Thus, I made a decent grade in her course, but it was not easy nor for academic reasons.

This class is probably one of the classes that stuck with me most since I left school.  She knows her subject well and is passionate about it.  She has a low tolerance for stupidity, which obviously bothers less intelligent folks.  She is tough, but I think that's a good thing.  I felt challenged in her class and I learned a lot.

most awful class ever...she's too feminist and attacks students who ask questions that make her explain her position.  repetetive and boring material.  awful final project.  don't put yourself through the misery.  oh, and if you're a guy she hates you.

Def. one of the worst classes I've ever taken.  It's a shame too.  I feel like it could be fun; could be interesting.  Elissa just seems determined to make it boring and filled with busy work.  It counts for nothing save an elective, avoid at all costs.
No Comments
WARNING - this class isn't for slackers or people who don't like to read.  Attendance policy enforced.  But the discussions are amazingly uncensored.
I had her for Middle Welsh.  She was so unorganized and ill-prepared it was scary.  Never, ever, take a class with her.  She is awful!

Nothing I do is ever enough.  10 pages of extreme detail on an approximately 7 page assignment gets a B because it's not detailed enough.  I ran at least 8 topics for my research project by her before she finally picked one, leaving me little time to get anything done.  I wanted to be in this class, I was interested in folklore, but never again.

The other reviews on this site obviously come from students who had no interest in the subject and who were not willing to put any effort into the course.  Dr. Henken is one of the most challenging--and one of the best--professors I've had at UGA.  More students should be willing to be challenged and shown new ways of thinking.

She is very knowlegable, but VERY arrogant. If you ask any question in class, she views it as a critique of her lecturing skills. Her assignments are NEVER explained clearly but graded harshly. If you have deeply held religious views or are gendered male don't even bother taking this class--you won't get a fair grade no matter how hard you try.

Prof. Henken expects a great deal from her students, regardless of the level of her class. She expects her students to come in with some sort of background in the subject and will become agitated if you simply don't have the proper repotoire of legends from your own life. Avoid unless you are highly dedicated.

She was unreasonably strict in a class that was labeled "Introduction" and is a subject many are a little unclear about.  Her grading is ambiguous and unclear.  Material is interesting, but it's just too hard for an intro class

I had Professor Henken in 1989 for a folklore class and she was openly disdainful of Southern culture -- she clearly thought we (the class) were a bunch of apes. I just came across this site and I'm shocked she's still at UGA 15 years later.

I had Dr. Henken for three classes and loved all three.  She expects alot from her students, but her classes are so facinating.  Both Folklore classes were wonderful and Medieval Welsh Literature taught me things I didn't know I was interested in.
Worst teacher I've ever had

American Realism & Naturalism.  If you are required to take this class, just sit in the back and read the books. Nagel doesn't like undergrads, he will even tell you that you are not smart enough to write the essay he assigns you. P.S. He compiled the Anthology he'll make you buy, even though all of the stories are online.

This class was easy to make a B in, but if you actually want to learn and retain material from a helpful professor, then you should just take something else. Class lectures were moderately miserable. It's a course in memorization of characters and he is ambiguous and unnecessarily tedious in grading essays.

Nagel comes off as a bit intimidating at first, but his class is not nearly as hard as he wants you to think. We had a midterm, final, and paper. He makes a big deal about participation, but I spoke maybe twice and still made an A. To get an A you just have to read the books; the midterm/final essay questions are just basic discussion questions. He LOVES to talk about himself and name drop! Heard about his summer home in Maine twice on the first day.

I love literature, and this teacher made me hate everything we read. Every comment about his snobbiness is 100% true, and its unbearable. He grades participation but literally never lets anyone talk but himself; he gives a research paper(30% of your grade) and talks about it for MAYBE 10 minutes tops (no exaggeration, no rubric). Just don't do it

Fabulous teacher. Class is  midterm, final, paper. Very knowledgeable and accomplished. Some think he boasts a lot, but you would too if you had as many accomplishments. He'll write a recommendation for those who get an A. He discusses many of the exam questions. If you take good notes, you'll write about 2.5 pages per class.

If it were not for the fact that he tends towards giving A's, it would not be worth taking his class, period. It's basically not worth it anyways. Suffering through every day of his know-it-all, name-dropping, and often repetitive lectures weighs out getting an A fairly evenly. Of course, he also assigns an anthology he helped to compile.

You need to read, go to class, and speak up so he knows you've read, but it's really not that tough. I LOVED his class. He knows so much about the books and the authors, the tests aren't too bad as long as you can throw in some details, and the final paper isn't too hard, as long as you don't put it off. Great class, I'd recommend it to anyone!

I loved Dr. Nagel's class. He was very willing to help--if you just ask him for it. I went into the class dreading it and came out with a new perspective. Tests are easy as long as you read and take good notes.
No Comments

I don't know what is wrong with all these people...Dr. Nagel is great.  His stories are always appropriate and interesting.  I think people are just jealous they haven't lived such an interesting life.  Take his class!

Narcissistic, egomaniacal prof will try to convince that you shd explore Hemingway simply because he is a Hemingway scholar. He himself justifies Hemingway's writing. Yammer endlessly about his own accomplishments or, worse, about grad students' accomplishments as if they were all because of him!

I've had him before and he is a complete egomaniac. He has a way of turning every discussion, casual or otherwise, into a monologue about his accomplishments, his interests, or the famous people he knows. Students are just objects to him. ZZzzZZzz...
Narcissistic and always talks about himself
Keeps discussions at a very basic level. Talks about himself a whole lot, too.
Very passionate and interesting teacher! His passion and knowledge makes you really interested in the material too. One of the best professors I had in UGA! But be warned, his tests are not easy.
he is ok. but think twice before taking his class during summer. in our class, he covered like 2 ch. the day before the test. it was tough

I loved Dr. Parker's class. He was so passionate about Geography and even though his straight-lecture class was a little boring sometimes, I enjoyed it. If you go to class and look over the lecture notes you'll do fine. Tests are straight forward and cover what's given in the lecture. Definitely a good way to get science credit.
Doesn't put-up power-points online. DON'T need the text-book. He's a good teacher, really knows his stuff. If you go to class and take good notes, and can memorize a bit, you'll do well.

I'm definitely not a science person, which is why I decided on Georgraphy. Quite an easy class, if you go to lecture (he doesn't post them online). But he's a pretty nice, animated guy. Just go to class, take notes, and it's an easy A.

Dr. Parker is a nice man. The class is really boring, but if you're looking for a pretty easy science with lab, take it. Tests all come from lecture. It's not an easy A, but if you can memorize and put some effort into studying, you can get an A. All of the tests are curved, and you don't need the book.

This class is sooooo Boring! He goes through the powerpoints extremely fast and most the time it is hard to get everything down, let alone understand what he is saying. When it came to exams I basically had to go through all my notes and try to teach myself. This class is HARD unless your extremely dedicated in learning the material.

This class was extremely boring. There are only 4 tests, no cumulative final. The lectures were boring just like the subject (but I'm not a science person). It is very possible to get an A in this class if you are dedicated enough.

Wow, for starters, i hate science so that doesnt help, but if you hate it like me, then DONT take this class if you can help it. VERY HARD. i had to change study habits 3 times before i finally made higher than a D on a test. NICE man but should be teaching upper level geo. Dont buy the book, everything is in your notes. MUST come to class. HARD!

this was a rough class for me.  it's just such a boring subject.  parker did ok, and was kind of funny at times, but it just wasn't interesting at all.  the tests are surprisingly difficult.  you need to lock yourself in the SLC the day before, but there's no papers or anything else so if you're willing to study a lot you can get a decent grade.

First and foremost-DO NOT BUY THE TEXTBOOK! It's a severe waste of money. Secondly, unless you just have a strong grapple on science, it's extremely hard to get an A, no matter how hard you study. He's a great guy, but the class was boring. If you MUST take this, I suggest you choose him and work hard!

He is a really great professor and extremely nice guy.  The tests are kind of hard but fair. There is no final and your grade is determined by 4 tests (curved). No need for a text book because everything comes directly from his notes. He gives you a study guide of everything that will be on the tests.

Very nice guy.  Told us straight forward that we didn't have to buy the book.  Lectures are boring and you have to go to class to get them- he doesn't post them anywhere.  Tests are kinda hard and focus on random facts instead of broad, more general stuff.  4 tests, final not cumulative.  Nice guy, but class is BORING!!!!
easy class to take as long as you come to class and take notes. tests are straight from the notes. no need for the book, i promise.

Great guy, very nice. Knows what he is talking about. Had some trouble in his class. Lectures were very mundane and difficult to pay attention to.   Tests were not easy. Not at good class to take unless you are interested in the material.

Surprisingly easy. $100 dollar book is NOT required and all tests are based on his notes. An enthusiastic and knowledgeable lecturer, but if you wanted to, you could pass the class by just having someone e-mail you their notes and taking the 4 tests. Nothing is cumulative and there is no final. The lab is laughably easy. Highly recommended!

Dr. Parker is great. I am not very interested in Geography, but he puts the geographic processes in simple terms so you can understand them. 4 Tests, no cumulative final; the test questions are straight out of the notes! Take notes in class, and you'll be fine. And also, if you're looking for an easy physical science lab, take the GEOG1111 lab!

Dr. Parker is a really great professor! I never bought a text book and did fine. His tests come directly from his notes and aren't bad as long as you study. He is very helpful and genuinely cares about his students.

Dr. Parker is amazing!!!!  Go to class, take notes and you will do fine.  He doesn't require the textbook and his tests come straight from the lecture.  He is always available to discuss any questions you may have and provides study guides online.  Only 4 tests but they are very straight forward and he sometimes gives curves.  HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

First of all, Dr. Parker is SO helpful and an awesome teacher... but don't take the class if you aren't interested in the subject at all. I didn't think it was easy because it was so hard for me to pay attention to my notes on SOIL for longer than 3 seconds. But if you don't have a problem with that, take this class.

Mr. Parker is the man and makes this class pretty enjoyable to go to and even somewhat interesting. Definetely take this class, there are only four tests and they aren't very difficult if you go to class. Be sure to wear a Hawaiian shirt on Friday.
Go to class, take good notes, read them through a few times before tests, you'll get a B easy. Not very interesting material, but not very hard.

Great teacher, really knows his stuff. Just take notes and read them through 2 or 3 times before the test and you'll easily get a B. I wouldn't imagine it being very much harder to get an A, i just kinda slacked off on the first test. Great teacher though.
Nice professor who knows his stuff. Interesting material. There are only 4 tests (no additional class work) but you should study hard for them. class is all note taking.
The guy is as interesting as a geography prof. can be, but the test are hard.
Easiest class at UGA...great curve...digestable material

i did not think he was that great.  his class and his notes were fairly easy to understand, but then his tests came from out of nowhere. he was a really nice guy, but his class was a nightmare!  totally boring and very not worth the trouble.
Tough class....you've got to study hard.  But what you learn is well worth the effort.  And this guy is a stud TRIATHLETE!
straight forward class; if you study some, youll do well
Test are much harder than they appear! Gotta study hard for this class!

Go to class and take notes and you'll be fine. He just discusses his notes every class. He can be kinda funny. No homework expect studying for tests which are essay based, but not too bad. Only three tests total, final isn't cumulative. Overall interesting class.

Dr. williams is very passionate about his field. He gives great lectures and holds a very laid back class. Attendance is not mandatory but tests are strictly lecture based. He does not use a textbook, give homework, or assign projects.
Nice guy, very passionate about Anthropology. Tests are all lecture based, no reading in the class. Take good notes and listen in class and you will be fine.

Dr. Williams is very passionate in his field and it shows in his teaching-- he is inspiring. In my class he tested by three in class essays to equal the final grade, but as long as you come to class its a breeze. No textbook, so no silly reading like some other ANTH classes. Take this class!

No textbook, but I almost with there were. He rants in class, gets side tracked, and thinks throwing in badly placed profanity is funny and intriguing. Very boring class. But the subject is so small, it's no surprise how much it gets drug along. Avoid if possible, or bring something to do in class.

I am not a fan of anthropology but I guess he is as good as it gets for teaching it.  Always wears a Hawaiian shirt to class and never keeps you the full class period. Your grade is entirely dependent on 3 tests, so make sure you do well...attend the lectures, thats the only way to get the info you're tested on.
Really cool guy. Really cool class.
Great asset to Georgia Archaeology.  Knows what he's talking about.  Assigns many textbooks, uses none.  Be forewarned.

His class was very interesting, I felt like I learned a lot from him. Furthermore, he has an amazing personality. Definitely, worth listening to, he has made amazing contributions to the field of anthropology.
SUPER!

Intro to Prehistoric Archaeology -- Dr. Williams is very nice.  I think this class is excillent to get a widespread background in archaeology. You really do have to study for the tests, but I feel like I learned a ton!
Essay based but very easy.
No Comments
No Comments
gives notes fast, too many notes to filter through for tests, also had some unhelpful TA's
Easy class.  You have to study, but the tests are very easy!

Calhoun knows his stuff. The class was all off powerpoint, so it was easy to follow. Pop quizzes are extra credit and can help you exempt the final. Tests are not easy, but if you study the study guides he uses the same questions! Interesting class!!

Calhoun is extremely knowledgeable in abnormal psychology. I really enjoyed the examples he brought to the class from his previous practice as a psychologist. If you're looking to actually learn something, definitely take him.

Take this class!! Attendance is not mandatory but quizzes for extra credit will help you exempt the final, and if you exempt you get an automatic A. If I didn't have multiple old versions of tests I would have suffered greatly, but if you have  them that's all you really need to study. He's great!! So chill!

class is extremely easy if you have the old tests but you DEF need multiple versions of them from over the yrs. from the 1st week on i didn't go to 1 class except for test day & made As on every single test & the final. nice guy but very mundane class. quizzes = extra credit & with good test grades & those u can exempt the final. didn't use book

You will not do well unless you have the old tests but theyre starting to catch on! Extra Credit quizzes are awesome, come to class. Spring 2011 TAs are not helpful. You will not understand the test questions unless you have the answers!

Get as many old tests ASAP! I had versions of the old tests and I made A's on all of the exams! Pop quizzes are EC= 0.325 exam pts/correct answer, which is super generous to even begin with since he has 12 quizzes! Get to drop 2 exams. Can exempt final if you have A average on tests and at least 75% on pop quizzes! super easyyyy!!!!

what i wish i had done: attended class more for easy extra points and gotten as many old tests as i could and not just had a few copies. I did end up with a B though! nice guy, it's a struggle to attend class and stay awake during it!

TAKE this class for an easy A. He is all about giving you extra points wherever possible. Good attendance and good grades on pop quizzes (which only count as extra credit) = Bonus points on your final. I never once had to look at an old test, by the way. Nice guy, very knowledgeable.

Had him for Abnormal Psyc. I ended up with a good grade in the class, but I still feel cheated. I could of learned a lot more if his lectures weren't dumbed down as bad as they were. On the tests you were expected to know details which aren't covered in the lectures. You are doomed without the old tests!

The questions on the tests are all from previous tests. There is A LOT of reading required, but once again if you have the tests you don't really have to do it all. I personally read every single chapter of the book, and read over old tests. But if you don't have the old tests and still read everything you could end up with a C on a test.

Worst professor I have ever had at UGA. Lectures are boring, notes are useless, and tests are impossible. I had to read the book for each test, b/c his notes only covered half of the material that he tested on. Don't take this class if you can help it. Old tests help, but only if you have all of them, not just one or two. TERRIBLE PROFESSOR!
Lectures are extremely boring and the tests are impossible. I had the old test questions and still did really poorly on all the tests.

Nice man but very impersonal. Always refers you 2 TA's and they were nice. DON'T TAKE THIS CLASS IF YOU CAN'T ANSWER QUESTIONS IN 30SEC-tests r on powerpoints, they read the quest. then give you 30sec to bubble answer, VERY HARD! Gives helpful bonus quizzes so you should go 2 class even tho its not mandatory. Tests are tough unless you have help

If you don't have the tests before you take this class, DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS. I went to class every single day, read every single chapter, studied all of his notes, but until I found old tests I struggled to pass. There are pop quizzes for extra credit and you can exempt the final. I'm serious though, find old tests or don't take this class.
Best professor I've ever had. Easy to exempt the final. Admits that all test ?'s come from old tests-- ask around, easy to get. LOVE THIS CLASS!

Take this class if you want an easy A! Old exams are essential, don't bother taking the class without them. He gives pop quizzes and even some make-up pop quizzes around long breaks. You even get a chance to exempt the final. You don't need to buy the textbook. The class is really interesting, too. TAKE IT! He's awesome!

OLD TESTS ESSENTIAL! Get as many copies as you can! He just reuses old test questions. Can exempt final = automatic A in class. Attend class for extra credit quizzes - you'll need it to exempt final. Gave extra quizzes for those who came to class at the end of semester or around holiday breaks. Book helps but not necessary to do good.
Very easy class. Get old tests and youll be done with the class three weeks early. I read over the old tests the night before the test and aced every test. Definitely an easy A.

Okay class. I found it interesting. Read the book. I had the class in 2006, I think. The tests were hard at first but became easier and easier. Curved a lot. Also had extra credit quizzes. Read the textbook definitely. The textbook is pretty interesting though. Got an A.

This class is a slam dunk A if you get old tests/quizzes. I spent $70 on making copies of old tests but it was worth every penny. If you work hard by staying up with the reading, studying old tests, AND GOING TO CLASS FOR QUIZZES, you can exempt the last two tests and skip class for the last 3 weeks. But it requires some good effort to do that

He's a very good teacher. Makes everything incredibly interesting.. but it's easy to get off track with the reading. With 8 tests, there is about one every week and a half or 2 weeks. It's hard to consistently study for this class. Also, get your hands on a test bank. That's where 95% of his test questions come from!
COME TO CLASS FOR EXTRA CREDIT! READ THE TEXTBOOK RIGHT BEFORE THE TEST! If you follow these two guidelines, you'll get an A. If you only study from his notes and never go to class, you'll get an F.

Dr. Calhoun was a very interesting teacher. He gives a TON of extra credit opportunities- I made an A because of the extra credit. He does take a lot of material from the book for his tests, but it is an interesting class so the reading isn't too bad. Go to class- he gives random attendance quizzes for extra credit. He is very nice.

Go ahead and get really familiar with the textbook. He seems to test straight out of the book instead of the notes he gives. Also, the practice test questions usually appear on the tests. So they help out a lot. And so do the extra credit quizzes...

He's a great professor. If you actually pay attention in class, you can tell he's basically the textbook in human form. There are 8 tests, pretty detailed so must read book. Drop 2 lowest tests. Extra credit, lots of it so dont skip class! And possibility of exempting final and get an A! Overall, its a very interesting class and he grades fairly :)

Great class.  There are 8 tests and he drops the 2 lowest. Also, there are extra credit quizzes and a chance to exempt the final.  The tests and quizzes are very detailed and strictly from the reading. Very interesting class. I recommend taking him!

The class was not diffucult. There were 8 tests in the semester (2 lowest grades dropped).  He also offers extra credit through pop quizzes.  Be sure to read the book because the tests come straight from the reading.  There is also a chance the exempt the final and recieve an automatic A in the course.
Interesting class.  READ THE BOOK, go to class to recieve extra credit, print the notes and take down what he says in class.  The tests are not difficult just extremely detailed.
Easy, easy class! TONS of extra credit opportunities. The lectures are kind of boring, but still interesting. I'm very glad I took this class. Easy upper-level elective for non-psyc majors.

I found Dr. Calhoun's lectures interesting; he did a great job integrating his personal experience into the material. The tests weren't too tough, and the class was a fairly easy 'A' . I feel like a walked away from his class pretty well informed.
First day of class he tells everyone he's very smart and that we should think that too. But yeah, his tests are extremely easy.

lectures str8 out of the book, reads from the screen--class is boring, but material is pretty interesting.  if you do the reading and study the practice tests, the Exam is just those questions rearranged!

His class format is the same for both classes.  Easy A.  A lot of reading, but he throws out problems, and lets you add points to your grade just by coming to class--it's a random attendance policy with a seating chart.  Finding old tests also help out because he uses the same question bank for all 1101 classes.
he was just kinda blah, but easy

i liked the guy, yeah, it was all lecture, but what do you expect when you sign up for a class like psychology 1101? he was very fair in grading and gives you lots of opportunity to raise your grade even, if you aren't the best in the subject, just by showing up and doing some extra credit.
You do not deserve to be in college if you make anything lower than an A.

I was excited about taking this class, but was very dissapointed.  I feel like the class could've been a lot more interesting, but the notes/lectures were very boring.  Also, Dr. Calhoun was completely unwilling to talk to individual students.  My friend went to ask him a question, and he immediately sent her to the TA's w/out any discussion.
Yeah, so easy, but pretty boring. really, you don't even need the textbook -- just the study guide he recommends. i hardly ever used the book, just the study guide, and got an easy A. take it.
B-O-R-I-N-G, but easy A.
Boring as anything but easy.  I think I missed 30 questions on the final but still got an A.  Typical intro class with lots of notes and studying.
Read carefully from the text, it makes the tests seem a lot easier.
Very fair teacher.  Throws out problem questions from the test.
easy, and lets you skip tests
He is the worst ever. The only class I slept in in college. His TAs took ex. credit attd. every Wed., so I'd skip every other day.  I got a B in a supposedly "easy" class.
terrible
Easy class - good professor - knows his stuff - is a little boring at 8am
Super easy class.  Calhoun could put a tape recorder down in his place, and I would have learned more
Extra credit makes it impossible to fail this class--almost anyone can get an A
Tons of easy extra credit available.  Worth getting up at 8am for.
No Comments
No Comments
Easy class... Not very useful

I took sociology of education for maymester and adored the class. Renzulli is so interesting. her class was mainly discussion based. we didn't use a book, only had online readings and printouts..Since it was maymester we had 4 tests but they were easy if you studied the material. Definitely recommend her. nice nice lady.

This is the best class I have taken at UGA. She is a fabulous professor who is very knowledgeable and interesting to talk to. Warning: She is extremely liberal but, she can support all of her claims. The class is eye opening and really interesting. Not that hard- you have to keep up with the readings but the papers are short and easy. Great class!

She plays favorites to a ridiculous extent. If you're not one of her favorites don't even bother asking her any questions. She will treat you with condescension bordering on cruelty! She is self absorbed, arrogant, biased and most importantly completely useless. If she is the future of Sociology at UGA, the future looks grim, indeed. AVOID HER!

Loved this class!  Most of the class was just discussion, then a 3pg paper due at the end of each section.  You can contest grades also, which brought my grade up when it was crunch time. Overall I just really felt like I gained a lot from this class.  Too bad she was pregnant or I would have taken her this semester too.

Wonderful teacher! Her lectures are always interesting and she definitely knows what she is talking about. The tests can be difficult, but if you come to class and take notes (which she also posts online if everyone attends), and then study then you should do fine. Her class is interesting if you are willing to participate. Do the readings.

There are better teachers to take.  Very subjective grader, and should be an easy A class but she makes it very difficult.  Minimal reading and optional final were nice, but she makes all these assertions without backing them up with data, and wants to hear only her opinion.  VERY opinionated and you will learn to just repeat back everything.Avoid

I loved this class!The discussions were always interesting. Not boring teacher and you don't have to take notes! She puts her notes online & the only thing that is required from the student is to complete the readings before going to class. There are random reading quizzes, but if you are there and  skimmed you'll be fine. No textbook,2 tests,1 pap

Renzulli is radiant. Her course will make you a vertible expert (useful both as a sociologist and potential ****tail party attendee) in family and work affairs, and she's super-cool as a prof to boot. Take it!

It has been a while since I took this class, but as I recall she was BAD about picking favorites and did seem threatened by students who were more independent in their thinking.  She also was difficult to approach if you weren't one of her favorites.

I took this class a year or so ago, but it has been one of my favorite classes that I have taken in college.  The class was very open and discussion oriented, and I think everyone ended up genuinely interested in the material.  The tests weren't easy, but there were no surprises.  I felt like I used a lot of the information in everyday life.

Renzulli was a great teacher! Her tests weren't bad at all if you study your notes. She even lets the class write the test questions- you'll know exactly what'll be on the test! Attendance is important. You also do a portfolio- another easy way to boost your grade.  There's a fair amount of reading and you'll be quizzed over it, but they're easy.

She picked favorites and obviously felt threatened by those who were more independent thinkers. Her tests were pretty straighforward from the notes, however. So take the class if you can deal with the personality.

Professor seems to have taken an instant dislike to several of her students.  Blames them for not being more active in class BUT REFUSES TO CALL ON THEM, despite hand being raised for 1 hour (I was one of these).  Several days in a row this ocurred.
No Comments

Super nice and friendly and tries to keep class entertaining. Generally requires participation. No textbooks. Doesn't allow ANY unexcused absences. Since it's a literature class, the material is pretty tough, I recommend taking at least another 3000 level course before this one, but he's very helpful. Take-home quizzes were pretty tough.
excellent teacher who inspires his students to the highest level and one that i would wish others will have the opportunity to experience: it is what academia is all about

His French Civ freshman seminar is awful. It's terribly boring and you basically just read the textbook online during the class discussions, and talk about it. He asks for your opinions and thoughts, then looks at you strangely and tells you you're wrong. I would steer way of this class.
Dr. Assaf is a wonderful teacher.  He is one of the most intelligent men I know, and he really cares about helping his students.
Not only did I learn a lot of French, but his composition class made me want to become a writer.
Really pushes you. You will learn a LOT of French.

I had Assaf for FREN 3010 and for a freshman seminar. He is extremely knowledgeable and qualified. Generally a very nice and fair guy but could be seen as very by the book/rules. Does not put up with **** excuses from students, but pushes students to do their best and helps anyway possible in furthering their knowledge.
Dr. Assaf is super-knowledgable about French literature and challenges his students.  I really enjoyed both classes that I took with him.
This is the best class I have yet taken at the University.
The last rater must be mistaking this professor with several others in the department.
I can't believe she retired!  I'm glad I had the opportunity to study with her.
Best professior I've ever had.
One of the best UGA teachers. Few people love teaching as much as Carmen Tesser. Wonderful person who is always available either in person or online.
Great teacher!

I loved his class. He doesn't take crap from anyone, he's very funny, and all of his tests, including the final, are from homework problems that he works in class. There is no way you won't do well if you show up and pay attention.

Mumbled constantly. Whatever he wrote on the board made no sense or went right over our heads. He curves exams and you definitely need the book, it's a better teacher than he is. The only good thing is he let us out of class 15 minutes early every day. Somehow I got a B, so you'll survive! :)
Hardest class I've ever taken. I have no idea what Snow was talking about. He did curve, but not enough to save me.
I seriously had no idea what was going on. He spoke very quickly and was hard to follow when he mumbled. Thank god he curved at the end of the semester.

this course was valuable as i quickly learned that economics was NOT for me. His lecture is hard to follow and the multiple choice on his tests are very difficult. examples are worked in class and the final is completely off old tests. However, his curve, at least for honors is amazingly good. i got a B i didnt deserve. I love him. such a nice man.

I never quite figured him out, but he was a very interesting professor. The ppl who gave him bad ratings are just bitter. He only gives out As and Bs (for the Honors), even to ppl who do horribly on the tests. I liked his sense of humor and his helpfulness. He always answered any questions and clarified all of the problems. Definitely take him.

If you don't read the book you will be very confused in class.  However, the tests come straight from the book's examples and the assigned homework problems.  The final comes straight from the old tests.

his class notes are incredibly confusing. read the book. he pulls his free response right off the homework questions, and he gives the solutions in class, so you want to copy those down. with all his other notes, don't stress if you miss something. no one knows whats going on.
Frustrated when I couldn't get the right notes from lecture.  Kept thinking "wait, what are we talking about?"
Coolest ****in professor ever...really great humorsense and very interesting.

I thought some of his humor was funny, but its underhanded and you have to listen for it. Quick and concise in his lectures, you'll miss it if you're not paying attention. Be aware and study the old exams.
Absolutely terrible professor!  This is the most boring and meaningless class I think I have ever taken in my life.  Avoid Snow at all costs!
I hate him.

I had Dr. McAlexander the last term of my senior year. I wish I had had him earlier in my college experience. I knew what questions he would ask and it lead to lively discussions. Yes, he was hard, but I learned to analyze the readings and still love the book or poem. I have been out of college a long time and still remember his classes fondly.
ratingTags_Rating: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment_Rating: Although not an English major during my 4 yrs at UGA, I signed up for every  available lit class with Dr. McAlexander.  His witty and informative lectures kept the classroom spellbound.  Even 40 yrs later when I read a poem or novel, first encountered in one of his classes,  I can vividly recall him reading aloud and sharing insights and anecdotes.
I took Dr. McAlexander for several classes in 1984-87.  He is the ONE professor I remember well.  Making "A"s in his classes remains among my proudest accomplishments.
I had Dr. McAlexander as a professor from 1989 to 1993. Smartest, most engaging, entertaining and kind teacher I've ever had. I think of him often and well. God bless him.

Crazy.  I don't understand these other posts.  Do NOT take Faulkner from this man.  You want to believe that he's The Word because of that drawl, but he's nothing but regurgitation.  Spare me the English professors who should have been Drama professors!  Of all my courses at UGA, his was the worst.  Kissup or kiss your 4.0 goodbye.

Definitely an English major's professor as the reading as well as the student expectations are considerable. McAlexander, however, is a very stimulating professor with an engaging sense of humor and wit.

Dr. Mac is by far the most fun, interesting professor I have taken in my four years at UGA. Going to class each time was a pleasure; I never wanted to miss. He is the only person who can curse and still sound refined at the same time. His class is really hard, but it is so worth it. Such a sweetheart...as long as you aren't a dumbass.

Whoa I had to comment after the person before me. I don't know what got their panties in a wad, but McAlexander is absolutely the most incredible professor I've had at UGA. He is able to draw the most illuminating discussions on material that he is invariably passionate about. He is brilliant, hilarious, and a talented instructor.

I've read all the postings, and they show the hype this guy gets at UGA. he's mostly hot air; asks the same question about four times only to say the same answer he heard at the beginning. bad analysis. encourages off the wall particip. he's a legend b/c people now a days go to school to get a show and self congratulations. he's popular, not smart.

Take whatever you can with this man.  He is the best professor you will ever have, and if he's too hard for you then you're not thinking correctly.  This is a valuable life experience... you'll never forget him.
Hard, unwilling to help students. If he doesn't like you the first day, he'll hate you by the end of the semester. First impressions weigh a lot with him.
fun, funny, smart, adorable!
GREAT LECTURER. Hard grader, but motivating and interesting. Funny, open, encourages class participation like crazy.
he's hot for an old guy...not really but amazing.  never a dull moment!

Not willing to help students out when stuck.  His main goal is to scare students out of the class on the first day.  He is only a good professor for a certain type of student.  If you can't think quick, his classes aren't for you.
one word --- enlightening
Love me some McAlexander!!!!
McAlexander is the best. Hands down. A legend.
One word:  BADASS
Awesome teacher, fabulous man.

if dapperly dressed (seersucker suits, my god, he wears seersucker suits!), silvery balding, brilliant, achingly witty men do it for you, then take this class.  I've talked to grad students and other faculty: all agree you haven't been in the eng dept if you don't have your own McAlexander story!
Dr. McAlexander is the best teacher ever.

The best professor I ever had by a substantial margin, in either college or law school.  Period.  He has a great grasp of the subject matter; he is a gifted and engaging communicator; and he is (shocking for profs these days, especially ones of his academic stature) a gifted and dedicated teacher.
i cant possibly say enough about this guy so i wont even try.  take the class

I had Dr. McAlexander 12 years ago during my senior year at UGA. He was the most challenging prof I ever had, but he was also the best prof I ever had. He changed my life, and I still think of his class quite often. Don't graduate without taking his class
My favorite prof in the English dept. Tough classes, but absolutely worth it. I learned so much from him.
McAlexander is my hero.

Atwood gets a pretty bad wrap from most people. Really though he is not bad at all, out of the chemistry professors he is not the easiest but his classes almost always have the higher average score than the other teachers on the tests. The reason for that is probably because he actually makes you learn.
ratingTags_Rating: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment_Rating: Molding wallpaper is more interesting and informative then Dr. Atwood. I felt as if I was digging my own grave each time I had to hear his condescending southern accent. AVOID THIS MODERN ROBERT E. LEE AT ALL COSTS.
Worst chemistry teacher ever! He is so difficult to work with. His tests are so hard and tricky and you cannot get a good grade from his class. I wouldn't recommend him

He seem passionate at first, but isn't. He has an uncontrollable temper, that you don't want to go to class, but have to, because he give clicker grade randomly. When I ask him to give example problem, he ended up yelling at me in front of the whole class like I didn't belong there. My advice is don't take his class.

Terrible teacher, Didnt teach the students anything. Only expected us to read the book and abosorb the material. When we asked him to go over some problems we had, he disregarded it and just moved on with the quiz. Doesnt actually have a lecture just makes you take a quiz the entire class. Not worth taking this class.
Does not grade on a curve great teacher but impossible to get a good grade

Is professor Atwood challenging? Yes, but this is a university-level chemistry course, so that's what the expectation should be.  If you want a good grade, prepare to put in the time. I feel like I understand chemistry better than if I had taken the class from someone else.  Great class!

At the beginning Atwood may seem very knowledgeable and caring for his students. Don't trust him, unless you want to endure one very aggravating semester. I like chemistry and I slaved myself studying and I FAILED. My classes mean this semester was a D, and he doesn't curve. Don't take his class.

Horrible teacher (if you can call him a teacher). Treats people like they were idiots and does not bother answering questions. I recommend taking CHEM anywhere but UGA or investing some serious coin in the tutoring zone packets!
You go along the book pretty well so make sure to read it but the

__typename_Rating: test info comes from lectures and the supplements the teacher writes. Make sure you get a hold of those and also go see Rich at Study Edge. He cleared up a bunch of holes.

comment_Rating: Gen chem is already a super difficult course, so you can't really blame Atwood for the less than average grade you'll most likely earn. However if you really work for your grade it's not too much different from 1st semester of gen chem. He definitely CAN be a jerk but usually, it's because some people ask questions he has already addressed/answered

Gen Chem is pretty miserable because it is boring and it is difficult to pay attention. Atwood explains things well but class often moves slowly. Tests are unnecessarily difficult and Atwood really isn't will to help students and he doesn't care about individuals... in his class you are just a number

He is an ok teacher. I had Suggs for Chem 1211 and when I got into Atwoods class, he expected us to know everything from his class last semester even though I was not in his class. He is kind of a jerk! And He made you feel stupid if you asked questions. I don't know if any other teacher would be better though.

He can be a jerk... I was always afraid to ask questions because he makes people sound dumb. He's really clear though compared to other chemistry professors. If you understand the homework and practice tests you should be okay. Do NOT wait for the night before the test to study! I would definitely take him though.

He's a pretty good teacher.  He definitely knows his stuff, and he is good at explaining things that are confusing, and not too bad.  Homework and tests are a hard, but as long as you study you will be fine.
Chemistry is not easy, but Dr. Atwood teaches it clearly. Teaches from powerpoints, which are available on eLC. Teaches very clearly, and answers questions that students asked. Great professor!

Dr. Atwood is a great Chem professor.  A lot of my friends who had other professors would wind up sitting in on his class.  Freshman Chemistry is a tough course, but he is probably your best bet.  You have to be willing to work very hard for your grade; none of the professors will be easy.
He is always willing to help. Be sure to visit him during office hours. Attend all lectures and pay attention to details. He gives helpful tips for tests!

Had him for both 1211 and 1212. Lectures are somewhat interesting and helpful. However, he has an attitude and is quite a jerk. Tends to favor people who suck up to him. Makes you feel stupid when you ask questions. Calls out people who text, sleep, talk, etc in class. Unfair tests.

Great teacher, tries to make chemistry interesting and has a good sense of humor. But you have to work super hard to make sure you understand what is going on in class. Do not expect to do well on the tests if you have studied any less than a week in advance.
I really enjoyed this class. I have heard that he is not helpful outside of class, but I really like his teaching style.

Dr. Atwood is a very good professor in my opinion, especially compared to some other intro Chem professors according to my friends. He knows what he's talking about, and makes it pretty easy for you to too!

Chemistry is a hard enough subject as it is. What makes it worse is when you have a teacher who not only does not care about you or your classmates, is lacking severely in their teaching skills, but purposely tries to confuse students so that they will drop out. If you are a UGA student, take your chemistry classes at a different school.

Atwood is the best chemistry professor you can have ! Extremely clear and helpful. He doesn't move on in class until he knows you understand what he's talking about. Go to class because of quizzes :) He can also have a great sense of humor sometimes :) great guy :D

He is an incredible instructor. He is super hard, but is by far the best chemistry teacher I have ever had. He is a smart-a$$ alot, and can make you feel dumb. But, again, I enjoy his class and learn a LOT. Be sure to do the homework, do the practice tests, and it doesnt hurt to find someone else who has taken the class and get their JEXAM Password

Took Atwood my 1st year fall 08. this man knows what hes teaching, but i would only recommend the elite chemists to take his class. he has high standards for his students, which means if you have a lot of questions to ask, you better take dr. allen. dude has no mercy though, so make sure you dont make mistakes. youll know what i mean.

Took him for 1211 and 1212.  Probably the best gen chem teacher, but he's a little full of himself.  Class really isn't necessary to learn the material, but the quizzes help your average so it's worth going.  Just know the JExam homeworks for the tests.  Also, it doesn't hurt to find someone who took it the year before and look at old tests.

The people who complain about Atwood have lost their minds. He's an incredible instructor. He doesn't put up with immaturity, so he can be "mean", but I can't imagine a better Chem professor. He is crystal clear, and he uses great examples in classes, is always giving us helpful tricks & things to watch out for. It's a hard class,but it's worth it.

Atwood is a good teacher--very thorough. He prepares you for the test. He also encourages the communal aspect of chemistry by having classmates talk to each other to decide the answers to clicker questions. I enjoyed his class.

Dr. Atwood was a great teacher. He was nice and very helpful. Go to his help sessions, sit in the front row, and talk with him. If he knows your name, he likes you, which is a very good thing. The class is horribly hard b/c it is a "weeding out" class for pre-med, but i believe he does the best explaining things out of all the chem 1212 teachers

Dr. Atwood is probably one of the better Chemistry professors on campus. This is coming from someone who struggles with Chemistry immensely. I would suggest going to class everyday because this is one you can't afford to miss. Best way to study for this class is to review your notes after class and read the book on concepts. Practice problems.

Basically, he's an arrogant jerk who doesn't do things on principle. He's not helpful. And it's not true that his students perform better on tests just because his TA makes the tests. The only people who think he's good are the girls who sit in the first row who suck up to him. I would take Dr. Allen.

When I was picking the teachers for general chemistry, i was reading loads of negative comments about this class and teacher, how he's hard, stupid, unclear, jerk w/e. Everybody complained but in reality..these are the people who didnt want to put the time and effort into the class. I took it, I studied for tests, did homework, and got an A. D/w.

Best 1211/1212 chem teacher you can take. All teacher have the same homework and same tests, but kids in his class do better an others. He makes the material easy to understand so you learn it IN CLASS and don't have to teach it to yourself like you might have to with some of the others. I Recommend over ALL OTHER gen chem teachers.
What the heck was that? Get your clicker's out. Fair enough? Its like a hot dog with the wiener sticking out of the bun.

Phenomonal! I wouldn't take anyone else! Allen and Anderson are AWFUL compared to him. Atwood's students do much better on the tests! I won't say that the class is easy, but if you work hard, you can get an A.

Amazing teacher. Lectures on material, then always pauses for any questions. Always answers questions to best ability and makes sure everyone understands. Makes chemistry way less boring with videos and jokes/sarcasm. Big football fan. Overall awesome teacher && I'm taking him for 1212 this semester. Definitely take him!!!
Good Professor he explains and answers questions. All true if you ask a question someone asked earlier he'll answer you in a somewhat deeming manner. But he is fair and teaches chem well.

Atwood was a great teacher, but CHEM 1211 is, under any teacher, quite challenging. He is good about answering questions and gives pop quizzes in class that become bonus points on your final grade. Go to class and study hard, because this will be one of your more difficult classes; that said, it is not impossible to get an A.

The teacher for chem does not change the homework questions or the tests as they are department wide. However, Atwood is definitely the guy to take. He is sarcastic, but he knows his stuff. Very very good teachers, but hard class.
he's such a jerk! not helpful, talks down to students. There isn't much else to choose from in this fruitless chemistry department, but good luck!

Dr. Atwood is the bomb! He is a little sarcastic, but he's usually joking. This class is hard! However Dr. Atwood takes questions and goes at the pace of the class. If you study(hard!) and go to class, you'll get at least around a B.

Dr. Atwood is definitely the professor to take for this course.  I did not find him intimidating, though people who are pretty sensitive might.  He knows what's on the tests and teaches it in an organized and knowledgeable manner, with real world applications of the  content throughout.  I worked to schedule him next semester, and would recommend o

Atwood is definitely the best chem professor at UGA. Chem is going to be hard no matter what teacher, but my class average grades were continually higher than the students in the other professors classes. Go to class he gives pop quizzes and are easy 100s that you will need! go to his help sessions!!!!!! best decision you will ever make!
Dr. Atwood is not my professor; however, I have attended some of his study sessions.  He's pretty clear, but he teaches WAY too slowly.

Atwood is a very strong teacher.  However, chemistry is hard and this course is designed to weed out some of the pre med freshmen.  You have to study, but it's by no means an impossible class.  The lab sucks though.  I recommend Atwood if you are planning on taking chemistry, as the tests are all the same for all teachers and he is the best.

Freshman chemistry at UGA is a weed out class so it's going to be hard regardless of the teacher. However, I think that Atwood is the best! Thorough, clear, good personality. Lecture outline is more important than the textbook (I used the book maybe 2 times this semester) and there are 10 pop quizzes for extra credit so it helps to go to class!
While he is not the easiest, I feel like he was the best. If you pipe up when you don't understand, he takes the time to explain. Definatly worth taking

Chemistry is hard regardless of the teacher, but I am SO happy I took Atwood! He is the best teacher for Chem 1211, and I do better on the tests than my friends with other teachers. However, just by taking Atwood and attending class doesn't guarantee you a B. You have to study like crazy and go to help sessions before the exams.

If you do not have a strong foundation before his class it will be more difficult for you then others. I wish I took this class with someone else. He tried to teach 37 pages the last two days of school. Then he didn't tell us our final was standardized until the last two weeks. Examples are simple in class but way harder on the test. Study diagrams

He was a great professor in my opinion. He was willing to help students, and his lectures were easy enough to understand though you actually have to do regular out-of-class readings and homeworks. I recomment him definitely.

This class is hard. Just showing up will not guarentee you a B. I took chem in 11th grade in highschool and got a C+ in this class but I went to every class. Atwood is a good teacher and going to his help sessions will help your grade. Atwood is better than the other chem teachers. He did write the book.

Atwood is an extremely good professor. He really does care about his students. If you are willing to try to learn and put forth extra time in studying and making an A, then he will also take time out of his busy schedule to help you. Go to his Wednesday study sessions from 7-9. Amazing. Take him if you like Chemistry!

College chemistry is hard. People whine and complain about how bad the teachers are, but it is really just the subject matter. Atwood is strict and will call you out for sleeping, talking, etc... but he also does a good job of explaining some very complex concepts. He is an excellent chem teacher.

I had DeHaseth for 1211, and Atwood is WAYYY better! He gives real life examples to concepts which is very helpful. He's strict and is not afraid to embarrass you. He's really funny and gets the class involved when he asks questions. He gets us to think and apply concepts. He's really really good. Since he made the textbooks, he knows what to teach
Fair enough?
He knows his stuff but he can't teach it on an undergraduate level.

He seems to go at a faster rate than the other professors. If you keep on top of thing, you're in good shape though. He can be pretty entertaining at times. Be warned, this is a tough class, and you will need to work for your grade.

Atwood just isn't a nice man.  I did exceptionally well in Chemistry in high school, taking both honors and AP, but Atwood's class rocked my world. Going into his class you must be well rounded in Chemistry, if not- I recommend de Haseth. He's much nicer and easier to follow. You learn the same stuff from all of them. Atwood just doesn't cut it
He knows his stuff...for sure.  In retrospect, he was a good chemist, but makes you work HARD for your grade.  Good luck.

Best chem teacher I've ever had. He isn't that hard and he is very good one on one and is more than willing to help. You will get a B if you show up and try. To get an A just meet with him for extra help. I would take him again if I could

I recommend this class for science majors. Dr. Atwood is an excellent professor and works hard towards getting freshmen prepared for the more rigorous courses. He knows his material and is helpful. I got a B out of the class and took H chem in 10th grade, so even if you didn't take AP chem you'll be fine!
