He's not that bad, really.  Go to class, read, and go to his Wednesday night review sessions and you should at least get a B.  Those of you who had AP Chem in high school will be better of than those who didn't.  And always bring your clicker to class;  you get bonus points for the pop quizzes.

Dr. Atwood knows his stuff but unless you took honors or AP chem in high school you will probably be lost in class most of the time. I've always been a good science student but I struggled to pull a B- read the material before and after lecture. He is pretty good with answering questions, but really sarcastic if you sound stupid. I suggest a tutor.

atwood is a pretty good teacher and clear when explaining complex subjects. this class in general is basically self taught, but atwood does a great job at answering questions. go to class because it helps a ton and the help sessions are even more beneficial
Take another professor if you can. This class is basically self-taught, but GO TO CLASS otherwise you will be completely lost.

If you can take another teacher, DO IT. Hard class, doesnt lecture well, no inspiration to learn. Mostly you have to teach yourself. If you love chemistry, you will enjoy him and his teaching style, but if you are indifferent to the subject matter his class will be difficult. GO TO CLASS, its extremely helpful.
He's a pretty good teacher.  He does like to make examples out of the people who ask stupid questions though.  Overall, he's a nice guy.

I really liked Dr. Atwood.  It's a difficult subject, but he's wiling to help you if you ask for it. Uses non-chemistry examples to help you understand things and stayed Wednesday nights until 9:00 for an extra help session. He really cares about making sure you get the material.  I will most likely take his class again.
He has interesting examples to help describe confusing classes. Uses same examples from previous years. Doesn't teach the way I like...

Ok first of all i don't know what all these people are whining about. Atwood knows his stuff and does explain things clearly. Just pay attention. Also, reading is a must (especially if you want an A) - this is a college level class - you won't be spoon fed. He is strict in his class so don't mess around.

Dr. Atwood knows the material very well. One problem is that it's a large class so there is no way he can shape his teaching style in accordance with every student. Attendance is not mandatory but is extremely helpful,so is reading from the book. Understanding the concepts is also very important, rather than just knowing how to work problems.
I found CHEM 1212 easier than 1111. Good teacher, hard class though.
He doesn't take any crap so be on time and pay attention. He teachers the material really well and out of class he is really helpful.

I had Dr. Atwood for both Chem 1211 and 1212. He doesn't mess around in class; none of the material is covered with much depth. However, he knows his Chemistry and will help you if you are willing to put in the work. A good grade in his class comes with hard work - he isn't the one assigning your grade.

Dr. Atwood knows how to teach the material, but his attitude is so offensive that I dreaded sitting through another class. He told us that we all "screwed up" when the test scores for all sections were low. When people ask questions he makes them look stupid. He is rude, offensive, on a power trip, and the worst teacher I have ever had.
Do NOT take Atwood unless you want your GPA to plummet. He is a bad lecturer.

What a terrible terrible teacher. Beware: all students are simply a statistic for this class. Atwood does not care if you learn the material. He just skims it adn skips over half the stuff that's on the test. If you're one of his pets that sits in the front row, he'll like you. Otherwise, get out while you still can. Take Shepler if you can.
I just didn't like his style of teaching. I felt like most of the things were over my head, and that he didn't try to bring it down to the student's level.

I had Dr. Atwood for both CHEM 1211 and 1212. He is really smart, but sometimes it is hard for him to get down on the students' level. He doesn't explain stuff in depth. You have to study it, learn it, and teach it to yourself. If you are already really good at chemistry, he would be a fine teacher, but if you need stuff explained, take DR. SHEPLER

He was just plain awful. He doesn't work out problems in class, isn't very helpful when asked questions, flies through the material, and made the bonus quizzes extremely unfair. I had to read the book and teach myself everything. If you have another option go for it. He practically destroyed my interest in the subject.

class moved very fast and often did not explain examples.  When you would ask for an explanation you would get a repetition of the same thing wondering why you didn't get it  The pop quizzes were unfair compaired to other chem classes because you couldn't use any notes or talk to any one.  Other chem classes. He has the "i wrote the book" attitute"

Moves way to fast and doesn't care at all if his students understand the material. I stopped going to his class for another teacher (Dr. Shepler - fantastic teacher). Don't waste your time going to the lecture you'll only get more confused, and his attendance quizes are impossible.

horrible teacher, does not explain material very clearly, and does not work problems out for you just tells you to do it and then shows you the answer!  Is very fast about answering emails.  do not text during class!!!

I would have to say that Dr. Atwood is a pretty good teacher overall.  He is a hard-nose about cell phones.  If he sees you with one, then you are out of the class for the day no exceptions.  This isn't high school, so students should know better by now anyway.  It is beneficial to show up every time to class.  Study the outline and you will be ok.

I liked him because he exxplains everything to the point and doesn't go on too much about one thing. This class is hard and you have to devote a lot of time to it but overall Atwood is a great prof for this course!

yea this professor is kinda arrogant. he is pretty good at explaining things because he uses analogies that we can relate to(like football). make sure ur cell is on vibrate or and dont use it in class and dont read news paper or do puzzles in class. cuz that really pisses him off and he will call you out and embarress u infront of 300 kids.

This is no class for someone who doesn't get Chemistry very well.If you like having things explained to you in a way that you can understand, then DO NOT take this class.  Keep cell phones out of sight and come in through the back if you are late to save yourself the embarrassment.If Chem comes easy to you take him, but if not, take someone else!

Dr. Atwood is a decent teacher. He knows his stuff and always asks if anyone has questions.  However, I would never ask him a question because he would always make people feel stupid (unintentionally) when they did so. Overall a decent teacher, but I would take Shepler if I had a choice.

Dr. Atwood is an amazing teacher, he really knows what he's teaching considering he wrote the textbok you'll be using. If you struggle with chemistry he is the person to take, he explins everything well, you will be ahead in chemistry if you take his class. Despite what everyone else says, this guy is very nice.

Dr. Atwood is a very good teacher, but you have to enter his class (a) willing to learn and (b) with an open mind. Make sure you pay attention to his rules (no cell phones, sit in the back when you're late) and try not to ask too many questions as this is when he comes off as mean. Best chem teacher!
He knows his stuff but the class is so big and the material so dense that you're more or less on your own. Good luck - study hard!

If you genuenly want to understand chemistry, take Atwood's class.  He is a great lecturer and gives lots of examples/video demonstrations of the concepts. However, he does not write the tests. Dr Stanton teaches more to the test, and Dr Sheplar goes a bit slower. Atwood's class is the hardest, but you will benefit the most from it in the long run.

He's a very detailed professor, he knows know to explain things well. As far as grading is concerned; there are 3 tests each worth 20%, there are 10 hw assignments all together worth 10%, and the final exam worth 30%. He gives pop quizzes each are extra credit added to your final grade so thats helpful, so come to class. Textbook extremely needed!!

Going to lecture really doesn't help, its all about grasping the material and that can be only done through studying the book on your own time. Atwood, however, is a good teacher and he does explain the information well. Use lecture to supplement your reading outside of class, not vis versa. Do this and you'll do well. This class is all about study

He is kind of a mean guy (kicks people out of class, etc.) but I have to admit he is a great teacher. He is one of the best you can get. Take him if you can. However, I wish sometimes he would spend more time explaining problems...

Dr. Atwood has been teaching Chemistry for a long time and he's very good at it. He has no qualms about making people look like idiots in class when they answer incorrectly. Dr. Atwood isn't any harder than the other teachers - everyone takes the same tests/homeworks. He explains the material well. Gen. Chem. isn't hard if you put time into it.

Dr. Atwood definitely knows his chem! Unfortunately, for those of us that don't, he's not very understanding. If you have questions, go to his office hours. He is much more helpful then. If you ask a question in class, he is very condescending. His tests are EXTREMELY hard! Don't take this class if you aren't willing study multiple hours daily!
Easiest A ever. Didn't even study.

I think the best adjective to describe Atwood is intense. His intensity is pretty funny sometimes and that's why I like him. But he's genuinely a nice guy and wants to help students succeed. I wouldn't say he's the easiest prof though I heard Shepler's pretty good too.
A very good teacher for people who already have a interest in chemistry.  He trys very hard to help everyone pass his class.
go to class and its not bad at all
No Comments

Chemistry sucks! I only missed one class, and I made a C. I tried my best in there, but I just couldn't grasp any of it. I wish I had been in Dr. Shepler's class. I went to her lectures when I could b/c I understood her explanations better. While Dr. Atwood seems to know a lot more about chemistry, Dr. Shepler was easier to understand (to me).

Dr. Atwood is an awesome teacher.  He knows pretty much everything about chemistry.  You should definitely go to lecture, bc he explains the hard concepts in many different ways so that you can understand them.   He is really available outside of class for extra help- although he challenges you to think harder instead of outright explaining things.
Go to class and get pop quiz grades. I was confused the entire time but eventually got a B. None of the teachers are all that great (simply because the material is hard).

I had him for chem 1211, and he definitely knows the material well.  He does not write the tests, at least not all of it.  Best way to make an A in this class is to go to all lectures, do not miss out on any "clicker points" that they have started. Find someone who took the class prior and work those tests and HW's (helps A LOT) from their JEXAM.
This class was really hard, and he was constantly comparing the class to A students, as in none of us had a chance. He was a good teacher, just way to hard.
Read the Book, Go to Lecture(if you want to do well), he does an ok job of teaching but not too clear sometimes.

this class was ridiculous.  He made it known that it was a weed-out class...meaning that they make the test especially hard to "weed-out" some people that are in the pre-med field.  Be prepared to spend a lot of time with your notes and book.  The lectures are very fast paced and can get confusing at times.  I ended up dropping the class.

If your coming in with no prior chemistry knowledge, or high lack of..this class will obliterate you. By far my hardest class, Atwood is very helpful when you need it...but be expecting to put in many hours if you wanna keep up..its a very fast and continuously building course..

atwood was too sarcastic for me. he made people look dumb if they didn't understand something that's why i never raised my hand. however, he is helpful if you go to him one on one. everyone takes the same test but i would recommend atwood since he makes the test. study with the prac test but the real one is harder.

Atwood is a very nice guy if you make the effort to get to know him some and at least make an effort in the class.  Most material can be found in lecture outline but the book is definately a supplement.  Take the practice tests and know that stuff well, but be aware the real test are a good bit harder.  If you study a decent amount you'll be fine!

Atwood always has the highest test averages, so take him. If you make an effort to get to know him, and go to his help sessions, you'll find he's really a nice guy. Chemistry is a hard subject and it doesn't help that there are about a million premeds at UGA.

Overall he's the teacher you're going to want to have, he3 makes the tests and he's the most clear, but that doesn't mean you're going to like him OR the class. They both pretty much suck. If you work hard and do practice problems you'll do well in the class. And as boring and pointless as it seems, go to class IT WILL HELP. Good luck
No Comments

For freshman chemistry, get Atwood, hands down.  He makes the tests, therefore he can teach you more of what is going to be on them.  Do not ask him questions, he'll make you look stupid.  By the way, those in 1211 now, 1212 is ten times easier.
He was awesome and teaches really well. Explains everything clearly and completely. Freshmen take him!!

Covers the material fairly thoroughly. One of the better chemistry professors. My advisor called the class a 'weed-out course', so if you're not doing so well on the tests (average class score or above), seek help from the tutors.
Pretty good professor, you could definately do worse.
the material sucks (and is hard as hell), but he does a good job of teaching.
100's in both classes.
If you're gonna take chemistry, take Dr. Atwood!

The class is huge, and the material demanding. considering there's a ratio of about 1500 students to one professor, good luck ever getting in to see him during office hours. You practically have to camp outside the door.

Atwood was the best Chem professor. He explained everything better than all the other professors. But the course itself was really hard. The tests are on JExam and always have things that you didnt do in homework or learn in class.

He really takes time in class to explain the concepts and is good about answering questions in class! I got an A by going to class, taking notes, reading the book, and doing the test reviews. The class is hard but it will be regardless of who you have as a teacher. But Atwood is definitely the best professor for chem 1211.

Gen Chem is a hard class regardless. You need to study, go to class, study your notes, and take practice tests to get an A. I got in A in both semester this way. Dr. Atwood is another reason too. He's a good professor. Slower, yet he emphasizes material. It helps you learn. He's the best out of the other gen chem profs. I liked him. He's great.

Dr. Atwood is a good teacher, he explains things pretty well for the most part and makes class interesting.  The tests are hard, but that's to be expected...as long as you study hard you can do pretty well in the class.  Atwood is NOT approachable outside of class and is a jerk if you try and talk to him in his office!

Me and all my friends called Atwood "the devil."  I took him about three years ago I guess and he was put on warning cause too many failed the test, still didn't curve though.  He teaches one way and asks questions a different way.  However, if you're taking chem at UGA, take him cause he writes the test.  He's a jerk to talk to in his office.
Good professor.  He can be a bit of a jerk in class, but explains things very well.  Tests are kind of hard.
I took him almost 10 years ago and still remember what a jerk he was.  The labs were very hard and he liked to belittle students during class.
Much better than Johnson - his lectures are easy to understand and he takes the time to explain everything as thoroughly as possible
Hard as crap!!
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
not bad. . .
No Comments

fair but gruffy manner. funny at times and relates info to outside examples, but skips important info and goes over the easy stuff. we had a running joke that he was doing his student tutors and hitting on girls in the class. much better and easier teacher than eidness for CHEM 2111. no need to go to help sessions-pretty easy class.

dr. atwood teaches a difficult class but is very helpful. as long as you do your homework and ask him for help then you should do fine in the class. he makes the class very enjoyable and interesting and is always willing to help students.
Just a jerk, seriously.
He knows what he is talking about, but he is not very nice and he defintely favors girls over guys.
atwood really takes his time to help students w/ the material and is also very helpful outside of class. i dont think some students really gave him a chance before they assesed his course.

Very boring and hard to pay attention, took classes with Zhu and helped a lot more.  Take Zhu, he makes the class interesting and fun and usually tells the class whats going to be on the test.  Atwood is an alright teacher, but really boring...
Egotistical

Dr. Atwood is an excellent professor. He's really sweet and really tries to help his students understand the material. If u make the effort to understand the material, go to class, and attend his help sessions, u'll be sure to make an A. He is one reason y I made an A in the class. He's really the best chem professor there is.
He will definitely take the time to help students one on one.
Great and fair teacher...
He is actually very nice and helpful if you take the time to get to know him.

He is total jerk.  Makes you feel like an idiot whenever you don't understand something and ask a question.  He could care less about the students in the class just so long as the class average comes out OK.
Great teacher, has to juggle hundreds of students and does a great job giving everyone the time of day.  Very helpful. A+
He is the best Freshman Chem professor at UGA, and so many people take this class that he can't be PC about everything he says. Be informed before you ask questions and you won't feel stupid.
He isnt as bad as a lot of people say - I think he gets called a bad teacher when its really just a tough class, no matter who teaches it.

Dr. Atwood makes you feel stupid if you ask a question.  His class is boring and if you don't understand an example you are basically screwed because you can't ask him to clarify because he will make fun of you.

He's a really good professor, compared to the other CHEM 1211 profs. He earnestly tries to help us, and I think he does a good job. The class is hard and a pain, but that's not Atwood's fault. I think if it weren't for Atwood, we'd all be screwed.
He knows what he is teaching and will help you if you need help.  Understanding the material is the most challenging part.

Atwood is a fair teacher. It's difficult to label him as hard or easy because it's really the subject matter that can be difficult. Overall, I think he explained the material pretty well, although he could have addressed student's questions a little better.
Atwood is a very good teacher. Just make sure you pay attention in class, so that you can do the problems outside of class. The key to this class is STUDY!
Dr. Atwood is very helpful when you talk to him alone. Pay attention in class and read your book. He allows you to do problems on your own instead of just lecturing... he makes you THINK!
He was always willing to answer a question that was asked in class and he was pretty clear in his answers. Just show up to class and you will do fine
He was hard, but fair.  Much better than the 102 prof who was **** half the time.

I loved Atwood. I was prepared before I took his class that he can be a jerk. He expects you to listen and be attentive. He tries to know his students in a 300 person class, I found that quite outstanding. He gives a help session weekly with a snack.
I know many people that complain about Atwood's teaching style and his attitude.  I personally haven't had any bad runnings with him.  So he gets thumbs up by moi.

Still an arrogant man as he was when I had him in 1998.  He needs to be dropped.  The class is not hard, but his instruction makes it VERY confusing.  I suggest that you take this course at a small school! (P.S - I got an "A" so this is not a ma
Sure he wasn't easy but if you went to class and spent a little time doing the HW and Practice Tests you could get atleast a B. I got an A easily.
He may not be very nice, but he's a very good professor. I had Johnson for 1211 and got a B. Atwood is a lot more clear, I got an A.
If you haven't suffered through Atwood's Gen Chem, you haven't been a freshman at UGA. I got a higher grade in ORGANIC than in his GenChem. This man should not be a teacher, he is horrible.

I took his class back in 1997.  After reading the other reviews, not much seems to have changed.  He was an insensitive jerk then, and still seems to be now.  If you have him now, there is still hope.  The other teachers at UGA are MUCH better.
the more arrogant, useless professor i've ever had.
I had him for both 1211 and 1212 and each day my respect and my tolerance for him dropped.  He doesn't care about you- you are a number in his eyes and he has no problem telling you so.
i liked this teacher
Luckily, Johnson taught our class, but Atwood made a few appearances.  I'd have dropped right away if he was my lecturer.
he acts like he WANTS us to fail...
he doesnt joke around
He's a good teacher, but give the computer crap a rest.
not patient at all but he makes the tests out
what an a-hole. get out while you can!
ughhhhhhhhh
He has no patience with anyone, and makes you feel stupid when you ask a question.
very full of himself, loves to show how much chemistry he knows

He's an amazing guy. Super nice and super helpful. I really appreciated his knowledge on the subject, was always prepared for questions! Also he was a welcome relief from all the PC and legalistic professors I had my first semester. Such a down to earth person.
Very intelligent and knows the material.  Willing to work with student and make sure he or she knows the materials well.  Highly recommend if you need a poultry sci class!
TA for Chem. Great teacher, really laid back. Very fair grader, you gotta do your work.

I decided to write a rating after I saw all of the negative ones written about Mr. Larios. While the clarity of the course is absent and he does not return grades very often he is absolutely worth taking! He is entertaining, lively, and has a great sense of humor. Your spanish will improve. He is an easy grader, this class will be a GPA booster.

Absolutely no structure to the class, every day he just starts talking about nonsense. Grades are never returned so you have no idea where you stand. Can't understand him, not a good lecturer. Easy for the most part but I ended with a B+ and still have no idea what grade i received on any assignment. Avoid

He is a great guy but he is a terrible teacher. He does not teach the material. Class is painful to sit through. It's really easy and I got an A because he basically gives you the answers but its not worth it. The class was so unclear and I did not learn anything

He's an awful teacher. He talks during tests so you cant focus. We only got twenty minutes for our midterm - not near enough time to finish. I think people noticed that most students were getting A's and he changed his grading because I don't know anyone in my class thats getting an A. He's annoying and petty and I definitely DONT recommend him...

I had more fun in his class than any other. His teaching style is very different, but my spanish definitely improved after taking this class. Participation is critical for your grade and general enjoyment of the class. I would recommend taking this this professor. I'm going to try to take him for 2002.

very interesting teacher. i am not really sure how he does his grading because Im sure that he does not record a single grade down. you never get any compositions, tests, quizzes back. He says that attendance is mandatory but he doesnt take attendance, but I would highly advise going to class. Just go to class everyday and participate and make an a

Great teacher! First class that I ever actually learned anything in Spanish. He has a different teaching style, and it works really well. Do not worry about your grade! If you go to class and do the work, you will make an A. I promise! Take him!
Larios has an odd teaching style and doesnt really record grades, but if you go to class and participate you do well in the class. Definitely the best spanish teacher i have ever had though
Stick it out...and dont assume that the work that you turn into him gets checked (or gets put into a gradebook)...it doesnt. As long as you show up, you should be ok.
Larios is awesome. He isn't a typical spanish teacher, but he makes it interesting. He answers your questions, and all you have to do is show up to class and participate and you should get an A.

One of the craziest professors I have ever had but he has a very unique approach to Spanish. It is very intimidating at first and you will want to quit but don't. If you show up to class, participate, and have a good attitude you will get an A. And we did not have a single graded assignment all semester so I am not sure what that grade is based on.

I think if you have Larios you should definetly keep him.  The first few days can seem really intimidating becauuse his teaching is unlike any other teacher.  I wanted to switch out the first week but I kept with him and am glad I did.  He makes learning fun and easy. Has worksheets that help sometimes and makes going to class enjoyable. Great guy!

He is great! He makes spanish fun. the class is very easy, and you can get an A by going to class. He wants people to participate, but it is not hard at all. Things get disorganized sometimes because he doesnt always tell you when things are right away, but then he makes up for it by helping make the assignments easier. You learn  without realizing

if you just went on the Key and saw his high GPAs, it doesn't matter!! Though i got an A in the class every day was HORRIBLE.  He doesn't know how to teach and my spanish got worse!  GHe may be a nice guy, but hes an absolutely terrible teacher. SWITCH OUT!

He's a nice guy, but he simply should not teach. The class is incredibly confusing and it should not be. He spends more time talking about life and learning instead of actually teaching for the test. Do yourself a favor and transfer out asap.
Great Prof.I loved him! Wish all my prof. were as easy as he is. Plus you learn w/o realizing your learning b/c he makes spa. fun and interesting.

Before i took this class i was a Spanish minor and after this class I am not! Larios taught absolutely nothing! In fact it was an ongoing joke in our class that he couldn't speak spanish becasue he refues to! I learned absolutely nothing! However, it WAS easy, but trust me it is too much frustration to take this class just for an easy A. AVIOD HIM!

If he likes u, u get an A. If he doesn't u get a B. No matter how much work u do or how much u know. Go 2 class and participate. Be prepared to look like a complete idiot. Seriously! U may not even be told when the final is. Every thing u say in class WILL be wrong. DO NOT try to understand him. U wont learn any spanish.

Wow, what a terrible professor. He refused to speak Spanish in our 2002 class. I even told him it would be to our benefit to speak more spanish but he refused and only spoke terrible English. You won't learn anything and the final is very difficult. He just doesn't seem to care or understand.

Before this class, Spanish was my favorite subject, but he just seemed to cause confusion every day. The class should not have been hard, but somehow he just made it that way because he was so confusing. I am reconsidering my major now. The final was way too hard given what we learned in class. Most of the class time was spent in confusion.
He is very hard to understand and the language barrier is very unhelpful.

His class isn't really too hard, but I had a difficult time with it because he was VERY unclear about what he wanted. Half the time I didn't know what the hw was or when a test would be until a day before. Worst Spanish teacher I've ever had, and I'm a Romance Language major!

So going along with everyone else...he is an AWFUL teacher. He never really taught and he wouldn't answer questions or help. At the end he told a lot of people in our class that we would get As and then he gave us all Bs. He should not be allowed to teach and several students from my class wrote letters to the department head.
Wow this guy has no idea how to teach. Wound up teaching ourselves. Easy class though except for the online bs

While I think Larios is a nice man, this was the absolute worst Spanish class I have ever taken.  Larios doesnt teach his students anything except how to memorize answers for tests, and the majority of class is occupied with ridiculous busy work.  He is not good about communicating with students outside of class and is very forgetful.

So basically, Mr. Larios can't teach. He is a really nice guy, but definately not a teacher.  I have never recieved lower than an A in spanish, yet due to the fact that I was a little rusty and he failed to do anything productive, I struggled in this class. If your caught up on 2001, you'll do just fine, but you won't learn a thing.

Sr Larios taught me absolutely nothing.  I was supposed to be taking a conversation, composition class but all we did was read a book, and we didnt even finish it.  Plus, he encouraged all of us to buy the English version too.  I have never had a professor that has taught me so little, but he is a very easy A.  I don't understand how anyone can like him as he is pretty worthless as a teacher.

Senor Larios was the best professor I had in my 4 years of spanish.  While you think you are stuggling in the class you will see at the end that he keeps your grades a secret, because on his scale almost everyone makes an A or a B!!!
Sr. Larios is nice enough but an absolute nut-case!  He was always yelling random things at us and giving us imaginary penaly cards in class.  It wa an easy A, but I didn't learn much.

I am very interested in Spanish (and I'm minoring in it), but this man taught me nothing.  The class was a joke! It was incredibly easy, and the "practice tests" were the actual exams!!Just so you know--you won't learn ANYTHING!!  But hey, if you want an easy A, he is your best bet.He's really nice

Señor Larios is awesome.  He helps you if you need it and has a very fun sense of humor. He reminds me a lot of my grandfather; very personable.  I don't know anyobdy that didn't get an A or a B in his class.
This guy really wanted for everyone to do well and be better spanish speakers, but he's pretty hard as far as information goes, its hard to tell what he means.

I love Mr. Larios. He is very funny, caring, and always makes you understand concepts that textbooks don't explain. He is very understanding of your problems and flexible, but doesn't like if you slack off. If you put effort into his class and show up everyday, you won't make a bad grade.

I personally was not fond of Larios.  We did not receive a syllabus until about 2 months into the class, and then the grading policy was incredibly unclear.  He crossed the line by  making condescending comments to me constantly in his class.
I found prof. Larios to be a very nice, helpful man.  He always took time to explain/help outside of class.
No Comments

Art is treasure to UGA. He has so many years of experience in more than one place. He is well known for his artwork and his influence in the preservation of traditional & folk music. I'd highly recommend him to anyone interested in art or folk music. He is a living legend and is always enjoyable to talk to.
Ole Art. There can't be any hair left on this guy's brilliant head. Tough and passionate; prepare to learn to draw the human figure.

Art is awesome, and I recommend that every fine art student take his class in materials and techniques.  You study the renaissance method for making ****ment, paint, gesso etc, it's great for judging materials later on...
Art is a great teacher and treats all his students with respect and is very helpful and professional.

She was my advisor for two semesters and was the worst. She never responds to emails. Even if it's urgent. Sage never worked. I am convinced she has it locked. Trying to make appointments with her or coming into contact with her seems impossible. If you actually need help or advice good luck getting it from her.

Worst advisor ever! The website to make advising appointments never works and she's not very helpful if you try to email her. Even if you ask her a simple question she replies with a short, rude response.
She is my advisor and she is horrible. She won't reply to my emails so I have to send them multiple times then she sends me a snotty email back. She is not helpful.

I find that she doesn't answer her e-mail very often. She seems nice, but I have told her some very personal information about myself. Based on somebody else's comments, I hope she didn't tell any of the professors I know she's close with.

Psychology Advisor.  Very personable and always willing to help students.  Goes the extra mile to acquire correct information for students.  Always professional, polite and, upbeat.  I believe you get out what you are willing to put in.  Be polite and have your ducks in a row and you will get stellar service.
She is awesome! She is a great advisor and willing to help all the time! She really knows her stuff...everyone should go to her - door is always open which is great when youre in a pickle!!
She is my advisor. She is terrible. Not helpful or forthcoming with information anyone would need. Can't wait to get you out of her office. Forget about getting help with grad school info.

Tracey is untrustworthy and indiscrete.  Under no circumstances should you share any information with her unless you wish to have it bandied about the entire school.  Walk carefully with this one folks!

Though she doesn't actually teach a class, Tracey is the undergraduate psychology advisor and has been so helpful.  She always takes time out of her busy schedule to make sure you have all of your questions answered, and she is a good friend as well.
Fink is a great man, and a great professor.  You'll learn a lot, even if you don't recognize it at the time.  You have to work hard, but he is willing to and wants to help.

I'm old now - graduated back in 94 - and I've taken classes at five universities. And of all of those professors, Fink easily stands out as the best of them. He'll make you work, but he'll make you love it, too, and I learned more from him than anyone. All these years later, many of his words remain in my mind and ring true. Thank you, Prof. Fink!

I love Fink, which is why I toko him two semesters in a row. He can be hard, but he's quite entertaning, and he knows his stuff. If you make even a slight improvement in your papers, he will bump up your grade. I know. Trust me. The first paper is figuring him out. By the last, you barely have to try, and you'll get an A-.
Incredibly knowledgeable in journalism industry. His class is the most worthwhile class I  have taken at UGA. Hard, but he is willing to work with you in every way to make sure you get an A.
Fantastic Prof!  I've never learned so much in such a short amount of time.  This class, and any Fink class, is worth taking.  You won't regret it and you'll remember it for the rest of your life.
An amazing professor that cares deeply for his craft and moreso for his students.

The best professor I've ever had. He's extremely helpful with his advice, and when he calls you out in class, you learn from it. I learned more from 3 months in his class than any of my other Grady classes. He's one of the best from a bygone era of journalism, and Grady is extremely lucky to have him.

In all my years at all my colleges (I get around), no one professor has taught me more or been a bigger influence on my life than Fink. He taught the subject matter well, but what we learned from his sharing of his life story was just as valuable. He is the gem of the department. Having him as a professor alone made transferring to UGA worthwhile.

I graduated 5 years ago and I still remember his class. Wonderful teacher. Be prepared to learn a lot and be prepared for class--he will call you out. He is pretty intimidating at first and he will test you to be sure you are paying attention.
Conrad Fink should be required reading no matter which department you're enrolled in at Grady.
Great professor.

Seems scary at first but you'll learn to love him. I graduated a few years ago but he still sticks out in my mind above all the rest. He's the only professor who taught me things I actually use in my job. Great person, great professor.
the best prof at grady, bar none.
the best professor in grady; interesting, fun, an expert in his field; he cares about his students and is extremely passionate about journalism
Very talented, but also *very* strict. Be ready to live up to very high standards, but to learn a lot from one of the best.
if you are a journalism major at UGA and you don't take fink, you're an idiot. the best professor at that school. he may be brash, but he does really care about his students. the best. hands down.
insightful, knowledgeable, funny. best teacher in the department
The best teacher EVER! Very knowledgeable and a genuinely nice guy
Thank God for the TA. Not a horrible class but TONS of dense reading. And a quiz almost daily.

Overall decent teacher. Sometimes he'll lose you, but when he does, his T.A. really helps clear things up in discussion. He is pretty anti-religious, and occasionally it shows. In general, if you pay attention in class, do the readings (usually 5-10 pages), and participate in discussion, you'll be just fine. Overall good intro to Philosophy

Pop quizzes make you go to class, but they are usually easy if you read. Breakout sucks cuz its really boring. 3 tests are not too bad; they depend on the TA grading them. Woller is pretty funny. He will post notes online after class. Look over them before tests. He curved one test by adding 9 points. It was overall an OK class.

This class was really boring. But it wasn't ridiculously hard.  Yeah he is really liberal and pretty condescending to anyone that's not, but his class isn't all that bad, and you do learn a few things.

dr. woller is awesome .. i took him for modern and metaphysics.  its not hard to make a good grade he drops the two lowest quizzes and final is optional.  metaphysics wasnt hard either but its not anywhere near as interestin as the course description implies

Dr. Woller is not bad @ all. Everything he went over was really interesting and although some things were unclear, he was willing to explain everything until you finally get it! Don't believe the hype, he's really okay!

He is really hilarious and makes class fairly entertaining. Sometimes, he can be a little unclear and some of his test questions are worded weird, but people make good grades anyway. Just be sure to skim the reading and review his notes a few times before the test, and you should be fine.

Just like every other philosophy professor, he's very intelligent and a little bit weird. It's not an easy class, but very helpful if you're thinking about majoring or minoring in philosophy. And, if you're a liberal, you're gonna like him a lot.
He's an intelligent teacher, but he's not very clear when explaining things. He's also funny and nice, but I wish he would spell things out a little more clearly.

This class is either really easy or really hard. There isn't really an in between. He goes over the readings but talks like you already know what he is talking about. Doesn't really explain things too clearly but he posts his notes online and they help some. Attendance isn't mandatory but he does give pop quizzes. He is kind of boring but alright.

A very boring hard to follow class, in my opinion, I would still recomend taking it if lookin for a easy grade. There are three 5 essay question test, and some quizzes on readings given every night. As long as you skim the readings, the tests and quizzes are no biggy. The grading is pretty solid and the lowest you can get on anything is a 50.

if you are a republican you probably won't like him. readings are really hard, but there are sparknotes for most of them. if you take notes in class and read sparknotes you can get a B on the tests. pop quizzes to check for attendance. not a really interesting class.
Too confusing and opinionated
I didnt do anything and got a b...fine teacher  pretty thorough...nice guy

This class was incredibly boring.  The lectures are jumbled all over the place and he uses outlandish examples to explain things.  One good aspect, you don't really have to do the readings.  I didn't read a single article, just read the notes before the test and managed to get a B! So, no need to go to class, just read the notes before the test!!

He uses the Socratic method, makes you do the readings, and actually go through them carefully and understand.  Yes he is very picky on his quizzes, but he drops the 3 lowest scores. He was very helpful with the papers he assigned.  He does make political wisecracks so if you are a close-minded conservative christian you probably won't like him.

If you don't agree with him, you are told you are both wrong and stupid. Gives off the vibe that he hates the whole class, and very difficult to learn from. Your input is not valued, so don't bother. Lectures poorly. Some students spent the semester counting how many times he said "right?", and other things like that. Made me hate philosophy.
This man is hilarious, and extremely clear. Though he is Liberal he will point out the good and the bad points to every argument and his mind is not closed to every point of view but his own.

I am conservative and he is liberal.  He will let you know what he thinks of conservatives in a more than subtle way. However, this did not bother me.  I think he is funny as hell and reminds me of Woody Allen which incidentally majored in philosophy.  For

He went over everything WAY to fast during class and whenever anyone had a quesiton about something he would turn it into another question.  I don't think I heard a direct answer from him allllllll semester.

Woller led an interesting class, but I'm agnostic and very liberal so I could get into his comments. For Christian conservatives, you might get a little frustrated. Class could be a bit confusing at times too. Other times it was very interesting and fun.

Ugh. How insane can one man be? His doesn't spell check his slides and the answers on them are often wrong. Boring, dry, and unclear. But my T.A. for the class looked like the boss from Roseanne, and that was basically all I remembered from that class.
He was impossible. He turned a simple seminar on ethics into a painful nightmare. He was very unclear in his lectures and asked for nit-picky details on his quizzes.
he Does know what he's talking about, if you think that he doesn't then your probably not intelligent enough to understand the material, so if your an idiot don't take this class
He was too partisan for my taste and I felt attacked if I spoke up with a conservative or christian answer.
Simple evaluation: hes frickin nuts. He covers alot of material and you have to stay up on the readings. He has notes online, but he is usually difficult to understand in class.
Often makes snide comments about Republicans.  When no one answered a question in class, he asked us, "What, are you all voting for Bush?"
Doesn't know what he's talking about and has trouble explaining things. VERY CONFUSING.
great professor, very helpful and nice.  i learned a lot and still remember his class, 6+ years later.
He demands a lot. I took his class as a freshman and I wish I'd waited a year or two. He definitely had his favorites in my class, and it was tough not being one of them.
Strange guy....

Despite being listed as a general intro, it's mostly biological anthropology.

He's an okay lecturer. He gets the info across but it's not synthesized, and the readings often took far too much effort to understand, having a lot of vocab and ideas that were not introductory. The assignments themselves were very easy, but the readings were so dense.

Fantastic human and fantastic class. 100% recommend this class for honors credit as it was so much easier than the regular section. Overall, no tests, just weekly assignments and no class on Fridays- Gragson is amazing.

Loved Professor Gragson. This class is very easy if you do the weekly assignments and those assignments are not bad at all. He is very a very engaging guy and his class is very fun. Definitely would recommend it!

Good class to take with him. As long as you put good time and effort into the weekly assignments and the class in general you'll do fine. Doesn't take attendance but I recommend going to class so you understand the weekly assignments better. Also just a cool guy in general.

There were no tests or quizzes for this class. There was 1-2 page writing assignment due at the end of each week. Honestly not sure if I learned anything in this class. Lectures were very open and easy to fall asleep in. Class was overall easy, but I think I got on the TAs bad side and that caused me a lower grade.
Absolutely amazing, captivating and really supportive!

Gragson is a great teacher and as long as you participate and turn in the assignments, you should get an A. There's no final (!) and he made Friday online work days for our weekly assignments- so very lenient class. I would recommend him for any intro to anthro requirement

Dr. Gragson's class is so fun. He is always cracking jokes and making funny side comments. His class has no tests, midterm, or final. Instead, you complete an online assignment once a week. He ends class early every day so that the online portion is not too much extra. I never made less than a 100 on an assignment. def the prof to take for anth2120

Dr. Gragson is the nicest guy. He is the best option for all of the ANTH profs. His class has homework every so often, but as long as you do it, you get an A. There are no exams, just an interactive game thing at the end of the semester. Class can be a little boring and you have to go. Overall, so easy to get an A, awesome guy.
ratingTags_Rating: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment_Rating: Very nice person and an lenient grader. If you do the homework you're pretty much guaranteed an A. His lectures are thought provoking sometimes but they are kind of boring. I would definitely take this over any other Anthro course.

He is an outstanding teacher! He really cares about his students and he is deeply interested in the material he teaches.  He is a very fair teacher and if you show up to class and do the assignments, the class is an easy A. There are no tests, only three 'quizzes' that each count for 5% of your grade (but there's lots of extra credit on them).

Very nice man, extremely boring class. His lectures seemed to drone on and on forever, with little notes to take/learn from. He gives a lot of readings, a few online assignments, only 3 quizzes worth a very small portion of your grade, and no midterm or final. Easy A if you do the assigned work.

For the entire semester, I thought Dr. Gragson was much harder than any of the other teachers teaching the honors intro class. We had more readings to do and 5 more papers to write over the length of the semester. There was no final, and the class average ended up being much better than any of the other professors. Almost guaranteed and A.

Dr.Gragson incorporates a great breadth of information to enrich a course, from physics to history to statistics theory. His assignments sometimes seem vaguely worded and intimidating, but he really does reward effort. A good prof and a good person too.
nice

I took cultural ecology with Dr. Gragson, and although he is a bit hard to hear at times, he is extremely nice (I emphasize extremely) and his class gave me the opportunity to get involved and actually get rewarded for it. I highly recommend taking his class because I feel pretty strongly that if you do most of what you are supposed to do, you will
a completely self absorbed human being.  did not consider the impacts his agenda had on my life.  do not take his classes.
He does not communicate well, mumbles all the time.  He is far too busy and too important to waste his valuable time on teaching students. He fancies himself a  scientist .
This is one of the worst professors I have ever had as an instructor. He was most unhelpful and impossible to understand.
amazing prof.! anyone who has failed--your stupid!! and doesnt deserve a job in the real world. this man is a great person...he happens to be the BEST RAQUET BALL PLAY ever!! --over all great person.
BAD teacher!! not helpful @ office hours...told me to go home and watch "Rocky"!?! like that would really help with Calc?? Awful!

He does not explain or answer questions.He makes students feel unintelligent.He is arrogant.He talks about irrevelant subjects that he finds interesting and refuses to answer questions during such a class even when a test is the next day.If you study really hard in advance, his tests are not that hard.

He has really horrible ratings, but I thought he was okay. A tough grader. The fact that he requires an actual report with commentary does make the class harder, but it's probably good for you in the long run since it forces you to actually understand what you're doing with Maple.

Very hard professor.  I knew nothing of integral calculus and now I know a little.  He gave mercy on me though, and I think he would do that for any of his students who really tried (i.e. attendance, office hours, asking ques. about hw).  But he does like to waste time in class talking calculators and is not very helpful in explaining problems.
Edwards is the worst professor I have ever had. He is absolutely horrible at explaining problems and likes to skip steps and belittle students who ask questions.

Edwards requires that the lab reports have introductions, conclusions, and explanations throughout.  He doesn’t always specify how to do the reports which makes grading sometimes unfair.  He doesn’t give instruction before a lab but will answer questions.
No Comments

He absolutely sucks.  Incredibly unhelpful.  Known by math students as one of the most dreadful people in the department.  Do not take his class.  I'm an honors student and I enjoy math, but his class was pure hell.  He makes you write papers along with you projects.  Avoid at all costs!!! Please for your own sake.

Awful teacher. He's rude if you try to talk to him. Doesn't like questions. Usually spends at least half of the class talking about his calculator or what he likes about the book. Tests on things he doesn't teach. Avoid at all costs. Only good thing is that he gives W's.
This guy sucked so bad! He can't explain a fricking thing, and he throws random problems on tests. AVOID!!!

His tests aren't bad, especially if you've taken the course before. He doesn't have an attendance policy except that attendance is the "difference between mercy and justice." His final is the worst thing you'll ever sit through in your life, so focus on LOTS of derivative rules within one problem. It's just complicated.
He is so boring and isn't a very good people person. Once you figure out what the tests are going to be like, its not so bad. Kind of.

He loves to talk about his calculator. But he is very easy once you figure out how he tests you. The problems come straight from the book--word for word. You don't have to pay attention much in class, just do the problems from the book.
Awful man to deal with. But figure out early he uses old tests and problems straight from the book.
He is an ok professor, but he puts too much emphasis on using the  TI-89 . Take his class only if you are not planning on using the material or if you are NOT going to take Math 2210.

He is the best! He's super sweet and knowledgeable and just overall awesome. I had so much fun in his class. He has a British accent which is always a plus. I highly recommend taking the class if you need to take chemistry!

He's a nice guy, but you'll need to sit in the first couple of rows to hear anything he says. Willing to answer any questions. He often assumes you've already been exposed to the material that he's "lecturing" about, so sometimes he doesn't explain it very well/completely. He pretty much just reads off of the PowerPoint slides.

Johnson is a really nice guy and seems willing to help his students, but he isn't very good at explaining concepts. His lectures were kind of confusing and he talks softly. Definitely sit in the front of the class. Not a great professor, but not bad. Chem is hard no matter who your professor is, so you will need to find outside help anyway.

Mr. Johnson has an English accent and a very soft voice, thus it was exceedingly difficult for me to understand him most of the time. Though it's a giant lecture class, he'll respond to you individually if you ask him questions. Great teacher but seriously, you have to listen hard to hear him.

How well you do in chemistry depends more on you than the teacher; however, Johnson is one of the best professors. I rarely went to class, crammed the day before and had around a 91 test average. I know people who go every class, study for days and have a C. It just depends on if you can grasp chem concepts. His reviews are helpful for the tests.

He is a great teacher, pretty easy to understand. But I didn't really pay enough attention in class, so Study Edge definitely helped me do better in the class. They have lots of extra practice problems for exams!

I took Sumner in the fall and had to drop it because i wasn't really prepared for a college chemistry course, it wasn't Sumner's fault, but after taking Johnson in the Spring, i must say he is a blessing! GREAT chem professor!!! Ive done better on all three exams this semester, he teaches chemistry really well... he's best out of the bunch

Professor Johnson tries the best he can. Test, hw, and even slide presentations are all departmental. Not much he can do about it. he tries to make the class interesting though. He's the best gen chem professor there is at UGA. You need to get extra help OUTSIDE of class to have any hope of passing!

Chemistry is hard. Take Johnson. He is very friendly & always open to answering questions. He does a great job of preparing you for the 2 hour final exam (standardized). Plus he does fun/interesting experiments in class. Attendance is not mandatory. Tests and homework are on JExam. Do the homework! I would take him again for 1212.

Professor Johnson is great chemistry teacher. In the beginning of the semester, I was terrified about how tough the course would be, but Dr. Johnson explains concepts very well and even does experiments to help students conceptualize the material better. Needless to say, chemistry is still difficult, I made an A (4.0) TAKE HIM!!

If Sean Connery majored in Chemistry and was a badass at teaching it, he would be close to Dr. Johnson.  Class is pretty basic general chemistry class.  If you can't get and A in chem 1211/1212 with Johnson, then go ahead and switch majors b/c organic will kick your ass!

He was a great teacher to me. He tried a lot harder than any of my other chem teachers to make things fun in class. If you have to take this class this is who you should take it with. Learn the material - spend like 30min each day reviewing, go to class and you will do great!!!

Enthusiastic and definitely a good teacher.  Sometimes brushes over the basics while focusing too much on whatever's next.  He tries hard to make the class interesting and will go above and beyond if you ask for help.  Just a warning:  the final exam is horrible.. think 85 degrees in a jam-packed lecture hall with barely enough space to write..
chemistry is aweful at uga. johnson did his best to make it not so bad
He reminds me of Sean Connery. Just read the book, go to class, memorize trivial information, you should get an A.
Very helpful. Very nice professor.
Dr. Johnson makes Chemistry as easy as it is ever going to get. His study sessions really help. His accent is not a hindrance to understanding the concepts.
Very cool guy; he likes fire a lot. Hope you can understand a very heavy British accent.
Dr.Johnson is an awesome professor! If you want someone who will actually TEACH the material, take his class.

THE BEST! Like other posts say, DEFINITELY go to office hours, BUT prepare thoughtful questions beforehand. Practice!!! PRACTICE!! no matter who you take... Don't cram/wait until the last minute. Stanton is smart and definitely the best chem professor I've had... 4 semesters-- HATE chemistry. Did well because he is a good professor.

Stanton is great; yes, he's sarcastic and a jokester which may be difficult to appreciate from some, but he is a great professor. I came in knowing nothing, and he taught as such. He teaches you everything and assumes you know nothing. GO TO HIS OFFICE HOURS!!!

Stanton is a great professor. You will learn a lot from him.  This class  is hard, but if you study from the beginning, you will make an A. His tests are fair, there are only a couple tricky questions. But he gives you extra credit on every test. Take him!! :)

Dr. Stanton is really a great professor. At first he may come off as sardonic and apathetic, and he is; but once he get to know him, he is not that bad at all. Tests are tricky so it makes students really have to know the material. An A is possible. If you want to learn chemistry, take him. If you want an easy A, look elsewhere.

You take a Skills Test(3%),3 tests(23% each out of 110 pts) & ACS Final(28%).No homework. I got a B in the class.I've heard going to his office helps.He loves dogs so bring one if you have one! It might help your grade.He gives practice problems.His handwriting is hard to read and he goes fast thru the powerpts in lecture. He rarely curves

Everything you've heard about him is true. But he does have a good sense of humor that makes lecture a little more interesting. GO TO HIS OFFICE. He will give practice problems almost identical to his test questions. Very friendly guy even though he can seem intimidating at first.
Doesn't like to give partial credit.  Is tricky on purpose.  Likes to play games.
I took his class summer 2011, his tests were very difficult!...next to impossible. On a positive note, he gives partial credit and had a good sense of humor.

The tests are hard, but he gives a curve. I highly recommend to go to his office hours and get practice tests. He is generally apathetic. I took this in the summer and he made lectures somewhat interesting, but he also got off-topic frequently. Be prepared for excessive studying.

Stanton is hard, don't get me wrong. However, if you put the effort forward and act like you half way care and are truly trying, then he is willing to help you out. Key point would be: GO TO HIS OFFICE!! All the time! Let him get to know you and don't take his sense of humor to heart. Attendance isn't "mandatory" but I would def. suggest going.

All these people who say for you to go to office hours is a joke.  If you are a young, semi-attractive girl, I am sure he is very nice and helpful to you.  This guy is a jerk to guys though.  Avoid him at all costs.  He enjoys making sure that not everyone passes.
He is so mean and horrible at explaining things!!! Do not take him !
Stanton is a great teacher!! GO TO OFFICE HOURS!! It will help tremendously!! He may seem mean at first, but really he is not. I got an A in is class so it is possible!

Easy class. Stanton tries to keep lectures interesting, but really...it's genchem. Attend office hours! He will answer questions and even give you hints as to what will be on the test. You have to put in the work, but your grade will reflect your effort.

He is the best CHEM  professor! I would recommend that anyone take him. HIs test are paper and can be extremely hard if you do not do the practice problems he posts on eLc or in the book. A major tip to passing his class is to ATTEND OFFICE HOURS! He will answer any questions you have and even give practice test questions!

If you come in to Dr. Stanton's classes with the idea "oh, paper exams must be easy; this will rock compared to JEXAM", then you'll be disappointed -- most of my class failed the first CHEM1212 exam. However, with the proper effort, it is entirely possible to succeed in his class (pay attention to his pet peeves! SF, units).

If you want someone who is going to be nice to you and just give you an A, look elsewhere.  If you want to learn about chemistry, take his class.  His lectures are interesting, and he obviously knows chemistry.  His tests are difficult but fair.  Someone complained about the curve for labs, tas are curved, not lab wide to control for how tas grade.

He is the head of the chemistry lab for CHEM 1211. I saw him twice throughout the entire semester. Both times he was yelling at a student. Hhe allowed all of his TA's to tell their students that there would a curve at the end and to not worry about there grades. Got to the end of the semester, no curve, and got a C+ while i got an A in the lecture.

BEST CHEM PROFESSOR AT UGA. Get in his class if at all possible. He grades hard, but his tests are very doable as long as you study his practice problems very thoroughly. (And he doesn't assign that many.) Made a C on the first test and freaked out, but with bonus points brought grade up to an A. I feel like I know everything about chemistry now.
Very easy to understand. Tries to trick you on test though. Make sure you cover all your bases.
Good teacher. Class was easy, had him for 1211 and 1212 and got right at a 100 in both courses. Didnt go to office hours but he has them all the time and everyone says they are very helpful.
Learning objectives from assignments not clearly identified.

Dr.Stanton is an amazing teacher. He can come off as intimidating, but if you make an effort to get to know him he's a teddy bear + has a great sense of humor. You will have to put a lot of time into studying for this class if you want an A, but if you go to office hours it is definitely possible. He explains things well and keeps class interesting

Prior to taking him I read the comments about him, and I was definitely proven wrong. GREAT teacher, knows what he's talking about. Has an egoistic sense of humor but it's what keeps the class fun. Highly doubt I left once without laughing at one of his sarcastic jokes. Don't take his joking side too offensively and you'll enjoy the class.

Definitely cares about his students. Get to know him on a name to name basis and show him that you are at least trying to do well in the class even if you hate the class, like me. He is easy to understand and answers all questions. The best chem teacher you'll probably get for gen chem.
Awesome Professor definitely recommend him!

I was so afraid to take him after reading all the comments on here, but he turned out to be amazing. Class was hard, but he is always available in his office to help you and gives lots of practice exam questions. I wouldn't recommend buying the book, Just print out the powerpoints from ELC and study from those. funny, great guy. Wonderful teacher

Stanton has made chem so interesting to me, even though its still hard and boring to me. Of all professors for chem, he is the best. He is very helpful even if he acts mean....AWESOME!! Go to his office hours!

This is an honest rate. First of all, I hate chemistry and awful at it, no matter how many hours I put in. Stanton does WRITTEN tests, so if you get a small part of the problem wrong, you won't get it ALL wrong like JExam. I finally understand Chemistry, and he gives great examples in office hours. He is a nice guy &does care about his students!

He's HARD. He's a good teacher that learn from his teaching style, but I--unfortunately--was not one of those. I had to withdraw. But that's not to say he's a bad teacher--I just don't learn the way he caters his teaching style to. You have to have a solid understanding in 1211 to get what he's talking about in 1212.

Great teacher. GO TO OFFICE HOURS! If you do, you will almost definitely pass. A funny guy, always makes class enjoyable, but can be a bit caustic at times. Don't be shy in his class, it will do absolutely nothing for you. Speak up and ask questions.

Dr. Stanton is the best chemistry teacher at UGA. He is very clear about what you need to learn and grading. The book was fill in the blank which where based of the power point note slides. Only 3 tests to determine you grade but if you study as directed it's an easy B+ to an A.
If you aren't a big science fan, I wouldn't take this class over the summer. It's too much information too fast.

I had him for lab this summer, not only is he RUDE but his TA's are horrible. We were all in a panic before the lab practical because our TA promised the graded labs would be ready for pickup 3 days before the practical for us to study by, and he was never anywhere to be found. Labs are way ahead of lecture..but practical is easy if you study hard.

Dr. Stanton is the best teacher to have, as a bio major on the brink of changing my major i would advise that you get in his class. GO TO OFFICE HOURS, you're guranteed to pass the class. And his chocolate mint brownies are TO DIE FOR. super nice guy, who cracks jokes to keep office hrs fun. he's more than willing to go the extra mile for students

Dr. Stanton is an AMAZING teacher.  Its a difficult class, but he makes sure you understand everything.  He is extremely fair.  GO TO HIS OFFICE HOURS.  He is very willing to help by giving you practice problems.  He jokes around quite a bit and even brings you brownies sometimes :) Dr. Stanton is awesome!

Dr. Stanton is the BEST teacher to have. I took chemistry spring 09 and FAILED my first two test. the book didn't explain much, nor did the teacher. Stanton is one of the nicest teachers,but you MUST be willing to work. OFFICE HOURS IS A MUST, IF YOU WANT TO GET A'S ON THE TEST. He will work with you until you UNDERSTAND! TAKE him!
the class isn't that bad- try to understand the full concepts- lab is actually fun and, honestly, the practical is okay- passed it  both times.
Go to his office hours.  ITs not that bad seriously. He's kinda nice.

3 exams and a final. 25% each No homework. I studied a week in advance for the first two exams and made over a 100. It's DEFINITELY do-able. The secret is to go to his office hours. He usually gives out old tests, practice exams, and will tell you pretty much exactly what will be on the tests. Anyone who makes a bad grade in the class isn't trying.

Stanton might seem intimidating, but just go to his office hours and he is willing to help and deals with all of our annoying questions. The class is hard so plan on studying a week in advance for tests and go to class, or you will fall behind! And he gives extra credit sometimes if you go. Best advice- go to class and go to office hours!
You think you know the material while hes going over it BUT when the test comes... You're screwed. There is not enough time to finish his tests either.
Avoid him at all costs

Stanton is not as bad as he seems. Go to class and take notes and do problems in the back of the chapters and you should get a good grade. I never  read any chapters in the book because he goes over the basic concepts for everytyhing in the class. When you do the practice problems it's when you'll understand it deeper for the test.

He assumes you took CHEM 1211 at UGA so AP students beware. Significant figures and showing work and units are all very important to your grade. I didnt receive graded papers until after my first test, but by then it was too late to see what he wanted. He's almost always available in his office and its clear he knows what he's talking about.

Good Ol' Stanton. The man knows Chemistry, but his personality bothers me. I get this feeling like he is biased against guys because I always hear from girls that he is great, and I always hear from guys that he is horrible. Nonetheless, his tests are hard, and he is determined to trip you up on the homeworks. Go find a better professor.
I got all A's but failed this class! It caused me to lose the Hope Scholarship.

I felt scared to ask him questions. He knows chemistry well, but its to the point where he thinks that everyone should automatically understand things right of the bat. His dry, sarchastic humor does not add anything to the class except annoyance. Also, he does not make learning chemistry interesting. Not the best teacher. dont take this class here
He's awesome... cracks jokes and teaches well... If you listen well and read the chapters, you'll be fine!

worst teacher of all time.he claims the review problems in his book come from tests.Well NOT ONE single question on any of them came from his book. He asks tricky and hard questions that take up lots of time to calculate and show work. When time is up on tests, ur done. He will verbally abuse you if you dont turn it in. TAKE THIS CLASS ELSWHERE

Has a really weird sense of humor.I would recommend people to go to his office during office hours to get help.I started attending his office hours & my grades came up dramatically (but I waited till the last two tests to figure this out).He can come across as rude but that is his weird sense of hummer.He's actually a lot of fun(in a weird way)!

this lab was easy, but the professor is a total jerk... the  person that posted below me praising Stanton is probably him himself...What a major LOSER..Stanton must've been bullied in school, that's why he likes to bully everyone, even his TAs!!

He is not conceited/condescending. He has an interesting sense of humor, & is somewhat obsessive compulsive. But not to extremes. Get help during office hours. It helps a lot. Chem is hard, but if you seek help, you'll do well. He's very smart & knowledgable. He also pretty much tells you what is on the test if you come to class. 8AM is only time.

Dr. Stanton chem 1212 Lab is easy, but he's a total jerk to talk to. I went to his office three times already and he's very rude and conceited. Of the times i talked to him, he made me feel like an idiot, and the other time he cut me off completely when i was saying something...he's a very  very rude jerk without any understanding. i dislike him...

I'm rating the lab itself and not rating Stanton because I've never really had to encounter him. With that said, this lab is awful. The experiments are a month ahead of lecture so you'll be completely lost the entire semester. They still expect you to be able to answer all the questions. Also, the practical exam is still as ridiculous as ever.

Don't worry about Stanton. Your TA makes or breaks your grade. If you get David Osborne, LEAVE!!! The lab is the only place where he has any authority, so he tries hard to be intimidating and militant. It's annoying but durable- until he screws with your grade. He will slash 20 or more points for things others take off 5 points for. Very obnoxious!

He is the worst teacher ever! He's mean and stupid!! He doesnt care about his students and doesnt do anything to help them. in fact the whole class is unfair and the TA's are incompetent (at least the one I had).
If you attend UGA and you need to take Chem, you might want to take it at another school. A lot of science majors here do. It isn't just Stanton, it's the entire department. Awful, awful teachers.

He is almost cruel when he talks to you in Chem lab.  I went for help on pre lab a few times and he treated me like an idiot.  He is a chemist, not a teacher.  I stand by this statement with all my heart.  The TAs are not much better.  Avoid Chem lab if you can.  I unfortunately cannot.  Good luck if you ever have to deal with Stanton personally.
Doesn't tell the truth.  His grading scheme is completely arbitrary.  He is rude and offensive.  Did I mention unhelpful?  He is to be avoided like the plague!

complete jerk. only saw him for a few minutes each period, and he never had a good thing to say to anyone. he wanted to fail someone bc they didnt clean up their lab station during the final. the manual that he wrote is useless, TAs wont teach it, and we didnt cover it in lecture for a long time. He is an awful person who acts like it. avoid him!!
I would recomend taking this class. The tests are fairly easy if you attened class and do the practice problems at the end of the chapters. We have no daily grades, only four tests.

I would definitley recommend Dr. Stanton for CHEM1110. Attendance isn't required, but if you go to class he'll help you out a lot. Also, I would highly recommend going to his office for help. He'll help you with your lab (he did some of the problems for me), plus he'll show you exactly what's on the test. Otherwise, the tests are very difficult!

Take him during the summer! He was very willing to help students and his tests are written instead of Jexam.  He can be a bit of an ass at time but he is just being funny and means well.  He talks a hard game but his class is a lot better than the regular chem!
Best among all the general chemistry lecturers. Gives hints about labs, relates lab to lecture. Good sense of humor. Perfectionist.
drbobbystanton as me and my friends called him was one of the best teachers that i have had so far in college.  He was very funny and was fun to learn from!!

I have mixed feelings about him. My friends told me stories about being treated like dirt when they went to his office, but I found him one of the best lecturers of all the general chemistry professors. I guess go to his class for lecture, but to someone else if you need help outside of class.

Dr. Stanton was an excellent lecture professor. I thought he explained concepts well and was open for helping students when he could. He'd drop helpful hints about exams and labs as well. I wished he wrote all of our exams!

Stanton was an average lecturer-he could explain concepts well but flew through the math. He was helpful, however because he'd drop hints about tests and tell stuff about labs (since he's in charge of all the labs)

He was alrite, i laughed everday in class, he was cool, i will say he's very egotistical , but hey if u got a doctorate in sumthin u'll probably be egotistical bout it, overall he's an intersting person to talk to too, very good in math

This guy is not bad. I had a 1211 lab. My group had problems with a self-directed lab experiment. When I went to his office, the guy pulled up the key on his computer. He was overly helpful. He told me what the TA would be looking for students to mess up on. I received an A in the course. Don't be scared to talk to him. He is helpful.

Terrible teacher.  Don't know how he got a teaching award, because if you go to him for help all he does is treat you little better than dirt, and is no help at all.  If UGA was actually a decent school, than they would fire him.

This class was extremely easy with fill in the blank notes and he also gave you 10 bonus points on each test. He would go out of his way to help his students by having review sessions before each test and he was always in his office willing to help. Defintely recommend this class, easy A!

So, I had him for lab, but you don't really have him, you have a TA.  He was nice to me when I went to him for extra help.  He's not quite as bad as everyone seems to be making him out to be though.  The class would be so much better if he didn't nitpick everything to death... always include equations in lab write-ups!!!

THIS GUY SUCKS! There was always something wrong with his slides, he grunts constantly like he's got a donut stuck in his throat, he enjoys telling the class that he doesn't care if you lose HOPE and that your grades are not negotiable. He needs a girlfriend and some sunlight...

OH MY GOD! This class was completely rediculous! I went to all lectures, all extra study sessions and even visited him one on one and he wasn't very helpful! HE IS EVIL!!!!! The kid below me must have kissed his butt or be a genius! AVOID STANTON!

To me, this class was so easy I couldnt bear going to lecture, plus his notes are posted online. Some people really struggled, but if you had a good chem teacher in HS, you should be fine. We used a preschool fill-in-the-blank workbook and had no textbook. Stanton definitely knows his stuff but thinks he's the sh*t, which he is obviously not.
I am pretty sure this man worships Satan.  He is truly the embodiment of Lucifer plus two hundred pounds.  If he brushes his hair over, you might be able to see his HORNS.

Stanton is Stanton. He acts as if everyone in the lecture hall is an idiot and knows nothing... ironically, I had to go to his office twice because he graded my test wrong by a whole letter grade. He's a decent guy when you talk to him one on one, as long as you're polite and he can sense your fear. Everything is posted online.

This class was basically high school chemistry all over again.  I went to class most of the time but usually slept through it, and still got an A.  The text book is fill in the blank lecture notes so thats not bad, and if you miss class he posts the notes online.
The only way to get an A is bring him an entire box of krispy kremes every class. He might enjoy cupcakes too.

he is a great teacher-he is very clear when he speaks and gets straight to the point...but his tests are very difficult.  he likes to make the tests hard and tricky, therefore you have to study alot.  chemistry is hard no matter who you take though, so even though he is intimidating, i would recommend taking him.

Again, Stanton lives off of feeling superior. He doesn't really care how well you do in the class nor really about any individual student.  He teaches with the "I know all of this and so should you" attitude. So, if you're not already knowledgeable about college chem, you're out of luck. I would suggest another professor.

Chem is hard enough without a know-it-all prof. He seems to thrive on knowing hes confusing (and failing) students, seemed the happiest when he could stump the entire class, and bragged about putting the hardest questions on the tests. All the classes take the same tests, but I'd recommend taking another prof. who wants to help his students learn.
Most people are scared of him but once you get to know him he's really great.  He's the smartest guy I've ever met (tell hime that and he'll love you).  He is the king of the chemistry department.
