Wow, what can I say that hasn't already been said? Stanton is a failed doctor, by failed I mean he never got in to medical school.  From there he decided to tourment young minds for his life's work.  His lab classes are designed to fail you and he trains his TA's to be complete ****s.**** like this makes me want to transfer from UGA.

He graduated from Tennessee... yet he makes Phil Phulmer look slim.  It's not his fault that Chem is hard though.  The class sucks, regardless of who is teacher.  Honestly it doesn't matter who you get for chem.

Be careful, the lab book he wrote has mistakes that he doesn't fix.  Your letter grade depends entirely on the final, so that's where you should put most of your effort.  If you have questions, e-mail him and he'll reply quickly.  Don't bother with WebCT discussions; he usually doesn't respond to them.
Everything that could be said about this insensitive man has already been said.

VERY unpleasant and disrespectful.  The final is ridiculous: you either get a 10 or a 0.  I managed an A, but only because I got lucky and got one of the easiest final experiments. Unfortunately, if you take chemistry, you WILL have to deal with him.

Dr. Stanton is pretty much unavoidable for Chem Lab. Your grade really depends on your T.A. However, if you have issues with your grade, go talk to Stanton. My T.A. refused to believe he could have made a mistake, which brought my grade down. Luckily, Dr. Stanton said he would change it. The exam is a ridiculous practical. You either get a 0 or 10.
I thought I was in his class... But I never saw him. That's not good, is it?
Stanton is very mean, has a persistant sour attitude towards everyone, and although I'm sure he is very smart, he does not teach well.
No Comments
Mean people suck. So...he sucks.

Bobby Stanton.  Words simply do not express the incomptent manner in which this man conducts what he deems to be "teaching". I dont know maybe all the extra "padding" on his body has stopped his brain from processing common sense and fairness. Maybe he's mean simply because he lost a contest to be Santa Claus to someone in a lighter weight class.

Ones do not express how horrible Stanton is.  I'd advise picking another professor, but he flaunts his tyranny over the whole chem lab department. He focuses more on making people upset than helping. I mean absolutely horrible.  Meanest person I never met. Grading scale is wacko. I kept a A until the final, which dropped me ten points to a B.

He is a turd. He is the meanest professor of campus. He is stubborn and egotistical. He has no emotions and does not care if any of students learn the material or lab techniques. He is probably just mad because he hasn't seen his feet in years. He is so mean that he may even force some of his TA's into therapy.
Mean, mean man.

This class is rediculous.  The lab manual is vague and we have to teach ourselves hard topics before we learn it in lecture.  Grading is unfair at times and nearly everyone in my class is failing or has a D.
No Comments

During a lab, the  TA messed something up, and he said very loudly, "You didn't even set this up right. No wonder this is taking so long," and continued on in that manner for while. I was quite embarassed for the TA despite my dislike for him, and am still wondering WHY stanton felt the need to be so condescending to his own TA. I don't think anyone was impressed.

I think that Dr. Stanton had a rough childhood and is now taking it out on the spoiled brats in his classes... You can't blame him... most of the kids in the classes I have had here are very rude to the Professors during lecture... However, he is not a very good teacher... There are numerous errors in his notes and lab manual... It is frustrating..
Pretty easy class! The tests were really easy as long as you came to class and studied the notes carefully. Stanton is kind of mean, but oh well. At least he doesnt make the tests super hard.
ok teacher, very difficult class
Hates the World. Problems at home maybe?   His belly button looks like a squished doughnut.
he is a very unpleasant person

He seems like a complete jerk in class-and the class I took was at 8 in the morning so everything he said pissed people off anyway, but in person he's usually nice.  He's very smart and knows what he's talking about, but the tests are very difficult.  He offers chances at bonus points which helps.

Pretty difficult tests, but if you study your arse off you can pull off an A--just look at me. Liked him for always saying "close enough for government work." If you took AP Chemistry in High School, you definitely have an advantage...I recommend exempting 1211 if possible and starting with 1212.

I only met Stanton once, and he was somewhat cold. He published his own lab book this year, and there were a lot of mistakes, so the labs were confusing and we had a lot of problems. The TA figured things out for us though and I think they were making corrections on the manual.
He could be a better teacher but is above average.
He is a very mean man. He doesn't do the grading though, so cross your fingers for a good TA.
he appears very mean and hard. but if you talk to him in privete and you are nice, he will also be nice to you.
He is a jerk
I had to talk to him twice about my lab. He actually helped me, but you have to know how to deal with him. He can be mean, and cold, but if you are nice and sincere I believe he will be of service.

Terrible, once the entire class got less than a 60 on the lab except one group who "adjusted" results. He gave them their grade and wouldn't change the entires class grade even though something was obviously wrong with the lab apparatus.
When he comes down to lab, he's not very nice, but I stopped by his office once and he was very helpful.
He is hard and mean.
He was the professor for CHEM1212 in the summer.  I got a D and he wasn't much help.  But I suck at chemistry, so take it for what it's worth.
although some of the labs are a little crazy they arent hard and stanton will always help you, he is a nice guy
Stanton is one of the most genuinely nice people i've ever met.  Everytime I passed his office, he was helping students.
He was kind of picky in his grading in my opinion, but a good professor, and the assignments weren't terribly hard.

Grandt is amazing! Very funny and willing to answer questions. You definitely need to buy the book. TAKE NOTES on what he says, and highlight ANY quote he talks about in class, as that is what the tests are over. If you miss a class, he will meet with you during office hours to go over what you missed. Such a great professor!
ratingTags_Rating: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment_Rating: He was abnormally difficult.  I have always made A's in English class.  In 1101 I made an A, and then after his class I made a C.  He was also almost no help during office hours.  He is one of those people that is really pleased with himself---
He's a bit odd... the class is entertaining at times. Definately grades papers hard. the stories you read are... interesting to say the least.
um, every book we read, he seemed only one chapter ahead.  not like anyone should go to georgia for literature, but this guy is is a total mess.
No Comments
No Comments

Grandt is hilarious. He makes this all so much fun. Take his class. You'll get to hear him randomly quote everything from Music to Lolita. But, go to class and respect him. Don't expect to be handed your grades without any work.
not that great

If you are wanting to go into the medical field, you should definitely take this class. It's so interesting and informative, and Dr. Espelie is a great resource for any pre-health questions you have. There's one small essay due each week, but overall if you go you'll make an A. You should 100% take this!

The easiest class I have taken at UGA. The material is interesting. He give quizzes at the end of class throughout the semester, but the quizzes are open notes and the tests are almost completely multiple choice. Easy A course
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment_Rating: Professor Espelie does a great job lecturing. He is funny and well respected. Would totally take again.
Espelie is solid at teaching beginner entomology courses, but doesn't keep up with taxonomic info so you might have to unlearn some of the order names he proposes if you're going for an ento degree.

Tons and tons of memorization. Definitely not as easy of a class as everyone makes it out to be. With that being said it's still doable if you put in the time. Don't expect this to be a blow off class because you will be surprised.
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--LECTURE HEAVY

comment_Rating: All I'm gonna say is that I made a D on one test and a C+ on the final and somehow made an A. 11/10, thanks Karl.

I took this class as an easy elective, and the open note quizzes every week are really easy as long as you take notes. however, this class is straight memorization and if you're not good at that I would NOT recommend taking it. I am not the best with memorizing and had a hard time on exams, have to work for the A.
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Tests are tough

comment_Rating: SUCH AN INTERESTING CLASS. Espelie keeps your attention for the entire class and lets you out early. Quizzes are open note and tests are pretty easy if you study.
ratingTags_Rating: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Amazing lectures--Would take again

comment_Rating: The funniest old man at UGA.  Wears a bug shirt every day to class that correlates to whichever bug you are learning about.  Tells you exactly what will be on every single test.  Quizzes are open note so if you just show up to class you will end up with an A.  Only problem is that he uses technology from about a century ago that rarely works.

Loved this class! We would watch video clips, some were relevant to the insects we were learning, and others because they were funny. I even took notes on Jurassic park. Fair warning there are about 10 pop quizzes, but they're easy if you paid attention to the material taught that day.  Also, class usually got out early.

Dr. Espelie is such an interesting guy and an entertaining lecturer. He doesn't use ELC so you must go to class to take notes. He does pop quizzes as a form of random attendance checks. If you're there, you'll get a 100 guaranteed. Tests can be a little trickier, but they're straight from the notes. Take this class!

Espelie was one of the best professors I have ever had!! He made class so interesting and was definitely willing to help you if you had any questions. He wore the most adorable bug shirts every single day and reminds me of an adorable grandpa! HIGHLY RECOMMENDED
ratingTags_Rating: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment_Rating: Easy class, if you go. Basically tells you what will be on the test, will tell you what's important and to star it. Tons of quizzes but they're easy. He also doesn't count a couple just in case you miss one or mess up. I got a head injury that caused my learning to slow and he was more than willing to help and work with me! Definitely recommed!!

This seminar is very beneficial if you are going into any healthcare field or pursuing a science based career. Dr. Espelie organized the seminars very well and is always there to advise you or answer any questions. It's a great 1 credit hour break from the traditional lecture classes.
A. Lot. Of. Memorization. If you are good at memorizing information, you'll be okay. He's a really interesting guy and provides fun topics for class.

Dr. Espelie is great. You know what to expect every class- notes via projector, short video clips, and easy 5-question quizzes (several throughout semester) mostly to check for attendance. Tests are very specific but not impossible. Keep up with notes and star things when he says to- they will be on the tests.

Favorite professor so far! Loved that he was so passionate about teaching and is always available for help. he wants to see you succeed! There are pop up quizzes and two are dropped and the tests were not easy by any means, but if you studied you could easily make an A. You will learn a lot!

Very easy class, and very interesting as well.  Espelie is a great professor, really funny guy.  You basically watch tons of videos, take notes that he puts up on PowerPoint, and pay attention when he tells you that something frequently shows up on quizzes and exams.  Attendance isn't mandatory, but he gives out open note pop quizzes.
Simple class.  Don't buy any books.  Just study your notes well, and you'll do fine.

AWESOME teacher. Gives easy notes on overhead, and you can also purchase them. Tells you what to expect on the test. Uses videos to explain notes better. I would take him again in a heartbeat. Laid back sense of humor. TAKE HIM!
Great class! I recommend everyone to take this class! I loved his teaching methods and he always kept the class involved and awake!! Not hard at all to receive an A in this class, take it!!

A bit overrated. Interesting subject though. Lots of notes but same as old ones if you can get them. No textbook - don't even buy the novel Silent Spring, totally unnecessary. Tests got harder, lots of short answer, esp. order name ID and spelling counts. You must study! Quizzes are open note and boost grade. Got an A.

Need a GPA boost, do yourself a favor and take this class. He's funny, awesome, and interesting. Attendance is a must for the random "quizzes" which are a joke. He tells you to use old tests to study (do it) i spent every class on addicting games, studied the night b4 from old tests and got an A...take the class

This is the best, most interesting class I have taken.  Espelie is extremely easy and entertaining.  GO TO CLASS-there are almost daily quizzes.  I would recommend this class to anyone, put it some effort and you'll get an A!
Really intersting!!! Learned a lot and it was not hard... just make sure you go to class because there are always pop quizzes.
He is an amazing teacher!!! You have too take him regardless of your major!

Great elective. Pretty much have to attend class due to the quizzes (which are open-note). Tests are pretty straightforward. Get your hands on the old tests if you can, they are 99% the same as the tests you'll take.

Take this class if you want an easy A! There are two tests and a final plus 14 unannounced (but open note) quizzes. Dr. Espelie will keep you laughing and he is just an overall great person. Don't worry about reading Silent Spring, he tells you everything you need to know about it.

Great teacher! Easy A. Just go to class and take notes. Final was a little tougher than the two tests. Just find old tests from previous semesters. They help a lot, and Dr. Espelie encourages you to do this!
Great class. Dr. Espelie is a great professor. He shows videos in class to help the students have a visual of what he is teaching. Interesting subject.

Easy class. if you don't get an a go back to high school. he gives about 14 quizzes randomly, they're open notes. there are only 2 tests and a final. the tests are not that bad just read over your notes; they consist of multiple choice, short answer and T/F. the final is kind of hard tho, so don't think you can study the night b4 and be fine.
Interesting class. He cares abou t his students. Attendance is mandatory.
nicest man ever
Easy A, go to class.

If you do not make an A in this class you should drop out of college. Open note quizzes. Tests are very similar to old ones. Plus, he tells you in your notes which information will be on the test. It is also very very interesting. Enjoyed it.

Best class ever... seriously. We have watched clips from Jurassic Park, The Lion King, A Bug's Life, Jack, Little Shop of Horror... if you don't rock this class you seriously need to reconsider where you are going in life. He gives pop open note quizzes and to pass the test read your notes once. He is hilarious and so helpful. LOVE HIM!

I LOVED this class.  He is very intelligent and incredibly caring.  He makes sorority girls appreciate insects. He literally put a roach on me in the middle of class in front of 300 people and made me scream.  I'm scared on roaches, and this is still my favorite class ever.  By the way, this was some kind of crazy monster roach on steroids.
He can beat up Chuck Norris and Jack Bauer at the same time, with both hands behind his back. If you don't do well in his class, seriously reconsider your status as a college studnent.

This is definitely the easiest and probably one of the most interesting classes I've taken.  For the tests, I read over my notes twice, and I felt like I was putting way to much effort into it.  Great intro class.  He in interesting and doesn't scare you away by making the class difficult.

he makes everything so interesting!  shows video clips every class which actually helps out a lot.  go to class so you won't miss the quizzes and you'll do great! it's not hard to find old tests (which he encourages you to do).  it's definitely one of my favorite classes taken at uga.

what toolbag gave espelie a low ranking? look, this guy is a hip cat. he has movies, slides, live animals, and open-note quizzes, not to mention the fact that he's hilarious. if you don't like his class, you're either an idiot or a miserable person to begin with. easily one of the best teachers at georgia.

Dr. Espelie is my hero!!! take his class if in any way possible and if not, have him look at your schedule for advising. I have his phone number in my cell phone. He is an amazing professor and advisor.

AWESOME class!!! I despised and was disgusted by bugs before taking this class, and I LOVED IT! I enjoyed going to class and adore Dr. Espelie. Requires studying, but mostly just memorization. Fabulous elective!
Anyone who can't make an A in this class should just quit college.  He is FUNNY and very informative.  Wish he taught more classes...do yourself a favor, take this class!
The best teacher/advisor ever!!!! Def made my college yrs the best!!
AWESOME!!! EASY A But very informative.  This man is what college professors should strive to be like!  I will never forget that carpenter ants don't live in Africa (Lion King clip).
wonderful person and teacher!
Dr. Espelie is a great teacher and a great advisor.  I loved taking this class, and I learned so much, too!
probably my favorite class ive taken in college
No Comments

i skipped more than half the time (no joke) and still ended up with a B-.  she has no idea how to grade.  once i took my paper to her so she can look it over again because i thought i deserved better than a C. her response? that i'm not a good judge of my work.  i don't know why UGA hasn't fired her yet.

She made me change my major and the next semester I found out from another professor that he really enjoyed my writing so I feel that she did nothing to help me improve and discouraged me from doing what I enjoyed prior to this class...She just rambles during class and I feel like we never worked on our papers but talked about useless stories that

Dr. Hoff was a great English teacher. When writing my papers I went to her office hours to get advice on my writing. Go to her office hours and she will know you are trying. pop quizzes on reading but readings are short. I recommend Hoff.
She's not a good teacher at all! Avoid her class if you can. The class discusssions are pointless. She's too picky on essays and gives whatever grades she wants. AVOID!

Prof. Hoff is a nice lady and tells good stories, but is not a gifted teacher. She does not know what a grading scale is, and can only give her students an inaccurate estimate of their cummulative grade. She grades essays based on her moods, and her she facilitates discussion through fumbling and outrageous hand gestures. Avoid.

AC Hoff is an entertaining teacher to have in class and does a good job of facilitating discussions, but the overall grading is very unstructured. Class averages on essay grades seemed to be abnormally low for an English 1101 class and you never really knew where you stood. If you go to The Key Hoff's class grade average has dropped every year.

Hoff is not the teacher you want to have for ENGL 1101. She is fun and all, until you get your papers back. I've got a 3.9 gpa here, I can write a paper, but I could not get an A on a single paper. The class has no structure. The syllabus is not followed and you have no clue what your grade is all semester until it appears on oasis. Don't take her!

Yeah, she's a little scattered sometimes, but she's cool, fun, and extremely smart. A little edgy sometimes, so students who haven't accepted that they're adults yet should stay away. Make the most of meeting iwth her to go over drafts. That helps alot.

Dr. Hoff is pretty random and likes inappropiate jokes. Sometimes she just goes off on her own little tangents and no one really knows how to respond. Overall, it's an easy class, though. She doesn't require much out of her students. (I only had to do 3 papers and the portfolio). Homework is not overwhelming at all... usually just a small reading.

She's DEFINITELY scatter-brained & odd.. like all the time.. but she's nice.  You don't have to write very many papers and she doesn't grade them hard at all.. all we ever did in class is discuss what we read (usually a very short story or poem) the night before.. definitely EASY though.

Compared to the other English teacher at UGA, AC is really cool. Your grades are nothing put the papers, and she doesn't give grades lower than C's. All you really do in class is discuss readings, that are usually pretty good. She is really smart but very scatterbrained, and she likes say inappropriate things. (Like how she goes to Toppers)
I didn't do much for this class, and I made an A.  While she isn't the most insightful professor, she's really funny and nice.  I would definitely recommend this class for an easy grade.

Composition class-grade is based almost solely on your papers(usually 3) + the portfolio grade on EMMA.  Ask her to look over your papers before you turn it in.  Fun personality that makes class almost enjoyable to attend

She is very easy. Yes, she's very weird but if you are a half-decent writer you can make an A. I recommend Prof. Hoff if you don't like doing a whole lot of work but enjoy getting an A. If you want a strict know-it-all, this is not the class for you.

She was, at times, very scattered brained and would forget to mention if class was cancelled and stuff like that. Although she seemed very laid back in class, she is actually a pretty hard grader so be sure to make every paper PERFECT! Oh, and she LOVES to say odd, out of place sexual comments that don't even make much sense. She's a little odd!

Who would complain about this teacher! Yes, I admit that she was a little scattered brained as many might think and yes, the class was all talk and no work except for outside work, but this was a really good class! I definately have no complaints

If you find yourself in this class and you don't mind wasting a class period to listen to an unorganized, scatter brain grad student, this is the course for you! I dreaded trudging to Park for this class bc it was completely useless. I would have had more fun getting my teeth cleaned!
Only a d--n fool would complain about a paper coming back in 2-3 weeks!  She's great!  Guess what?? Your highschool teacher sucked!!!
No Comments

I got an A after a lot of unduly hard work. My old AP Engl teach was 10x more intelligent, and I always got A's in his class. This woman doesn't know where she's criticizing from. She's better at being a student than a prof. Uninspiring, tedious, and boring. No cohesiveness of thought.
This woman is very scattered and sometimes disorganized.  Takes like 2-3 weeks to return a paper, and grades difficult depending on her mood.  However, she can be a really cool teacher sometimes.
This lady is introverted. She is very intelligent but she just has a difficult time interacting with people. But if you go talk to her, she's very nice and helpful. Just give her a chance!!!
No Comments
Her grading methods were very arbitrary.  If she had a date, the grades were usually good, if not bad.
I got an A in the class, but I have three words to describe this woman: moron, moron, moron.

He's a great guy who's super helpful and very knowledgeable. Unfortunately, he's not very good at making class interesting and tends to drone on with his monotone voice, so lecture is incredibly boring. The subject of the class wasn't interesting so that didn't help. He's a great professor stuck with a boring class.

Dr. Gurian is such a sweet person and an exceptional professor! He is very passionate about campaigns, so seeing that makes me excited to learn. Overall, this class was interesting and helped me better understand the current election. He's very objective and an fairly easy grader. I wish he wasn't retiring so I could take more classes with him!

Honestly,e was pretty tough. Long lectures that are hard to listen to. I only took him because I was in a learning community that required it. I did all of the reading and am a political science major and only came out with a B+. However, he is passionate! Not a bad guy, just hard to stay engaged.

Professor Gurian is precious. He is a sweet and approachable man who is very knowledgeable about the material. His tests can be pretty tough, but if you pay attention in class, read the book, and study, you should do fine. I hated learning about American government, but he made the class less boring.

Gurian tried to make the lectures very interesting by including various types of teaching styles, including responding to opinion questions using clickers. The Friday breakout sessions are mandatory, but you can skip he regular lectures and get notes from someone else and still do fine. Only two tests, a research essay(super easy), and the final.

Gurian is a great teacher, the lectures are sometimes boring, but for the most part at least fairly interesting.  He has a cool little old man ponytail, and if you study you should be fine for his tests.  I didn't read and did fine.

LISTEN TO ME: I am a poly sci major, and yes, his tests are tough for an intro class(essay,short answer,and multiple choice)but not impossible (I got high A's on both tests). If you HATE gov't and don't wanna take it, take another teacher. If you want to read the bookstudy and learn, take him! He's a great lecturer,and you WILL actually learn.

Great lecturer! He is smart,clear, and helpful. The class is not super easy though. His tests (2 midterms) are not bad, except the test is 30% essay, 20% short answer from breakout, and 50% m.c (25 Q's). He gives 3 essay topics in advance, 2 will be on test, and you chose 1 to write. Textbook helps!! Breakouts are required-TA Sarah Hunter is good!
The class is tough, but you won't find a better pols teacher at UGA than Gurian. He is reasonable with assignments, and if you do them and attend lecture, you will be successful.

Basically, if you read everything assigned for the class you'll be fine.  The breakout sessions are where you have to be there.  The lectures aren't that bad; some days are more interesting than others but he tries by adding videos and doing clicker participation.  Overall he's a really good teacher and go into the class with an open mind.

Tests are difficult. Attendance in lecture is not mandatory, but is in breakouts. There is an extreme amount of reading assignments given, and weekly typed-responses are assigned. For an introductory class, this is a difficult course compared to other POLS 1101 classes. If possible, I would recommend finding a different teacher

He's a cool guy with one of the better lecture classes; he uses videos and class surveys to involve everyone, but it's a bunch of information that you're never sure what to focus on for tests, which are hard. You never know your overall grade until the end. Have to write essays but they're given ahead of time. I don't like history and I got a B

He doesn't let students know their grades. You receive your test grades and quiz grades, but participation grades and average grades stay hidden until the FINAL semester grade. It's annoying because you can't keep up with your grades, and this class is hard...
The class is very easy, you don't have to attend lectures or study very hard. Most of the information is common sense. Put effort into the essays and you're golden.

DO NOT listen to any of the comments below that say this class was easy. This is an introductory course and it difficult. Gurian is nice and knowledgeable but this course is way too demanding. Test are ridiculous, ask questions about material that was never discussed. YOU HAVE TO WRITE essays and ta's grade hard. Avoid this professor at all cost.
His lectures are easy to pay attention to and engaging. Tests are very difficult. Grades depend highly on TA's. Attendance is not mandatory, so it's very tempting to skip.

Gurian kept the class interesting and understood that this was a mandatory class for most students. Read the textbook, it will help, but it does not seem entirely necessary. The tests were reasonable although not super easy. Going to class is not mandatory but the lectures are very important so I did not skip any classes.

Awesome teacher! I would totally recommend him! Don't listen to any of the bad comments. He does other stuff besides lecture too, like show video clips of past debates and mock elections. He's also really nice and the tests were fair, if you go to class and read the book.

Avoid at all costs. Lecture is painfully boring and the material will likely be things you already know. What makes the class difficult are the tests. The multiple choice questions are completely relative to interpretation. The tests are way too difficult/confusing to be essentially the only 3 grades. Way too difficult for an intro level POLS class

Gurian's a decent teacher but his class is pretty hard for an intro POLS class. You only have four grades that consists of breakout session participation and 3 tests. The tests are hard and based off the textbook and lecture notes. The textbook does not have all the info you get in the lectures. I suggest taking another POLS 1101 teacher.

The tests are really hard. He is a nice guy, but there are never any notes in class. All he does is lecture, and he doesn't give us any idea as to what will be on the tests. There are a lot of essays involved, but they are fairly easy.

You will never see a powerpoint in this class. Overall great professor. Some lectures may seem pointless (by pointless, I mean POINTLESS) Breakout sessions are pointless as well but required. TAs decide the grade. Tests are really straight forward. Gives us essay topics ahead of time. Overall a good professor, I would recommend him!
good teacher
Great professor, so nice. Lots of essays, but fair grader. Love him!
Really nice guy, interested in seeing students succeed. also not a hard grader
He has a wonderfully dry sense of humor that probably goes over the heads of some people. He's very helpful and knows the field very well, and he is a genuinely nice guy.

I thought Dr. Gurian was a great professor. I found his lectures extremely interesting and I learned so much is this class. The tests are very fair and focus on larger concepts rather than details, which is really nice. The only downside is that some TAs are much harder than others.

Most brutally boring professor I've ever had.  Seriously. I'm not kidding.  He doesn't take attendance during lectures(MW), but attendance is mandatory for breakouts(Fr), and every absence is 1pt off your final grade. Essays are straight from the lectures,Mult Choice is straight from textbook,short answer is straight from breakout. Bad prof, avoid!

Do. Not. Take. Him. Bottom line. The lectures are absolutely pointless, as the tests come directly from the book and breakouts. With that said, the TAs will determine your grade since they are the ones who make up the tests. This is far too demanding to be an intro course that is a university wide requirement. What a shame.

Extremely monotone and boring. Tests are mainly text based and the lectures seem pointless when referring to the multiple choice section of the exam. Tests are relatively difficult and challenging. Must study!

Dr. Gurian is such a great professor. His tests are fair. He is very engaging, and his real life examples are hilarious. I considered changing my major to political science, but then I realized that the best part of the class was just Dr. Gurian
Loved Dr Gurian. He's an incredibly nice and knowledgeable guy with a sense of humor, and gives great lectures. Class was not too easy and not too hard, just go to class and study and you'll do fine.

Poli-Sci majors @ UGA, act now!  Take his Campaign Politics course.  Gurian has a great self-deprecating sense of humor, is affable, and very, very knowledgeable.  If you dig presidential campaigns, participate in class, and actually do the read what's required you'll do well.

I LOVED HIM!! I hated anything to do with politics before taking this class, but it was one of my favorites. His tests are extremely straightforward and easy. Go to class and break out, take notes, and study and you'll do just fine. definitely recommend him! (he gives you the essay topics before the test too)
Dr. Gurian is amazing I recommend him for anybody! I never studied but always went to class and pulled a B

First off, Dr. Gurian knows his politics. He's a nice guy, and good teacher. I'm an INTL/History major, but lecture was kind of dry sometimes. I guess since most have to take it, he had to make it more "accessible." FYI, this is a TA team controlled class. Its not awful, just a bit annoying (especially breakouts). In the end it was a decent class

Your grade depends SOLELY on the TA you get. Dr. Gurian's lectures are interesting, and he incorporates a lot of video clips. If you're a good essay writer, then you will do just fine. He is very fair and seems to always have the students in mind when it comes to tests. Just hope you get a good TA and make sure you take part in discussions.

Dr. Gurian is a pretty nice guy and an interesting lecturer.  Cross your fingers for a decent TA because they can either make or break your grade in this class.  Also, take the book quizzes on mypoliscilab because a lot of the test questions came from there.
He was very clear in class and made the lecture somewhat interesting. Class was not mandator. Class helped but a lot of the information came from selected readings and the textbook.

Excellent professor! Made political science interesting. Important to go to class and take good notes. Test was one long essay, a short answer section, and 25 multiple choice (test was two-days long) The final was 2 essays, but I had plenty of time to finish. Really nice guy. Knows his stuff!

He is amazing! He made politics so much more intersting that I imagined it could be. The tests were not that hard. If you don't like essays then you won't like that part. But he is one of my favorite professors here at UGA and I'm not even a POLS major!

TAKE HIM! Had zero interest in political science before class, he made me love it! Lectures are long, but he makes them interesting. 3 tests, 2 parts (mult choice and 2 essays). Essay questions given beforehand. Not bad if you keep up with readings, study, and go to class.

Dr. Gurian is such an awesome professor. He speaks very clearly and explains things in easy terms so we can understand it without having to "figure out what he said." The tests are two part test. Multiple choice and short answer at break out, and long essay at the lecture. The essay topics are given before hand, so it's not bad. Definitely take him
Dr. Gurian is literally the best lecturer I have ever had. If you go to lecture everyday, pay attention, and take good notes, you will make an A in the class. I STRONGLY suggest this professor.

Dr. Gurian was an amazing lecturer and great at teaching what he does. If I was in a smaller classroom setting, might have done way better because TA is the luck of the draw, and I didn't get so lucky. Take him if you're in a smaller class, and try to avoid sessions with break-outs and way-too-high-expecting-for-a-graduation-requirement-class TA's.

I took Dr. Gurian for campaign politics and it was one of the best classes I ever took at UGA. Extremely interesting day-to-day discussion and the tests and papers are pretty straightforward if you can express an intelligent opinion and go to class.

It's VERY IMPORTANT to attend lecture. Reading the assigned chapters also helps, but I skipped the last few and still got an "A" on the final. Tests are two days long and include an in-class essay, the topics for which you will be given beforehand.

Excellent teacher and speaker, but if you are not someone who can learn by just listening, this isn't the class for you. His lectures are only spoken with minimal technology (we watched election ads on the screen one class and i think that was it). GO TO LECTURE! You will fail if you do not. Breakout really ties in with what you're learning. LOVED!

Gurian is a great teacher. He makes his lectures interesting and relates everything to today's politics. The multiple choice questions are easy and I often felt over-prepared. However, the T.A.'s look for almost perfect essays and will not hesitate to fail you. Make sure to include MORE than one example for everything you write.
He is an absolutely great lecturer. He's very entertaining and straight forward, and his tests aren't hard... IF you study. I would DEFINITELY recommend him to anyone.

If you go to the lectures you don't need to buy the expensive book. He's a phenomenal lecturer, and makes learning about the different branches of government as interesting as it'll get. His tests are straight from his lecture and the break outs. Break out are mandatary. The class is overall pretty easy

Gurian's honors class over the 2000 election is incredibly interesting.  He's a fair moderator during class discussions, and forces students to think for themselves.  Grading is difficult, and because he only uses only letters when grading papers, it can be hard to know where you stand.  Overall, it is a great class, taught by a great professor.

pretty good teacher.  some lectures can be a bit boring, but they're rarely boring when he's discussing current events (so take him during an election year if you can!).  class difficulty can depend on your T.A.  mine was awful but i still did well in the class.

Dr. Gurian was a really good teacher and did a good job of explaining things in class. I didnt read and of the book and still did fine.  But it also depends on your TA.  His tests are a bit confusig but if you take good notes and come to class, you'll be fine
Dr. Gurian made the subject very interesting. His tests were a little tricky. Be sure to do all of the reading and attend class!

Gurain is a nice guy that made this subject more interesting than it is. i hated polisci, but i can say that i liked his class because i learned soo much. the tests were a bit difficult, but if you attend class and read the book youll be fine. grade really depends on your TA-so good luck. one thing that i hated was there was participation grades...

Dr. Gurian is a great teacher. He's very nice and always eager to help you. He has a lot of interest in the area and is very enthusiastic about teaching. He knows his stuff. The grades really depend on what TA you get though. But I would definitely recommend Dr. Gurian!

He was an ok teacher but your grade depends on which TA you get. Mine was very VERY strict on the essays of the tests...if you weren't completely specific on the topics she would mark you down 30 points. Attending lectures is not mandatory but a lot of the test questions are from lecture.

Dr. Gurian is a really nice guy who tries to make lecture interesting, and usually succeeds. The tests (I thought) were fairly easy, and he gives the essay questions to you before the test. I didn't miss class a lot, but sometimes I missed it and it wasn't too hard to catch back up. Take his section!
Dr. Gurian is great, and really knows his campaign politics. One of the nicest professors in SPIA, completely approachable. Definately recommended.

Dr. Gurian is great! If you get a chance, TAKE HIS CLASS. Not a lot of out of class work. Only test is the final, three papers throughout the term though. All the class does is really talk about the election. Its great. He's also very objective, which is always nice. Go to his office hours, he loves just getting to know his students Best prf @ SPIA

Nice, funny, unbiased presentations. You get the essay questions before each test. Your TA will determine your grade on a lot, since they grade the essay. I took a lot of notes. Attending class is VERY important, especially the breakout sessions.

Dr. Gurian is incredibly nice and, like the rest of the SPIA faculty, very objective in their teachings.  Took Campaign Politics in Fall '08, one of the best classes I've taken.  Not sure how great it'd be without an election to talk about, but highly recommended nonetheless

Dr. Gurian is nice and tries to crack funny jokes, but his lectures are sooooo boring.  Tests are hard and every test has an essay, 4 to 5 shorts answer, and multiple choice.  The final consists of TWO essays.  Hope that you get stuck with a great TA that grades easy.

Gurian's a good professor. 1st half of the semester was amazing, started to drag towards the end when we talked about the history of campaigns and stuff. Attendance is pretty much mandatory, but if you come to class you'll do fine on the tests. I would recommend his campaign politics class

Campaign Politics during an election with Gurian=paradise. I also took his special topics class. It was fantastic. This guy is one of the best. Take anything he teaches, especially Campaign-related classes. He is a brilliant scholar on elections.
This guy is such a great teacher! He also has a good sense of humor and is willing to help. My TA wasn't that great, but otherwise I really enjoyed his class!

Excellent professor.  Had no interest in politics but he made it intersting. Is monotone but what he says is interesting. Learned a lot.  Would def recommend him.  As stated by others, your grade is really dependent on the TA.

Nice guy. Interesting to listen to if you like politics. The TA definitely has a significant impact on your grade as some of the multiple choice questions come out of your breakout and the TA grades all short answers as well as the essays. So a bad TA can screw you. But Dr. Gurian is an interesting guy and the class isn't that difficult.

I really enjoyed his class! He seriously reminded me of Mr. Rogers, but without the train and puppets. Instead it was a discussion of the constitution and election. Grading definitely depends on the TA, so look for a good one!

great speaker with fairly interesting lectures; material not difficult, but tests can be tricky; really depends on TA and breakout session discussions (which are mandatory); only 3 tests given, which can be good and bad... recommended if you have good understanding of poli sci

Dr. Gurian is an excellent professor.  He explains the material very well and has made me interested in politics and elections.  Basically your TA determines your grade.  Definitely a great and funny professor.

Gurien pretty much just rambles which is why I went to lecture 2 times the entire semester and that was to take the tests. Go to breakout, participate in breakout. Over half of his tests comes from breakout. The other half is from class, but he has old test floating around in any Greek test bank. Grade depends on the TA, ended up with an A
Dr. Gurian was pretty boring, but was fair. I got stuck with a bad TA though and got screwed with grades. The majority of the grades come from essays.

possibly one of the most interesting classes ive had here at uga.  dr. gurian is  incredible at teaching a somewhat boring class and trust me, if you go to class and take notes, you should be able to get at least a b.  read the book to suppliment the notes and getting an "A" is a piece of cake

interesting lecturer. tests had mult choice/short answer/essay. in all honesty, the mult choice was tricky. and how well you do on the short answers and essays depend on your TA. mine was tough. i came out with a B-.

I have absolutely no interest in Political Science, but this professor somewhat changed that. It was hard for me to take notes from his lectures because i had no interest but buying the notes from Baxter helped me for the test. Like the other comments, your grade is determine which TA you have. Test have multiple choice, short answer, and an essay.
This class totally depends on the TA, mine was nice and she loved to debate but the tests came out of nowhere with some of the questions.  But I never went to the lecture and still made a solid B.

Dr. Gurian is good professor. He knows his stuff and is able to convey it in a way that is pretty easy to understand. If you are at all interested in government and politics, you will enjoy lecture. If not, you might be a little bored. Find the old tests, it will help you out a lot on multiple choice section however, the tests change every semester

Very nice guy. Does a very good job of relating the material to the average college student (some could argue he really "dumbs it down" to more of a high school level). Half of the test material is taken from lecture and the other half from the book (a lot of time the two don't correlate too much). So doing both helps. Tests CAN be tricky and vague

HOLY CRAP this class was boring.  If you are going to be a political scientist, spending your life conducting surveys and using reduction analysis, this is the class for you.  He is a sweet guy and obviously loves being a political scientist, but this class has no real-world practicality and is tearfully boring.
He is SOOO interesting.  He really knows his stuff.  Books aren't really essential at all, but going to class is a must.  All in all, great class, awesome professor.

Although Dr. G is kind of monotone, if you listen to what he says he is really interesting. Attendance in lectures is not required, but there is NO WAY to get a good grade if you don't go. This class turned out to be a lot harder than I thought, but your grade is basicallly dependent on your TA. I would recommend Dr. Gurrian as a professor, though.

Gurian is probably the best teacher I've had in a while. He really knows his stuff and he has a good sense of humor every once in a while. The lectures can be boring, but if you sit up front, it helps keep you interested. Depending on your TA, your essay could be graded harshly or leniently. If POLS is a must, take Gurian.
Good lecturer.  Your grade depends on your TA.  Mine was such a mean grader so it was much more work.

Gurian is okay but the class itself is very boring. My TA is horrible and refuses to grade on the same scale as the other TAs. Go to breakout the first time and check out your TA if she is horrible get out while you can because it will not get better.

He's really nice and seems to be fairly smart, but I personally thought some of his lectures interesting, but most of his lectures boring. The grade depends almost entirely on the TA. :( which is bad.

If you want to take poli sci I'd reccomend taking it with this guy. The grade is 4 tests which are 2 parts each, the exam, and your breakout(like 10%). The tests are 2 parts:essay and mult. choice. You can find old tests to study from and he gives you the essay topics in advance. I didn't read or take many notes but got an A by studying for tests.

Dr. Gurian is an excellent teacher, I loved his class. He tries to make it interesting (even though its such a huge class). The breakout sessions kinda suck, but I still highly recommend taking his class.
He's good.  But a good TA is very important.  Vita is awesome.  If you in her class stay if you're not try to switch.
Excellent professor. The best 1101 professor at this university, by far.
If I could marry this man I would. He is such a good teacher and I really like him in general. Although discussion group is a bit boring, I think he is AMAZING.

Prof. Gurian does indeed attempt to make politics interesting and, if he can't do that, at least to explain it thoroughly. He admitted openly in class that much of politics is, in fact, boring, but nevertheless attempts to make it entirely engaging.

Good teacher.  Very engaging, which can be a problem because you have to hear hackneyed comments from the brainwashed students - a hapless and blatant attempt at scoring participation points.  Note: If a student ever starts a comment with "I think" you can be assured they in fact do not.
He is damn good teacher if you can ignore his liberal agenda.
Very engaging, enthusiastic teacher. Made the subject matter very interesting, and explained everything clearly. Enjoyed the class a lot.
He is one of the most interesting teachers I have ever had. He really enjoys politics and makes it fun and interesting for his students as well.  If you get a chance take his class.

Got me excited about politics, especially interesting during an election year. He gives great lectures, shows interesting clips, SNL, funny debates...tests are a little difficult, but he gives you essay topics before so that you can prepare... attend lecture and breakout and you will be fine!

yes i agree he is a good teacher and he does make it more interesting but I think some parts of the tests are kinda hard and not very fair because you have to write essays and so it can be subjective and even if you wrote a good essay, it might not be good enough. Basically, it seems kinda hard to m

Dr. Gurian is AMAZING! He made government FUN! He shows great clips from interviews and stuff. He also showed SNL skits! He's quite a character. His tests are VERY fair as long as you go to class and attend breakout you'll be fine!
this class was awesome and interesting even to people not interested in gov't!

I loved politics before, but I had never had a more fun and interesting teacher! Smiling and always joking, yet unbiased. I wish I could say the 1 million great things about him in this space! THANK YOU DR GURIAN! Good TAs too!
No Comments
Loved him!
I absolutely loved this class.  I was never very interested in politics before, but with his fascinating anecdotes and unbiased information, I realized that I actually like learning about government!

Typical of any English class, he requires a lot of reading. My complaint with him and this class is that we had very few assessments, thus very few opportunities to improve your grades. The only real points came from a short paper and the final. He also doesn't give clear expectations for papers he expects you to know what he wants.

A very fun teacher to take if you enjoy the subject! I took ENGL 3100 and loved everything about it! You will write a lot and he expects you to write really well, but there is a take home midterm and a creative response final project!
A super interesting professor! Expects greatness and he's very intelligent! You will write 8 500-600 word literature analysis and you have a take home mid term and final!

Dr. Gatrell is Oxford educated, therefore expect to  be taught by an Oxford graduate. He is a harder grader, something that he admits, but I still found his comments helpful in improving my writing. His lectures are insightful and he doesn't mind answering questions. He is a little scatter-brained, but I would take his class again.

I would agree with many other reviewers. Dr. Gatrell's lectures were entertaining, but the grading was extraordinarily unfair. I have never received less than an A- in an English class and have a B- in Dr. Gatrell's. Going to his office hours was useless-- he told me what to improve on, I did, and he arbitrarily gave me another B-. Don't take.

Oxford educated Dr. Gatrell suffers no fools in his class. But! If you read the material, and attempt discussion, he is entertaining, patient with lack of deep knowledge on the subject, and a tough, fair grader. His classes are hard, but he is more than willing to help you get better. Don't take anything he offers unless you plan to actually work.

Unless you have prior knowledge and/or experience in the subject matter, I would advise that you avoid at all costs!  I never leave reviews, and I have a 3.93 GPA. I thought this class would be interesting and easy, but it turned out to be one of my few B's even though I worked VERY hard. The grading is arbitrary and flip.

Make sure you're interested in the British Isles and not just England and pay attention to the maps. He's scatterbrained and during the semester he would crash into desks and keep walking. Use your computer to take notes or you might not be able to keep up. No matter what others say, he is knows what he's talking about and he will answer questions.
Wonderful man, nice to listen too, a bit scatterbrained. Can be a bit sarcastic but very helpful if one is willing to listen.

Very lecture-heavy class (didn't allow for much class participation).  Tests are open notes, though, which helped a lot.  Incredibly tough grader, especially on papers.  I wouldn't recommend taking him.

He may appear to be nice and has a lovely accent but he isn't overly nice one on one.  He is sarcastic one on one and not helpful.  Half the time he forgets what he's been talking about and doesn't have notes.  Very hard on papers and makes fun of you for your mistakes.  Take someone else if possible!

No homework means nothing to prepare for but I didn't enjoy that. 3 grades only: paper & presentation, midterm, final. Hard grader. Not helpful one-on-one. Awkward. Though he knows his stuff - Would not recommend.
Best instructor of my college career (just graduated). Inspired me to major in Victorian studies in grad school. GREAT lecturer. EXTREMELY helpful outside of class.
Dr. Gatrell is very knowledgeable about Victorian Lit, and the class is not terribly difficult.  His lectures are easy to listen to.
Condescending, disorganized, and dull--a winning combination.
he is a nice guy and he really knows his stuff.  he makes the class interesting, but he goes all over the place and it's hard to follow him sometimes.  overall a good experience.
rude, mean, set in his ways
This was a scattered class that took immence studying.  However, having said that, at least the grades were curved.
A fun class with a fun professor.  I'm a very big fan.
No Comments
No Comments
Dr. Gatrell is one of the best teachers I had while at UGA his class was interesting and fun.  He is so enthusiastic about his topic.
Absolutely do not take this guy. He is inconsiderate of students and flat out rude. His communication skills are garbage. Doesnt return calls or anything.
Avoid him if you can. He is all over the place and inconsiderate.
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment_Rating: Terrible. Youd think GEOG 1111 would be an easy A. It ended up being my lowest grade this semester because of this professor. Yes, I attended class all the time and studied hard, but he made the exams/material/grading as difficult as possible. All he cares about is going to Japan & not our well being. do NOT recommend.

Dr. Box has really good intentions & is a really sweet man, but he is the worst professor ive ever had. Im about to enter my final year of college & never experienced such poor teaching. He flies through his power points, lectures are very heavy and unclear. Only graded by four exams. drop the class if you dont pass the first 2.

I love his passion, but man hes confusing in his lectures. If you take notes from his extremely fast PowerPoint slides and go over the notes in the textbook he gives you, you should be fine. Dont follow what he saids because that is not on the exam.

He is very knowledgable about the content but he teaches as if it is a review and not like he is teaching it to students for the first time. If you are taking geography to get an easy A for a physical science credit, DO NOT take Elgene. There is so much material for each exam and not all of it is on the test which makes studying hard.
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment_Rating: Dr. Box is not a bad guy or anything, just very old fashioned which might shock some people. He doesn't use ELC and grades off of few assignments. It's very important that you go to class and take detailed notes and study. I thought I could skate by by just showing up, but you really do need to put in effort here. An A is very possible though.
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment_Rating: His class is pure lecture. I struggled from day 1 and should've dropped the class. I miss the second exam for a family emergency and my final became 60% of my grade. The only grades are 4 hard exams and people seemed to do very well or very poorly. During add drop week, if things make sense then give it a try, but if you can't grasp it drop.
ratingTags_Rating: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment_Rating: There are only 4 graded assignments; 3 tests and 1 final. If you have an A or B average on the 3 tests, and show up to class consistently, he'll let you exempt the final. However, over half of my class failed the first 2 tests. If you take him, use the information in your yellow notebook to study for tests because his lectures are too confusing.
ratingTags_Rating: Participation matters--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment_Rating: He was very difficult to reach outside of class. He does not use email and it is really difficult to meet for office hours. He lectures every day through powerpoints that he will not put online. Also speaks really quickly so you don't get all the info down. Tests were way more specific than the lectures. Highly do not recommend, not an easy science
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment_Rating: He doesn't post anything online and makes you go out and buy the syllabus/binder needed for the class in addition to the book that is barely helpful. He went on tangents about things that weren't on the tests and just lightly brushed over the things that were. Take anyone else!! He's no help and very rude when you ask questions.

Most people think this class will be an easy A so they don't go to class. If you go to class and just listen you will do fine. He takes attendance randomly and if you have an A or B average and attend class 50% of the time, you can exempt the final. Study hard for the exams and this class is not bad.

Professor Box is clearly passionate and knows the material inside and out. His class is very lecture heavy with only four grades, only being exams. He doesn't take regular attendance, but I would strongly advise not skipping because it's hard to catch up after missing lectures (that aren't available online).
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment_Rating: He refuses to use ELC at all so don't go looking for any powerpoints or grades in there. He blasts through limitless topics as you struggle to keep up. He is unreachable outside of class and won't reply to emails. He'll just read off powerpoints and answer your questions. Only grades are tests. However I was on my phone every day and still got an A
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment_Rating: Dr. Box is obviously very knowledgeable about the content, but he spends half a second on each slide and expects you to have it written down or memorized. Tests are hard. He teaches very broadly but the test questions will be extremely specific.
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment_Rating: this class is way too hard and my class has a 78 for a test average and he said that was good???? thats weird cause then most of us would have C's or below
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--Tests are tough

comment_Rating: If you don't go to class or have someone to share notes with, then you won't pass. He gives you a notebook, but gives a lot of extra info in class through the slides (that he does not share online!!) He's a really nice guy but the course isn't easy. There is only 3 exams & a final. (fyi, take pictures of the slides in class bc he moves quickly)
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment_Rating: Dr. Box is obviously extremely knowledgable in the field of physical geography. However, this leads him to sort of glide over the basics that students need to learn. Overall, he IS a nice guy and I think he really wants to see students succeed, but he makes this course waaaaay too difficult (its a 1100 course lol). TAKE GOOD LECTURE NOTES

You HAVE to take notes. He says the textbook is enough but that isn't true. If you take notes/pictures of the slides and make good study guides you can very easily do well in the class. Don't take this class if you're not willing to put any effort in because you will fail. Show up to class & take the lectures seriously and you'll do very well.
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment_Rating: I took Box because it worked with my schedule. Don't do it. Change your schedule. He refuses to upload powerpoints to ELC because he figures that will encourage students to come to class, instead it just helps us fail. Tons of material covered at a lightning pace, very difficult to keep up unless you take pictures of the slides in real time.
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment_Rating: This was not an easy class but it was not impossible either! The key to passing is paying attention in class and taking notes. Most people don't do well because they zone out during classes or don't take his lectures seriously but if you pay attention in class then you only have to do about 5-8 hours of studying for each exam and you can make an A.
ratingTags_Rating: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment_Rating: Worst prof I've ever had. DO NOT TAKE THIS COURSE WITH BOX!!! I had friends in the same class but with a different profs, and they finished with an A overall. Box makes no effort to meet after class and he teaches like everyone in the class already knows the info. I never skipped a class and failed 2 tests. Can exempt the final if you have an A/B.
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment_Rating: Ridiculously hard for a 1000-level class. Box expects you to memorize a slide as soon as he shows it, even if he doesn't give you time to write it down. Usually when someone asks a question he acts like they're just being stupid, even though his lectures are insanely detailed and hard to follow. Tests are extremely hard as well.

Although Dr. Box is, without a doubt, incredibly knowledgeable in his field, his lectures are not very helpful when it comes to studying for the exams.  His lectures include superfluous, trivial information that (most) will not appear on the exam.  His exams are incredibly difficult for an intro level class.  Study his notebook, learn the vocab.

DO NOT TAKE ELGENE BOX He makes his test up the night before and they commonly have nothing to do with what you studied. If you go to his office hours he will patronize you. He YELLED at our class and called us stupid because half the class failed the test, which was obviously our fault and not due to his teaching. Nice person. HORRIBLE professor.

He is obviously an expert  in his field and has a passion for geography and weather systems. Most of the photo he showed as examples were taken by him around the world. His classes were the definition of lectures, but he interacted with the class frequently and keyed in on those who were keyed into his class.

I took this class expecting it to be an easy physical science credit. However, it is not. Professor Box knows the material very well and expects you to do the same. It's a lot of application of the concepts you learn in class so if you understand those you're golden. DO NOT miss a lecture it'll feel like you missed 1000 years of class.

He talks fast in lectures and speeds through slides, so you'd best take pictures of the long slides. He knows what he is talking about and gets easily excited about his subject, which is great to see. Help and clarification is there if you ask.
Do not take this class. He is a horrible professor and is very scatter-brained.

This guy has been a leading mind in his specific field (Plant Geography) for over 30 years. It's not the easiest, but if you're willing to attend, listen, and learn then Dr. Box is one of the best you'll have. All of his bad reviews are from Intro GEOG kids who are mad he doesn't use ELC, ignore them, they're just stupid underclassmen.

I took to Weather and Climate with Box thinking it would be an easy A, I was wrong. So far I've been struggling quite a bit. His last class section is the most interesting but I am dreading his final exam. Personally his is very interesting, he has traveled to what seems like every place on earth. All in all, not an easy class

There is almost no point in going to class. He goes too fast and doesn't teach you much of anything. His study guides give little help for the exams, and the exams are actually much harder than they should be given that he does not give much focus to anything. You will hate this class. It's boring and pointless.

He likes to give pop quizzes, but they're only based on attendance. You can exempt the final if you have a B, but few people did. Your grade is made up of 3 tests. The book was useless. He doesn't put notes on ELC, instead he uses an overhead projector so if you miss class, you miss notes that aren't in the notebook you have to buy.

Professor Box's teaching seemed to be a little outdated. He doesn't like using computers and therefore it is hard to follow along with the notes. His tests are also very ambiguous and all over the place.  His lectures were hard to follow.

He is not that great of a teacher, and the material is really hard! This class is not a breeze and the tests are pretty much based off the study guides but still require a lot of studying. He's nice if you got to him during office hours, and he will try to help you do better. the book doesn't help at all so dont buy it.
He cannot teach to save his life! He rushes through everything so fast that I cannot catch anything that he says. And his tests require a LOT of studying!

Dr. Box is a nice guy to anyone who actually goes to class. His attendance isn't completely necessary but I HIGHLY suggest that you don't skip his class. Tests are unpredictable. If you are not good at taking tests, don't take this class because your grade will mainly come from the tests. Other than that, this is a good class.

I really did not like this class or the professor. It was extremely boring and the professor seemed rude to me. I went in to ask some questions for an exam once and he gave me one word answers and looked at me like I was stupid.  He doesn't know what ELC is and very rarely responds to e-mails.

Dr. Box is a weather geek!! Doesn't require attendance, but you need to go. He follows a note booklet, so the notes are practically there. His lectures provide the basic questions for the test though.. and he'll answer ANY question you have. Allowed those with A's or B's to exempt the final if they wished, which was nice. Interesting class and prof

He's very sweet, and obviously brilliant; however, he expects everyone in the class to automatically understand the subject as well as he does. He does not use a computer AT ALL, which is incredibly frustrating. (really, he showed us slides...) Only take this class if you are interested in the subject.

Boxeo is a decent teacher - he clears his throat really grossly a lot... but he gets the information across. The tests are really unpredictable and set up strangely. I guessed a lot - the first test I got a 93 on and the second a 58... really unpredictable. Fairly interesting subject though!

This professor makes a fairly simple subject very confusing. The packet you get is half typed (and I mean on a typewriter) half scribbled notes. I have put some effort into the class but it is so boring and pointless I have a hard time focusing. Needs to send out powerpoints but I don't think he knows what a computer is. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS.

Nice man and has a strong interest and understanding of the subject. The material itself is pretty dry unless you're actually interested in the topics, which makes attending class difficult. He takes no attendance [except for maybe once that I can recall] and has the notes printed in a BelJean packet. First test is hardest b/c style is unexpected.

Easy Class. He's Not very helpful, but it doesn't matter. I went to class no more than ten times that semester. I didn't even look at the material until a couple of days before the tests. I studied maybe ten hours per test. I made an A. Go to the first week of class though. It sets a good foundation.

He's a nice old man, but he really needs to update his teaching styles.  Sorry buddy, overheads are definitley out.  He makes a BelJean notebook thingy, so if you study what he tells you to in the notebook, you should be ok for the test.  I think the first test is the hardest because you don't really know what to expect.  Overall I learned a lot.
No Comments

BORING!!!! I went to this class maybe 6 times total.  I just couldnt take it...it was so boring! I crammed night before test out of bel jean notes and ended up with a B.  If you have insomnia take this class he will cure you!
Do not take this class
HORRIBLE!  You can tell this man is brilliant but he can't teach it to you for anything...

She has a terrible teaching style and none of the assignments will match up with any of the work done in class.  She tries her best, but expects everyone to just be getting it because she's obviously the best teacher ever.  Average grade on the first test was a 50.  Avoid if possible.
ratingTags_Rating: Group projects--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment_Rating: This was hands down the worst class I have ever taken. Whitehead makes things a lot harder than they need to be for this class. If I were you, I would take the math placement test and avoid this course at all costs.

Professor Whitehead's lectures made sense, but sometimes the homework wouldn't be similar at all. You get unlimited attempts at hw quizzes which is nice. There are 4 tests, all of which she gives you thorough review guides for that almost mirror the tests. If you get a higher grade on the final, she drops your lowest test grade and replaces it.
ratingTags_Rating: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment_Rating: Professor Whitehead is a really nice person who is pretty fair. When she teaches the her explanations are a little confusing and not super helpful, but if you go to her office hours she will take the time to help you. If you put in work you will get a good grade. You don't have to show up to class, there is an attendance sheet but no grade .

Professor Whitehead is a really nice person who is pretty fair. When she teaches the her explanations are a little confusing and not super helpful, but if you go to her office hours she will take the time to help you. If you put in work you will get a good grade. You don't have to show up to class, there is an attendance sheet but no grade for it.

She was extremely helpful and her lectures were very easy to follow. It helps if you take notes and show up to class but even if you don't, catching up is easy because she posts the powerpoints online. she doesnt require a textbook and shes an all around great teacher.

I'm not the best at math and Ms. Whitehead made it even more difficult. She constantly dismisses questions from students who don't understand material and will not explain anything over again. I mainly taught myself with uga's online tutorials for the class.
ratingTags_Rating: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment_Rating: Math Modeling is supposed to be one of the easiest classes at UGA but Professor Whitehead makes it unnecessarily confusing. She moves so fast through lectures. If you miss one class you have missed an entire unit and if you look down for so much as one minute during class, you will be confused. There are 10 homework assignments per unit and 5 tests
ratingTags_Rating: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment_Rating: Professor Whitehead is a very good teacher; she teaches everything very well and makes sure that everyone understands. If you show up to class and pay attention, and do the online quizzes, you will do fine!
ratingTags_Rating: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment_Rating: Professor Whitehead is a sweet southern lady who really wants you to learn in her class. She is accessible outside of class to help you with anything you may need. The tests are very similar to the lectures and homework. As long as you do your work and show up you should have no trouble in this class.

She was extremely condescending towards students and if someone tried to ask a question she would cut them off and continue teaching. The class is easy, she takes attendance but it doesnt matter. I basically taught myself the entire class through the notes. Its calculator heavy, she doesnt teach the math but how to use the calculator.

Do not take this class. I had so many friends take the same course with a different professor and they had a much better experience. She is rude when you ask questions and makes the class much harder than it needs to be.

I honestly do not understand who wrote these reviews because they could not be farther from the truth. Mrs. Whitehead is truly the worst teacher I have ever had, preschool to sophomore year of college. She doesn't want to be there as much as you won't and it shows. She makes you feel stupid for asking questions and is beyond out of touch. HORRIBLE.

Susan Whitehead made things unnecessarily difficult. This class could have been much easier, but she does not explain things well at all. About 10 quizzes for every unit. Study for tests and the best way to study is with the practice problem set she provides.
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment_Rating: Susan is an AMAZING professor! 10/10 recommend. I'm not a math person, and she makes it manageable. She is very helpful, but you have to put effort in. If you're struggling, go to office hours, and I promise it's beneficial. She will help you until you understand, and is very personable while doing so. I hope my professors to come compare to her.

Mrs. Whitehead is the best professor. She is so flexible with office hours and will sit with you until you completely understand what youre doing. I took this class as a freshman and I hope my other professors throughout the years compare to her. there is homework but if you do it and stay caught up youll realize its actually super helpful!!

Whitehead is a solid choice for this course. Although her lectures can be at times confusing they're not hard to follow if you bring the notes or at least follow along closely and ask her questions to clarify. If you're still confused I would recommend office hours. Use her practice problems and you'll be fine on the tests.
ratingTags_Rating: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment_Rating: Ms. Whitehead is a kind lady. She does not allow phones or laptops. The way she teaches the material can be slightly confusing, but if you ask for clarification she helps. The tests are difficult if you do not study. However, if you take the practice test ahead of time and know the material you will do fine on the tests.
ratingTags_Rating: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment_Rating: Ms. Whitehead is SUCH a good professor. She explains things so clearly and is always available for extra help. She gives you unlimited submissions for the homework on eLC and always has a study session before every test. She is very patient and will review a concept or calculator technique even if she's already gone over it 10 times before.

Ms. Whitehead is an amazing professor. There is NO reason to struggle in this class. I failed the first test and almost withdrew, but with her encouragement, I stayed. If you are struggling, ASK for help, email her and go to office hours. I worked my butt off for my grade but she helped so much. Cant say enough about how great she was.

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS. The material is pretty simple but she makes it so hard. People will ask questions during test reviews in class and will make fun of students and bash their intelligence. Theres about 50 online quizzes, a math project, 4 tests and a final. She doesn't care about her students at all. DO NOT TAKE HER.
ratingTags_Rating: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment_Rating: VERY HARD CLASS!!! I wouldn't recommend taking this class if you aren't naturally good at math or aren't willing to work VERY hard. There are 5 tests including a final and about 30 online quizzes throughout the semester. She offers no extra credit but will drop your two lowest quizzes and will replace your lowest test score with the final.
ratingTags_Rating: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Tests are tough

comment_Rating: everyone hates math and she understands that so she makes the math very understandable. As long as you go to class and put away your phone and follow along with the notes and your calculator, you'll be fine. 4-5 elc quizzes due the day of the test, they are hard so start days in advance. very accessible office hours. project worth 10% is easy too.
ratingTags_Rating: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment_Rating: Don't expect to walk in and get an easy A. Had to put in a lot of work before each test. Still a solid choice for math modeling
ratingTags_Rating: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--TEST HEAVY--Tests are tough

comment_Rating: The actual material isn't super hard but I still had a rough time with this class( I made A's on all my math classes in HS).She's pretty rude and makes you feel dumb for asking questions--not to mention never had the actual answers to the questions with her. The tests are 20 questions and very easy to fail--she doesn't give partial credit. HW's key
ratingTags_Rating: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment_Rating: If you go into this class thinking it is super easy it will get you. Study hard, do the quizzes as the material is taught and go to office hours to ask specific questions if you need help. She is pretty passive aggressive but oh well- suck it up and she will teach you a lot.
ratingTags_Rating: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment_Rating: Honestly, Susan was a VERY hard teacher. If you skip class you miss important information about how to do problems. I skipped a bit and my grade suffered because of it.
