Her class is not hard if you go to class and try. Her office hours are not helpful so I would take advantage of the peer tutors. Study well for tests and go to the DAE review days.
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Tests are tough

comment_Rating: I hate this lady... She made things so difficult when MATH MODELING should be stupid easy! If you're good at math you'll be straight, but if your like me who actually needs a teacher to care about your well doing in the class then don't take her class. She grades tough and she wont even let you ask questions during the test, and has a smart mouth!
ratingTags_Rating: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment_Rating: She's rude and makes you feel dumb for asking questions. Her class average for the second exam was between 39-43. Doesn't give extra credit. Don't take her
ratingTags_Rating: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment_Rating: Susan is the WORST teacher I have ever had in my life. All she does are examples and does not explain concepts and when you ask questions she snaps at you for not knowing even though everybody is confused. 0/10 recommend this horrible woman and this terrible class. She will RUIN your GPA if you're not good at teaching yourself math.

Dr. Whitehead is one of the best professors I've ever had. I'm not a math person and really struggled the first two units, but began going to office hours before class and started getting solid As. I wouldn't have been able to turn my grade around without her help. She answers all questions via emails immediately, and really cares about your grade.
ratingTags_Rating: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment_Rating: I have always struggled in math and failed the first test because I didn't know how to study for it but I've made a 90, 100, 100 on the last three tests and the final replaces the lowest test. Lectures are all online and you basically have to teach yourself because she doesn't go in much depth but it really isn't difficult. Fairly easy A.

Whitehead is sarcastic and inflexible. If you ask questions during class, she acts incredulous and treats students like they're dumb. She then generally tells the student to "ask those around you to help you." If you can do math without much guidance, she's fine. If you actually need to be taught- look for a different professor. I

So thankful for professors like Susan. She was so understanding and patient. Her quizzes are unlimited tries which is awesome, she replaces  your lowest grade with your final if it's higher. She responds to emails with questions quickly. Her class challenged me but in a good way. I got out the class with an A, but I worked hard for it! Take her!

If you're taking this for an easy math credit, take her. She very clearly explains everything & it's a good refresher on basic concepts. Even working ahead, I got 100s on almost all quizzes & finished w/ a 98 in the class. Others who aren't already solid in some basic math concepts found the class more difficult, but I heard she was helpful 1:1.

I have never been particularly good at math so I took Math 1101 to fulfill my requirement. This class was a bit difficult at first because of I was not used to the way she thought, but by the second test I understood. The notes she gives you will help you on the quizzes, and the test. Like any math class it takes practice to truly understand.
ratingTags_Rating: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment_Rating: If i could choose a word to describe her it would be "meh". she's gonna do her job and expect you to do yours. Online quizzes with unlimited tries and all we do in class is go over them. Honestly she can make easy concepts confusing for no reason. If you're expected a SUPER easy class don't take this one. just go ahead and take stats or something.
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment_Rating: kind of confusing but not impossible. There is homework for every section and she does not give any partial credit on tests.

Very scattered curriculum for this class. Although she understands the material, she explains it in a very complicated way, and I had to reteach myself everything. Takes off points for very minor mistakes on tests which really hurts. If you follow directions, 20% of your grade will end up being 100% easily. Four hard tests and a hard final.

I dont even think she understands the material that she is teaching, so she is really bad at answering questions, like REALLY bad. Shes condescending and makes fun of you. She hates cellphones. No attendance policy though, so theres that.

This class is not terribly hard, but as someone who is AWFUL at math, it was still a bit of a challenge. This being said, Ms. Whitehead is the ideal person to teach a non major math class. She is clear, concise and ready to help you outside of class. I would have gotten a better grade but I bombed  the project. I recommend a TI-36X Pro Calculator.

I am not a math person at all, but got an A. The slow-paced lectures are easy to understand with lots of examples. Homework is assigned for each unit, but it is optional and not turned in. I never did it. There are four online quizzes and one online review quiz for each unit. If you do well on the quizzes, you will do well on the tests as well.

I did not attend class regularly because I did not find the lectures to be helpful. Her lectures are just going over examples in the textbook which I found easier to just do on my own time. If you can do the Unit Reviews(like a study guide) before each test, you'll make an A. She is also extremely rude and condescending if you ask her a question.
Theres no homework but theres multiple online quizzes each week. gives a review guide for tests which is very helpful. can be somewhat condescending when questions are asked.

She takes attendance everyday and you can get someone to sign you in, but if you miss the lecture, it's really easy to get behind. You don't have to turn in any "homework", but you have online quizzes almost every week. Also she's very condescending. I felt like I couldn't approach her without feeling stupid.

Straight forward and clear with concepts. Lot of online quizzes that help with grade. Takes attendance everyday but if you show up and take notes you'll be good. Homework isn't mandatory but good practice for tests. Text book necessary for online quizzes and in class problems. I'm not math savvy but thought this was an easy A.

Ms Whitehead is an excellent math teacher. Her lectures are always clear, and I've rarely had any questions about what to do. However, if you do have questions she is happy to help. I definitely recommend her class.

I found her to be somewhat rude and unhelpful when it came to answering questions in class. She is also super strict about any technology. She is very thorough in lecture and if you pay attention you can get an A. She was very nice over email but condescending in class. From my friends with the class, she is better than others.

LOVE this professor! She answers all your questions during class and after. Takes role but you can have someone write your name down for you and come late. Tests are short (like 13 or so ??s) but if you pay attention and do homework you'll have an A. She is very thorough! 4 tests, homework is a quiz you do online weekly, and a project and exam.

She is awesome! I had never been very good at math and had always had bad teachers, but she wants you to do well. She is clear on class expectations and if you do the homework you'll learn what will be on tests and quizzes. Study old tests and quizzes to get an A+! Also very welcoming at office hours.

She's not the easiest grade-wise, but I think she's your best bet for this course after talking to friends in the same class with other teachers. I really liked her and loved the class. She's very good at explaining and it was just a great class because you always know what you're doing. Definitely recommend her!

I know a lot of people find her annoying because she explains things very thoroughly, but I loved it. I'm not a math person in the slightest, but she was probably the best instructor I could've had for the course. Quizzes are the class period before the test, which are essentially the exact same format of the test itself. Highly recommend

She is very good teacher and goes over the material slowly and beaks everything down for you. Her quizzes are open note, partner (basically the whole class works together). Her tests are not bad if you study the quizzes and do practice problems. Homework is assigned but not turned in.

Overall a fairly easy class. She explains all concepts very well, and there is an open note, open book quiz before each test (you can even work in groups). My only complaint is that she could be a little condescending when questions are asked. Oh, and you'll be kicked out in a heart if she catches a glimpse of your phone.

She is very good about helping out if you have any problems. She explains things very well. She allows quizzes to be a semi-study guide for the test, but be warned, she throws some curve balls on the tests. If you do the homework (not turned in) then you'll be okay. I'm not a math person and found her course well taught. She's nice.

Really great teacher! Super clear with what she wants you to know, very helpful! Quizzes the day before each test open note with partners. Highly reccomend. But be warned.. its not much like you did in high school! STUDY! work problems from quizzes and homework for test. Test usually JUST LIKE the quiz but with an additional problem!

Mrs. Whitehead is a good teacher. She dumbs things down a lot but I'm terrible at math so it was helpful at times. She takes attendance so go to class, you'll need to go anyways if you want to understand the material.

Math is not my forte whatsoever, but I loved Whitehead. She knew her stuff, and she explained it well. If you acted cocky, she put you in your place, but if you went to her office hours and participated in class with genuine concern for your grade, she would help you. I highly recommend her and thought her humor was hilarious.

Math is not my strong suit and she was absolutely no help.  She told the class that the math tutors on campus would not teach the way she wanted us to do things, so not to use them.  Then she was unhelpful as well.  Take anyone else.

I struggle with math to begin with, and Whitehead was a mix of things. As far as explanation, she's wonderful. She knows her stuff - but be prepared to be reminded of the fact that you don't. She's snarky and I felt undermined by her when she proceeded to tell me to anticipate a C based on my first two exams. I made a B. So, she's good, but mean.

The class is weird because she doesn't actually teach a whole lot- she just works problems.  It's nice because she'll work any problem you ask her to, including problems from the web quizzes, but I didn't feel like I was learning anything other than memorizing how to work specific problems.  There is no partial credit because it's all on computer.
The class is easy and the tests are pretty easy. Compared to other math classes, the concepts in this class are elementary.
Willing to help if you need it, explains things very clearly and very deliberately, genuinely wants you to understand

Mrs. Whitehead is definitely the best option at UGA for Math 1101. We had about 10 quizzes this semester, 3 of which came the class before the unit test, and you could use notes/neighbors. Replaces your lowest test grade with your final grade if it's better. Allows 5 absences, if you exceed she drops you from the class. Really a good math teacher.

Ms. Whitehead is an okay teacher, she repeats things a lot and always works out  problems from the webquizzes in class, which other teachers don't do. She will work and problem a student requests. However she gets confused a lot and can make you feel stupid at times. You have to come to class in order to do well.

i HATED professor whitehead. she is completely useless. i was really good at math before i took her course. there is no such thing as partial credit because everything is done on the computer. she is incompetent and rude and always gets confused in class. do NOT take her class.
Do not take her. I would've rather have had a harder class than be told I was stupid day after day after day. SO patronizing and condescending. Worst class I have ever taken.

Mrs. Whitehead is a very nice lady. She makes things very clear, and repeat things a lot. She goes over homeworks (which are not mandatory, but helps.)One thing that bothered me was that she focused a lot on usage of calculators rather than learning how to solve problems by hands. But she is nice, and tests are straight forward.

I didn't like her at first, but I ended up loving her. I mean, her "condescension" is mainly because she emphasizes things over and over, but STILL some students ask her the same question. Take her. She makes it easier than other teachers.

Mrs. Whitehead is an amazing teacher. I was really worried going into the class as I havn't had a math class in 10 years. She was always clear and emphasized the key concepts. She may at times seem a bit frustrated if you aren't understanding but only if she has repeated herself alot. Do the homework, ask questions and be sure to go to class.

She is incredibly patronizing, so just accept that being in math modeling means you aren't very good at math (b/c she never fails to remind the class of that.) Regardless, she taught everything thoroughly with several repetitions. She gives clear outlines for what to study for the tests. THIS IS YOUR BEST OPTION for math modeling

Don't let her age fool you - she is smart as a whip!!  She is the most helpful math teacher I've ever had.  Whitehead would go over any homework or quiz problems you needed, too.  This class is an easy A as long as you do your homework (unlimited amount of tries!) and study for tests.  TAKE WHITEHEAD and you won't regret it.

Mrs. Whitehead explained the material in a way that broke down the concepts and allowed me to understand what I was doing rather than just telling me what to do which was very helpful. As long as you do your homework the class will be a breeze. Homework is assigned every night but is optional.

At least 2 quizzes for each test. You don't have to do the homework. If you study problems she goes over in class and the quizzes you will be fine for the tests. The tests are pretty easy, don't forget your calculator for quizzes or tests or you get -5 pts. Best teacher for this subject!

This class is extremely easy.  I hardly ever attended the class, and I made an A. An attendance sheet is passed around at the beginning of each class, but it doesn't count for anything.  She can be rather condescending, and she tends to make her students feel stupid.  As long as you practice textbook problems before each test, you will succeed.

Mrs. Whitehead is by far the best math teacher I have ever had! She helps out on the quiz problems and homework problems all the time! She sometimes does make mistakes while writing on the board, however that would make us laugh and get through the class. If you get a chance to take her class, DO IT! The prof makes the complete difference in math!

the easieness of the class depends on if you can understand the material. study and you should do fine. the tests are exactly like what she does in notes and in class. she can kind of be a betch though because she acts like whoever asks a question is stupid...so ask a friend instead. shes not very helpful when it comes to that. she takes attendance
Basic Algebra. It's like high school all over again or middle school dare I say. Not too hard and extremely boring. Test are easy as well. Professor Whitehead is very kind.

I took her for Pre-Cal and she can be sarcastic or condescending in her tone. She is not too hard but she does confuse herself a lot and when a student corrects her mistake, she always makes up an excuse as to why it was wrong. She may start working out a problem but she'll tell us to finish it. WTF?! She isn't hard, drops a lot of grades. Made a B

Ms. Whitehead is a great lady but if I am honest, she was extremely confusing at times. She knows the material, but at times had trouble explaining the problem or giving an easy to understand explanation. A great lady but I think I made the mistake of taking her TR she probably would be better and easier to understand 3 times a week.

Class was very easy and she made everything very clear and easy to understand. I never did the homework and still did well on all of the tests and quizzes. She explains things as though you are a second grader sometimes, but it makes it that much more straight forward. I would definitely recommend her.

I hated math in highschool and I have an A. She gives very good notes and her material is all very well organized. She explains everything clearly and always goes over everything in class that is going to be on the tests. If you ask obvious questions, she can sound sarcastic, but she is always willing to help.

She is a pretty good professor.  But she can be rather condescending and makes her students feel stupid and inadequate.  Homework is not mandatory but do it anyways...she takes most of the questions on quizzes and tests from homework!

A great teacher, goes slowly so students really understand the material. If you can definitely take her. There is homework but you don't have to do it. Quizzes and tests are easy. If you pay attention in class you will do fine.

Great teacher! She will help you A LOT with math, especially if its not your subject. She's also very nice and patient and makes sure you understand everything before the test. I made a 100% on every test!
She's great and really makes the problems seem so simple!  She is always willing to help if you have any problems or questions!!

Ms. Whitehead is truly a remarkable teacher. I have never felt very comfortable with math and she has taught me so much in such a short amount of time. I now feel confident in my math skills because she is such a great teacher and makes the material easier to understand. She always explains problems well and answers student?s questions with good ex

TAKE HER!!! She speaks English (as her native language!) She is really helpful but all homework and tests are done through J-Exam. She goes over lots of practice problems so don't be afraid to ask for help!

Perhaps the best math teacher in Boyd. I was horrible with math in highschool, and I ended up with an A. I did work pretty hard for the grade though, but her teaching is superb. I don't think she writes too fast, and she is very clear. Her teaching applies to the tests and you don't have to worry about working problems you have never seen before.
Take her! You won't regret it

She is an excellent teacher, and she explains very well.  Very easy to follow, and all her teaching is helpful for the test.  Teaches almost exactly what will be on test.  Great and not boring at all.  Very enthusiastic, helpful, and intellegent.  I would definitely recommend taking her.

I liked her! Make sure u took this class in hs, I did and I got an A in the class.  If math isnt your forte this class won't be easy, somehow she writes on the blackboard incredibly fast, and she doesn't waste a single minute if you take it 2X a week.  She's always willing to help, DONT BUY THE BOOK, just do the JEXAM hw and practice tests.
Gives out many handouts to help you, however in class she goes a little fast. One of the better math teachers at UGA

Ms. Whitehead was an amazing teacher. She was one of the best Math teachers I have ever had! The problems are on JEXAM, so she doesn't make the tests, but she is great at preparing you for the homework and tests. She is very willing to meet with you and answer questions and really cares about getting to know you as the student. Highly recommended.
Take Reichle instead. You won't regret it!
Wonderful! very clear explanations and always ready to help.

Mrs. Whitehead is a very good teacher. Her teachings are very clear and she will always help you if you need it. I would reccomend this class to people who math isn't their strong suit because they will be able to understand the concepts and get a good grade!
Awesome
Fantastic! Don't take anyone else for this class! oh, and DO NOT BUY THE BOOK! It will be a total waste of your money, all the homework and everything you need to prepare for tests is JEXAM!

She's absolutely excellent! If you have to take a subject as hard as Pre-Calculus I would only suggest Whitehead. Many of the other professors can barely speak English! She explains things amazingly well!
She is a very nice teacher but this class was very difficult for me! Her test are very hard and learning how to use the calculator for math modeling was really difficult!!

This class is extremely basic and mostly a re-hash of something you would learn in high school. Ms. Whitehead approaches the material very thoroughly and makes sure you definitely have a good grasp of it before moving on, which is helpful to those that are not very good in math (such as myself). Highly recommended if math isn't your thing.

Ms. Whitehead is an excellent teacher for pre-calc, prob one of the best at UGA.  She explains everything clearly, and goes over most of the J-exam problems, which are helpful when studying for tests.  She does not take attendance, but she does give out quizzes frequently.  She will also help you with any problem you do not understand. Take her!

She is really really nice and is willing to help you with any problem you have in class. While attendance isn't really mandatory, quizzes are given regularly during class. Going to office hours definitely helps if you're having trouble.
Great teacher, clear and concise, focuses only on test materials.

Ms. whitehead is an amazing teacher! Precal uses JEXAM so she doesnt get to make the tests but she prepares really well for them. she explains everything very clearly and doesnt take attendance. she gives easy quizzes to boost your grade. TAKE HER IF YOU CAN!!!
Ms. Whitehead is awesome! She explains everything you need to know for the test!!
Very good teacher because she focuses on what you will be test on.
she is a great math teacher and really explains everything very clearly

Don't take PreCal UNLESS YOU HAVE MS. WHITEHEAD! She is awesome! She honestly explains EVERYTHING you need to know. She has office hours and she cancels class the day of the test which is really nice. Jexam obviously isn't the best but you'll get used to it. Her quizzes are jokes if you go to class, but study hard for the tests! A+ teacher!

Does a great no. of examples.  Attend class to not get confused. Quizzes are gimmes.  Tests require some studying.  However I think course might have been actually more simple if she didn't progress in so many baby steps and just taught u the final concept u need.
Decent teacher, tests are pretty hard, but the practice tests help a lot. Just make sure you go to every class and take notes and you'll do alright.

Great teacher! She was extremely clear and would do anything at all to help you. She could look around the room and see the confused expression on my face and would re-explain what she was doing. She did not mess around with lofty theory: she was all-practical, example problems, and what would be on the test.

She is such an amazing teacher!  She is incredibly clear and helpful and she'll always give an example of every problem you could possibly see on the test so you're always prepared.  If you take the notes and practice on JExam, you can easily get an A!

I loved her. She was really nice. I've never been that great at math but she breaks it down and does problems out of JEXAM. I had seen almost every question on my tests before on her worksheets or quizzes. You need to study for sure but if you go to class and do the JExams...you'll get an A.

Mrs. Whitehead is awesome! She always goes over everyones questions and makes sure they understand before moving on. She gives an adequate amount of homework and spaces her tests and quizes out nicely. She is always available for help and the best thing is she lets class out early almost every day!!!!

It is a pretty easy class. You definitely have to study to do well on the tests. She gives really easy quizzes about once a week and drops the lowest two of these grades. A very simple project that takes about 20 minutes to finish is 10% of your grade also. Also--she lets class out early pretty much always.

Ms. Whitehead is a great teacher. She is very helpful, and is very laid back and easy going. She is also American, and is southern, so she speaks perfect southern english. I would recommend her to anyone.
Very clear, easy to follow. Can be condescending... but overall she is a pretty nice lady. I'm pretty awful at math and I found her class easier than I expected.
She really made sure that everyone followed her.  Even at times it felt like I was back in elementary school, but hey when it comes to math that's what I need.  Overall, she is a great math teacher.

This was a great math class. For someone who's only C in highschool was Algebra 3, it felt great making an A. I never missed the class and I think that really helped when it came time to issue grades. She always wants to help and she explains math in a way everyone is able to grasp. Do the homework and practice tests and you'll do fine in the class

She explains the concepts in a clear and understandable way down to the last detail.  She can be a bit condescending at times, but overall she is very helpful and while I wouldn't call her class intersting I would call it informative and easy to grasp.

Mrs. Whitehead is a fair teacher.  She isn't warm and cuddly, but she'll explain the material to you and offer extra help.  She can have a pompous attitude at times, but once you get beyond it, she's almost cool.
Whitehead is absolutely HORRIBLE!
Best math teacher at UGA. The reason people think she's not is because they are either athletes or don't go to class. If you think she's hard, then you are a retard.
One of the best math teachers I have every had. A+

Whitehead sucks! She is rude and doesn't want to offer help. She thinks if you don't get it you should get out. Her class was hard for me to understand and she was very unwilling to answer questions and help students. She just likes to hear herself talk.
No Comments

Lovingly call this class 'Waffle House Math'. She makes the material easy to understand and spends ample amounts of time on each topic. Seems to be very accessible as far as questions and help go. Wants to help students understand and is straight forward.

I really enjoyed this class. Dr. B-A brings a positive and understanding attitude to each class discussion. She is really wise and brings so much knowledge into each of our discussions. This class discusses a lot of difficult topics and I have learned a tremendous amount. I absolutely recommend taking this class!

The best professor I've had at UGA! The class isn't difficult, pretty easy to make As on tests if you went to class and reviewed your notes. There's no homework and lots of opportunities for extra credit.

I had her for both Business Law and Employment Law in order to fulfill my legal certificate requirements at Terry. I am now in my 3rd year of law school and regularly look back at what a waste those two classes were. Business Law barely prepared me for Contracts 1L year, and Employment Law was just a seminar on cultural agility. Very caring though.
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring--So many papers

comment_Rating: Definitely one of the most caring professors I've ever had! Her tests were kind of hard (very true/false heavy and dealt with small details in the lectures and book), but her lectures are amazing. I would recommend her for sure

Dr. B-A is a sweet professor and very knowledgeable, however, maybe 30 min of the 1hr and 15 min class is spent going over the material. Attendance is mandatory and if you miss more than 2 days, she takes 3 points off your FINAL grade in the class. There are extra credit opportunities but it is very disorganized and causes lots of confusion.

Literally the easiest class I've ever taken at UGA. Definitely interesting to learn about social issues, but if you're looking to actually learn about the law, opt for a different class. Dr. BA is definitely smart and lead great discussions, but if you think you'll get too fed up with a self-absorbed professor , take someone else.
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT--So many papers

comment_Rating: Dr. BA has a lot of life experiences and it's cool to hear her speak on those, however I think as a professor she is just difficult to follow. Her lectures are all over the place, she randomly gets off topic for no reason. Personally, I like her as a person but not as a professor.
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment_Rating: Gives so many opportunities for extra credit that are interesting and stuff you wouldn't usually go to. Tests can be tricky and easy to do poorly on if you don't throughly know the material (they're your only grades). You have to go to lectures or else serious points get taken and you should read the book in addition to her lecture notes
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment_Rating: This is an easy Terry elective as long as you do all the work on time. If you're fine with a class with heavy busy work and strict attendance policy, take this class. There are no tests or final so if you show up and do the work you should be fine
ratingTags_Rating: Get ready to read--Participation matters--So many papers

comment_Rating: Dr. BA is decent. Her lectures just have no structure and she goes on these extremely liberal tangents. Overall it is manageable.

Her class is hard, not going to lie. Unless you plan on going to law school or are really interested in law, you are going to have to study. She is an excellent lecturer but really puts her opinions and viewpoints down your throat all semester. Class is 3 tests, opportunity for up to six points on extra credit! Hard, but possible.

If you want to learn about the law DO NOT take this class. If you want to be woke, DO take this class. It's mostly just her talking about controversial topics, and, if you let yourself, you will learn a lot. DO NOT BUY THE TEXTBOOK. She wrote it, and she makes dang sure you know that, but you don't even kinda need it.
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--SO MANY PAPERS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment_Rating: Easiest class I've taken, show up to class and enjoy it. The material is super interesting. No tests, just one page papers every few weeks. Lots of extra credit opportunity available.

Overall enjoyed the course and material. However, I took this online and it seemed like the professor could care less. Her instructions were confusing and if you sent her an email attempting to clarify you were lucky to get a one word response. Not sure why the professor feels the need to teach if she could care less about her students.
ratingTags_Rating: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LECTURE HEAVY

comment_Rating: Overall the class was enjoyable, Dr. BA is very intelligent and looks to challenge her students. The class consisted mainly of guest lecturers and weekly deliverables from 2 books. Interesting class but be warned, she is very lazy with grading. We have one class left and no one has a clue what their grade is/could be. Pretty easy MGMT elective.

Dr. BA is super sassy. She conducts class in a discussion based lecture so it feels a bit more like an english class. Participation is not necessary but attendance is. This is not a cut and dry class, you get out of it what you put in. Easy A though if you do the work.

I had a technical issue with our first test, I took this class online, and I was only able to submit 5 answers and ended with an 18% as my first test. She was extremely rude about the matter and did not care about my situation. I remained in the course and passed with my first C- somehow even though the tests are ridiculous. Do not recommend.
ratingTags_Rating: Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment_Rating: While some aspects of this class are easy and a great way to get points, the tests are impossible.. I have taken two tests in the class so far, feeling good about the material, then click submit to find that I have made a C on each test. The material seems straight forward, but it's Dr. BA's way of wording the questions that is extremely vague.

This class is unnecessarily difficult. There is a lot of easy supplemental work; however, the tests are ridiculous. To begin, they are ill-worded and do not contain many necessary details. At best most of the class would make Cs with the text in front of them! I have yet to hear of someone making above a B on a test. Tests seem easy. Do NOT take!

I don't even know where to start with this class. The tests are ill-written and contain material that she hasn't mentioned in the text or lectures. Most of the students make C's at best on all of the tests with the material in front of them! This class is unnecessarily difficult, and she clearly doesn't proofread her tests. DONT TAKE

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS. She teaches it at 8am and has a strict attendance policy. You get one excused absence, every absence after that is 5 POINTS off your overall grade. There are zero tests. Assignments are easy, but she takes off major points for not turning them in. She assigns one quiz over material she barely teaches. Not worth taking class.

Dr. B-A is a fantastic teacher. She starts every class with a poem and really cares about her students, not just in relation to her class but in relation to their personal lives. Cares deeply about social issues, which is always a plus. Dedicated professor, gives fair exams. As long as you study and attend class you'll do fine in her class.

I did not like her while I was in her class but retrospectively I realized that she is just a professor who is passionate about teaching. I took 4400 and there were four tests which weren't easy, but were fair. Overall, she can be annoying at times with her large opinions and strong personality, but she means well.

I took 4400&4500-loved both. 4500 was so easy-it's usually at 8am & you can only miss once but if you can handle that+simple writing assignments online then it's a guaranteed A.. entire class is mostly discussion&interesting. 4400 is lectures and had 4 tests-MC & pretty straightforward. I don't get the hate. She gives lots of EC too. TAKE HER!

UGA should seriously consider firing this teacher immediately. You learn absolutely nothing about law. She is arrogant and shoves her opinions down your throat and if you disagree then you are automatically wrong. Easily the worst teacher I have ever had. Her class is very unprofessional and unorganized. Also the assignments are very pointless.

If you really want to know about the law, do not take her, she is so unorganized and efficient. Grades were dues but she turned them in two days after and after flattering her with emails, if you just need an easy a, take her, if you want to be educated, don't. She didn't even grade my papers but still gave me a grade.

This class was SUPER easy! While you don't really learn much about the law itself, you learn a lot about yourself and how certain thoughts affect the work environment. Overall, the class was entertaining and the topics were interesting. But seriously, don't buy the book.

It's no wonder the administration has been fighting her presence since she arrived. She teaches you NOTHING. She uses the class as a soapbox to express her one-sided opinions on all things taboo. She likes to exercise her authority by forcing students to execute hours of pointless busywork. If self-righteousness bothers you DON'T TAKE HER CLASSES.
Wow.  I agree with the previous 4 post.  What they said.

Dr.B-a is truly one of the few professors I've ever had who has prepared me more about real life than any other professor. She teaches you to be more open minded because she doesn't want you to learn your lesson the hard way when you enter the work force. The material in the course def. makes you think.
Don't buy the book!

This Maya Angelou wannabe is a self-righteous, bleeding heart, extreme left-wing liberal indoctrinator who demands eveyone agrees with her political views.  She is a self-righteous narcisist.  The class isn't that hard as long attend class and pretend to agree with her socialist view point, and make sure you do ALL your useless assignments for an A

Easier than Reed but, make sure you only miss one class because she doesn't make that known up front. Also, her test questions are all coin flips because she does not adequately prepare her students (she misses a lot, and when she is there she rambles off topic the whole time, so very little notes). I didn't learn anything about law in this class.

Completely agree with the person below me. Excellent professor who really enjoys what she does. This was my favorite class this semester. You must attend class, however, you are only allowed to miss one class and after that it's 4 points off your final grade for each class. Tests were mostly all true/false....but pretty hard and subjective.

Definitely easier than Reed. Tests are almost completely true/false and very tricky and subjective.. but her extra credit helps a ton. I got B's on all the tests and ended up with an A in the class. Some stuff in her book (that she wrote) completely contradicts what she teaches, and she won't tell you which is the right one.. kinda annoying
As long as you don't disagree with her and attend class, you will get an A. This class taught me nothing more than how to keep my mouth shut.
Discussions in class were dominated by Dr. B-A and pretty much completely one-sided. The work load was pretty easy, you just need to make sure you write what she wants to hear.

This class is useless - a complete waste of time. Extremely easy A, but it takes all the self-restraint I have to sit through this class. Why? The professor is self-righteous and overly idealistic.  She thinks blacks are discriminated against constantly, and she makes generalizations about white people and males. She also says the N-word in class.

Dr. BA has been the worst teacher I've had in 5 years at UGA.  It's an easy A, but i would rather take a C in a class that I actually cared about. If someone in class speaks up w/ an opinion differing from hers they are interrupted rudely and told something like "Class, I'm so glad that was said, you'll learn why thats wrong by the end of my class.
She has switched to power-point notes this year and it has helped a ton! We really don't cover that much in class and she's a great person. Plus, she is WAY easier than Reed!
No Comments

If you do the work and regurgitate her opinions you will do fine.  Do not attempt to give your own opinions if they do not agree with her opinions.  She will take off an extreme amount of points for "not getting the point of the article."  If that happens, just re-write the paper inserting what she obviously wants to hear.

she's an awesome person, so i'd take her class just for that. i agree her tests are somewhat irritating, but in the end everything seems to work out pretty well. Overall I think it's worth it just to meet her and stuff.

The notes she puts on the board are useless.  Memorize the book an you'll be ok.  The tests are difficult because they are extremely subjective, but its worth it just to meet Dr. BA.  She's a wonderful person with a very entertaining classroom.

Dr. B-A's notes on the board are very unorganized, in cursive writing that is pretty difficult to read.  Second test: 48 out of 72 questions were True/False.  Third test 45 out of 50 were true false.  If you like true/false, take this class.  As a person Dr. B-A is awesome, but the tests are annoying.

Dr. B-A is perhaps one of the best professors out there. I found her class interesting and relevant to the real world. She provoked thought and conversation in each session and brought to light many inequalities in the workplace one might encounter. As I am now employed, I have used her teachings many times and have prospered because of it.

Very entertaining teacher.  Tests can be a tab bit difficult because some questions are subjective.  However, she gives TONS of extra credit opportunities.  She does everything possible to make the class fun.  Notes are very disorganized however.

Dr. B-A is one of the best teachers that I ever had a UGA. She is really interested in the students and wants to help you learn and will invest in you. She is not the easiest teacher, but compared to the other Business Law teachers, she is a breeze.

Don't agree with her politics? Get ready for some bad grades. I dared to disagree with her in a paper I wrote and was marked off because I "hadn't learned what I needed to." I rewrote it and spouted her own rhetoric back at her and got an A. Go figure. Waste of a class, don't even bother with this teacher.
Her class is very easy.  Basically just show up and you will make an A.  But you learn in this class, and Dr. BA makes it really fun to look at this boring topic.

If your a conservative, you'll hate her. She preaches openness and "love" for all different types of people with different beliefs (as long as your beliefs are the same as hers). Tests were kind of tricky too. Many answers could go more than one way. I hear Reed is harder yet worth the trouble, so take him.

Dr. BA's class was the best one I've taken at UGA in three semesters.  She is passionate, confident, and well versed in the material she teaches.  Her sassy nature makes her classroom a fun place to be.  You'll walk away from this class with a great deal of practical knowledge.  HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

If you have to take legal studies, this is the ONLY professor to take. I hear the other ones are pretty tough, Dr. BA is a great teacher, great person, and her class is pretty easy. pay attention in class, take notes, which isn't a lot to study, and you should do ok on tests. and she gives easy extra credit and i think attendance pts as well.
Perhaps the worst professor I've ever had.  She just repeats everything she wrote in her own book in class.  Her ethics are somewhat questionable as well.
She's a great teacher and very easy.  You'll learn a lot but won't have to work too hard while doing it.

Her class is an easy A. Don't be scared when she says that you have to work your butt off to achieve a good grade. All you have to do is regurgitate her opinions back to her in single page, 14 point essays all semester long. Not too hard.
Dr. B-A is very interesting.She explains everything very well-you barely have to crack the book-just gloss over it for terms if you forget, but go to class or else you'll miss a lot of info.
No Comments
Dr. B-A is one of the best professors at the University!  Take her class, even if you do not have to.  Class with her was always entertaining!!!!
Take this class for an easy "A", but don't expect to learn much.
A great teacher and even better human
Great teacher and very interesting subject matter.  Very controversial discussion, but enlightening and useful.  Tests are tricky but should make for a fairly easy A or B
Going into every test, I thought I knew everything... boy was I wrong when I got my test back. The tests are ridiculously tricky.
No Comments
Didn't teach me a thing.  Only those looking for an easy grade, and nothing of value should apply.  She is full of rhetoric and didn't provide me with any useful legal info.
She is a terrible, degrading teacher.  I did not learn anything from her and was miserable while in her class.
She is the best professor that taught me about the real world, and prepard me for what to expect after college.  I owe her a great deal of gratitude!
An amazing teacher - you will leave her Employment Law course with a new perspective on the workplace

Baker is a challenging teacher but it is not hard to do well in his class. Every test is 4 questions long and are taken directly from past tests (get those tests from his website).  As long as you study for the test and go to class you should easily be able to get at least a B.

He is very unhelpful. You will do far more learning from doing hw and reading the book than attending his pointless lectures. Half the time he can't get his own problems right. He posts old tests for practice, and 75% of the questions on the tests/final are from these, which is the only reason people can get a good grade, b/c his teaching is awful.

The test are not too bad. I went to class only on the days of the tests and ended up with an A. As a teacher, he is horrible. The things he goes over in class is never on the test. Old tests are VERY helpful (GET THEM IF YOU WANT AN A).

One of the worst teachers that I have ever had.  I really don't know how other people liked him.  I read the book and went to every class.  His lectures were hard to follow and went too fast.  Wouldn't recommend to my worst enemy.

After taking this class you will truly be good at intro physics.  But at what price? Tests are extremely long and are fit into 50 minute periods.  To pass a test it requires unreasonably obsessive studying and you also have to hope you don't make any small math errors during the 50 minutes of frantic working during the test.
Hard professor but you will definately know your stuff

Hard class.  make sure you know all concepts and formulas cold.  study like hell, you are guarenteed a B.  Makes hard class throughly enjoyable.  all exams are similar to practice exams.  final exam is similar to hourly exams.  At least two questions on the hourly exams come straight from practice exams- so know practice exam material well.
Smart man, good teacher (compared to other Physics professors), hard tests, liberal grade curve

dr baker is a most excellent professor and i think the other people who are rating him and gave bad responses didn't take the little bit of time it takes to either study or ask baker questions outside of class
i love dr baker!! hes the best teacher i've ever had!!

Dr. Baker is very intimidating, and teaches from a practiced perspective that doesn't make sense to alot of students first starting physics.  You WILL NOT get higher than a B without going to office hours for extensive help in a Phys4XX class.
the worst prof i've ever had.  criticizes and degrades students in front of the entire class.  i think he tries to make the material as complicated as possible.

Extremely boring, lectures every class without any visual aids.  Isn't bad at first then it gets extremely hard to pay attention by end of semester.. Lectures are frequently off topic and the test topics are straight from lectures.. Not from book.. Many test answers are his opinion not necessarily the right answer.
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment_Rating: Terrible professor, gives very boring lectures and does not speak loud enough. He is not helpful and does not make himself available to meet with students. His tests are incredibly confusing, have multiple correct answers, and don't cover the material he claims we need to know. He gives his class confusing assignments that are poorly explained.

Dr. Baumgartner's class was very boring, but it's so easy. If you've had even the most basic of statistics classes you'll do fine. You don't have to come, but some of his test questions are very detailed from class lectures. All tests and quizzes are open notes/open book.

Dr. Baumgartner is a great professor.  I took him in a graduate school class and he was more than fair and always willing to help.  If you show up to class and take initiative the work will pay off.  I didn't know much about academic research but his class really broadened that perspective for academic research for my graduate program.

Boring Boring Boring!! I had him for intro to kins, and now i have him again mon,wed, fri for a stat class (in kins). oh and its at 8am!! He puts you to sleep every day and tests over the most random info. ex of test question last semester: a) Nurses are doing great and will be doing good. b)nurses are doing good and will be doing great...etc.
Great professor! You will not regret taking his class. The workload is not heavy at all. He's a student's teacher
Easy A. 3 tests (worth 30 points each): 1st test was mainly over syllabus and 3rd test is the "final".

Don't think for one second that just because it has open book tests that it is a joke.  Those tests are by far the hardest open book tests of all time.  If you have a hard time finding stuff quickly out of a book, you are screwed in this class. Better get all his words copied or nots are useless too. Probably made a B and had to fight for it.

He is a very boring teacher. Easy class. You can probably skip all the classes and still make an A in the class. Everything he talks about seems like it would be common sense and really makes it a waste of time to even go to class. He talks a lot and goes off topic all the time. Book material is barely covered and not worth reading thoroughly.

He seemed very out of his element teaching such a large class, maybe he does better in a smaller setting. His test questions were very subjective, but again he didn't seem that comfortable with the material. Maybe he was just thrown the class.
LOVED HIM! so cute, Laugh at his jokes!! Open book tests!

This class may seem like it is eassy because all of the tests are open book, but this is the hardest open book test you will ever take. An 85 is considered an A, but don't let that fool you. You will still have a hard time in this class. This was one of 2 B's that I made in all of my Major Classes.
unbearably boring! EXTREMELY monotoned and reads from his book.  Not hard, just really difficult to motivate yourself to go to his class, and stay awake!
BORING
Baumgartner's class was so easy, but extremely boring.  If you can stand being bored to pieces, it's an easy A.

Not a very hard class, but make sure you contribute to class discussions. We had 8 books to read and I only read like two of them. She cares about you doing well, and go to office hours if you really want more feedback on your essays. The class is really hands on and discussion rather than just essays. Take this over the usual English classes!

Probably the most boring class I have ever taken. No doubt, Dr. Wegener is very sweet, but she is very scatterbrained and goes off topic in every class. Essay topics are very vague, but if you ask her for help outside of class, she gives good advice for your paper. Overall, I would not recommend this class unless you want to bore yourself.

Dr. Wegener is a very sweet woman, however, her class was the most unorganized and frustrating thing I've ever experienced. Her assignments are extremely unclear, so I struggled with how to do any work for her. She often goes on tangents during class and never actually teaches ANYTHING, but attendance is mandatory. She grades based on her own ideas
I do not know what talking in class and the assignments are never clear .

Mrs. Wegener grades on how often you come to class and how engaged you are in class rather than how good your material actually is. If you go to (almost) every class, and seem engaged throughout the semester then you'll be fine. I was expecting an A- in this class and somehow she turned it into an A.

She's a nice lady, but very unorganized and scatterbrained. She rambles about the most random things and likes to read straight from Wikipedia articles. A positive however is that she is very open to letting you choose your projectspapers topics. But, she grades a little tough and tells you that you "should have said this or look deeper into this"

She's a  sweet lady, but her class is unorganized.  Sometimes she talks about the reading, sometimes she doesn't.  Likes to google and read off articles to you, but it'll ever be on the test.  Papers and projects were open, but also wasn't really clear on what she wanted.  Said "write about whatever" but then said "you should've done this instead"

I LOVE Dr. Wegener because she's incredibly sweet and knowledgeable about her subject, but if you prefer your classes to be really structured, she is not the professor for you. She really does ramble about random stuff every day, which basically means you don't need to come to class to pass the tests as long as you read. Randomly takes attendance.

She will say for our papers she wants us to write on something that interests us and tell us to go for it on a topic, but then make comments that she doesn't care for that author or this and that at all. So it's really about writing something that interests her. And yes, she spends a majority of the class talking about completely irrelevant things

She likes to ramble so I never really know what is relevant to our discussion.  Her voice goes very high pitched and she gets very excited about things easily.  She likes to pull things up on the screen and read things off Wikipedia, which I can do on my own, so she's not "teaching" it.  Kind of annoying.

Great lady and teacher. LOVES TO TALK and has no trouble talking for the whole class. Looks for discussion, but okay if there is none. Essay prompts are clear and have choices. Have a lot of time to work on essays. Grades quickly. Not too much into EMMA (thank god) and no textbook so that saved some $$$

Dr. Wegener is the sweetest woman ever.  She has so many things to say during class that it causes two problems: 1. She gets distracted by another interesting thought, and cannot complete the first one, and 2. the students do not have time to participate in the discussion. It is very rare that more than three people can talk each class period.

Literally the most boring class of my life, but Dr. W is a very nice and interesting person with a cool accent. If you go to class, act interested/participate, and write decent papers, you'll do fine. I hardly read anything all semester and came out with a B+!
She's a great professor, but lectures are super boring. She tends to talk in circles and never really has a point.  But she grades really easily and offers help when you ask for it!

Took multicultural with her.. her lectures are sooo boring but she grades fairly easy and in class quizzes are easy if you just read. She also lets you rewrite your papers if you aren't satisfied with your grade, but she doesn't give you too many points back.

Dr. Wegener is very interesting to listen to, but her grading can sometimes be very haphazard and confusing. She's an easy teacher though. Go to class because she gives out a lot of in-class journal assignments.

Dr. Wegener's class is an easy A.  For the most part, she grades fairly but sometimes the grading on papers is subjective.  Make sure you read all the poems and readings because there may be pop quizzes in class.  Other than that she is extremely kind and personable but the class does get boring because all you do is listen to her talk.

Dr. Wegener is not a bad teacher at all. She grades pretty easily, and she takes the time to learn names. Go to class becuase she does in class pop quizzes/assignments. She takes note of who's in class. She loves to talk a lot so the class just sat and got on our computers the whole time.
Her accent is unique which kept me listening in class. She grades fairly.

As for the quality of teaching, she knows very much about the topic of American History, specifically in Women's studies.  As for the class time, I often didn't attend because it was early, but every class was interesting if you payed attention.  I'm sure she's as bored with 1102 as the rest of you, and so she often does strange topics.

This class was really easy. Dr. Wegener tends to drone on and on about nothing which made class extremely boring. Class was basically sitting and listening to her talk about random things that were completely irrelevant. However, she is very nice and fair and the easiness of the class makes up for the negatives.

I took 1102M and I loved Dr. Wegener.  The readings were boring and depressing, but Dr. Wegener is such an interesting lady you MUST take her class.  All you have to do is read the stories, talk about them as much as you can in class, and you're golden.  She graded pretty easily on all my essays.

I had Dr. W for English 1102M. Class is extremely boring. For homework you read something, and then she talks about it the whole class period. Her paper topics are strange, and she will tell you that you did all this wonderful stuff on your paper and then give you an 89.5. It is easy, though, classwise as long as you show up.

Pretty Easy class, no test and hardly any quiz. Just do your best on your paper. Peer Review is pretty stupid but can be helpful at times. Reading material is ok, but she always go on and on about stupid crap in class.

She yit yakes way too much and has horrible essay topics and makes the class feel like high school with stupid journals and study questions. However, she is an easy grader and her accent is cool. SHe isn't intimidating, yet I don't feel my writing skills have improved
Easy class to get an A in, but I am not sure that she cares about or is interested in the students

I think that Dr. Wegener is a great teacher. She grades easy on journals and grades fair on papers. If you are a descent writer and you put in the effort, you should make an a. She's a really interesting person too (she's from Norway and has a British accent).

Dr. Wegener's class is pretty easy. She sometimes gives odd topics and spends a little too much time on a certain topic. Apart from the bizarre squealing and talkativeness, the class is pretty cool. It's a guaranteed A class if you know how to write. English is FUN!

ms. wegener is very nice, however she's a bit on the gregarious side - in other words, she talks A LOT. i mean, she's actually spent a total of 15 minutes (if not more) in the beginning of class just talking (about what?...i don't know). but she's okay.
No Comments
I thought she was really cool.
No Comments
She is easily frazzled, a little off her rocker, but would I suggest this course

She's an awesome teacher.  Very upbeat & very easy to deal with.  She identifies well with the students & even though she had no attendance policy - her evening class was always fully attended. If she teaches any other courses in the future - I'll enroll!
Brilliant.

I really disliked this class at first.. it was really difficult to try to work with new materials and was at times very frustrating and time consuming.... but i wound up really liking the class.. you might be intimidated at first- but really, don't drop it- it gets better and you'll learn a lot.

RG is intimidating at first because he has been teaching for a long time and he really seems to be looking for innovention and creativity.  But he's really nice once you get to know him better and he's very helpful if you have questions.  You must follow the directions of the assignments very carefully and come to class prepared.

RG is actually one of my favorite teaachers i've had at UGA. at first you are like wtf, but then you really like him.  his projects are direct and you end up learning alot.  i would highly reccomend him to anyone, plus he was the director of the cortona program for like 25 years or so, so he knows what hes doing.
RG is the nicest guy ever.  If you have a chance to take a class with him, by all means you should.  He is so helpful and is seriously one of the nicest prefessors ever.
way cool 'n kind
He thinks hes the best teacher ever but the lectures are confusing and he just talks and expects you to remember everything he says.
ratingTags_Rating: Tough Grader--GROUP PROJECTS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment_Rating: By far one of my favorite professors I have had at UGA! I mean be prepared to do the work, because he expects his students to do the work, but if you can manage your time well it's really not that bad. For sure go to class and try to participate, but I thought it was a super interesting class if you're into intelligence and all that!

Dr. Johnson is an excellent teacher and his class is super interesting. That being said, the class is tough, but definitely manageable. You need to go to class, write down everything he says, and do the readings. The group project is also great. Overall, hes a great professor. Hes can be very particular about what he wants, but take him.

Dr. Johnson is a great man, but his class is not easy. Although you learn a lot, you need to read a lot, too. A big chunk of the study guides were not on the actual exams, so try to read the books as much as possible. The group project is interesting, and I enjoyed it. However, take at your own risk. Great professor, but tough class.

worst professor in UGA. don't take his intelligence class because its simply not intelligence related. He teaches about congress, sub committees of congress, bureaucratic stuff in the name of intelligence, its simply not intelligence at all. That is because he was a staff member of a senator and he discusses all his work in that class. super boring
ratingTags_Rating: Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment_Rating: Great professor - inspiring, a plethora of experience, and more than willing to help students outside of class. Is also a great mentor with an ability to give sound advice for a career in a related field.
ratingTags_Rating: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment_Rating: didn't like his class
ratingTags_Rating: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--GROUP PROJECTS

comment_Rating: A knowledgeable, inspiring, well-prepared, experienced and, at first, intimidating professor. Introduce yourself to him, get to know him. A great mentor to have. Makes himself available to students if you take the first step to ask for help or reach out to him. His lectures are intriguing. His classes can be tough, but he makes you want to succeed.

Very knowledgeable, experienced, and great speaker. He values good written and oral communication skills. Reads a lot and expects you to do the same. Fair grader and very willing to help if you will ask him and go to office hours. Intimidating at first, but very nice guy, good friend to have. Keeps your attention. Knows his history.

I took this as an IDL course, there were 19 assignments, roughly 21 MC and 3 short answers per assignment and then a final (same format but not online). I never read the chapters, just searched for the answers in the book and studied those and the end of ch. highlights for the final, I ended up making an A! He is available to talk if you need help.

We had 7 books to read, and he expects you to read them all. Most of them were written by people whose names he drops constantly. He is an egotistical has-been. His class is the hardest in International Affairs and made me hate a subject I once was interested in.

Very interesting speaker and defintely an expert in intelligence. The tests are very difficult, though, and consist of fill-in-the-blank. You must memorize hundreds of facts down to the most specific details mentioned only once in passing. Take perfect notes and stay attentive. Not a good class for those trying to keep a high GPA.

Fantastic professor.  Tests are difficult and can be a little random, but if you go to class it's not that bad.  Group project isn't that difficult as long as the entire group participates. Overall the best class and professor I've ever had.

Excellent prof, probably the world's expert on intelligence. Problem is, he knows it and casually name-drops just a bit too much. His tests are heavily fill-in-the-blank off random details and he doesn't test much, if at all, from the reading, just lecture. Also expects a lot on the paper. Great guy, weird tests.
smartest man in the world

He assigned 3 reading books and no textbook, so it's hard to know what to study. We had one big group project and a final exam as our grades. He's very informative and interesting. One of the best teachers at UGA. He expects a lot out of the students

He assigns 5 large reading books, but no textbook. I got an A without reading the books. Go to class everyday and take good notes. There are no tests other than the final exam. Big group project that's half your grade so write good papers. He wrote a textbook titled w/ American Foreign Policy and there's much of his lecture.
Excellent teacher and communicator

He is a wonderful teacher, but the reading load is insane and he expects a lot out of his students. There are very few grades, and it's hard to make them. BUT you learn a lot and at the end it's not about if you made an A or C because you'll be glad you took the class. Plus he's very personable and helpful.

I took this class as an independent study class. The chapter assigments weren't difficult but there was alot of reading. And there was only one test...the final. And in my case with an independent study class I HAD to pass the final to pass the class. I did pass but the final was somewhat difficult. It had three essay questions.

he is one of the best teachers you will come across at uga. be prepared for a heavy load of reading and very few grades, but you won't regret taking the class no matter what outcome or grade you have at the end.

Loch is the greatest. He assigns a lot, but at least it's not a bunch of bull like other professors assign. I actually learn about politics with Dr. J. Other professors just give you a heap of theoretical garbage. I like Dr. J.

The top professor at UGA and for good reason. Dr. Johnson brings more knowledge and expirience to the classroom than do the rest of UGA's faculty combined.  A gentle and caring man who is witty and incisive.  A resounding recommendation for those that have the chance to take his classes.  Also, the most interesting lectures I have ever attended.
Great class but required a lot of reading.  Dr. Johnson's tests are pretty hard because he pulls out random quotes and wants you to know who they were said by.

Mr. Johnson is an arrogant individual. Each day was a ninety minute lecture on the greatness that is Loch. I would not recommend any course he teaches to any future UGA student. He even yelled at a student for yawning. I didn't blame the student, I needed a pillow most of the time.
The most interesting lecurer I have ever had.  I would audit this class if I weren't with the univ.
Best professor at the University.  Brilliant, incisive, caring, but won't whitewash your grade either.

His lectures are easy to follow for the most part, and the homework assignments can be completed in a couple hours if you read the textbook. The problem is that most of your grade is tied up in the exams which cover material that either has not appeared in lecture/hw, or covers familiar material at a much more difficult level.
ratingTags_Rating: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment_Rating:
Dr. Suchi is a professor that does'n care about what he is teaching and he is not interested if the student understands or not. Do not even bother going to his office hours because he has nothing to offer you. 

I feel pained because Computer Architecture is a very fantastic course for CS student. Teaches A in Class text you on Z. Assignment on G.

a very stressful class. Bhandarkar's lectures and slides have a ton of extra information that is not on the test. He assigned only 5 homework assignments the entire semester and did not provide any kind of study guide for the exams. Every exam I was very stressed that I was going to be surprised with a question that I did not study and I often was.

His lectures weren't totally useless, just very broad. The assignments make you apply a lot of knowledge so you're forced to really teach yourself in preparation for them. I would avoid the lectures and opt for teaching myself instead as the assignments were much more difficult than what was being discussed. His class was not fun to go through.
ratingTags_Rating: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment_Rating: The lectures are not very engaging, but you need to be there to understand the content. Also he assigns a lot of homework. You are only graded on the homework and 3 tests (including the final which is 35% of your grade). The tests are completely short answer and include stuff never covered in lecture or the homework.

You will teach yourself MIPS - it's by far the most difficult programming you'll do in college. He does a handful of extremely basic examples in class and then assigns homework that will take at least 10-15 hours and will require double that in self teaching.
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment_Rating: He knows a ton about the subject but since he's so smart he tends to fly through the material without making sure everyone understands. Architecture is a very demanding course in general. He assigns lots of homework and each assignment is difficult and time consuming. Tests are pretty hard as well.
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--TEST HEAVY

comment_Rating: Bhandarkar gives very long tests, and homework takes a good amount of time as well. However, if you pay attention in class and reference the textbook for whatever is unclear, a good grade is definitely possible. He will make you work for it, though. But he is clearly passionate about computer architecture.
ratingTags_Rating: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--TEST HEAVY

comment_Rating: he does not know the materials and has no interest in updating himself.
No Comments
The concepts he teaches is good.  But he still follows the age old textbook. He will not keep rapport with current technology in computer architecture. Assignments are really hard but exams are ok.
He gives realtively easy tests, but the homeworks are hard. If you have a nice TA, then you'll do good in the class. He teach with fast pace. No questions will be answered clearly, so be prepared.

He is a master at breaking down the material and always has a helpful analogy to assist with comprehension. He brings an interesting twist to an otherwise bland subject. Ive never appreciated math before taking his class.
It was impossible to understand the man.  He made the class 1,000 times harder than it should have been.  He is very picky on the format you use on his 3 hour tests!  Worst class ever!
This man can not teach Math. I learned everyting out of class. Oh, and I took a test over 6hrs long, some people took longer. Yes you can get an A in the class, but its not worth it.
This is the most horrible teacher I've ever had in my life, and I really enjoy math.
Lectures are hard to understand and test are like 5 hours long.  Try to get another teacher that is easier.

DO NOT take this class with this professor unless you enjoy proofs, hundreds of metaphors and analogies that dont make sense, and tests that last from 8 at night until 1 in the morning.  He is a nice guy but he makes the class the worst and most boring i have ever had...and i love math.  class runs over 15min every day.

Junster's lectures are sometimes confusing but will spend multiple class periods explaining concepts students are having trouble with. His tests are hard but you'll do well if you study and prepare for them. He gives out groups in the beginning of the semester that are a valuable tool for notes and studying. Its fun, non-traditional math!

Hes a realy nice guy and pretty understanding. He takes a totaly diffrent aproach from typical math class and i think its harder but diffrent. He would not fail you if you work. Hes very difrent but very intresting i would recomend him if you get bored with the same old thing.
His teaching style is very different and hard.  If you work hard in his class then you will get the grade that you want.  Tough class.

dr. jungster has really good intentions, i think. he's just really socially inept and has little patience for those who may lag. and my first test did take about 4 hours.  however, the class overall isn't that hard, after you get used to it, and i got a lot more interested in it as time went on. i'd probably recommend this class.

He has good intentions, but he's a horrible teacher! Each class consists of a long and complicated proofs, and he gets mad when you don't understand his process. His tests are night tests that take me well over 4 hours and are incredibly hard. Despite the grade distibutions, don't take him! His class is really frustrating for non-math majors.
His intentions are good, but he should not be a teacher. HIs first test took me 5 hours. That's ridiculous for a calc one test.

His intentions are good, but I did not work well with his teaching style. He only taught proofs which makes it hard to do applicable calculus. Many people were in his first class for 5 hours. That's ridiculous. He thinks he is the only person in the math dept who can teach calc. Given the option, there is no way I would take this class again.
Something is wrong with him.  I failed every test and got a B in the class because i went to every class.  I still know zero calculus because his class was so frustrating I just gave up.

He gives one VERY easy quiz which accounts for about 15% of your grade. He also gives out extra points for the tests and will bump up your grade at the end. His teaching style is a little odd, but if you are an average math student then you should do well in his class!

His teaching style is very confusing.  If you are a very good math student, then you will do alright and you may even find his teaching style to be hilarious, but if you didn't have Calculus in high school then you should probably consider another teacher because you will be lost in this class.

Although his intentions are good, I didn't like his teaching style. If you're already good at math then understanding what he's trying to explain shouldn't be too much of a problem, but if you're not- good luck.
The key to his class is to attend class. Be attentive and you will do well. I liked his teaching style.
just be polite, give respect, and show concern and you will do well
No Comments
No Comments

I have taken Dr. Jones for FREN 3010, and now 3020. Her lectures are very interesting and engaging. It is essential that you go to class and participate in discussion (just try your best) and you will do fine. Syllabus and expectations are very clear.
ratingTags_Rating: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment_Rating: Dr. Jones is a wonderful professor. She is transparent about her expectations and does not grade too harshly. She rewards good effort and truly wants you to learn. You are graded on 4 essays, 3 out of 4 quizzes, an individual presentation, and a final. Participation counts for 25% of your grade, so keep that in mind! Otherwise, it was a breeze.
ratingTags_Rating: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment_Rating: Madame Jones is very clear from the start about her expectations and she follows the syllabus to the letter! Her classes are perfectly organized and she prompts each student to participate equally. She is a hard grader, but assigns manageable work and will make sure you learn.

Dr. Jones is very nice, reasonable, and a great teacher. The optional homework due every class (clearly outlined in the syllabus) is helpful and not too hard or long. Class is mainly discussion and participation based, but it's easy to get those points. There are lots of compositions, but all the cultural topics are very relevant and interesting

Dr. Jones expects a lot from her students in regards to class preparation, participation, and paperstests. If your effort is obvious to her, you'll be rewarded. Speaking AT LEAST once per class is MANDATORY, as is the homework and reading. Really challenging, but I learned so much and would most definitely take another one of her classes.

Great teacher and great human being!  She wants her students too learn.  She gives a lot of work, and makes it interesting.  She literally pours out knowledge and resources (See Ravishing Maidens) ...

Dr. Jones is my favorite French professor! She made me love Moyen Age literature and she was just overall friendly, helpful, and interesting. She takes a subject that can be difficult and makes it worthwhile. As long as you prepare for class, (especially the reading!) then you should do fine. She is a fair grader.

One of the better French teachers at UGA. Subject is not easy but she is such a good teacher that what could be hard ends up being perfectly fair and makes it very possible to make an A. Hoewever you have to do all the work, and read a ton to keep up, but in all honesty it's a major class and thats what you should expect. TRES BON PROF!!!

As you can see I took Dr. Jones for two classes, both of which I loved. She's quite possibly one of the BEST French professors at the University. She's very helpful and makes class enjoyable. She even got my interested in Moyen Age literature which made my visit to the Musee de Cluny all that more enjoyable! LOVE HER!

This could have been a tedious class, but Dr. Jones is charismatic, extremely intelligent, and well-organized.  To take full advantage of the class and her lessons, you need to make yourself do the daily homework because she doesn't collect them (and so of course I slacked off at first).  She is a rigorous grader, but she is an excellent explainer.
I wish she were my mom.
Great professor, all about culture and literature, not just verbs. If you see her in her office she will speak to you in English and you'll realize just now nice she is.
amazing teacher
Professor Jones is Awesome!
He's a great teacher. This class is very labor intensive (we had to read 4 novels), but you'll learn a lot. As long as you show interest in the class, he'll make sure that you succeed.

worst class ever!!! He talks, talks, talks. We had to read 4 novels + lecture material+ textbook material in less than 2 months. The class was so intense that it made the content boring and unappealing. The teacher wants specific information which is hard to give when you have to memorize 100 different groups of Native Americans.

assigns multiple chapters in the book but only lectures on about 1/5 of the material from book.  doesn't understand technology (powerpoint, anything on the computer), and wastes a lot of class time showing lots of pictures of the same stuff.  avoid him, all tests are essay format only
Dr.Hally is a great guy and a very good anthropology teacher! This is an interesting class, try to make it to most lectures as he gets a lot of test questions from class.
No Comments

Beck was so sweet and really loves his students (he even emails you to congratulate you when improve on tests), but there were only three tests and absolutely nothing else to determine your grade. This was the hardest class I've ever taken in college, I read the book and came to class and still really struggled. Love Professor Beck though.
ratingTags_Rating: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment_Rating: The sweetest cutest old man I've ever met. You can tell he loves what he teaches and he makes the lectures interesting.
