He discusses everything you need to know in class but you can't find that material in the textbook. With that being said it is easy to meet with him or the TA outside of class. Option of multiple choice or essay test.
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Hilarious

comment_Rating: Dr. Beck is a very knowledgeable and funny professor, however the set-up of this class is less than helpful from the GPA-standpoint. Only 3 tests, the multiple choice is around 70 questions and is pretty tedious. There is an FRQ option too, but not many people take it. You HAVE to go to lecture to do well on the tests.

Super sweet old man, has a TA for any outside of class questions. Three tests in total (final exam is just like the other 2 tests, all weighted equally). Option of multiple choice or free response tests. Free response can be tough if you missed a few big topics, but you have options to choose from. Multiple choice can be tedious. Study in advance
ratingTags_Rating: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment_Rating: I had a tough time with this class. I read the textbook cover to cover and studied upwards of 12 hours per test, and I still only pulled a C+. This course is subjective, so there may be several "right" answers to a question, but you need to choose the "best" answer. Professor Beck was a good lecturer and a funny guy, but his class was tough.
ratingTags_Rating: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment_Rating: I really enjoyed Dr. Beck's class. There are 3 tests and 2 papers. Pay attention to the graphs because they will show up on the tests. You can tell he is very passionate about Sociology.
ratingTags_Rating: Respected--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment_Rating: Dr. Beck is very kind and funny. Your grade is an average of the 3 exams, all of which are based on the lectures and the online graphs. As long as you study these very well, you should be fine without reading the textbook. The class is very interesting and I really enjoyed it!

I loved Beck's class. Most of the exams are based on lectures (you don't have to read the textbook if you take good notes.) Make sure to pay attention to the graphs he goes over. There's only 3 exams and they're pretty specific but if you know the lecture, you'll be fine.
ratingTags_Rating: Tough Grader--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment_Rating: I took SOCI1101 during Freshman College, and I was glad to have Dr. Beck as my professor for this class. He's grumpy and sarcastic in the most hilarious of ways, and he's very knowledgeable of a variety of subjects. My only complaint is that his tests can be challenging if you don't 100% understand his specific graphs. Otherwise, he's great.

I took Beck for Freshco. Your grade comes from 3 exams and 2 papers. Exams were multiple choice, or a short answer version. I always found the test tricky. I read the book, took notes, and made notecards and made Bs. Exams have the graphs from class and are mostly applying definitions. The papers are not bad, 5-6 pg, just follow the directions.

Class is interesting, I really enjoyed the material but the tests were VERY specific. He would show graphs in class and then ask specific questions from those graphs that you had to memorize. I read the whole textbook, paid attention in lectures, made flashcards, and studied notes, yet I got a 90, 85, and 77 on the tests.

Dr. Beck is a great professor, but don't miss a lecture. Attendance isn't mandatory, but if you want to pass, you will have to go to class everyday. There are only 3 exams that determine your grade, so read the textbook, study the graphs, and go over the lecture notes.

Professor Beck is a very traditional professor, but his lectures were engaging and he is absurdly well-versed in Sociology. The grading criteria are simple: three tests, that's it. No extra credit, no homework, nothing else. The tests are based almost entirely on his lectures, but they're definitely fair. If you know the material, you'll do well.

I really enjoyed this class. Beck is a really witty and funny old man who clearly knows what he's talking about. I always found his lectures to be very interesting and engaging. The only grades are the three tests, and I made high B's on all of them. Not an easy A but an A is certainly do-able. The tests are almost pure lecture notes so go to class

Dr. Beck is a funny old guy who loves to teach. I didn't do as well as I would have liked, but he did a fine job of teaching. I would recommend taking this class. He loves puns so if you're into that you're in for a treat.

Dr. Beck's class was really interesting. If you are doing FreshCo, realize that it will be a lot of work, but they all are and I definitely recommend taking sociology. The hardest part is two different five-page papers with little direction, but they are only 5% of your final grade each. There are only 3 tests counting for 90%. Take it seriously.

I LOVE Dr. Beck's class! He explains issues that can be complicated in a simple way, but he is sensitive in that he knows some of his topics may hit close to home.  You really do have to read for his class though - only having three grades sucks, but the class is worth it.  He can be scary at first, but he's actually a witty guy who loves puns.

Dr. Beck made our large lecture class lively and interesting. He's very witty and obviously extremely knowledgeable in his field. Grade is based on 3 tests of 60 multiple choice questions, which are easy to pass if you show up for class and study hard. I would recommend this professor's class to pretty much anyone.
3 tests but they're the only grades; not too bad as long as you pay attention in lecture, read, and study. Interesting class especially if you like social sciences

I really wish I would've listened to the reviews. The best way to describe this class is a GPA killer. Yes, he is very easy to listen to and extremely interesting. But what really matters is the grade. Your only grades are 3 tests. I've never studied more for a class and I've never done worse in a class. I never skipped a class. I read the book too

Took this class in the fall of 2013. Not a horribly interesting course, but there's only three tests and almost no outside work, aside from reading. You will definitely need the book. Pay attention to the graphs, because there's always a few questions about them on the test; it's the same with the movies, so make sure to go those days.
Most interesting class at UGA. The photography project is really fun. Dr Beck has really cool stories as well. Take this class if you have even the slightest interesting in the American South

Dr. Beck isn't extremely interesting but not extremely boring either. The class is relatively easy. He goes through a powerpoint but you need to read if you want to get an A on the tests. Three tests the whole semester, but the final isn't cummulative. If you're good at reading and memorizing, I would take this class.

This class is basically just average. It wasn't extremely interesting but it wasn't horrible either. Dr. Beck tries to make his lectures interesting but sometime I did fall asleep. Computers are not allowed at all! Final grade is based on only three exams and they are pretty vague. Most of the material seems obvious but still made a B- in class.

good teacher. makes the class interesting but tests have weird wording on some questions. plays movies about 4 times. not really needed to pass class, only about 2 or 3 questions on the test are from the movies. only 2 tests and the final makes the grade

If you don't mind 200+ pages a week for the readings, a 15 page double spaced midterm and the same for a final... Then this class is for you! This class is very easy if you do the work, read the syllabus and ask for help.
The tests were relatively hard and I read ever single page of each text book. He kept the class interesting and clearly loves his research. If you get to know him he's pretty awesome.

Dr. Beck is really great at teaching Sociology, but his tests were really difficult for me no matter how much I studied.  I always chose the multiple choice tests, but never could pull higher than an 82 regardless of how many notes I took.  It is a really interesting and fun class so I would recommend it to anyone who can take him.

Dr. Beck is awesome.  Takes a genuine interest in his students.  This class was at 8 AM and I didn't mind getting up for it, most times. Very interesting, well worth taking if you're interested in American South at all.

Easy class, especially if you're taking it your junior or senior year.  It's like going back to your first semester on campus.  Tests are pretty easy.  I went to have the classes and studied less than 2 hrs for all 3 tests and finished with an A.  Read the book and readings and you'll do fine.  Attend breakouts for easy bonus pts

I loved the class. It was fun, interesting, and the professor is great. Take this seminar if it's available. Professor Beck is a great instructor and I wish I discussed the movies/papers more. The papers are not too hard fairly simple and easily graded. Just a great seminar.
Easy class if you do the reading and show up!

I absolutely loved Dr. Beck's intro class! He was very interesting and loved the material, which made his lectures fun. Definitely read closely and understand the text, as he tests mainly the book. However, his lectures compliment the readings well and I had a great experience with him. I'd take him again!
Lots of readings. Tough grader who won't tell you the standards, so expect to get a B.  The class itself is really interesting.
Nice professor, but class is a little tough. Only grades are 3 tests that you take and bonuses from breakout attendance, but if you study ALOT you should be fine.

Good class, okay professor. I went to every lecture, but still had to study a lot on my own b/c there's quite a bit of material & tests are detailed. Breakout sessions really depend on the students, not the TA, so participate and ask questions. Charts from class will be on the test, so study them on WebCT and make sure you know the vocab.

I enjoyed Professor Beck's class a lot, I would definitely take him again. Just a few problems with the class: there were only 3 tests so don't screw one up; breakout sessions were pointless other than giving bonus points; and the tests were very thorough even if you do study.

Dr. Beck was a great teacher and had many examples to help everyone better understand the concept. The class sometimes could get a little boring, but it wasn't too bad. The breakout is the only part where attendance is taken. The tests can get pretty challenging. So you should read the chapters in the book and know the important terms & definitions

Dr. Beck was great.  He gave really informative statistics about our class versus previous classes he'd taught.  My only qualm was the absurd number of questions based on graphs you had to memorize on test 2.  He also posts a pun after every class.

Dr. Beck was a very engaging teacher.  His class provides interesting insights into, well sociology of course.  I took his class over the summer in 3 weeks so it was obviously very challenging, but I enjoyed it.  Reading is a must, so is class attendance.  Expect to have a lot a material to study for the tests.

Material is mostly intuitive so class can be boring, but the graphs are pretty interesting. He keeps the class moving with jokes. The break out is a good idea, but it is up to the students to have a good discussion. Read the book for tests, they can be tricky!
The attendance to the breakout sessions are the only mandatory thing. You have to read/study the book.It is essential for the tests. If you understand the concepts, the essay option isn't bad either.

Beck makes the class interesting and he's got a good sense of humor. The tests are average: not too easy, but not too hard. Just know the key terms that are in the text book. Overall, I'd highly recommend him.

Dr. Beck is great, and his classes are so entertaining and informative.  He's hot for his age, and he is very engaging.  The class is fairly easy if you listen actively.  Although, the mandatory attendance kinda womps.  Other than that, though, he's great and so is the class!

DR. Beck's lectuere's were really easy to understand, and he even tried to put up little jokes and cute comments in the end.His tests were all multiple choice.The textbook was easy to understand, and focused alot on vocabulary. USE the online webpage for practice tests, some questions were similar!

Dr. Beck makes the material very interesting and has a great sense of humor. Go to your discussion section and go to class. If you have good attendence in discussion, he adds points to your grade. Read and do the review on the cd and you will get an A. His tests are tricky sometimes, but overall, the class is very easy
My favorite professor ever!

Beck made the subject interesting most of the time. I really enjoyed the class, even though I had it at 8am. you should prolly still read the text, but for the most part i didn't and i made a B. tests are somewhat challenging b/c they focus a lot on statistics, but they don't ever get too detailed. great class, especially for into social science.
boring boring. fought to stay awake. nice, but kinda overdoes the evil, rich white man thing.
Loved this class! The lectures were clear and to the point and event interesting! I would highly recommend this teacher!

Dr. Beck is a good professor, but what he teaches in lecture is not exactly prevalent to the tests at all. Studying for them can be a bit challenging, b/c you basically have to study everything in the book. Tests are difficult even when you study 6 hours for each one.
I love Beck!! He is a great professor. He is very funny and makes the lectures very interesting. The class is pretty easy as long as you study before tests.

Dr. Beck is an awesome teacher.  He knows his stuff and knows how to approach such a large lecture class. I enjoy going to his class, even though I have him first thing in the morning.  His test are not that bad and his lectures are interesting. I

Typical giant lecture class, very impersonal, but he at least gives entertaining lectures and has funny anecdotes. You have to read the book, and the tests are fairly difficult. However, he gives the option of either multiple choice or essay format. I would recommend this class to anyone having to take a social science.
i love this teacher.

Dr. Beck is a great teacher.  He really knows his subject matter and is constantly changing his material to keep up with changing information.  He gives students an opition to take either a multiple choice or essay version of his tests...great for any learning style.
Great and interesting...
Beck rocked my balls off.  He rules.
Dr. Beck made class pretty interesting with his humor. I agree -- a lot of reading, but doable and definitely pretty straightforward. Read and go to class and that's basically all there is to it.
Beck's a good teacher. Get to know him and he will do everything he can to help you. Lectures are entertaining. Lot of reading, but it's straight forward. GO TO CLASS!

This class wasn't as easy as I thought,because you only have 3 tests that determine your grade.So if you mess up on one test you are pretty much screwed.Beck's lectures are pretty clear, but you have to read A LOT on ur own.My TA(Jess)was nice though.  Unless you like to read a lot don't take it...
Good Teacher!  Interesting class.

He's a really nice guy and is very entertaining. The information is pretty straight forward, but the exams test the book info more than the lecture notes, but he's a very helpful and understanding teacher.

Venus was literally one of the best English teachers I had. His class was really easy and included a ton of discussion where you could pretty much just have a conversation with him. His essays weren't bad at all, mostly because you got to pick the topic, and he was a pretty lenient grader. Definitely recommend him.

Fantastic professor with a great sense of humor. Very laid back and is not capable of being rude. Always willing to help in class and during office hours. He's very organized and tries to follow the syllabus to a tee. If you learn from his feedback, you should get an A.

This guy is great! He is very random and tells funny stories but still teachs you some things. Class can get boring, but if you participate a lot in class discussion, it helps a ton! and he'll like you which helps with grades. We got to choose our own essay topics which was great too. Highly recommended, but is leaving UGA next semester :(

I love Mr. Venus. He was such a great teacher and really funny too. Meet with him on essays, because you will always end up with a better grade on it. Proof read your essays VERY well b/c he is kind of a hard grader (especially w/ grammar). He tends to ramble on a bit, but that's what makes him great. He's funny and will grow onto you very quickly.

Real nice guy.  Its obvious that he knows what he is talking about.  Take advantage of office hours, and he will help you as much as possible.  I believe that he really cared about all of his students.  Grading is kind of harsh, but keep it organized and you'll be alright.

Dr. Venus might be the best professor I've had at UGA. He's tough grader, but takes your effort and response to criticism into account. If you show that you are willing to work, he will go out of his way to help you.

Wesley Venus is a really interesting guy. He tends to ramble a little during class, but he can be really funny too. He will grade harshly but does take into account your effort. Definitely go to office hours. That will help tons. The class was really interesting overall and I would recommend him to anyone.

I enjoyed every paper I wrote for this class. He's a really interesting guy, who has a wealth of knowledge for a variety of subjects. I recommend him, even if you don't need a particular class that he might be teaching. Also, lectures are only boring if you don't contribute to them.

Mr. Venus is a great teacher. Class does get boring, but not always. As long as you participate in discussions you'll be fine. He grades pretty harshly even on reading responses, but it's not impossible to get an A in the class. If I had put in a bit more effort I'm sure I would have done a lot better in his class.

This man isn't bad at all and I do somewhat feel that he helped me to become a better writer. To the students who have issues with grammar, beware because this guy is a grammar freak who seems to instantly notice EVERYTHING out of place. I believe he was tougher on me because English was my major.People in my class rarely received A's.Office hours!

Dr. Venus is a really cool guy. I'd take another class of his if given the opportunity. Class gets pretty boring, but the work load is not bad at all. I highly recommend setting up conferences with him before turning in each paper. He seems to take that into account when grading. I recommend this class.

I took multicultural and he was aweeesome. We discussed the readings in class and he really had interesting thoughts, but it's important that you read the stuff too. It's actually good homework and i liked the readings. Really cool guy.

I had him as a TA in Engl 3k. I don't think I would have passed if he wasn't my TA. Stand up guy who won't fail you just because bureaucracy wasn't in your favor. I'd recommend him to someone looking to get through Eng Comp classes without unnecessary hassles.
Lectures get redundant and boring but he is a lot of fun. Fair grading easy to make a B if you actually try but A is a bit harder to get.  Always helps out and is overall funny!!
very nice. always willing to offer help. not hard to make an A.
Easy to make a B but takes a bit more effort to get the A.
He is a pretty cool guy. You do actually have to work in the class, but it's not difficult to make a B.
Awesome! He's just a really cool guy, take him!
S e. was her best subject. She had good command of what to!

This teacher is horrible. I am in the middle of taking her class and she is very disorganized; only talking about Nip/tuck, her ebay account, what she is wearing and how she copes with lonely nice. I think she spends half the class time talking about actual material. This is an utter waist of time and she is inept. DON'T TAKE HER!
One cRaZy lady! Material is pretty much incomprehensible (the way she presents it). Offers little to no help outside of class. I learned absolutely NOTHING!
Crazy lady.  Don't take this class if you're a marketing major because you won't learn anything you don't already know.

She says some pretty outlandish stuff, which can be entertaining or annoying, but she does have enthusiasm which is nice. Her attendance is not required, but I think it's necessary to properly complete her test study guides. Take notes on every example she says (even the wacky ones) and you'll do fine... but sometimes her test questions are random

I thought this class would be fairly easy considering the ratings on here, and I have taken several psyc, soci, and social psych courses.  I studied hard with the study guides provided etc, and I ended up with a C in the class.  The tests are crazy.  Why do I care what a fox trot cartoon said in the book?  It wasn't in the study guide to know?

Wow... that is all I can say. Somewhere between hearing about her Ebay underwear purchases, her "personal" life, or her crazy tantrums, I realized she probably is not the best fit for the Terry College of Business. Get something out of your education and take someone else.
I had Dr. Carroll 4 times at UGA.  She is fantastic; so much fun.  Just GO TO CLASS and you'll do great.  SKIP CLASS and you'll do poorly.
Chili pepper for Dr. Carroll

Great class! I was very skeptical about taking Art History before, but she makes it so interesting. The best way to pass the class is to study your notes. DO NOT BUY THE BOOK. Unfortunately, the entire art department has an attendance policy that shes required to follow. So, don't skip class or you will fail.

As an Art History minor (previously major), Tiffanie is by far my favorite professor in the art history department. She is clear about what she expects on exams, and fair in her grading, and entertaining in lectures. Love her Renaissance & mannerism lectures.

Literally my favorite teacher of all time. She is the kindest and most passionate teacher you will ever meet. She actually cares about her students, and sometimes cancels class just to give us a break.I've had her multiple times and I never fail to be entertained by her teachings. If you can find a reason to take a class taught by her, DO SO!!!
Great professor and best art history professor I ever had.  Really cares about her students!
Outstanding teacher! She is very fair and is passionate about her subject.

VERY HARSH GRADER. Will give you minimal feedback on major point deductions, especially for the writing projects. Reading the textbook is very important, tests are pretty straight forward and will give you partial credit on some questions.
ratingTags_Rating: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment_Rating: Really knows what he's talking about, interested in his subject, so its fun.  Tries to make class fun with jokes, but usually they are lame.  bad test make-up policy, because he drops the lowest grade, so you can't make up any test, even if you were sick.  altogether great teacher!!

Dr. Lockerbie is awesome! He enjoys what he's teaching. His tests aren't that bad. Study the notes & read the book. The tests are straight forward. He isn't one of these teachers who likes to trick students on tests. Either you know it or you don't. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.

This class is pretty difficult, though the discussion sections help. Most of the test comes from the book & isn't discussed in lecture. I think sometimes his test questions are a bit confusing, and he is also very picky about short answer questions. There are pop quizzes - so you have to go to class.

Really interesting and well thought out lecture, made an effort to get to know the students, and was very helpful.  There was a research paper but he broke it up and had us turn in each part, and he always offered his  help!

Very helpful (if you take advantage of it) and wants you to get a good grade.  Requires a lot of reading (if not, lectures get boring) but offers interesting discussion.  Tests were pretty easy if you study the notes and do the reading.  Big paper for this class but he'll pretty much give you an A on it if you go to his office hours.

Lockerbie is just plain nice. He obviously cares about his students and actually tries to help you get a good grade. Fairly large and detailed term paper for this course but he will help you along the way.
One of the 2 best teachers I've had at UGA. He is very conceptual and objective.  He also shows concern for students.
Great teacher! Go to class, take notes, study the notes...the notes are the test! Take this class!!
lockerbie is the best. his lectures are interesting and funny, and his tests and quizzes are not difficult if you go to class and take notes. take his class if possible.
tons of pop quizzes. if you get a good TA, then the class is a lot easier. difficult at times if you aren't a poli sci major.

Lockerbie is a wonderful teacher!!  I really enjoyed his class. Read the book and attend class to take notes you will get a good grade in the class!  I actually learned a lot from him. Very clear, precise, and interesting.There are are pop quizzes, but they are to help you, not hurt you! (HINT: he looks at his watch a lot when heis gonna give one!)

Hes a very very nice guy. Big lecture so you can miss class a lot, but there are pop quizes which suck, even though you can still get by without them. Test are easy just read and study his notes. Most poeple just cheat. The TA quizes are easy as well...you should do fine
nice guy, but if you don't like poli sci it is a pretty hard class...if you are a non major i would recommend someone else.

Dr. Lockerbie was a great Poli Sci teacher. Hands down the best at UGA. He NEVER lets on about his political affiliations to his students or anyone. He never made a biased comment without making a biased comment for the other parties as well. My TA worked under him for 3 years and still had no idea what political affiliation Lockerbie was, which is great in a Poli Sci class. Take him... he's a bit difficult but very approachable and helpful!
Very intellegent, very interested in his field. Clever, dry humor! A genuinely nice guy.
Boring class attendance required.  TA's don't have a clue and are not helpful.
Great professor. One of the best.

Dr. Lockerbie is one of the best professors I have had at UGA. He was very clear in his examples, was very professional at all times, and seemed to truly care about our well-being in and out of class. I would gladly take another class taught by him.

Lockerbie is a great teacher. Clear notes. Easy, straightforward tests. My ta graded pretty easily. Pop quizzes in lecture and in break out sessions, but the ones in lecture come straight from his power point notes. Lowest quiz grade dropped. Take this class! He's good. I got an A.

He is an excellent teacher.  He gives great examples so it is easy to understand the material.  The TA's grade hard, but the tests are pretty easy.  I never read any of the book, and I couldn't get past the language in the reader, but I still made B's on the tests.  Definitely try to get his class!!

he is one of the most articulate teachers i have had, and this makes the material very easy to take in and engages the students. very interesting to listen to. i will miss having such a good teacher next semester!
He knows so much about what he's talking about!
Dr. Lockerbie is and excellent teacher! He uses clear examples and encourages you to ask questions. As long as you read and take notes, you'll be fine. I highly recommend him!

Pretty easy.  Lectures with power point.  Pretty amusing most days.  Tests are not too hard, but you definitely have to read.  Break out is awful and the TA's assign a participation and attendance grade, but its liveable.

He is a wonderful teacher!  He makes POLS easy to understand.  I have heard about some of the other POLS1101 teachers and he is by far the best!  Tests are short answer, true/false, and multi. choice.  If you are planning on taking POLS 1101 then you shou
Great teacher!!  Explains clearly, and is very organized with notes.. You do need to study pretty hard to do well on his tests though.
Very knowledgable and easy to understand. Assigns a good bit of reading. All and all, an excellent professor.

He is not getting a bad rating because his class was hard. It was fine, and easier than most, probably. His age shows in the classroom. He mostly rambles, and his lectures are insufferable to listen to, as well as very confusing. Maybe my least favorite class in college. (Note: the back half of this class was online due to the pandemic)

Professor Atkinson really cares that you learn something and understand the material. He is by far one of my favorite college professors that I have had. The tests and homework are pretty much straight from the notes and lectures. If you go to class and pay attention, you will do well. Wish he taught another course.

Dr. Atkinson is a fantastic, and very nice, professor. He's extremely knowledgeable about economics - you could easily have a multi-hour long, very informed discussion with him about almost anything. The class itself is very easy so long as you go to class. Textbook isn't necessary. Perfect class for your senior year! Highly recommend!
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment_Rating: Econ majors should definitely get Atkinson to advise your thesis. He gives good feedback but is also extremely lac about the whole process so as long as your are competant you will get an A.
ratingTags_Rating: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment_Rating: Atkinson's class is really straightforward. It's basically a rehash of 4010 Micro with some game theory thrown in, but goes in depth on some new topics. The trick here is that he's obnoxiously anal about how you do the homework and answer on the test. If your lines aren't straight or you didn't write in capital letters, X. He just wants HIS answer.

Lectures are boring as he spends half the time truing to draw straight lines on the board. The tests are exactly hw questions, or notes taken off the board... so go to class. Good professor and interesting class
Easy class and easy material. Notes and HW translate directly to the tests. Study and go to class and you will get an A

Easy class, excellent professor, easy tests. Do not buy the book, he just doesn't use it. He formally took attendance twice, but missing an unannounced experiment day will knock off 2-4% from your final grade. You will make an A if you go to class and take notes from the board.

This is the kind of class where you get what you put in. TSP seems lame at first until you realize it forces you to understand econometrics better. Atkinson spends too much time in class complaining about Stata, but he is really helpful in office hours. The final exam ended up being kind of easy, unlike the 8070 final. Good guy though.

Dr. Atkinson's lectures are very straight forward.  The class examples, homework, and test problems are very similar.  DO NOT BUY THE BOOK.  If you are looking for an interesting but fairly easy Upper Level Econ, take him.  He repeats himself some - don't learn a ton of new material, but it is more in depth and detailed than econ 4010

Easy class and highly recommended.  Good teacher, easy tests. DO NOT BUY THE BOOK.  DO NOT BUY THE BOOK.  DO NOT WASTE 100 dollars and buy the book.  Take this class if he teaches or any class that he teaches because he is a good professor.

Dr. Atkinson is not only a very knowledgeable professor (one only has to look at the number of career accomplishments he has), but he also is skilled at explaining concepts and teaching in general.  His tests are straight forward and you will be well prepared for them if you make some effort to study and look over the review materials.

A great professor, very intelligent and interesting.  He incorporates contemporary issues into the course, which makes class interesting and relevant.  He was also very accommodating when I broke my arm and couldn't take the exams or do the homework conventionally.  I definitely recommend him as a professor.

Professor Atkinson was a good enough teacher. The only thing that made the class challenging was how boring he was and just not very personable. He did his best to stimulate discussion. The class was pretty easy becaue he had tons of study materials posted online so there wasno doubt what you needed know for the exam.
could use work on making lectures clear and insightful. Also, topics would be easier to understand if he didn't go off on so many tangents.
No Comments
Excellent teacher.  Highly recommend for advanced Economics.
eye candy
very intelligent; good leader in class.

Dr. Morrison was very helpful. She grades essays like a beast, but I managed to get 2 A's and a high B. Attendance is mandatory. She is very helpful and is available for conferences and meetings. Only buy the anthology. DO NOT buy St. Martin's Handbook or Writing Analytically. You will be wasting money

Takes her FOREVER to grade things. Also, she is not very helpful of understanding at all, even if you have serious extenuating circumstances. And she can be super rude. That being said, the class is not all that difficult. If you can deal with a difficult teacher and don't mind the work load, it's an easy A or B.
She was an interesting professor, to say the least. Seemed like she was really into literature and her students, but sometimes her teaching style can be too elementary/boring.
I had her this past fall for 1102M and she was HORRIBLE!  I do NOT recommend her, even to get the multicultural requirement fulfilled.

The comments about Valerie are pretty fair--she is not an easy grader. As an English major taking an Honors multicultural section from her, I received an A- on all 3 of my papers. However, she is extremely fair and clear about what she wants. She also schedules meetings to discuss your paper. She is a fun lady and makes class enjoyable.

Um, Hard grader. What you have to do is go to the office hours and just go over ur essay. I also found out that if u dont have the best grammar or style, make up for it with creative ideas. Those count too. I made 1 B-, 1A- and A on papers. It was ok, a little discouraging.

I took the multi-cultural section of the class and it was kind of hard. I made a 90, 89, and an 82 on all 3 of my papers - not due to unfair grading. She's pretty clear on what she wants. Fair grader. Lots of fun and makes class interesting! Quizzes to slightly cushion your grade :) I recommend for anyone.
Not clear on what she wants. She grades hard for the heck of it. She is rude and has an attitude. She just isnt as great as the reviews I read. I do not recommend this class.

I loved her! She was funny and her energy was admirable. The essay conferences were great and she really wanted us to do well. I made an A, but I have always done well in English. It seemed okay for everyone in the class though.
Extremely dedicated to students. Most personal instructor I've had during my college career by far.

Pretty fun and fair overall. Her 1102 class focuses on postmodernism, which is more difficult but not at all impossible. Puts stickers on A quizzes. Got an A on the first paper. She is very helpful and friendly in general.

Very harsh grader, not a particularly interesting lecturer.She expects perfection but can't seem to follow subtle ideas in papers.Demands certain things be done in your essays but will count off for them.Very disorganized & unclear in what she wants; she seems to look for reasons to not give As, even if you've provided all the info she asked for.

Dr. Morrison is a great professor. She was always upbeat and discussions about novels made the class very interesting.  She was always willing to help.  It is very hard to make an A in her class, but she is very fair and clear in her grading so it is not impossible.

Dr. Morrison is an awesome teacher. She is very nice and down to earth. She is a BEAST of a grader when it comes to essays. She reads them closely. I worked HARD for an A in this class, but you will definitely become a better writer. I accidentally estook the class that focus on postmodernism, which is harder than a regular class.

Valerie is the funniest lady ever!  She really loves literature, especially postmodernism.  Participate in class, DO THE READINGS.  There is a really light reading load, and it's mostly short stories which are pretty entertaining.  There are two tests and two papers, so you have a chance to pull your grade up if you bonk one.

I really liked her and this class. She's very entertaining and makes it all fun to talk about.  Assignments aren't hard- there just aren't many, which makes it harder to save your grade if you mess up on one.  Only about 10 pages of reading every other night. It's really not a difficult course.  I really liked it and would recommend her to anyone.

I took her multiculture course, and it was pretty rough. She expects you to know so much coming into the course and grades ridiculously hard. She is very nice and makes class fun. She also has quizzes that boost grades, but not by a lot. I suggest only taking her if you're an exceptional writer.

I don't like writing and this class did not help me like it any better. She's very nice and will answer any questions that you have, but she grades her papers so hard. Has paper conferences for every paper which can be helpful if you have written most of your paper.  Grammar and literary terms quizzes are easy and boost your grade!
Fun person, she has the ability to make boring poetry interesting. She is a tough grader,  but my writing skills are vastly improved. She is very energetic!
I LOVED this class, Valerie as really cool and helpful. She's amazing and the reading assignments are really interesting!
Gret and fun instructor.  Didn't assign book- only course packet!!!  I had to work REALLY HARD to get a B, but i REALLY liked the class!  Def. not as  hard as other ENGL 1102 instructors!!!
No Comments
Tough grader, but a very enjoyable teacher. Personal, caring and helpful. Highly recommend

Before this class, I always had A's in english. Despite having three conferences before turning in my papers, this lady still gave me C's for reasons she never even mentioned were problems in the conferences.  She thinks she is perfect at english and grades very hard.
She grades extremely hard on papers but she is an all around great teacher.  She is very helpful on papers if u have a conference with her.  I would definitely recommend her!
This lady is not fun. She acts like she is an English goddess. Would not recommend.
A great teacher to have- both fun and able to teach well!  I think she is easier in 1102 rather than 1101 however.  Every 1101 class is rough.

Years after taking this class, finding my way through the political boggs of DC and Europe, I think back to this guy's class. Take it if you have the chance and just listen and retain. He will test you on your own concepts about topics and he offers a view that many at UGA cant...real world experience!!!

He did buy us our book (that he wrote) and took the whole class out to dinner and paid, but I did not find him a very impressive teacher.  I got an A- but I often found myself confused as to what the point of going to class was considering our grade was 80% term paper.  Very chauvinistic and arrogant.  Don't expect to learn about IR.

You will learn more about international politics, and the real manner that political situations and issues are viewed by those in power, (mainly because he is one), than any other person you will ever meet in your life.
Dr. Pelanda rocks my socks.  Don't stress over the final paper, you'll get an 'A' if you follow directions and turn it in ontime.

He is buddha.  He is cut from the finest intellectual cloth.  He tells you the real way politics is viewed by the elites. This guy knows Kissinger personally and is a multi-millionaire.  The liberal professors at the department cannot stand him because he knows does what he wants.  read next post...
Easily one of the best teachers I have ever had.  He not only teaches, but inspires you to learn more about the world around you.

Mk, so, Theatre Major? I am speaking to the fact that if you've gotten to this point, you might want to release your inhibitions to the wind or your voice. If you're not crazy, or free, you're going nowhere. Wonderful experience, somewhat jarring commentary, although, eventually developing the frescos of the sixteenth chapel... I have no tattoos...

The course itself is easy to get an A as long as you show up to class and participate. Lots of play readings. Kristin is a good teacher but makes inappropriate comments in class that made students uncomfortable.

I had been out of school for four years working as an orderly and transporter (night-shift) at a local hospital. I was working full time when I took her class, I got a {C}. Not particularly hard, just out of the loop from college. She gave me all she had and eventually I unlocked my voice on my own time. Was my second and final acting course...

She's the best. Easy A. She is tough on criticism but her honesty is what you need to hear sometimes. This class is super easy if you just show up and participate. She's so funny and easy to talk to. LOVED this class even though it was super long and 3x a week. Made some good friends in there too because she forces you to get close. 10/10.

Kristin is super chill and hilarious. She really really knows what she's doing but you won't know your grade until the class is over pretty much. As long as you show up and make an effort, you're good. It's genuinely a really fun class and shouldn't be a pain to go to at all, plus attendance is super mandatory because it's a studio class.
ratingTags_Rating: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment_Rating: Voice was such an interesting and relaxing class.  The first half of the semester is a yoga session while the second half is diction lessons.  I learned so much about my voice and alignment and correct pronunciation.  It's a really cool class!  Highly recommend all actors to take it.

This was the toughest and best acting course I've had.  If you want to pursue acting and want to be an actor, take this class.  I found it very challenging because of what we had to do.  Glad it's offered during the Maymester so I could focus on it.  I would take it again.  It was such a great class for personal discovery. It is tough. Good luck.
ratingTags_Rating: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment_Rating: I'm so glad that Krisitin was my first acting instructor at UGA.  She's very passionate and cares about her students.  One great benefit in having her was the two private sessions we had where we worked one on one with her.  She gives great critiques and wants to not only do well, but also work to do well.  I highly recommend her.

Kristin is great. She's fun, loud, and wants people to let go and try acting. It would take a lot to do badly in this course, but it's possible. She likes to read people's facial expressions and body language and we asked her to typecast each of us and tell us our age range, which I think is helpful.

She now teaches at UGA (where I took it). She's helpful, nice, and a great acting teacher- I loved this class and I thought it helped me grow a lot as an actor. As long as you do the work, I'm pretty sure you get an A. Take this class!
Scattered and really loud all the time in her teaching. No sense of style in her directing or her acting. Would not recommend.

Kristin is a great teacher. If you are an artist, you have to be open-minded to new techniques and perspectives. If you can't deal with people who aren't as "Christian" as you think they should be, you are in the wrong business. If you don't like the person she is, get over it and take what you can from her knowledge of the craft.

OMCow!  That woman thinks the only way to act is to have someone beat you over the head with the "Method" book.  I got a bad grade in there because I don't believe in method acting.  I don't believe you have to hit yourself in the head to know what it feels like to be hit in the head!  I don't believe you have to get raped to be able to act like someone who has just been raped. ARG!!! ... I think I will digress, as she is no longer adjunct-"ing" at AC, because Scott Clark is the man!!!!

I disagree with previous two ratings. She was an incredibly helpful teacher with more knowledge about real world acting then some of the professors still teaching at AC. Yeah she cusses...get over it. That's life. If you're involved in theatre then you need to understand that there are people like her out there. She was great!
Do not take... I completely agree with the person above; the profanity is untolerable; especially for a Christian College... why is she still here???

(Adjunct from hell) The. Majors, you HAVE to take her for acting; shes the only one who teaches it. DO NOT TAKE FOR FUN ELECTIVE! She uses offensive profanity and if she does't like you, you will NOT pass! She will also lie to the dept. head to fail you!

This class was difficult for me since I was taking it along with ECON4010 which is a course students usually take before this course. Professor Chatterjee is passionate when it comes to his work and I really enjoyed his lectures. He is always willing to help students with topics that are difficult to grasp. Take him if you've already took ECON4010

Rarely teaches cuz he's high up in Terry, so if you can DEFINITELY TAKE HIM. Class discussions are great. Walks you thru how to think, limits info to what you need to know (and puts it all in ppts). Has won a ton of teaching awards. Way better than the standard macro teacher. Has limited availability outside of class, but you wont need any help.

During this whole COVID19 nonsense, Professor Chatterjee was able to seamlessly transition his class into an online format, as well as increase the weight of the homework to help the grades of his students. Hes a great lecturer (back when he had lectures) and always made himself available outside of class. Definitely take his class!
ratingTags_Rating: Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment_Rating: I highly recommend Chatterjee for macro. I found the subject difficult, but he is a great professor. Very good at explaining concepts and a fair grader. The textbook is very informative, so would recommend reading in addition to reviewing his slides. Be aware though, that he does grade on a curve.
ratingTags_Rating: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment_Rating: One of the best professors I've had at UGA. He's very fair, the work is more than doable and he offers extra credit at the end of the semester. Take him if he's available.
ratingTags_Rating: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment_Rating: I literally feel like I'm among the gods when he teaches... if you ever have take his class you're a truly blessed human

The most intelligent, engaging and compassionate professor I have had at UGA. He is deeply invested in the material and frames it in a light so that his students may internalize it and use it to form their own opinions.  Take his class. You will learn a lot and become a better human being in the process. Would be an asset at any university

Great professor. Instead of lecturing the whole period, Chatterjee really encourages class discussions, and motivates you to think about the material. He definitely challenges you on tests, but if you go to class and read the textbook, you should be fine. I would highly recommend taking a course with him if you have the option.

Professor Chaterjee was an awesome teacher. He was extremely organized, professional, likeable, and open to feedback. He was challenging, but his office door was always open. There are many classes where I just obtained some material so I could make the A. This class make me learn enough to get the A. Take him if you can!
Hands down, the best all-around professor I've had at UGA. A kind man who knows what's going on. I wish I could have him for every course.
Good teacher!
No Comments

his MIST ecommerce was great, probably the most useful class i've had.  Dr. C  is challenging and will make you read a lot (and motivate you to discuss) but it is all well worth it.  Dr. C is also a very kind person who really cares about his students.
No Comments

I had him for the Biotechnology FYOS. We literally just had articles to read for each class, and all we had to do was sit as he talked about them. He's a sweet old man. All we had to do was write a 10-page paper over a biotechnology topic of our choice. He took us all out for pizza after the semester ended.

He is a sweet old man. Everything you need to know is on his power point. I would definitely recommend his class over the other one -with I believe Wood- where you have to take a quiz every week and that becomes your grade. It took me a test to figure out his testing style but there's a good amount of extra credit worked into the class.

The dude is unintelligible. When he teaches in class, nobody pays attention because it is actually more confusing to try to listen to him than it is to learn the information on your own. He's one of three different professors that co-teach 1107; Armstrong is by far the superior professor.

He is a sweet old man. He taught a little less than half of my biochem class and his tests were much easier and he would tell stories in the middle of class sometimes about his school in Amsterdam and his life.

He is a sweet older gentleman and technology has left him behind. He puts figures up on the overhead, but it is hard to follow. Just read the book and do the mastering biology homework and you will be fine. He also recycles test questions for the final, so study your old tests.
Cute little old man, sometimes hard to understand what he is saying. Fairly easy, read the book, you'll be fine. Random attendance checks.

Like everyone already commented, he IS very humorous and nice "little" old man. Unfortunately, he's not so good at teaching, but you can tell he's very knowledgeable about all the topics.. he just can't put it into words students can understand. His review session's awesome bc he practically give out questions and answers for exam :) do attend!

The sweetest man you will ever meet, but the poor guy can't teach. Be prepaired to teach yourself. Luckily the material is pretty easy and he gives you old tests to study from. Use the online book resource and to all the practice questions you can find on the website and in the book. Tests aren't too bad if you study the right things.
Dude's getting old but overall still a pretty good prof
Take his class! I LOVE this professor. He's such a nice and funny guy. His notes are all you need for his part of the class. He tells you what study for the exams, too. He's awesome!!

He was the funniest old man and he really tried to make the lectures interesting. He's really bad about not putting any words on the overhead and just using figures to explain so keep up with the book readings!

I was surprised at how easy this class was. DerVartanian's tests are very straightforward, and if you read the book they're simple. When he lectures, all he does is read off powerpoints and show the figures from the book so you don't really need to go. Lab is really easy also.

I loved his class especially because his tests are exactly from the book and his practice exams. He even goes over them with you IN class. No tricky or vague questions. Very straight forward and exactly from the notes. (UNLIKE Armstrong. avoid him if you can) also very nice and sweet.as long as you attend class and take notes, you'll get an A. easy
Very boring and uses a lot of figures in class. If you go to class take the book with youso you can make notes next to the figures he shows in class, otherwise note taking is very difficult.
Not too hard..just study the class notes and you'll be fine.  He highlights everything you need to know for the test.

Bad teacher, good professor.  You have to teach yourself most of the material, but he highlights all the important points that he requires you to know for the test.  Pretty easy class, no attendance policy, but you should go to class to learn what he wants you to know.

Dr.D was a really sweet old man but he really can't teach. I hated how his only method of teaching involved "look at this figure". If you're not reading the book, then you won't do well on Dr.D's portions of the exams.

Fair tests, somewhat interesting lectures. UBER-better than the teacher he taught with, DO NOT TAKE A BIOCHEM CLASS WITH MOHNEN!!!!!!!!!! Devo is the man, Mohnen stinks on ice. Devo and Lee is the way to go I hear, wish I had done that.
He rocks. He was a great advisor and an awesome teacher. He is the MAN. He's funny, friendly, and always willing to lend a helping hand.
No Comments
not the most interesting lectures, but nice guy
Devar was great! He was so sweet and hilarious...I loved coming to class just to hear what he had to say. He is worth the studying.
Very easy and does lecture directly from the book.

What a sweet little old man! He lectures directly from the book so don't bother going to class and his tests are so easy. He wears this red cardigen to class every day, he's so cute! Reminds me of my grandpa!

Zeichner can be a bit hard to understand at times because of his accent but he reads from the powerpoints a lot which helps. The tests are relatively easy and if you take the tests you can skip the final.
Zeichner is a nice guy and can sometimes be funny. His class is pretty easy and the only grades are 4 tests, and if you take all 4 you have the option to skip the final.

Best professor I have ever had. He really knows his stuff and has a lot of experience. As long as you attend class and take notes and study them before tests, as well as do at least some reading, it's easy to get an A. 4 tests and a final
Information is interesting, but tests are very hard

This class is hard, but the professor is nice and has a great sense of humor. there are only 3 multiple choice tests so if you don't do well in one your grade suffers. Also, final is optional and attendance is not mandatory.
He is confusing and ambivalent.  If he does know what he is talking about, he doesn't know how to convey it to students.  Not much of a people person for a psychologist.

He is an interesting guy so that alone makes his class interesting. He's straight forward and tells you what you need to know but yes, he doesn't really put on a show for you. I hated intro psyc and like this class so I would give him a chance.
This is the worse professor and worse class ever!  I can't believe this is psychology!
Very boring. Tests were not extremely hard. No attendance policy.
I think his problem is that he does not care for the classroom or for students.  Research is his interest--racking up published articles to list under his name.  It's an ego thing

It was a difficult class with a good deal of reading but it was really interesting subject material, and I learned a lot from the course. He's willing to listen and meet with you, don't be intimidated :) Would reccommend him- but definitely not to my slacker friends :)

As a 4.0 student, I usually don't struggle in any class. However, he has managed to make this one of the worst classes I have taken in college. His tests are ambiguous and can be interpretted in many different ways, even the TA didn't agree with him most of the time. AND He lashed out on me in class for not following his rambling train of thought!

speaks in low lulling boring tone. rambles. on the first day of class he told us he came from isreal (which according to him is close to germany) really hard to know what he was going to test on. i recommend staying away

The professor was hardly ever on topic and he jumps around to unrelated material constantly. The class test averages were in the D to F range every time and the test material was so specific the very best note takers and studiers still had no idea. He has to curve grades to produce a decent distribution so good luck.

Zeichner really is not a good teacher at all. He was very hard to understand, He talked very lightly, and he was very unenthusiastic about the class. He provided no notes besides a few random words that he would write on a projector during each class. handwriting is hard to read. He is very insensitive as well. Caused me lots of unnecessary stress.
His tests were ambiguous, he was not flexible, and very unhelpful.  His TA did not even agree with some of his test questions and answers.
This guy is just weird but he is also very angry which is odd because he is a psychologist who researches anger.  Guess it must be projection.

The exams I had were not straight from the back of the book--they were hard and very specific. The material is interesting and Dr. Zeichner definitely knows his stuff, but he wasn't at all helpful, flexible, or even close to approachable about a problem or concern in the class.  His TA (who was never in the classroom) handled all student questions.
No Comments
The tests were straight from the back of the chapter questions, so very easy. I thought this class was interesting, and Dr. Zeichner is so funny and nice.

I'm sure Dr. Rothstein is a great person outside of the classroom but I don't think that he should be teaching. His notes are very hard to follow and he has a hard time communicating how to do simple math problems. I'd go into a lecture and leave feeling more confused. I just ended up teaching myself. Take another professor if you can.

His handwriting is completely illegible but after some time you get used to it. He curves his test and he is an easy grader. The quizzes are straight from the homework, so as long as you do it, you're fine. If you go to his office hours regularly, he will see you are invested and take more interest in you and make sure you're doing well.

Professor Rothstein definitely enjoys his job and it's obvious he loves math, but his lectures are incredibly scatterbrained and difficult to follow. He starts examples and always fails to finish them, often because he made a mistake early in the problem and didn't feel like going back to correct it. Be prepared to teach yourself if you take him.
ratingTags_Rating: Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment_Rating: Great teacher but terrible hand writing if you are visual learner don't take his class .

Rothstein is a great math professor for students who really want to understand the material of the class instead of blindly computing problems repeatedly. He focuses on concepts and wants every student to discover the inner workings of the logic behind the numbers. I'd recommend him for students who want a challenge to spice up their courseload.
Impossible to decipher lectures due to lack or format and illegibility. Be prepared to teach yourself the course. All the homework and tests come from the book.

He teaches the concepts without explaining what he is doing or why. In this class we used a real textbook, the problem is he gives homework straight from the textbook but then does not teach the class the basic concepts needed to complete the assignments.  He doesn't have ANYTHING in ELC meaning no online tools and his handwriting is 95% illegible

DON'T be alarmed by the fact that he writes his own book. It's not bad if you COME TO CLASS, which is a MUST if you wanna pass! Tests are pretty easy if you do the practice exams and show up for review. If you get the whole class to beg for a homework extension, he'll usually give it, or even give answers before it's due. It's really a good class!!
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment_Rating: Rothstein wrote his own textbook and makes up his own theorems (e.g. the free lunch theorem). My best friend's dad is a linear algebra professor and even he was unable to understand or help me with this class. Rothstein also has bad handwriting due to a condition, so if you don't hear what he says then you won't be able to take good notes.

He wrote the "textbook", which is just a PDF that's a transcription of a lecture (there are sections in the "book" that are literally a conversation between a teacher and student e.g. "do you understand this?" "yes" "let's move on"). I had to purchase a real textbook just to pass the class. The "concepts" he teaches are his own theories.

He made his own book, made up his own theories, and makes his own exercises that are assigned as homework. He believes his way of teaching it is the only correct way and will not accept anything else. Office hours are useless because he gets frustrated and is not helpful. Although he does curve, you will never actually understand what is going on

He is a sweet old man with a genius mind; however, he isn't that great of a teacher. If you previously took calculus in high school, you'll have a good idea of what's going on. He's very spontaneous in his teaching and doesn't really have a structured format for class. He's willing to help if you don't understand concepts.

Rothstein is such a sweet guy and you can tell he loves his job, but he's just one of those people who's too smart to be teaching. He's extremely old and has difficulty writing and getting his point across in lectures, arrives 15 minutes late to class everyday, and he can never understand why you don't understand a concept.

Please, try and take another professor. Rothstein is the worst math prof I've had at UGA. He spends weeks on one concept, doesn't follow the textbook (yet still assigns homework from it), and really isn't good at teaching. If you end up taking him, know the definitions, because he pretty much makes the class recite at least one every day.
I liked him. I thought he was definitely a good math teacher

Dr. R is a great guy who is willing to help anyone who will ask for it. The class is hard, but he makes it interesting. I would take him again for anything. He gives you the test before you take it if you ask for a pre-test, and the quizzes come straight from the homework.

The material for this class was really hard, but Dr. R wasn't too bad. It got confusing at times, but he is definitely willing to help. I survived off of office hours. You have to do your homework if you want to pass. He is really good about giving partial credit, just write down everything you know and it will help.

Very bad teacher.Nerdy band kids would really love him though because of his weird personality.A lot of people get annoyed with his weird jokes and excitement for math.If you do take his class study every random proof or theory because tests are mostly proofs.Homework is important due to hw quizzes. Not consistent w/ quiz vs. tests
Really nice professor. I enjoyed his class even though calculus is definitely not my thing. Slightly eccentric, but I think that goes for all math profs. Really helpful guy.

Rothstein was a pretty good professor. It gets really excited about the subject, which makes going to class a little more interesting. He enjoys helping. So asking questions in class or going to office hours are really beneficial.

I believe that Dr. Rothstein is one of the greatest teacher. He know how to teach and explain lots of stuffs about cal 2. It's just up to the students to study and do their homework. U need to attend class or you will get lost. He is willing to help you out at his office hour. If you do your hw and study, you should be fine in the class.

I thought Dr. Rothstein was a good teacher. He knows the material well and gets very excited about it. He uses a lot a theory in explanations, but it never seemed that complicated to me. Hopefully Calc II will be as easy.

Dr. Rothstein makes his class interesting and entertaining. It was like being taught by Willy Wonka (The old, good Wonka and not the new creepy one). If you pay attention and ask questions when you don't understand something, you'll do fine. Also, he enjoys helping students, so take advantage of his office hours.

I took him for Pre-calculus.  He always seems a little unprepared for class, but gets frustrated if you ask too many questions before he's finished his lesson for the day.  He's nice and usually willing to help outside of class, but he's not the best teacher.  I ended up doing better when I taught myself.
Uses weird comparisons and explanations, but is always willing to help if you ask for it.

willing to help, but can't seem to teach in a way for most people to understand, albeit he does know the material very thorough just can't seem to teach it in a way for people to understand it though. Luckily I knew most of the stuff so it wasn't so bad. The test are all based on jexam practice test so just memorize jexam pratice test

He's a very odd man. He doesn't teach very well, and although he's willing to help you, he just gets you confused even more. The only good thing is that when he gives a quiz, he lets you know ahead of time which problems will be on it. I withdrew from the class due to his lack of teaching ability, and I would not recommend taking him.

Though many don't seem to like him, he really isn't that difficult. A strange little fellow who at times was in his own element, he will still manage to answer homework or test questions if you make the effort. The class is not tough as long as you utalize the J-exam practice tests. Take a lot and you'll be prepared...the test uses the same questio

He needs to take TECH1101 on how to teach math 3500. He really can't teach. In class, he only goes through simple theories which are not helpful at all for the homework. Indeed, his lectures are som shallow and confusing.  Pretty unlucky to have him. Why dont Dr Shifrin teach this class??????????

Not a bad teacher. Difficult to get into a personal relationship with outside of class, but in class was very expressive and had a great sense of humor. Didn't cover physical applications of the theory as much in our class as he might have.
By far, this teacher makes even the Pythagorean Theorem look like a figure out of space; he complicates everything. If you dare question his work, he gets pissed off easily!

This class was the reason that I went into math theory.  You have to work, don't expect to just be able to listen in class, you have to go home and really work, but if you put in the time you'll learn SO much.
He goes way to in depth with things to the point where he just confuses you.  He explains things WRONG and gets mad if you try to call him out on it.

This has been by far the worst class I have ever had the misfortune of taking.  He complicates examples and concepts unnecessarily, often refuses to answer questions, and gets highly perturbed when students ask questions that he feels they should be able to answer for themselves.  This course is "Foundations of Graduate Mathematics" ha ha.

Fairly easy class, made easier because Dr. Rothstein teaches cohesively with a strong directive. It's impossible to get lost if you're paying attention and do the homework. He does, however, give a nasty final, so watch out.
Had never used the main program that the class focused on
No Comments
He doesnt know how to use the Maple program very well and he doesnt help the students very much. There are projects due every 2 weeks at the beginning of class.
Rothstein's very funny and a great teacher. If you do and understand his homework assignments and quizzes you will do well in the class overall.
awesome teacher! kind and helpful! i recommend Mr. Raptis to anyone and everyone who wants to conquer their fear of public speaking!!!!
He's EXTREMELY hard!!! I failed this class! I even read the whole book and took notes and went to class everyday... :'( I shouldn't have taken this class....
joke class, everyone is an A.  But if you are looking to raise the hope grade, can't beat him!

if you're really interested in becoming a more effective public speaker, don't take Raptis.  But, if you want an easy elective, by all means, register for his class.  He doesn't count attendance, so if you don't have a test or have to give a speach that day, don't go!!  and if it's a morning class, he'll always have his mcdonald's coffee!

EASIEST "A" EVER!! We watched movies almost every other day, and he taught straight from the book. Quizzes are common knowledge almost, and tests are the simplest you'll ever take. If you make below a 96 in this class, you're an idiot
Best teacher ever! Easy class and he shows good movies.  Posts notes on webct and you dont have to read book.
He is the best!
Awsome teacher, cool guy, easy class, do the work for an easy A.
Easy class with no attendance policy. He also shows a lot of movies.

He's so cool, no attendence policy and shows lots of movies.

Professor Dawkins intermediate class is definitely a challenge. He is a great professor because of his years of experience and he also knows how to treat his students like adults. attendance is not mandatory but it is necessary to do well. he gives you suggested homework problems and the answers so that you can do work outside of the classroom.

A wonderful professor. Very professional. Class was very hard. Tests are very long (4-5 hours), but he prepares you for them. Take this professor over anyone else teaching. No matter who teaches the course, it will be difficult.

A great professor.  He is the most challenging professor that I have ever had, but he genuinely cared about the success of every student. He will help you a lot if you just ask. His tests were SO HARD.. and long... around 4 hrs.  Half the battle was getting through the test.  Study a lot, and be prepared to get a lower grade than you're used to!
No Comments

Dr. Dawkins is an incredible intermediate 1 professor. It's true and I won't lie: He's EXTREMELY tough but he's very nice and very helpful. Do his work, ask questions, and DON'T wait to study...and you can do well.

Dr. Lewis is a rare professor who understands what it's like to go through his own class. He takes difficult material and makes it easy to learn. He will push back due dates or remove some material from a test if he feels he did not do a good enough job teaching. Easily my fav professor at UGA. If you have the option to take his class, do it!

Dr. Lewis was my first exposure to physics, and is one of the best professors I've ever had. I struggled at first, but he is incredibly helpful in office hours and in class and I managed to pull my grade up. The course is rigorous and the tests aren't easy, but he does everything he can to help you out as long as you make an effort.
Helpful in office hours and cares about students
Awesome.  Clearly cares about students understanding the material.  Without a doubt one of the best teachers I have had here at UGA
great, caring prof
Dr. Lewis is an exceptional educator.  I completely believe that he is only interested in his students succeeding.

Dr. Lewis is an brillant professor who conveys difficult concepts in an understandable manner.
Great Prof!

An excellent teacher. Makes learning difficult concepts really really easy. He's the best teacher I've ever had and would highly recommend his courses to anyone in the Vet School. I really look forward to his classes every week.
Great professor. I took his class back in the early 90s and it completely changed my life. Thanks Tim.

Blow off class. Only went once and then he told us everything was online so I never came back. Tests can be taken in groups (and I recommend it). Only downside is that a lot of the tests seem to have errors in the questions and answers. If u put in minimal effort u will get a B. He curves the class average to an 85.

I suggest taking him but only because you don't have to go to class. I went the first week only and I'm still pulling out a B in the class. All quizzes are online, at home, and you have a week to complete. Most answerss are googled or easy to get from the notes packet. BUY THE PHYS 1010 Notes because his in class lectures are all over the place!

Terrible experience! I learned nothing in this class and it was a waste of my time. Wouldn't take the class unless you know a lot about physics and are good at looking things up on google. You do not get anything from class, so I wouldn't go. I tried the fist half of the semester and I did better when I didn't go. He doesn't try to meet up with you

Excellent teacher. Makes it easy to understand. Makes you memorize the formulas. This might seem terrible, but it truly helps. I dominated my lab final because of them. The only thing is his tests are multiple choice. This is good and bad. However, it has a built in curve that compensates for most partial credit. He's also really entertaining.

My counselor put me in the wrong class so I am a little lost, but Heil is entertaining. Some of his comments kill me. He does run through the notes that are online so lecture is TECHNICALLY not mandatory, but he says things in class it is prudent not to miss (like 3 of the test questions). If you have to take Phys 1111, he's the prpfessor you want.

Dr. Heil is a good man who knows his physics. He seems as bored with the class as your probably will be. You will learn physics,sort of. Dr. Heil says lots of funny things all the time. If you took physics in high school, you probably won't need to come to class. He demands that you not read the book, and only uses it for problems.
Useless. Lectures are hard to comprehend and he just goes over the notes online, attendance is non-mandatory and class is extremely dull. Avoid like the plague.

His tests are way easy if you show up to class as he tells you what 3 of the 12 questions will be. You need a text for the practice problems. If you go to class, he tells you which formulas to memorize (usually 8 to 12).

This class sounds like an easy A.  There are 8 tests there all online the notes are online too.. But I got a B.  The test are not easy because neither the notes nor google are helpful. So take your tests with 2 or 3 friends.  Don't waste time going to class.. it won't help. But on a positive note this class takes no effort.

Do not take this class... i feel like he knows what he is talking about, but has NO IDEA how to teach it.  I loved physics in high school, but hated his class.  Even though the tests are open notes and online, they are still confusing questions.  I suggest not taking this class for your science unless it is required.

Online website is expensive because you pay for really difficult tests. Google is no use. He curves but won't tell you until the end. No extra credit. Very dull, boring lecturer. Impossible to get an A. Must study to get a B, and easy to get a C. Take someone else, espically if science is your forte.

If you just want to complete your physical science credit or take a science without a lab, take this course. Exams are hard to make higher than 90% on but luckily he curves the raw grades to an 85%. Take organized notes (to use during the test), review notes, use google, and take test. Very simple to make an 85 on all exams. A little extra to get A
1010. No textbook. Attendance is not required. Tests are ridiculously easy to do well on. This sounds good, but I would not recommend this class. It's the kind of easy that isn't enjoyable.

i took this class because they say its one of the easy classes at uga. there right but the class is online, no book, based off test, he barely teaches, showing up its useless. but if u want to get the grade take it but if u want to learn something i dont recommend it

This class is an easy A. Test are online and you can use your notes. Even though all he does is read the notes from online, during class sometimes he can be kind of funny. In the end I made an A and it didn't take much effort.

this class was not very interesting. Prof. Heil would pretty much just read over the notes he posted online. But when you got to the test you would see questions that he barely covered in class. If taking the class i would suggest going to class unless you completely understand the material. The only good thing is that he does curve.

Half of the test material is not explained in class or in the notes. No textbook is used.  I went to class everyday for the first half of class but did much better not going and using a textbook. The tests are online, so I thought it would be easy to google the answers and do well. I was wrong.  Ended up with an A- though.

I got an A and I never went to class, and the notes are all online. You can use them on the online 8 tests and 1 final. He curves the raw scores to an 85!. I got a group of 7 people to help take te online tests. For people that want to learn something, DONT take this class, but if you want a gpa booster, then take it.

Went to class only twice the whole year because his lectures really dont accomplish anything with regard to the test.  Not that great of a teacher, I haven't really gotten anything spectacular out of the class.  Tests are difficult, but at least he curves them which is good.

Hard class. Completely pointless to go to class. Notes not helpful either, basically trying to teach yourself. Dont believe when people say it's easy. Online tests so you can use notes and Google and still make C's! How is that possible???

Attendance is not mandatory. Buy the printed notes at Baxter St. Bookstore and you dont need to attend class. All the tests are online (8) and the test questions can be googled to find the answers. EXTREMELY easy, slack class. He curves all of the tests so even if you fail them, you get a good grade in the class. No homework/classwork. I got an A!!

This class was major CRAP. It is not easy as it sounds. You have to memorize over 30 formulas foe each of the 5 tests and you might just use only 6 or 7 of them. You might just make a C  even if you beat the class average on each of the tests. This all includes the curve. The tests only have 12 questions and no partial credit.

If you care about your GPA, take physics elsewhere.  Heil does not teach; his "method" is guess and check. You have to memorize 30+ formulas for every test just to get by. The tests make up almost your entire grade, and are 12 question mult. choice. Even if you do all of the homework right, the tests are impossible. I was an A student before this.

Please don't take him.  He is just an awful teacher.  His grades are all exams.  He's not a good lecturer, his tests are difficult, and he doesn't really care about his students.  This is such a hard subject that you need someone helpful and isn't so vague.
This class was awful. The notes are worthless and attending the lectures didn't even help. Avoid this teacher if possible.

Physics is going to be hard no matter what.  One of the hardest classes - I've been told and I would have to agree - at UGA.  Heil is insistent on his "methods." Tests are incredibly difficult, and unfortunately, are the only grades (besides lab).
