Awful. He just isn't a good teacher, and spends too much time insisting on how well his 'method' works. Lab is not counted as a separate class, so it'll be what saves your final grade.
his class was fairly easy; just memorize the formulas and work practice problems from book and you should do fine (plus tests are multiple choice).

Dr. Heil's lectures were bull. All the tests and exams are online, so we googled. There is no textbook,unless u buy the printed lectures. The class was a social hour really. I did absolutely nothing and got a B..thanks GOOGLE! He curved the test average 4 points. And gave us a hundred for one of the tests.And he was alwasys screaming quiet please!

Heil is the worst professor I have had at UGA. Lectures are pointless (he spends half the class shouting "Quiet, please."), you pay $100 for access to a website (no textbook) with poorly written material that's no help (so you can't teach yourself), and tests are so poorly written you don't understand the question. DON'T TAKE HEIL'S CLASS!!!!!

Instead of using a regular textbook, he change into using an "online textbook." It is mainly just bulletpoints of info. You don't learn anything much, and the info does not help you on tests. He doesn't explain much during lecture either so it also doesn't help you much on tests. This class was hell.
He's awesome
As long as you get to know him a little outside of class, he's a pretty good guy, and he'll help you with whatever you need.
The lectures were helpful and he tried to keep it interesting.  It was hard for me to comprehend.  Read the text because it will help.

To pass the tests memorize the answers to the sample questions and read the chapters. Go to class every day to get the quiz extra credit at the end of the semester. You have to work hard to get an A, but it's also difficult to make a C. Good class to take to fulfill the science without a lab requirement.
No Comments

Not a bad professor - don't let these guys fool you. His tests came from lecture notes and the book - plus the practice test! If you go to class and take the daily "quiz" more times than the class average, you get a few points added to your final grade. Plus all the tests are curved. It's not super easy, but it's way better than Bio or Chem.

thought this wouldn't be that hard of a class but it is. i'm doing better in my "hard" classes than this "easy" one.not sure where in the world his tests come from. so don't take this class unless you absolutely have to. one good thing is that with the curve it's hard to fail, but still, it's hard to do well.
easy class if you've had physics before. going to class is pointless so buy the notes and just study a couple of nights in advance for the CURVED tests and enjoy the free time
Going to class is worthless.  His tests do not come from his lectures and his lectures are very boring.  I thought this class would be an easy A, but it's difficult to make a B.

You'll do better on exams if you just take the practice tests and read the book.  They make WAY more sense.  There is extra credit for going, but its BS, only worth 2 points on final grade, so don't bother.

I thought this class would be easy, but it's the hardest class on my schedule. His lectures don't make sense, and his tests come out of nowhere. I tried to get help, and couldn't. If you came to UGA for physics, try again.

I enjoy the lectures, but the material is occasionally difficult to grasp, and the tests are rather detailed. He gives help to anyone who asks for it though! I think he's funny and look forward to attending his lectures!
The only boring class I have.  The only point going to class is to get counted for attendance.  He's terrible at giving lectures... so read the book or you're out of luck!
This guy is sooo rude.. his class was supposed to be easy and fun, but not anymore! He doesn't want to help you, very boring lectures. Good Luck if you got this guy!

This class was pretty tough. People rave about his multiple choice test, but that means that there is not any extra credit. UGA Physics department is not the best. If you need Physics, take it over the summer somewhere else!
No Comments

Newsflash--not an easy class anymore! Rumor has it that he got in trouble because his class was so easy now he is making it harder to get even a B. Lectures straight through the notes and doesn't spend ANY time making jokes anymore. I thought it would be an easy A.. but it isn't.

This is by far the funniest class at UGA!  We waste about 30 minutes of every class by talking about celebrities and his past discretions.  It's great.  Just remember to ask him about his most memoriable MLK Day...

THE BEST CLASS AT UGA! He makes it impossible to be able to fail his class.  He will even make fun of how easy his class is.  Spends 30 min reading peoples comments from the quizes (SOOOO FUNNY!)  He is just overall a great guy!  EASY B but work for an A!

I took this class in an 18 day summer course, so it was a lot of work, but I still ended up making an A. Stretch this out over a full semester and it's an easy A as long as you do your reading, pay attention, and do study q's. but he definitely wants everyone to do well and he offers lots of extra points. Highly recommend taking his class.

Dr. Barstow is more along the lines of your typical boring high school teacher than a college professor.  His lectures are long and boring, but the subject matter is fairly easy to comprehend if you read.  He gives extra credit for attendance randomly.  Wouldn't have him as a first choice professor, but you'll be fine if you get stuck with him.

He offers a lot of help and gives a clear study guide that he bases his tests on. His lectures are long and boring, but he gives extra credit if you show up! He is always willing to help. He is a very old, sweet man.

A moderately easy class and a really nice professor. Four tests and a final. If your final grade is higher than your average, he takes the higher grade. Gives TONS of extra credit (easily 24+ points) just for attendance. Also gives in depth study guides which make up the tests. As long as you memorize the study guide answers fairly well, you're ok

This class is an easy A with an absurd amount of bonus points, in depth study guides, and study sessions before every exam. There is a good amount of reading, not as much as you'd expect though, so it's a relatively easy class. Prof is very nice and wants you to pass. As long as you read and do study guide you will pass with an A/B no problem.

Professor Barstow is a great teacher! He teaches you exactly what will be on the test so you always know what to expect, although he is sometimes difficult to understand and his lectures are lengthy. He gives a ton of extra credit for coming to class. You will have to pay attention and study to pass, but it definitely is not too hard at all.

The good part about his class is that he truly wants you to pass his class. Bonus for attendance However, for me he lacks the resources to help me. I'm just as confused when I ask him questions I do not understand. I study HARD in that class only to make a C at best and when I ask him, he rambles on without giving a concise answer. Avoid if you can

Lectures are long & boring. He plays short videos in the middle of class for fun. Try & stay on top of the lecture questions & bring them with you to answer in class. You'll sometimes feel like you haven't learned anything in the lectures. BUT he gives extra points for attendance so go! DO NOT wait until the night before to study for his exams!

Dr. Barstow is a very nice man. He tries to break up the class by showing a YouTube video in the middle, but on the days he doesn't do that, class seems extra long. He's a pretty good teacher and provides study questions for each exam that really help. He also does a help session the night before each exam.

Avoid if you can. Barstow is a sweet old man who has outlived his teaching ability. He shows a short video each class and will give you extra points for random attendance checks, but his lectures are SO boring. I felt like I was basically teaching myself the material. Grade is based on 4 exams and a final; you can get As but you have to work HARD.

Dr. Barstow is retired and only teaches one class per semester. The only grades are three multiple choice tests and a final, but there are bonus points for attendance. tests were tricky. Lectures were boring.

Dr. Barstow is an amazing professor, and he is definitely passionate about biology. He gives extra credit for attendance, so GO TO CLASS! He is super nice and he has a great sense of humor. Be sure to read the textbook; it will help. His study guides are based on the notes, so take good notes in class. Try to also sit towards the front of the room.

He is a sweet man, but the lectures can be a little boring. He shows youtube videos halfway through every class to help you stay awake. He gives extra points for attending class so do it! Reading the chapters and doing the study guides helped me make an A in this class so I recommend doing that.
If you are willing to pull 4 all nighters before the exam, take it. If not, DONT. He is not clear and skips all his lecture notes.

Please save yourself and your GPA and do not take with Barstow. He's a cute old man but you can't hear him at all and the tests were hard for me. He gives study questions after every lecture and if you don't do those, its hard to pass the test. Attendance points saved my grade, so if you take this class- GO TO CLASS!

Dr. Barstow is a sweet older man.  As a person, I really enjoyed him.  As a teacher, however, my beliefs changed day by day.  He shows fun videos to get your attention, but then has boring lectures.  Study old tests for your final.  I am not very good at science, but I got by.

Dr. Barstow is wonderful. He is super nice and really wants you to do well in the class. He gives you extra credit for coming to class and always curves tests based on questions that the majority of the class missed. He has help sessions the day before every tests and give study questions after each lecture that test material is directly from.
He gives a lot of extra credit for attendance and he gives study guides! They help

He's a super nice guy is definitely passionate about this subject. I just couldn't grasp this course and it affected my test grades severely. I found it pretty difficult, yet I know others did well. I didn't put as much time into studying as he recommends, but I did do some.  He takes 'random' attendance, which is every other class for bonus points

Dr. Barstow is really interested in what he teaches. The class isn't always that interesting, and tests can be difficult, but by reading the book and going to class, everyone should be able to do well. Attendance gives you extra points, and the final can replace your class grade (up to 1 letter grade)if you don't miss more than 2 attendance checks!

The class was not easy considering it was for non-science majors. However, Barstow knows a lot about biology and puts a lot of effort in the class. Tests are difficult but not impossible. Go to class! You get extra credit and can bring up your grade with the final as long as you don't miss more than two classes.

He knows a lot about bio. He tries very hard to keep students' attention, but sometimes it is still very boring. The tests are extremely hard if you don't pay attention or study. Read the textbook thoroughly! Attendance is counted on random. If you don't miss class more than 2 times, you can replace your semester grade with your final grade.

Tests are INCREDIBLY hard (especially for an intro class). He focuses a lot on chemistry, and he really doesn't explain things very well. He wants you to be able to apply material - which is fine - but the way he does it is often really confusing and you get punished for what you don't know more than rewarded for what you know.

DON'T TAKE BARSTOW. A lot of his exam questions are really pointless (trivia like where Darwin was buried, calories in a Big Mac meal). You'll end up learning huge chunks of material actually relevant to biology that won't be on the test. He can also be patronizing and rude. He's really particular & scrunches everyone up together during exams.

Great bio professor who really knows his stuff. We got a total of 20 points extra credit in random attendANCE checks over the semester . class wasnt easy but having a teacher who is organized and experienced in teaching the course makes it much easier. He gives out study questions for each lecture which test questions come straight from.

Dr. Barstow is a really sweet professor. It is very easy to get an A if you take the class seriously. I went to his office hours once and he was very helpful. His classes consist of power points, all of which he post online. He gives extra credit and if your final exam grade is higher than your overall average he will increase your average.
My first language is not English, and I am not a science major student. However, I love this class. It is hard for me to remember the words, but I am still doing good. If I can make it, you can.
he takes random attendance checks which gives you 2 points bonus on your test. 1 test I had a 78 on, but got an 84 because I got 4 attendance checks. So go to class

His lectures are very hard to follow.I didnt really pay attention to them, just read my book and used the study questions he provides and I ended up with a b+/a- (depending how I do on my final).He guarantees his questions on the test will only be from the study questions. So studying those is the best way to do well on the test

Dr. Barstow loves Biology! He tries really hard to make his class interesting and has youtube breaks. He really cares about his students and wants everyone to make the best grade possible. He gives extra points on tests for attendance, and he puts his power points online. I'm not a science person and I still did fine in this class.

He is really nice and really helpful. He tries to make the class more entertaining by showing short youtube videos. The tests are challenging but he has study questions to help you out. AND ATTEND CLASS. HE GIVES EXTRA CREDIT PTS FOR ATTENDANCE. (2 points for each attendance quiz). Not easy and not too hard.

He's a great teacher that really cares about the subject! However, if you're not a bio major, this will be a boring class. He has youtube breaks for long classes. The tests are hard but the study questions really help! Read the chapters (or at least skim them) before every lecture. It really helps you understand. Also has attendance quizzes.

This class required a little more work than I initially expected. The tests are almost straight from the book and study questions. We had three teacher this semester, which caused an inconsistency of test types. Dr. Farmer's were more critical thinking while Barstow's were more vocab based. Overall it's not too hard of a course though.

Dr. Barstowe is a good teacher but the class is terrible. For a while we had three different teachers, all of whose material were on tests. Tests are inconsistent, though there is a bunch of extra credit. Overall, if you have to take bio, Barstowe's your best bet but be careful!
nice.

Super nice! Tries his hardest to get the class excited about the subject (but sometimes fails at it). He puts youtube breaks in all lectures and is very straightforward about the tests and quizzes. Seems to care about his students.

Dr. Barstow is a great teacher and a really nice guy.  He is the easiest of the 1103 professors, but is very monotoned.  I never used the book and still made really good grades.  The quizzes are easy and usually over the lecture you had the day before.  Tests aren't difficult, and you should definitely never miss class.

Dr. Barstow is a precious old man. We had pop quizzes which helped my grade. I went to his office 4 times and he remembered me after the 1st visit. Introduce urself, chat with him, I seriously think he pulled some strings to give me a B. If ur final is higher than the grade u go into the final with, he gives u what u got on the final as ur grade.

He's nice... but sometimes hard to follow, goes off tangent with stories. Some information on the tests are only from lecture, not from the book. Attendance will help your grade some, but only because of the random attendance checks (which you receive points for). His powerpoints are old and could use some updating.

He is NOT a hard teacher. Maybe, if you struggle with sciences. He has quizzes that are usually announced that are important and usually over the previous lecture. His tests are very basic knowledge questions. Sit in the front, ask questions, and let him know who you are. Also, if your final is higher than your average, it becomes your average.

He teaches 2nd part of BIOL 1107 (if you had DeVartanian for the first part) and I have to admit I liked Barstow better. The difficulty of his tests seemed pretty much same as DeVartanian, but his review session isn't too helpful. If you work for it, you'll get A. If you ask him anything about Meiosis or Darwin, he might love you. Forever. :) Haha!
Easiest of all the bio 1003 professors, no group work, but there are pop quizzes and you don't need a clicker.

Class was very interesting. There were easy quizzes and test were not that bad if you read the book. There are about 10 Random Attendance Points and definitely come to class because he may say something important thats not in the book for the test.

He was a VERY difficult teacher and hard to understand at times because he gets off topic. BUT you learn a lot in his class!!!! This class truly taught me how to study! GO TO CLASS!!! sit in the front!!! and let him know who you are! that helps so much! the quizzes are more important than you think! Take him if you want to learn about biology!
Sit close to him, and don't miss class.

I'm not into Bio so this class was a given struggle. Easy quizzes, easy random attendances: so go to class. Tests were difficult and pay attention to the wording on test questions! Study questions did not help, but reading the book and youtube did!

I thought I was going to hate this class, but even though Barstow is old he is a decent lecturer and makes things easy. He puts all the lectures on ELC and gives study questions for the weekly quizzes. Read through the textbook and look over your notes and this class should be pretty easy. He also gives a few extra credit points for attendance.

Great professor with a true passion, understanding, and love for the subject. Nice humor. Offers lecture slides on ELC as well as lecture study guide questions that are extremely helpful for his tests. Gives quizzes on each chapter. You can easily make an A in the class if you try. Just keep up with your lecture questions and don't slack off!

Great guy with a good sense of humor. The material can be boring so he tries to make it interesting. The tests are difficult but if you do the study questions you should be fine. Also, attendance isn't mandatory but I'd suggest going-he gives bonus points and he will help your grade at the end of semester. Definitely recommend him!

Wonderful! Great guy and sense of humor. The class was tough for me. STUDY and READ the book. Powerpoints didn't help me much. Attendance isnt mandatory but he randomly gives attendance points so go every time! If you just keep up and study a little everyday, and A is possible. Take Barstow if at all possible.

I liked him a lot. He makes the class interesting and has a good sense of humor. I don't like his tests, watch out for the wording. Biggest thing that helped me was doing his study questions and doing the questions at the end of the chapters in the book. I'd use the online book resources too. He gets lots of his tests questions directly from there.

Barstow was a pretty fair guy. Class was usually boring and hard to understand, but once I reviewed I kind of got it. The textbook was helpful, but I barely ever read and still made a B+ in the class. Make sure you keep all your tests because he uses them for the final!

Nice old guy, average teacher. The class (by non-science-major standards) was not hard, but required a bit of effort. I came to class and studied the day before each test and made an A. Each test had a few weird or obscure questions, but you make up for those by getting points for coming to class.

He is a very kind and lovable man with a great sense of humor, but be prepared to buckle down in his class.  You need to know material forward and backward to do well on his tests and READ (preview text before class).  Class attendance is a good idea because he occasionally, along with helping your grade, gives little bonuses to people who attend.
Dr. Barstow is great. He's smart, knowledgeable, nice, loves teaching, funny, and really cares about students. If you put some effort into this class you will do well. I enjoyed this class.

I'm not a biology person, but I put in a lot of effort for this class and only made a B-. He's a nice guy and at least tries to make class interesting (usually fails). The tests are tricky, you need to carefully read the book and know his power points. The random attendance was nice.

Run away while you have the chance! Biology isn't my best subject, but I had a very hard time with this class. It's not all bad though. Dr. Barstow takes random attendance for extra credit, so show up to class. Also, his final had a lot of questions from previous tests.

Dr. Barstow's was pretty fair. If you read the chapters and do the study questiosn you should be fine. Class is not always mandatory, but the random attendance quizzes do help and are ussually given after each test. He is a precious old man and keeps the class laughing. This class is worth taking and an A or B can easily be made.

This was an awesome class. It was really interesting. Barstow made biology for non-science majors very easy and straightforward. His tests were a little confusing sometimes but as long as you read the textbook, you are guaranteed an A+ (like me). Go to class because there are random attendance quizzes that give you extra points on tests.

I liked Barstow a lot!! He's the sweetest old guy and if you read the book and pay attention to his lectures you should do fine. Sometimes his lectures don't come from the book and are on the tests so be sure to take notes!
All of his tests come directly from the textbook. The only reason to attend class is random attendance is taken which gives you a few extra credit points on the tests. His power points are useless.

This class can be extremely boring to the non-Bio person. However, Barstow does make some things interesting by trying to relate things to life. Tests are pretty difficult, and sometimes questions are unclear. He also sometimes takes attendance for points even though its a 300 person class. He's funny, and he does seem to try to help the students.

Be prepared to bring coffee or a coke. Lectures will put you to sleep! This class was boring, but at least he knew that because he occassionally shows u-tube videos to wake everyone up. Tough class. Tests ask obscure and random questions and answer choices are tricky and often confusing. He does give random quizzes, so go to class!

He is the most boring teacher ever. His lectures are completely useless if you actually want to know anything because he only covers the simplest topics. He makes stupid rude comments and thinks he's funny. He also gives random attendance quizzes when it rains. Don't worry, the class is easy but a complete drag.

This class was great! As long as you go to class and stay awake, then you will do fine on the tests. A lot of the answers from the tests he will say in class. The final has tons of questions from previous tests so just study them! A valence electron is not what you think it is, ask him. He plays youtube videos that are fun & gives ec for attendance
Great class, even with the 300 students in the auditorium.

This class took WAY too much time and effort.  Even after doing all the readings, study guides, and coming to most of the classes, I still only scarped by with a C+!  His tests are ridiculous and ask questions that are too obscure and not covered in lecture.  Also, as a warning to others, he is a huge fan of Darwin and a big advocate of Darwinism!

I learned a lot in this class but not because of Barstow. I didn't go to class except for on quiz days and got an A in the class. The quizzes are only five questions so it's easy to get 60's and 40's. But you can redeem yourself on the tests.

I have had Barstow and Brickman and Barstow is ALOT better. This class can be challenging but that is just the nature of the class. If you talk to him one on one he is really helpful. There are a ton of quizzes so attendance is mandatory but you should go to this class anyway because trying to learn the material from the book will not be enough.

Out of all of my classes, this is the one that required the most of my time. Attending every class, completing all of the reading, and completing the study questions helped me. His tests are very tricky and difficult. I made an A but after a lot of work. Also, I was very bothered by the evolution sections. He is a huge Darwin fan.

He is a great teacher and describes things thoroughly. He gives study questions for each lecture and has quizzes, which are easy if u know the study questions. Read the chapters/know study questions before tests and you will be fine. Take good notes and go to class for occassional extra credit.

He is a great teacher and describes things thoroughly. He gives study questions for each lecture and has quizzes, which are easy if u know the study questions. Read the chapters/know study questions before tests and you will be fine. Take good notes and go to class for occasional extra credit.

Take this class! He is a great teacher and describes things thoroughly. He gives study questions for each lecture and has quizzes, which are easy if u know the study questions. Read the chapters/know study questions before tests and you will be fine. Take good notes and go to class for occasional extra credit.

Go to class, do the reading, and the study guides and your're guaranteed to get at least a B. His lecture can drag a bit sometimes, but is for the most part helpful and needed for the test. He really cares about his students and will help you out if you make an appointment with him. Nice guy, too... reminds me of my grandpa.

Barstow's class is difficult. The study guides for the test are pretty good for studying for the test, but it is essential that you study them a lot. The quizzes are easy, and there are random attendance quizzes for extra points. The final is very difficult, but if you make higher on it than your class average, he bumps your grade up to the final.
Dr. Barstow was a pretty good teacher. read the chapters in the textbook before every test and you'll be fine.
Tests are difficult. Studying is needed. Especially if you're not a science person.
He really does explain thing well. The tests are pretty tough and they always throw tricky questions at you. The final is very similar to the tests so make sure and review those before the final.

This class was definitely a lot easier than I was expecting. Barstow is not the greatest professor since he talks about things that are irrelevant a good bit of the time. As long as you read the book, the tests are not bad. His tests are more difficult than DerVartanian's though.

Lecture attendane and study time do not necessarily reflect the grades you get in class. His test questions are really obscure and tricky though they SEEM easy at first glance. went to every class, jotted down notes for word for word but still ended up with C or D on tests.but got As and Bs on Dervatanian's class segment.(they split semester)

Fun class! He shows YouTube videos halfway thru class to wake everyone up.  Gave lots of quizzes to make people come to class, but they're easy (5, with 1 or 2 bonus, questions). The night before tests I'd recommend doing the study guide, rereading the chapters, and DEFINITELY get a copy of old tests because there are a LOT of the same questions.
Going to class is not necessary. The test questions are hard but if you have old tests then the class is very easy.

I loved bio in high school so I decided to take it in college to meet my science req.. yeah this class was pretty hard, the tests were basically impossible, the test questions are really obscure and I don't think my scores reflected the understanding of the material.  I knew most of the material pretty well and I still only got a  C+.   boring too

I loved bio in high school so I decided to take it in college to meet my science req.. yeah this class was pretty hard, the tests were basically impossible, the test questions are really obscure and I don't think my scores reflected the understanding of the material.  I knew most of the material pretty well and I still only got a  C+.   boring too

I loved bio in high school so I decided to take it in college to meet my science req.. yeah this class was pretty hard, the tests were basically impossible, the test questions are really obscure and I don't think my scores reflected the understanding of the material.  I knew most of the material pretty well and I still only got a  C+.   boring too
Very good teacher. Cute old man-- keeps your attention. Shows "YouTubes" during class. Great!
He's a great teacher. Though his notes were thorough, it is necessary to read the book.

Dr.Barstow was nice enough but there were several days when he put me to sleep. I thought some of his tests were off from the notes. It's important to attend lecture otherwise you'll probably be lost on the exams. Not a bad professor but you need to know your stuff come exam day.
Class is hard if you have a hard time studying and remembering. Tests and quizzes were similar to back of the book test questions. He is very nice and the study sessions were somewhat helpful
The class is very easy; look at the sample MC questions in the book. Read the book; it should help. If you go to class and read the book and you get less than a B+, you're probably retarded.

I would definately recommend Barstow among the Biology professors at UGA.  You will definately get the grade you deserve if you work for it.  Get copies of his old tests.  It really helps for studying.  Also, look at the end of the chapter questions, becuase the exact same questions or reworded versions show up on tests and quizzes often!

The class was pretty good because the lecture notes were not long at all. However, much of his test questions came from the book and that did not help much because sometimes the textbook was different then what he would teach. He also got confused a few times.

go to the study sessions. they'll help you do well on the test. lots of quizzes but they are all announced. class is hard. you have to study. make sure you study the questions at the end of each chapter. beware he loves darwin.
always willing to help. test can be tricky. just study and you will be fine

Dr. Barstow is one of the best teachers I've ever had! The class wasn't hard, but you have to study (what you do expect...it's a science class). He is very approachable, and does his best to explain the material to students in a way that they can understand. I highly reccomend him!
Pretty boring class. the lecture is pointless. the tests are hard if u dont have the old tests from last year to study from. Barstow is a good man but he cannt connect to students really well.
He has slow moments sometimes, but most of the time he knows what he's talking about. Test questions tend to be the same each year and about 5 come from the self quizzes in the book.

Lectures are virtually useless and pretty boring, but the quizzes make grades easier.  I didn't find the tests that hard as long as you use the book more than the lectures.  The powerpoints online make the class a lot easier, too.  Barstow definitely didn't relate well to the students, but he had his funny/interesting moments.

One of the most inspiring teachers on campus.  He is a really nice man that is willing to help at any time.  His lectures are interesting and he really does care if his students understand the material.
Nice man who will help you if you need it. Showing up to class is definetly a plus...you'll do better on tests plus get some bonus points.

Dr. Barstow is very straight forward and clearly states what he expects from his students. If you go to class everyday the quizzes will be a good grade booster and, by going to the off quiz days, he usually gives out extra credit quizzes so you get credit for just showing up. The tests are fair and most questions are taken from the back of the book

Dr. Barstow while a nice old man should think of retiring soon...he can't relate well to us as college students.  His lectures are pretty mundane and straight powerpoints. And then the tests are ridiculously hard compared to the information he covered in class! I actually learned more from the book and studying than i did from attending class.

Tests are rather difficult but the class itself doesn't require too much effort. He's a nice person but he gets really mad if you don't show undenying passion for biology, evolution, and Darwin. His obsession with Darwin is really weird.

Barstow is genuinely interested in students doing well in his class, so if you put in the effort, he will be glad to help you out if you have problems. It is possible to do OK in the class by not going much, but you will get a much better grade if you are in class!  Barstow explains things well and uses a clear system of powerpoint and note-taking.
Tests are hard, but he makes biology really interesting, as long as you can handle sex jokes and have practice tests to study from, you're fine
BEST PROF EVER!!! changed my life and my view on biology.  Dr. Barstom is a true genius of our times
His voice puts you to sleep but all in all a pretty good teacher. Study the practice tests.
Dr. Barstow was the best teacher ever!!! But he is hardcore about evolution...kinda sad.

This class was split by Barstow and Crim. Barstow's tests are not easy, but if you study his practice tests and listen in class, you'll do fine. Crim is dry but entertaining, especially when he refers to his own experience with a colonoscopy at his annual physical...
Incredible professor. Science can be tough, but this is an *extremely* well qualified guy teaching freshmen level classes -- wow!  He even pays a student to type & post the class notes!

Barstow is a MUCH better teacher than Dr. D. I got an A on every test with Dr. Barstow and an A and B on Dr. D's tests. Barstow explains the material, Dr. D just showed pictures (the same ones everyday).
He is an okay person but test are hard as *#@% and Dr. D is way better he should just teach hte entire semster
This class was split between Barstow and Dervartanian. In comparison, Barstow isn't as interesting or as easy. Go with Dr. D.

Mrs. Foster is one of the best professors I've had at UGA and the best professor I've had in the education department by far. She is nice and funny and is willing to answer questions. Because she is currently teaching in the school system, she has a lot of useful tips and knowledge. Her tests are very fair and you can easily make an A if you study.
Easy Class. I didnt study at all. Made a B-, but i really didnt study, at all. She hates IEP'S...
Very nice, assigned manageable work and let class out early most days

She is an incredible teacher & loves what she's doing! Because she is a special education teacher she can give a lot of insight as to what it is like to work with children with special needs. She is extremely willing to answer and questions or help you out, and she is genuinely a down to earth and kind hearted person. I would highly recommend her!

Mrs. Foster is a great teacher!  She is very sarcastic and makes a 3 hour class bearable.  You definitely need to come to class because her tests are over her lectures, but getting the Bel-Jean packet helps a lot! Great teacher, truly loves what she's teaching.

This class is really easy.  You have to go to class, but she usually let us out a good hour early.  Lectures were sometimes a little boring, but this class felt shorter than my intro EFND class that was less than half the time.  She feeds you the exact notes, then give you the exact questions on the tests to study with.  You can make an A easily.
Very good professor. She knows her stuff. Painless 3 hour class. Enjoyed it very much!

Painless for what was supposed to be a 3 hour evening class. She gives you the information you need and reviews for each test. If you go to class and actively listen, you'll know exactly how to be prepared for the tests. She does sometimes getr off track, but she really is interesting and I like the fact that she actually is a special ed teacher!

I really enjoy Ms. Foster's class. She's a pretty entertaining teacher and even though her lectures were boring at times, she always let us out of class early. I thought I would hate a late Tuesday night class but it wasn't terrible.  Tests were harder than I expected them to be though, so make sure you study a good amount.
Great teacher.  Cuts class short, helps you with anything that you need.  One of the easier A's that I have gotten at UGA.

Fairly easy class if you read and stay for the study guide after lecture.  She is very knowledgable about the material.  Class gets boring after a while and she talks and talks and talks...gets very annoying!  Overall, good teacher and recommend her if you need the class!
Mrs. Foster was a very fair teacher. She's very straight-forward. If you attend the lectures and do the readings, you will get an A.

very nice and understanding...she made the class more painless than it should have been.  lets you go early...explains exam material thoroughly...powerpoints are boring though.  just get a friends notes from previous semester and it will save you a lot of in class note taking

She's cool.  It sometimes seems like she's always having a bad Tuesday (I only had the class once a week) but she would always cut class short.  The lectures are all powerpoints and kinda boring but it's not hard information AT ALL.  She takes attendance every week but it's for extra credit only, so it won't count against you if you don't come.  She tells you pretty much everything that's on the test the class before the test.  You'll take a lot of pointless notes but the class is easy.

She was super nice...cut classes short, went easy on tests, etc.  The class itself is long and boring, but she makes it 10 times better than it could be.  I started off in a different class that had an insane amount of work, and promptly switched to Foster's class after somebody recommended it to me. If you have to take the class, take it with her.

This class is easy as long as you attend lectures and study for tests.  She gives you exactly what you need to know for the tests and as long as you know that you're good.  The lectures are long and boring and on a powerpoint.  She is knowledgeable and readily answers questions though.

She uses class time to vent about the negative aspects of teaching to a captive audience. Not too hard, but definitly requires more studying than I would have expected for this class.  Offers up to 10 pts. extra credit (added to lowest test grade)for attendance.
She was nice, but all the whole class was powerpoint lectures and it was pretty boring.  She is helpful with letting you know what the tests will cover and giving study guides.
The class was easy.  She usually cuts it a little bit short, but she whines and complains a lot about teaching which can get extremely annoying.
Wonderful professor. Incredibly bright man and intriguing reading and writing assignments.
Brilliant. Requires lots of reading and brings it into discussions heavily. Be Prepared. His knowledge is deep and wide.
Dy Dyer is awesome!  He knows his material, is very interesting and is very helpful.  He is the best!

Take whatever this man teaches.  his classes are challenging, but incredably interesting.  he's always interested in talking outside of class (very approachable and a GENIOUS, so that helps).  also, he's a reasonable grader.  Discussions great-but READ

He doesn't like women and would often mention that during classes and also a few racial slurs. He was very cocky and inconsiderate and I read the book before all tests and made low Bs or high Cs. A bit portion of his tests were historical knowledge and dates which he never mentioned were important to know. He also lost my paper &gave me a 0 for it.

Professor Dowd is a nice guy, but his lectures are just painfully boring.  His tests are absolutely ridiculous- basically no matter how much you study he will ask the tiniest little details that you don't know, its almost impossible to get a good grade.  The final we had was also 102 questions long!!! Also attendance is mandatory...

Just do the readings assigned and you'll pass the quizzes. I sometimes didn't read the assigned and failed the quizzes with a 50. but he drops some quiz grades so yea..  Although lectures are long, they're relevant to today's time. It's somewhat interesting I guess. He wants to help you get a decent grade. He's average :)

I really think the reviews on Dowd are wrong.  He has an incredible ability to break the most complex topics down to easy an to understand material. In regards to the test, the questions are easy to predict. If he talks about a statistic for 30 min, expect to see it on the test. That is common sense. These other people just didn't listen...

Takes attendance, quizzes over the reading every week (I had TR classes, so every tuesday), watch several movies that are asked about on the midtermfinal. Really boring but really easy if you do the reading. Notes always posted on eLC so you don't have to pay attention in class. SOOOOOO BORING.

Sociology major. Made better in Theories and Research methods than Film. Class is awkwardly organized by topics. Gets mad when you bring in other aspect of sociology. Films are outdated, irrelevant and agonizing to watch.

There are a required four critiques out of six. Unclear about what he wants included in the critiques. Feedback was unhelpful. He is not open to other interpretations of films. There are a max of five critiques, but I did six and he refused to give me one point that would allow me to more from a C to C+. He accused me asking for special treatment.

Sociology of War/Military is itself an incredibly interesting class. However, you should know as a prior service officer in the US Army that Dowd is very passionate about this subject. He is incredibly knowledgable and expects a lot. Incredibly qualitative course (tons of writing/reading). There are weekly debates and the reading is crucial.

Decent professor. TAKE LECTURE NOTES: the class can sometimes become a bit boring (I began to nod off occasionally near the end of the year), but it was an alright class. Tests weren't too bad (100, 88, 92): review your lecture notes + his slides, and read the textbook chps. Hint: the main library has a copy of the text!

Extremely rude and ignorant. Talks about his opinions and expects everyone to agree. Hard core massogynist. Repeatedly told me he did not receive my paper when i emailed it to him 4 separate times and visited his office about it. Still got a 0 for the paper that i turned in. Do not take this professor.

Terrible professor. Didn't explain anything well and took so long to explain one simple topic. Tests were extremely hard and picked the most minuscule details he could find. Didn't really know where any of the questions came from on the tests. 2 tests (60 questions) and a final (100 questions). 3 "short papers" for participation (out of 3 points)

Awful class! He is very biased to his opinion when grading the film critiques. He was very vague in the directions for what he's looking for but then grades harshly. Did not say what he was looking for until the class after the paper was due (which is obviously too late). I tried to get help and he was no help at all! DO NOT take this class!!
nice, friendly

Do not take this professor. You can memorize every single lecture slide and still do poorly in the class. Attendance is mandatory and he is the most boring professor I have ever had. He goes off on tangents and expects you to remember everything he says. Test questions come out of absolutely no where. If this is an elective for you, skip it.
A very good and fair professor..if you want to learn and be around an intelligent person this is the class for you. However you need to do your work...
This class is easy if u completely agree with everything he says in your essays. If you disagree with him you will get a C. Just dont have an opinion and agree with him and you will do fine.

I took him for Sociology in Film and he was great! His lectures were interesting, the papers were graded fairly, and the final exam (our only test) wasn't nitpicky at all! He asked very broad, open-ended essay and short answer questions. Overall, a fun and easy class.

Do not take this professor. I had him 3 years ago and his tests were ridculous. He asks nit picky questions instead of doing general ideas. Recently, I emailed him in what I thought was a very polite and unassuming email and what I got in response was very rude and unprofessional.

Tests are ridiculous and cover statistics he puts up in class, instead of general concepts. Must go to class and take notes on everything he says. He is a hard grader on 'extra credit'. I wouldn't recommend taking this class at all. One of those classes where you should get an A but end up with a B-.
Good Class, but tests are tricky. They are mostly statistics from his lectures and can be extremely picky, not the general concepts.

Nice guy. Awkwardly funny but funny. He likes what he is teaching you can tell. I don't think he was the greatest teacher ever, but not the worst. But you HAVE TO READ. He won't leave a great impact but he'll make you like the class enough to attend. Interesting stats too.

Like someone else said, while both studying the tests and after taking them, I felt like I did well, but I'd get my grade back and it would be a C or a D. Class is usually interesting, but his tests are just picky. Dowd is a very nice man, and I thought this class would be amazing, but it was difficult to do well in his class.

SOCI 1101 is a class that I thought would be easy and it's not that bad.  Dowd is a great teacher but the test are pretty difficult I always come out of them thinking I did great to be rudely distraught when I get my grade back.  Good class overall and great teacher

As others have said, you'd think SOCI1101 wouldn't be too hard. It's interesting, the professors interesting, and a lot of it seems to be common sense. I liked Dowd as a teacher a lot, but his, tests, wow. They are incredibly hard; he picks obscure, seemingly unimportant topics and tests you on them. Nice guy, but make no mistake, hard tests!

Attendance is not mandatory. It does count as extra credit. He offers other extra. credit too! As long as you go to class, you will do fine! He is precious!! I loved his class so much! Take this teacher...it is worth it.

SOCI1101 is a deceptively difficult class... the tests are much harder than I expected.  Dowd takes obscure people, dates, and figures and puts them into the test questions.  However, he offers 5 extra credit points to your final grade just for coming to class! The Social Things textbook was definately not my favorite, but we used it sparingly.

If you don?t mind working for an A you can learn a great deal from this wise man. Many professors are unclear about expectation and deadlines; you'll get none of that here.  The tests require thought, but are set up to allow the student to choose topics they are most familiar with.  I love Sociology and no one knows it like Dr Dowd. Much respect!

He REALLY knows his stuff. Pay close attention to his examples and go to class because he gives extra points. Do well on the tests (there's only 2)! Read the book and take good notes. He's a really good guy.

Very knowledgeable,  but tends to harp on one issue or example for a really long time. I might be biased because I think sociology is basically saying really simple things in a really complicated way, but I think this class is basically a waste of my time. It's incredibly easy and pretty pointless. The only reason I come is because he gives extra c

I find it hard to believe some of the things said about Dr. Dowd.  This is the second time I've had him and feel that he is one of the most well informed teachers at UGA.  Perhaps instead of dismissing his "idealogies" as the norm, one should listen more closely to what he's saying.  Again, he has a PhD & you don't.  He's a great guy.
Dowd is brilliant; I loved his class.

Great class and he knows his stuff; but, if you disagree with him, you'll get a lower grade. Hint* Repeat everything he says and agree with him and don't use your HEAD. It took me a while to figure that out; I would've gotten an "A" rather than a "B+"
GREAT AND SUPER KNOWLEDGEABLE ON EVERY TOPIC IMAGINABLE.
If you study the notes and do the readings, you'll do fine. Do pay attention in lecture. A lot of the test is based off of the notes.

Class is almost pointless. He basically reads off powerpoints that he puts up on WebCT anyway. Tests did not seem hard as you're taking them but then you never make the grade you think you should. making good grades involved LOTS of studying and all nighters at snelling the night before the test...good luck!
Very poor teacher, gets off subject.

A lot of people struggled with his tests, but I didn't find them that hard. If you know how to take notes and study well, you'll do fine. He knows what he's talking about and keeps the class pretty interesting. I would recommend this class if you don't mind working hard.

I thought I would like sociology but he made it inredibly boring. He rambled the entire class, making hard to take notes. He would pound one topic into the ground and it wouldn't be on the test. He asked very specific questions for an introductory class. His TA's are awful. They don't know anything about sociology. Test were very hard.

Professor Dowd is a very nice guy, but his test are completely application. If you can't seriously take what you know and apply it to something else, then i would not advise taking this class because you will fail

People complained about the tests, but I did not find them hard.  You have to attend class in order to do well and he has pop quizzes over the reading.  However, this is college and to do well in any class you have to attend and read.  I hate sociology and I enjoyed this class.

All I ever did was study the notes I took in class and read the assigned chapters, (which are actually very interesting if you like sociology) and I did extremely well in this class. In my personal opinion, the people who complain don't take good enough notes. If you trust your note taking skills, this class is far from difficult.

SOOOOO boring. i cant emphasize that ENOUGH. take another teacher if possible. also if ur stuck with a bad TA good luck. it wasnt THAT hard as it was BORING. just avoid it, ppl were falling asleep all around me ALL the time in class including me.

terrible class, he assigns about 40-60 pages of reading a night. the tests cover 300-600 pages of material and he asks very specific and unreasonable questions. he has students teach the material so you don't really know what is important and going to be on the test!! the class was boring and hard

He is a wonderful man! Even though he can seem boring it is very obvious that he cares a lot about the subject and the students. If you really just work reasonabley hard you will do well. Its interesting stuff anyways and he is always willing to help!

This is the worst class ever. I hated it so much you never know what to study and he just rambles during class. When signing up for this class don't take DOWD, don't even take the chance that you will get his wife....it is not worth it.
He rambles about nothingness the entire time he lectures, rarely any of it is actually important to the test.
Talks a lot to attempt to explain subjects in different ways. Pretty easy class, if you are willing to put the work in... pretty interesting too.

He is adorable, intelligent, and helpful.  His tests are considered a little tough, but I thought they were easy.  If you are a good note taker and willing to go to class every day(b/c there are pop quizzes) you will be fine.
Tough grader; he'll take off points if he doesn't agree with your opinion (bad trait in a sociologist), but very smart. He's willing to help you if you ask and he's very passionate about his work.
Dr.Dowds test for this class are now take home. How easy is that? they are essay form and over the readings. I think he is one of the most pleasant, cheerful teachers I have ever had.

Used examples from case studies incorrectly - like, gave the complete wrong findings as truth to the class and we were tested on those, if you've done any past research in psyc or socio, I wouldn't take this guy

Tests were unreal. Hardly relevant to what was taught. He's a nice guy, very insightful and extremely intelligent... but it is very difficult to pass the class due to little details that were expected to be known for the exams.
Dr. Dowd can get a bad wrap, but he is an extremely thoughtful and intelligent professor.

Very very hard grading, but do-able as long as you don't mind writing. The twist is you have to share his extreme ideology. He thinks anything other than his opinions are bias, but his own feelings are just the norm.

Oh wow...he is soooo.  The book has nothing to do with the tests, maybe 2 or 3 questions come from it.  I always did better when I didn't even STUDY the book.  Lecture classes are BORING and I usually ended up falling asleep no matter how hard I tried to stay awake.  He IS very nice but made the subject very dull.
HE IS TERRIBLE

His test were very hard because of several things. First, you couldnt stay awake/focused during his lectures because he didnt hardly talk about anything relevant to the textbook or sociology and it made it very easy to zone out. He is also very dry in his lectures so you have to strugggle to find something important becauase it will be mixed among
The tests in this class are insanely hard. If Dr. Dowd were not such a nice man, I would have been very upset about his performance as a teacher.
Dr. Dowd is a nice guy, but sometimes it is unclear what he is talking about!

I got a C in a class that should've been at least a B. His tests were arbitrary and full of the dumbest, most pointless questions. Lecture was unbelievably boring and irrelevant...I wish I'd never taken this class because it needlessly brought my GPA down even though I worked hard.

He is a very smart and enthusiastic teacher. He talks a lot about irrelevent topics, though, and sometimes his lectures are pointless. The tests are based mainly on examples where you apply a theory, instead of definitions and stuff. When he does talk about sociology it's very interesting.
I took an upper level soci class and although tough, Dowd really takes time to explain the subject matter and I recommend taking hime. Beware, his classes are usually pretty writing intensive
Dowd is a fantastic teacher. He is although almost to intelligent to make his point clear. It can be difficult in that matter.

His tests aren't bad, but be aware that the final is cumulative. I had an A up untill the final exam. Make sure to study and review throughout the semester or your grade might drop (it's easy to get terms/people confused).

He did not care about the students, and would not help out no matter what the questions was. Also, he promised a study guide before the cumulative final, and we did not receive it until 12 hours before the final (and it was LONG)!

I loved this course. Dr. Clark is very cool- she incorporates lots of interesting discussions into the course. Make sure you do the reading, you have written quizzes randomly and you need to speak in class discussions. Her tests were straight forward and papers were also. She is available and willing to help always!

Very straightforward class. She lectures every class meeting. There are papers, and a big final paper due at the ed of the course but she is willing to help with it. She was easy to understand and is a fair grader.

This was an incredible class. I wish every course were this structured. Dr. Clark's lectures were easy to understand and they would show up on the pop quizzes. You write two papers, a midterm, and a final. If you study the vocabulary and use the book for your papers, you'll be fine.

didn't read anything and passed 10/12 reading quizzes. need to get 3/5 answers correct to get 100 on reading quiz and she drops lowest 2 scores.  2 tests easy. 2 papers not too bad but graded very grammatically co be careful on that

Enjoyed the class but my TA was awful - very picky grader.....totally NOT a reflection of the work or effort I put into this class - he's crazy - admitted he doesn't give A's - why bother killing myself?

Really depends on the TA....some are not so bad, some easy & at least one grades like it's an honors english class....TA's do all the grading.  My friend wrote a much better paper than me - her TA gave her a B.  I got an  A & my paper wasn't so good ;)

This was an EXTREMELY easy class.  And it was kind of ridiculous because you have to come to class to take the surprise attendance quizzes.  And Professor Clark is SO boring.  Her lectures are given in a monotone with poorly put together power points.  If you want an easy A and want to be bored out of your mind, take this class!

You have to go to class because there are daily multiple choice quizes that are pretty easy and then the TA's take attendence. The lectures are extremly boring and are posted on Webct, you only have two papers, a mid term and a final. Just make sure you study for those and do well on your papers and thats all you have to do there is never homework

You'd like this class if you: 1) Are ok with a mandatory attendance policy. 2)Like reading your history book and writing harshly graded papers. 3) Like sitting through boring and dry lectures. 4) Can stand being watched like a hawk by the TA's to make sure you aren't on your computer. 5)Want to take copious and pointless notes.

VERY nice teacher BUT EXTREMELY boring but then again, I've never been interested in History. TAs do grade all ur stuff and its fair grading. She does hand out study guides for midterm and finals and two papers. get help from ur TAs!!!

I liked this class way more than I thought I'd like a history class! I thought Prof Clark made a boring subject interesting and she provided clear, concise answers. Grades definitely depend on you TA since they grade your papers and tests. Tests are long, but manageable since you you get a study guide. If you try you can get an A or B :)

The class is manageable. There's only five grades for the whole semester: Midterm, Final, 2 Papers, and Quiz Average. The lectures are extremely boring and pointless. Attendance is mandatory however. She uses vague, unhelpful Powerpoints. Taking notes are a waste b/c you don't need them. Use the books for the paper topics, which aren't bad.

i didn't like this class at all. attendance was mandatory in assigned seats, and she gave pop quizzes almost once a week. my ta graded all of my stuff really hard. the lectures are straight sleepers, and i hated going to class. i would only take this class if it's the only one available.

Attendance is mandatory. The lectures are pretty pointless. The slideshows are very vague and not helpful if you are going to study only from that. The only tests are midterm and final, which kinda sucks bc if you do bad on one then you're screwed. The books are interesting and you have to read them bc there's a quiz every week.

Lectures generally work like tranquilizers with the occasional sarcastic comment. Notes are laughably vague (WWII=two slides), leaving it up to you to write down her explanations. Attendance is required, punishable by grade deductions and her random pop quizzes. She is very helpful if you talk to her, though. Bearable if you can handle boredom.

well, dr. clark is a nice lady but she's just not a good teacher. If you like teachers who read from a podium and a power point then you should take this class. She uses a script every single day of class and it makes it very very boring. I ended trying not to fall alseep. The quizzes are easy. With a teacher who doesn't seem to know what she sayin

Lecture is boring, but you have to come to class for quizzes. The papers and exams are ridiculous. The TA's graded them so hard and there isn't a set grading scale, so I ended up with a B. Two 5-7 page papers are required and you have to cite sources using the books. OK class and teacher, I just didn't enjoy it as much as I thought I would.

Dr. Clark is a great History teacher. Give quizzes almost every class on the reading material for the day. These quizzes come from the book's webpage. Look at that before you go to class. She obviously knows this subject very well & loves it. If you study & put time into it, you'll get an A. I did. Tests are hard but manageable.

take this class w/ a friend so you can make fun of her voice together; share a book; play off each other's essay topics; and quiz each other on the study guides before the midterm and final.  on the midterm and final, the numbers are on your side. her lectures did not stand out from the book yet attendance was mandatory :/

As an all A student, this class was my only B(she must have curved the grades bc I thought I was going to get a C with my low grades).  You HAVE to do the online quizzes from the book's website and remember the answers for her quizzes.  Also, TRY TRY TRY to get help from the TA's on your papers and study guides, if you get help, then you're fine.

Professor Clark's lectures were pointless. They usually consisted of one-word bullet points that barely identified the subject much less discussing the "signficance" of it. Attendance and reading before close are both mandatory as she gives about ten pop quizzes during the course. I would recommend only taking her if someone else isn't available.

like any history class, you're probably going to have to work harder than you've ever worked before to get an A....how does clark compare to other history professors?  well i really cant answer that, but if i were to guess, she would probably be more on the easier side.   Just make sure your papers are checked by one of the TA's before you turn the

As a history major, this class was incredibly boring and a joke; however, I understand it's a survey class, so easiness is a must. Her tests are easy, with  a study guide and many bonus points, yet her voice makes up for it. I'm sorry to say, because I'm sure she's sweet, but her voice makes me feel like my bones are being scraped with a fork.

Professor Clark gave good lectures, although they tended to get boring after a while. Also, she does in class quizzes but the answers can be found by doing the online quizzes that go with the chapter to be covered in lecture that day. The TA's do all the grading, so you have to get a good one. Overall, the class was not difficult.

I really did not like her class. I like history very much, but her lectures were boring and never got to the main point. She requires so much of her students--constant pop quizzes, attendance, and rigorous notetaking. I would not recommend this class if you are not willing to put in a ton of effort!

Lots of reading! I took it one TR so there was no break-out but  we still have TAs. There are two papers that are had but the mid-term and final are easy. She tells you exactly what they cover. Lectures are interesting to me, but i like history. she covers more than the book so class is important.
Only two tests, two papers, and quizzes on readings... it wasn't bad at all. She is well organized, but sometimes kind of boring to listen to. Overall the class is pretty easy.

Shes EXTREMELY conservative and you can notice her bias in her lectures. You dont have to pay attention in class or even read the textbook to do well in this class. She gives out a study guide before the exams and as long as you know those specific terms you're fine. The papers have prompts that are broad enough to BS with general information.

Clark is a great professor. She really loves what she's teaching, and as long as you do what you're responsible for, you should make a good grade in the class. For our class we had two papers and two exams, plus reading quizzes. Not bad at all!

I found this course to be pretty difficult. It is a huge lecture class but there are assigned seats and she takes attendance EVERY SINGLE class with only 3 excused absences! For homework there is always a lot of reading. She gives pop quizzes ALL the time-sometimes 2 classes in a row. In all, there are 2 papers and 3 tests.

Well prepared, knows her stuff.  Can't BS your way through the class.  She cares enough about students to provide enough guidance on what is on the tests.  Willing to help out students.  Overall good professor.

Her class and lectures were very organized and interesting. She is one of the more approachable history profs. There are 3 tests, but she provides a list of terms and possible essay questions. I thought she was a great instructor; one of my favorites at UGA!

Good professor for a very broad and detailed subject. Lectures can be boring at times but are extremely helpful. Use lecture notes for making study guides given for midterm and final and you will be ok.  Important to attend class because some material on exams is not in the textbook.  Overall, good history class that was informative.

I thought it was an easy class but I rarely missed a day because I took like 5 pages of notes or more each class.  Pretty interesting, but she reads straight from her notes which can be extremely boring but hey anything is better than pre-civil war.

Not necessarily a bad teacher but not a good one. She reads straight from her notes all the time, so expect a monotonous class. As long as you read everything and make sure you write what she wants this class is somewhat reasonable.
What a great teacher, really interesting and new a lot about the subject.  Highly recommend you take her.
AWESOME.  Lots of reading, but if you just do what you need to do and discuss in class, and you'll make an easy A or B.

Whatever you do, read the syllabus, all the time. He will not answer a question if he tells you the answer in the syllabus. He is very passionate but he doesn't help you if you don't understand something, he tells you to read the chapter again. His class is passable but I would take someone else...

Dr. Stueck is extremely knowledgeable in American history. You will learn a lot if you read the book, study for the quizzes and listen in lecture. He is an extremely harsh grader, though. He purposely lowered my midterm grade a letter grade by taking off half points on questions. He also lacks clarity when it comes to what he wants on papers.

Dr. Stueck was extremely passionate and knowledgeable. Do the reading assignments and you are guaranteed to pass the quizzes and therefore the tests. Attendance is optional, but he does give 15 random quizzes throughout the semester that cannot be made up. Overall, extremely interesting class!

I had Dr. Stueck a couple of years ago and I just wanted to say that I really enjoyed his lectures and that made the class very fulfilling for me. It was not the easiest class, but I got a lot of interesting insight into US history. His tests are essays, but all you have to do is display that you can intelligently discuss the topics he covers.

Dr. Stueck is an absolutely brilliant man. I've never met a class I couldn't get an A in...until I met Dr. Stueck. He expects you to to take notes, read, and participate in class. If you do the readings, take notes, talk to the man, and go to the study sessions, you should do just fine. The TA's do grade hard, but that's because he tells them to.

Stueck is a very boring lecturer. He does not go over many facts of U.S. history but rather interpretations. The tests are ok but asks for too much information within a short amount of time. Also, his grading is very strict.  You have to read the book before class, so you can know what he's talking about. Overall, if possible avoid his class.
Avoid taking his class!!! The TAs grade very strictly. You have to do all the readings and take extremely good notes in class which may help you to get at least a B.

JUST DON'T! Dr. Stueck is unavailable and rude. I never got to speak to him the whole semester. My TA couldn't understand anything that I was asking him, so he was also not helpful. Grading is way too tough...I never got anything wrong, they always just said I should elaborate more. Overall, a very poor experience.

He is a very difficult professor, but if you do the readings and go to class most of the time you can get a B. I think that he is intimidating in lecture because he expects you to know the material perfectly and gets mad if you ask a question someone else asked. He offers to review with groups outside of class before the final.
DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS IF YOU CAN HELP IT!!

Terrible teacher, do not take this class! He barely talks about the facts of history, but rather what he believes is true. Quizzes almost daily. History is a good department at UGA but find a different professor.

AVOID taking his class.  He is extremely boring but even more RUDE. He takes no interest in his students.  His weekly pop quizes are based on the most obscure topics from the 60 page reading each night.  IM NOT EXAGERATING. Horrible.

Stueck is hard, and the tests are essays. He gives you the information you need though. Take notes on the songs, and read EVERYTHING. The TA's are willing to help. Go out of your way to write extremely lengthy essays on the major essay. Be thorough in your short essays (write atleast a paragraph) I got an A with a lot of hard work.

HORRIBLE. I made Dean's List last semester and had to DROP this class because it was impossible. Attendance is not mandatory, but he gives pop quizzes almost daily over the 60 pages of reading you are assigned nightly. The only grades are tests, which are composed of about 10 essay questions and an additional big essay. NOT RECOMMENDED!

This guy is TERRIBLE! He focuses on what he considers being the correct interpretation of history, shoves his political views down your throat and he is just an all around AWFUL teacher. I loved history until I had his class. He is EXTREMELY rude and boring. Avoid this class at ALL costs!

Completely agree with previous posts - Stueck makes no effort to make himself available to students, is rude and very boring, seems to base grades on class attendance (which is not mandatory and not even recorded), expects way too much from an intro course, focuses on irrelevant specific events and documents from the past. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS!

The class wasn't difficult, but you need to like history or have friends in the class, if you want to do good. Take notes in class along with buying the student notes from Baxter Street Bookstore. The tests aren't that bad. Make sure you at least scan over the readings, especially After the Fact and the book he co-authored.

Stueck teaches a vague, unnecessarily politically heavy history class that seems heavily influenced by his own political views, with no attendance policy, his attitude regarding student absences seems to strongly affect the way he grades work done.  He's boring, rude, and unwilling to make himself available to students. do NOT take his maymester

I took Professor Stueck's honors class, and it was tough. There was a lot of reading, which he grills you on during class. There are very few grades, so you have to do well on everything, Sometimes he's very unclear about what he's talking about and how it relates to the class topic. He is old, and can be grouchy when he isn't calling you a chisele

Great and interesting class for those who like history and foreign policy. Requires reading and paying attention. Class is usually interesting and he applies the material to prepare you for policy making and judging.

DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS! it was awful.  I'm a good student and this was just overwhelming.  There is way too much work for an introductory history course.  My grad student friend said it was on GRADUATE level work.  Too much work, too much reading, too difficult of tests, and too many unfair, negative political remarks.  DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS!!

This is a difficult class and probably not for people just "taking it for taking its sake". If you want to do well, do the reading and yes there is a lot of it. TA's are difficult graders but are very helpful and willing to help outside of class. He is very liberal. If you are a history major, this is a good class for you.
Great teacher! Very fair.
Not a fan, never stays on topic, unclear about exams, self indulgent.

This class is challenging, but worth it. He is always willing to help, and you can tell that he's really interested in the subject. The tests are not difficult if you use his study guide and skim the reading.

I had a 4.0 (60 hours completed) up until taking this class!  He is nice and helpful, but his tests are just unreasonable!  You have THREE books to read, and if you don't read and study every book and come to class 10 minutes early (to write down song info), you won't do that well.  Also, the TA's grade really hard!  Get someone else if you can...

this guy is hard. attendance is required, and he takes attendance even in a lecture class. the lectures are somewhat interesting, but that won't make up for the difficult tests. tests are short answers/essay. if there's another professor other than him, i would opt for the other one.

Stueck was an excellent professor. Very manageable workload. We had 2 tests (short answer, essay) that were not hard, a presentation, and a research paper. Stueck was more than willing to discuss my topic with me and even led me to the most interesting and relevant sources to my topic. If you're a history major or just not retarded, take him.

This teacher is awful! I dropped the class and I'm taking it over the summer. "Dr. Drop" plays songs at 8 AM; they are on the test! He starts before 8 AM for the songs so if you show up on time...you still miss stuff. His tests are 5 essays and the TAs grading are horrible! He means well but he is sooooo libral and doesn't like other opinions!
I would not recommend this professor to any one. His lectures can be very interesting but his test are ridiculously hard. If you are looking to pull up your GPA with this class you can forget it!
TAKES ATTENDENCE IN AN AUDITORIUM CLASS 8 in the morning sucks too. heavy lecture notes and five ta's grade differently. hard tests. five short answer and one essay. easy final though.

Stueck requires attendance. Often strict on grading and informs TAs to be strict as well. Kind person at heart if you show dedication. Hosted study sessions before tests out of his free time to assist. Very knowledgeable about subject but often dry to listen to. I learned a lot in his class but through a large amount of work.

The class is difficult and requires alot of outside work. His lectures did keep my interest and his class is not at all boring, but if you are looking for a slack class this is definately not it. Your grade really does depend on what your TA is like.

he is obviously very dedicated and passionate about history, but he is also a dick. he picks on people in class, and his lectures are difficult to follow as his outlines are always behind or different that what he is saying. he really does have test questions that we only discussed for a minute or two in class, and it feels like he wants you to fai

very hard teacher.  i thought i was smart until i took this class.  i had to study for about 3 hours straight just to get a low B on a test.  his nickname is Dr. Drop, so do yourself a favor and only take this class if you really and truly love history.

Ok, he believes in his subject and teaches it, but his TAs are devils. The grading system is incomprehensible, it seemed like they were picking numbers out of a hat for grades. The more I studied for a test, the worse a grade I got on it. Also he is unhelpful and doesn't like to talk to the students. Mandatory attendence, etc. GET A DIFFERENT PROF!

Stueck talks entirely too fast, and I've had test questions based on subjects we had only discussed for about 2 minutes. I tended to make poorly on tests, but I had some friends who did incredible. Your grades depend a lot on the TA you get. Attendance is also mandatory, so only take this class if you hate yourself.

Pretty difficult class, definately requires a WHOLE LOT of studying, but an A is not impossible. Must read literally everything he requires in the book, and take detailed notes during lectures. Attendance is mandatory, which is kind of a pain, but you really don't want to miss lectures. Recommended if you are up for a challenge
DO NOT TAKE!!! SUCKS!

This class is absurdly and unnecessarily difficult.  The TAs grade in different ways so your grade partially depends on if you TA is nice or not.  The tests seem to written to confuse the student.  DON'T EVER TAKE THIS PROFESSOR!

This class is somewhat demanding, but there's nothing wrong it. Stueck talks entirely too fast and we do not cover most info indepth enough imo. Dr. Stueck is very interesting though, which could partially be because his ideology isn't all that different from my own. Anyway, this class is worth taking but expect to invest a good deal of time

Horrible...! His tests are the worst and the damn songs are the stupidest thing in the world! I hate this man and his 5 TAs....His lectures are drab and boring....his tests seem impossible. I love learning about history but i hate this class! Take another class with a different professor for your own sake!
There are a lot of notes and a lot of reading and he takes roll but if you go to class and sit in the front it's really not that bad.

Not as bad as other reviews make him out to be. Tests are all written response, but it's not that hard to make a B on them. Just try and keep up with the reading, go to class, and take decent notes and you should do fine. NOT hard to get a B, regardless of what others have said here.

This class is terribly difficult, and the test format is impossible. The grading system is unfair because different TAs grade the five short answer and one long essay questions on the test. Different TAs grade more difficult that others. Terrible teacher. super super boring. NEVER TAKE THIS MAN!

suuuucks. unless you are ANTI conservative drop it. this class is BORING and hard as hell. he cares about his research and thats about it. it's damn near impossible to get an a. AND he takes attendence in an auditorium class... DROP!!!
absolutly worst class ever
No Comments
No Comments
No matter how hard you work, no matter how much time you devote, no matter how much you know history, you will just not get an A. He is one of those who prides himself on not giving any.
