Easy to get a C or below. Must work hard for a B and close to impossible to get an A. You had better be an extreme liberal because voicing a conservative view on a short answer question or a paper will leave you with an 89 no matter how hard you may have worked for an A.

Stueck teaches big lectures and attendance is required, but it only makes you work that much harder.   He will call on you randomly but it keeps you on your toes.  He lectures, but he is interesting and REALLY knows his stuff.  He is unbaleivably willing to help if you need it.  You just need to ask

My advice is to take another professor.  This class is way too demanding and attendance is required.  This is my second year at UGA and he is the teacher that I am most afraid of.  While in class you get the feeling that he wants you to fail.
he's awful!!
His lectures are really boring, but one of the books is interesting and an easy read.  His tests are hard and come mostly from lectures.

A demanding teacher, requires attendance and calls on people randomly in a large class setting. A nice guy but not popular. He instructs his TA's to grade harshly and they do so faithfully. Good lectures, a real pro, knows his stuff, wrote one of the books we use. Tests are short answer and essay.
The worst professor ever!
grades tough
No Comments

He told us on the first day that he would probably be the oldest teacher we would have while we were at UGA! Very nice and tries to help but sometimes assumes that you know more than you actually do. Very dry humor but really nice!

Churchman was extremely hard to understand sometimes. He would mumble and then strike down questions from students that he felt were obvious to him, not necessarily for the students. He was a nice guy, but if you have never taken calc before, definitely avoid. I studied constantly all semester and barely scraped past with a C-

He is an old guy who is genuinely willing to help if you show interest. He will solve any question you ask for webquizzes. Just be patient; however you have to have an interest in math because he does not explain well. My advise is to Practice problems and start reading for your finals early. Be careful when putting your answers in on webassign!!!!

Churchman is a nice, reasonable guy, but he is horrible at explaining problems. He assumes that everyone knows the first few steps so he kinda mumbles to himself and goes ahead and gives out the answer. His class was pretty much a waste of time except for the days right before exams because he went over quiz problems throughout class.

Nice guy, makes me think about my grandpa, but his explanation of math is rather confusing and he rambles and tells random stories that side tracks the class.  I would not recommend taking Churchman unless you are extremely good at math.

Don't take this class unless you have prior Calc knowledge. I say this b/c he often skips vital steps, which can be confusing. Otherwise, take the class. The homeworks are easy grades b/c he/the ta works out problems in class. The tests arent that long. However, the fianl took the WHOLE 3 hrs!

He had funny corny jokes and he was really nice. If you need help don't be afraid to ask for it. He made his class a lot easier than he had to. Easy homework grades, but actually do the problems, don't just ask him to work them out and copy them; that's how you do bad on his tests. I really enjoyed the semester with him, so definitely him!

Dr. Churchman is a great teacher. I took precal with him over summer. He likes to go off on random stories and often makes corny jokes, and he is really old. If you have the option, I would really recommend taking a class with him.

Churchman likes to teach, and always has funny stories about random stuff.  Math for decision making is kindof inexact in itself, and he didn't know all that much about it.  There were so many easier ways to do things, and the day after the test was always a debate about unfair questions, but I got a really easy A

Dr. Churchman was the oldest of my professors, and sometimes he could be a little old school. He did offer a lot of extra help opportunities, and homework was really easy to get 100s on, and they made up a great portion of our grade. The midterms are tough, but he tells you what you need to know. Final took all of 3 hour alloted time.

He is a realy nice guy and this class is the easiest class i have ever taken .If you even have a brain equivalent to a dog you will do just fine.Remember to do your homework and take a couple of Jexam tests before time and if you have problems take it toi him and he`ll help you out. Thats all i did and got a 100% in this class

Don't take him. Mr. Churchman is an extremely nice man, but is very confusing and always wants to take the long way when solving something. Because UGA's math program is so screwed up, all you really have to learn is the problems on JExam. I don't think he ever looks at those problems to see what we need to learn. Very nice but not a great teacher.
He tries really hard to help, but sometimes is a little confusing and always wants to go the long way.  Not short and to the point!  Nice guy. . funny!

If you haven't taken precal before, some of the math may be hard. Mr. Churchman is very helpful however and always checks up on webCT. He makes sure that everyone does the best they can. He may be hard to hear while teaching but if you ask him to clarify any questions, he will do so without complaint. He is very funny too, the class is amusing.

He is funny and makes jokes all through class. He is really old but knows what he is talking about. He always goes out of his way to help you and gives past test questions in class. Always goes over homework on JExam before it's due and the test questions are easy if you know how to do the homework. I don't like math but this class was easy.

He is a great professor. I have made a 100 on every test as so have alot of other ppl in the class. He is an enjoyable teacher and likes the class to interact. Students did leave the class but not because of the teacher but because of their own lack to come to class and listen. He answers all your questions thoroughly.

He's a great guy and pretty personable but he does not explain anything clearly! Our class had to tell him to keep things simple and get straight to the point of how to do it instead of over complicating things and just confusing us all. Switch if you get him unless you study well and are a natural with maths.

He is a nice man but NOT a good teacher. While people in other classes were making A's on tests, our class average was like a 50. He does not explain things well and makes you feel like an idiot if you have a question. Over half of our class had to drop. Take pre-cal from someone else for your own good!!

i think he is a great teacher, however the math 1113 tests are the same for every 1113 class: they are random questions, so the prf has no idea what will be on them. he is funny and exciting. class is never boring. he explains everything well. if you need to meet with him to get some help he goes out of his way to help you. his grading is easier than the other teachers from whati hear.
Does not teach well.  Needs to retire.
He was nice, but so hard. He went really fast in the lectures and the tests were really hard. I had to drop his class.

This guy is very hard. He flies through every section and when someone has a question he makes them feel like an idiot. I would advise not taking his class although he is nice and he knows his subject he is just too hard and too old to still be teaching.

Notes are directly from the book for the majority of the semester. Because he specifically hints at what is going to be on the quizzes in class you might want to go. His quizzes are short answer in list for mat and he usually uses lists of three. Very dry sense of humor over all and his tests are difficult if you don't have a copy of the old ones.

SO BORING. The class isnt bad, but it is literally painful to listen to him ramble about nothing. Weekly quiz are common since, but if you dont list exactly what he wants you wont get  credit. All in all, class isnt bad just boring as all get out.
Its all about the Marketing Plan.

He is unintentionally funny. I always do poorly on quizes but there is really no excuse to do bad. The tests are several essay questions. Nothing like the quizes. I also hear he gives out alot of A's and curves everything. Im still currently in his class and have only had one test for which I am waiting to recieve my grade.
He rambles on and on...but, he is really a nice man. He is very willing to help if you need it. He gives quizzes on a weekly basis, and that gets old. Other than that, it is not too bad.
No Comments
Thorough and very knowledgable, seems a bit dry at first but very funny sense of humor :)

Race, Gender, and Class in Media is one of the most important classes I have taken or ever will take. Media literacy is the theme, and if you can grasp that then you're halfway there. This class will open your eyes to privileges you probably enjoy yet do not recognize.
This is a great class for anyone who wants an interesting class and wants to learn something. It's also a great elective for you Journalism students!
& media. AWESOME class.

can't give enuf praise! amazing individual who puts his mind & soul into educating & inspiring his students. always willing to discuss more, interested getting to know you & listening. regardless of your major--this is a MUST TAKE class for lif
The best teacher I will ever have, hands down. Very sharp, very personable, goes well out of his way to help with anything.

He rightly assumes you remember what you learned from 1112, so brush up some on that. He's a great professor for getting the basic concepts down, although some of his material for the class is getting aged and needs updating. As long as you do all the labs and go to class, you should be looking at a B at least.
Super nice professor.  Really like the class even though I did not know what he was talking about half the time.

He's a really good professor and he really knows his stuff and is passionate about it. But sometimes he doesn't quite know how to explain something to someone who isn't a science major. Harder than I thought it'd be, and also more interesting.
Class is relatively easy if you put in any effort at all. I didn't and pulled a B-. Material was far more interesting than I expected. Gives extra credit for attendance, but it is random.

I must admit this class wasn't AS easy as I expected. I had to study for the tests, but they were not hard when I did. He tells you what will be on the tests at the study sessions, but there's no study guide. He gives random quizzes and your attendance is based on how many you miss. He knows and cares a lot about weather. He's helpful, and funny.

Prof. Mote is a really nice guy and a good teacher. If you go to class to get the powerpoints and skim over the book, you'll do fine. I did study a good bit for his tests, but if you study they aren't impossible. This isn't a super easy class, but as long as you attend class most of the time and study you'll do fine.

This is the easiest class i've taken at UGA by far. Just go to class and take notes and you will do fine. The book is only helpful if you don't understand something, I wouldn't waste the money. Mote tries to be funny, and most of the time he is. He knows a lot about weather. I would recommend this class and this teacher.

I don't know what everyone is talking about. This was one of the easiest classes i took. All you have to do is come to class and take notes. His tests come straight from notes, so dont bother with the book. He's a really good guy, too. You wont do well if you dont go to class. He looks exactly like the bald sargeant from Starship Troopers

Boring. Unless you want to study for hours to only manage a low B, listen to stories about when he lived in the Midwest, or really just have a passion for weather and climate, don't take this class. If you do take it, take your own notes from the book, especially when you start talking about the adiabatic lapse rate and such.

Don't take this class; it's horribly dull, and not easy at all.  I thought it was going to be a breeze going in, but it's not.  Dr. Mote is very nice, but he's SO boring.  You'd think with a subject this dull, he might liven it up a bit, but he doesn't.  The tests are difficult; he asks lots of nit-picky questions.  Avoid this class!
very knoweldgable...great class to take.
I was so bored by this class. The tests were not bad if you did the reading. Plus the videos were pretty funny in a "look at the 80's people" way. I know I learned a lot in this class.

He didn't like explaining things more than once. Concepts he said we wouldn't be tested on were on tests, he didn't stay with the syllabus, he wasn't helpful at all at reviews. At exam time, he said his office would be open Friday to look at tests, but then, on that friday, he said he was too busy.
I thought the class would be interesting, but then it just kind of put me to sleep every day.
Very knowledgable of material. Tests are straight from lecture notes. Good sense of humor.
Knowledgeable of material.  Covers much information for class time but thorough in explanations.  Weather proficiency very high and has a sense of humor.

I was in there for two days and that was only because I couldn't find a replacement class after the first day. I dropped out immediately because the guy is a total b. There was no point in sticking around after he gave us the intro. speech to how he teaches. Terrible!!

He loves the subject, but he will give you a handout on Monday and expect you to be able to do what the handout says without giving any instruction and if you ask for help he will treat you like a fool.
You will not get an A, no matter what.  I had the highest grade in class going into the final and the highest grade on the final.  Still got a B.  Seriously dont try, you will not  get an A.

Biggest pain in my you-know-what!!!!  I have NEVER worked so hard in my life, and the only reason I got an A was because he curved the entire class!  He congratulated me on making the highest grade on the midterm, shook my hand, and then handed me a paper with an 87 on it!  He was serious!  AVOID!!
I've only had him for 3 days and I already want to kill myself. I've never had to do more reading in my life. He never, ever gives As, as he wants A students to be professors of geology or something.
Took class from him in 1986.  He was a pain then and is still a pain now. same old same old

Professor Dallmeyer was quite possibly the most boring and hardest teacher I've ever had.  He gave impossible homework assignments and an insane amount of reading.  His quizzes and tests were death.  He was anal about attendance too. DO NOT TAKE HIM!

easiest science class I've ever taken. went to class maybe 5 times all semester and made an A. when i did go to class however, i really enjoyed his teaching, he was funny and definitely loved teaching the material. homework was impossible but the tests were nothing like the homework, they were a hundred times easier.

His lectures can get very boring because the content is boring. But he tries to make it as lively as possible. There are 5 tests, and 1 can be dropped. He allows 1 cheat sheet, front and back. He sends out the notes on what will be on the test. Mastering Physics homework assignments somewhat correlate with what will be on the test.
Dr. Dennis is a nice guy, and the class is easy for a physics class

Pros: one of the better physics 2 professors, powerpoints clearly show what will be on the exam, tries his best to keep students entertained, very approachable. Cons: would sometimes fail to clarify topics that could be on exams, homework questions (Mastering Physics) don't relate to exam questions, grading criteria isn't as clear as it could be.

Dr. D is the man! He's very knowledgeable about physics, and his lectures are usually very interesting. Unless you don't plan to go to class, the textbook isn't necessary. The exams are sometimes challenging - if you miss just two or three questions, you're already in the B range, which can be frustrating. Conceptual questions on exams are tricky!

You can clearly tell that he knows what he's talking about during lecture. The tests are not bad, they're just five 14 multiple choice tests and you get a cheat sheet for each one. He's super funny and the only downside is the fact that he goes through topics at sporadic speeds.

Dr. Dennis is extremely funny. His tests are not too difficult. They are 14 questions multiple choice and he allow you to have one page of a 'cheat sheet'. He has pop quizzes at the beginning of every class over the nights reading.

Maybe the easiest Physis 2 class! Go to class, study for exams, do the hw, and make the cheat sheet (anything you want on it) and you'll get an A! He is a great teacher that explains everything really well! The only bad point is that he is really slow at getting through the material! No cumulative final, just 5 exams and you can drop the lowest!

Hilarious professor and very passionate about his field but was a bit disorganized with his lectures for 1112. Tests were relatively easy so do well on the first 3 to exempt the last test/final. Homework is always pushed back and he sends out his class notes. Go to class to get an extra bonus point in the end.

Pros: multiple choice tests, a 90 is an A, tends to push back HW deadlines, attendance is +1% on final grade Cons: Very unorganized, will teach 2 sections one day and 5 the next Tests are a mix of conceptual and math questions, so read the chapters.  I wouldn't say it's an easy A but definitely doable.

Dr. D is an amazing professor! He is funny, & loves for his students to be engaged in lectures. He randomly walks around, chooses students to answer his questions, if no participation. He uses fun gadgets to help you understand the material better. You also get to use a cheat sheet on all multiple choice exams. Easy A! He wants everyone to do well!
Dr. Dennis is awesome professor

He's a good teacher.  I enjoyed his class a lot.  He didn't use the book, and the tests were based on the notes.  And he doesn't give enough homework (odd as that sounds).  Attend class, pay attention, as questions, and study your note completely.  I'l looking forward to taking him again.
Dr. Dennis is awesome!!!!   he is hard but fair!!
Dr. Dennis wants his students to get a solid A in his class and makes every expection of the student crystal clear.  These expections are always reasonable..
Has a point of view, but has actually done something about it.
Easy class, but interesting to hear his perspective.  Certainly not a "nut job" though he is very adamant about his views.  Took two classes with him and both were quite easy, but informative.

He's not a "nut job". He is very passionate and outspoken in his views, but a lot of them are correct. His class & exams are easy. If you want to get an A make sure you email him articles, etc. that he may like. He won't know your name if you just talk in class....email is the key.
No Comments
Not as bad as everyone says.
He is a nut job, but you can get an A from him if you ****up some liberal garbage on the final.  Just remember, Rehnquist is evil.  If you call him Torquemada on the final you'll get an A+
This guy is a nut job.  Teaches you nothing of practical relevance.  Spends half the time talking about the "Dreyfuss Affair".  Summary of course: "Cops and Republicans=Nazis".

Great guy, good professor--very fair and helpful during office hours. Material was sometimes confusing, but the notes on the board were clear. Motivation by application rather than simply starting in the abstract was a nice change for a math class. If I had the chance, I'd take him for more classes.

He is a nice guy but really scatterbrained a lot of times. He always gets lost in his own thoughts. Its actually pretty funny. There will be lots of silent moments in class when he is just thinking about what to write on the board next.  Otherwise he isn't the fairest grader but he curves and drops lowest test grades to help out.

Sornborger is really cool!  He is a great guy and so, so smart.  He was very straight-forward and organized.  His tests are pretty straight forward, too.  It is a very doable and enjoyable course.  He was always helpful during office hours, and interesting to chat with.  I would take more of his classes but I'm not in engineering.  Take him!

He is a great teacher in my opinion.  Always went out of his way to help me understand whats going on.  If you go to office hours for HW help, you will do well on the tests.  Test questions come straight from HW.  I only go to class, go to his office hours to get HW done, and I ace the tests. Awesome guy, kind, and funny as hell.
Good guy. Office hours are fun, as is class. However, teaching is not his top priority.
Good teacher, very friendly and helpful. I learned best at his office hours. Likes to give out good grades
He is pretty smart... he explains very well and is ready to answer any questions (relevant or irrelevant). Pretty good teacher overall.

He is a great teacher-but you have to get used to his style (and the fact that he has only been teaching for a few years).  If you take him- be prepared to go to office hours often to help you with those impossible-to-solve homework problems.  tests are easier than homework.
I liked this guy.  He is extremely intelligent and he will work with you.  He teaches concepts, and if you get them, everything will go smoothly.

Flick is the man. He is taking a break from teaching to pursue his PhD, but if you have him in the future this is all you need for an A: show up to class (he counts off heavily for attendance), and bring him drafts of all of your essays (he will tell you exact changes that need to be made for a higher grade). I highly recommend this teacher!

I LOVE Prof Flick and I wish that I could have him for all of my English classes.. He's kind of unorganized but he's such a hippie and he's a really nice guy. The books he picked out were really interesting and not too painful to read. He allows paper re-writes but doesnt grade too hard from the beginning anyways. I definitely recommend him.

Flick overlooked some of my work, then proceeded to blame me when he should have read my paper to the end. He was very degrading and patronizing about the misplaced paper over email only one hour before final grades were due.  As a result of waiting until the last minute and not reading through my paper, my grade took a hit taking a week to change.
awesome teacher.

Loved this class. Flick is an incredibly involved, helpful professor. An easy A if you put forth the work and let him look at drafts before you turn in essays. Be sure to do the readings. Do the group project sooner rather than later, and speak up in class. Discussions are your friend. He really cares about his students, highly recommended.

He has an appreciation for students who are willing to discuss their ideas on papers or the direction their papers are headed before final drafts are turned in to him. If you can spare the time and can put in the effort, that will be the difference between a "B" and an "A" for Flick.
Great professor. If you participate in lectures and read the novels, papers and tests are a breeze. He's sort of a hippie, but learn to write in a hippie style, and you're golden!

In a word: confusing.  I've taken CMLT classes before and this one was hard to follow because there was no direction!  But you better participate b/c its part of your grade.  Good luck trying to guess at what he wants you to talk about though!  No direction, unclear, hard paper grader.....

Flick's class was a lot of fun, though he does have a tendency to wander off topic and talk about his various life experiences (ask about the mountain women).  As long as you read your assignments and participate in the discussions, this is a moderately easy class.
he's a tough one but absolutely HILARIOUS!
He's really coool reallyraelly cool he'sjust hard as hell. but lots and lots of fun

He was very rude when I did ask for help and his emails to be were the same way. We did not have a book but we did have assigned readings that he would email to us. Then the next class would just recover what we read. Hileman is one of the worst professors I have ever had.

Super strange. Roman literature is interesting though. Sketches (journals) are due every class and is annoying. Went to his office hours, not very helpful because it "wasn't fair" to other students. I found it difficult to get an A..Better hope for a B

Honestly, the class was pretty easy. Dr. Hileman is pretty laid back, and makes it so that the class isn't something that you stress out over too much. The sketches we had to do a few times a week were kind of a pain, but other than that, it's wasn't bad at all. I would take him again.

Dr. Hileman was definitely one of the best teachers I've ever had. I love writing and literature- I'm a journalism major. He is a bit ecsentric, but it is really just entertaining. I actually enjoyed his "tangents". Though they were tangents, he managed to always bring the subject back to the lesson. Take his class if you are interested in writing.

He is knowledgeable about the subject matter he discusses, but he tends to ramble. Hardly a single lecture passed without an awkward comment. The class was informative overall. It's not hard to get an A, you just have to try.

He's an odd guy, but he's super nice. And he's really not that strict of a grader. His lectures are boring, but this class isn't much work AT ALL! I never stressed over getting everything turned in, and I got an A- easily.

He's an odd guy, but he's super nice. And he's really not that strict of a grader. His lectures are boring, but this class isn't much work AT ALL! I never stressed over getting everything turned in, and I got an A- easily.

If you like to talk about sex instead of english, take this guy's class. If you prefer combat boots with pink socks and shorts to professional attire, take this guy's class. If you like to use all the ink in your pens to doodle to keep yourself awake while your professor talks endlessly about boring subjects, take his class. If not...GET OUT NOW!

If you like to talk about sex instead of english, take this guy's class. If you prefer combat boots with pink socks and shorts to professional attire, take this guy's class. If you like to use all the ink in your pens to doodle to keep yourself awake while your professor talks endlessly about boring subjects, take his class. If not...GET OUT NOW!

Hard teacher. He grades essays really hard and is not helpful at all.  his lectures are really boring and attendance is mandatory.  He was kind of a funny guy but I do not recommend  him for a teacher at all.

Worst English teacher I ever had. He was cool for like the first two weeks of school then he just jumped off that wagon and started riding the "so-boring-you-start-tattooing-yourself" wagon. Don't take him if you want to remain sane. He is the strictest grader ever! If you want an A, don't take this class. Save yourself!

This guy is certainly interesting!! He's ridiculously knowledgeable on his subject matter and extremely helpful (I definitely called him on his cell phone for help on my final paper at like, 11pm). Yes, he is a difficult grader and his test are a challenge, but manageable, I mean, I earned an A.

This dude likes tangents. I never felt prepared for what was going to be on tests. He always wanted us to tell him what to teach us. Grades don't reflect overall learning, but grammar specifics and learning to apply other people's modes of thinking--no originality. Thank goodness it's over. The only plus is extra credit opportunity.

He was my TA. He wasn't an overly stringent grader (though he is realistic), and was really great at giving constructive criticism for our papers. I nearly slept through a test, but he still let me take it. His lectures were never boring and he's just fun to listen to. Lets us discuss whatever we want in breakout.

Gives a reasonable amount a work and is a pretty lenient grader.  The tests, in my opinion, were pretty easy (I didn't do most of the readings and still did well because I paid attention in class).  If you have been successful in English classes in the past, this class shouldn't be a problem for you.

Not a likeable guy in the slightest sense.  Extremely hard grader... I consider english to be one of my strongest classes and I still got a B. He gave out only one A in my class during the fall of '05. I was extremely dissatisfied with the class as a whole, if you get stuck with him as a teacher, good luck.

I didn't really like him. He's a difficult grader, and just generally not a likeable guy. If you're a decent writer, you won't have a problem getting a B, but an A requires skill at writing. After the first paper, though, you should be able to tell him what he wants to hear.

Mr. Hileman is definitely strange, and sometimes he seems to rebel simply for the sake of rebelling. However, he led me to improve my writing skills, and you can pull an A if you put effort into your papers. The most important thing about papers is the CONTENT... try creating theses that are thematic and discuss their universality. Overall: GOOD!

He brings up interesting ideas but the readers were boring and difficult to concentrate on. He grades harshly but gives you constructive criticism you can build on. I definately became a better writer but he still gives like 3 people A's which kind of sucks He talks about sex and everything to do with it a lot too. kind of odd but whatever.nice guy
Why did i attend this class everyday? because at times it was more like a sideshow. Funny, intelligent teacher but difficult grader.

Horribly boring.  He choose terrible subject matter for the class, everything we read was incredibly boring and completely different from the other 1102 classes.  He interestingly weird for about the first 2 weeks then he just becomes completely mundane except for a few comments he likes to make about peoples sexual orentation.
Hileman is interesting... His grading is very strict. Most of our class got B's.
No Comments

Very interesting class; Hileman keeps you on your toes. He hass daily journal assignments and 5 essays per semester. He grades very strictly but appreciates participation (will boost your grade!) He loves to help you earn your grade if you need help. Most of the class earned B's. I recommend it!

This was the best English class I've ever taken...  Hileman is one of those professors that makes class interesting. His methods of teaching are far from any high school lit class. However, he does grade essays stringently. He's stingy with A's though.

B. Don Massey is a great guy, and is pretty funny, but his tests are completely rediculous. ESPECIALLY the final. He literally talks about every random thing in the world, and expects you to randomly recall it on the tests. I wouldn't recommend taking this course.

Massey is pretty much the coolest man on the planet. His lectures are intriguing, and he really knows his stuff. The class is not very demanding. He gives you study guides for tests, and if you go over them, you'll be fine. He forgets to take attendance a lot, but it's a good idea to go to class.  I really enjoyed it and I learned a lot!

B. Don is incredible.  I've had him for several classes and have loved them all.  He basically gives you the test the class before, and lectures are really interesting.  If you attend class and pay attention, you'll do really well.  An added bonus is he has a thing for canceling class or letting out early.

He is very interested in the subject but has NO structure to his teaching style. You LITERALLY have to write down every single word that comes out of his mouth because you never know whats on his exam. He is SO scattered. I hated this class. He seems like a nice guy but his tests are retarded. Beware!

Great guy who really loves what he does, and is great at it too! He told our class multiple times that we would be having a quiz next class, but when we got there, no quiz. Also, he's a bit scatterbrained and although you learn alot, the midterm/final are difficult because he sometimes has things on there he didn't teach. You'll still learn tons.

He's a nice enough guy, and his stories are good, but this guy is NOT a professor. Go to class, take notes, and make sure you're there for the class before the exam. He'll tell you everything you should know (mainly b/c he's remembering what he said over the weeks to make the exam that night)
B. Don doesn't have the most sophisticated teaching technique. Its half entertainment, half rambling--but his sincerity, experience and knowlege make him totally worth listening to.

Mr. Massey was not very helpful whn asked questions.  He seemed bothered to be speaking to an undergrad.  The TA's were awful... one easy, one hard.  Don't take this class unless you really need/want to.  The papers for breakout were rediculous, required detailed knowledge of MLA format.  My TA was more concerned with formatting than substance.

This class can be boring, but Massey makes lots of jokes and tries to keep things interesting. The break-out sessions are great if you get the right teacher. If you need the credit, take it. Keep in mind, THIS IS NOT AN ACTING CLASS! :( I was disappointed.
No Comments
The class is easy. You just go to class and take notes. You have to go to class...it will help. There are days when it's interesting and days when it's not.
No Comments
No Comments

This class is awful. We are supposed to be learning how to apply the WMST major to the real world through this capstone course, yet all weve done so far is read books from the 70s. It would be more helpful to be talking about current events and what we could do as far as praxis, than MORE reading. Her grading criteria for papers is also vague.
ratingTags_Rating: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment_Rating: Dr. Thomas is beyond absurd. Here readings are endless and don't pertain to the topic. I feel as if she makes class unbearable and worthless. I was enrolled in her Gender and Music Videos class a previous semester, and I literally dropped the class on the first day while she was going over the class. She is BORING and UNINSPIRING!

great! the class got off to a slow start mostly due to technological problems, which resulted in a lot of lost class time but overall, a really great class. the organization of the readings really tied things together for understanding the subject. LOTS of reading but fun class, easy grading... plus she's very hot!

I liked her a lot.  I thought she had a lot of interesting things to say, i loved the selections she picked for us to read, and i liked the way she organized class around our discussions.  Sometimes a little close-minded toward the guys in the class or anyone who denies that a certain bias existed, but overall enjoyable.

Really cares about her students and wants you to do well in the class. I took it over the summer so obviously it was more work but I would spend about an hour a day doing homework for it. The online tests are super easy because they are open note and open book. Definitely would recommend.

This professor is the most unreasonable and difficult to work with. I would not take her online classes if you want a good grade. The course was overly demanding and to be an online class you should not have to meet at specific times every week a couple of times a week.
Very knowledgeable, friendly, and helpful
Awesome teacher, you will never be bored. Easy tests and final, very little work needed.

TAKE THIS CLASS!! The first test was a little difficult, but for the rest of them and the final he gave all of the test questions to the class.  There was a google doc full of all the answers and even a quizlet.  They were the exact same questions and answers as the study guide.  Really a great guy.  Only downside is the random attendance checks.
lol except the first test he gave his class all the questions.  As long as your class makes a google doc you'll be fine.  But go to class because thats 100 points of your grade.

He gives the questions to the tests, including the final, & you make a study guide w the class to figure out all the answers. Occasional paragraphs to turn in after certain classes. I overslept during a test and he was extremely nice and let me retake it. He is really funny & cool and I would totally take his class again. definitely take his class!

Dr. Stringham is by far the best psychology teacher, he genuinely cares about his students and you learning, NOT about your grade. He actually makes you want to go to class, and if you just listen to his lectures which are usually funny, you will do well in the class. Funniest teacher I've had and super smart; lucky to have him teaching an intro.
Great teacher overall. He's hilarious and makes the material fun to learn. There are random minute papers that can save your grade later on in the semester so attendance is advisable.

Jim is a hilarious instructor! The course material is difficult at times, but his class was still extremely enjoyable. There are simple extra credit/participation opportunities throughout the semester, so go to class regularly to get those points! You'll also find that his study guides for the exams are extremely helpful.
he was interesting

Dr. Stringham is great!  This class was the hardest psych class I have taken at UGA.  He started giving us the test questions before hand as a study guide after the first test.  He does minute papers as attendance checks, so it is beneficial to go to class.  He will post his powerpoint online.  He has a lot of great stories and he is funny!

Pretty cool class. Dr Stringham is a nice guy, tells a lot of dad jokes, but he goes through material pretty easily and makes it understandable. You don't have to go to class, but he gives minute papers randomly so there's an incentive to attend. The minute papers are really easy. He gives the questions to the tests beforehand. Pretty good class.

Jim has long lectures, but he makes things interesting. He gives examples and tries to get a room of 300 people to participate (but you can stay quiet if you want). He does random in class assignments to check attendance, but they're just simple surveys usually. He gives the test questions ahead of time, so tests aren't bad. It's a great class.

Jim is the man. He is very clear about tests - sometimes to the point of giving you the test questions. He is also just a really cool guy, total dad. Attendance is checked by in class assignments periodically but they are a really small portion of your grade. You won't regret taking this class.

Dr. Stringham made Intro to Psychology a bearable class to take. He assigns in-class assignments typically once a week at random to check for attendance and it gives you a small 10 point grade in class, which helps. His study guides for the tests are extremely helpful and its easy to make a good grade in class (I made an A). I would take again.

Really funny professor. Unfortunately cancelled class a fair bit since he was out of town. He had great lectures that were both funny and interesting. Tests could be fairly tricky (4000 level class after all)... easy if you showed up to class and read the PowerPoints. Attendance (10% of grade) is randomly taken (1% each time) 12 times (2% ex cred)

Jim is an amazing professor! He has a deep understanding and respect for his students that no other professor possesses. Participation is a decent portion of the grade but his fantastic and often hilarious lectures will make you WANT to go to class. I would recommend taking psychology with him to anybody with an interest in the subject.

Best psychology teacher. Take him if you can. Makes lectures easy to understand and he uses humor to make learning easier. Gives questions. Gives random in-class assignments and extra credit.  Homework is through textbook. Tests aren't hard. Overall great experience and I would definitely take him again

We call him Jim, and he's a great professor. Even at 8 a.m., he made lecture entertaining. He wants us to learn the material and not just aim for grades, so he gives us the questions to the test. Extra credit was given randomly in class. He genuinely wanted us to succeed in the class. Take this class with this professor if you can.

Professor Stringham was an amazing professor. His lectures were entertaining and interesting, but still got all of the information across. His tests were a little on the easier side, but still required studying. He was always trying to help his students and make sure everyone passed. Recommend taking for Elem. Psych.

Jim is by far the best professor that I have had at UGA. He loves what he teaches and really tries to make the class easy and interesting for everyone. He gives you the exact questions that are going to be on every exam and grades writing assignments very easily. He cancels class a lot and gives some extra credit for just showing up to class.

I had an Tuesday Thursday 8 AM with Stringham which sucked, and he knew the time sucked so he worked with us a lot. He knew attendance was scarce and put lectures and important deadlines online so we were able to be up to date even if we didnt go to class. Basically, even if you never go to class, you'll get a good grade. Plus, he's adorable.

Stringham is a really cool dude. He makes the subject really interesting. He tries to be funny, be he's even more so when he doesn't try to be. Tests are really easy, and the best part is, he gives you the EXACT test as the study guide. Take Stringham for a fun, easy A!

He is probably the best teacher I've ever had.  He makes the lectures interesting and fun.  He gives great study guides and easy tests.  Basically if you get the chance to take his class do it!  I know more about psychology now than I thought I would ever know.
He is probably the best teacher I've ever had.  He makes the lectures interesting and fun.  He gives great study guides and easy tests.  Basically if you get the chance to take his class do it!
This is an easy class. He gave us all of the questions to the tests beforehand.

Jim is great. Tests cover lecture slides only. He tells you to focus on lectures for tests and all the test material is from lecture. He also posts slides on elc after class. Has random "minute responses" for attendance checks and is an easy 100 grade if you just write a sentence. He gives the final questions to you in advance. Uses launchpad- $75

Stringham is a great psychology professor. He is extremely easy. He gives a ton of extra credit for coming to class, and he gave us the final beforehand. Aside from it being an easy A class, he is also a great teacher. Very entertaining and lectures were never boring. Take him if you can!!

Stringham is by far the best professor I've had. He has a way of making a class with 300 people laugh consistently. UGA doesn't realize that they have one of the best teachers ever. If you have a chance take his class, I'd love to take another one of his courses!!

Stringham is the best psyc professor at UGA! He's awesome! You can skip class, but you won't want to! His class is very straightforward. You don't need to buy the book, everything that's on his tests comes DIRECTLY from his powerpoints, which he puts online. He even gave us the final word-for-word a week beforehand! TAKE HIM TAKE HIM TAKE HIM!

Really cool guy, but the class can be a bit boring because of the huge number of students. I could've done a lot better had I paid attention and took it more seriously, so if you make the effort there's really no reason to not do well. Stringham can be pretty entertaining, and he was very likable.

This is the best psych teacher at UGA. When I took it he was very hilarious and entertaining. He makes the class interesting and I never wanted to skip! Advice: Don't skip class because he gives extra credit and study your notes (don't buy the textbook). He also gave us the final as a study guide for the final. So the final is easy to get a 100 on.

I absolutely loved this class! I took it as a Maymester and the teacher is great. He's hillarious and makes the class interesting. I read the book and looked over the notes for the test and was fine. I'm not a Psych major and if he teaches anything else I will be sure to take it. Love him!
Jim keeps lectures interesting; he's very witty.  Tests are fairly easy and very straightforward. LOVED this class!
Great teacher!!  Very interesting class.
Loved this class.  He's an awesome teacher, very helpful and friendly.  The class was easy and interesting.  I recommend him to everyone.
Unfortunantly he is leaving because I recommended him to everyone. The class was so interesting and was interactive even though it was a huge lecture. He was my favorite!
SO MUCH FUN.  I loved this class so much I considered changing my major.  He is hot and incredibly intelligent.  Also, quite witty.  I wanted to marry him, sadly, he is taken.

THE BEST OF THE BEST. this class was so awesome you do not even want to skip (and there are random minute papers (very easy), they really help out your grade)...he is so funny .... I made an "a" in it - the tests are not that hard if you study the notes mainly, but make sure you read the book too. take his class by all means!!
the BEST. never skipped one class. he is soooo funny and nice, definetely my favorite teacher ever!
I didn't consider skipping class - He is SO FUNNY and SO HOT! Makes the class really interesting and enjoyable!

This class was amazing! Tests are a little difficult, but he goes over some potential test questions before the test. Also, notes are not posted online, so you have to go to class, but class is so interesting that I didn't find it to be a problem.
Attendance counts a lot and he gives random attendance checks (15%). Tests are really easy and you get to drop one anyway. Good teacher, but be ready to write fast. Notes aren't online.
I LOVED this class, and you will too...Jim's GREAT and FUNNY!!!
I absolutely loved his class! Not only was it interesting, but it was so much fun!
Funny, easy on the eyes, makes class very interesting. Highly recommended.

The first thing I have to say is that he is very attractive. The class was easy because he explained the information well. He was open to answering any questions I had with no problem.  I absolutely loved the class.
SO HOT!!  He's funny and always keeps it interesting.  If you go and listen, tests are easy because of how he relates what he teaches to you and life so it's easy to remember.

Professor Stringham makes lectures interesting and fun. You can ensure your A if you glance through the book and pay attention in class. Honestly, you don't even have to go to class, but it's really quite fun! Great teacher.
FUN CLASS, EASY TESTS, EXCITING TEACHER.  IT doesnt get better.

TAKE JIM.  He goes by his first name and calls people in his lectures and stories ****s, which is funny.  I knew about 20 people in my class and I am almost positive we all got A's.  He also makes the subject matter very interesting.

TAKE HIM!!! Not only will you maybe get an A, but seriously the classes are fun, you learn cool things, he's an interesting guy, will let you out early, and if you dont forget to look over the book you can get an A. Only thing about Psychology in general is the fact you have to do 6.5 experiment hours, but u have to do that for any psyc classes.

What an amazing professor! Funny, helpful, very clear. I think if you just really study your notes before your tests and pay attention in class you can easily make a very high B or an A. Some questions do come from the book - I think people forget this and are a little tripped up by some questions. GREAT CLASS!

I don't think he's as easy as everyone makes him sound. His tests can be a tad tricky.  I studied and went to class and I still ended up with a B.  The class is fun to go to...he makes it so interesting.  However,you don't have to go...I got really sick and was out for a while...bought the notes at Baxter Street and actually did BETTER on the test!

Jim is a really good teacher! Very pleasant and funny!! one time, i went to his office for help, he was really patient and willing to help. but i dont know why i havent done so well on his tests! maybe his tests were not as easy as i thought! Overall, it is a very fun class, other than taking tons of notes each time
Dr. Stringham is a fantastic lecturer and he is very approachable.  I really enjoyed his class, and I would recommend it to anyone!
His class was very interesting and fun to go to. He made the information fun and interesting by how he presented it. He is a very funny teacher and i loved his class... take it  easy A and fun.
I enjoy the class, the test were not as hard as they could be but I found some questions hard to understand, but If you have to take a Psyc course pick this one.
Stringham's the best

He made us laugh, lots. His notes were clear and he kept things interesting. He made the 300+ class feel a lot smaller and more connected. His tests were fair. It is important to go to class because he gives little pop quiz things. Very easy but you gotta
He was an amazing teacher... and funny... and hot... very approachable... GREAT teacher...
great teacher- makes learning fun, all aroung nice guy- really helpful near test time- definetaly a fun and easy A!!
He's awesome, real nice and a good teacher
I loved going to class and I want to marry someone just like Stringham. Very approachable and funny
Jim was fun in class. He keeps things light hearted with jokes and off the wall comments, especially during the sections on human sexuality... I would recommend him to anyone who needs an easy A
Funny, easygoing, definitely a great professor!

Jim makes this class very interesting. He is easy to talk to & get along with. His test are 95% taken directly from his notes. It is important to take all the notes on his power point. He is funny and way cool. If your a psych major and have to take a bio-psych defiently take his class.
really really nice and actually interesting. easy to get at least a B, offers extra credit. young and kind of cute, too. flirty.
hot, hot, hot, extremely funny, hot, kind of hard to get an A, extremely easy to get a B, not a stressful class at all, hot
I really enjoyed this class.  Sitting and copying PPT notes was actually interesting.  Take this class.
not extremely easy. Reading the textbook and a good bit of studying is required to make an A.

definitely the easiest psyc. teacher to get. tests are easy, class is fun. if you go to class easy A. plus he gives bonus credit if you're at a high B, so if you just pretend to have put a lot of effort into the class he'll help you out.
This was my favorite class this semester.  He made it interesting and funny and could really relate to his students.  I enjoyed this class a lot.
He makes his lectures alot of fun and entertaining. Just go to class and take the notes and the tests are a breeze. He's awesome.
Awesome teacher, especially if you are into music.  He ties everything into music. You takes lots of notes in class but the tests come straight from the notes.
So Awesome!!!!! Definately take his class. Easy as pie and so sweet!
He is soo adorable and easy to understand...he makes class interesting..I had it at 9:30am but looked forward to attending. :) Definitely take Jim!
Stringham is hilarious and if you take notes the class is really easy. He makes it interesting. Great teacher.

He makes the class interesting and funny. His tests come exactly from the notes, and he does really good reviews. He is a very fair teacher. You get to drop your lowest test grade, but I'd be suprised if you even need this. He makes it easy to get an A
I look back on this class fondly.  Probably the most influential class I had in College. In grad school, I was way ahead of the game.
He was hard, but I learned so much. English classes were a breeze after his.  Thanks, Hoskins! If you are willing to work, you will learn.

I thought his class was great.  He had open discussion in all of his classes.  You did have to come prepared and read u're assignments which were for the most part interesting.  If there were any questions about them we debated during class.  He did get off focus but that made him more entertaining and class time go by quicker.  He always helped.

Hunter has trouble speaking fluently;  He stops in the middle of a sentence and starts talking about something else completely. Basically, you will need to rely on yourself, the book, and any outside help you can get.  If you are a serious student who wants clear instruction and understanding of this subject, do not take him.

I have not had his class at U.G.A.; but took Eng 191 from him at Athens Tech.  He is a great teacher that really does care about English.  He is always willing to help out a student.  If he sees that someone is trying, he will do his best to help him/her out; but, if he/she does not try at all, Hunter will have no sympathy.  Two thumbs up.

Hoskins's class was great.  He aims his discussion towards those who can keep up.  He doessn't care for whiners and makes that clear.  If you act lazy or like you don't care, he isn't veery forgiving.  BUT I learned more in this class than I have any other by far.  Especially about writing.
He is unprepared or at least comes across that way.  He will get mad at you if you haven't read. He is a hard grader but you will improve as a writer. He loves the paramedic method.
Overall he's a pretty fair teacher...just make sure you're prepared when you come to class and that you've had some caffine!

Hunter grades essays very hard. Attendance is taken every day. Class is full of very deep though and discussion. I loved it! Some may consider it boring but if you pay attention, you'll get a lot from the readings. He is A.D.D. and gets off topic sometimes. Again, he grades very hard. You can develop into a good writer in this class. GREAT CLASS!

Professor Hoskins is VERY boring and rambels on and on.He likes EMMA A LOT.He likes you to use all aspects of EMMA.He is willing to help you if you go to his office. He never lets you out of class early and he takes attendence EVERYDAY!Pretty good teacher but he is tough and grades hard.Picks boring topics to write on, usually requires research.

Dr. Anderson is a tropical storm of knowledge with a 100% chance of BLOWING. YOUR. MIND. Ridiculously intelligent and knows a lot about basically everything. He goes off on tangents frequently which can be distracting, but he has fantastic input on all of his texts for the class. You'll work hard, but you'll learn a lot.

This professor is great (which is why I took two of his classes) and I always recommend to all incoming English majors that they take him. He's not only intelligent, he's very friendly and helpful. I left his classes both times feeling like a better writer.

Dr. A has very interesting thoughts. The class always zooms by because he often goes off on tangents (relevant tangents, usually connected to the text), & they take up a lot of class time. But, what he says is valuable. Your writing will really improve; very harsh grader. I've never made below an 89 on a college english paper until this class.

In 7 years, best professor I have ever had. Hilarious, fascinating guy. Really listen to him and read his comments if you want to profoundly improve your writing. He emphasizes artistry in his students' work a lot more than conventions. He never said it in so many words, but I think he would rather you deeply appreciate one book than read them all.

We wrote about 5 out-of-class essays (one was the final) on the reading. Attendance is not mandatory. Anderson is really fun to listen to! He's like a really hyper little kid and tries to get you as interested as you can get in American Colonial Literature. Grading is fair, I suppose. I made a B on every single paper.

Dr. Anderson is one of those professors who hold very specific and rigid ideas about a text. If you don't agree with his opinion, it will be reflected in your grade. Sure, he makes silly, inane jokes, but do you really want a professor who goofs around during class yet is inflexible when it comes to grades? Seriously, don't take him.

Dr. Anderson is an incredible professor. Not only is he hilarious, but he has the ability to make every class interesting. His attendance policy is very lenient, and yet class is almost always full, as people actually want to come. Any class taught by Anderson is guaranteed to be a great class! Take him if you get the chance!

American Novel was a fantastic class. Dr. Anderson is so funny and loves to hear your ideas as a student. His renditions of Huck Finn are priceless. Lots of reading (some of it rather boring) but a really worthwhile class.

I'm surprised no1 has added Dr. Anderson yet, but I absolutely loved his class. He is the first Engl. professor that really took interest in helping me write and edit like a pro. It's a lot of difficult reading, but he makes it interesting! Only essays-He grades very hard but also lenient for any help and open to YOUR ideas. You will learn A LOT!!

I took this class Fall 2015, but his class was one of the best and most interesting I've taken yet. His lectures never bored me, the only struggle was the early hours. 10/10 would recommend, especially if you have to knock out a science requirement while taking more difficult courses.

Really nice guy. He is so passionate and actually cares about each individual student. The class isn't an easy A, but it is very attainable if you are willing to work for it. I wish all professors were like him.

Best class if you need a science. A really fantastic professor. He clearly loves what he does and clearly understands not everyone feels the same way. He let class out early. I didn't even buy the textbook. He gives pop quizzes in class but other than that everything can be learned in Google doc study guides.

Dr. Porter is great! I made B+ on all the tests and came out with an A due to the final and pop quizzes. There are 2 tests, 1 cumulative final and 6 pop quizzes. Be sure to read your book you pick for the final!

ECOL 1000: There were two tests, each being all multiple choice. The questions were very specific such as "how much money did Atlanta spend on pollution prevention in 2013". Attendance is not mandatory but he gives out 7 quizzes throughout the semester, and you can drop two. Everyone I know in the class made a low B on both tests.

LOVE HIM!! Have an actual crush on him he is SO nice, so enthusiastic about his subject, and easy. Gives in class pop quizzes but gives multiple chances to make them up if you miss a few. Tests are easy. I hate science classes but love this class because of him. Best teacher I have ever had definitely take this class. Don't buy textbook.

He was very enthusiastic about ecology. Class was interesting, I learned a lot. Lectures can be long, but most are quite interesting. If you go to class, you'll get an A. Tests are easy, and quizzes are easy 100s if you're there for them. I feel like the point of the class was to get people to care about the environment, but it really worked.

Dr. Porter was very enthusiastic in lectures. Most of his lectures centered around issues that we are currently experiencing and he loves to throw his own accomplishments and findings in the lecture. 6 random pop quizzes, only 5 count and you can go to an outside lecture to get a free 100 on one of them. 3 tests cover the other 75% of the grade.

supposedly a really easy class and it would be if it was more organized and less focused on the professor's accomplishments and whatnot. left every class feeling like i'd learned nothing about ecology and only about all the amazing things porter's accomplished. made it difficult when the test actually asked questions about ecology.
Porter is GREAT. Very passionate about what he teaches, which makes it very easy to listen. Beware of only three grades in the class though. Actually study for midterm and final!

One of the most passionate/engaging teachers I've ever had. Makes you want to listen and go to class. The information is presented in a lot of interesting ways. Lots of cool facts and personal experiences. Random pop quizzes but you'll never mind going to class. EASY A

His Ecology course changed my life and he is one of my favorite professors at UGA. Dr. Porter sounds and looks like Albert Brooks, and brings such passion and enthusiasm to his lectures that it's impossible not to get excited about class. Take him!!
AWESOME! So Enthusiastic.  Changed the way I look at the environment.  A must take!

When he taught his second half of the class, it was interesting. He doesn't express his political views but makes it really clear. Sometimes the lectures can make you mad. It was difficult to determine what would be on the test, because he gives you no idea what will be on it. It was easy the first half when he wasn't teaching. I don't recommend it

Do not leave UGA without taking Dr. Porter. He is and amazing teacher! I loved going to class every day because of how passionate and enthusiastic he is about his research. This class was so interesting and really showed the truths and realities of our world today. Definitely take this class!

Best instructor ever. So passionate. I took this as my science requirement (before they changed the rules), but I honestly think this should be a required class at UGA. We can all learn so much about the future from this class. Dr. Porter is so geniune, take him if you're given the opportunity. Easy class, but so interesting.

Dr. Porter is the best professor I have had at UGA. His lectures are interesting because he really cares about what he is teaching. His excitement tends to rub off on his students, and I do not know anyone that didn't enjoy his class.

Dr. Porter doesn't have students, he has a fan club. Everyone clapped after his lectures. Don't believe me? TAKE THE CLASS! It changed my life. Porter is super informative and inspiring. Easily one of the best professors I've had at UGA.

Definitely THE best teacher i have taken so far! Never missed a class, he just made it so incredibly interesting! Opened my eyes to a lot of things and incredibly easy to understand. Absolutely hilarious and energetic. LOVED HIM AND HIS CLASS! Def. a class you must take if you are a UGA student.
Dr. Porter is the best teacher in UGA. There isnt good enough things to say!! TAKE HIS CLASS. It is a really easy A. You have two test and they come straight from the power point notes.

Anyone who didn't give Porter perfect ratings is silly. HANDS DOWN THE BEST PROFESSOR AT UGA. If you have a chance, take him. I could have cared less about ECOL but he really opens your eyes to the world. I'm serious, you'll know what a college class should be like by taking Porter. Do it

Dr. Porter is an awesome professor. He knows A LOT about his field. He also likes to show you all of the news clips he has been in, which are actually interesting. And, he loves to make fun of Bush, which is hilarious. Everyone should take his class. You won't regret it.

I think it's common knowledge by now that Dr. Porter is one of, if not THE best professor at UGA. Required or not, everyone should take his LAND 1000 class. He is incredibly enlightening and entertaining. Dr. Porter lives his subject. He's not shy about bashing Bush, and depending on your views, this can be either offensive or hilarious. TAKE HIM!
I LOVE THIS GUY!! I honestly wish I could take the class all over again.  He's honestly the best professor I've ever had! TAKE HIM!! You wont regret it.

Interesting class. Wasn't difficult at all. The two tests (no final) weren't bad and just covered lecture notes. You don't need the book. He had pop quizzes so you have to go to lecture.  And yes, he isn't shy about his political views, but he wasn't rude or offensive about it. Probably the easiest life science course. I'd definitely recommend him.
Very interesting class. His passion made it all that more enjoyable!

Very easy class, do not need the book. The class title should be changed to 'Liberal Propaganda', however. There were multiple classes where he did not even touch on the subject of ecology, rather took an hour and a half to bash anything and everything regarding the Right. Regardless, this is the easiest science class at UGA.

This class is super easy and mostly based off his notes but it is alot of stats and stuff so it's hard to remember it all. He's really liberal and does not try to hide it, which is kind of annoying. Don't bother buying the book never opened it.

I did not care about Ecology at all but Dr. Porter's class really changed my life.  I know it sounds cheesy, but he really is a great teacher and helps make you a more informed person while keeping lectures interesting.  Take this class!

This is absolutely the BEST teacher I have ever had!  Dr. Porter is enthusiastic, talented, and pulls all his points together flawlessly. He was also flown to D.C. to help the Obama administration choose scientific advisors. Definitely study all the random stats in the notes for the quizes, but overall a pretty easy class.

This classs is NOT as easy as i thought it would be. Lectures are very interesting and Mr. Porter is obviously very passionate about what he teaches- this makes class very enjoyable. But the notes are almost irrelevant to the tests and quizzes. It's hard to prepare for the exams.
Dr. Porter's class was the best I have taken at UGA. You will learn a ton in it and it is all applicable to the real world. The book is not necessary at all. Easy class, great man.

Porter was a great professor, who always kept lectures entertaining.  I took this course with the lab.  The class in itself is not bad, but the labs can be very time consuming and boring sometimes.  Other than that, the class is good if you want to help your GPA and learn about the environment.

Take this class and the lab as your science w/ lab requirement.  You won't regret it and it is an easy "A" course unless you are mentally deficient. To top it off Dr. Porter is actually a nice guy, easy to listen to and very approachable. While I disagree with some of his conclusions I think this class should actually be required at UGA.

Great professor who really cares about what he teaches.i actually enjoyed going to this class.extremely important guy,shows u cnn clips where he is their source of info.2 test,gives extra credit.test r all multiple choice.one essay.u should get an A in this class
Dr. Porter is awesome. I actually enjoy his class. He takes a lot of pride and interest in what he teaches. I think everyone should be required to take his class

Dr. Porter is amazing. His lectures are incredible and at the end of every class, we applauded him. This was the only class I attended every single day; seriously, you will want to come to class. He really knows his stuff and has been doing really important research since before we were born. His tests are essay tests and they are kind of hard.
Porter was hands down the best prof i ever had. I am a math major, but this was probably the best class i have taken at UGA so far.
he rocks! awesome! EXTREMELY EASY CLASS!
really good teacher, his lectures make you want to come to class. i would highly reccomend
He is really interesting and shows lots of video clips.  Class always gets out at least fifteen minutes early at least.

Dr. Porter's class is Very interesting throughout the whole semester.  We didnt use the book AT ALL.  Only 2 tests and no final.  Attendance not mandatory.  The lab (optional) is long but still learned a lot of great info.
This is a very interesting and fun teacher, who wants you to learn about his passions and concerns witth the environment.

This is a course that every student at UGA should take. It opened my eyes to environmental issues that affect everyone, to be specific, global warming. Even as a Republican (and anti tree hugger), global warming has become an issue that is one of the most important to me because of this course. Dr. Porter will make you want to come to class.

One of the nicest professors I've had. He is truly passionate about his subject, and is a raging liberal (which I loved). Lectures are a little long if you're not interested in the subject, but most of his notes are in the reading. He really just wants to depart knowledge, and obviously loves teaching.

Porter is one of the best profs at UGA. He knows what he is talking about and teaches an intro class like it should be taught. He gives exciting lectures you actually want to attend. He also keeps class light with only 2 tests and a book report. He has been inspiration to me for my major. Teaches and researches with a passion. Great guy.

Dr. Porter is the most amazing professor I've had thus far at UGA!  He is very enthusiastic about the material which makes the class that much more enjoyable!  If you really take him seriously, you will enjoy his lectures and will get something out of the class.  Lab is very easy (just attend and do the work), tests are easy too, didn't need book.
Really great teacher, very interesting class! Tests are somewhat challenging but aren't too bad, just make sure you study his lecture notes and go to class.

Dr. Porter was truling enlightening. With most classes, you'll never take anything with you outside of the classroom into the real world. This class has not only given me knowledge, it has given me an awareness for world we live in. Dr. Porter is an INTERNATIONALLY respected teacher, lecturer, researcher, and friend to any student that he teaches.
dr. porter is a wonderful professor! i recommend this class even if you have science out of the way - very interesting!  he has a genuine passion for teaching this course.

Dr. Porter's class is one of the top 3 I've taken. I typically hate sciences, but this ecology class is incredibly applicable to whatever you're interested in. The tests, lab reports, and book report are easy and the lectures are freaking incredible. Take LAND 1000 if you don't need a lab, and ECOL 1000 if you need a lab, it's the same class.

Very knowledgeable professor, love the vids in the class and how we get to see him in CNN and National Geographic. Your grade on this class truly depends on the lab. Take him, easiest "science" you can get.
Dr. Porter's lectures are fun and exciting.  He makes you want to come to class and learn!

The best option possible if you need a lab science credit.  His lectures are very interesting and keep your attention, and if you actually show up and pay attention to the lectures, you'll get an easy A.  And most importantly, he just might change the way you think.  One of the two or three best classes I've had at the University
Class was so easy. Just study his lecture notes and you don't even have to take your own notes.  It was interesting; he is very liberal and likes to project his views onto the class.
Very good teacher, best I've had yet.  Very liberal, but I respect his views only because of how nice of a guy he is....TAKE HIM!!

Fantastic - one of best teachers @ UGA.  Different subject every day.  Drastically changed my attitude.  Best class I have taken @ UGA and have already recommended to friends.  Tests relatively easy - lab  depends on TA.

I pretty much stopped going to lecture b/c they were so liberal and still did well on tests. Just buy the lecture slide notes and study them. Smart man, but some of his arguments are questionable (criticized govt for paying for Katrina cleanup). Labs suck, have to do work for them, depends on TA how well you do on lab grade.

Fond memories of Porter in the honors science sequence several years ago. Intelligent, kind soul who got me (a history  major) interested in biology. !! One of the first UGA professors I had who didn't seem to see his students as faceless numbers. He sort of felt like my dad.
Porter is a great teacher!!!  I loved his class.

Dr. Porter is one of the best professors on campus! I appreciate the fact that he ENJOYS teaching and does a GREAT job making his class feel his excitement! His lectures are so interesting and you can tell he knows what he's talking about. Whether you like lab depends on the TA. Overall, this class is superb!

Porter's lectures are relevant and interesting. He really does deserve a round of applause at the end of class. Fun to see Repubs get ticked off. First test had unbelievable curve. Labs require a lot of writing and braving of elements, but they're probably easier than those of any other science class.
amazing class.  recommended for anyone even those who hate science.  will open your eyes to issues in the everyday world that you may never have thought of.  TAKE THIS CLASS.

One of the top 5 classes I have ever taken here at UGA.  A lot of the time his lectures were so amazing it felt as though applause was needed.  The labs for this class were also very different and interesting.

Porter is an EXCELLENT teacher. You don't mind going to class because each lecture is different and so interesting and especially enjoyable because of the passion he puts into them. Strongly recommend for a science course.
Great Prof. really gets you interested even when you thought you wouldnt be.
One of the best professors I have ever taken a class under!
This is an awesome class! I'm not a science person and I loved it. He is very entertaining and very passionate about the environment and best of all its not too hard either.
Very helpful teacher. I went to office hours a few times when I was confused and she always answered any question I had.  I couldn't have asked for a more helpful teacher.

The class is hard, but she will almost always go over questions you have if you write them down and give them to her. She usually puts time aside to go over these questions. (I've never gone to office hours for this reason.) I don't know if she does this every semester, but our last three days were just her going over any questions on the final.

Mrs. Warnes is extremely nice and always willing to help! Precalc is a tough course but she does her best to help you succeed, including dropping a few grades to get that average up! Definitely recommend her!

She's so awesome!! I have never been able to understand pre calc and she helped me every step of the way! I never needed to go to office hours, but she'll take time out of class to help explain anything that people may be unsure of!
Assigns homework not even she knows how to do. Read: came to her with a homework problem I didn't understand and she didn't know how to work it either.

I don't know why so many students complain about Mrs. Warnes because she's a good professor! Just pay attention in class and if you don't get the concepts, see her during office hours and she'll help. The final is cumulative, but just study your past tests and you'll be fine. The project is an easy A and takes no time. Tests are straight forward.
She isn't clear, she does not answer questions clearly, does not know peoples names, and tries to guess your name. Not a good teacher and i would not take her again.

Professor Warnes is very boring. Her class is very boring. She is not very personable. Somedays she is in bad moods, somedays she is in better moods. Sitting through her class is like approaching the event horizon of a black hole where time dilation turns seconds into eons.
Terrible teacher who makes no extra effort to help you learn.

Professor Warnes is a good teacher. If you are expecting a teacher to hand you an A, thats not her. She makes you work for your grades and her class is challenging. You have to constantly keep up with your studying and make sure to do your homework and web quizzes. Overall it was a tough class, but it should be tough; you are in college.

For the sake of your GPA, DO NOT take this professor. She is essentially useless and will not help you with anything. Her handwriting is barely legible, she cannot add and subtract, she is very forgetful, and it is made very clear that she has absolutely no idea what she is talking about. Tests are too hard. Homework is ridiculous.

In my experience, she was a good teacher. She works problems out step by step and doesn't have a problem explaining the steps she took. She's approachable and sweet AND she focuses on application problems, which are usually the hardest on tests. I'd recommend her.

Horrendous instructor. Get ready to teach yourself the material, because Warnes will not be of assistance. She works most of the example problems wrong, won't answer students' questions, and rushes you through exams and quizzes. Worst math professor I have ever experienced.

This professor is absolutely awful. Math 1060 should not have been an overly difficult class, but Warnes didn't teach! She expected us to just figure out everything by ourselves. If you asked a question, she would smirk and ask a question back or tell you to find it in the book. She worked the example problems wrong the majority of the time. Awful.

Do not take this professor. She is not helpful, at all. If you ask her a question, she responds with a question. She makes many errors in problems she shows and says "I don't know arithmetic." If you go to her office hours, she will not help you. The tests are very hard, and the homework is ridiculous. Homework every night + quizzes 2 times a week.

Ridiculous, horrible teacher. Makes no sense when explaining anything, writes poorly organized and haphazard notes, makes mistakes, isn't clear about what she's even talking about it. Clueless when you ask her a question, usually answers with something unrelated. You're better off teaching yourself.

Absolute worst teacher I have ever had in my life. I'm taking math 1101 because I have to have it for graduation, and it is complete torture. She does not teach and does not put together lessons. You do the homework, and then come to class and ask questions if you have them. FIND ANOTHER MATH TEACHER!
I didn't like her at all. She didn't make the class easy and wasn't very helpful.

I definitely recommend Mrs. Warnes. She is the sweetest lady and definitely knows her math. She's extremely patient. Her in class quizzes are the hardest aspect about the class but she drops your 2-3 lowest grades. She's excellent!

She was very sweet and definitely cares about her students. But she is very her way or the highway when it comes time to trig. I wanted help with the unit circle and she completely ignored me. i got help outside of class instead. During the trig unit she just kind of gives up. the class itself is just hard, so she does help to dumb it down.

I would definitely recommend Mrs. Warnes for Pre-Cal. The material itself is challenging, but she usually explained it very well. Occasionally everyone in the class would get confused, but she always reexplained it if we needed her too. Definitely take advantage of her office hours. She is always available for help outside of class, which is great!

Her examples in class are never really in the homework so you HAVE to read the book to understand, but the book was very hard to understand. I spent at least 3-5 hours on homework only to fail it!! And her tests are always hard even though she says they're easy. She's very nice but just not a great teacher :/
