I personally found this class really hard. She is indeed very sweet, but her teaching style is not helpful whatsoever. You have to use the book most of the time and the book was confusing.

Professor Warnes is extremely nice and wants her students to do well. She welcomes questions, all you have to do is ask. That said, she expects you to work for your grade. Homework can be time-consuming and the tests aren't easy. But if you actually take the time to learn the formulas that she gives you and do the homework, you should be fine.

She is a super nice lady and is extremely willing to help as much as she can, and she truly cares about how you are doing in the course. She really does want you to do well. The class was hard for me, but I'm terrible at math.
She wasn't very clear when it came to learning Trig. She just kind of gave up. Not being very good at trig already, it made me frustrated and impatient.

This teacher is horrible. She is the nicest person you will ever meet but she cannot teach to save her life most likely due to her age. The worst part about it is the homework. She makes you TYPE it and it takes at least 6 hours to complete all to get a failing grade on it because she grades so strictly. AVOID THIS TEACHER AT ALL COST!!!!!
She is an absolutely horrible teacher. It's really hard to understand her and she talks to you like your stupid. Definitely find another teacher.

The beginning of the semester was not as bad but towards the end, the things we were learning were extremely HARD! I hated using WebAssign because it took off points. Overall the instructor was helpful. Class was not that bad, but if you fall behind on one section then your out of luck.

I would not recommend this professor at all. She is willing to answer questions from the homework and webquizzes, but her methods don't make any sense, particularly in the trig unit. You do better teaching yourself. She also talks to you like you're stupid when you have a question. DEFINITELY find a different professor.

Mrs. Warnes is an excellent teacher. She seems helpful enough and will answer any questions from Webquizes/ homeworks. The only downside is that one can only miss three unexcused days of class. She is fairly easy to understand and gives really helpful hints and shortcuts on how to remember and solve problems. She also drops grades.
terrible seriously aviod

She is okay. The material isn't too difficult. Just try hard and do the homework and quizzes, they are exactly like the tests. Don't EVER miss a class. If you miss just one class you get WAY behind. And then you're screwed because the book sucks. Good luck!!

Although I didn't find the class material to be difficult, I really struggled with the teacher of the class. She never thinks that she makes mistakes (even if only a fraction of the class finishes the test, she insists that it's the students' fault). She wasn't nice to students either when they didn't understand.

don't take this class.  my roommate took 1060 with henden and had it 10 times easier.  she gives homework that takes way to long, her test screw u cause they are confusing and she grades every little nit picky detail.  for example, i got a 116.7 out of 150.  how the heck do you get a .7? thats how crazy she is.  and she is getting senile

DO NOT TAKE THIS TEACHER! i have studied and done every homework assignment.. which by the way KILLS your grade. her grading system is horrible and i have to teach myself the concepts. get the book because you will definitely need it. if you aren't a math whiz to begin with do not, under any circumstance, take this teacher!!!!!!!!!

The tests are really easy, but her grading is questionable. The homework kills you and is much harder than the tests. The lectures are pretty descent. It gets easier the farther you go along and she gives her final grades based on how the class did as a whole. I had an 85 and ended up with an A-

Nice person but a horrible teacher, tests are ridiculous and there are only 15 questions out of 120 points so each question is worth 8 or more points. homework is more harmful then helpful and overall it was a horrible class. DO NOT TAKE!!!
She gets distracted and has to start teaching over again. Fairly easy class if you put a little effort in.
Not an easy class. you HAVE to use the book. if you miss classes you get way behind. dont recommend
My advice to you: don't take this teacher if you struggle with math to begin with, because this class only made things that much worse for me. Hard to follow, hard tests, just awful.

Great teacher!! She was always willing to help and answer questions. Her quizzes are not too bad and she does not count them all. She is also such a sweet lady. J-exam is the bad thing, not her. I would recomend her!

Professor Warnes is an awful teacher. She dose not teach the material well, and sometimes it's hard to follow her. Her tests are hard and not consistent. I made As and Bs on all her quizzes but never made higher than a C- on any of her tests. I recommend not taking her if you have a hard time with math. I am very good at math but I had a hard time

She is a nice lady, but not a very good teacher.  Often makes many mistakes while working problems for the class. Tests very from easy to hard,  without any kind of warning of a change.  Not an easy A class like it should be.  Concepts are simple, but she makes them hard.
very helpful and great teacher. you have to go to class, but if you ask questions then she will help you get an A! her quizzes are relatively easy and if you study them you will do good on the tests
Good teacher who is nice and helpful.

She is an o.k teacher! she tries really hard and wants you to do well and pass! it is J-exam that sucks! but it is easy to master once you get the hang of it! but she is a good teacher. just a little hard to follow some times
Nice teacher. Pre-Cal's pretty easy. To be honest in any Pre-Cal class at UGA all you have to do to make a good grade is study JEXAM practice tests and homeworks before the exam.

I didn't understand her lectures some of the time, but the problems she assigns for homework (book and JEXAM) are important for tests.  As long as you study the JEXAM problems, you'll do fine on the tests.

she is an awesome teacher!! she breaks math down so it is easy to understand. study jexam and you'll get an A! anyone should feel lucky to have her...really shes awesome!!! huge heart and wants her students to succeed!

Mrs. Warnes is an excellent teacher. She's very clear and offers help to those who need it. Very compassionate about her job and makes it her concern that you succeed if you show effort. Tests are on JEXAM. They are considerably easy becuase they are just like the practice test. An easy A, if you study.

I dont know why she has such a bad review, I thought she was one of the most compassionate, helpful, and knowledgeable math teachers I've ever had. She made pre-calc easy to understand and spent time really getting us ready for calc. The tests are reasonable, her lectures werent boring, and if you study and spend time on the subject it's an easy A.
No Comments
She was a terrible teacher, the only reason I made a C was from pure luck. She didn't explain methods very well and if you asked a question in class, she made you look stupid!
TERRIBLE! AVOID THIS LADY AT ALL COSTS!
No Comments
Ms. Warnes is one of the best teachers I have ever had.  She was very helpful and most of the time she was clear.  I highly recomend her.
EXCELLENT!  She made everything so easy and made me actually want to go to class. She's the best math teacher I've ever had.  Highly recommended.
She is wonderful.  Very helpful and knows her stuff.  She seems a little tough at first, but stick with her. I would never want another math class unless it was taught by her.

This lady was a nightmare. Math1060 is supposed to be an easy class however she effectively made everyone feel like a complete idiot. The course materal is pretty interesting but the way she lead us through the semester was at times very frustrating. She did keep up nicely with webCT.

very good teacher, especially if you have her for intensive. knows her stuff and is always willing to help you, i would recommend her to anyone. what went from not knowing anything to feeling comfortable about going into calculus
mrs. warnes was the best math teach ive ever had. she is awesome.
Really good teacher. Did a great job, and was very helpful, and didn't mind answering questions.
Had her for intensive pre-cal. Hands down, the best math teacher I've ever had. Will go the extra mile to help you if you go to her and ask.

She is not clear at all when she teaches, & most of your notes will have to be added to by your personal work. It's not hard content but she doesn't do enough to help the students understand how to apply procedures. The you are left to do it on your own.
Wise

Dr. Harrison is easily my favorite professor at UGA. This is my second class with him and he has continuously shown me that he cares about his students success and wants us to understand everything. If everyone did poorly on the test, he always added extra points. Minimal work, but study for tests.

Hard phil class. Do not recommend if not in your major. Harsh. grader and the class is not relevant if you are not a phil major. Easy workload though if you want to study for only three tests that is your entire grade
ratingTags_Rating: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment_Rating: Professor Harrison is pretty fair with his grading. If you show up to class and pay attention, you can expect to do well. Otherwise he isn't afraid to fail students. The content of his lectures is truly incredible, as he enjoys applying old philosophy to typical problems students face. Beware, though, he is a very traditional/conservative person.

Dr. Harrison is THE MAN!!! He really pulled through when I should have failed a test and he made most of the tests easy enough. I did a lot of practice problems (his syllabus isn't joking when he says you have to dedicate hours per day) but it was worth it in the end. Don't take this class with a hard class load, but DO take this class!

He wanted you to get a good grade in the class. He gave out ten bonus points initially, but after that you were on your own. The class was rough and not to many people made A's. However, he was fair. He calls people up the board, and if you get the question wrong he's going to humiliate you. This motivated me to do all the book work before class.

He was a really nice guy and his lectures were never boring because of his sense of humor, but the tests were not really dependent on having been present in class.  Most of the work needed to get a good grade takes place outside of class.  Overall, I enjoyed the class because Frank is so funny.

Professor Harrison taught when I was a student more than forty years ago. He was thoughtful and   helpful. I did not take his classes, but he was a critical intelligence at work when he contributed to seminars and forums. It delights me that he is still teaching at Georgia. Take his classes. He will challenge you to think.

Great professor!  The class is NOT easy, and if you expect to express any opinions you have, make sure you have a reasonable way to back them up.  So do not expect to enter a class where 'every opinion is equal.'  Although he can seem somewhat uncaring about others during class, he is extremely helpful and friendly to his students outside class.

Harrison is a really great guy and he loves to hang out with his students after class. It still doesn't change the fact that his class is pretty hard and you're going to have to read a lot to make a decent grade. The class is pretty much for people interested in philosophy, it's definitely not an elective!
If you read the material and take lots of notes, you'll do just fine. He's a fair grader. Unfortunately, he's kind of overbearing and pretentious. Not a bad guy, but not my cup of tea.
Unlik most professors, he really makes you work for your grade.  Most of my classmates were used to being spoon fed and hated him.  But is you are smart and work, it is well worth while.

Fails to prepare students for his tests. Merely brushes over material, lecturing mostly on opinion rather than literary analysis. Shows up late on tests days yet loves to preach about moral responsiblity. He does not allow for very much discussion considering he reads straight from his notes from start to finish.

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS! the journals will kill you and he often does not grade them fairly. he talks a lot without saying anything at all. really boring. no discussion at all. get ready to listen to him talk about his granddaughter and warped view on the world. ahhhhhhhhhh.
He told my class he's purposefully meaner and more difficult before midpoint withdrawal to weed out the "weaker" students.
The class is as hard as it is worthwhile. Highly recommended.

Great professor! The lectures are very entertaining and informative. He will tell you exactly what to expect and sticks to it. This isn't the easiest class, but it was very enjoyable and you learn a lot. Class is never boring if you have any interest and he is very helpful. Go in expecting to have a good time, but be challenged at the same time.

LOVED this class.  Frank's hilarious-- you just have to learn to deal with his old humor.  very religious, but it's not too bad (from an agnostic).  very knowledgeable about symbolic logic, and the class is actually rather fun if you like proofs.  it's not at all hard if you do the work, but like any math-type thing, the work must be done.

Yeah, I signed up for this Freshman seminar on Morality and Critical Thinking, hoping it would be interesting and mind stimulating... yeah, only for him.  Get ready to sit and listen to him talk about HIS opinions.
Worst teacher at UGa that I have had.

Dude, it's Frank! Frank's the man. He's been teaching this subject for FOREVER, and definitely has it down backwards and forwards. He's always engaging, friendly, and willing to help, even if he's inflexible when it comes to the course objectives and the difficulty of the class. The tests are tough, but you'll do fine if you study.

He expected a lot from us. The midterm was over 3 books, 15+ scholarly articles(20-40 pages each), and the lectures. It was the hardest test Ive ever taken. Go to his office hours! He helped me a lot with my paper. At the end of the year he let me do an extra credit project that allowed me to get an A- not a B-! He really cares about his students
ratingTags_Rating: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment_Rating: Eddy was an interesting guy. His lectures were engaging but he went off on tangents all the time. We were graded on 4 speeches, a midterm paper, and a final. The final had pretty much NOTHING to do with the rest of the class... and he was a tough grader. He respected his students, though, and made himself accessible outside of class

Go out of your way to not take this class. The whole class he goes off on tangents, PowerPoints with one bullet point each, expects you to know everything on your own. The midterm was absolutely ridiculous asking us to memorize so much random stuff. The final exam was over things he never taught in class. Undergrads are not at the level he expects
ratingTags_Rating: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY

comment_Rating: This class was amazing. The only thing that would make it better is if he were to wear Leather Pants.
Took his political debates FYOS and it was very beneficial. He's one of the most intellectual professors I've encountered and without a doubt one of the most concerned with his students' success.

He expects A LOT, especially at the beginning. Midterm alone was over 3 books, lectures, several articles and context from the current election. There's a 10-15 pg. paper and a group presentation with a 10-15 pg. paper as well. He's not a harsh grader though, so you can make an A if you work hard. He's also really funny, so I grew to love him.
No Comments
No Comments

Dr. Quick is a GREAT professor--he always keeps class interesting and fun. I would definitely recommend taking his class and would take it again in a heartbeat. Be prepared to read and write a lot though. Do what you're supposed to do (and do it well) and participate in class and you will do fine.

I have never posted a review before, but I HAD to for Dr. Quick. He is my favorite English professor I've had. His lectures are HILARIOUS, insightful, and can make anyone love the literature.  Not overwhelming work, but you need to keep up with reading and attendance is through daily grades. He helped me to write killer essays by the third big one!

Take Dr. Quick if you actually want to learn. You will come away with a much broader knowledge of literature, but you will have to work for your grade. Go to class, do the readings (he gives pop quizzes daily), and most importantly--go meet with him during office hours. The essays are difficult, but he will help you if you visit him.

Dr. Quick is really cool. He is one of the smartest, most insightful professors I have ever had. His lectures are fun and cool and involved. However, he isn't really clear on what he wants from you regarding assignments and proved to be a rather difficult grader. But his class is amazing and he's a really fun guy.

Dr. Quick is extremely passionate and knowledgeable about both literature and teaching. He creates assignments to help you learn the material but also better your writing abilities for other classes. He has stopped class to say hi to guide dogs, bought the class donuts,  and makes the best corny jokes. One of my favorite professors for sure.

Words can't describe how amazing he is. Dr. Quick changed my perspective on teaching. He is funny and friendly. Keeps everything interesting, makes learning fun. He is passionate about his field. His learning goals meet students needs. Always teaches, never preaches. Engaging class activities. He is extremely helpful. BEST. PROFESSOR. EVER.

I'm at the end of my college career and have had many professors but he's by far one of my favorites. Great teacher who is understanding, caring, funny, smart and willing to help with whatever. I highly recommend getting to know him outside of  class. (I think he can be opinionated but not at all close minded- he doesn't force his views on anyone.)

Dr. Quick's passion for the subject matter and sense of humor permeate all levels of his teaching. His class isn't hard, but you will need to do all of the assigned work. Great teacher and would highly recommend him to anyone, regardless of their major.
Dr. Quick is wonderful. He is passionate about English (and life) and that passion is absolutely contagious.  You can't go wrong by taking any class he teaches!

Dr. Quick is my favorite professor ever!! He is the nicest man and is willing to help you with whatever. I hate English classes but I will miss his class. He is very funny and kept it entertaining. Do the readings to raise your daily grades in case you don't do well on the papers. I love Quick and honored to have gotten to know him!

Dr. Quick is a really nice guy and keeps the class entertaining. You have to do the reading assigned everyday (clicker quizzes that bomb your grade if you don't). A lot of work. 3 papers, 3 novels, story quizzes, lecture quizzes, presentation, end portfolio, and the final was really long. Good class though. Quick is a funny dude.

Dr. Quick is an amazing professor! He is the kind of professor that I would take more English classes just to have him again. I had him for my freshman seminar and he was so helpful in acclimating us the University, helping us grow close as a class, and was an amazing man. Class was about McCarthy and he made it funny and interesting. GREAT!!!
Great professor and teacher. Very entertaining and relevant! I would recommend his classes to anyone!

I don't know how he has any negative reviews on here. Dr. Quick is funny, interesting, and always willing to help. He does have his own, specific ideas about the meanings behind readings, but he's not close-minded at all. Good readings, fair grading, decent discussions. He's a great person to get to know- Definitely would take his class again!
Prof. Quick is a great professor. He grades papers a bit hard but overall he is a great professor. He keeps the class interesting and always got the class laughing.

I had a terrible experience in this class but ended up with a B+. Paul Quick is the kind of English professor who intentionally grades harshly at first to "prove a point" and then ends up giving out As & Bs. Harsh grading for an entry level English class. He is extremely arrogant and close minded, but the class its self was very interesting.

Greatest teacher ever! I loved his class. He doesn't take role but he gives in class assignments that help your grade tremendously. I only missed one class and thats because I absolutely could not be there. I LOVED going!

Great teacher!He told me one time he wanted a pepper and he deserves one! He is a great teacher, very helpful!He presents the information in a way that is easy to understand It is a lot of reading and I am not much of a reader but I've started to like it a lot more because the material he picks is interesting to say the least.I love professor Quick

Honestly my favorite professor of all time-- he's interesting, quirky, and most importantly, he knows what he's talking about. I've taken two classes with him so far and wish that I could take more. This class was always the highligh of my day.

Dr. Quick is truly a breath of fresh air.  Enthusiastic, funny, interested, and invested. He'll help you any way he can...you just have to ask.  He grades tough on the papers, but is the best professor I have had at this university, hands down.  A little scattered at times, but worth it.

He was the bestest.... He was helpful in more than academics. He did not mind offering his time to you. He is a gem among gems. He also related all the work together and made it more relevant to everyday life. The best prof alive.....
awesomest prof ever...but get ready to write. He makes you earn your grades
I thought that Paul was condescending and unwilling to be flexible.
So much fun, even at 8am!  Paper grades are hard, but he compensates with tests and final project.  He likes people with personality who will speak up in class.  Fabulous professor and great guy.
Dr. Q is soooo awesome! FUN FUN FUN class, the papers are demanding but not impossible and the atmosphere is exciting and fun!

PQ is one crazy man. Paper grading was hard, but if you stick with him and go for help, he'll definately ease the pain. Tests weren't too bad. Outspoken and appreciates it when his class is as well. Warning: may go through bouts of excessive giddiness and/or dancing.

a lot of reading, but he makes the class very interesting. don't let the quizes intimidate you. they won't hurt your grade much. he gives two exams primarily to help raise your grade and take emphasis off papers, so they're easy. i loved this class and highly recommend it.
Heavy reading load.  Makes a realtivly uninteresting topic interesting.  Grades papers harshly, but compensates with easy grading on tests and projects.
entertaining in class but paper grading is too difficult
No Comments

He is heavy on readings and gives daily quizes over the readings which are pretty difficult even if you read.  He is a pretty hard grader on papers, but for the most part very fair he just expets a lot.  Classes can get boring unless the class is outspoken.  Likes group work which is unbeneficial.
Straight to the point.  Have to come to class to get the notes.  Even if you don't come to class you can still make an A but do the study quide.  Super nice.
She's so nice and she make the material as clear as she can. I really enjoyed the class even though it was at 9 am. Tests are kinda hard, do the study guide!
You don't need the book and you don't need to go to class.  Just make sure that you know and understand everything on the WebCT notes and you will make an "A"

She explained every inch of the material extremely well. She definately knows this stuff and obviously loves to teach it, which definately makes for better teaching. The only work is in labs, and they arent difficult if you pay attention to the TA's synopsis of the lab. Her notes on WebCT coincide almost exactly with her powerpoints. Easy!
Pretty straight forward teacher. However the tests are not as easy as she makes them out to be.. study the notes online.. not the ones from the class. class notes will help for verification though.

She can be a little monotone, which makes it rougher to stay awake. Other than that she's a good teacher. She always gives review sheets for the tests and a practice test. Grades are also curved quite a bit in everyone's favor. But the tests can be very tricky...

She is a very nice lady who knows a lot about Geography. Her passion helps to make a pretty dry topic somewhat interesting. Only having 4 tests means you have to do well, and the tests are pretty tough. The books are never used, and she does not take attendance.

she's a really sweet lady. i enjoyed her class. she is straight forward about everything and the tests can be a little hard but study and they are easy to ace. her photography at the end of class is a nice touch.
This class was not to hard, but you realy need to study.  She only gives you 4 tests and no extra credit, so if you do poorly on the tests then you are not going to make the grade!!  Boring

Very easy..just make sure to look at the notes before the night of the test.  The textbook, is a waste of money...I never opened it once.  She puts allll the notes online along w/ study guides and practice tests.  She also curves a lot. And b/c of WebCt it is really unneccessary to go to class

Easy class. Attendance isn't neccesary, because her notes are online. Didn't buy the textbook. She is an interesting lecturer. Pay attention to concepts and examples- this is what she will test on. Got an easy A.
Easy, enjoyable class; don't even bother buying the textbook as all the notes you need are online. Her tests do make you think, so make sure you're clear on all the concepts beforehand.

Easiest class ever! I NEVER went to class and I NEVER read the book and still pulled an easy B, I totally could have had and A if I hadn't bombed the first test. She curves the grade so a 75ish is a B. All the notes are online and there are practice tests that basically are the content of the actual test. I DEFINITELY recommend this class.

Kinda boring class, but easy. Notes are available on WebCT and there is no attendance policy, so it's easy to skip class. Pictures she shows are interesting, but overall, the material is boring. Really sweet lady.
Excellent professor! Super nice, and didn't assign any textbooks.
Soooo easy. I went to class 6 times-4 tests and 2 other classes and I still got an easy A! Just study the internet notes-there's a lot for each test, but it beats going to class!

If you study, you'll make an A. If not, you can pull a B and maybe a C. She is a good professor though. Although she does almost just read straight down the page of notes in class so I skipped a lot and still got a B.

Easy class if you're interested in climate and weather and volcanos and stuff like that.  I enjoyed her class...copied down the lecture notes and rarely used the book.  she posts the lecture notes on WebCT along with very helpful study guides.  Go to class, listen and study and you'll get an A...if you don't go, you can pull out a B.
Boring class, no attendence, tests aren't too bad if you study and she curves them.  Easy class if willing to do some studying, no other work besides it.

Very boring unless you are just interested in climates and air pressure.  Tests are hard but she curves.  No attendance policy. Puts notes on WEB CT but lectures help on tests.  WEB CT notes good source for studying. Overall okay just boring!

Wow, I don't know where to start with. Akira is a very supportive teacher and has a structured lesson plan that enables optimal learning. I had a better comprehension of the material than my previous semester with an equally talented teacher.

I took another teacher's 1101 last semester. Good: His grammar explanations are crystal clear. He can explain difficult concepts very well. He can answer any questions we throw at him. Bad: He loses his temper quite easily - like, when students are chatting, he'd yell at them. He looks very sweet but not really. But he's like one of a kind teacher.

I probably know the person that posted before me because this is my 2nd semester with him too. He's an excellent teacher! He has strict classroom rules, yeah, seriously. Compared to last semester, he is more organized and just seems happier this semester, probably because all the dumb kids are gone. Very clear and easy to understand. Love him! <3

Akira-sensei is AMAZING. Even though he's from Osaka, he speaks clear and fluent english. In and out of class he gives great help to anyone who needs it. His lessons are easy to understand and as long as you do the homework and study for a bit, you will do well. This is my second semester with him and hope he teaches JPNS 2001 next semester.

I took Akira'S 1101. I was, very surprised by his command of English. Plus, he's hottt. I have many Japanese friends but he speaks like someone that grew up here. I guess he is very fair and accepting. He can be mean, however. The only times I saw him "mad" were when a girl left the classroom and a Korean girl missed the final. Lame.
No Comments

Akira's interesting.  While he does know his subject (being a native speaker), he often had trouble explaining certain things.  Also, he was late to class a lot and sometimes didn't show at all.  But he's a decent teacher and a funny guy; it's pretty hard to fail his class.

I also heard about akira sensei's reputation and I totally loved him. OMG, he's beautiful. Attendance policy sucks - but it's departmental. He was very helpful during his office hours. He is always there to help us when we need it. I hated my stupid classmates because they always ask stupid questions. Sorry for akira sensei. Oh, mini-drama rocks!

Prior to taking Kondo's class, I took JPNS1001 with another TA. When I came into his class, I was amazed to learn how great his teaching ability is compared to my previous teacher. He absolutely knows difficult points for ENglish speakers to learn the language. He is the coolest teacher I've evern known. I am taking his JPNS2001 next semester.

Akira Sensei is a funny guy and I really like him, but, he has a bad habit of being late to class at times. There is a lot of studying and working from the workbook and lots of quizes. The mini-drama can be annoying if the people in your group are being difficult.

I took his JPNS1102 after 1101. I liked the way he taught us but unfortunately sometimes we got lost when he was explaining grammar because his understanding of grammar in English/Japanese is way beyond us. I didn't like mini-drama because my group members were so stpid and they didn't do any job. He's probably too smart to teach at UGA.

First of all, he stresses attendance, and drops a letter grade if you miss more than 6, WHILE he is absent even more than the students. We had to wait 2 hours for him to arrive on mini-drama day(when it was suppose to be reading day across UGA) Very rude, very strict about grading, and a simply awful awful teacher. I got a B in his class.

He is an untraditional teacher in many ways. He's very friendly and close (whereas many other professors and TAs are constantly dissatisfied with their students and whatnot) to his students. He play a role as a teacher but he's cool. His knowledge on language in general is superior and that made me have an interest in language and linguistics.

Akira sensei is an excellent teacher. He teaches Japanese with a complete understanding of how to get the point across. The attendance policy sucks, but its departmental. He is very fair, and is always willing to help. If you are taking Japanese, he is the TA to take it with!

The difficulty of this course is not completely Akira-sensei's fault - the department mandates that we move WAY too fast through the textbook, and the emphasis is on rote memorization, not retention.  Also Akira-sensei grades way too strictly.  That said, he is very funny and very helpful/available (just don't expect him to change your grade).

kondo is a good teacher. however this class is A LOT of work. you must be committed to studying everyday b/c there's always a quiz or test the next day. but if you really want to learn japanese, you will learn a lot b/c the class is fast-paced.

He is an awesome funny teacher. The subject is of course difficult and he must move fast to cover it all but he is good at using up-to-date tactics in teaching and is really good at simplifying the explanations.
He is a great teacher!  He is clear, and is dedicated to teaching.  He has a great sense of humor and will stay after class to help you if needed.  I'll miss him after 1002!

Akira does lots of things for his students, all around nice guy.  What a lot of people don't realize is that the amount of quizzes/tests/homework assignments he assigns is By the Department!  Every Japanese class has lots of work.  He does his best to explain grammatical concepts.  He does pick on people but it's everyone.  Hilarious drawings!!

He is a great teacher. He is effective at teaching.  The volume of the work will kill you.  Everyday you will have work.  He even gave us a lot of homework between Fall and Spring Semesters.  The material is not difficult, but the pace will hurt.

i got an A, but i have to agree with some of the comments about his grading being unfair. he definitely has his favorites and his not-so-favorite students. he would tease or pick on students who didn't do well in his class or students who didn't pronounce words correctly. his class isn't easy, but not hard, but you do learn a lot about the culture.

He is cute and knowledgable (well, he is Japanese) but the course is quite loaded, he would assigns HW everyday and assignments due every day, but good things is he breaks the distribution of marks into many differnt components so even if you did bad in one, you still have chances to get the marks back.

Took his first year (semester) teaching class. He is much better than our previous teacher. He tends to be too *grammar oriented* (probably beause he's a linguistic person? .. i don't know what he studies..). btw, he is not *a professor*. he's a TA - he understands us students. his grading is tough. but he's always there for extra help.

I was kind of curious about akira-sensei when I saw his name in oasis this semester because of the bad ratings some people gave him. Very surprised to learn that he's been here for only 2 years but he speaks perfect English. His explanations are always clear. Akira-sensei has a great sense of humor and truely dedicated to teaching.

I never really found anything hard about this class. The sheer number of quizzes could either hurt you or help you, that's it. If you simply tried then you couldn't possibly do badly. Kondo-sensei always made class interesting, whether by himself or merely by the presence of assistants. Though often unclear with answers, still was always helpful.

I can see he's truely dedicated to teaching and loves his students. Those who are ****ing about him must have been just lazy. His quizzes are somtimes hard and has a very strict attendance policy. I am hoping to have him again in JPNS2001. His grading policy is fair and I am just sad to see people complain because of the grade they got.
No Comments
No Comments

Very fun and helpful guy.  The quizzes and tests could range from easy to hard, but it didn't matter so much since they were pretty much every day.  I signed up for 1002 with him again...I recommend him.
Kondo communicates well with his students. He makes the class enjoyable while proficiently teaching the language and sharing cultural information.
His class was always fun and interesting, and he's usually very friendly.

He is wonderful. He is really young and he is a student too, so he understands. This class is really easy if you don't mind a little bit of studying, and he gives daily quiz/test grades so it is easy to do well even if you bomb a couple!

Rambles on and on about the same topics class after class. Boring, hard to pay attention, and not worth the hassle. Midterm average for the class was a 40 if that tells you anything about his ability to teach effectively.
ratingTags_Rating: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Lecture heavy

comment_Rating: He absolutely sucks
ratingTags_Rating: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment_Rating: Professor Godlas is a long winded professor. If you are going to take his class understand that he is 72 years old and will talk about parts of religion that will go over your head on the first day. He doesn't have much logistical awareness when it comes to assignments. He requires you to turn in all assignments printed out in person and online.

Do not take this class. I have no idea how I got an A. Dr. Godlas is an old man and although he's very knowledgeable About the content he is not good at relaying that information to students in any way and I swear to God he taught us the same thing every class for 5 weeks. Learned nothing.
didn't talk to him once in person or on zoom after the first day of class it was completely on your own. didn't learn but got an A so

Go to class and do the weekly HW assignments. If you take notes and read the text book (its just a book not a text book, cost $20) then you will get an A. I got 110 in the class with little to no effort. Also, great guy and you will learn cool things about various religious.

I have never written a professor review but Godlas was really something else. He skipped weeks of class to go to Turkey and India and California during the semester. Didn't grade any work and slaps grades on it as he pleases. Lecture heavy and they were unrelated to the course. Bad professor, terrible human. Don't take him. Better off on your own.

One group paper at the end of the semester. Weekly reading and quick written assignment about the reading that you will present in class. Godlas is a well-respected and known academic who occasionally had to miss class to fly to middle eastern countries for field work or lectures. Think Indiana Jones meets a psychologist meets a Buddhist.
ratingTags_Rating: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--GROUP PROJECTS

comment_Rating: Dr. Godlas is great. I'm in his FYOS (Emotional Intelligence and World Religions) and it's enjoyable. The class is 100% discussion based - every week you read articles, type written responses to them, and talk about them in class. (The discussions center around emotions and religion, so if that isn't something you like - don't take this course.)

If you're looking for a straighforward class do not take this one. His lectures ramble on and on, he misses a bunch for seminars and his teaching style is sporadic. He is incredibly knowledgeable about the information just not good at teaching it.

The class is interesting and discussion based. You have to prepare a small response to an article every week but it honestly takes 15 minutes to do. Every few weeks you have to present an article with a group but all you do is summarize it. Also, you'll get As as long as you try!

Dr. Godlas is a very intelligent individual and an impressive scholar. As a professor, he is engaging and appreciates students who maintain interest. I would recommend his upper level courses to religion/arabic majors.

this class is NOT easy so if you don't have a personal interest in the subject, take someone else. Do all the extra credit and you won't have to worry about your exam scores. I enjoyed the class but if you do all the extra credit (do it!!) it is very homework intensive.

I took his Emotional Intelligence freshman seminar and was very pleased with Dr. Godlas himself. He is a very friendly, approachable and extremely intelligent guy. He is also pretty funny in his own little quirky way. However, I did think he required too many papers for a freshman seminar and attendance in my class was low.

This class should not be an introductory level class. The 2 exams are all essay questions, and are extremely detail oriented. Way too much asked for an intro class. I made a 95-100 on assignments, but the mid-term (avg class grade with a curve was a 58) brought my grade down way low. Do the extra credit--the only thing that will save you!

I took the emotional intelligence in religion FYOS with Dr. Godlas. He's a very nice and smart guy, and the class was not too much work- we had to read an article and write a short reaction every week, along with a weekly emotion journal. If you're looking for a FYOS to take, this is a good option.

If you are lazy and do not want a challenge, then do not take a class with Dr. Godlas.  The required reading is just that . . . required reading.  The work load is enormous but the payoff is priceless!  You will learn more than you ever imagined you could learn in one class.  Dr. Godlas is very friendly and eager to help.  I highly recommend him.

This class was by far the most informative class I have ever taken in my life.  The literature discussed and the detail Dr. Godlas goes into is outstanding and really gives the student a greater understanding of both the author and the material.  I highly recommend Dr. Godlas, but only if you are looking for a challenge.

Not the greatest professor I've had. Lectures are typically pretty hard to follow, and the tests cover a lot of information. Also, there are a lot of pointless journal assignments, and large projects to complete. Wasn't terrible, but would've much rather had a smaller class and a professor that wasn't so hard to follow.

DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS!! Take Rel 1001 with DR. Honderkamp to fill the Requrement. THIS IS WHAT MY TA SAID WHEN I ASKED HIM.  Godlas is hard to understand and difficult to work with.  He may be an expert in his field of Sufi Islam, but is not very organized or enjoyable to hear his lectures.  DROP IT BEFORE THE DEADLINE!

I've taken multiple upper level electives with Dr. Godlas and was always able to pull an A out of each course with some effort.  I can't speak to the lower level classes but the 3k's were difficult but not impossible and he was always available outside of class.  I had a good time, not an easy time by any means, but I got a lot out of his classes.

I've taken several classes from Dr. Godlas and have liked them all.  He jumps around in lecture and will get off topic easily but is brilliant, if you do the reading and come to lecture you should be set.  Plus, if you're having problems he is ALWAYS willing to help - he's just a little scatter-brained sometimes so you might have to track him down.

This was the worst class I have taken! This man had an agenda which was to push his own faith. The midterm and final were all short answer essay and essay, I went in knowing I was going to fail, the question was just by how much.DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS IF YOU HAVE ANY OPTIONS LEFT!
EASILY the worst elective ever taken. I read these and still took the class.....regret it so deeply.

Easily the worst class i've taken at UGA. Very hard tests which were comprised of short answer and essay format. NO multiple choice based tests. Only Midterm and final. Breakout session is a grade booster. His teaching style is to drop a bunch of slides with various lists that you have to memorize. I was disappointed because i wanted to learn more.

The midterm and final are impossible; I studied the best I knew how and still failed. The only redeeming thing for my grade were the journals and projects- if you do all of them and some of the extra-credit opportunities, you can probably get away with a B.

Despite the warnings on this site, I still decided to take this course, and deeply regret it. If you care about your GPA, DON'T TAKE IT. For a 1000 level course, it is absurd. All you have to do is read, and read, and read. just to make a B.

Very intelligent, super well versed in his subject matter, but completely unrealistic expectations.  I'm a good student, I didn't miss a single class, and I still had to skip eleven questions on the midterm because I simply ran out of time.  I made a D, but everyone did so bad it got curved to a B.  Managed to pull an A but only with a LOT of work.
avoid this professor unless you are going to be a religion major.

The tests (2) were VERY difficult, extremely detailed.  I am usually a pretty good test taker and I still can't think of a good way to prepare for them.  There is simply too much information.  Godlas is very knowledgeable, but he tries to fit all of his knowledge into a 1000 level class which just isn't feasible.  Find a different class.

This class is too intense for a 1000 level class. His lectures are too fast, he assigns senseless "busy work", and the TAs are completely useless. They spend too much time returning papers and clarifying assignments that they never really help the students. Plus, his tests are too detailed, there's no you can be prepared for the them.

DON'T TAKE HIS CLASS!!!! Soooo much work, impossible tests, and his teachings are so random you never know what he's talking about. His tests are so detailed orientated that its horrible. DONT DO IT!!

Worst class I have ever taken. The work load is out of control for a 1000 level course, his lectures are extremely incoherent, and the break-out sessions are completely useless. Do NOT take this! I worked my butt off, and still didn't get a good grade.  I love studying religions and Godlas is a nice guy, but this class is honestly torture.

I took it as a humanity credit and hate it. The break out sessions (maybe it was my TA: Cox) feel more like an hour of organizational things like turning in papers, setting out guidelines for all of the busy work, explaining Godlas' directions with every assignment. The class' time is constantly being moved. Try to find an alternate reli class!

dr. godlas is pretty entertaining, but not for the right reasons. the material about the religions is semi-interesting, but he is funnier to observe. he chants, does yoga, demonstrates ti chi chuan etc. in lecture. the tests are hard. you do journal entries every week. hope that you get a good TA.

Haha, Dr. Godlas, good man. Sweet vests too. Dont take this class unless your ready to study ALOT for the final. I had an A going into the final, ended up with a B-. TA is super important for this class. I never went to class, probably reason for failing final. Easy Class, hard test. Professor is nuts too. Sometimes he dances.

Dr. Godlas... where is he? Oh, not in class, and probably in Iran, Turkey or some other Muslim country talking about poetry. Seriously, he was hardly ever in class, and when he was we talked very little about Islam.  His teaching methods are interesting and useful for studying religion and history (my majors), but he makes little connection between

Absolutely do not take this class unless you are okay with getting a lower grade than you deserve and being frustrated in and out of class with the professor and the work. The midterm was easy but the final was ridiculous (coming from someone who studied alot and would have had a 4.0). I regret taking this class, for I did not learn anything.

He is a very intelligent and friendly person. However, he gives a ton of notes that are hard to get down unless you are typing, but even then you won't be able to catch the meaning because you are focusing on getting down the notes. If you get a good TA, and you really want to expand your viewpoint then take this class. Don't take it Freshman year.

Dr. Godlas cracks me up. He likes to spout out in foreign languages, meditate in class, and his comments are quirky. However, he knows so much about the world's religions that all of his students are expected to as well. The class has a lot of potential, but he is very hard and there's a lot of material to cover. Hugo Mendez is the best TA.

While Dr. Godlas is very knowledgeable about his material, he can't really impart it upon a class of 300+. I think he would be a much better teacher in a smaller environment with upper-level classes. I also believe that the work load is a little too heavy for a freshman level class (I'm currently a junior). Your TA will make or break this class!

If you  ever want a tourguide to seek the holy grail. this is your man. he comes in every day in indiana jones attire. his class? oh guess i never paid attention. his hat was the most interesting thing all semester. he is a tax
He is too hard for a 1000 level course.

I would not recomend taking this class as an incoming freshmen to college.  I made the mistake of taking this class my first semester and not understanding that some teachers are alot harder than others and I wish i had looked at the key or this website before taking it.  Once you have more classes under your belt the class will be easier.

Dr. Godlas is incredibly knowledgable and passionate about religion- however he expects all of his students to be as well.  There is a huge amount of busywork everyweek, lectures are incomprehensible, and the books are no help because Godlas has his own method of study.  The midterm and final are all essay and made up of ambiguious questions.

Possibly one of the worst professors at UGA.  Makes religion boring with his pointless busy work.  His tests are over the top and he poorly communicates what he expects.  Its pretty sad that someone who has been teaching as long as Dr. Godlas could be this bad.  Avoid taking his class!!!
freaking ridiculous.. uses his own terminology and doesn't explain it very well. analogies are insane and don't help you understand the material

Dr. Godlas is very knowledgable about the material but he doesn't teach the 1000 level well. Our last test was all essay and I was told it was a 4000 level test. Out of 400 people only 8 made an A, the average grade for our mid-term was a 55.

Dr. Godlas is a bit spacey, but he's very knowledgable. He teaches the subject well, and has a sense of humor. There is a lot of work, but its all pretty easy...theres just a lot of it. He has no set format for tests, but if you study you can do really well.

Dr. Godlas is obviously a nice man and interested in his subject but his head is in the clouds ALL the time. The workload is ridiculous and we never knew what to study for tests (they covered impossibly huge amounts of material). I ended up with endless lists of religious terms in Hindi and Arabic, but little understanding of major concepts.
Horrible Horrible class.  The only thing worse than the teacher was the T.A. we had.  The test were overly hard, the lectures were boring etc...

At first glance this class seemed fairly easy. Then I find out that there is a ridiculous amount of work that comes with this class. His lectures are incredibly boring and he is incapable of speaking normally. We are students, not doctors. WARNING: his midterm and final are ALL ESSAY!!!

What, a scholar who expects students to read all the assignments, know all the material presented and tests as if you should know the material!? Godlas is a fine scholar, always approachable, always understanding, deeply interested in his material and really wants you to learn.

One of the most boring classes I have ever taken. I was so excited about taking this class but it was just one big disappointment. He just reads word for word off of the power point and is not very clear about the material. So boring. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS!
the lectures are so boring. all you do is copy notes from a power point and listen to his annoying voice. If you do the work you will be fine, but there is alot of it.
Agree with everyone else, nothing but busy work and boring lectures...
Boring, boring, boring lectures and way too much homework and reading for a 1000 level class. Tests were entirely too hard...plain and simple, don't take this class.
The course wasn't as bad as the others say. I found him to be helpful and a good lecturer.

I agree with the majority of the posts.  There were too many Islamic terms to remember and the readings were so boring that I would rather spend my time smashing my face in with a claw hammer.  I still don't know what the hell a "theophonic wave" is? He was nice. I received an A, luckily..

was the WORST teacher that i have ever had in my life. the tests are ipossible to study for because the info to knwo is endless, and since the test is almost all short essay, you really need to know the info. he never follows through with things and offers no help with study guides DO NOT TAKE!!!!!!
Very unclear about directions. Very heavy work load for a 1006 class. Too much information saved for just one test. The worst class I've ever taken

I thought this class was horrible. The material was interesting but the course was incredibly unorganized. He would always promise to tell us about an assignment or post something on WebCT and weeks would go by and it still wouldn't be done. This was the worse class I have taken at UGA.

I liked this class. The homework was simple and he gave an easy extra credit assignment. There were only two tests, but the midterm was a breeze. I made a 93 without any studying. Also you don't really have to go to class because he gives you all the notes on WEBCT before the test!

The class was very easy. All quizzes and tests were open book and either take home or online. The final exam was optional. The lecture time was incredibly boring though. Like several other reviewers said, he spends way too much time on really easy topics that could be covered in thirty minutes. Luckily though, attendance is optional so I skipped about half the lectures. If you read the book and attend just a few of the lectures, you should be able to get a good grade in this class.

Probably the most boring class  I have ever taken. All the quizzes were online, no in class tests, and an optional final. When I went to class I spent my time studying for other classes. The quizzes were based out of the book and his notes which he generally posted. Ended up with an A in the class.

I only went to class about 10 times. The only reason I went that much was to turn in the take home exams. The days I did go were spent snoring and drooling into my hand. I still got an A-. Trust me you are much better off just reading the book.

The most boring class i have ever taken. Terrible! He just rambles and no one pays attention and hardly anyone comes to class. The class is pretty easy though, so that's the only good thing! So take him just for the easiness but be prepared to fall asleep I'n class, SO BORING!!!

I had to drop this class because he changed the time and location just a few days before classes started, upending my entire schedule. He didn't even put down the classes new location on oasis. Came off very arrogant and disinterested in communications with him.

Class time is wasted on never-ending examples. He attempts to make class interesting by joking, but it never is. The subject matter is poorly planned. He extends Chapter discussions for multiple days when he could easily teach the subject matter in half a class period. The class is, however, easy if you have the right mindset...and I mean EASY.

Pretty boring teacher, and although it's true that the material isn't easy to explain, he still is unable to make it clear and applicable. Phil 1000h could have been interesting, but he usually goes on tangents and rambles. Not a hard grader, but take Phil 1000 with someone else.

this class was so boring. every time i showed up i asked myself why. he spends the entire class on one example that is not very helpful, and is not interesting at all. FYI: you do not learn about philosophy in this class. It is about finding fallacies in sentence structure! (NOT FUN!) and, the tests are hard and little prep is given

Interesting class. Very laid back, intelligent and funny professor. The TA Luke was the best! Tests were fairly difficult though, but reading the book and doing the exercises help a lot! I learned a lot in the class! 3 tests (including final), pop quizzes, and online quizzes.

He continues what could be a one minute statement until it takes up the whole lecture and ends up teaching just about nothing. Extremely boring.  HARD tests (especially the second) and he does not know how to prepare you for them (atleast if he does, he chooses not to). DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS.

Baird's class is the most boring class I have ever taken at UGA. I know that several ppl probably withdrew after the 1st test.  However, Barid curved every exam and made an easy final.  The chapter tests are hard however you get 3 tries. got a B+ and only went to class for the first 3 weeks. Just read the book on your own for the exams.

Very boring! The class is hard but he seems to grade leniently. I wouldn't take it if you are just looking for a easy elective unless you are really interested in philosophy. Nice guy though and funny at times.

Overall a boring class. He curved some of the tests, but be prepared for a lot of mind numbing reading. None of it was interesting. The class should be structured for a smaller amount of students, it was a huge lecture hall. I wouldn't recommend the class unless you are really devoted to philosophy.
Do not take this class if you just want an easy elective.  He wont curve even though probably 1/3 of the class failed.  And the online test are extremely difficult even with notes and the book.

The material covered in 3010 is extremely thick and difficult. Baird is a funny, even tempered professor who is always ready to help...it's just that the course content is hard from the get go. The lectures are a little disorganized, but I prefer the laid back feel to a mandatory attendance / quizzes every other day scenario.

Lectures are disorganized and half the time it seems like he doesn't know what he's talking about.  It's like he's "learning with us".  Also, often goes on and on about subjects that could be covered in a third of the time.  Tests and papers aren't too difficult.  I was really excited to take this class this semester... should've thought twice.
The material for this class is very tough to grasp. The class discussions can be good but often go off onto tangent after tangent... I was often very bored in the lectures.

Baird is extremely helpful! The class is already interesting itself, but all you have to do it listen. The people who do bad are those who don't try...at all. Read the assignments, listen in class and you will get a good grade. This class gave me hope for intro classes!!
Knows What he is talking about. Funny at times. I enjoyed his class.

This is the most boring class I have EVER taken. Literally half the class was falling asleep in lecture or didn't come-even though attendance was mandatory! Two of the tests were ridiculously but everyone failed one because the questions were badly written. I feel like I could've learned better from just reading the book. DON'T take this class!!!

Dr. Baird, at least when I had him, is not the type of professor you would classify as a philosopher.  He is fairly narrowminded and doesn't understand philosophical ideas different from his own particuarly well.  This of course translates into that having your own ideas will  likely get you a bad grade in his class, and you will not have fun.

I hated this class! I didn't feel like I learned anything from the lectures or the class as a whole. The material could be very interesting, but without any interesting discussion, the class was terribly boring. Overall, the class was really easy. Nobody did well on the second test though. I would not suggest this class to anyone.

This class is not hard, but it is extremely boring.  His lectures take longer than they should and his class is completely disorganized.  The second test was way harder than the material he went over in class.  Go for a class with the same difficulty level that's interesting and worth your time.  Skip this one, even if you plan to take the LSAT.
The discussion sessions were a bit unorganized, but lectures were informative and to point. Papers were easy once you figured out how he grades them. All in all, a very good class.

The class as a whole was okay, but the discussion sections weren't very organized. What was needed for the debate comments wasn't articulated before the first one was due, and the grades were posted late! Other than attendance being mandatory, I enjoyed it well enough.

For the most part, this class isn't difficult. However, some of the tests are pretty ambiguous and can be a tad confusing. The discussion groups, save for a few times right before a test, are pointless (unfortunately though, attendance IS taken). Baird tends to make class way longer than it needs to be, but really, the class isn't too bad.
I hated this class. Class is all participation, and I never really knew what to expect for the tests. It really made me hate philosophy.

Really enjoys what he is doing and makes for a nice atmosphere.  Once you learn how to write his papers his way it gets really easy.  Also the quizs are exactly from the day before so it is easy to study.  Cool class and topics.
i have never hated a class as much as i hated this one.
This teacher is not easy anymore. I think he was giving too many A's and the department had a talk with him. Now he takes hardcore attendence, assings HW and Quizzes. Also the TA...

what a boring class. the man could be done teaching in 15 minutes, instead he takes the entire 50 min class period.  there is literally 30+ min of downtime each class.  if you dont know how to think and want to possibly learn, take this class.  if you can already think, RUN!

Although it was an honors course and the material was, in its principles, very interesting, there was far too much reading assigned for an introductory course populuated mostly by freshmen. The material was also far more detailed than expected for an intro course.
his tests are hard, but he's very willing to help you.  you'll definitely learn a heck of a lot because he encourages you to think about and discuss the material

Bamber is definitely difficult but I really enjoyed her class. Its definitely way too much work for a class that is usually taken with Intermediate II and you have to work consistently almost every night to get the conceptual stuff down. Go into office hours and ask lots of clarifying questions during class.

I took her two years ago and still have bad dreams where i am taking her test and always failing. I wake up sweating. I am being cometely serious. Bamber was way too difficult. Arbitrarily draws the grade line at the end of the semester. DO NOT TAKE HER AT ALL COSTS. I have graduated and found a job and still have nightmares about her. Seriously.

DONT DO IT! Take cost in the spring with any other professor. "Bomber" is one of those professors who has to prove how difficult her class is and arbitrarily draws the letter grade cut offs at the end of the semester. So you could make an 80 in the class and get a C if that is how she is feeling that day...

Takes up homework and grades for accuracy everyday.  I got high Bs on the two tests but ended with a c in the class. Her notes are hard to follow and she doesn't post hw answers online.  I would recommend taking cost with the other professor in the spring.  She is the worst accounting professor I have had at UGA.

Hard class.  Absolutely excellent instructor.  I could have done much better if I had been a better student.  She was always willing to go the extra mile to help, and always brought a tremendous amount of energy to the classromm.
Best teacher I've ever had. Her course is extremely time consuming, but if you have a chance to take COST with Dr. Linda Bamber, you should!
Wonderful, dynamic cost accounting teacher. Very helpful, and she'll work you, but it's worth it. The material is voluminous but straightforward. Do exacly what she tells you, and you can make an A.

Absolutely worst class/professor. I did not learn anything all semester and did not find his teaching style helpful at all. I like reading Shakespeare, but he did not make it interesting nor teach me anything I didn't already know. Class is pointless and he gives pop quizzes on each play that are based on rote memorization of a few character lines.

His class is not very well-structured. For his Shakespeare I class, we were expected to read the plays on our own, but then we would slowly go through them line by line in class. Very little discussion, and the quizzes were impossible because it was rote memorization. I had no clue what my grade was until after finals, which was frustrating.

This class was a complete waste of time. I didn't learn anything the entire semester. He is not clear about what he wants on tests or papers (although he isn't a hard grader) and doesn't teach the material. Most of class was him reading aloud or telling us random anecdotes. His only plus is that he is very understanding if you have to miss class.

I took Doyle for two different classes. He's really lax on attendance and doesn't grade super tough. You do have to work for the few essay tests or short essays he assigns, though. Be able to identify the poems he gives and write well on the material and it's a super easy class with a funny teacher.

He is very funny and nice. I enjoyed his class but not his tests. He is an easy grader but he gives you very few passages from lengthy poems and expects that you identify where it is in the poem, which poem it is from and what the significance is. Overall it was a good class and he was entertaining.

Dr. Doyle is very nice and was always willing to help me when I had a question. We spent every class going through texts line by line, which was great because he really helps you understand what you read. He's funny, too. Very enjoyable class.

One of my favorite professors at UGA! Even if you don't like English, take this as an honors course if you need a core English credit. He's absolutely hilarious, and he even had my class at his house for dinner. If you laugh at his jokes and write the essays, he will literally give everyone an A. I seriously looked forward to this class everyday!

One of my favorite professors in Franklin. Very funny and easy-going and is ALWAYS willing to help his students and is truly interested in each individual's learning. Even if you're not interested in the topic, you will have a great time and laugh in every class. Pay attention and you'll be fine!
He is awesome! I love him so much... fun, fun, fun, fun, fun... dirty mouth... but it's quite endearing.

He is the easiest English professor I've taken. I say easy because he teaches his literature well and is very easy-going on giving us work. IF you stay on top of your readings, everything falls in place for you. It wasn't much either. I'm taking him again for Milton. He's really nice and great sense of humor. I enjoyed him greatly!
Shakespeare is awful, but he is a pretty good teacher. You have to read the plays since there are detailed quizzes on every play. We also had two tests, a paper, an optional paper, and a final.

I had him for a freshman seminar. It was the easiest class i've ever had. He's really funny in a "WOW, did he just say that?" kind of way. Women, take him with a grain of salt, I had to. He acts almost like he doesn't give a crap, but still wants to teach. GREAT TEACHER!!!

Had him for poetry (which is a bore to me), but he made the class interesting. He is known for his crude jokes, but don't take it personally- he's just making light of the class. The load is refreshing when balanced w/ ur other classes; thus making his class more enjoyable. If you get the chance, give his classes a shot- it'll be fun!
I had Doyle for a fresman seminar on legends and folklore.  Very knowledgeable.  He's really funny too!  Highly recommend!

SOOOO inappropriate.  Its awesome.  He's hilarious in the "dirty joke you are embarrassed to repeat" kind of way.  Tests were overall fairly easy, but always had a few obscure questions.  Term project easy if you give yourself plenty of time and take it seriously.
great professor.  Easy class and very interesting and funny.  Missed several classes and made a B, should of gotten an A
Dr. Doyle is amazing! His classes are really interesting, and he's so funny and nice!
Lives up to his "dirty old man" reputation in his poetry analysis. Funny at times, but not terribly interesting overall.
Only Doyle could make Milton interesting--love his quirky sense of humor, very down to earth personality. Highly intelligent but not intimidating--an interesting professor.
It was an easy A...it just took a while to get used to his jokes.

I have had Dr. Chuck D for Shakespeare I and Milton. He has to be one funniest people I have met due to his somewhat inappropriate remarks. However, he only lectures, always gets off topic and behind schedule. His tests and papers could be viewed as adhering to guidelines of his brand of new criticism. Knows his subject material well.

Extremely helpful and funny.  If you're overly PC, I wouldn't take his class cause he makes some off color jokes, though I found him hilarious.  His knowledge of the subject is intimidating, but he is not.  Great teacher!
No Comments

A wealth of knowledge, Dr. Doyle brings an extensive background in linguistics, folklore studies, and literary theory to the table in all of his classes.  He is soft-spoken and easy-going, despite the demanding nature of the curriculum.  He integrates wit and wisdom into every lecture.  Fabuloso!

She is so sweet, but I found it hard to pay attention in her lectures. If you struggle with math, don't take Mrs. Pike. If you are pretty good at math, do the homework, labs, and reviews, and you will be fine not going to lecture. Don't buy the book!!!

Dr. Pike is a very nice woman, but her class is so boring. Often times, the students have to correct her on her math, because she makes so many mistakes. This makes the concepts harder to understand. Overall, easy class. Don't buy the book. You will never use it.
She knows her stuff, but is TERRIBLE at putting it into learning terms for anyone who is not a math major. Thank god for other professors notes or I would have failed.

Ms. Pike is a very nice woman with a very monotone voice.  She puts her powerpoint online and just adds examples to them during lecture.  She is the STATS coordinator, so that is helpful.  Try homework before class. If you can do it without going to lecture, don't go. you won't learn anything else. Labs are easy. Tests can be tricky but not too bad
Very easy course. Basically a GPA boost. Book not required, I only go to class on tuesdays before lab, be careful on the tests. It is very easy to misunderstand a stat question.

WORST STAT PROFESSOR AT UGA. DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS. Tests are full of "trick" questions, and even if you know the material, it is unlikely you will make an A, or even a B. TRUST ME. I went to labs, lecture, tutoring, studied notes, and I could not crack a B on her tests and IM A MATH PERSON.

DON'T BUY THE BOOK. You literally won't open it. Everything you need to know is online, in the powerpoints. A lot of people are saying don't go to lecture, but I found it helpful. Labs are super easy. Make sure you do all your homework and study a little before each test and you'll probably get an A.

I have always been good at math and this class was extremely hard for me. Mrs. Pike was boring and I did not like her notes. Going to class was pointless because I wouldn't get anything out of it. I had to go to tutors and teach myself to pass.

If you're a 'math' person, going to class is useless. I learned everything in the breakout session that the TA taught. O'Neal gives reviews the day before the exam that are amazing. Get him if you can! If you're not a math person the class won't be as easy as everyone says(not impossible though). If you are a math person, this class is a joke.

BORING! She has a very dry, dull teaching style. The slides are posted online, so you don't need to attend lectures. I learned more from my breakout with my TA. I stopped going after a month of class, and just went to the test review sessions instead.

terrible!!!! run from her! she is soooo boring and i learned absolutely NOTHING. i went to class, to lab, had tutors, and ended up with a b-. morse came to our last class bc she was sick and i learned the most that day!!!

I don't really like statistics, nor do I like boring teachers and this was a combination of the two. Dr. Pike is a sweet lady and tries to make things entertaining, but normally I just fell asleep during the class. I still made an A though, and even though Stat Lab for the most part is pointless, it helps sometimes.

Unenthusiastic about everything! I went to class everyday, had a tutor, and went for extra lab hours.  TAs were more helpful then the professor was. Had to drop this class, when I went to talk to her she didn't tell me anything I could do to do better, she was just so blah. She was nice but not a good teacher. Book doesn't help, never used it.

Pretty basic Statistics class. By no means fun or interesting, but Dr. Pike does a fine job teaching it. She is willing to stay after class to answer any questions about the notes or homework. Do not buy the textbook however, we did not use it once!

She is sooo hard to pay attention to.  Most people fall asleep in her class.  She is unenthusiastic about everything, and frankly it's like trying to listen to your grandma babble on about stuff you don't care about, but you nod your head politely anyways.  I would recommend another professor, but she's pretty easy.  Just boring.

Pike is really boring, but statistics is such a boring subject. She does tend to ramble, and repeat what she said a lot. I swear I learn more in lab in that I ever learn in actual class. I normally did a lot better to study on my own and skip class.

Pretty boring class if you're not a math person, but great professor. Do not buy the book. Go to class, pay attention, and ask questions if necessary. Go to all of the optional reviews, do all of your HW, and study the HW. If you need more help, go to open lab.

1st math class I got a B+ in, Im an A student. Go to the labs, they help the most (Yager was my TA, hes good). GOTO CLASS and get notes but dont expect helpful answers. Barely used the book but online hmwk helped. I taught myself a lot. GO TO TEST REVIEWS! THEY HELP TONS! Dont skip class and then expect to learn everything in the review tho.

She was a very good teacher.  She explained everything very well.  if you go to class, pay attention, and take notes you'll do great! The text book is very unnecessary to buy, I never opened it.  Attend the optional review sessions, they're very helpful. Get help immediately if you don't understand something and do the hw, it'll help you understand

I love Pike.  She is the most helpful professor that you will ever find. I recommend her class to anyone who is not good at math because she will go out of her way to help you.  She sits outside of the lab before every test incase you have last minute questions.  If you need help, she will answer your email almost immediately.She's a nice lady.

Her class is almost useless in comparison to the excellent review sessions before each test. Her voice is monotonous and she tends to mess up a lot. The tests and quizzes are easy, though. Fairly simple math if you know what you're doing and everything can be solved using the software, StatCrunch.DO NOT BUY THE BOOK. I never opened it once.

So easy if you have any math background from high school. I took stat in high school though. Didnt go to class but twice. She posts her lecture notes, it's math! Easy math. My TA was asian and hard to understand. I didn't really study on the first 3 tests and got A's. It's just simple mean, median, mode, and population stuff. Easy A

Don't need the textbook. Class is boring but helpful. 4 tests and optional final. TA break outs help a lot and homework helps with your grade a lot. I made an A pretty easily and didn't take the final!

I went to every class and still made a B-, barely.  Most of my time was spent in the lab trying to figure out what she was talking about, but the TA's were very helpful. Honestly, you might as well skip the class and go to the lab, the TA's are much clearer. The class extremely boring, but if you like that kind of thing have at it.

Class is so boring. Gives you an optional final if you are satisfied with grade previously. Don't blow a test because the final was not fun- entirely comprehensive. Ick. Studied hard the night before and managed a B (most people do).

The material in this class can be kind of dry, however it is taught in a very clear method. Review sessions basically cover everything before tests, so attendance to lectures may only be necessary if you are having difficulty. Her teaching method is helpful and straight forward. Overall a well put together class.

She is very nice, but also very boring. I had a hard time making myself pay attention.  Although she makes it somewhat easy, most of what she shows is way easier than anything you have to do on homework, quizzes, and tests.  Make sure you go to the review sessions.  They are very helpful.

She is awesome. Do not need to buy the textbook. Math is always my worst subject, I ended up with a 94 in the class without taking the optional 5th exam. Go to her lectures, if you go to class you will understand everything perfectly and won't need extra help. The TAs are a great help if you have homework questions

this class is BORING! it is hard to focus in class because she is really  boring and has a lot of technical difficulties. I learned more in lab from my TA than i did class. However, she is a sweet teacher and the class is really easy if you read over the notes posted online, and do all of the homework. Take this class but don't buy the book!

math is my worst subject. i got a 96 on my last test. she is a great teacher, go to class (not required) she goes over anything you dont understand and answers all questions. do all homework and lab quizzes. she lectures right from her slides. i would take her again if i had to take another stat course

She is pretty boring and tends to have a lot of technical difficulties, but she is always extremely willing to go over stuff people understand and offer help to people who need it. Class is pretty easy if you go over notes and do your homework.

This class is an easy A.  All notes are online and she goes through them pretty thouroughly in class.  Going to lecture is not even necessary, just the labs.  Labs are so easy as well.  As long as you do the homework and labs you will do fine on the tests.

Absolutely best person in the world. I'm from out of state and this lady comes to the hospital to check up on me when she heard I broke my leg. She offered to give me private (free) tutoring). Class is easy enough. If you are taking stat take her. Love her
She is a great teacher! As long as you go to class and pay attention you should do fine!  I never opened by book.
