she is extremely nice and realy does want to and try to help you understand, however her teaching style isn't the best, but it's not horrible. i was able to get a B+ only going to her classes when math really isn't my subject. homework and quizzes weren't hard and tests weren't too bad either. they were fair.
This class was SO EASY. Pike was very boring and most of the time I just would not go to class. I got an A easily, but it was my least favorite class.

This class was easy for me, but just because I read other teacher's notes online. Pike's classes and notes were unclear and didn't help me at all. I went to class most of the semester but it was a waste of my time. Just go to lab, do your homework, and have notes printed out (from Pike or another teacher) to use for the quizzes. it's manageable

If you need to take stat, I wouldn't take Pike. She is really boring (and I understand that it is hard to make stat exciting...) She seemed easily confused and would often make a simple topic more difficult. Go to the help sessions, they help a lot.

Pike was not the most entertaining professor, but if what you are looking for is to get a good grade then she is good.  As mentioned by others, the $20 study sessions are well worth it.  I easily got an A in the class when I went to those.

Nice lady but very sweet voice always but me to sleep. Go to the $20  Vaugnh review sessions, they teach you everything you need to know for the test in 3 hours.  It might help to go to class before lab to make a good lab grade. Make good grades on your homework and you will be fine.

This class is a drag, but easy enough if you print off the notes from WebCT.  Going to class isn't always necessary, just make sure you go to lab.  Also, there was a $20 review session that we were offered, and I highly recommend going to that -- much more helpful than Pike's lectures.

Her lectures are a little hard to follow, but she's a really sweet lady. Homework and labs are 20% of your grade and are pretty much guaranteed 100s. Tests aren't impossible but can be challenging. Basically the class is an easy B but a hard A.

This class is really boring. It helps if you don't go to class and just go to the lab; the TAs are great and teach better and quicker. You can get notes off line from her or other teachers and they help if you have any issues.

Come on people.  Dr. Pike was a wonderful teacher.  She is incredibly helpful and yes, the class is boring, but it is STAT.  It will always be boring.  Homeworks and lab quizzes, which are pretty much a guaranteed 100 count as 20% of your grade and the final is optional to replace a test grade.

Oh boy.  Talk about putting you into a coma.  Pike isn't a bad lady, she's kind of cute in and elderly way, but she just isn't a great instructor.  Try to take notes, if you can't, just get them from WebCT from another instructor.  Lab quizzes are important- my TA would check answers for you.  Homework can help a lot- try to make 100s.  Open Lab.

This class makes me want to blow my brains out.  The woman is so incredibly boring.  She's a sweet lady, but she has no idea how to teach.  She drones on an on about the same thing for an entire class.  I realize the class is an intro-level, but she teaches as though it's full of morons.  She's glad to help if you need it. Avoid Dr. Pike and stats.
See the other people's posts, and get the clue!  She is a nice lady, but she can't teach!  I was trying to strangle myself during her lecture...

Pike is a pretty nice lady. She trys to teach you the material in a relatively easy way which she seems to pull off since this is STAT we're talking. Although she had labs and hw, you should start off from the jump making ggod grades in hw and lab cause that can help you later.

I thought this class was easier than my high school stat--and it wasn't AP! She makes it so easy, it is hard not to make an awesome grade (replace a test score with final, can skip a couple labs and hw's without penalty). Yes, the lectures are boring, but so is math in general. She teaches you everything you need to know in class for the tests.
so hard. i got a C. i've never gotten a C before. i just suck at math, and she is so boring. and yeah, don't buy the book it was a complete waste of money.

Pike makes bad jokes the entire class which makes it more painful than most math classes. Do your homework and go over it before the tests. TAs and Pike never truly answer your questions just restate what was already said. HINT: you dont really have to go to class if you print off the other teacher's notes available on webct. They include all info.

This class isn't very hard and Pike is nice.  Don't buy the book unless you absolutely have to...I didn't use mine all semester and got an 'A'. Print notes off of webCT and go over in class.  Do example problems and you'll be fine.  And as for all the people saying she's boring...How the hell do you make statistics interesting????
I liked her. She's a little boring to listen to, but she gives excellent notes, and she teaches everything very well straight off the tests.

Class is extremely boring. Not once did I stay awake the entire lecture. It's really not hard though, you just have to put effort into learning the material.. study, actually do the homework, etc. It's not bad.

Contrary to what other people have said, I think her class is really easy.  Her notes are straight forward and easy to follow and the homework isn't bad either.  If you just study your notes, go to class, and study your homework you should do fine on the tests, they aren't that bad.  But this class is very boring so get lots of sleep before coming.
Chandler Pike is one of the most boring people EVER. I am glad I took statistics in high school, otherwise this class would have been a TOTAL bust. ...Well actually it was, but I did well.
Dr. Pike is very nice and patient.  The class can be boring, but it's not that hard to do well in her class!  The homework and labs are easy.

I took stat in high school (i don't know if that matters) but i think that pike is an overall good teacher. she makes outlines for note taking which held me stay organized. if you go to class (every day) and keep up, anyone could make a b and a lot of people could make an a (i am and i really don't think that i've put much effort in)take her class

Ok i had atkinson and he sucked so bad and put me to sleep so often that I started coming to Pike's class instead. She is SUCH a better teacher, knows her stuff, unlike Atkinson who is an IDIOT and gets confused all the time. I thought she was a great teacher and her class was much smaller than Atkinson's.

Although Pike is knowledgeable on Stat, she has lost her ability to communicate her knowledge to students.  I would recommend taking any other teacher.  She's available to help, but she's not too helpful.  She's terribly boring.  The class itself is numbingly boring, but the tests are brutally hard. If you take the class, PREPARE for horrible tests

VERY boring. Doesn't unite ideas well. Can be helpful if she tries, but she doesn't always try. Should probably come to class, though, because this course overall is harder than expected. All the Stat classes have the SAME test questions and format, so take any other prof to avoid sleeping in class.

The class will prepare you very little for the tests. Ms. Pike is very boring, and it was difficult to sit thro class. Still, her handouts are online, and she is very willing to help on an individual level. Not sure I'd recommend her tho.
if you have to take statistics, please take it from another teacher, trust me.
No Comments
very very boring, she's a nice lady but its soooo borinng and unclear

Prof. Link is crazy. I took this class genuinely excited in studying music and film, but she literally will read from wikipedia, does not know ANYTHING about modern movies, and thinks the Avengers score is "typical boring action music." Was not expecting to get a C on a vocab quiz. Pay attention to very small, seemingly irrelevant nonsense she says
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment_Rating: Professor Link is a very nice professor, but her lectures are very dry and boring. Most of the quizzes are opinion based, but she grades it using her own opinions. This is a very opinion based course, but your opinions must match hers to get the credit. I dropped the class.

The material itself was interesting. The instructor, however, was very disorganized and the lectures reflected this. The assignments were not helpful for understanding the material, and she did not give helpful feedback whatsoever. On occasion, she would bring up topics that were not relevant to the course.
Easy class but boring professor who goes on rants that have nothing to do with class.

Lectures are completely disorganized and she reads Wikipedia pages straight to you... That being said Music and Film is a very fun topic. She grades papers easy. Everyone bombed the first reading quiz then aced the second. It was her first time teaching this course and should get better with progression.

Comes across a little crazy, but makes more sense after a few classes. Provides a world-view of the material, which helps to understand the material.  Downside- you have to come to class to really "get" it... copying someone else's notes or just reading the book won't cut it, unfortunately.  Overall, LOVE this professor!

I really, really loved this class! I don't say that lightly. I am very strict when it comes to great classes. This is one of them. Link is hilarious! Never a dull moment with her  craziness! She's eccentric- and it's great! If you just know Composers and what they wrote, you'll pretty much get an A. I did.

Dr. Link is incredibly hard to follow in lectures. She goes off on random tangents and barely covers the material. The tests she gives are hard (identify pieces and info about them from a short sample she plays) but the rest of the work is easy. Even the TA's thought the tests were overly hard. Attendance is only mandatory in breakouts

Okay, I am a musician and I didn't consider this class to be super easy. I don't think it's really the material but the questions she asks. She is SO unpredictable! Like the final was out of this world!!! The answers weren't in the book and even though I paid close attention in class, I STILL didn't know the answers (it's all short answer).

Dr. Link is VERY hard to follow during lectures. I got really frustrated trying to keep up, so most of the time I played on my computer. But everything comes from the book, so it doesn't really matter if you miss class (attendance only from breakouts). If you study for listening quizzes and memorize facts about the songs, you'll be fine. Easy A.

She really likes the textbook and pretty much anything on the quiz will come from the book. The week before a quiz, there was always a really helpful review. She clearly really likes music and knows what she's talking about. She's nice and enjoys teaching. But she's kinda scattered and all over the place and I had a really hard time following her.

Terrible, unprofessional, and scatter-brained.  Yells at you if you ask questions.  If your male don't take her class.  She only likes woman and everyclass is a male bashing session.  Knowledgable on one subject and one subject only.  Avoid at all costs.  Good ratings on this site are prob. only girls views (you the viewer should check on that)

The worst professor I ever had.  And I worked hard and went to every single class.  She cannot teach at all.  She doesn't plan her lectures at all and cannot stay organized during class.  Yes, she is brilliant, but she sure can't convey what she knows.  And she unfortunately had no qualms about humiliating her students in front of the class.  She's a scholar, not a teacher.

Dr L can be somewhat overwhelming at first. Her lectures are very spirited. I found this to be a nice change! For once, Lectures were energizing. She may seem unprepared or scattered brained, but after having her, you realized that's not how she is. Her knowledge is immense. Her only goal is to share that with students. She is fair, but demanding.

Everyone is entitled to their own opinion, and this is mine. I think Dr. Link knows what she is teaching, she is very knowledgable and that can't be denied. However, reading out which students in the class are "failing, and should drop and think about chaning their major" is absolutly unethical. This alone, is reason enough not to be in a classroom

I thought Dr. Link was going to be horrible when I first went into her class. Everyone said such horrible things, but she just expects a lot and wants you to learn. She's really good if you take the time to read the book and pay attention in lectures. The TAs where great too!

Contrary to popular opinion, Dr. Link is an extremely helpful and caring professor. She doesn't just give a lecture, she gives you life experiences. She is wonderfully insightful. The course is challenging and unfortunately she pays for the fact. If you take her class, you will work hard, but learn.

Dr. Link, though experienced and knowledgeable, is an entirely ineffective professor. She frequently speaks on unrelated tangents during her lectures and the class is behind schedule on the syllabus before the fourth week of class, forcing confusing schedule changes, including assignment due dates
This was positively the worst class of my whole life. The teacher is so unfair and tries the best she can to fail you. If you can avoid this teacher at all costs, do.
Brilliant Professor..
ratingTags_Rating: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment_Rating: He is an extremely helpful professor and you could tell he was interested in the subject and it was a subject he was excited to teach. He expects participation and all he asks is you read the articles. No textbook. Class discussions were important in this class. I would highly recommend this course to anyone interested in the subject.

Dowd is a total smartass, but he's pretty funny and likes it when you ask questions. He may not sit there and give you the answer but he'll lead you right up to it. Go to class. Stuff he says is on the tests and not the handouts. Skim the book before the tests.

He hands out a packet (5-10) pages of "notes" before every class, and all they are are crude diagrams. He talks a mile a minute and expects you to glean something from it, and he does not answer questions clearly. I went into the first test knowing almost nothing and got an 88 b/c TA's grade the tests . But still, he's so obnoxious it hurts.
Walk into this guy's office, and there's a nice happy sign on the wall that says "stupid people shouldn't breed." You can go ahead and include yourself in that statement as far as he is concerned.
best
v good
Good teacher, go to class and take notes. you'll get an A, if you don't go to class or talk at least some. he'll drop your grade a letter grade, so Go to class and talk and take note, easy A

Pretty straightforward class.  Go to class and take the notes.  Then study the notes and you should do fine on the test.  Also, class is very media interactive.  Paper seems intimidating, but it's not.  Definitely take this teacher!

Kallerman is quite debatably the best teacher on campus; he's knowledgeable (but not painfully so), makes his class interesting, and wants his students to perform well.  I had only 4 exams and two essays ("homeworks" he called them) for the entire class.  If you are interested in American Government, then you'll make an easy B (A is "possible").
No Comments

This was an alright class for intro. to pol. sci.  The exams were pretty difficult because the multiple choice he picked out could be pretty tricky, but overall it wasn't too bad.  You have to be good at memorizing a lot of information for the exams and you can do well in the class.
Dr. Kallerman is hot like Salsa Picante.  He's pretty good as a teacher but really most of us girls just stare at him and daydream.

Doug is a great professor! He is hilarious and his lectures are very interesting. He told us the book was required but it was never really needed. The only grades are quizzes, tests, and a final. The tests were pretty difficult. Overall, as long as you study, I would highly recommend this class!

Class isn't "mandatory" but you should attend all lectures and take detailed notes or you won't be successful. 2 exams and 1 final weight HEAVY and studying material is very tedious. I rated a 4 b/c he gives the top percent of the class an A but doesn't specify what grade is needed which is STRESSFUL as you don't know until final grades are posted.

If you show up to class and take notes regularly/study it's pretty hard to not do well in Doug's class. He's passionate about the material and cares about his students. The lectures can be long but they're entertaining-he pulls in a lot of his own experience, which keeps things interesting.

Doug has easily been one of my favorite professors and I definitely recommend taking his class. His 1121 is not the easiest class because if you mess up one of the exams making up the majority of your grade, you will get a less than desired grade. However, Doug's fun personality and quips make showing up to class something to look forward to.

Doug is a caring, funny guy. And the content is relatively interesting. But, you're only graded on 4 short quizzes, 2 tests, and the final exam, which can be a little rough. Also, you have to go to class, he doesn't post slides and missing a day can put you behind quite a bit. Good class, but avoid if you're just looking for a science req.

Dr. Crowe is an amazing professor and makes the class enjoyable. However, the only thing that goes to your grade is the quizzes and tests of which are fairly difficult. There is also so much content which is exclusively gone over in class. There are much easier Geology and science classes to take. He does not deserve a 5 rating due to difficulty.

Super easy class, Doug will make sure you succeed, if you show up to class and listen you will be fine, but it's hard to know what's on the exam if you don't show up to class so attendance isn't MANDATORY but to do well in the class you should show up. Super easy tho.

One of the best professors I've ever had. He's very reasonable and tries really hard to give people a good grade. You have to attend lectures to get the notes, but the lectures are so fun it wasn't bad at all. Grades were just quizzes, tests, and a final and it was all lecture-based. I would 100% take more classes with him.

Crowe is an amazing professor and I would take him as a professor for any course. Attending class and taking notes is a must to be successful in this class. The amount of work you put in will reflect how good your final grade is.

1st off, don't buy the textbook; you don't need it. It would be best if you showed up to lectures; they're funny and contain great exam information. He has five quizzes and four tests, but he gives crazy curves. He is really helpful and super accessible outside of class. As a non-geo major, I always found class fun and interesting. 100% recommend.

Doug is actually the best. He makes an intro geology class interesting by focusing on a lot of things relevant to people who aren't geology majors. It is test and quiz heavy but he curves HARD and it helps everyone. Super funny and casual as well, but still super knowledgeable.

I LOVED THIS CLASS. I had no idea what to expect from a GEOL class, but I learned so much from this one. Dr. Crowe made talking about waste disposal interesting. You do have to show up to class for sure. You'll do fine as you take notes and read over the textbook chapters (which I probably should've done a bit more).

One of the best professors at UGA! I took this course as a requirement and thought it would be boring, but he's absolutely hilarious and makes lectures very entertaining. As long as you attend class/take notes and study a bit, you'll love the class and the professor. Definitely take this professor!

Doug is Awsome the test can be a little tricky but if you just go to class you will be fine he is super funny in lectures and just an overall great guy. he understanding and almost convinced me to become a geology major, take his class. I barely studied, just took notes in class and I was fine

"My job is to teach you, not ruin your grade for a 1000-level class." Professor Crowe is amazing, caring, and funny. He has a passion for what he teaches and his lectures are interesting and enjoyable. As long as you go to class every day and take detailed notes you'll do good. Grade is based on 2 midterms, 1 cumulative final, 4-5 quizzes.

I LOVED THIS CLASS! I am not a science person at all and I was dreading geology. Dr. Crowe was hilarious in class and explained things SO well. As long as you show up to class and take notes you will be fine on tests and quizzes! I 100% recommend this class.

LOVED Professor Crowe! I am 100% not a science person, but this class is insanely interesting and straightforward. He will never try to trick you on any assessments, so as long as you know the lectures you're guaranteed a good grade. This is a very low-stress class. There are 4 quizzes, 2 tests, and a final.
Doug is a gem. Pretty easy class. Quizlet can be your best friend for studying for quizzes and tests. Take this guy.

Chill guy but I wouldnt recommend his class unless youre willing to be the only one to put in work. He is kind/patient when you ask questions but he let us out of class 20 minutes early every day. Usually this is good but not when the class average isnt that high. Its like if he only cares when he knows his students do. No room for mistakes
ratingTags_Rating: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment_Rating: He is pretty interesting and very nice. A lot of his lectures can be boring, but I learned a lot. No homework, but there are "pop" quizzes which he always mentions ahead of time. His tests are straight from lecture and easy. The labs were pretty boring and kinda annoying.

Amazing professor and amazing person. I detest science and he made the material interesting, understandable, and enjoyable. He says tests come straight from the notes, but that's only if you take super specific notes - go to class and write down every minor detail he says, because it'll be on the test. Didn't open the textbook once. I loved him!
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Hilarious

comment_Rating: I really enjoyed this class way more than i expected, and i give that credit to him. He's 100% real with you and I feel like he's truly just trying to inform the class about the world today. we never had homework, and he says he has pop quizzes but he always tells you the class before that theres going to be a quiz in the upcoming class.
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--LECTURE HEAVY

comment_Rating: His tests come from all the lecture notes and are pretty straight forward. He makes the material simple and is funny while doing it. I would take him again!

CROWE IS MY FAV PROFESSOR. Wish I could have him for every class. He's hilarious but also gives great lectures that are straight to the point and easy to understand. Tests/quizzes are only lecture-based so you just have to pay attention! He's always available to give you help/answer questions. I HIGHLY recommend. Can't stress enough how funny he is

Crowe was great. You have 3 tests, 1 final,5 pop quizzes (that he tells you when they are&don't be afraid to ask either). He'll tell you, go to class and you'll pass, and nothing could be more true. Crowe realizes this is a prerequisite for most of us, and he isn't trying to kill your GPA. I only used the textbook for review, so rent if you can!
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--LECTURE HEAVY

comment_Rating: Teacher is solid. Lets be real, you're taking this as an easy A requirement. The thing is if you treat it like an easy A and just go to class and don't study in anyway shape or form you're gonna get a B. Everything is straight from the notes. That said he gives you everything you need to succeed. Funny dude but the material...

Had to take this class. Luckily, he's an awesome teacher. I missed class one day, and he printed me out all of the notes and sat down with me to go over them to make sure I understood the material. He's sooo funny, just make sure to write down everything he puts on the board. 5 pop quizzes & 3 tests, just pay attention and you'll be fine

Crowe is hilarious in that "dad" kind of way, and sometimes just in general. Explains things very clearly, makes rocks and water far more interesting than I thought possible, and has some of the easiest tests/quizzes I've ever taken. Would definitely recommend this class and professor. Warning: the lab is boring as can be, but also very easy.

He makes lectures easy to listen to. Tests are over material covered in class (not always in the book) so go to class. Everything is really easy to understand. Gives in-class quizzes (with warning) and 3 tests+ final (made A's to A-'s and barely studied). He actually made me kind-of like geology. Go to class & you won't have anything to worry about

Crowe is awesome. He makes Geology so interesting and I look forward to going to that class. Only 3 tests and some quizzes which are super easy multiple choice straight from lecture. He even curves tests so that 20% of students receive As. BEST class to take for a non science major physical science credit. And the lab for this course is easy too.

Wow Crowe is awesome. He truely understands Geology in a way that he can teach so that the information is crystal clear. He is hilarious which at times makes you forget you are learning about Geology. CLASS NOTES  TESTS!!! Do not buy the book unless you have difficulty looking graphs he shows on the projector which sometimes contain test questions

Dr. Crowe is an extremely qualified and engaging professor. He is inspiring and teaches his class in a very straight forward manner with lecture notes every class. Periodically he will give out quizzes that covered previous lecture material but they aren't difficult. No crazy papers, only three multiple choice exams. GOOD CLASS

Crowe knows everything about the material he teaches. He is not cocky about the information and always welcomes questions. He is ALWAYS available for help if you need him by office hours, or through e-mail, he is very prompt. He tries the best he can to make the class interesting even though the material is boring. Presents both sides. hard tests
Great teacher with a true knowledge of his subject matter. If you go to class and take the notes he provides, you will succeed.

It's a lot of information and it's easy to get confused. For some reason I made really good grades on the quizzes but bombed the tests. Just study ALOT! There are pop quizzes but he drops the lowest one. Other than that, Crowe is a great teacher and he makes class interesting
Nice guy, knows his stuff.  Class is pretty boring but if you go and take good notes, you'll do fine on tests.  Does not try to trick you.
Great class! Professor Crowe made the class enjoyable and interesting. His lectures are very easy to follow and take notes on. Highly recommend taking his class.

Ok, this is how you are going to ace this guys class: USE A VOICE RECORDER!!! All of his test questions come from his lectures.. If you record all of them and listen right before test day you should have no trouble at all.

he was nice, funny, cool guy, but his tests/quizzes were pretty hard, and i heard from my retarded lab partner that the other teachers were easier and that he was making A's on the tests. still if you work hard you can probably do well. he is a swell guy and not a bad teacher

He is the best teacher i have ever had at UGA....he is very intelligent and knows what his talking about but is not prideful. He gives both sides of every story and loves to teach. Very fun class and going to class is actually fun with Crowe

(cont'd) made great grades all yr then bombed a test. would have ruined my grade but he bumped me bc of my consistent effort. Made a B, would have made an A except for my bad test. Had no interest in geology before, but learned so many interesting things and really enjoyed this class. I HIGHLY recommend him. He is also pretty hilarious.

Dr. Cr was an EXCELLENT teacher. seemed arrogant at 1st but actually friendly smart & helpful. You have to study in this class bc of "pop" quizzes but he warns you the day be4. There is a decent amount of notes but all straightforward. Office hrs were helpful he let me see what questions I missed on a test and write them down.

He is awesome. Attendance is not mandatory but he does give pop quizes. He remembered me like two years after I took his course and encouraged me throughout when I was having a difficult time at UGA. He is a great professor and very helpful!!! He makes this class interesting. I had no interest in the environment before I took this class.

I do not recommend taking this course with Crowe. This is specifically directed towards students who have harder classes. This class requires plenty of studying with the frequent quizzes and it is almost impossible to keep up w if you are in other (harder) classes. Crowe makes a class that should be easy, very difficult through his teaching style.

Crowe is an excellent teacher. I had no interest in Geology before this class, but he tries not to make it boring and makes funny jokes throughout. There are three tests and a final and eight quizzes but he drops the lowest one. The lab that goes with this class is also REALLY easy. Definitely one of my favorite classes.

This class is great. Dr. Crowe is fantastic. He uses a lot of dry humor which breaks up the long lecture hours on T/R and he is definitely out there to make sure you succeed. I had no interest in Geology, and now I've decided to double major, adding Geo to my course load. Tests are a breeze, just show up and take notes.

Dr. Crowe taught my geology class with powerpoints that he posted prior to each class. His multiple choice tests and quizes came straight from those powerpoints. He was always willing to help his students and made sure we were comfortable with the material. He had a great attitude every day and had a good sense of humor.
Very good teacher, test and quizzes can be confusing at first but get easyer and he is very willing to help

This class was amazing. I originally took it because I thought it would be really easy, but I ended up loving the class. Professor Crowe is one of, if not the best professor I've ever had. He made class so interesting and funny too. Tests and quizzes are easy, straight from the lectures. Go to class, you'll fall in love with this course. I promise.

Absolutely AMAZING professor. I'm already a fan of physical science but this class was above and beyond what I expected. He is completely clear in lectures (which aren't mandatory but you won't want to miss). He tells it straight and adds hillarious comments throughout (including chipmunk refrences). Take this class!

I don't even like Geology, but I love this class. As long as you go to class and take good notes, you will be fine.  He gives random quizes, but they are straight from the lectures- so are the tests.  I think I have looked at the book 2 times. He is an excellent teacher and he makes his students actually care about what he is saying.

He's hilarious. I took his basic geology course and thought I would hate it, but he actually made it fairly interesting. He explains things well and goes off on tangents that are always hysterical. Definitely take a class with him if you get the chance!

I hate science but this guy is AWESOME. Definitely one of the best core classes I've taken. He makes everything so interesting and he's hysterical, realistic, and tells it like it is. Please take this class if you need another elective!!!

I had Crowe for the "Finite Resources, Infinite Thirst" freshman seminar.  He's a really cool guy and provided a lot of advice to us freshman.  Even though I don't know him in a "real" class, his personality is great.

I hated this class, because I hate Science. But, Crowe was an amazing professor and lecturer. I ACTUALLY understood and was a bit drawn to it b/c he made it fun and interesting. However, it is a hard class and I ended up with a C. I just didn't get it. But take him! he's not hard at all. The secret: STUDY like always!
great class, maked rocks interesting, does not teach in the fall, so try to get him in the spring. deff go on the field trips for this or any geol class, it will bump up your grade 3-5 whole points

Dr. Crowe is an outstanding professor.  He makes the material easy to understand and doesn't make the tests insanely hard.  He has a great sense of humor and would always make me laugh in class.  Definately recommend him!
dr. crowe is one of the funniest teachers i've ever had. his lectures are easy to understand and all the test material comes from the notes. super cool guy!!
He was funny, and i learned a whole lot in his class! Take him!

Crowe is a great teacher!  He makes the lessons fun and the tests are easy if you pay attention to the lectures and don't buy the book.  There are short multiple choice quizes every 3 or 4 classes, so make sure you go or you'll miss one.  They're very easy if you pay attention in class, I only have ever missed 1 question at most.
Great class!!! the best professor. He wants you to learn and help you do it. I love geology thanks to him. The test are from the lectures... so go to class you will enjoy it.

Dr. Crowe is a really good professor. So far he has actually been my favorite professor. His notes are really good and when it comes to the test there are no surprises because the questions are things we have been over in class. He is also really funny. If you have a chance I would take his class.

Dr. Crowe is an amazing professor. His tests are only from what he teaches in class, so it is very straight-forward and there are no trick questions. He gives wonderful notes and explains, in detail, everything so that it is understandable. However, he does not post his notes on WebCT so it is important you attend every class to grasp the concepts.

I personally really enjoyed Dr. McCoy as a person, but struggled in the class. There were a lot of assignments, but the only two grades in the class were the Midterm and Final Portfolios. This being said, there was basically no way to know what you had in the class the whole time. However, I think she's a really great teacher.
ratingTags_Rating: Gives good feedback--SO MANY PAPERS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment_Rating: Dr. McCoy is an amazing professor and a great person. Her class is by no means easy, but she wants you to succeed. If you work hard and take advantage of her office hours so she can explain to you in more detail what she wants out of your work, you should be okay. Just be prepared to do a lot of writing and re-writing.

She is a really great teacher. It's hard to get an A on a paper, because she's a tough grader but all the assignments are pretty easy. Very helpful when you ask and she actually cares about you as a person rather than just a student. She rambles a lot, but she's also very entertaining. Loved her
Nice professor but grades hard. She rambles a lot on things that are irrelevant to class.

Dr. McCoy is easily the most interesting and interested teacher I have had at UGA. She's really laid back and cool, and usually starts class with great music and relates it to the discussion. You have to post on the ELC discussion board every week, and there are a couple essays. She is very caring and understanding, and loves what she does!

She was not a great professor. Was very vague, and not very helpful. Class was a waste of time. Someone would ask simple yes/no question and she would spend 20-30 minutes rambling, then complain about us wasting time. She liked to give readings in the textbook with accompanying journal entries, which she never graded or commented on.

She is a really nice lady and always willing to help you. Enthusiastic about what she's teaching and really cares about everyone. However, she grades essays kind of hard, I seemed to always get B's no matter how hard I tried, and so did everyone else in the class. Reading assignments were sometimes overwhelming.

Really an all around great class. Lots of reading but not more than you would expect from an entry level English class. She is really passionate about research and it shows in her teaching style. I really enjoyed the class and I got the sense that everyone else did too.

Dr. McCoy did an awesome job explaining what she wanted and expected of us. Everything that we read for that class (which was a lot) was enjoyable and interesting. I was afraid to take her when I read the reviews below. Maybe she is just harder on first semester students. I know that several of us made A's on our papers in American Literature.

Dr. McCoy is a very interesting lady. She is very easy to talk to, is always willing to meet with you and responds to emails quickly. However, one of the first things she said (after the drop/add period) was that she thinks that As should only be given for great papers and that none of us are great writers yet. No one got an A.

Dr. McCoy is a very nice lady. She is very helpful outside of class and through email. She let us choose all of the topics of all of our essays. However, she grades really hard. She would say "this is a terrific essay" and compliment it over and over and I would still get a B. I don't think anyone in our class got an A on an essay.

SHe is a very very nice nice lady. Class is in the lab alot, alot of busy work in the start, but its slows down. 4 papers-she let us pick our own topics fo all of them. dont expect higher than a B on any of them. Really helpful though!

I hated this class, but it was bearable... she requires you to come to class every day and there is a lot of out of class work. interesting if you like post-civil war literature, otherwise good luck. otherwise, not to bad of a teacher, and she allows you to format your own class, which is nice

She is a really good teacher but  a tough grader. This makes it really hard to make an A in the class. She does so in order to make us good writers. Moreover, she is ready to help anytime. Great teacher if u r willing to learn not if u want an easy A
Great teacher

Dr. McCoy is a great teacher. She is clear as far as what she expects and explains her assignments well. You will not be lost in the class. She grades slightly harder than some other teachers. She is very involved in all assignments, so if you do start to do poorly, she'll let you know. Almost impossible to get an A, but a B is easily attainable.

The reading assignments were very short, usually taking 20 min or less to complete.  As long as you did your work, and showed progress thoughout the semester, then you typically do quite well in her class.  I received an A for the class even though I was writing B papers all semester.  I highly recommend her class to anyone considering it.

By far one of the best teahcers I've had. I can honestly say I learned a lot about English and how to write a decent essay from her. I'm pretty sure only one or two people in my class made an A, but you definitely learn a lot and she is very kind, helpful, and understanding.
Looks at progress. Failed my first essay, but ended up with an A in the class. Very liberal, open to any ideas, which can be... iritating. Helpful.
The professor is really nice and caring.  She also is pretty liberal and easy-going.  However, she makes it pratically impossible to get an A.
She is very warm and caring in addition to being a good teacher.  She is a tough grader but she does it to help you become a better writer.
She is a very good teacher. Very helpful and cares about her students. As long as you do the assignments, you will have a good grade. Essays are graded hard, but not impossible.
Very good teacher...Will help a student with anything! Grades essays a little hard..but that is expected!!
The essays are hard, but the teacher is very personal.
TOUGH ESSAY GRADER.  Then again, so are a lot of English 1102 profs.
Incredible teacher.  Engaged udents all the time.  Made class interesting.  Learn a lot !
Andre class was great
The class was fun and I liked the projects. I wish I had room at the time for Spanish 3
great class, miss it a lot
Loved the class. Great teacher!

Andre Franco has been one of the best teachers I have ever had. He was very clear and I understood everything that he explained or assigned in class. I would highly recommend him for a language teacher. He takes the time to help you with any needs or questions you might have. He is a great teacher, and I have mucho respect for him.
Great teacher.  Strict "No Ingles" policy promotes studying.  His tests are brutal but he'll help you out.  I think he left to teach at Middlebury though.
franco is an awesome prof. i enjoyed his class. the department tests are easy in comparison to his quizzes, but he teaches well and is more than willing to help everyone.
That's bull, he's not easy. he just makes everyone think he is.  His test and quizzes are equally as hard, which is not easy, and the final was ridiculously difficult.
really funny and laid-back.  not a tough class and you should learn the basics pretty well.
"uhhhhhhhh". "umm". this guy needs to get some enthusiasm in his life
I was just jumping rope with this prereq course, and he realized that... He gave me a full letter grade higher than I deserved.
He is hard to understand, but his tests and quizes are easy.
Class was hard, but he was a fair grader and was rather lenient on grading tests.  Lectures were boring, but hey, it's Calculus, what can you expect?
The lectures are very boring and he moves too quickly. Not very personable, but he will help you out a lot if you go to his office hours. He's not the best, but not the worst either.
Uhhh. What can i say!! He's just a bad teacher! probably because he's not confident enough to be a teacher! but, he's available for help after class, so u might find that helpful, at least i did!
This material is hard enough without a teacher who teaches to the math majors in the class.

Just show up to take the quizes each week (very simple).  He drops the lowest grades too.  Never takes attendance.  Will help you out with any questions if you are considerate (as most people are not).
Don't take it from him!

His lectures were painfully boring and he clearly was not interested in teaching the class.  He was extremely unwelcoming of outside discussion of the class and was not clear on the material that would appear on the tests.
argh!!!
Very good teacher. He is better at expaining things one on one though than he is in class. Overall pretty great teacher.

He is the person who puts stuff up for JExam testing times and such. He loves JExam.... You have homework on it too, but it helps out for tests and stuff. Office hours are good to go to him and ask him stuff. You take quizzes, but you drop some of your low ones. He doesn't take attendance and it's a

Exceptional speaker, I don't think I heard her speak the same word twice when lecturing. Very clear and concise information, sometimes goes on tangents but always to bring light to a couple of points that usually end up on the tests. The textbook is not necessary but be sure to take thorough notes. Overall very insightful class, I enjoyed it.

Professor Crain is a sweet woman but she is not the most exciting teacher. Her lectures were a bit boring and she tended to ramble. Her quizzes came directly from articles in the book so definitely get it! She definitely won't inspire you to become an art historian but her class wasn't terrible.
Prof. Craine is hot.  The class is boring, so i used to draw in it.  But she's hot.  in a **** way.

She checks attendance every day with an attendance sheet. Her lectures bored me, even though I love art history. Sometimes I actually fell asleep, which I NEVER do. Her tests were pretty challenging and detailed, so I studied a lot. She is nice, but also dull. I would strongly recommend taking a different professor if possible, but I did get an A.

Prof. Crain's lectures were not the most interesting. It seemed as though she'd either recite way too much information quickly or ramble on about how beautiful a piece of artwork was. However, that's not to say her lectures were a complete waste of time. Her tests are not too difficult if you study the notes from class.

The worst art history lecturer I have ever had, however because of the difficulty of her tests you actually learn the material.. on your own. Unless you're particularly good at retaining info from a rambling mono-tone lecturer that comes off like she's sleep-talking. Ps the student notes (when i took the class 2 yrs ago) were very helpful.

The worst art history lecturer I have ever had, however because of the difficulty of her tests you actually learn the material.. on your own. Unless you're particularly good at retaining info from a rambling mono-tone lecturer that comes off like she's sleep-talking. Ps the student notes (when i took the class 2 yrs ago) were very helpful.
Great teacher!  You will have to study, but she is not the hardest professor I have ever had.  I made an A.

It takes some time to get used to her. She talks softly but she refuses to use a mic. She's not hard to understand though most ppl think she's pretentious because she uses big words. She likes to jump around in her lectures. I'd bring a laptop. The text is useless. She'll talk a lot if she finds a painting interesting--may not be relevant to test.

I found her lectures extremely aggrevating.  She speaks in VERY BIG WORDS all of the time.  I don't think that I am intellectually challenged, but she was hard to follow.  And her exams were very hard.  I am a good student, and actually made a C in this class.  All A's in all others.  She said that she expected us to make C's.  Ugh.

Maybe this isn't the same teacher that everyone else is raving about but I hated this class. She was condescending and difficult. It was impossible to get a decent grade and she never answered my questions when I consulted her about study habits. Worst class so far.

Professor Crain is a very intelligent woman who is obviously passionate about art history, but I found her to be slightly hard to follow sometimes.  She jumped around a lot during her lectures.  If you have trouble understanding anything, just set up an appointment to meet with her in her office, and she'll be happy to help.

I loved this class! Mrs. Crain's lesson plans started off slow but picked up and became very interesting. She is extremely helpful. If you take notes in class you don't need the book. I am going to miss this class. Two of her TA's grade the tests, and they are fair. Take this class not only for the topic but for her expertise.
she has been one of my favorite teachers!!  definatley a demanding class, but it is definatley worth it. shes very well read and very understanding. i look forward to going to class every day.

She is so nice and helpful! She is very interested in art history, and it shows in her lectures. She is pretty clear in her explainations, but if you are still confused, she is more than happy to help! Great teacher!
she is super nice and very helpful! you have to take detailed notes and the tests are a bit hard but the quizes are easy and she helps you out if you go to her office. def. recommend!

This class is challenging, but very interesting.  Crain is well read in her subject.  If you already have a hard schedule, you may not want to take this class.  However, if your load is not too heavy, I definitley recommend this class!  It makes the student cultured and familiar with prominent western art.

Overall, she's a great teacher!  The tests can be kinda tricky, but if you take good lecture notes, you can pull off an A.  You can really get behind if you don't go to her class, but her lectures are so interesting that you'll want to go every day!
She is very helpful and insightful
It's so hard to stay awake in this class, especially at 9 AM.  She's fairly boring, overly thorough, and occasionally makes subjects confusing, but overall is ok.

I think professor Crain is AMAZING. She is able to talk about a statue, which to me looks like a lump of marble, interesting. If you pay attention you'll love the class. She made me change my major to Art History!
As soon as she turns out the lights, im out so the class was hard for me.

Explains concepts very well. Very helpful. I think she makes the material very interesting and makes sure to give you plenty of background so you understand easily. Take ntoes and pay attention and you'll have an A.
Great teacher, she sometimes get a little confusing, but she always comes back to the point. If you listen in class and take notes on the key points. You will definintly get an A!
TAKE, TAKE, TAKE, 100% TAKE! Martin is incredible, hilarious, and has such a great character. He made Spanish III a fun and interactive class where I honestly felt happy going to each time.

Fantastic professor, he made my first experience with Spanish amazing. I learned a lot and felt comfortable in basic conversation. Funny, kind, available, helpful, and understanding, I would take any class of his. Spanish 1 was especially easy, try and he will give you an A.

Absolutely the best professor I could have had for my first year of Spanish. Easy grader and will teach you the basics well. Homework is assigned but he just goes over it in class. Very energetic and makes learning Spanish fun. He is very understanding if you have a busy schedule the week of a big assignment or turn in something a little late
TAKE HIS CLASS! I promise you will be so happy you did. You'll actually learn to speak and understand Spanish and the class is enjoyable. He is a great teacher and makes it fun.

He's very sweet and an easy grader. Peruvian but speaks very clearly and he's easy to understand. Happy to explain in English if you don't understand, but speaks primarily Spanish in class. Doesn't require much work outside of class.
Awesome teacher. Very laid back. fair grader. wants everyone to learn spanish and do well! very informative. Not much hw. Only the week of a test to help study.

Senor Martin is one of the best Spanish teachers I've ever had. Not only is he young and funny, he truly wants you to understand the material and is willing to explain it countless times and in countless ways to help you get it. Even though it was an early 8am, this was definitely one of my favorite classes I've ever taken at UGA.  TAKE HIM!!
INCREDIBLE. Martín is one of the best teachers I've ever had. Take his class...you'll learn so much!

Martin Rocks very good teacher and he is very helpful...he knows his spanish well and his english tooo so he can help if you get confused...if you miss a hw he lets you do it again for credit...martin rocks!

This class was ridiculously easy, though most of it was a review for me. Most of our classtime was spent playing games to learn the material. He prepares you really well for all the tests, though the final was really hard compared to all the in-class assessments. Definitely take Martin's class if you can!
One of the coolest and best teachers I've ever had.  Learned a ton too.  Very helpful out of class.
Martin is the man. He is by far the best spanish teacher at UGA and a very fair grader.
This crazy Peruvian is such a good teacher, friendly and his class is lots of fun. I highly recommend him. Watch out guinea pigs.

This dancing fool will pretty much rock your face off.  He is the reason why i am doing international business with a minor in spanish.  He was rated number 1 out of the other 145 teachers in the spanish department.  Plus... he has ridden a llama, so you know he knows his stuff!!!!
Man Martin is pretty much amazing. He's really helpful, really good teacher....tests and quizzes not hard, study right from the book....some notes. I'm taking him again for 2001 if possible.
Easiest Spanish class at UGA!!!

I personally had a terrible experience with Dr. Wilder. He was not focused in class and took forever and a half to give papers back. I frequently left class frustrated. I would NOT recommend this class to anyone
ratingTags_Rating: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--SO MANY PAPERS

comment_Rating: Honestly one of the worst professors I have ever taken. He never came to class, and when he did he rambled on about things that didn't matter. We wrote 4 papers and only got 1 back to see the feedback. He was unclear on assignment due dates and was difficult to get ahold of. Do not take this class- unrealiable unprofessional professor!

Best class I've had in my English major. He's really funny and ties the novels to today's stuff like mystery novels, horror novels, movies, and TV, etc. Asks a lot but its reasonable. Slow grader but helpful comments for next paper.

Professor Wilder is a really funny guy. I really enjoyed his class; we covered some really interesting topics and he was helpful in how to think about writing. However, he is an EXTREMELY slow grader. We did not get our first papers back for 2 months. Leaves helpful comments. Due dates were changed a lot so a little confusion with the syllabus.

Ridiculous slow at giving back essays and hard grader.  But half a semester I've learned more about writing papers and analyzing than in all the classes I've had before. Weird but interesting assignments. Really funny but sometimes pushes it a little too far or gets offtrack. Likes to talk about his kid but just smile and laugh to keep him happy.

Like earlier guy I'd heard nothing but good stuff about Wilder as great prof, but weird semester. Canceled 4 or 5 times (nowhere near 10) for sickness, injury, etc. Tried to make it up to class by making syllabus too flexible which sometimes led to confusion. Great lectures, strange tangents, hilarious. A little weird but good class. Learned a lot

Quirky but cool guy.Pretty funny. A basic 3000 level short story class. I don't remember anything about who he was taught by, but he did talk about meeting Kirk Vonnegut in a crowd or party or something a couple times.I don't remember what his point was but he didn't really make a big deal of it.I wouldn't call the class hard but it was challening.

Dr. Wilder is a pretty cool guy, if a bit weird. If you read the assignments and participate in class a little bit you should get a pretty good grade. He had us write response papers which were incredibly easy and short. You should expect to hear the same couple of stories from him over and over again, such as who he's met and been taught by.

Snow days and sick days got us way behind, so calendar was confusing for a while before he updated it but its the first English class Ive ever learned so much in. I was surprised it was so interesting to talk about food and culture. But a VERY slow grader.
Good prof. Very hard grader but made me a better writer by forcing me to work harder if I wanted a decent grade. Interesting topics. Pretty funny guy too but kind of absentminded.

Do not take this professor! He is extremely strict when it comes to grading and took off points for a technical error. He is very hard to work with. I liked his personality at first, however. He has a very dry sense of humor.
He is a terrible teacher. He doesn't want to help, his grading is unreasonably hard. AVOID THIS GUY!

Honestly my favorite English class ever. I had to miss twice and was upset about it. Wilder likes depressing poetry but his sense of humor still keeps class light and upbeat.He does a great job of making the Victorians relatable to today because like he says we're still talking about the same stuff in today's society.

A good mix of lecture and discussion. Not a fast grader but assignments okay. Practiced in class for exam prep which made exam pretty easy, and met alot out of class on papers. Funny as hell and talked to me after class to answer questions almost every day. Not a great class but def a good one.

Its clear he knows a lot about poetry, but he really just does a lot of talking. Arrogant and unhelpful. Graded on a poetry test (very few people felt prepared for it), two papers (again, not helpful in preparing us) and you have to go to poetry readings too. A lot of people withdrew after the poetry test. Had potential but just wasn't a good class

Excellent professor. The readings aren't too demanding, but he does expect students to retain most of the additional information he provides during lectures for the tests. While some may find this standard too exacting, I found that it made me learn more, and I was grateful for the opportunity.

I took it on Junemester in Oxford. The reading load was kind of insane before we even got to Oxford, but classes were great because he filled in all the gaps with context and history we missed in the reading. Great lecturer but I wouldn't take the class again in such a short term because of the crazy pace. He was great but the calendar was nuts.

One of the worst teachers I've ever had. Unreasonable grading, wasn't fair or kind, and wasn't willing to work with the students. Even great essays were given D's and F's for stupid reasons. Try to take another teacher if at all possible if you'd like to do well in this course!

The best class I've had at UGA. Great books, fair grader and he's funny and laid back. When I had some personal problems he actually cared how I did catching up on what I missed but also if I was okay. None of my other profs did that this semester. In my 3 years at UGA I've never had a better or more caring prof.

Wilder's great. Puts alot of emphasis on scanning meter and rhyme and learning stanza forms and terms and stuff like that. The midterm was hard as hell (but he's gving an extra credit option to help). But mostly we talk about the poems we are reading. He doesn't make you feel stupid for coming up with a different reading than him or anyone else.

Dr. Wilder and Dr. Pizzino are by far the two best English teachers I've ever had. Wilder leads great discussions but even his lectures are great too. Some of the only classes I've totally lost track of time in. Always available to talk in person or by email. And funny as hell. A great way to start my last year, but I wish I found him earlier.

Dr. Wilder is an incredible teacher.I'm a senior English major, and he's absolutely one of the best English professors I have had at UGA.It's very refreshing to have a prof who is passionate about his subjct.My favorite classes were the ones where we spent the whole hour discussing only one or two poems.I learned a lot about how to read poetry.

I thought a Victorian poetry class would be totally boring, but he keeps it pretty interesting. He's hilarious and he does a graet job of hooking the Victorian stuff to issues we talk about in modern times. Great summer class!

Class covered crazy amount of material. Like thousands of years. Tough grader. Takes a long time to return papers and tests. But great lecturer. I always hated English until this class but now I signed up for another one next semester. Very funny which makes even the dull stuff okay.
Wilder is a really slow grader which is frustrating but he is a really good teacher and my writing has gotten much better this semester. The class had an interesting theme too.
Interesting class, good guy, hard grrader.

I wish the class had focused on History more insted of so much literature. But it's still been a great class. He's hilarious and a really good lecturer. Usually hate group presentations but this one worked great.

He is on some sort of power trip. The only people who really love him are English majors. He is a jerk when grading, a jerk when speaking to him, and if you ever say something he doesn't think is right in class he will tear you apart. Don't take his classes unless you really love being taught by a pompous man who believes he is better than you

Dr. Wilder is one of the best English profs I've had. He is very demanding but made me work harder. I spent lots of time in his office on my papers and exams. h'es nominating one of my papers for some award. There's lots of reading but no more than other upper level classes. If you don't mind hard work, I highly recommend. If you want easy, run.

Prof Wilder was always available to talk about exams, papers, ect. in office or e-mail. Lectures mostly interesting. Discussion was good when people did the reading. He'll argue a point but gives credit to others if people give support. Don't know how someone came up with >200 pgs/wk. More like 100-150. But VERY hard grader especially on papers.

Dr. Wilder is not approachable. Many students in the class agreed that they were intimidated to speak in his class because they were scared they'd be wrong.Read every single thing he assigns or you won't do well,which is usually >200pgs/wk. PREPARE TO WORK HARD. **VERY** tough grader and writes sarcastic comments on your papers. I do NOT recommend!

His class is different from all the other 1102 classes as it focuses on food and culture. He grades really harshly, but I can tell he wants your writing to get better. Take him if you want your writing to improve. Stay FAR away if you want an easy and high grade.

Best prof EVER. Like some people before I cant decide if he's better lecturing or leading a conversation with the clss, or both. And he's so funny. I've never laughed so much in a class. I wrote down pages of funny lines. I learned a lot about victorian novels and my writing got better due to him knowing something about everything.

He has a sarcastic personality that can sometimes be funny but overall I wouldn't recommend him. He is the type of teacher that refuses to give students an A and is on some type of power trip. Also, he didn't show up to class a lot but instead of sending an email he would have a sign on the door so you would still walk all the way to class

Prof. Wilder is fantastic. I took 4500 from him in the fall, and I'm taking 4520 now.  That's the 4th or 5th class of his I've had. He's completely freaking hilarious-as everyone else said-and a fabulous lecturer. When he gets on a roll, you lose track of time. he's slow to return papers and tests, but that's really the only negative thing to say.

Professor Wilder is absolutely hilarious. I had him last semester for Intro to Fiction. He likes discussion, but he's also a FABULOUS lecturer. The only complaint I had is that our class had group projects, and the later half of the class was student-taught. I'd rather have had him teach, and the group paper wasn't fun, but there was no final.

All I can say, it's a pleasure to finally sit in a class that the professor really knows how to lecture. I don't mean prof. that just talks the whole class but one that comes to class with something well thought out to say. He has a talent for explaining and for turning the time period into a story. You look up and suddenly the class time is over.

Great teacher! Was skeptical at first (the class was themed around food/dining), but I actually really enjoyed it. In addition to the books, we viewed films and completed a couple of group projects. He grades harshly (C+ papers could probably earn As from other professors), but you'll learn a lot. He expects you to really know your grammar.

Like everyone else said, he's hilarious. I guess I missed the quips that bothered the last person. Sometimes I came into class kind of lost from the reading, but he always made it clear which led to great class discussions. It could almost be listed as a history class too. When I came to college, this is exactly the kind of class I wanted to take.

He is very good at teaching, I will give him that. I wasn't too interested in hearing him make quips about students who missed class or dropped out. It was a bit juvenile. Very strict about grading, so make office visits frequently. He is much more friendly in person than his in-class persona suggests.

Awesome. Just awesome. Slow on returning exams and essays, but knows everything about the 19th century and is the most hilarious prof I've ever had. We all decided we want to make a movie about him, and we'd use all the hilarious things he tosses aside or mutters under his breath. Sit in the front so you don't miss any of those jewels.

don't know the last guy's deal, but i've never had more fun in a eng class. yeah he's got boundaries & can be a little intimidating b/c he's so professional.but if you roll with it he's hilarious. he makes fun of himself a lot more than he does of anyone else. as for the class, ties everything together so you seee a big picture. recomended!

do NOT cross him. i am dropping his class because i tried to explain an absence and he wrote me an email that was extremely rude and hurtful. he is ridiculously arrogant, and be forewarned that if you do not fit into his parameters or bow down to his ideas of "boundaries between professors and students" then you will get a very nasty atttitude

The best teacher I have ever had. Made  even the most boring prose/poetry profound. He's hilarious in class and dresses well. Bring your laptop to class and take copious notes; that's how I got A's on the final and the midterm. Will tear up your papers, but it's justified. Wish I could take this again, it's the most I've ever learned in a class.

He starts out seeming mean and arrogant, but he actually is a really nice guy. He grades harshly, but it's because he's trying to help you better your writing. My advice is to make a lot of appointments before papers are due and you'll be okay. He makes lots of comments on papers, take them into consideration for the next paper. I recommend him.

i hated this class early on. 1st 2 essays crushed. i would have gotten a/b from my 1101 teacher. 3 was better but still not what I think i would get since i worked like crazy on it. writing center thought it was good, but not wilder. but he just looked at my 4th essay draft and said it may be an a. i can tell my writing really has gotten better.

he totally bashed my 1st paper and I'm freaked out about turning in #2. he does know his stuff though and is helping me with drafts. like other people said his humor really does make a terrible class a little better. oh and yeah, he does dress great; only teacher I've ever seen who's always got a silk hankie in his jacket pocket!

funny, and really wanted students to grasp material- it was a very engaging class, sometimes quite hilarious. it's been a few semesters since i took this course, but i don't remember the tests to be unneccessarily tough. i would def tell anyone to take him- i almost miss his class now! oh - and i agree w someone before- he does dress really well
This class was easy and interesting.  he does an excellent job of surveying the material that is required.  Take this class if you're okay with actually doing work and participating in class.

This was my favorite class this past semester. His lectures are pretty interesting and he really encourages class participation. His test are straightforward, but make sure you study your notes. He's fair and his dry humor makes the best of what could be a rather boring subject.

I hated this class. High grades in AP and 1101, but I made a C- in 1102. He was always availalbe by e-mail but he left it up to us to come to him for extra help. No required conferences or anything likie that. He siad that we needed to make our own decisions about whether or not we wanted his help. class was fun but didn't make up for low grade.

dr wilder's class nearly kicked my butt. i got an f and a d on the 1st 2 papers but i started asking him to read and comment on drafts and stuff and i made lots of appts. my writing improved more than i thought was possible b/c of this class. i ended up with a b. he gives lots of help but it is up to you to take him up on it. no required appts.

Grades tough on essays. Not much assignments to do. Watch out on your essays. They will haunt you if you're not meticulous with them. I had a B in English 1101 with a different teacher. I left Dr. Wilder's class with a very low grade =(.
No Comments

Wilder's a good teacher, but the tests nearly killed me. Need to know your stuff. He's not great on organization, and the lecture is point-blank, so it's imperative that you make connections between works and not just know what each piece is about. Wants to help students, but he's not always clear or creative. Fun and a good guy, overall.

he was a great teacher. The class was never boring and I always enjoyed his insight and jokes. It was clear he likes english and teaching very much, which is a great!  He is well read and even if you arent an english major you will find this class very interesting!

He is knowlegable and passionate about english, his class isn't exactly easy but i checked the key and my class got a high gpa. I really respected and appreciated him and his insight. Plus, he's really funny and an enjoyable.
Very helpful.  Wants the students to learn about every aspect of a piece of literature.  Funny.  Open to discussion.

hot! dresses great! great teacher, knows his stuff, keeps it light, funny and serious, super enthusiastic about the lit. i like science and usually hate eng but this is my fav class this sem. i look forward to it even tho its early morning (9:30). love it but test nearly killed me tho.

best eng prof ever! no pushover but he knows everything about eng lit and really fun. jokes somewhere between hilarious and corny but really keeps stuff light even when talking about serious stuff. teaches lit but brings in art, music, hist, and other cool stuff. never learned more in an eng class.
Great teacher who really likes his subject.  Tests can be a little overwhelming, but if you're willing to study hard you'll do fine.
A very good class.  Wilder makes poetry very interesting.Plus, He is nice and easy to get along with.  The tests can be hard, but an Easy A if you study

Myers is a really nice guy, and he usually knows what he is talking about, however I barely understood him. He usually goes far off topic, and the class is very dull. He is a very tough grader, and I had no idea what to write by the end of semester. This class was more frustrating than it was helpful.
very funny, nice guy, good teacher
I found he was very hard on grading papers; however, his comments didn't help me to significantly improve my writing.
He is a very hard in grading papers..he will help you though if you are willing to improve your grade. won't promise it will improve much though.
The class is incredibly boring. I would definitely say he is one of the harder English teachers. The reading are very complex and confusing so writing a paper on them is nearly impossible.

This class was interesting. Myers is a cool guy, but the readings were pretty deep which made writing about them difficult. He is pretty tough in grading, so don't expect an "A" on all four papers. The final exam is a portfolio showing your work from the semester, but it's a lot work. Overall, I'd say Myers is a good prof for a first-year course.

LOVED this class. Essay topics are usually fun & interesting - can be broad, but that allows you to explore a topic you actually care about. Funny, extremely helpful professor, really cares about his students. Do the readings, work hard on your essays. Don't be afraid to come to him with questions about your drafts before the due date. GREAT CLASS!

Id say his class was more challenging than hard. He expects a lot for each paper. He has a very dry/awkward since of humor and he made the class less of a bore. Overall a good professor- just dont expect and easy A

Myers is the man. He is brilliant. If he sees that you are trying, your grade will improve. The class is only four papers and he'll probably grade the first one hard, just to wake everyone up, but all in all the class was an easy B and an A if you put effort into your papers. Definetly take this class.

Cool teacher. The readings are a little harder than normal, but he does a great job explaining. It the essays in class tend to build on each other which come in handy for the portfolio. He also does in class peer review which is helpful. I definitely learned to write better in this class

Good teacher. The literature used in the class is very difficult and boring, but he does an excellent job of explaining it. Very fair in grading. If your looking for a class that will bore you, this is the one. But as far as the teacher, he's okay. He wouldn't be my first choice, though.
He's a good guy, very fun sense of humor.  His topics are so confusing and boring.  He grades pretty hard and very random.
Myers is awesome. His sense of humor is great, and he is a fair and thorough grader. You will learn a lot in his class.
nice guy, but grades a little too hard. If you have a choice I wouldn't recommend him out of all the teachers since you have to take english it sucks to have it bring you GPA down.

A good man, jokes like Seinfeld, disposition of Garrison Keeler, mannerisms of Winnie the Pooh. Very salient on symbolism, meaning in the readings. Not rigorous and good at his trade, fairly young, expects some familiarity with the material. Very helpful, likes Family Guy, Cohen bros.

Dr. Smalley is in my opinion a fantastic teacher, the guy clearly knows his field. As a heads up though, his tests are pretty tough and he doesn't post any materials so you have to take detailed notes during lecture.

My FYOS was "How Tree's Grow Humans". We spoke about tree's roles in literature, film, books, and other media. It was a very interesting class full of discussion. We went on campus walks sometimes and Dr. Smalley would talk to us about tree types and their history. I was suprised by how much I enjoyed this class! Very caring and full of stories!

Dr. Smalley is hands down the BEST professor at UGA. If you ever have the opportunity to take one of his course, do it! He can be a little scattered at times when presenting information but is always happy to stop and answer any questions. He genuinely cares about his students and encourages you to stop by his office at anytime.

Dr. Smalley is one of the best professors at UGA. He is passionate about his work and his students. This particular class is mostly memorization, but the lab is fun. I've registered for him again next semester in Landscape Management. :)

Dr. Smalley is a very passionate teacher who loves to talk and share stories. Great labs for the class and the structure of the class is fantastic. It's a lot of memorizing, but If you do the work, It's not bad. Smalley is Awesome!

Most spaced out teacher I have ever had. Great teacher, knows a lot and LOVES his field. I had him for a study abroad, thought I would get an a but B+ instead. Tough grader but the trip of a lifetime. Recommended.
Lab with class as well.
No Comments
No Comments

I've only had Dr Smalley for an easy intro Hort class. He's easy in this class, but I've heard from other students (and kinda got the impression myself) that he is somewhat arrogant and pompous. Not sure how he does in the higher level classes. Good luck.
Material is somewhat unorganized causing you want to skip class a lot, but it's worth it to go usually because Dorfman is a good guy and leads interesting class discussions.
Awesome guy. Had him for an FYOS but would definitely take him again. Certainly recommend him.

Dorfman is a good teacher. This class was really easy to me, i missed class alot and easily got an A. The tests are alot like the old tests he puts on his website so you bascially have some of the answers. Take this class!
He's a great professor. Do your homework and show up to class and you'll be just fine. You won't regret it.
Good professor!  Fairly easy tests.  Be sure to show up for class because he gives extra credit when there is low attendance.
He will basically give you an A! I'm not even joking. If test scores were low, he gave more extra credit. There were quizzes in class for EC when attendance was low and you play games... do it!

Very boring lectures! He takes the material from the book to make his powerpoint lectures, so you dont even have to come to class.  He posts review guides and practice tests.  His tests are easy.  He gives extra credit pop quizes when class attedance is low and when we play economics games in class.

Dorfman is BORING. He lectures via powerpoint using material from book. You almost don't even have to show up for class, but he does do extra credit if he notices half the class is skipping sometimes. He gives sample questions and previous exams to help studying. Tests are easy, but rigid.

He is a great guy. Pretty funny and interesting. But most of all, he will do absolutley anything possible to help you get a good grade in his class. He actually cares. He assigns homework but it's not mandatory. His tests can be tricky but if you actually study they aren't hard. I love this guy.

As a professor, I enjoyed him a lot. He talks really slow and he has quite the dry sense of humor. He explains things well but expects you to put in the work outside of class to master each unit. You do get an opportunity for extra credit, but most of your average rides on the tests. If you put in the time, you will get an A or B.

Math modeling is supposed to be an easy class for people who aren't very good at math but this class was difficult. If you're not good at math visit him at study hours and he will help you. The quizzes are easier than the tests.

This class was difficult for me because I never did work or paid attention in class. I studied hard for the final and did fine. The class really is not difficult at all if you try. Very helpful office hours and a cute old man. Mainly consisted of a project, quiz, tests, and a huge final percentage.

This class is supposed to be an easy math class but Reichle's isn't. His tests don't really reflect what he teaches in class so success in this class relies on self instruction. His test averages are always really low and not that many people do well in his class. He is not understanding AT ALL and can be very rude at times.
He is a really helpful teacher that cares about your success. You have to do your homework and may possibly go into his office hours for specific questions but overall the class is not difficult.

Really good professor! He goes fast so I ultimately ended up copying all the examples he gives in class and then reviewing them later on my own. He uses webassign which I found very helpful. His office hours are fantastic and he is so helpful and approachable. The tests and homeworks are all online which was weird at first but you get used to it.
He is AWESOME! tells you exactly whats on test and gives you all the notes you need. SO SWEET and very helpful in class and office hours. TAKE HIM. he is the best and a really great teacher!
Reichle was great! I detest math, but he explained things really well and told us exactly what would be on the tests and quizzes. The homework is optional, but really helpful to review before tests.

I am not a math person, at all. But Prof. Reichle actually made it bearable! He is very clear, and very patient if you need clarification. He is helpful if you're having a problem, and his quizzes and tests are fairly easy. I highly recommend him!
