Professor Reichle is an okay teacher. He seems to know what he's talking about but goes too fast. He  is too strict on attendance policies, even if you have a family emergency...he won't allow you to make up things you have missed and you get an automatic zero for the material missed. So school comes before family. I did not like him or his class.

Mr. Reichle is an interesting guy, in a good way. I've never really liked math, but I thought he did a good job teaching. Drops lowest 2 quiz grades and replaces lowest test with final. Explains things pretty well, approachable/nice person. I'm more slow at math so I had to study more for tests, but I managed an A-. Take him for 1101 definitely.
He's a really great professor. He's goofy, but explains the material well. Always be prepared to take a quiz though. They are pop quizzes with usually two problems, so if you miss one, you get a 50.

I hate math, so I mean it when I say Mr. Reichle is the best teacher I've had! He really takes time to help you, and doesn't move on in class before asking if everyone understands the material. The tests and quizzes are straight from the homework, so an A shouldn't be a problem with this class if you work!

Professor Reichle is a great teacher that cares about his students.  He has 4 tests that are straight from homework and class.  He gives 8 quizzes but drops 2.  If you do the homework and stay focused then an A is no problem.  Definitely take if you need a math credit but don't enjoy math.

Professor Reichele is the absolute best teacher I have ever had! The material he teaches is exactly what is on the tests. Reviewing the concepts in class really help. Homework is not mandatory but any student should run through the problem to understand. Definitely enroll in his class. You won't regret it!

Mr. Reichle was SUCH a great teacher!! definitely do the homework each night because the tests and quizzes come right from questions in the book. he will answer any questions. attendance is taken up until the midpoint of the semester and then he no longer takes it. he drops the 2 lowest quiz grades as well.

He was probably the best professor I had this semester. He has a really subtle sense of humor not everyone seems to get. He goes over any questions you may have if you just ask. He is so willing to help you on any office hours and like 10 minutes before class starts. You don't need you text book but that comes from the students not him ;) THE BEST!
Prof. is a pretty good teacher. Web assign is not as bad as everyone says. In fact, I kind of like it. Tests are easy, but the class is super boring though. He looks like a turtle.

He is the most lenient teacher I had so far and I love the way he teaches the materials. His pop-quizzes are very easy and his grading style is awesome! He makes sure people ask him questions even if it means that the class has to be a couple minutes longer. LOVED him. Take his class!

I liked this class surprisingly, and I hate math. He made all the concepts crystal clear and if you do the practice problems and come to class you should definitely make an A. He doesn't have a lot of patience for dumb questions though. Test were very easy and quizzes were as well (he drops the 2 lowest out of 8). Definitely recommend him.

I liked this guy. He's really nice and does a good job teaching the material. The class was super easy too. The problems we did in class are pretty much the same ones on quizzes and tests. There were no surprises or tricky problems. It was all pretty straightforward.
Good teacher. Helpful and approachable. Works out problems from the book. If you work out the problems in the book, you should be fine.
Best teacher! Loved him and his class!

Mr. Reichle was by far my favorite professor out of all my professors during my first semester at UGA. He is so helpful in and outside of class. He really cares about his students. You must go to class because he gives pop quizzes. He is a great teacher for those who don't like math. Don't buy the book for pre-cal. You use webassign online.

GREAT teacher. He's funny in class, and will do practice problems until every single person understands them. He's easy to follow, and spells out basically everything that's going to be on the test. There are NEVER any surprises. He also grades quickly, usually within the next time that we have the class. TAKE HIM!

Reichle is one of the best teachers I have ever had! Numerous times I have sat in his office for hours asking questions, and he is always patient with me and tries everything he can to make me understand what I'm doing and why. He's also pretty funny in class and in his office, so it's never a dread to have to go to his office for help. TAKE HIM!

All the other comments are pretty true. One thing they don't mention is his grading. He is really good about grading quickly, especially considering the size of his classes. He is kinda funny and very easy to understand.
he is great!! take him.. he will help you in any way he can!

By far the best teacher I have ever had at UGA. He's such an easy going teacher, and is really helpful outside of class. You can come back to him if you have problems with homework and/or test and he will give you back points if he feels that you made a small mistake. he gives easy quizzes to help build up your grade. attendence is a must. GREAT TE

I LOVE THIS PROFESSOR! He is my favorite professor at UGA! I hate math, and he honeslty made it easy to understand. If you go to his office hours he really helps you! He truly wants to see his students do well. His test and quizes are not too tough if you study and go to class! And you HAVE to buy the book! TAKE THIS CLASS W/ THIS PROFESSOR! :)

Very helpful outside of class and through email. He makes math easy by only teaching you the things you need to know to pass the class (which is good in case you are not a math person). I recommend his class because of his sense of humor and helpfulness and understanding.

By far the best math teacher I have ever had.  You are guaranteed a good grade if you come to class and study.  He breaks everything down so that even a person who hates Math can't help but enjoy his class.
He is the best teacher ever!!!!!!!!!!!  He is extremely helpful.  If you want an A, then you should definitely take this class.
A reall good teacher! Very nice and funny!
Best math teacher ever. Do practice tests and you will have no problem making an A. If you dont take him you are giving up an easy A.
I hate math, but I didn't mind this class.  Made everything seem easier than I thought it would be.
Best math teacher I've had.

Beyond incredible teacher. I am not good in math nor do I like doing it, but he actually made it interesting and I didn't even dread going to class. He is extremely helpful (especially in office hours) and he makes each student feel welcome. He is very patient and even funny as well. Take his class if you need this math. Don't take Whitehead!

awesome & funny... super easy even if math isn't your thing... attendance not always madatory; final can replace a bad test grade (4 tests total); 2 lowest quiz scores dropped (8 quizzes total)... highly recommended!

Mr. Reichle is probably one of the best math teachers I have ever had. I have never been that great at math and he helps everyone understand. There are no surprises on the test and he prepares you extremely well for test and quizzes. He will answer any question and is always open for help! I would definitely recommend taking his course!!

Class was pretty much simple math, he is willing to explain any and everything.He responds quickly to email. I rarely did homework.He dropped two of the lowest quizzes,and gave us a chance to make up one of our tests. The final wasnt too bad either. TAKE HIM for math! He looks kinda like moby, lol! SO sexy!

Mr. Reichle is awesome. He does not always take attendance. He does not surprise you with anything on the tests. He tells you what to study for the quizzes, and he does not try to make you fail on the tests. Tests are all from quizzes, homework, and in class discussion. And the homework is pretty reasonable. He is awesome, and I am bad with math!

Best teacher I've ever had! He makes class the most fun a math class could be. If you work the practice tests enough, you'll do very well on the tests. The quizzes make you keep up with your work and are a always a problem we worked the day before. He lets you out early alot too! Very pleased!!

If you are taking pre calc, then take it with Kurt if you are smart. He teaches directly from the practice tests, there are NO suprises on the test. Everything that is on the test is taught in class. He places everything you need to know right if front of you, but its still your responsibility to learn it. Practice tests=EASY A.
he is possibly my favorite teacher at uga, and i hate math. i never thought i would make an A. he actually made the theory of math seem interesting. definately not a boring teacher.

Kurt is the best ever!!! I am really really bad at math and still ended up with an A. He teaches straight from the practice test and doesn't waste time with stuff we don't need to know , he will help you with any problems from your homework. He is also very entertaining!! take this class if you want an A!! best decision I ever made!!

I hate math. I went into this class with a horrible attitude and didn't expect to do well in it. Reichle was the best math teacher I have ever had. He taught things in a very comprehendable way, and worked every homework and practice test problem for us (before anything was due). He will go over any test with you and give partial credit.

Excellent professor. Best math teacher I've ever had. Very clear in his teaching techniques, and very fair when grading. Partial credit for all test problems, and he's really fun in class. The only down side is the daily quiz. Just go to class, review, and you'll do fine!
Reichle is a great teacher, all you do is copy his notes off the board, and study the problems he does, because they are almost exactly the problems on the test. Easy A, even easier B.

I hated math before this class and now I love it.  This teacher is so helpful and he is funny too.  He likes to joke around a lot and he gives partial credit on a lot of things. He is fun to joke around with and he has a teaching method that doesn't make you memorize but makes you understand in an easy way.  I love this teacher.  He is great.
If you have to take pre-calculus, take it frrom him. A great teacher, and if you do the practice tests you cannot do badly in the class.
awesome teacher. loved him. and kinda funny....

This is one of the most helpful math teachers I've ever had in school. He talks to the students and is always willing to help, and he gives partial credit on EVERYTHING. His grading policies are nice and he is very friendly and personal.

Great teacher! Extremely helpful and very approachable.  I had to make up a test and it was no problem with him.  Get on his good side, and you will do fine.  It's easy to slack, but make sure to stay on task and you'll get an easy B.
he is the BEST teacher, show up for class, take NOTES, do h/w, pract. tests. and u will do fine. but if u slack in anything. that's UR fault ;D

Dr. Kirkland is a renowned Taoist scholar and is, according to him, one of the fewest who really understand Taoism. Get used to hearing about how much he knows; his lectures can be inconsistent and always lack structure. Having said this, you will learn a considerable amount if you do the reading. If you don't, you won't pass the exams.

Great academic, but not a great teacher.  Not in my opinion anyway.  Some people really liked his class.  I just had a hard time following his lectures, which seemed to be rather "stream of consciousness", taking whimsical diversions and seeming to have little direction.  But you can do well if you KEEP UP WITH THE READING (which I did not).

His lectures are incredibly disorganized and difficult to follow. It felt like there was hardly any structure to the class. Goes off on tangents a lot. Had to buy 7 or 8 books for this class alone, plus a reader. As interested as I am in the subject, I barely learned anything...

Crazy lectures and lots of readings but if you write down what he writes on the board and read what he tells you to then the class is actually fun and pretty easy, but his lectures are not organized at all so some people got lost and gave up.

Do NOT take his class. While you can do well if you read  everything, you will learn absolutely nothing from him. He thinks incredibly highly of himself. He refuses to let any discussion happen because he prefers to only discuss his accomplishments. He would be an asset to the Religion Dept if he were actually interested in teaching.

Clearly he knows what he is talking about and is one of the top scholars in his field. However, he knows this and isn't going to let you forget it. Also, he has no real interest in helping students. He basically acts as if either you get it or you don't. If you don't, tough. He also refuses to allow asking questions in class.

Dr. Kirkland is more interested in shocking his students than teaching. The class was incredibly unorganized and it often to him half the lecture or longer to even get to the topic. He knows the material but lacks any teaching ability. Not very entertaining when you are interested in the subject and just want to learn.

Out of all the classes I've take at UGA, the ones taught by Prof. Krikland have been the most interesting and entertaining; they were my favorites. He jumps around in lectures, but this is hardly a problem.  If you attend class, take notes and read what's assigned, you are set! The people I know of who did poorly failed at at least one of those.
do all your readings.   do your readings, this can not be stressed enough.  Kirkland is a great teacher, fun and insightful.  but class is easy if you do your readings.

He is ridiculous.  He teaches you nothing and like someone else said, he loves to hear himself talk.  Do not go to him with problems about your grade because he does not care.  He believes he is above UGA, so don't expect him to be sympathetic.  Overall, the content of the class was interesting but just from the readings, he taught me nothing.

Kirkland is a bit of a space case.  He does ramble on about completely insignificant things throughout the majority of the lectures.  Class is interesting just for the sheer unorthodoxy of it all.  Really need to know your readings to do well.

Read above comments, take them to heart.  Kirkland talks about himself most of the time; if I had to take a test on his life story, his likes and dislikes, and his pompous attitude, everyone in the class would've gotten 100.  Knows what he's talking about, but lectures very poorly.  Read the books carefully and you'll be OK.  Take only if you must.

this class was horrible... he likes to talk about his life and his views. I found him to VERY disrespectful to others - he likes to belittle new age religions, people who change religion, other majors to name a few. his lectures could be done in half the time he takes.  his tests are from the readings and native american words (very random).

I went into this class excited about the topic and was VERY disapointed. This professor talks about himself or other un-related topics for the majority of the class and is extremely disrespecctful to students when they respond/speak in class. Do NOT take his class unless you want to learn about his life achievements and personal viewpoints.

Dr. Kirkland is a strange character.  He lectures about nothing to do with your class for the majority of the time and then expects you to know everything about the subjects at hand.  The detailed, 25 multiple choice question tests are his pride and joy... he makes them difficult and tied to the texts.  He offers to bump up your grade at the end of

professor kirkland lectures poorly, never really saying anything o much use unless you want to learn about baseball. If you ask for help via email be prepared for him to reply rudely and completely forgo your requests.
If you do the readings and come to class you should be fine

He loves to hear himself talk. Out of a 75 min class, you get 10 minutes of lecture. At the beginning, it takes him three weeks to get to any kind of content. He grades his essay assignment hard and won't talk to you about it later. He treats you like you are retarded.
Interesting and informative.

I can honestly say I did not learn a thing this semester. The professor constantly talks about himself and things not related to buddhism. I went into it with good expectations and came out dissapointed. I dont reccomend the professor.
No Comments
great teacher, took class as an elective and very happy i did
No Comments
No Comments

Prof Moore cares a lot and is willing to give you the help you need to do well in the class. She explains concepts as simply as she can. That said, the content of this class is extremely monotonous and tricky. I don't recommend taking this class for a fun finance elective unless you plan to be a forex trader or something.

Do NOT take FINA 4810 with Moore. The class is so unnecessarily hard for an elective. I wasn't expecting an easy A, but I also wasn't expecting the difficulty of the tests and quizzes. Doable if your course load isn't heavy to begin with. Overall would not take again.
ratingTags_Rating: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment_Rating: Great personality, but she goes by the textbook & that's about it. You don't get any connection to current events or how about what you are learning is applicable to the real world. She gives you some room in the points and tests were not the hardest I've taken but you still have to prepare a lot. Would not be my first elective choice.
ratingTags_Rating: Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment_Rating: Shes the worst teacher I've ever had at UGA. The material is way too hard for an elective, and she doesn't care at all about her students and is overall rude. Genuinely don't understand how she was hired.

It's clear that Prof Moore cares a lot about her students and she is really nice when you need help. This class is so ridiculous though. So insanely hard for an elective and for info you will likely never use. A lot of the times this was more work than my core finance classes.
ratingTags_Rating: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment_Rating: She gives pop quizzes as a way of taking attendance, but there's a percentage that get dropped to allow things like sick days. You HAVE to buy the book. Mini-quizzes are easy-- you should get A's on them. Take notes in class and skim them over before class to get A's on pop quizzes. She gives a lot of grades to help you practice before exams.
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Beware of pop quizzes

comment_Rating: Moore is a great professor, she makes the material interesting and easy to learn. Your grade rests on 3 exams, 1 final, and mini-quizzes each day that are manageable plus help you prepare for real test questions. If you have questions, she's always open to answering them. But sometimes you have to do some self-learning yourself to grasp everything.
ratingTags_Rating: Clear grading criteria--Beware of pop quizzes--Amazing lectures

comment_Rating: I don't understand the bad reviews Dr. Moore has on here; I had a great experience in her class. She explains the material extremely well and gives you everything you need to do well on the tests. There are a lot of in class activities, but if you go to class and do your work they only help your grade. Also, having the textbook is a must.

Never had a one-on-one but Dr. Moore always seemed nice and respected. The material can get confusing and at times I felt like concepts weren't explained the best, but I figured things out. Lots of in class assignments that count for attendance and online quizzes. I really liked the material, wasn't like other finance classes at all
ratingTags_Rating: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment_Rating: Strict. Does not care if you are one minute late and have an excuse, will not take your homework. Not a type of teacher that will help you out.
ratingTags_Rating: Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment_Rating: 10 percent of the total grades 100 points assignment means Pop quiz every class.

Professor Moore wasn't the worst professor I had at UGA until I actually needed help. She seemed interested to help me until I brought up a difficult question. She was unable to answer and this showed me that she has no real knowledge on the material she teaches. Many other instances that displayed this ignorance. Awful professor. Steer clear.

Lots of online quizzes and four tests. The quiz answers you can typically find online. Very straightforward multiple choice tests. No curve because most people usually do fairly well. Interesting material and knowledgeable professor!

Dr. Moore takes relatively simple concepts and makes them hard to understand. She also claims to care about her students and their well being when she realistically does not. Get as far away as you can from Dr. Moore and any of her classes.

Professor Moore is very excited and interested in her material, which makes her lectures a little more interesting. She does a pretty good job at explaining relatively difficult concepts. I will say her tests are very tricky and they require you to know sometimes random things out of the text book. She definitely makes you work for a good grade.
ratingTags_Rating: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY

comment_Rating: I took Dr. Moore's microeconomics class this past summer during Freshco. While the class was challenging, she makes it to where students who want to succeed can succeed. I recommend going to class because many of her examples and hints are helpful for the tests which make up the majority of your grade. Overall, be ready to learn and work hard.

This was a difficult class that required a lot of reading.  I read every sentence of required material, watched every powerpoint presentation and studied for each quiz and test.  The teacher was available by email every time I had a question.  She was very helpful explaining anything I was unclear on.

Test are extra long, and impossibly hard for no reason. Tries to trip you up every chance she gets. You need to know every single detail and that still might only get you a B-.. She is extremely kind and helpful though.

Do not take this teacher. This online class was the hardest class I've taken in all 4 years of college. You have to know this material forwards and backwards and that's still not enough sometimes! Just warning you this class is impossible!

By far the worst teacher I have ever had at UGA. Not only does she make the class redundantly hard, but she also expects you to devote an absurd amount of time to this pointless class. The tests are extremely hard! The class average is typically a C, so unless you want this class to drop your GPA for no reason, take another class!

Different type of class. She is sometimes rather conceded and expects you to know what she is talking about. As an Econ major the class was rather pointless to what an Econ major wants to study. Much more Micro driven then macro. Choose another elective upper level before this one. Health or Public Sector Econ

I found this class interesting. Dr. Moore practically spoon feeds you the material by giving you an outline and then writing the notes out on the outline in class.  Do the study guide for the tests and you should do really well. I liked her and the class.

so far my favorite class at UGA! if you want to learn how the U.S. became the #1 super power of the world take this class!!! myra is awesome, sometimes explains things too slowly, but is very thorough and passionate in her teaching. you don't use the book that much, just go to class and pay attention and write everything she says you'll be fine!

Don't do it! If it's not required for your major, I'd stay away from this course. Dr. Moore wasn't a terrible professor, but the class itself was boring, and the tests didn't seem to relate to the material at all. If you're not good at memorization, you will not do well in this class. Don't count on theory to carry you--this is a history course.

Probably one of the most interesting teachers at UGA. The material isn't exciting at all, but she makes you interested in what she is saying by the way she speaks. Tough cookie on the exams though. Take good notes (only way to pass). No extra credit. Quick homework once a week. I definetely recommend her, though!

Dr. Moore was an excellent professor.  It's the history of the economic development of the United States.  It isn't all that exciting.  Going to class, reading the book, and doing the study guides will get you a good grade.

Extremely boring. She tries to get you excited about it but for some reason just fails. You can learn the concepts of econ as well as you want, but the tests ask about minute details no one cares about. I usually find history really interesting, but this class was terrible.

Myra was the "Economics Fairy," as she is tiny and gets very excited about graphs and charts and starts dancing around the room every time she gets to show us a graph/chart. But she was a great, fair teacher who cared if her students did well and grasped the material.  Go to class and don't miss the Sunday assignments and you'll be fine!  Enjoy!

Horrendously boring class. Painful to sit through any way you spin it... So don't sit through it. Get old notes and do the study guide (which are VERY strong indicators of the test material) to prepare for tests. You'll be perfect. No incentive to come to class. She only does online quizzes outside of class.
Horrendously boring course. It's painful to sit through any way you spin it... So don't sit through it. Get old notes, study them and do the study guides. Tests are the study guides

Take the class for what it's worth.  It's the history of US econ, so it will be boring.  Don't go to class if you don't want.  Just get the student notes and old tests if you can.  Easy to get a B+ or A- with these.  She sounds like shes crying in class and gets excited for weird econ facts, but she means well.  Class kind of sucks, but not too har

This is an extremely easy classs if you have three things: old tests, student notes, and study guide answers. Old tests are 60% of the questions  and the other 40% are straight from the study guide. I went to class only on test days and i currently have an A. You can skip a test and the Final will count double but u cant drop a test. 10% from ELC

I made an 82 on every test.  No matter how hard I studied, each and every one was the same outcome.  Gives easy open note quizzes for EC but you have to be there everyday.  She does enjoy the subject though.

Pop quizzes can add 2 points to final grade. Very boring unless you like HISTORY. Basically the theme I learned: the farmers always get screwed. Tests are more difficult than expected. The final is comprehensive, so memorize all the previous tests. I fell asleep in class a couple of times.
Class is very boring. The test questions are worded weirdly and test really random facts. I felt like this class was pointless.
do NOT take this class, this lady sucks. the class is boring and the tests are really tricky, and she will definitely screw you over.

I hate this class. I don't understand why it is required to take as a business major unless Economics is your topic of study. I can understand material when in class but the tests and the way the questions are worded makes me think that I have learned nothing at all.

If you have an interest in History, you'll love this class! I've learned more in her class than all of my econ courses combined. She is nice and sometimes can go into TOO much detail. The material for each exam can be lengthy and you do have to memorize a lot. Tests are straightforward. If you show up and take notes, it's an easy B or A- course.
If you show up everyday and take notes you will get a B very easily, possibly a low A as well. It was interesting course that teaches you implementations of economic policy and their affects.

One of the worst professors I've had at UGA.  She is a good lecturer, and her tests do come straight from the study guide. But, there is entirely TOO much material on each study guide. By the time you complete it, you have basically retyped all of your notes. In order to do well, you have to memorize EVERYTHING.
She enjoys her field, and is a decent teacher. Some questions on the tests can be extremely picky and can hurt your test average pretty bad.
SHe knows her stuff. However, the book is completely useless. exams are straight out of the notes, but there are some tricky questions. She is a very nice person, but the class is horrible.

The chronology of the course was dreadful. We covered like 4 out of the 20 or so chapters in the book (can't remember how many chapters there were), and Dr. Moore can be a bit annoying when she repeats the same instructions for every quiz. Very sweet lady butlectures really were a bit boring and the tests were a pain at times
Headphones or earplugs are recommended

The most boring class I've ever taken for my major requirement. Not only was the material inane, but the professor was awful with grading times and chronology of the material. Though she made the material comprehensible, she was very flighty and nagging. Get notes from a friend; save your sanity by not attending this class if you must take it.

I had her for ECON 2200. She is a good teacher and explains things so they make since. The study guides she gives before a test requires a lot of time but if you do the study guide you should make a B or A on the test. Attendance is not required but she gives 8 random pop quizzes each worth an additional .25 pts on your final grade.

She's one of the best prof. I've ever had! I love this woman! She is amazing. The subject is amazing. Everything is amazing about it! She explains things very well and the tests are easy if you do the study guide. Helps us out by giving us 8 pop quizzes each .25 points added to your final grade. She's very dedicated and the subject is interesting.

Great teacher! Not a difficult class. You can tell she really likes what she does. Attendance isn't mandatory, but she does give 1 question (usually easy) pop quizzes that help your grade. If you can find old tests they help. The title of the class sounds super boring, but don't let that deter you. I actually enjoyed it, & I learned stuff.

I had her for ECON 2200 also, but 4000 is much more difficult. The tests cover a ton of material. There are open book pop quizzes so you have to be in class. She is picky about the project and it counts for a lot of your grade. She is really good at explaining concepts and giving real world examples.

Moore is a GREAT economics teacher. She did a good job of hashing out the complicated subject matter and not getting bogged down in the details, but exploring the general themes and trends.  The tests were straight-forward and I normally got a lot out of going to class. Finished with an A and am very happy. Definitely recommend.

Not too bad of a class.  Don't really have to go, unless you want to take attendance quizzes given every 1-2 weeks.  Tests are MC and T/F...cumulative final.  Make sure to go through the study guides thoroughly for each test.  Material is pretty interesting for the most part.  Overall, not too bad of a class...just alot of memorization.

DONT GO TO CLASS you are wasting your time.buy the student notes they are literally word for word what she writes on the overhead there is literally nothing to gain from attending class unless you want to hear her verbally say whats in the student notes. I made a B- and only showed up on test days.if u dont believe me buy the student notes and go.

She's very interested in what she teaches. The subject is also fairly interesting if you like learning about a little bit of history and economics. But her tests are tough. Make sure you do the study guides thoroughly and you should do fine.

This class is pretty easy if you go to class and do the study guide. I would buy the student notes as well even if they are the ones from last year. That is what I did and they were exactly the same as this years notes. she writes her tests buy looking at the study guide so the tests went hand in hand with them. She also loves to teach and is nice.
Great teacher, hot as heck.

The ONLY class I have ever failed, ever. Her tests were ridiculous! You can study for hours and still not pass (like me). Unfortunetly, I failed and have to take the class again....I'm hoping for a different professor.

I hated this class, I got a 79.59 and received a C+, no rounding at all.  She shoots for a C average on her tests and gets it.  The tests are hard and its hard to pay attention to her in class unless you LOVE AMERICAN ECON.

The class was interesting and I had some prior knowledge of some of the material. Nevertheless the tests were pretty difficult and it was tough to pin down what to focus on studying most, even with the study guide. Just try to be thorough with everything as much as possible. She gives great lectures. Read before going to office her office hrs!

She loves to teach this class. She gives open notes pop quizes basically once a week for extra credit. Tests are kinda difficult but mostly from her notes and from class. Buy the student notes and you will be fine. Take this class
She is really excited about this class. This class was not too difficult if you actually study. We did not use the book much, if you pay close attention in class, you won't need to buy it.
She is one of the best professors at UGA. Absolutely excellent at explaining the material. Second to none.

Great teacher! I thoroughly enjoyed her class and although I only got a "B" out of it it was my favorite class of the semester and one of my favorite here at the university. Do the study guides and you should do well on the tests. Extra credit is given as unannounced pop quizzes and if you get them all she adds 2 points to your final grade.

One of the best professors I've had. She really knows her stuff and knows how to convey it to her class. I really enjoyed everything about this class. The book isn't needed, but there are a few questions from the book on every test. As long as you go to class, take notes, and pay attention, you should do fine. But adequate studying is required.
She's a good teacher. Very clear with what will be on the test. My main advice: DO THE STUDY GUIDES! They are the test. Also, she gives random pop quizzes that add to your final grade which is nice.

Myra Moore is one of the best.  Very clear, and fair.  Not a hard class as long as you go and take good notes.  Book is not necessary, but helps. I think she's the only one for 2200, but if you get a chance to take her for something else, I recommend.
Pretty easy class if you put forth some effort and go to class.  Extra credit quizzes help a good bit for your final grade.

Pretty easy class if you take good notes (make sure you take notes even when she doesn't write something up on the board) and do a thorough job answering the study guide questions. The study guides take a long time but you're guaranteed an "A" if you do them. She really does get excited about what she teaches so that is pretty cool I guess.

I took the honors version. Class could be tedious at times, exciting at others. She really loves the material it seems, which made it interesting. Attendance not mandatory, but suggested to get the notes. Very helpful and tests were straightforward. I'm taking her again next semester.
great professor! very interesting and her tests come straight from the notes. and she also gives study guides. i def recommend her!
Easy class, if you go.  Attendance is not mandatory, but you'll learn everything from the notes in class.  I never looked at the textbook; you probably shouldn't waste your money.

I took the honors section of this class and it was a lot harder than the regular class most of my friends took.  Tests are short answer and essay format, and there is a huge research paper/debate that counts for 25% of your grade.  I thought this was going to be my easy class this semester and I definately put the most effort into it.
She's one of the best lecturers I've taken.  She really knows her stuff, and she can't help that it's a little boring.  Her tests are tough so be prepared to study hard.
lot of info but easy if you just study the notes...book is not needed...can be pretty boring class though

Great teacher! She really enjoys teaching this subject. The outlines on WebCT are extremely useful & helpful when taking notes in class. The study guides for the tests are great. They help you know what to expect on the tests. The quizzes are give extra points. But they are unannounced so you have to go to class if you want the extra credit.
A great lecturer.  Makes subject interesting. Tests do not always reflect material in class without trying to trick.  Some test questions focus on trifles.
Tests straight from the notes and study guides.  And two grade points extra credit if you get all the easy in-class 1 question quizzes correct.
i had no past economics education and came out well because she tests from the notes...pay attention and learn to graph.  She loves the subject so it is not too painful.

Good teacher. She really knows what she's talking about. I'm not very interested in the subject, but she made it a lot more interesting for me. Tests were pretty easy; just go over class notes and study guides. Show up for class and you should be fine.

Great teacher.  Knows her stuff.  On WebCT she has topic outlines for all her lectures- very useful when taking notes in class. She does do extra credit w/ giving 10 unannounced 1 ? quizzes worth .2 each.  If you got all 10 correct you have 2 pnts added to your final grade.  Tests, for me, were not hard.
Energetic, You have to pay attention and attend class.  She doesn't like slackers
bring some earplugs
needs improvement

Prof. Moore made the class very very easy.  If you go to class and print off the notes from WEBCT you will be fine.  Take really good notes on the notes from WEBCT in order to make an A.  Her tests come directly from those notes and your notes almost item for item.
No Comments
No Comments
As long as you study the material and take notes in class you will be fine. The study guide really helps prepare for the tests. You rarly have to use the book.

Unclear grading criteria and unfair with how she decides to weigh each assignment. Instructions for our writing assignments were vague; her notes made it seem like she expected us to read her mind. Completely unaccessible outside of class (she never answers emails). I dont know how you can make a FYOS challenging, but she managed to do it.

Worst women I have ever had the displeasure of meeting. She is rude, low-class, disrespectful, ignorant, extremely hostile, and an obvious and pathetic social climber. Stay away from this psychopath. No one in our class could stand her. She represents everything that is wrong with tenure. Do not take any class with her, you will regret it, I do.

I agree with the below comment. She should be avoided at all cost. She doesn't understand any of what she is teaching, and makes an already marginalized group feel more so. She is so caught up in her theory that she fails to see her own obvious shortcomings.

This was my least favorite teacher I have had in all of my days on the face of this earth.  The class was interesting due to student participation.  Her teaching leaves much to be desired. Her tests and assignments were fair, but she was very tangential in nature and would generally alienate an already marginalized group. If you can, avoid her.

Outstanding discussion of sensitive issues. The tests were taken directly from the book and lectures. One must simply pay attention and participate to get an A. Dr. Thomas presents a total and well rounded analysis of the issues around prejudice in this country; it has changed the way I look at life.
Great class and excellent teacher.  She does a really good job at covering racial and other prejudice-based topics that can be very sensistive.

Tests ask authors of specific theories and dates of article publications = very hard.  Most of the material on the tests are obscure facts and dates that no one cares about - take very detailed notes.

What a terrible professor!It was hard to get in touch with her if students had questions about the class.  Plus, she continues to talk about accolades and honors--very annoying.  She did not seem student-oriented.

Super easy class, there's online "readings" but you don't have to do anything outside of class because he says everything that you need to know in class. Your grade only comes from 4 mult choice tests and that's it. He's pretty funny and you can get away doing other work in his class too. Solid choice, especially if you're looking for an easy class

Easy to skip if you need to but I never wanted to! Lectures were really interesting on a topic I'd never even considered before. Dr. Martin cares more about the material than being a tough grader, and his scale reflects it by not assigning minuses (90+ is an A, 80-86ish is a B, 87-89 is still a B+, etc). No textbook. I'd definitely take him again.

Only 4 exams and no drop test, so each is 25% of your grade. It's an easy class and the material is easy to understand, but make sure you pay close attention to all the details in the material in lecture, your notes, and the test. A 90 is an A in his class, so its better than the usual 93. Make sure you are careful when taking his test though
ratingTags_Rating: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment_Rating: I enjoyed Prof. Martin's class a lot. I had never taken psych before and this class definitely helped me develop an interest. No homework, heavy on lectures, but he puts the powerpoints online if you miss class (but go to class because he tests on some things off of the powerpoint). He's friendly guy and I'd take another class of his.

Dr. Martin's class is extremely interesting! Existentialism is kind of out there, so don't expect this to like any of your other courses. There is no textbook required, and Dr. Martin just posts articles for you to read instead. Show up to class and listen, and you'll definitely get an A!

Existential Psychology Dr. Martin is the best. He's super chill and makes the class pretty easy even if it's not your thing. However, the course material is so fascinating you'll probably find yourself reading the assigned articles anyways. I've met several former students who took this class and now study ExPsyc as a career. Highly recommend.

One of the best professors I've had at UGA. His lectures are interesting and easy to follow  along with. There is no required textbook, just articles that he posts on eLC. Sometimes the readings can get long but he tries to keep them short and tells you when you can just skim or read certain sections. Definitely take this class!

Dr. Martin is a wonderful person.  I'd definitely take his classes again. Basically, he gave us four tests, no final, and they're multiple choice. He was really nice and always willing to help us if we had questions. It also helps that the information was interesting and engaging.
Just the best. Passionate and easy going.

TAKE HIM! Article readings, so no textbook. Readings get confusing but pay attention in class & you'll figure them out. Reviews from test so you know what to epect. Make a study group. Discussion helps since you don't discuss in class. Ended our class a month early b/c he doesn't want to to waste time with something you don't like. Curves grades!

Dr. Martin is one of the few professors who is truly more interested in learning than making a grade. Class consists of reading scholarly journals about social issues, and discussing them in class. The class sometimes gets a little dull, but for the most part is very interesting perspectives on real issues. Tests can be difficult but are curved

He assigns a lot of readings but he goes over them extensively in class. If you miss a class (he didn't take attendance) you can always just do the readings to catch up, and you don't need to read if you're in class. He curved our tests a bit too. Dr. Martin is nice but he rambles a lot when he lectures. He can get boring, but it's not too bad.

LOVE LOVE LOVE HIM. this class was like a blessing.  It was extremely interesting and he doesn't really care if you come to class or not. You dont have to do the readings just listen to what he says, he repeats what he wants you to know over and over so it's not difficult. i studied for his tests about 20 min beforehand and made As on all of them.

Good professor, good guy.  He cares about his students and wants us to learn, not just get a good grade.  He brings stuff to class because its interesting and maybe even useful.  You do have to work for your grade, but I think that makes it more meaningful and rewarding.  Recommend.

Great professor. His existential psychology course is extremely interesting. He teaches based on what the research suggests rather than what is comfortable.Definitely recommend that anyone who has a chance should take his course.
Great professor. Always willing to meet with students who wish to discuss psychology both when it relates to the course and when it involves general or off topic questions. Definitely recommend.

He's really weird... not gonna lie. Make sure you pay attention to what he says, not what the reading says. The tests aren't hard if you look over your notes beforehand. He's a nice guy, but the class gets a little boring because it's mostly just him rambling.

I took his existential psyc class, which was weird, and consisted of him alternately telling us (in his odd style) what was basically his view of the world and making us read psych studies. It was interesting material, but very vague and subjective. The tests were kind of random, but not too hard.

No tests only papers, must go to class to know what is going on! Willing to help and practically answers the papers beforehand if you ask. Format can be kind of dull though, he just talks a lot. You definitely do not need to do the readings, I wasted a lot of time at the beginning doing that.

I took his intro class a few semesters ago in an auditorium (300 students).  Although the class size was distracting, he was clear and informative.  He responded well to student questions and got many college kids interested in psychology.

What an odd class.  While he seems passionate about his work, he lacks delivery skills and doesn't know how to present the material properly.  I found it as an unstructured class and he seemed to also go off on tangents.  The class was a waste of time and he's odd.

Best professor I have ever had!  Lectures are hilarious and interesting.  Great teacher and really care about you and your learning.  Always there for help.  Harder class but pretty manageable.  Recommend this class for anyone who is interested!  No need for textbook, he is the textbook!

Dr. Kuhnert may be the most talented professor in the Psychology department. He is funny, brilliant, kind, and truly cares more about what his students take from the class that they can use in the real world than grades. Exams can be difficult, but he is more interested in your learning.
Dr. Kuhnert is the I/O Program Chair for UGA.  His classes are entertaining, challenging, and highly informative.  If psychology of the workplace intrests you, this is who you need to have!!!

WONDERFUL! Took his freshman seminar and will definately be taking his class later. Always willing to help and is not concerned about grades, just helping you understand material. SO nice and smart! TAKE HIM!
Only had him for a Maymester, but one of the best professors I ever had in undergrad. He is the textbook.

Karl was one of the nicest, most knowledgable teachers I've ever had.  He tends to go off on tangents, but his lectures are interesting and funny.  Even at 8am, I enjoyed his class.  Truly a nice guy who cares about his students and has a lot to teach them!
Wonderful Professor! Engaging and motivating, after graduating I realize just how much I owe to his teaching style and content to make issues revelent in "the real world".
Good teacher.  Recommended.
Great professor! Personable to students and hilarious as hell!  Made subject matter interesting.

I took the honors section of this class and there we're only 6 of us. We had one open response midterm and one multiple choice final I should have been failed both but got an A. He is very charismatic and knowledgeable and knows that for classes like this, most of us are just there for credit. Participate and ask questions for the A!

He is a good person with a kind personality, but there was no structure to the course. That made it very difficult to learn anything or retain any information. He is clearly knowledgeable, but I would not recommend him as a teacher. You will not learn anything unfortunately.
ratingTags_Rating: Participation matters--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment_Rating: Dr. Schroeder is a really great teacher. His tests are a little confusing but if you work hard they are not impossible. It's important to get the book and keep up with readings because a lot of the test info is covered in the book not in lecture. However, there is a massive curve. Huge. He's very understanding and wants you to do well!

I had to take his class to get a 'physical science' credit. If you can somehow get out of it, I wouldn't take his class. It's insanely stressful and I literally cried because his test are so hard. The curve will help you get a decent grade but it takes a ton of work. He's very nice and likeable but this course is extremely hard. Avoid if possible.
ratingTags_Rating: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment_Rating: Dr. Schroeder is an awesome professor. Although the content of the class isn't exactly easy, he does provide a lot of help and clarity if needed. There are pop quizzes, but we literally discussed word for word the answers before we took the quiz. Tests are tough, but if you read your book and study about a week in advance, you'll do fine.

Schroeder's tests are pretty difficult, but he curves all them. We had a few quizzes but he would generally go over the material for the quiz at the beginning of class. Only downside, he doesn't use ELC so you won't find out your average, or how much he curved the exams, until closer to the end of the semester.

You'll love this guy as a teacher. He has a sense of humor and tries not to make his lectures boring. There are no mandatory homework assignments. His test are hard because the material is hard but he gives a huge curve at the end of the year.

Before this class, I thought the very idea of geology was dull and esoteric as anything could be. It's studying rocks! But, after taking this class, I've learned to find the field really interesting. Dr. Schroeder connects the concepts to very practical applications and to places around campus. It's not the easiest class, but you'll learn so much!

Dr. Schroeder was an absolutely awesome teacher.  He is so passionate about what he does.  The class is tough, but he gives huge curves and allows you to drop a test.  I had no interest in the material but learned a lot.  If you have to take a geology class, take Paul Schroeder.
He's a pretty cool guy. He loves what he is talking about. He's passionate about geology but the stuff is probably not the most interesting stuff in the world. If you have to, take it with him!

I took a Kaolin seminar with Schroeder. He is very passionate and nice, but the class itself is pretty boring. However, there was minimal work: read a book (which you only had to skim or read part of), ask a few questions, and go on a field trip. If you needed to miss class you can e-mail him beforehand. Just show a little interest and you'll pass.

Soooo nice but incredibly boring. I could tell he really loves teaching and enjoys the subject but science just isn't my thing. He's definitely willing to help you as much as possible but tests are really hard!

I would highly recommend taking Schroeder. The tests are difficult but he curves them. Most of the questions come from the book so you have to read the chapters. The class is boring but you do have pop quizzes every once in a while so attendance is necessary. Make sure to do the extra credit. He helps out your grade a lot and is helpful overall.

Dr. Schroeder's seminar on the Georgia Kaolin industry is excellent.  I had no interest in the subject, and I didn't really even know what it was, when I began the course.  Now, after many entertaining lectures and one incredible day trip to the Kaolin district of Georgia, I've come to really appreciate the subject matter. Excellent teacher!

This class is hard. I am generally really good at science but ended up with a C in the class. Quizzes are easy and the field trip will help you if you study. I would suggest taking a Physical Science class if possible.

Do the extra credit field trip! I did not; ended up with an A-, which would have turned into an A if I had gone. Tests can be tricky. He loves his diagrams and geography based questions. He does curve, but don't rely solely on it because you don't find out your curved class average until finals. Quizzes are ridiculously easy. Take Schroeder!

Great teacher. Geology is boring in general but Schroeder made it interesting.  Lectures are slides and he puts them up so class isnt mandatory.  Quizzes are insanely easy and the tests are all 50 MC.  They can be hard but he curves them a lot so in the end you do fine. Made an A with medium effort. I would recommend taking him.

I love this class. Dr. Schroeder is a good teacher, and I really like his way of explaining things because he uses examples that we understand. The test was not very hard if you paid attention in class and read the book. The study sessions are very helpful.

The tests are multiple choice and very hard- but he gives a huge curve since everyone bombs it.  I'm definitely not a science person, so I didn't find the class super interesting.  If you need a lab science this is definitely a good pick though and I'd recommend going on the extra credit field trips for easy points.

He is a very likable guy- how his lectures are soo all over the place without any hint of a flow. I ended up reading the chapters as he assigned them just to get an overall picture. Tests are impossible but the curve will get you an A if you reasonably try to keep up.

This class seemed hard throughout the semester as the tests were hard but at the end of the semester, when we received our grades, they were all higher. He gives 5 tests, including the final, and you can drop one. He also  curves so my test average of 80 and my quiz average of like 75 ended in an A at the end of the semester.

Thought it wouldn't be bad after reading ratings on here but I failed every test. I still came out with a B- but it was very stressful and I did the extra credit field trip. I came to class everyday and still failed most of the in-class "attendance" quizzes.

your first test grade may scare you a lil bit...but trust me the curve pushes you up a WHOLE lot so don't worry! he's really nice, funny and cares about his students. most everybody gets an A or B from this class! his lectures are very scattered, but read the book and take the online quizzes and you'll be fine

okay..so, although he is INCREDIBLY boring and tests are absolutely impossible no matter how much you study..he curves EVERY test like crazy (EX: I made a 64 on one test and ended up with an A on it). DONT buy book: there's an online book with WAY better resources! random quizzes in  class, but NOT hard. i have an A for really no effort!

Boring class, quizzes on some days, tests are ridiculously hard on things that you will easily read over in the book or miss if you tune out in class for a second.  Curve makes everyone feel a little bit better, but I don't really think it's worth the stress of seeing that you completely bombed a test and having 10-15 pts added.
He's Hot
He is very knowledgeable, always willing to assist and make sure students understand what he's talking about.  Great teacher.

This class was extremely boring, but Schroeder is really nice and tries to be interesting sometimes. The book doesn't really help.  You have to write down everything he says because he will test you on some random example he might've said in lecture.

Schroeder is a good guy. He will make the class seem hard but if you show up and take notes you will be fine. The class requires little effort. Nohomework, easy quizes, and tests that he curves alot. Study the notes and read the book before a test got me an A

He is a very nice guy who obviously loves his profession. However, he forgets that most students aren't majoring in geology and tries to teach every little detail about every little thing. And the chapters about rock types will make you want to swan dive out the window. Still, he curves tests, and his final is from previous test questions!!!
Very nice professor who really goes out of his way to make sure his students understand difficult concepts.  Not an easy course, but an overall enjoyable one.
UM....um...Um.... In this class he explained way too deep. So, it got really confusing. Nice guy BORING CLASS but an easy science. Not just "rocks for jocks" like everyone says
Really enjoyed the class. He's a very nice guy. Be sure to go to his office after every test and get the answers from the questions you got wrong (that's how he makes up the final).

He's a really nice guy and makes time out of class to help his students. His lectures, however, do not have any form of organization. Understanding the material that he attempts to present makes a (typically) easy class very challenging and very confusing.

He is a genius. He is so kind and understanding and passionate about education. The class is easy and requires outside service hours at a high school. He emails you about 8 times a day with all sorts of articles (not mandatory to read at all).
The best professor I have ever had. Let's you find your own way--doesn't dictate knowledge. You'll be lucky to take a classs from him!

Peter Smagorinsky is the teacher's teacher.  If you are in the profession and would like a style to emulate, then this man has the knowledge and skills you are looking for.  For fun, kicks and giggles (and hopefully a lot of success)I decided to alter my own teaching to be more like his this year, and it's worked wonders!!  Thanks, Peter

Dr. Smagorinsky is one of the best professors I have ever had. He is so helpful and thoughtful. I love how even though he has a very high status, he is still so down to earth and caring. He knows his information and presents it well. If you love English Education, he's TOP TIER!!
Dr. Shaw loves astronomy.

If you are not extremely interested in astronomy, do not take the FYOS "How to talk about the Universe". Unlike most seminar classes, we were required to give a twenty-minute group presentation, a ten-minute individual presentation, and write a six page paper. I learned a lot from this course and loved it, but, for a FYO, the workload was immense.
He was a super super nice guy, but he couldn't teach. Astronomy is a very very hard class to teach to yourself. Be careful

He didn't do much in class and expects you to learn the material on your own. He did not teach he only answered questions students had on the material. If you don't like to learn on your own then don't take this class. He gives you all of the test questions in advance but they are very specific and he wants a lot of detail in the answers.

Class is kind of vague. You basically learn through doing questions the day before and he talks about them the next day. At the end of every class, he asks you one of the questions for your "quiz". You turn it in at the end of class. Can make or break your grade. Tests are decent. He gives optional review days the day before the test.

This is not an easy A. Do not take this professor or this class! I had Magnani for my lab and he was great, but Dr. Shaw is not a great teacher. I learned from the book and you have to go to class to take the quizzes and take notes in order to get an A. Ultimately I wish I hadn't taken it, especially with Shaw!

Since I was here looking at my old school I had to put in my 2c. I majored in and graduated from UGA's Ast program.  Dr. Shaw is a very good professor, even at the first year level. You wont appreciate this until you've gone though a few more years of school, and suffered through many more professors.

Shaw is a very smart man. The class is set up in a very strange way: you learn by doing the homework the night before then you go to class and talk about it--no lectures. However, he liberally gives out extra credit and his tests are easy if you did the homework and have a basic grasp of astronomy. I recommend this class to anyone.
He's a pretty bad teacher. He doesn't do much except ask questions from the back of the chapter, and there's no variety whatsoever. That said, he's nice ,but not someone I would recommend.

] Dr. Shaw is an awful professor. He doens't teach in class; he simply asks the questions from the back of each chapter, which we were expected type out responses to each week anyways. The amount of work outside of class is ridiculous, I typed up at least 7 pages of single spaced text weekly. His tests are extremely difficult as well. Terrible.

The class is easy as long as you do the questions and read the text. The test questions were literally random questions he pulled from the homework questions. He doesn't take attendance, but part of your class grade is dependant on answering in class.

It's true that Dr. Shaw wears the same clothes everyday and just gets questions from the back of the chapters. In the 2011-2012 year attendance was mandatory for a participation grade and tests were not able to be exempted spring semester. Overall the class is easy,and I would advise taking  this class if you have any interest in astronomy.

Nice guy but a HORRIBLE professor.Going to class is a waste of time.He doesn't teach at all!Read and do daily questions on your own.I never went to lecture except on review day.The tests are pretty hard.I read all the chapters and made note cards of bolded terms.I got Cs after the curve because the multiple choice is VERY TRICKY. not an easy class

Read the chapters, answer the text & daily questions. Lectures are useless. You can make an A by studying the material outside of class. You will either love or hate this professor. If this class is your major he will either reinforce your love of the subject, or he will make you want to change your major. It's true: he doesn't change his clothes.

Entertaining professor to listen to. You will use the textbook ALL the time, so read the chapters throughly and learn the content. Easy class if you study right. Watch what you say; he is not afraid to go on a tangent about how stupid whatever you said was in front of the class. Good class but I didn't really connect to this professor.

This class requires a lot of studying. Do the questions he assigns and ask questions during class if you can't find the answers. The only grades in the class are the tests themselves. You get to drop your worst test grade. You have to be very specific on the tests. He grades like you're a physics major(I'm not) and wants that level of detail.
You need to keep up with the readings and put in the time to get good grades.  I struggled to get a B+

This class is not for the mild hearted.  It is very difficult, if you don't study, you will not do well.  Here were my test grades in order from first to last: 64, 69, 98, 92.  That is with the tests curved sometimes as much as 10 points or more.  Point being, if you study, you will do well.

The subject of Astronomy is my passion. I love it, but this professor almost made me consider switching my major. Avoid the class if you can, but if you do take the class, reading the book will do you much more good than listening to his lectures.
Nice guy, somewhat hard class. Just read the book and go to class. And definatly take advantage of the clicker points.

Excellent class, was sort of interested in Astronomy beforehand, but now in love with it. Go to class, use the clickers (extra cred) and read the chapters. There is no homework ever, and the tests are a breeze if you do all above. I didn't study at all apart from reading the chapters and made an easy A, and exempted the final.
Only C I've ever received.   Good Luck, I hated it... with a passion.
He WILL ruin your GPA. He should be fired. He is the worst teacher I've ever had in my life. The subject content is pretty interesting but he has NO teaching OR personal skills.
interesting class, very hard tests, but an easy final. can fail all the tests and pass the class if you do well enough on the final

This professor is very intelligent and passionate about astronomy, especially the moons of Saturn, which had little or nothing to do with the rest of the course.  I didn't enjoy getting up in the morning to watch slide shows of moons (which I could have done at home). I hardly ever attended class, memorized the book, and made As on all assignments.

The clicker questions really dont help you out grade wise if you actually look at how he grades. Do the homework because it adds to your final grade and its helpful in learning. READ THE BOOK if you want to do well. Tests are based on the book, lectures are almost pointless. I can say he does have a really funny dry sense of humor.

I love Dr.Shaw! Really interesting&loves astronomy. Tests are essay, but it is actually better b/c if multiple choose=have more specific answers instead of just putting down what you know. Go to class. Is stuff on the test that isn't in the book(not to much though). Tests are really hard, but the each hw is +1/4 pt to your final grade so do the hw!

The tests were tougher than I expected.  The extra points from  clicker questions are nice.  Read the book, he doesn't go over everything in class. You have to really understand the material to do well on the tests.

Decent guy, big class. You use "clickers" in the class to answer various questions, and if you score above average you get extra points on your grade. The key to this guy is showing up to class and paying attention, then reviewing the questions online before his tests. It's relatively easy, but you can't just wing it.

This class was a lot harder than I expected. The biggest problem was that he pulls test questions completely out of left field. You really have to study a lot. There's another astronomy teacher who I hear is much easier; take that one.
Do not take this class.  Yes, astronomy may seem interesting, but this class WILL ruin your GPA.  Shaw is a nice guy, but horrible at teaching.

very easy subject matter. fairly interesting. he puts all the notes online so no need to go to class except for tests. he also drops the lowest test grade. i made a 102 and 95 on the first two. dont need to take the final if you have taken all the other tests and done well. helpful too. has study sessions whenever he can.

I had Shaw for 1010 AND 1020 & unless you are capable of having a really good attitude, studying a LOT, & absolutely LOVE astronomy, you shouldn't take either course with him. He's a pretty quirky guy & is really intelligent but its easy to get impatient with his vagueness and impossible tests. and WATCH OUT, i had an 89.7 & he didn't give me an A.
Class is pretty interesting but he grades very precisley and wants to know things that you've never even seen in class or texts.  If you need the books I still have them, my email is espett@uga.edu

Agreed with the below, that you should NOT take his class unless you know your way around astronomy already.  Readings are sometimes impossible to understand.  If you're in one of his classes where he gives essay tests, expect extremely fickle grading.

This class is very difficult if you are not into Astronomy. Review his online notes. Only study parts of the book that are in the notes. You still might want to read the chapter but don't try to memorize it. Each test has about seven chapters on it and you will never remember it all if you don't study the parts of the book that are in the notes.

Do not take this class unless you are absolutely ENAMORED with Astronomy. It's mostly physics, not the easy My Very Eager Mother Just Served Us Nine Pies. It's extremely difficult to study for, and his lectures are boring. He's an okay guy, but his class is a definite NO.

Mr. Shaw is a horrible teacher.  His lectures are worthless and he is extremely boring.  Tests are very hard and take a LOT of studying to do well on.   I ended up with an A but it was only after lots, and lots of studying.

HARD tests. You can study for hours and still not know the answers when it comes down to it. He's pretty interesting if you're interested, but if not, very hard to pay attention. You HAVE to read all the material to even have a chance.

If you like astronomy, then you will like this prof. He knows his stuff and is extremely nice. It won't be exciting for you unless you actually enjoy astronomy and aren't simply looking for an easy lecture course. He also is extremely helpful with his notes as he has them all posted online... simple class, only 4 tests and 3 count.

Wow, this class was horrible. You will have a horrible time taking notes from his lectures, but even worse, his voice is monotoned, and hard to pay attention to. Tests are generally difficult, but I suppose paying attention in class and reading the book would be sufficient. I don't recommend this class.

He is the weirdest, worst teacher ever.NEVER TAKE THIS CLASS.No matter how hard you study, it never works.Going to class is pointless-made the same grade on my second test wenI didn't go to class as i did on the first one when i didYou fall asleep anyways bc he is awfully boringHe never talks about important stuff.Nothing in his notes is on the tes

This class is horrible.  It has been the worst experience ever.  He is picky and rude.  He does not explain material well.  The homework does help the grade but it is such an ordeal with him.  You either get the answer completley correct or no credit.  He does not give very much partial credit.  His tests are too long.  He never changes his clothes

if you read the chapters, the tests are not hard at all, but going to class is really important. if you are looking for an easy lower division elective, dont take it... you have to like the material to be able to pay attention during lecture. drops lowest of 4 test grades, including final. easy A if you put some effort into the class.

This class makes you think - a lot.  I took Dr. Shaw last summer 2nd-session.  The tests were all essay and required a bit of studying.  You could drop 1 of 4 grades or not take the final.  Could add many points to your final grade by doing the nightly homework.  Funny guy.  Very knowledgeable.  I definitely recommend his class.

oh my god! the worst experience of my life! they guy is obviously intelligent, but soooo boring. tests are absolutely impossible. i think he tried his hardest to make questions that only his fellow profs could answer. a lot of the answers were obviously wrong, so that narrowed it down to three similar choices most of the time.NEVER TAKE THIS CLASS!

Professor Shaw is extremely intelligent, but he assumes everyone else already has the knowledge he has. He doesn't explain things well, and I came very close to failing his class because I could not remember tiny details about things that didn't seem to matter in the book or his lecture. I wouldn't recommend the class at all.

This class is extremely difficult only because the professor fails to explain things clearly. We'll spend most of the lecture time discussing irrelevant topics. My advice would be to skip the lectures and study the book by yourself. The tests are also very specific and hard, but he does sometimes give curves, especially on the final.
A great teacher

Shaw is difficult. During summer session all exams are essay. Beware multiple choice tests during Fall & Spring are much harder. Following his lectures can be a chore & what he wants you to know for the test is unclear. Even with his bonus points, you must read the entire assignment. Be prepared to wish upon a star for a good grade in this class.
Very hard class. Shaw gives ridiculously hard tests.

This teacher is very boring. You study about 5 chapters per test only to have 25 tricky multiple choice questions that deal with details not concepts. Shaw doesn't care if you know everything about a comet and how its formed. he wants to know what was Haley's Comets exact temperature when it struck
This was just about the hardest class I have ever taken. The tests are extremely hard, classes are boring, and help sessions, not helpful! There are many formulas and minute details to memorize.

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS!! The lectures are boring. Going to class is pointless. All the notes are online and in the book. I studied for COUNTLESS hours and STILL did bad on the tests. The question are over minute details and are ridiculas! His help session are awful too! I do NOT recommend this class
take 1020
I wouldn't take his class again if you paid me.

I thought this class would be interesting but the boring lectures taught me nothing because of his reliance on the internet and the way he glossed over all the important details.  Plus the tests were way too difficult and often confusing.

Shaw seemed like he would be a nice guy outside of class but in class was a little boring and quite vague. My biggest complaint is that his "help" sessions suck and his test are tricky. He DOES curve grades sometimes and you can drop a test. overall this class was challenging but doable.
dont take this class, it is impossible and he doesnt curve or anything.
The class is pretty easy if you pay attention and study.  He will help you if you ask.  The tests are easy if you study.  You also have to read the book.
No Comments

It was a bad mistake to take this class.  Do not take it.  Maybe if enough people complain he will make his class better or get fired. His tests are really hard.  BTW, DO NOT look at the key if you are deciding on whether or not to take his class, the percentages are not right.
His tests are too difficult and off topic. Dont take this class
DO NOT take this class.  The tests are unbearably hard and it will ruin your GPA.  Again, DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS.

Boring, he lectures most of the time. very hard to get As on papers unless you put a lot of effort into them. I didnt really learn much from that class. If you participate and work hard on your papers,there is a possibility you might get an A.

Mr. Jameson did not teach me anything about writing. He explained nothing and yet expected us to write brilliant papers. His grading system seems unfair since he has little criticism for many papers, yet none of them make over a 90.

Everyone in my class seemed to hate Mr. Jameson just as much as these other students do, but I thought he was a nice guy who knew how to recognize a good paper even though he did not give much advice. I read some of the other papers and I see why they got the grade they did. Write a good thesis, integrate quotes and cite many examples to do well.

One of the most boring classes I have ever had.  He also was a very unfair grader and would take off points for no apparent reason.  It was impossible to know exactly what he was asking for in papers and he did not help when I visited him during office hours.  I would avoid this class, he made me hate english classes.

I would avoid Jameson at all cost. His grading system is nonexistant. He grades inconsistently and unfairly. The class is mostly discussion and will bore you to tears... He "tries" to help you on your papers, but it's useless, even if you do what he says. DO NOT: buy Making Literature Matter, read Huck Finn, or take this class from him!!!

The class is extremely boring. He does try to get conversations going but it's rather hopeless. He does not follow the grading rubric and is not helpful when it comes to figuring out what you did wrong.
I don't see what everyone else thinks is so bad about him, I liked Andy just fine. I found it hard to pay attention in class sometimes but he's very easy-going and an easy B.

4 papers. one in class. all 4-7 pgs. he grades stringently and doesnt explain why he took off. fun to be in class with. very broad prompts make it hard to know what he wants you to write. although attendence is 'mandatory' he rarely checked ours. allows for one paper to be one class late without penalty. not too bad.

Jameson's classes can get boring sometimes; but if you sit through most of them and gather some information for the 3 or 4 papers that you have to write, you'll do fine. It helps if you are already a good/great English student, then you will do great in the class. He's a helpful, easy-going guy, just try not to get him early in the morning.
Nightmare.  Nice nap time though. EXTREMELY boring class meetings.  Grading system is whack (does not use the department rubric).  Pretty vague too. Avoid if you can.

The class is fine with only a little bit of reading and required comments on online class forums... My main problem was his paper grading system. He grades fairly harshly and rarely gives you extensive reasons for doing so... I sent one of my B papers around to my past english teachers and they agreed that he is too hars...mayb im just complaining

The class was not that hard...in class, all we ever did for the most part was have discussions...they weren't usually as boring as everyone thinks...he grades fairly harshly, but I made a B without any effort (and I'm not a good writer..at all!)...If you have him, there is no reason to stress or drop the class.

His class is not that interesting. He stands there at the front of the class with his legs on top of each other and is like "soo..anything you want to talk about from the reading last night?" and he is an arbitrary grader and lacks in the constructive criticism department= how are we supposed to read his mind as to what he wants?

he's a really nice guy, the class can be boring sometimes but everything is pretty straightforward and he really encourages discussion and lets you pick a lot of your paper topics if you don't like his suggestions. i think he graded the papers pretty leniently, though his comments are a little lacking so its tough to guess what he wants.

Im not going to say that Andy's class was easy, but he was always willing to help you out if you had a question or problem. he even gave you one "free late paper." i dont know why every one else seems to be complaining so much, they must not have been in class.
Andy seems like a nice guy and makes you think that you will make a good grade... then you go down with a bad one...
Andy doesnt grade anthing fairly---get ready to fail
