I agree with the other statement. He doesn't grade fairly at all. If he likes you 'A', if he doesn't 'C' or 'D'. He doesn't ever explain what he wants and expects you to read his mind.

Andy grades his papers based on whether he likes you as a student or not.  You could have an incredible paper and receive a poor grade just because he doesn't like you or the topic.  So if you suck up you will be fine.  But if you don't get ready to settle for a C or D.

Andy is very nice, laid back, and relates well to his students.  He offers a lot of help and will even read and correct your papers before you turn them in!  He doesn't assign a lot of work and is flexible with assignments. Just stay awake and participate in class and you should get at least a B.

The class as a whole is very interesting. Lots and lots of reading outside of class, but it's worth it for the discussions you have in class. If you don't like to participate in in-class discussion she is not the professor for you. She also offers a really cool extra credit trip. Be prepared to write a lot in class, too though.
If you want to learn to write effectively take her class! She is tough but fair. I am a much better writer after taking her class. She is happy to help outside of class.
She was by far the hardest teacher i have ever had. And her grading is intense. Don't take her class if you are not an English major!!!

Dr. Inglesby is the toughest teacher that I have ever taken. I am an English major and her classes made me question my career choice. In the end, I passed her class (barely, C+), but I came out a better writer. She is a tough grader and a stickler for attendance. I will more that likely take her again, but only because she is a genius in her feild.
She is very nice and willing to help you with your papers; however, she is a very tough grader. If you want to be an English major, then I would suggest her, but otherwise I would avoid her class.

She grades thoroughly but my AP English teacher in high school graded more strictly.  Don't expect to get an easy A, but as long as you put effort into the assignments, you should be perfectly okay. I liked the class, she has a dry sense of humor, which I really enjoyed.
Good/Ok teacher but hard. Has to many rules on how to type a paper, what words you're allowed to use, etc. Takes the fun out of writing.
Enthusiastic and funny. A little green, but not nearly as green as other instructors her age. Interesting and personable.

Don't take this class. Too hard, too strict on grading. She's out to change the world one grammar student at a time. Nice person, though. If you want a good butt-kicking, then you should sign up for her class.

Do not take her class.  She was condescending and rude.  She was not willing to help or assist with essays.  She even made the class write an in-class essay on a part from hamlet where we had to use quotes and we werent allowed to use our books!  Dont take this class!!!!!
strict grader of essays but class was interesting and keeps your attention.
Professor Inglesby clearly knows her stuff, and she is passionate about teaching it. She's a tough but fair grader on essays. Gives out few a's, but very easy to get a b. Enjoyable class.

Harrison Hartman is one of the worst teachers I have ever encountered. His teaching style is incredibly dry and he does nothing to make the class the least bit interesting. And it doesn't help that the subject that he teaches is already boring. DON"T TAKE A CLASS WITH HARRISON HARTMAN UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCES!

hands down, weirdest guy i have met, he is nice though and means well, just unique. class is boring, so i didnt go and went to tutoring zone and crammed and did ok, for a strong B, dont cram (more than normal) and go to tutoring zone

gives you the notes- you just have to fill in the blanks so it makes the class easy. don't by the textbook because all you need to know is the notes. tutoring zone gives really good extra credit problems. i'd recommend him because i loved hartman!

He wants students to do well.  Sends out study questions and posts note guides online.  The class was not terribly interesting but he keeps things lively.  He is good for a "comedic" outburst or bad joke at least once a class.  Makes fun of himself some too.  He also has review sessions and drops your lowest test grade.  I would recommend him.

Well, he's not returning next year.  However, he was one of my favorite professors during my freshman year.  Class was very easy if you just filled in the blanks and memorized them right before the test.  Cut off for an A was a 90.5.  Also, he had one or two jokes a class that were terrible but funny enough to make it worth going. We'll miss you HH

Took his class last year. I am still wondering why he is still teaching.The worst professor you can ever imagine. Not the hardest though. He does not care about you at all, he does not even look at students during lectures. You can make an A in class and basically dont learn a thing. Dont waste your time! If you need to take Econ class, take 2106!

His tests are not tricky if you know the material. Just make sure you read the notes thoroughly. DO NOT BUY THE BOOK. But, this is the most BORING class I have ever taken. I hated it. Honestly, I wouldn't suggest it to anyone who actually wants to learn.
i haven't had a test yet but he is adorable! nicest guy ever

It's possible to come out of class with an A. I got an A-, and I studied at least 6 hours the night before each exam. He drops your lowest one, which helps. Don't study for quizzes: they're open note and very easy. Attend lecture and go to his office for extra help if needed. The class can be boring, but don't let yourself drift off.

The class was ok. My mind always wandered during class but I still managed to fill in all the notes. You need to really memorize all the stuff on the notes and make sure u don't get tricked while taking the test. They're kinda tricky. But he is a nice guy, and he tried to make the class fun with random outbursts and jokes. I ended up with a B-.

Quite a boring class. He was confusing and made little effort in trying to explain concepts in a clear manner. It was as if he was talking to himself for 50 minutes every MWF. He would also rush and start talking a mile a minute when time was almost up for the day. Exams were difficult and very tricky. Only plus was fill in the blank note guides.
The most boring class I've ever taken. The notes are confusing and his tests are full of those I-IV questions with every combination of those options for answers.
quite boring. not very helpful. cool calf-work out shoes though.

The class was so boring I stopped going. I just studied the note guides for the test and I failed the first one which he dropped and got Bs on the next three. He seems like a nice person but he talks like a robot and the way he phrases things is sometimes confusing.

Dr. Hartman is a nice guy.  He tries very hard to keep his class fairly entertaining, but his class is boring.  Every now and then he has a corny joke, which is funny.  It is really easy to make an A in this class; just memorize the note guides the night before.

Not the best class UGA has to offer. HH tries to make his lectures entertaining w/ preplanned jokes, but ends up making it awkward & boring. Tests are tricky and difficult, but not impossible. Gives 3 tests, 3 quizzes & takes 2 best of each plus the final. Book is terrible, basically photocopied out of other books. Avoid Hartman's class if you can.

His class was really boring. He means well and knows his stuff but his words just fall awkwardly into a jumbled mess. Tricky tests. DON'T BUY THE BOOK!!! In fact, go with a different professor all together...

IF you go to class and memorize the note guides before the test you should be fine. This was a very easy class if you just know the material. The test aren't tricky at all.There are three test and he drops one.

He is boring and monotone, but his attempts at humor make him likable enough. Print out the note guides, and DO NOT let your mind wander. Pay attention and learn IN CLASS. I took notes but tried to learn the material later, and my grade was a letter grade lower than I hoped for. Huge class, so make a friend and help each other out when you miss.
Not as easy as people say. Not bad though. Studied pretty intense the night before and managed an A-. Don't buy book. Quirky for sure :)

Mr Hartman is strange, and you will laugh at what he says, but he means well. I am an average student and got and A. 3 tests, but takes best two. DONT USE BOOK, he takes tests and quizzes STRAIGHT from his notes. BUT DO GO TO CLASS so you can fill in the notes. Study notes and you'll do FINE.

Extemely monotone and boring.  I guess i never clicked with his teaching style so i only managed a B.  Tests are tricky even though they do come directly from the note guides.  Don't buy the book.  If i took it again i would go for another prof.  his jokes are corny and pre-planned. Very boring and hard to understand what he's trying to say.

this class was extremely boring. But also extremely easy. He gives out note guides that you fill out in class. Then the test come straight from the note guides. I would definitely recommend taking this class. Its an easy A.  Also Dont buy the book i never used it.

HH has an extremely monotone voice and repeats everything he says 3-4 times which makes for a boring lecture, though it's easy to follow.  I missed over 2 weeks straight, and when i showed up for the test with no preparation I still pulled an 86 with common sense alone.  Overall a great guy and makes some hilarious corny jokes. No need for the book

Hartman was actually pretty funny. Class was boring but he'd lighten it up occasionally. I'm not a business major of any kind and made a B+ in the class so if you are and you get that stuff you should do fine. Definitely do do the practice tests though and do go to class, because the notes are much clearer when he goes over them. Not a bad guy

This class is EXTREMELY boring! Easy A as long as you go to class and fill in the blanks to the noteguide. If you know the noteguide you wil do fine on the test. He is so boring though but overall a really nice guy.

H. Hartman physically looks like the PC guy from the Mac vs. PC commercials. HH is as much a nerd as PC as well. Buy the student notes and study them. Do his practice tests. Do the homework. You DO NOT need to go to class but should have a contact that regularly attends or find a group of friends that takes turns going to class. DO NOT buy the book
Great class. The tests are straight from the notes, but make sure you know everything on those notes. If you know them thoroughly you should get an A on the test. Don't read the book, just the notes.

I got all the notes, but didn't look over them, then bombed tests.  DON'T GO TO CLASS, YOU'LL GET NOTHING FROM IT. JUST BUY THE NOTES. He helped me out in the end, go to office hours, he's eager to help you.

I thought Hartmas was a great teacher.  He is very organized, old fashioned, and very helpful.  I could tell that he was always willing to help me with my questions in the course.  O yeh... he is corny, but i found him funny!

Ok he may be dorky but he IS a good teacher.  Anybody with a brain can go to his class, take the notes, and get atleast a B.  They best way to study for the tests are to do the practice tests on webct that he purpously gave us to "practice" and they work!  DONT buy the  book... I never looked at it once and made B's on all the tests.
I think Hartman is funny with all of his dumb jokes. His notes are basically fill in the blank, but the way he words his tests make it absolutely impossible to make an A...or a B
His voice is very monotone. He is very repetitive but his tests are tricky by the way the questions are worded.

Tests come straight out of his notes and lectures. Buy the notes packet at the bookstore and you're set. That being said, his lectures are incredibly boring to attend, and he is quite monotonous at times. Other than that, he is fairly helpful if you should contact him directly.
I got an A easily in his class.  The thing is, in the end, you could make a 45 in the class and still get a D-.  He completely curved grades!  The people who failed got below a 45.... come ON.

Do not take him. His class is boring and he is a horrible teacher. I got a tutor and still only came away with a C. His tests are hard and even after reading the text book and going to class I still failed two. He will not curve because he thinks dropping the lowest test grade is good enough. STAY AWAY!

Easiest possible class.  Make sure you attend class because tests are straight from the notes.  Take notes and study them and you'll pass all the tests with an A.  True, he tells horribly bad jokes, mostly due to his monotonous voice but class is extremely easy.

Laughably easy. Tests come straight from the notes. He's horrible to listen to, and he is not amicable in person. If you just need the class for a requirement, take him. Econ majors should avoid, as you won't actually learn anything!

The tests DID cover most of the information on the note guides that he hands out. You don't have to read the book much unless you need to. He's very clear, but VERY BORING. It's hard to get an A, but very possible to get a B since he drops the lowest test grade. You just have to study and go to class! You won't understand the material unless  u do.
This class would be easy if the tests actually had the material that was taught. Tests never had the material that was covered on note guides. Take another professor!

HORRIBLE!!! DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS WITH HARTMAN!!! He comes up with the most stupidest jokes that only 5 year olds would like! Tests were nearly impossible to pass. He told us a story when he tried to tell jokes everyday when he was younger and bascally he was a loser in school. A LOSER! End of story.

HORRIBLE!!! DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS! His jokes are retarded and very boring. On our third test, the class average was a 64 and he did NOTHING to bring it up! Thats right NO CURVES. I heard Mangle's test is WAY EASIER than Hartman's. DO NOT TAKE HARTMAN'S CLASS!!!

Although the material is really boring (and sometimes Hartman is too), he often makes these outrageously corny jokes. Those make the class bearable. He drops the lowest of 3 test grades (yay!) and the in-class assignments are ridiculously easy since you can use notes. I would definately take his class again. Just be prepared to be bored often.

His mission in life is to see people fail.  You can tell he has been bullied all his life.  He is extremely nerdy and out of touch with reality.  Gave me my first C ever and the final was the hardest thing I have ever taken.  Don't be deceieved with how laid back the class seems in the beginning.
Pretty easy. The tests and in-class assignments are straight from his notes. He is very helpful also.
Class is very boring and he repeats himself many times, but his tests are very straightfoward and from the notes. I think it was a pretty easy class, he drops your lowest test grade!
hes really borring and he types up the notes but puts fill in the blanks. the tests are alot harder
No Comments

He does his best to make the class interesting...sometimes it works, other times it doesn't. He tells corny jokes, which usually made me laugh. I didn't learn a whole lot during lecture, but once I looked over my notes, I began to understand. He gives you note guides, just fill in blank. Not bad, but you have to study.
Wording on tests were so ambiguous! He is the MOST BORING professor I have ever had! Get another professor

Do not take this teacher! It was horrible and boring...it did not matter whether i went to class or not because either way I would not understand the material...I made my first C in my entire life in this class!

He is a very good professor.  He gives you note guides to print and fill out and the tests come straight from those.  He usually spends half of class going over what was covered in the last class, which means you really only need to go to every other class.  Homeworks are easy and he only counts 2 out of the 4.  He drops the lowest test grade.

Lectures were painful but necessary to have notes to study for tests. He tried, with good intentions, but the class was pretty dull. I did very well on the first test but my grades progressively got lower. By the end of the semester his lectures were confusing and didn't follow the noteguides. I got a B but I would just say proceed with caution...

This guy is horrible.  He has the most monotone voice I have ever heard.  You pretty much have to go to class everyday because all of the tests are from the notes.  The book is terrible.  I went to class everyday and still ended up with a B.  He tells the worst jokes and you will probably want to kill yourself if you take this class, so please don'
gosh it was a painful time with him. zero personality, zero extra credit, zero help.  Find another professor- hard tests and boring class!!!

If you're looking for a nice fat D on your otherwise straight A report card, take this class. That's exactly what happened to me. Although the class was easy and laidback, the lectures in no way prepare you for the extremely difficult tests. No curve and no study guides. The test averages in our class around the 60s.

WIERDO. He is funny when he randomly sings in class. Otherwise VERY boring- just fill in the blanks off overheads over and over. test are okay and HW is easy and only 2 out of 4 graded. need to put in effort to get a good grade.

A lot of people don't like him, but I thought he did a good job of teaching. He's really nerdy with a corny sense of humor, but does a good job of explaining things in a very simple way. His tests can be trickier than expected, but study the notes and you'll be fine. He posts fill in the blank notes on WebCT, which make the class a lot easier.

Dork...that's all I can say about him. But ya gotta go to class, or at least rotate with others in going to class (cuz ya gotta fill in the blanks on the notes, which he'll give to ya). Stay on top of the notes, study for 3 or 4 hours a test, and you'll do fine. He drops 1 of 3 midterms and 2 of 4 Homeworks, so you can screw up some.

This guy left me wanting to pull out my hair and eat it. He used very ridiculous examples and made me actually question if I was actually in a college class. He most closely reminded me of Milton from Office Space and I seriously thought he had a little red stapler and if I could have found it I would have stolen it. He kept me laughing, at him.
A great expereience. He will keep you on your toes with his quirk/goofy personality. Test are easy. Take ECON with this professor

Conveys subject-matter well, but tests are not a good measure of understanding. Exams were far too difficult and required much more critical thinking than his lectures allowed for. Homework and class were easy, but tests were shockingly hard. Some class averages in the 60s. Don't let the first test (very easy) fool you.

*Unhelpful, bad tests* It would delight me to think of this teacher wearing concrete shoes and swimming with the fishies since that would mean that I never had to hear him speak again. He's very stupid, does retarted impressions, and I had to hop all the way up to the back of a classroom up lots of steps in order to not smack him with a crutch.

Dr. Hartman is one of the strangest teachers I've ever had because of his goofy sense of humor. This is helpful in staying awake in an economics class! He knew what he was talking about, he teaching style mades sense, he used a curve, and he really cared about the students. He's my favorite teacher at UGA so far, and one of the very best.
No Comments

Harrison Hartman might be the funniest instructor you ever have. I laughed so hard in class that I came close to passing out. You learn a lot in his lectures and his style of reviewing is helpful, especially if you miss the previous class. His tests may have the hardest multiple choice questions I have ever had which don't go too well with lectur

I might be the only person in the world that actually liked the class (maybe b/c I made an A)!? The tests were hard but they wern't impossible. The prof. provided good examples in lecture and his notes were clear (his tests come directly from the notes he provides).
VERY HARD AN UNHELPFUL!!! VERY BORING!

Yes he is very boring, but since he always reviews the previous days material the next day of class you can go every other class and still get all of the notes.  The tests come right off of these notes, and you don't need to buy the book.
HORRIBLE!!  He was so boring and unhelpful.

This class is extremely boring. The actual material is not that hard. However, the tests are ridiculous. The tests may be multiple choice, but they consist of a, b, c, d, a and b, none of the above, all of the above.... It is almost impossible to make an A in this class!!

By far, the worst professor I have ever had.  If you have any chance, DON'T TAKE A CLASS WITH HIM.  His tests are extremely hard and convoluted.  He doesn't cover the material he tests.  He drives the details in, but no one really gets the main idea.  This guy won't even help you if you ask for it.  Class average for one test was 66%.
Does a great popeye impression, but other than that he is pretty boring.

Extremely boring-speaks in a monotone!  He tries to make jokes but they usually bomb.  Tests are extremely hard!  He does curve but not enough.  The first 30 minutes, he recaps the notes from the previous day-helpful if you wwere absent but double bore if you were in class!
Very dull and boring. He tries hard, but doesn't convey the material well. His tests are far too difficult (the last test avg. was 61, which proves a problem on HIS part, not the students').

He reviews the previous notes the first 10 mins of every lecture which was very helpful when you have to miss a lecture or for person with a bad memory. His tests are hard but he curves it at times. His class can get boring at times but then he tried to tell jokes in between.

BORING!!!! If you want a nice long nap in the middle of the day, this is your man. The tests were insane, especially because all the notes were fill in the blank and he would say something off hand that was not on the sheet and then it was on the test.

The most boring professor I've ever had. The tests are waaaaayyyyyy to hard for the material.  Going to class just complicates things. I suggest dropping his class and taking it next semester w/another prof.  If you like questions with "All of the above" etc. then he's your guy!! :)

I really did not like the way this class was formatted and the way his tests were. As a premed student taking some upper level biology and chemistry classes, PHYS 1112 somehow was the hardest class I took and my lowest grade. I was frustrated/ confused, as his homework which was practical DID NOT align with the test which was theoretical.

Dr. Nakayama is nice as a person, but the tests are impossible. I studied the textbook, did extra questions, attended lectures, got outside tutoring resources, and still did not do well in the course. Good luck is all I have to say.

Dr. Nakayama means well but he does a very poor job at explaining upper-level physics to someone who has never learned the material. He gets mad if you ask simple questions. This was the hardest class I've ever taken. In his defense, physics is very hard but he did not make it easier. A nice man outside of teaching. His online notes are good.
ratingTags_Rating: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment_Rating: Dr. Nakayama is a pretty good professor. He did have some moments where it was just like... WHAAAT? but over all he was good. I went to office hours like 2 times a week and he was spend hours helping me master the material. People speak negative about him because he has an accent but that's not fair.
ratingTags_Rating: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Lecture heavy

comment_Rating: While Dr. Kanzo was quite knowledgeable about physics, he did a mediocre job at teaching it. I found myself relying on textbooks and youtube videos just to understand concepts. Problem sets were easy, but tests/final exam were rough. I do not recommend him at all unless you are already 100% knowledgable in physics.

One of the hardest teachers at UGA. Tests are INSANELY hard, even for the simplest of topics. Frequent homework assignments, 1-2 homework assignments due per week. If you can, avoid professor at all costs.
ratingTags_Rating: Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment_Rating: Dr. Nakayama really cares about making sure his students understand concepts in class. Tests have a bonus question, and the practice exams he posts are a good representation of the actual exams. If you read the textbook and do the extra homework book problems he posts, you'll be fine.

People are going to complain, but he is very caring. I hate physics-do not care about it. He tries really hard to make you like it and help you understand. He encourages class participation and frequently asks if you understand and will take the time to go over it if you do not. He gives practice tests that are useful to test. Fair if you work hard

Dr. Nakayama is a very nice guy that loves what he is teaching, but he just doesn't teach it well. He never worked out examples in class, but the two or three times that he did, he did them wrong. Other physics profs give students a drop grade and easier tests... Nakayama's tests were 3 questions. The final was curved though.

The lectures are super dry and if you can stay awake for them I commend you. You'll probably hear not to take this professor from others but a positive note is that his lower limits for grads are all lowered (a 65 was a C in this class...) By lowering the lower limit, you'll be surprised by what your final grade is ( a lot higher than you thought)

Dr. Nakayama is very passionate about physics and he shows through his lectures. However, I found his class difficult b/c almost all of his test questions are based on theory, analysis, & being able to rationalize. Not to mention you have to have a pretty good grasp of physics I too. So knowing the formulas & being able to plug in #s will not help.

I loved physics before this class. I also had a nice GPA and rarely complain about my professors. This class is RIDICULOUS! Maybe if you are higher level and enjoy teaching yourself and having no life, you'd be ok. This guy has 2 questions, and they are insanely difficult and not covered anywhere. I made a C+, but most people I know failed.

First day of class he will tell you he loves questions, but I went to his office twice and he just laughed at me and said "Must understand basic concepts" -thats real helpful Nakayama. If you learn by understanding theory and background then you will do fine(B-C not an A), but if you are like me and actually need to work problems you will fail.  He

This professor is ridiculously terrible. First of all, you can't understand a word he says because his English is horrible. Second of all, the tests consist of only TWO questions. And might I add, they are  absurd. Avoid at all costs! At leas Wiegert curves!!!

TERRIBLE!!!!!! AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!! He is impossible to understand. Tests are bull. He will pick the one thing you went over the least and was the hardest and thats the one question your test will consist of.  Makes sure that you know you are wasting his time if you do not understand and ask a question. HORRIBLE TEACHER! DIDN'T LEARN A THING!!!

One of the best instructors I've had.  Explains things clearly, and really wants the students to learn the material.  Not approachable?  Baloney!  He was very disappointed people didn't come to his office.  He WANTS to be approached and to be asked questions.  And he answers them clearly.  He's hard, but if you put effort into it, you will do good.

Difficult course and doesn't like to be bothered by trivial questions. If you are insightful and actually know what you're doing I would recommend him. Again, if you're just looking to get by or get an easy A, don't take his course. But if you're actually interested and competent you can learn a lot.
He's extremely un-approachable.

E&M is a hard subject.  Nakayama doesn't give you any breaks either.  His lectures are straight forward, as are his tests.  However, they are tough.  You *will* have to know your stuff.  Don't bother asking him any questions, though.  He doesn't want to be bothered.  Not very approachable at all.
She is a great professor that wants you to enjoy English class but the English department has a strict curriculum so many of the rules are not her fault.
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--SO MANY PAPERS--Caring

comment_Rating: I loved professor o'neal. I do not like English but very much enjoyed this class. She is a little scattered so it was never very clear what was going to happen in class but she's really funny, and kind. She is a fair grader, and knows that not everybody is going to be a stellar writer. Would love to take her again.

Best professor I've had since attending UGA. The readings are interesting, and she leads a funny and engaging discussion. She rewards those who work. I talked to her out of class a few times during the semester, and we still have good conversations whenever I see her. I think you'll like this class even if you don't like English because of her.
ratingTags_Rating: Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Caring

comment_Rating: Great teacher and she knows her stuff, however, she rambles. A lot. Be prepared to listen to her talk for the majority of class on anything from the topic to her childhood. She grades papers pretty fairly and gives you a few good guidelines to follow during your writing process.
ratingTags_Rating: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment_Rating: Prof O'Neal was one of my favorite professors last year. She's open to any interpretation of literature and wants to develop on your ideas. I had her for American literature since 1865 and got an A. Take her course!!

O'Neal is kind of a hard grader but she's wiling to help you if you go for help. Her class is super chill and there isn't a ton of homework. Make sure you do the forums and occasionally make comments in class and you should do fine.
ratingTags_Rating: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment_Rating: I loved this class! If you took AP Lang in high school you will be more than prepared. Basically you just read short stories and plays and write papers on them. I love to write so for me it was an easy A but if thats not your strong suit she gives amazing feedback and is always available to chat. Super nice and cool!

Midterm and final are heavy on quote identification but as long as you can identify the work and explain the context, it is doable. There was a large final project but this was also doable if you figure it out ahead of time and she is flexible. Fantastic lecturer that gives great perspective on the works. She is passionate and worth taking.
ratingTags_Rating: Gives good feedback--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Amazing lectures

comment_Rating: You read a couple of novels, but it's mostly short stories and poems. You have a big final project (25%) and a final with some short essay questions (25%) but other than that you have a midterm with a take-home essay and one other essay (7ish pages). If you participate the class can be really fun but sometimes she dominates the discussion. 8/10
ratingTags_Rating: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment_Rating: O'Neal's English 1101 class was not hard at all. I think to obtain an A, your writing skills have to be great. I think she likes students who participate in the discussions, but my class was a special topics class that focused on the election so I did not say much. Honestly, getting an A in English really depends on what professor you have.
ratingTags_Rating: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment_Rating: One of my all time favorite teachers. She really cares about her students and what she teaches. If there is a matter of concern whether its turning your essay in on time or making it to class, just talk to her and if it's legit she will understand. when meeting with her for essay reviews before they are due, she gives GREAT feedback.

Tough grader for intro level class. Class wasn't boring but a lot of time was wasted, kind of all over the place. Honestly don't know what I could have done better to make an A. She lets you choose the paper topics or gives you an interesting prompt. Encourages you to write about things you're interested in, which I appreciated.

Dr. O'neal definitely cares about her students. However, if you are not good with memorization DO NOT take this class. Half of your grade on the midterm &  final comes from quote identification and with 25-30 works to read, the quote ID is very challenging. She definitely is very unorganized. Pro: essays are bearable because of the broad topics

She is honestly just an all around great person. Essays are fun to write because you can pretty much choose your own topic. She is an easy grader and gives great feedback in order to make you a better writer. 10/10 would recommend

Ms. O'Neal is actually one of the best English teacher I have had at any level of education. She is so nice and really allows you to exercise creativity with your writing. Her paper assignments are broad and she will let you pick almost any topic within range of the theme to write on. She holds one-on-one conferences which are super helpful.

Dr. O'Neal is very nice and helpful.  She has a very relaxed personality unlike some lit professors. The short stories and poems we read were actually interesting and she gives you a lot of options for your essay topics. Take her if you can!

Dr. O'Neal is a fun teacher, and she is always very honest about what her opinions are. Sometimes she is a bit scattered, so the lectures aren't always easy to take notes on, but she likes to tie in modern-day parallels, which makes it worth it. Tests are usually quotation-based, and you have to know the works pretty well, but most people do okay.

I absolutely loved taking ENGL 1101 with Professor O'Neal! We had three papers and a portfolio overall! She is very helpful in reviewing essays and gives good feedback. Great class for first year students to help transition into college work!

Dr. O'Neal is a friendly woman and wants to help students, but class structure is non-existant and boring. I felt as though I learned nothing, and an extraordinary amount of effort was required for average essay grades.

Dr. O'Neal is the kind of professor that will actually remember your name. She genuinely cares about her students. If you work really hard on your essays and go to her office hours it will be reflected in your grade. She doesn't hand out As, but she isn't unnecessarily hard like most UGA english professors. By far my favorite professor at UGA!

Dr. O'Neal was an excellent professor. Her topics in the class were so interesting and she always provided feedback and help for her students. She genuinely cares about you and your grade. You choose your essay topics and there isn't a terrible amount of work.
She is awesome. You choose your own essay topics and she is not strict at all.

Professor O'Neal was an excellent teacher. She is very clear in what she expects of her students. She was not very strict. If you do badly on a assignment she will let you redo it if you ask her nicely. Overall a fun class. If you put in a little work you will get an A.

If you have the opportunity, take this professorno question. She truly cares for her students, andshould you end up in her ENGL1050 class there's a good chance you'll enjoy the reading and the lectures. She offers tremendous suggestions to better your writing. She is so passionate about what she does that you just might start to love it too.

She is a very understanding teacher and is willing to help you on your papers. When I first entered this class, I did not enjoy writing but she changed my whole perspective on writing. She lets you choose your topics which makes the writing process much more enjoyable. If you have the chance I would highly recommend Dr O' Neal.

Dr. O'Neal is an awesome professor. She is very helpful during office hours. Class was canceled 5-6 times throughout the semester for conferences with her. The essay topics were very open-ended. She seems like she genuinely cares about her students being successful in the class.

She is a good teacher, but very scattered-brain. She has a syllabus that plans out what she expects to do everyday, and she is good at sticking to it, but she gets side-tracked during class. Also she is not very technologically literate so watching her do things on the computer can be hard to watch. She will help with your essays though.

Definitely one of my favorite teachers at UGA. The class was a great mixture of learning how to perfect your writing in a safe environment, but she help student build relationships with one another and played the best YouTube videos. Highly recommend this class!

Professor O'Neal was absolutely great, and if you show interest, this class will be an easy A. She doesn't really check journals and rarely do you have homework. You only have 3 papers and a portfolio, and she definitely will help you through it. I would definitely take this class again.
She's very nice & approachable, and everyone loved her. She gives good feedback on your papers and will help out any way she can.
Really nice teacher. She grades pretty easy on papers. Class is virtually pointless to go to. Doesn't take attendance after the first few weeks.
So grateful to have been in her class last semester. It's hard to explain, but she is an awesome teacher! I highly recommend her to anyone who has the chance to take her!

she was a great prof! she likes for you to have something interesting or unique about your essays, if you do that then you will be set for a good grade..there are a few pop quizzes but they dont count for much. take this proffessor if you can!!

She likes interesting facts on your essays. Most of homework are assigned readings. Make sure you read (it's not even that long), rarely she'll give pop quiz. She's willing to help you through steps! :D. Doesn't give A easily, have to work hard for it!!!  I'd love to take her again

Professor is awesome and knows how to generate class discussion. I actually enjoyed the class, papers were pretty painless. She is very open to working with you on your papers. Very little out of class reading. Very little assignments other than the 3 papers required by UGA English. Few journals or other in class assignments. Take her!
Classes were pretty entertaining, and she's a nice professor. She is very open to topics for papers and to class discussions. She doesn't pass out A's to quickly though.

really fun class, watched youtube videos to get topics rolling almost everyday. She's the type who grades on whether its really catchy or interesting rather than grammatical or structural. She always told me to loosen up, and the favorite essays she showed in class were always the most unique and interesting. Super understanding too. Love her!
Easy grader and super nice! Class discussions were pretty random, but fun. She even brought our class donuts. *Two thumbs up!*
This class is easy and Professor O"Neal is a very fair grader. However, if you are used to challenging English classes, you might be bored.
There is no one I would rather diagram sentences with than Dr. O'Neal.

Dr. O'Neal is an awesome professor. We only wrote 3 major papers. She's open to whatever topics you want to talk about.She is specific with what she wants tho, which is definitely doable.The mini informal grammar lessons were extremely helpful. Take her!

I dread English classes, but I actually enjoy this class. She makes things so much more fun that they would be with other teachers. She is very helpful, and she has definitely made me a better writer. I would strongly recommend her!
Really great professor, super fun class.

English intros are usually a snore, even (maybe especially) for English majors, but Dr. O'Neal managed to challenge and excite her students. She chose to explore the Bildungsroman (coming-of-age story) in my class, an excellent choice for a room of clueless Atlanta suburbanites whose idea of self-exploration usually involves fake IDs. And she's hot

Dr. O'Neal was by far the most incredible teacher I've ever had. Not only was she helpful, she encouraged me to love English. She is super approachable and I was disappointed if I had to miss a class. The readings are short, she does most of the talking in discussions and really wants to see you excel. Do yourself a favor, take her class.
She's super laid back and pretty cool, although a tiny bit unclear at times. not a hard grader at all. just read stories and wrote papers and had a presentation.

Dr. O'Neal was a wonderful teacher. She made class somewhat interesting with good short stories and occasional movies. She lectures most of the time and does not push for a lot of discussion. Also, no quizzes so the reading isn't really necessary. We had 4 papers and she is a pretty easy grader and very helpful if you have any questions.
I enjoyed the class alot. The reading is a good amout but she gives you plenty of time to complete it.  Participate in group discussions.

Oneal is a very good prof.  Her class discussions are very helpful and generate alot of essay topics and veiwpoints.  She by no means hands out A's on papers.  However, she is very accomadating and more than willing to walk through your paper w/u if you approach her.Do freewrites, consult her on essays (thesis etc.) and compile a good portfolio=A

O'Neal makes "class discussion" very easy-- she does most of the talking, seldom including the class. Reading ALL stories aren't really necessary; just read enough to include support in essays. However, she is very picky about essays, but is willing to help a great deal through all steps of your paper. Essays due about every 3 weeks.

Dr. O'Neal is a good teacher and is willing to help her students succeed. She is very specific about her expectations for papers but she is lenient on the topics. This isn't a teacher that hands out A's, but if you just do your work and listen to what she wants, an A is "do-able."

Dr. Leglar is a wonderful teacher. She was my advisor and professor in school. She continues to be my first line of defense when I need help with a concept or teaching strategy. I will forever be in her debt.

Dr. Leglar is a wonderful teacher. She was my advisor and professor in school. She continues to be my first line of defense when I need help with a concept or teaching strategy. I will forever be in her debt.
Great Teacher

If you're dump, you'll still pass her class but if you want a clarity, you won't get it.  You got to read to get A in her class and willing to research her topic for lecture because she's never prepared for the class.  Her test hard and is not always what she went over in class and half of the time, she doesn't know what she went over.  And they're

Dr. Leglar is brilliant and hilarious (but a very dry sense of humor) and will not tolerate any stupidity or laziness in her classes.  That being said, if she's not one of your favorite, most helpful professors, it's probably because you're too dumb for her to bother with.
Worst experience of my life!!! Run for your life!!!
Dr. Leglar is a wealth of knowledge and an asset to the university.  If you don't pass her class it's because you're a cry-baby that doesn't study.

Dr. Leglar was my advisor, and as a music major in the honors program, she gave me more support than I could have asked for. I was not a music ed major, so I never had her as a professor, but I know that as an educator, she has a valuable opinion and a good head on her shoulders.
She doesn't know anything about music ed. She likes to degrade students with useless exercises and lots of paperwork. Also is totally 2-faced...will turn on you in an instant.
No Comments

This woman needs to retire. Although she is supposed to be an education specialist, she hides behind useless assignments because she can't keep up with her life. Stop trying to rule the world and do what you were hired to do. Get over yourself and retire.

I'm not a good writer, so for a 1101 class, she grades pretty picky. She gives very good feedback to improve. There's extra credit if you need it. The quizzes are really easy as long as you read the story. She's accessible, takes attendance, and her lectures are pretty mid. She just talks a lot and goes on a tangent. Overall, pretty chill.
ratingTags_Rating: Tough grader--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment_Rating: The negative reviews here are people who put in 0 effort expecting an A. Reeves is one of the best professors I've had. Clear expectations, hard grading but makes you better, she offers EC to make up for the hard grading, and super easy reading quizzes every now and again. She also is very very generous with students who she can tell are trying.

Professor Reeves was as good as a Lit professor can get. Hard grader but gives good feedback and allows rewrites on 2 of the 3 papers. She also offers plenty of extra credit so an A is pretty easy if you do those and rewrites. On top of that she offers bonus peer editing points if you take the extra 10 minutes to give good peer editing advice.
Just coming back because my memory from two years ago of her making me cry came up on my snapchat.  Avoid her. Thats all

Her lectures are incredibly boring, but she is a pretty nice woman. She requires attendance, but lets you go to any of her sections that she teaches. She definitely is a super tough grader, but she does allow rewrites. Boring class but shes not the worst English 1102 professor...
ratingTags_Rating: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment_Rating: If you typically struggle writing wake up... its college. she is a fair grader and provides blunt but relevant comments. You can also rewrite 2 of 3 papers! Lots of reading but the quizzes are dumb easy! Honestly just read and get ahead when you write and EMAIL HER IF YOU'RE STRUGGLING!! She's super understanding and will recognize effort!
ratingTags_Rating: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment_Rating: She is a tough grader but she'll let you rewrite.
ratingTags_Rating: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Get ready to read

comment_Rating: She's a really tough grader, don't know of anyone in my class getting above an A. Super unclear about assignments then tells you its your fault when you don't understand. class is super boring just go sit and listen to her read the assignment you read the night before for the quiz. just a bad class all around
Be prepared to be very bored in class.

Worst professor I've ever had. She will make mistakes while grading and then blame it on you when you're not at fault. She is very unclear about her expectations and is the toughest grader I've ever had. Very rude when grading offering no positive feedback. Abruptly stopped grading one of my papers and just wrote "sweeping generalizations."
SUPER tough grader for papers. Will let you write rewrites though

VERY tough grader!!! Barely ever gives out A's. Super boring- found myself dozing off. Quizzes almost every class based on a reading but they're easy. Nit picky grader. Extra credit is given but not allowed to go from a "B" to an "A". Very helpful though but vague expectations.

She is extremely vague about essays and topics and an extremely nit picky grader. The highest grade I saw anybody get on one of her essays was an 85. I genuinely don't feel that I learned anything the whole semester other than how to incorporate a quote every other sentence.

I so enjoyed her class!! She was a tough grader, but I feel like a much better writer now that I made it through. She gives you easy reading quizzes and Extra credit opportunities, so take advantage of those!! Another plus, she is super easy going about due dates.

very nice lady but she was a tough grader. BUT she gave lots of extra credit opportunities and the essays got easier as they went along. i ended up with a B+ which was awesome, so you can do well with her, but she is a hard grader!

Save yourself, don't take Reeves. She was indecisive at best, and her grading was horrendous. The rubric she followed was unclear while many of the "errors" she found were very subjective. When approached with questions, her answers were always vague, as if she wasn't even sure what she was counting off for. Not very high quality at all.
Yes, Dr. Reeves is a hard grader, but if you try hard, come in during office hours and follow her advice, not only will you get an A like I did, but you can learn a lot.

I would not recommend taking Dr. Reeves.  She changes the syllabus weekly and emails changes at like 2 in the morning.  Grades the essays(55% of grade) sooo hard.  A B is possible but you have to rewrite every paper in order to get a B.  The only good is that she does let students rewrite 2 papers. There are less painful teachers availale.

Her grading is my biggest complaint. It seems as if she picks a grade at random or predetermines one. My essay grades were OK, but she is a picky grader. She emails the class info the day of class and then acts surprised that we didn't check our email between waking up and noon! On the plus side she is quite flexible on due dates.

I liked Dr. Reeves! She is a tough grader, but I feel my writing has improved because I took her class. Her quizzes really aren't that difficult if you actually read the material. Overall I thought she was a great teacher.

DO NOT TAKE HER! I only made A's in HighSchool. Rubrics seem average, but her grading is ridiculously picky. Make sure to do readings and ask questions. Very unfair grader. A little unorganized and scattered brained. Sometimes can be very rude and snitty.

Horrible teacher; class a complete joke. Made up and changed the syllabus at least twice a week, complete with emails to the class detailing the next day's newly determined activities (but only sent at 11PM..). Learned NOTHING. Grades too harshly for some, not nearly harsh enough for others. As if grades are decided before reading. Is this college?

At the beginning of the semester I was so stoked to have her because she seemed so easy.. she didnt give a lot of homework and just seemed really laid back. She is the HARDEST GRADER ive ever had. She gives quizzes on readings & asks questions on the smallest details. & dont bother w/ extra credit bc it doesnt even help in the end.

She's NEVER on time to her own class and always lets us out early.  However, she is a very nice lady and a decent teacher.  She grades essays pretty harshly, so don't be surprised if you get a lower grade than you expected.

4 papers all 60% of grade, 30% portfolio (definitly will help and boost grade), and 10% quiz grade over light readings (relatively straight forward). She will work with you, and you will become a better writer after the course. I would say average grade is a B for her class. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND HER!

This class was intimidating but proved to be helpful and quite applicable to courses involving writing. She is not at all an easy grader, but her grading style is necessary in order to truly learn how to write. I would recommend this class to those really looking to better their writing.

I hated english throughout highschool, and I was awful at writing papers. She tries really hard to help you out and she let our class rewrite ALL of our papers. We normally had reading, and had a quick and easy quiz at the beginning of class. She lets you turn your papers in late without any points taken off. I DEFINATELY recommend taking her!

Crazy harsh grader.  You better understand the crap out of that prompt before you even think about starting your paper.  But she's also really cool -- scatter-brained, too.  Our final paper was cancelled because she didn't have time to grade it.

She is very unorganized! I got a 50 on the first paper and only made A's & B's in high school! I would not recommend her to anyone! If your a person who is very unorganized, maybe you will relate to her. I once made an appt with her and she never showed up to it.

Harsh grader is an understatement.  She had me feeling as if ENGLISH was my second language and I am American.  Even with other ENGLISH professors @ UGA reading my paper I would get 60s.  She had me feeling as if I was going to fail but I ended up with a B.

I really enjoyed this class. She would almost always answer emails and would answer any question or concern that you might have. The only downfall to this professor I feel is her being VERY unorganized. Like many people said before she changes the syllabus like a hundred times. Overall if you get her your lucky!

This teacher grades very harshly, I took honors english classes all throughout high school and consistently made A's and B's at a private academy. I can't understand how an english 1101 teacher at a public university grades like I am in a graduate level course. She is often disorganized and will allow you to turn in papers late if you contact her.
Nice, helpful, and if you do poorly on a paper she's more than happy to help you hone it and develop it. I highly recommend her.

papers were graded fairly, even if topics were not always super enjoyable. if you are awful with due dates like i am, then take this class. as long as you let her know what is up, she will let you turn in papers late -- i ended up with an A, but if i had another prof i'm sure my grade would have been much lower.

Reeves, overall, is a very nice professor.  She can, however, be very disorganized!  She must have changed the syllabus throughout the course more than 11x's (no joke).  Sometimes when you contact her, she wouldnot respond.  She grades somewhat harshly.  Don't see how it was possible to get an "A". She's nice overall, but can be much of a hassle!

Even though not always prepared for class, always interested in topic. Wish there had been more class participation required. Papers were fairly graded, and if you talk to her about writing topic,s she will be very helpful.

While she was nice, the grades were impossible and she often could not answer me on how I could have done better. I made a B, but put in more than A-effort. There were several times I tried to contact her concerning things and I never got a response when it was imperative that I did. It was hard to even know HOW to do well. English used to be my fa

Terrible teacher.  Never prepared for class, and her grading is awful.  No matter how hard you work, you will not get a good grade on a paper because she will find something wrong and take off a lot of points.
Great prof! She's very helpful if you have a hard time and always willing to make time for you. Plus, she responds to emails faster than most of my friends. Be prepared for busy work on grammar.

She was a nice enough teacher, but she was a really tough grader on essays. Sometimes her comments made sense, but sometimes they seemed kind of unfair. She was also kind of unorganized, and we got about 2 - 3 emails a day from her.

Her class is pretty easy, but she is a tough grader when it comes to essays. The class is boring, and I found her pretty uninteresting. She never followed the syllabus and often emailed the class 3 or 4 times a night. I wish I had taken another class.

Made A's on essays in high school, made B's on essays in her class. She's very unorganized when it comes to assigning things - I'd sometimes get 2-3 emails in one night because she was constantly changing what she had said in previous mails. Came to class late a few times. Hated using emma.
She grades hard, but she is really nice and understanding about grades.
She grades hard, but she would meet you half way a lot of times with other things. She was fun.

We had weekly quizzes that weren't difficult if you'd done the reading.  Two exams that were supposed to be in-class, but she let us take them home.  Midterm and final were cummulative of the quizzes.  She facilitates interesting discussion, and knew random information about American Lit.
Not too hard of a Class,(i got a high B)but be ready to hear her liberal/feminist views in class and a lot through the reading assignments
Pretty interesting class, only 4 major essays to hand in, and she lets you do 2 re writes.  I think it is an easy class to get a B in.

Hard to understand/follow at times however it doesn't matter. All hw/quizzes are online and they'll show you how to do the problems online too. Test is based off the quizzes/hw prob's. just w/diff. #s. Do the hws/quizzes/study them and you'll get an A/B! Also don't buy the textbook! You DO NOT use it at all.
very very nice man. Soft spoken but very willing to help you. The class in general is easy concepts and he is a fair grader. Probably not the BEST teacher for this class but definitely not the WORST.
He is such a sweet man, but very little he teaches in class in on the tests. Read the book and you'll be fine.
The second test he told us that he would fail the test. If you can help it dont take unless you are really good with pre cal

He does not teach the material. Plain and simple you will teach yourself through this course. However, the material on the tests comes straight from the online homeworks. Just be prepared to go to tutoring and teach yourself everything. Anyone can get through the class with atleast a B though.

MAKE SURE you know your pre-cal book from cover to cover because that is what this prof. expects. For example, we didn't even start with chapter 1! We started with 2.1 and its been rediculous from them on. I just dropped the class I couldn't handle it anymore. He is really helpful in office hours but no help at all in class. AVOID THIS PROF!

He is NOT a good teacher for pre-calculus. He more than once just didn't know how to work a problem. If you arent good at math like me then DO NOT take him. I had to teach myself through the sections and also his class is very unorganized.

He's a sweet, gentle, absent-minded professor type, and always willing to give help in office hours...without all that help, I would never have gotten my A. His voice is soft and kind of mumbly, so sit in the front or you won't be able to hear.

He frequently got distracted in the midst of problems and wasn't always clear. He would give us a rundown of the test before hand, and then on test day it would be more complicated problems than we had practiced. He was a nice enough guy, but I don't feel like I learned anything about Calculus!

DEFINITELY brush up on your precalc if you're gonna take him for calc. He does not slow down, and he EXPECTS that you know everything from precalc. Math is my favorite subject and I struggled in this class.

While he was a very sweet professor the material in this class would not have been difficult, had the class been taught in a more orderly manner. It was very hard to follow what was going on the most of the time. Sweet doesn't get an A. The comp. program that test are given on often vears slightly from class so you often do not know what to expect!

I took him for calc II over the summer which was probably he reason why it was so hard. I seriously read the book and bought calc II for dummies and the homework still left me in tears at times but he realised it was hard and didnt include it in our grade. The tests werent bad IF YOU STUDY! This class isnt for slackers. Hes kinda boring too.
i think the fact that i dropped the class says it all...i tried hard and couldn't do it.
Really nice guy. Class is hard, and the material really sucks. Tests are not easy, and he gives pop quizzes. He is willing to help, but i learned nothing the whole semester.
ta was more helpful. hard to keep interested, granted it was calc. threw lots of curveballs on tests

Nice professor (addresses students' questions), but test material seems harder than class work.  Sometimes he wants different, more "exact" answers than in the textbook.  Also sometimes shows unnecessary work to figure out the solution.  I'd prefer taking his class over Dr. David Edwards' course, though!

He is a great teacher. I took him over a summer session so the class was smaller than the normal size. He is willing to answer questions and to meet with you during office hours. He gives a lot of pop quizes so you have to study along! There was a fairly easy project too. He reviews the info for the test the day before so DEFINITELY show up then!

Dr. Burgoyne is a sweet old man. He goes slowly enough that everyone should be able to follow. Yes, he does make dumb mistakes sometimes, but he still knows more about math than you do!  One warning: pop quizzes all the freakin time!

Burgoyne was a great Math 1101 teacher.  His test were very easy, seeing that he basically reviewed the entire test the day before.  He gives really easy quizes once or twice a week.  If I had gone to class more than a couple of times I would have gotten a 4.0 for sure.  I've also heard that all the other teachers for this class sucked, so take thi

Here's the key to getting a A: Go up to him during the tests and quizzes he will practically give you the answer... During my final he completely worked out the problem for me. I made three Bs and one A on the tests and made a high enough grade on the final (he practically helped me through it) to make an A- definately take him if you get the chanc

He seems lost during lectures and makes frequent mistakes.  He just does examples and kinda slacks on the whole TEACHING aspect of his job.  But he grades very easily.  Tests are easy, especially if you study.  He gives projects, but he explained them in depth numerous times before the lengthy due date was reached.

He's a great teacher if you're not good at math.   Teaches very slow and boring but it gives you time to comprehend.  There were 4 tests, 1 final, 4 projects and quizzes about once a week or so.  Seems like a lot but its very easy. Listen carefully to what he wants on the projects or he will take points off.

soo, burgoyne was a nice, sweet old man..but he was a horrible prof. i was pretty good at math, but he was awful. i think it is more JEXAM than him, but still i think there could be a more effective teacher when using jexam. i wouldnt take him again
prof. burgoyne is like the optimal grandfather... he is caring, funny, and makes the class enjoyable-- not a difficult class... highly, highly recommend... i was lucky to have him for math...

Whoever said he was hot is wrong.  He's like 70, but anyways.  I knew most of the material before taking the class so I did very well.  He gives pop quizes a lot but they're always only one question and at the end of the class after we've been discussing the material.  He can be monotone at times but I'd take him again!

Dr. Burgoyne is very kind and very nice, and thats about it.  Since PreCal at UGA uses JExam now, he has no idea how to teach effectively with the program.  Also, if people in the class are more advanced in their understanding of PreCal, he teaches at their level and moves too fast for non-math types.  AVOID HIM FOR ANYTHING THAT USES JEXAM!!
I love this man he totally saved HOPE for me, I totally suck at math and I got an A.

This man is very sweet and somewhat helpful when you need him...but, when taking PreCal at UGA you use JExam...he is not a good teacher with this because he doesn't make the tests so he doesn't know what to teach!! Don't take him for PreCal!!
What to say about good ole prof Burgoyne?  He was good, and funny.
No Comments

A very nice man! Only thing hard about this course is sometimes questions are tricky, but pretty standard trickiness. Class can be quite dull, but he manages well enough considering that it's a mathematics course.

One of the easiet classes I've had thus far. He's extremely boring though, but always willing to help. Good clear teaching methods for the most part.Go to class, and going to the study sessions before the test help as well.
Class harder than I expected. Very, very sweet man, but his voice made me tired.

One of the sweetest professors I've had.  I expected an easy A out of this class but it turned out a bit more difficult.  Going to class will help because 10% of your grade is pop quizes.  The practice tests online help for exams.
This class was a little harder than i thought it would be, but i think he was one of the best teachers.. he gave pop quizes in class but he dropped 2 of them and he never took attendence.
I took him for International Studies at JU. He is a great teacher and respond quickly to emails. I will definitely recommend him.
He is a very smart and compassionate teacher. He gets off topic a bit, but has a lot of knowledge to offer.  Sometimes he does not have a very strong filter, and his jokes can be a little intrusive.

THE BEST professor I ever had at UGA. I know others have said it, but Jorge is seriously one of the smartest people you will ever meet. He is so accomplished academically and he is truly an inspiration. He cares about his students...he encouraged us when the semester was over to contact him anytime if we needed his help- TAKE THIS CLASS! He's great
Looooooved this man. So insightful, so sensitive, so flexible. If for some reason he doesn't leave this Fall, FIGHT to be in his class. Well worth it.
Very Smart.  That's what i want to say.  Smart, Clever, and critical thinker.
A deep, outgoing, thinker
He is very smart. I have learned a lot about --Literature!
Had no idea what was going on....not a good teacher at all.  Nice guy, but just can't teach lit.  He gave very random multiple choice tests...FOR A LIT CLASS!
Great teacher! He was always so willing to help anyone, and he is one of the smartest people I have ever met.  He is the BEST!

One of the best professors I had. We only worked on ONE paper in her class. She is organized and will be straightforward when explaining what to do. Considering we only did one paper, I learned a lot from her class. No final too. She doesn't go easy on you when you are writing your paper though so make sure to use her suggestions(or writing lab)

Good at making boring books relatable. Be prepared to read A LOT & FAST. Many small writing assignments, but they're informal, easy 100s for those. She gave us a lot of groupwork for class time. Can be annoying but also easy 100s. Doesn't give any feedback on work (unless asked) & is easily accessible & responsive via email.
ratingTags_Rating: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Accessible outside class

comment_Rating: She is extremely helpful and very organized. For English, her class is pretty interesting, especially American Gods. Her grading isn't hard, but not easy either. You must work hard to get an A. She does offer extra credit at the end of the semester, so that helps. Definitely recommend taking her.

I liked her a lot. She does a really good job of facilitating good discussion and gives helpful and encouraging feedback when grading papers. We also read some really interesting literary works, especially "American Gods".
Dr. Walker is a great teacher! Makes class interesting and really cares about the students. You can achieve an easy A/B simply by showing up for class. Take her!

Ms. Walker (could be Dr. by now) is a great professor to have.  She really loves literature and writing but is also pretty laid back.  Not a strict grader, understanding about most anything, and you get to watch plenty of movies.  Class was had a Gothic theme which kept interests up. Great class.

She's great! She's super helpful and not at all a hard grader. She doesn't give random or unnecessary assignments, and she's very understanding if you can't get something read in time for class. Virtually NO homework. 4 papers with a HUGE extra credit bump if you want it. I can't say enough good things! Highly recommended!

I took ENGL 1102M and found the class really helpful for developing text analysis and writing skills. Jessica Walker was always available to work with us on anything. I learned a lot without getting too stressed, because assignments weren't excessive. Great teacher!! Easy to talk to, very knowledgeable, and interested in the subject matter.

She's a decent teacher.  Has a bit of an attitude, so do not get on her bad side.  Also, tends to be slow to get graded work back and sends long e-mails, which (in order to receive important updates that are hidden) you must read.

All our writings were in-class, which was a great help in workload. She also constructed questions on the midterm around our input; she said it was no use having us write on something we hadn't thought about first. Go to class and take notes, and you'll be fine, she's very nice.

She is very helpful and easygoing. She lets you choose what you want to write about, which makes the writing process a lot easier. Her class helped my writing so much and I would definitely recommend taking the class.

Shakespeare section, but she did make it interesting. Papers  topics seemed forward but it seemed impossible to ever get the grade. I made a lot of 89's with alot of effort. Overall great teacher just be prepared to work.

For Shakespeare emphasis: Rather boring stuff but she made it as interesting as possible- I dreaded getting back papers. Very hard grader I worked WAY too hard for a class- I got the A, but it was a struggle, let me tell ya. I asked English majors and other professors to proof papers and still wasn't satisfied. Re-wrote papers time and time again
She was cool. Highly disorganized. But was a good teacher. Made 3 A's(92,90,90) and 1 B(83) on all essays and ended up with a B+...She is strict about her grading policies. Wished made an A-...

LOVED her and her class!!! Very helpful and understanding lady. If you have questions or need help w/ ur paper, she always makes appointments w/ u. No major tests- somex make sure to read few stories that she assigns (very simple and enjoyable, tho). Mostly essay writings, but again simple. HIGHLY RECOMMEND! My fav. teacher! would take her again.
She's really nice and grades fairly. I would definetly recommend taking a class with her. She's great at what she does.

She knows alot about what she is talking about and will help you when you need it.  She provides lots of time in class to get assignments done.  The papers are enjoyable because she gives you a good deal of freedom in choosing your topic.
She lead great discussions!  She will help you if you ask for it and she's just an overall fun lady!!!
SHE'S AMAZING!!! :) I loved her!
Quite possibly the worst teacher at UGA. Run, do not walk away. Avoid at all costs, does not know what she is doing and is totally disorganized.
Jessica is a cool lady, really laid back and understanding. Grades fairly and is not a bad choice for an english teather.

Jessica is an awesome teacher! She makes discussions interesting and knows what she's talking about. She's also cool about leading the class into off topic discussions, but that's fun too. She grades very fairly and is very helpful when it comes to writing papers. I recomend her! :)

i dont think walker is a brainless idiot...i thought she knew a lot about every story we read and found details that i often overlooked.  it is kinda boring sitting thru every class, but she was fair.
a brainless idiot--avoid at all costs.
Mrs. Walker is a great teacher.  She facilitates discussion well.  She grades fair, and is very helpful!
I took his online class. He was available via email and the assignments were not hard, provided you read the text.
So very boring and outdated. I made an A and went to class 4 times.  A true waste of money.

He was a very nice guy and took the time to meet everyone. He even tried to help me with some personal  issues, which I greatly appreciated. If the class did get a bit boring, it was because barely anyone participated. I enjoyed his jokes, which, even though a bit corny sometimes, still made the class more fun. His notes were also very informative.

He is a genuinely nice guy, even if he is a little bit boring and fairly opinionated.  Like someone else said, he's like a loveable grandpa.  The worst part was having to get up for the 8 am class.  It really isn't hard to make an A at all.

Dr. Garbin is old and hard of hearing. What's cool is that he doesn't really lecture - he gives you lecture notes and tells you to read, then in class, you have discussions. He also seems to care about his students as individuals. He's like a funny grandpa who talks a lot about the structure of society.

HORRIBLE TEACHER! I thought that sociology would be interesting, and it probably would have been if I didn't have Garbin.  he's boring and opinionated in a way that rubs you the wrong way (even if you agree with him).  nearly all the people in my class disliked it.  he's become so old that he just needs to retire-- his opinions are outdated.  bad.

He is pretty old, and somewhat boring at times, but he is a genuinely nice guy.  He can also be very funny.  Take the opportunity to meet him in his office hours and he will like you a lot more.  I really enjoyed this class a lot, and would recommend it to anyone.

i thought this class would be awesome, but he was so boring.  i didn't learn anything because you didn't really have to read and his lectures were so boring.  everyday at least a few people fell asleep.
He is a nice guy.  His lectures get a bit boring... but the subject matter is fun.

I almost dropped the class the first week because I hated him so much, but he grew on me after a while. He will seem really condescending until your class starts to understand what exactly he's looking for during discussion. Get past the first bit, and it gets so much better. I ended up loving the class and looked forward to it every day! Nice guy!

Frustrating to be in this class. If the students don't read, there's no productive discussion in class, which is what Dolezal is great at, facilitating discussion and ideas. He does not give explicit guidelines, rather allowing you to interpret prompts and ideas how you will. The lack of guaranteed answers/structure will upset the spoonfed learner.

Dr. Dolezal is an excellent professor. He won't give you the answers, but he's not going to penalize you if you don't know them. If you really try to engage with the material, he will meet you where you are. He will force you to question your assumptions. Some people won't like that, but then again, why are we in college?

I had to withdraw from this class because I felt so frustrated by his teaching methods. He would not answer your questions in class, but merely called on other students to answer and then never said if the answer given was right or wrong. I was so lost and there was no way to gain clarity. He also argued and made offensive comments to students...

Dolezal is a super friendly guy, and his class was really laid-back. He doesn't give a lot of hard deadlines, but as long as you're flexible he's a great teacher to take. :] (also the review before this talks about dawgspeak, but I don't think Dolezal does the slang dictionary. maybe they meant the other 4100 teacher, mccreary?)

The class was split between working on the "dawgspeak" UGA slang dictionary (which was fun and interesting) and actual linguistic information. The material wasn't difficult, but the text he assigned was difficult to interpret and his teaching didn't clarify anything. Our final involved poorly photocopied dictionary pages that could barely be read.

Fred Dolezal is a tropical knowledge storm with a 99% chance of BLOWING. YOUR. MIND. Like a professorial Yoda, he'll teach you to be intellectually self-sufficient. He will hone your mind to hit the exact mark like a mental sniper. After his class, your mind will avoid ambiguity like a plague-ridden sewer gator. Get ready.

Prof. Dolezal is a good man. Participate in class discussions and your class will be much more interesting and informative. If you put your best foot forward and do the work expected of you, you should be fine. He teaches you to think for yourself and explore the world around you, not just the world within your class. A fun man and good teacher.

If you like teaching yourself, take this guy. If you like being taught, take someone else. He expects you to come to class already knowing everything, and then just spends class time being pretentious. He doesn't teach necessary information until the day of or after the quiz. I'm upset that my tuition money pays his bills.

WITTY and FUNNY!  He really facilitates class discussion, and it's always interesting.  I had him and before the second day was over, he knew everyone's names.  He'll often randomly call on you, so make sure to pay attention, though it isn't hard.  He's very laid back, and he even made Shakespeare interesting.  I would definitely take him again.

This class was really interesting. He teaches you to think for yourself and question everything. He in no way holds your hand, so there is some work required. I found the class very rewarding and his offbeat personality was quite humerous at times. Very little essay writing, mainly just reading and discussing. Overall a good teacher.
It was a summer class, but I found him to be off the wall and fun but a little nutty.  I could tell he was rubbing some people in the class the wrong way, but I liked him.

Don't expect a clear cut, perfectly organized class structure. It's really based on discussion of readings and historic dictionary excerpts. There aren't very many assignments. I think the final grading is done based on participation throughout the semester, since discussion is such a big part of the class. Beware though - he can be harsh.

I checked this site before I took his class and ignored the bad reviews-I regret it! This professor uses straw man arguments and other logical fallacies to debate with you. This makes the class extremely tedious. He often either gave us faulty information or didn't know the answer to students questions. Another reviewer called him an idiot-I agree.

funny guy.  kinda moody but not bad.  you coyuld get an a if you workd and a b if you didnt.  not much writing or reading and not a hard grader.  pop quizzes so go to class but pretty interesting.  watched some random movies and he loves betty boop cartoons.  id take him again..
English Grammar is not for everyone.

i don't know how y'all took his classes in so poorly or maybe just couldn't appreciate his teaching technique, but i thought he was excellent! he taught us to learn how to think, and maybe some ppl are just too lazy to try, but i learned a ton from him and while he was vague at times he still instilled in us a go-get-it mentality and work to perfec
No Comments
worst teacher i have ever had in my entire life. not only can he not teach, he's condescending, rude, and close-minded. avoid him at all costs!!! listening to him ramble is not worth an easy A.

My class was so unorganized.  I would have been better off just buying the book and teaching myself.  He was rude and uninterested in student's questions, and put random items on our quizzes that were 2-3 chapters ahead in our books to "keep us on our toes."  Do NOT take this class.
