His class was very different... there weren't too many papers to write and we just did a big group project. This is the class to take if you don't like to write a lot.

Great professor. Very knowledgable about the material, and since these classes are very small, she is interested in getting to know you if you let her. Sure she might be a bit disorganized, but no one is perfect. She tries her best to help you enjoy the culture, language, and her class if you are willing to put in the work. You will learn a lot.

Dr. Quinlan gets a bad reputation because of general lacking of communication in her classes between both the students and the professor. She wants to help, but you have to be willing to put in the effort to understand the reading assignments. She thinks outside the box, and expects deeper analysis from her students, which I admire and respect.

Susan Quinlan is the worst teacher one can get at UGA. She is never prepared to class, does not know portuguese (speaks it awfully), and constantly "discorrect" (marks wrong what is absolutly correct) your papers.  She hates to be challenged on her feminist interpretation of the world. You all are right her class is boring and meaningless! Avoid it

OMFG!! worst teacher ever. she missed three weeks of class (sometimes without letting us know before) seemed like we were learning the language at the same time as her. the book is hard to find because it is literally 35 years old. She has no idea hwo the grammar system works and marks off for grammatically correct structures.
Worst professor I've ever had.

This teacher is a joke, she has no idea and pretends that she knows what she's talking about. Classes are boooooooring and she doesnt really know what's going on. This teacher is a joke, she'd be better off teaching a crochet class or a cooking class not at University level. If you want an easy A get into one of her classes, but be aware you will n
It's an ok teacher. Easy assignments. Classes get booooring.
Worst professor I've ever had!
No Comments
You have to be kidding.  This is a professor????

Dr. Cobb is one of UGA's best treasures. He is a renowned Historian who was completely educated at the University of Georgia. His insights are truly amazing, and he has the ability to context history with today. His personal blog cobbloviate .com is also a must read. Would take ever course he offers.
ratingTags_Rating: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment_Rating: I LOVE COBB! He's so interesting & you can learn a lot from him. He's the definition of a college professor though -- he literally just lectures the whole time, so you have to take a lot of notes. Tests are doable. You just have to study of course.

I heard lots of complaining about how hard his class was but I found it to be all for nothing.  As long as you do the readings (which are interesting), go to class & take notes, study for the tests, you can get an A easily.  His tests are not that hard - he even gives you the ability to pick the questions you want to write about.

You have to go to every class, but it gives you 6 extra points on your final grade, so it's worth it. You need to skim the book and take a lot of notes on the lectures, and definitely talk to your TA for test advise. People generally do badly on the first one, so definitely study your ass off for that one, but it gets easier when you know how.

He's a very sweet teacher and he's probably in his late 60's but he's not a bore to listen to. However, he does have a seating chart... In a lecture class of 300. This means he takes role every single day. You are allowed to miss six times though and this has been more than enough for those few days you just really can't make it. I recommend him.

Dr. Cobb is one of the smartest professors I've had. He has a vast amount of knowledge when it comes to American History. His tests suck. I did bad on the first but well on the final 2. All history professors at UGA make their classes hard so you might as well take one that's interesting.

I am not very good at history to begin with, but still did well in past classes. His lecture notes were extremely confusing to me and the test were super hard! I would not recommend taking this class.

nice guy. there are other history classes out there that may be better for your gpa as a core class. Avg grade this semester was a low B. Must attend class(mandatory) and take thorough notes. Textbook use is bevy and he pulls easily overlooked terms to define on tests

Cobb's a pro, at it for 41 years: tough, witty, intolerant of shenanigans, fair, and super smart. You HAVE to read, attend class, and take notes. 1st test of 3 walloped me, but I aced the next two. Don't buy notes - just read and pay attention. Use the question list he posts on eLC to study from, and know key terms from textbook.

He really does offer good extra credit, like 6 points on your exam if you attend every class. MUST BUY RED NOTES. Take notes of the key terms in the chapters he assigns/ if he assigns just pages. Just focus on the key terms in the book and use red notes for the lecture and you'll be fine, but you do have to study and hes kinda boring.

Yes, Cobb's class can get a little boring, but he's always willing to help. He gives two quizzes that you can earn up to 5 points back on your first two exams. Post-civil war history is the easiest because a lot of it is familiar. Know the details on big events and study key terms in the book and you'll be fine on the test!

Dr. Cobb is one of the best and most acclaimed professors at UGA. Everyone in his lower levels classes dislike the amount of reading and work, but his upper level classes are wonderful. Dr. Cobb is extremely knowledgable and helpful with all of his students. You have to be prepared to keep up with the reading, but his exams are not very difficult.

DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS! Everyone failed the first test and I have never failed a test in my life. He expects a ridiculous amount of studying and reading and doesn't care about the students. Half of my class dropped the class after the first test. He thinks he tells funny jokes.  (they aren't funny)

His lectures are straight and to the point. He also gives extra credit opportunities! TAKE ADVANTAGE OF THEM! These points are EXTREMELY helpful. Get to know your TA! They do more than just grade your papers. They can give you pointers on what and how to study. My TA was GREAT! READ YOUR BOOK It makes this class a lot easier!

Although his class is hard, Mr. Cobb is a great teacher. If you keep up with the reading and pay attention in class you'll do fine. The notes on NOTEHALL.com also help A LOT! You might also want to get close to your TA. they are EXTREMELY helpful! I made a 90 on my final! His class is possible! It's only hard if you make it hard.

This class was so boring. He is SO hard to pay attention and takes forever to get to the point, so its hard to take good notes. Attendance is taken every day in a class of about 300.The tests are ridiculous and consist of multiple choice, short answers and an essay question. If I had to do it again, I would definitely take a different, easier teacher.

Where do I begin!?Class is mandatory and you have assigned seats.Lecture is SO boring and you can't use computers.It is very hard to take thorough notes so I bought student notes to fill in the holes.Before the test he sent out an e-mail saying he bought the student notes and not to rely on them!Tests are mostly writing and very HARD. READ THE BOOK

DO NOT TAKE! GPA NIGHTMARE! Cobb is VERY reliant on the textbook for the test, his  lectures are boring and the material he teaches in class is not on the test but he makes attendance necessary. He tries to tell jokes but it just makes the class angry after he brags about a low test average for the class. BEWARE!

Cobb is a very different kind of teacher. He is old, and 100 percent pure lecture. His class is absolutely boring. We have assigned seats in a 300+ class, and attendance is MANDATORY. His TA's are the devil. They patrol like nazi's for cell phones, attendance, and cheating. They grade super hard. He knows what he is talking about but is very blah.

Cobb was really interesting to follow in lecture, and if you go to class (you have to) and pay attention, you'll be fine. You aren't to slack off all that much, but it's not the kind of course you want to kill yourself over either. I would recommend him to anybody. You really will learn a lot, and he lectures in a really clear and organized way

This class isn't too difficult. Just pay attention, take notes on the important points, and skim the chapters. The tests aren't hard if you studied. Didn't have to kill myself at all. Cobb is a good professor who keeps the lectures interesting. The only annoying thing about the class is the mandatory attendance.

WOW!! You will work your butt off for this class...there's only 3 tests, including final. Those are your only grades, but by the time you see how harshly they are graded, you're begging for more grades. He is no help (TAs do ALL the work), and we had ASSIGNED seats in a 300+ class! Attendance is MANDATORY. Be prepared to work!

I don't like history, but Cobb really clarifies the subject. He prides himself in being a hard teacher, so he's not terribly compassionate when you don't do well. He gets a lot more interesting after withdrawal period.  Not an easy class, but you really do learn a lot. Had to study like a beast, but straight from the notes. Buy the student notes.

This is not a bad class at all. His lectures are fairly interesting, and if retained anything from your history classes from highschool you will do fine. The bonus pt system helps a lot too!!! Don't expect any interaction though there are lots of people in the class with you.

Killed my GPA!! You have to like history to do well in this class. He's monotone so you have to pay attention if you want to catch his jokes :-) He has Q&A sessions b4 tests, but he won't answer your question unless you prove that you already know something about the subject. NO hints as to what will be on the tests! READ! And ask questions.

I really enjoyed this class! Yes, attendance is mandatory, but it's really for your own good and you get points for it. Tests aren't so bad if you read the reading focal points. Buying student notes really helped, but I suggest taking your own notes also. Read the books he assigns, they really help out your grade and they're actually interesting.
Awesome lecturer! This guy can really make history come alive. I have never witnessed a more passionate teacher...I just wish his TA's would get a life and STOP GRADING SO HARSHLY!

GET INTO THE INFORMATION! He tests your knowledge of concepts not how well you can memorize timelines... Do the reading, go to his study sessions. Its a little tough to get help because he leaves it up to the TAs.

HATED THIS CLASS WITH A PASSION. I studied a week in advance for each test, bought the student notes in addition to taking my own notes in class, and got a B+. This class ruined my 4.0 GPA. TA's don't know how to grade and Cobb's microphone sucks.
Cobb is GREAT! loved his class. go to the TA review sessions and read the book.. you guaranteed an A.

Loved Cobb! His passion for history is obvious in his teaching. He makes it as entertaining as possible, but you have to be prepared to pay attention in class and take good notes. Tests require a lot of studying and memorizing events, but I thought the class was totally worth it.

Professor Cobb is amazing. Yes the TAs patrol like Nazis to make sure you're not doing other things but it's for your benefit. He makes history fascinating! I wish he taught 2111. I paid attention and got an A, only slackers did poorly in his class. Go to class and Q&A sessions. Very helpful. Fantastic professor, really funny, totally nice guy.

I loved this class. Dr Cobb's lectures were the most interesting I've ever heard. He tells stories that make a topic interesting. He also has a good sense of humor. The tests were tough. You need to study, but getting a good grade is definitely possible. Go to Dr Cobb's Q/A sessions. They really help. Go to class. Extra credit for full attendence!

Do NOT take this class. It is very long and boring, and attendance is mandatory. Not only that, but the TA's patrol the class watching to make sure you don't have anything up on your computer thats not notes. Everyone did aweful on the first test, and it was grader too harshly. And my TA was not reasonable in her grading. Cobb also mixes up facts.

Dr. Cobb appeared to be a very passionate and intellectually enhanced older individual. I loved his sarcasm; it made the class!and the extra credit for good attendance was good too. He's tough, but I recommend him b/c you actually come out knowing something.

Tough on attendance, but go to every class and get 9 points extra credit on the final. Tests can be tough, but fair. Keeps class interesting with jokes and stories, it's the only history class I've ever taken that I didn't want to fall asleep in.
This class requires a lot of work, and the tests are tough, but fair.  He does a pretty good job trying to keep lectures interesting by telling jokes and personal anecdotes.
The class is not too bad most of the stuff is from the lectures and u can get by with a B+ without reading and he does help u out a little bit on the tests.. he does joke a lot.. some are funny

Great Professor, made a lot of jokes and kept class interesting. Get 9 points added to your final exam if you never miss a lecture (he takes attendance). Also have 2 reading quizzes over assigned books for extra credit on the only two tests of the semester. I loved the class, except my t.a. was TERRIBLE and graded way too harshly.

Cobb is the epitome of a Southern Intellectual.  He fills his lectures with tons of useful information, and does a pretty good job concealing his political affinity.  Tests are straightforward from lectures and readings.  He is strict on attendance.  Sweats a lot, and pulls off the "skullet" look.  Do take him if you have the chance.

I hated this class.  I never missed a day of class, studied everyday, and took thorough notes.  I made a C in the class.  The tests are graded way too harshly.  The essays on the tests are left too open for interpretation, and the TA's doing the grading will not listen to reason. Do not take this class unless you have ample of time to devote to it.

Easy my butt.  I know you get bonus points for quizzes and attendance at the end of the semester.  But I took notes, memorized them, and did horrible on the tests.  If you compare what he says in lecture to what the book says, they will always contradict each other.
His class is really good; I never took notes but just bought the StudentNotes before tests and always did really well.  An easy A for sure!

History was never my subject, but this guy made me love it! I'd take 10 pages of notes by the end of class and not even know it because I thought I'd been listening to him tell stories the whole time. Lots of laughter; he's funny!
No Comments

Cobb's a very good teacher, and if you take good notes you can do well on the test.  There are also a lot of opportunities to get extra points.  I barely read the book, but from my test grades and extra credit, I only needed a 56 on the final to make an A in the class. best history teacher!!
he actually made history interesting!!  i loved going to class and my attendance helped me get a good grade!!  bottom line he is an amazing teacher!!

It's a boring class, but if you go to class and get credit for being there it will really help you in the end.  The written assignments are a breeze and add points to your tests.  I would def. take him again!
Dr. Cobb is a very good teacher. He is pretty funny and his tests are fair. I definitely recommend him.

This class turned out to be very easy, there were a few written assignments which were not hard at all, and if you pay attention in class and take notes or buy the student notes you will be good.he has an attendence policy but if u dont miss any classes you get like 12 points added to ur grade

I think Dr. Inscoe has retired now, but just in case he hasn't: He is a wonderful professor and person. I personally wouldn't take him again because I'm not a history major and don't like to read as much as he assigned, but he worked with me a lot throughout the semester and helped me with everything. He is so caring and cares a lot about history!

Inscoe is a fantastic professor. Really gets to know you and cares about your performance. There are not a ton of grades in this class but there is a good amount of reading. I am not a history major and still really enjoyed this class.
ratingTags_Rating: Respected--Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment_Rating: I took Dr. Inscoe's Antebellum South class last semester and it was great. Lectures were informative, interesting, and easy to follow. The midterm was hard, but he gives you extra credit if you do all three essays (only two required). He's very kind, and I'd like to take another one of his classes
ratingTags_Rating: Get ready to read--SO MANY PAPERS--Amazing lectures

comment_Rating: Mr. Inscoe is without a doubt one of the most knowlegable history professors at UGA. This class is mainly discussion and a good deal of reading.  Dont let the amount of reading push you away from this class.  Although he assigns 8-9 books, you rarely read the whole thing.  The readings are very interesting.  I recommend this class 100%!!!!

While it was only a freshman seminar, Dr. Inscoe was a very interesting and intriguing professor. While his grading may not have been the easiest, he is easily accessible and is quick to point out to his students what he desires from them and how to improve. I look forward to hopefully taking another class with him in the future. Excellent choice
Enjoyable.

Really nice guy and extremely interesting. He picked some really good (and some not so good) titles to work with this semester. This course was heavy on reading, but overall it was fairly easy and an enjoyable class.

Dr. Inscoe is absolutely incredible in and out of the classroom. He's a master at nurturing your curiosity and while he's a hard grader, he rewards hard work, even if it hard work does not yield high test or paper grades. Pay attention to the comments on his papers, they usually are the key to what he wants and are great tips to improving writing

I really like Dr. Inscoe. He gets distracted really easily in his lectures. This class involved so much reading (ten books and a packet), so it was hard not to be involved in his lectures if you kept up with the reading. He's a hard grader on papers, but overall a good teacher.

Dr. Inscoe is the best history professor ever!!! Relates history to his students through films, novels, readings, and captivating lectures. Dr. Inscoe is a true southern gentleman who led me to change my major to history. Test Format consisted of Multiple Choice, IDs, and Essay questions. Highly recommend this class to anyone regards of their major

i loved dr. inscoe. his use of autobiographies, biographies, movies, etc. showed his dedication to making students interested in the subject matter, and it worked! he's extremely knowledgeable, and also so nice and accessible. i highly recommend him. don't remember the class number, but it was southern history.

Best professor I've ever had and i'm a MARK/ENGL major. CAPTIVATING lectures, wonderful readings and films. Difficult tests, but you really feel like you've experienced something more than a class. Incredibly helpful outside of class and always available. I only wish I could take another class taught by him because anything he teaches is first rate

Probably the best in the department. Very smart and very demanding but also the nicest guy you will ever meet. Really cares about students and is always accesable. There is a reason why he is the most respected UGA History prof nationally.

cool class, the times were inconvienent but the disscusions were a lot of fun. Paper required for each film, pain in the neck but it is only a 1/2 semester course and you'll leave with two credits. worth taking, interesting subject, fun class

Dr. Inscoe is the best professor I have had at UGA. His knowledge is quite impressive and his class is very engaging (and entertaining), and his usage of non-academic materials (books, movies) keeps things interesting. The best thing about him, though, is his accessability - he is super nice and always accomodating.
he is GREAT and VERY VERY FUNNY.

Beautifully kind soul with serious Southern history chops. Not only did he give me plenty of material to chat with my elderly grandfather about, he reminded me that history majors can read novels too...and he was very accomodating with an Honors option. I took this years ago so don't remember the course number, but it was Georgia history.
EXCELLENT class! Its a whole lot of work and a whole lot of reading but its really interesting especially if you like southern history.

Dr. Inscoe is an awesome teacher, he is very enthusiastic and passionate about his history. Tests are pretty hard, but as long as you keep up with the readings, a B is easy to come by, but you have to put in the extra effort to get an A.

interesting lecturer, incorporates books and films well, but his tests are more like literature tests than history ones. multiple choice were very nitpicky and essays had obsure relations to facts. also i was never given a clear grade on my paper; my t.a. told me they had not set up a numerical equivalent to the letter grade (A-) that i received.

I also recommend Dr. Inscoe. As a history major, i found him more interesting than most, and he does do a great job at incorporating various learning materials. Be prepared to read alot, but as long as you do the work and go to class you will be fine. Also a very nice guy, and very smart. Pleasant voice, nice to listen to.

Dr. Inscoe's class is quite boring as he just lectures with little guides up on the board but the tests are not difficult at all. There is a lot of reading but as long as you do it it helps a lot. I'd recommend his class.

I didn't think it was too bad. But he tends to jump around a lot in his lectures, meaning he doesn't really go in chronological order. He also tends to get sidetracked which can be confusing. The tests weren't too bad to me, I got an A on both, earning an A in the class. Be prepared to spend a lot of time on this class. Keep up with the reading!
Very helpful teacher. Very enthusiastic about his lectures. Engagin class texts, like above, the tests are difficult, but the quizzes are easy as long as you go to class and read the assigned books.

A breath of fresh air after withdrawing from Larson's 2111 class last semester. Nice incorporation of books and films. 1 paper, quizzes on books, midterm, final (not cumulative). Hand gestures leave something to be desired but definitely recommended.
He's a good teacher, I like listening to him but be warned his tests are very difficult. The quizzes are pretty easy though as long as you read the novels he assigns.

very interesting readings and interesting lectures.  Dr. Inscoe is very engaging and seems to have a genuine concern for his students.   To the previous poster who was neutral, I would say that Dr. Inscoe is well worth taking, though I remain neutral regarding his personal appearance.
I've never had this professor; just listing him in hope that someone else will type something about him who's had him in the past.  My ratings are nuetral b/c I had to put something.
I hate English but somehow Steven made me like it. Highly recommend.

Dr. Florczyk is the best English professor I have ever had and perhaps the best instructor I have ever had. He is very supportive at every stage of the writing process and truly has helped me become a better writer. His wit, clarity, and intelligence place him above other professors. I highly recommend him to anyone.

Dr. Florczyk's class was awesome! He has a great sense of humor which makes the class more entertaining. There are 4 papers and a few pop quizes... If you put in the effort, then getting an A is possible. Definitely recommend this class!

He is very helpful and his class is very interesting. He is also hilarious. There barely any work outside of class, but he sometimes has reading pop quizzes. I would def recommend this teacher if you want a chill class

Class is pretty boring. I never did my readings, so I didn't participate a whole lot in class. Still, I did fine. You have a midterm, a final, and two papers. One paper is 2-3 pages and the second is about 5 pages long. 4 absences allowed.

Best English teacher ever. I had terrible english teachers in high school but had some good raw writing ability. If you show effort he will help you out a lot. Always approaches class with a sense of humor.

Take Florczyk. Funny guy, great teacher, intelligent, helpful and fair. 4 papers and a portfolio but it's not hard. He allows you to turn in 1 paper late without penalty. English attendance policy is strict at UGA but he's lenient. Don't BS him and he'll be cool. I showed up late a lot but did the work and he didn't bust my balls. I recommend.

Very interesting to listen to. I learned a lot in his class and it was pretty easy. He is extremely nice and is willing to help out a lot. The writing topics he gives in class are interesting. I recommend taking him.

Steve is the best professor I have ever had! I absolutely hate english/writing, but this class was really interesting. He is extremely helpful and a very fair grader. The course material is not bad at all and he doesn't assign ridiculous amounts of work. Plus he's extremely witty, funny and hot!

Steve is the best English teacher I have ever had! He's funny, smart, and SO HOT!! English is my worst subject, and I did really well in his class. Plus he picks good and interesting topics to write about and is a very fair grader. Basically, he should be the only one teaching English.

The class is very hard but if you show him that you are making an effort, he does "help" your grade a lot... i was getting a B- on every assignment and i got an A- in the class... BUT take the class at your own risk... always go to class (most important)
If you want an easy A, or an A at all, DO NOT take his class.... I worked so hard and got nowhere... this class messed up my 3.8 GPA... he grades papers so harshly
Steve is such a cool guy, really fun, great teacher.  Discussions were soo interesting.
Alright professor.  Class was very boring.  He was a cool guy though.  4 papers and a portfolio determined your grade.  Easy class to make a B in but hard class to make an A in.
Makes things interesting and understandable.
He made english at 8am bearable.  Awesome professor and very helpful when it comes to assignments.  Go to office hours to discuss essays and possible areas of improvement.  Highly recommended.
Great teacher.  Knows what he is talking about and grades very fairly.  Highly recommended.
he's the leader of my discussion group for engl 3000.  he really explains everything much better than dr. parks.

Steve is a really cool guy. He grades fair and has a good grading system set up for his papers. He is willing to help you if you approach him. Funny guy :) I definitely recommend him to anyone who has to take English
Steve is the best english teacher at UGA
steve is awesome!
Steve is muy hot!  And he is a great professor!
he is consistent on his grading! he's funny, laid back, and a good professor.. steve is the best ;D
Steve is a bad ass.
Very nice person and helpful in class and very approachable

Hardest teacher at UGA. She is very monotone and hard to follow. The tests are VERY specific and require and insane amount of memorization. I almost dropped out mid-semester, but needed the class, so I had to buckle down and study for days straight. Do not take if you can avoid!!

i love art history, i can barely hear her. she's boring. monotone. i cant tell whats important and what's not. this class is horrible. it seems like she doesnt even have much interest in it at all. i wouldnt recommend this class at all.

I was quite scared after reading all of these comments, but she's not so bad. Her tests are very straight-forward, just be sure to write down EVERYTHING she says because she is very nit-picky with her grading. Also sit near the front, she's kind of hard to hear She is very knowledgeable on the subject and I found the class interesting.

No wonder her name is a homonym for Pain. This class was literally painful to sit through. Completely monotone, faces the screen, not the class, you can barely hear what she says, NO questions, NO discussions, NOT helpful. She's terrible! avoid her at ALL cost. I love the subject and still couldn't stand this class.

terrible teacher. boring, monotone. doesn't appear to care about her students or if they are comprehending the material. i love art history and all the subject we learned, but she made me not enjoy the class. if you get her, switch out as fast as you can. other than that, she's not too hard, you don't really use the book

This class is so boring. The content of the class is amazing, potentially very interesting art works BUT Dr Payne is an awful lecturer. She speaks very low and is frustrated when someone asks a question. There's a book, I didn't buy it, and didn't have any major problems on tests. If you like art, and want to continue too, take another professor.

This was by far the worst class I have had at UGA. Her lectures are boring and it seems like she actually tries to embarrass people who ask questions. She definitely lives up to her horrible reputation. Her testing format is not that hard, but the amount of information she expects you to know is impossible. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS.

do not take this professor!!!! she is extremely boring and unenthusiastic. she is rude and rolls her eyes at questions. her tests are impossible because she makes you know an impossible amount of things. she talks slow and soft and does not care to help anyone. i repeat DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS!

This professor is extremely dry and boring. Her lectures are very difficult to pay attention to (which is unfortunate because the information covered could potentially be very interesting). Her tests are generally pretty tough as well. I would highly discourage anyone from taking her class.

by far the worst professor i have every had in my entire life. Her class is extrememly boring and dry. She talks over you and is not concerned at all with you actually learning the material. You might as well take Italian first before you take this class. She is also not willing to work with you on ANYTHING. Dont take this class.
If you can avoid taking this class, DO! I've had four other art history classes and they were all wonderful, but this one was terrible and she is no help at all!

The worst thing is that you have to know the full name of just about all of the artists, and long italian names are not my strong suit... Other than that, just type everything she says, study it, and learn the info on the lists. not a great personality but other than that it's not terribly hard, just a ton of memorization like any other art history

She has a really nasty disposition. I really hated going to her class. She is not very fair and tries her hardest to embarass people if they are late or their phone rings. You have to try and learb her methods of teaching if you want to do well. She is also not very helpful at all.

By far the worst teacher I've had at UGA. She's incredibly boring, rude, unhelpful, and condescending. I would NOT recommend this teacher to anyone unless they are masochists. Also, she stutters and forgets what she is saying midsentence. She does not deserve a job as a professor because she's a horrible teacher.

Absolutley The Most Boring Class I have ever taken, and I can tolerate a lot. Had to do other work in class just to stay awake.  Was late ONE time and got ****ed at like I was late everyday. This is the only class I have ever withdrawed from - she is the worst teacher Ive had at UGA.

struggled in her class but @ the end i figured out how 2 study. shes actually easy compared 2 other ARHI teachers but def not the nicest one. make sure u know all the images on her syllabus. helps 2 memorize w/ a chart that has da author, pix, etc. Go to all her lectures, TAKE GOOD NOTES & read. be VERY specific. takes off pts for being 2 general
SHE IS AWFUL!!
Absolutely Awful!!! She simply can not get her words out and when she does makes no sense whatsoever. I would recommend ANYONE besides her if possible!

I will agree with everyone-Payne IS extremely boring.  and repetitive.  but she is soo easy! She gives you alot of days to miss, (6) which is nice, and I've suffered through 3 classes she's taught, just because I know I will make an A.  I've never even bought the text, just listen and memorize the artworks on WebCt.

Interesting subject with absolutely boring teacher. Reading the book is not required to do well on the tests. All of the out of class assignments are easy 100s. She's a pretty boring and scatter-brained, so be ready for that.
UGH!  Worst class I have ever taken!!  She is completely unclear and refuses to help you out in ANY way.  I suggest taking this class taught by ANYONE else.
She does not stay on track; and talks like the dry eyes man.  Careful not to fall asleep in this class!!

class was not that challenging, as long as you pay attention. i dont do any of the readings and i still make A's on the tests. just take detailed notes. unfortunately, prof. payne has a stuttering problem.

I agree with "Lectures were a cruel form of torture. She is really nice and easy to deal with but boring like you've never experienced before. Tests are really detailed and nerve-wracking." I could barely stay awake and she seemed pretty spacy on anything remotely unrelated to the lecture at hand.
Interesting class made dull with tedious lectures. Hard class to stay awake in despite the subject matter. Awfully nitpicky tests!
Lectures were a cruel form of torture. She is really nice and easy to deal with but boring like you've never experienced before. Tests are really detailed and nerve-wracking.

I'll have to agree, boring (not energetic at all!). The material is so interesting, I expected more. Come to class and take notes and you will pass. Tests are somewhat nit-picky, so pay attention to details she emphasizes.

She was extremely disorganized and repeated the same things over and over again. The reading was boring and so were the lectures but all that said I learned a lot. Her test have a lot of nit picky questions so watch out for that and take detailed notes if you can stay awake that is :)

Excellent teacher, however the material is very extensive. It is a lot to remember and you must know specific dates and time periods. I left the class with a lot of things I didn't know before and a much higher level of interest in Art.

typical day: walk in, sit in lecture hall, start taking notes the second class starts, take notes until a minute after class is supposed to end. Every day. 3 tests are made of having to identify slides of artwork and then writing an essay. Lots of work & study, but interesting info. BORING Teacher:(
For this to be a class about "free time" I had the most work in this class. She grades like she is anenish professor and shes not. Just act like you are interested.. Avoid her if possible.
Definitely not a leisurely class to take. Must outline the entire book for homework grades, write a lot of essays, and attendance is mandatory. You will have to work in this class. NOT AN EASY A.
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments

Best part about this class is that an 80 or above is counted as an A in the class. He also gives an extra credit assignment that is relatively easy to do! Also have to do a research paper at the end of the semester which wasn't too bad. Take good notes in his class (doesn't post lectures) because the tests are pretty specific!

Has a 10 point curve on his final grades (so a 65 is an 75 in Athena, and so on). That is one this I appreciated. Very lecture heavy. Always says tests are easy but are incredibly detailed. Project assignment is vague, and he grades harshly. Very difficult for an introductory class. I was thankful to scrape by with a B.
ratingTags_Rating: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment_Rating: Horribly rude and arrogant man. Goes through material way too fast and in way too much detail for an intro-level non-major class. You need to have memorized every single detail of lecture to have any hope of passing the tests, which are formatted horrendously. Avoid at all costs.
ratingTags_Rating: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment_Rating: Dr. Brook was a very interesting and engaging teacher, even though he teaches an incredibly boring subject. I genuinely enjoyed the class, though, and if you work hard studying and DO THE EXTRA CREDIT you shouldn't have a problem getting at least a B.

This class is easy to forget about because the only HW you ever have is a paper thats 20%.  Make sure to start it in advance so you can go in and get him to help improve it. AND DO THE EXTRA CREDIT. Those two things were the only reason I ended up with a B the class.  Never got above a 60 on a test even after studying and never missing a class.
Much harder than expected for an intro level class. Tests were very challenging, even after taking notes and attending every class. Memorization is key. wouldn't reccommend

Huge curve where an 80 is an A, but don't be fooled. Tests are very specific and difficult, even if take notes and study. Lectures are long, and you must attend class to take notes. Random attendance is taken, which can help your grade. Extra credit news journal due at the end of the semester helps also. Would not recommend this professor.

HE IS SO AWFUL. He literally pre-curves his class.. which you would think is a great thing but it's for a reason. A 70-79 is a B, a 80+ is an A... but it's because the tests are RIDICULOUSLY hard. For an introduction class, he makes it hell. It's meant to be intro level but if you don't write down every word that comes from his mouth ur screwed.

DO NOT take introduction to landforms with him. He is an awful professor. I'm a finance major so i took it to satisfy a science credit... for an introductory class, the tests were ridiculously difficult. When asked about grades he gave on term papers, he didn't care to listen to the student... he just wanted to be right.

Brooks knows what he's talking about, and can explain it to you. If that's all you need then you'll get an B automatically. You're going to be happy that 80s are As when you get a 75 on the first quiz. Definitely the hardest non major class that I took. You won't fail, but if you want an easy A, take Stan.

Do not take this professor if you love yourself. An 80 is an A, so you probably won't fail, but you will hate every second you sit in this class. He loves to watch you suffer and will basically grade your essays like you're a fourth year geography major. Material could be at least somewhat interesting, but he makes it as boring as possible.

The lectures seem very straight forward but ridiculously hard testing. The paper was long and didn't have much instruction. Do not let the grading scale fool you. An A starts at 80, you still need to work for it! He has to change the scale because his grading is so difficult. Attendance checked randomly for bonus but highly recommended!

Best advice you can ever receive: Buy the student notes from Baxter Street Bookstore. If you want, take notes yourself from lecture as well. Go to class for attendance checks that give you 5 points. An 80 is an A-, NOT an A, so don't get it confused. Don't buy textbook; questions do NOT come from it. Take this class

Brooks is overall a pretty good teacher. The lectures do get quite boring but he has an 80+ as an A. He also gives random attendance checks and for everyone that you are present for, you get a point on your final grade. Really easy to get an A. Tests are a little tricky, but manageable.
Probably the best teacher I have ever had. He is very funny. The class was very easy, but the tests were a little tricky.

I thought I was gonna get an A easy b/c of the whole 80-100 is an A thing, but you really have to know the stuff to do well on the tests. his tests are very specific with dates and depths and such. and he gives out a writing assignment, which I thought he graded pretty tough. very funny guy though, although a lot of material is not. go to class.
Cool class, learn bunch of interesting stuff but not really useful unless you are geography major.

The man wore a swimsuit and a Hawiian shirt with a blob of sunscreen on his nose in the middle of winter when he discussed sand and beaches, truly funny.  The class is very easy if you either read or attend class.
No Comments
Must go to class because tests are all about notes. 80-100=A...so that was a plus!

Ms. Martin is a pretty good professor. Go to class for notes and pop assignments. She tests you over her notes only, so don't buy the book. There are 3 exams (including final non-cumulative), various assignments and quizzes, and 1 semester project. She gives study guides along with the tests which are really helpful. Overall a good professor.

I am enjoying this class very much! She is just the kind of art enthusiast I was hoping for when I signed up for an appreciation course. About the only complaint I have is that she is quite biased when it comes to material covered. Her favorite artists are obviously more emphasized, but overall it's a good course if you're at all interested.
A is attainable... You gotta put forth an effort, but doable... Lectures are interesting and enjoyable! Take her!

Ms. Martin is not bad at all. Her tests come straight from lecture, so go to class and take notes, because she takes attendance. Don't talk in class or leave early and you should have no problems with her. We watched a couple of videos, and we had 3 tests & 1 project. I completely procrastinated studying, and I still got an A-. Take her.

Class is pretty easy, especially if you attend EACH class. Shes a stickler for things like leaving before class "officially" ends. Shes really helpful if you utilize the office hours. Attendance is a must if you want to gain a large chunk of your overall points.

Class was more difficult than I expected. Attendance is mandatory in a really big class. Grading seems unfair sometimes especially in in class activities. However if you ask for help and do the extra credit opportunies you'll be fine.

Study guides are helpful, but instructor is very passive-aggressive. Lecture is conducted as if it were a middle school classroom. No talking and mandatory attendance in a class of 300+. Exams questions sometimes come out of nowhere. Take another instructor if possible. If not, it's not the end of the world.

She is a helpful teacher as long as you make it known that help is needed.  plus, it won't be a difficult class unless you make it difficult on yourself(personal experience). Overall, it is decent class.

she was not really friendly and kicked people out of class for talking. i felt like i was in middle school. her test ask you to recall alot of detail from her lectures. i would recomend finding a different teacher for this class

As long as you go to class it's extremely EASY.  She takes attendance everyday and there are random quizzes that usually cannot be made up.  The tests come directly from the study guides.  Lecture is only boring if you have absolutely no interest in Art History.

Go to class. Get A or B. Her study guides are not tricky -- they will prepare you well. She has no tolerance for rude chatty students during her lecture -- thank god because their whispering is 10x more annoying than her lectures. Well prepared instructor too.

Avoid her if possible. Wasted money on a textbook, only used it the first 2 weeks. Tested ONLY over lectures. Takes attendance EVERY DAY in a class of 130! Has random outbursts of bad temper. Test questions are often tricky and somewhat obscure. However, she does make great study guides for tests, and the class isn't terrible, it's just her moods.

Considerably easy if you pay attention to lecture.  She is moody and really looks forward to class participation.  But if you do well on the tests, she is less moody.  Tells you what works of art she's gonna test you over and her tests are a lot of IDs and multiple choice.  Gives study guides for tests, which is helpful.  One of my easier classes.

Ms. Martin was very entertaining.  She always tries her best to be entertaining.  When I took the class, she did not issue a textbook so attending lectures is a MUST.  DONT MISS CLASS or you will not get an A.  As long as you go to class you'll enjoy her teaching style.  A+ Professor!!
Do not take this class.
She was moody and more interested in listening to herself speak than anything else. I really like art and art history, but this class was awful. If you take Art Appreciation don't take her class!
No Comments
The class was mildly difficult, but the material was interesting.  Ms. Martin expects great things from her students.  Attending lecture is very important if you want to do well on the test.
No Comments
If you lack the ability for abstract thought, like myself, do not take Ms. Martin.  I thought her test were ridiculously hard.  She is a very nice lady and I actually enjoyed her lectures.
She is energetic and fun, but is difficult. Must attend class!!!! She is challenging, but doing well is attainable if you try.

Hard class, hard tests, boring, very long lectures. Lost my interest in art by the time class was over. Lots of dates to memorize, teacher was somewhat helpful. She has high standards, she demands a lot.
Class is very easy! But the tests are very specific. You have to know people's exact names and how to spell them or very specific dates etc.

She did not show up for three weeks and I still got an A...The tests were not hard at all and she is such a funny teacher you will like her...definitely take her if you want an A and someone that is enjoyable to listen to.

She's amazing. We had a three-week period of no class, (she just didn't show) no penalties to us. Her lectures are very interesting. She also pretty much highlights, and stars the stuff that's on the test. Her tests are super easy if you study. I love all the inferences (read: side jokes) that she brings in.
Totally hot and a great instructor. Cares about her students, and a cool person outside of class.

If I was a lesbian, I would be in love with this lady. I took this course in May, and she dropped 2 books from the reading to make it easier. It may be a lot of "reading" but you can probably Sparknote the common stories (ie: the Odyssey and the Aeneid). She tells you what quotes to know for the quizes and the weekly journals are 1pg double-spaced.

This class stressed me out, but only because I wanted to prove myself.  Be prepared for class, study your translations before the test, and don't be afraid to ask questions.  She'll help you out as long as she knows you've tried.

The best college professor I've ever had, period. I did not want to take this class--my interest in the subject was nonexistant. However, the class was made much easier by the fact that Ms. Harris obviously took a personal interest her students' progress, and would do anything to help them. Not an "easy" class, but she made it very bearable.
she was awesome. very funny and great teacher. she makes the texts come alive and her tests were easy if you listened in class and read.
she is one of the dearest teachers...she actually cares about her students! great class, highly recommended.
easy and fun, cant beat it
Awesome, decent amount of reading but very cool, and very interesting....Just take good notes in class and will be fine.
She is one of the best teachers around. Very funny and makes the books come alive. I will take anything she teaches. Sign me up!!
Best teacher I've had.  She made the class fun and interesting, and she was always willing to help out students.  Highly recommend her to anyone.
Fantastic teacher!  The best I've had here at UGA so far.  She is sooo sweet and very helpful, even though the subject was not my forte.
Harris was extremely excited about the subject and she really tried to make the class fun and thought-provoking.
Norma was very helpful. She knew how to explain things and her teaching was beautiful. Take her class.
Her class was fair and easy.  I learned alot and she tries to help when possible.  Take her class.

She doesn't know how to teach. If i hadn't already had a good spanish education in high school I would have been completely lost. The actual class is do-able if you have previous knowledge b/c the tests are standard throughout the department.
Montalvan seemed as if she was willing to help, but communication with her was very difficult and she sometimes seemed to be impatient with too many inquiries.

great teacher, but not an easy grader.  you have to work in this class...she is great about taking time to look over your papers before turning the final draft in, and she helps her students as much as possible.  i liked her a lot, only frustration was that i wish she wouldn't grade quite so tough on papers.
She was a tough grader, but it will definately improve your writing skills. Facillitated discussion very well. Not many assignments, and not too nit-picky.

Definitely a solid teacher. She was always willing to critique your papers before you turned them in. 5 essays + final. Gives great feedback so you can improve on your next paper. Extremely approachable.

I don't like english at all and she made this class kind of interesting and not very difficult. She is really nice, definately get her if you can. It's not an easy course, but if you don't like english much you'll definately like her. She is very helpful!

Took his Freshco Literacies in the Humanities. It was all about 1 project and journals that we had to write. The class was all about what you put into it and he definitely helps give feedback to help you organize your topic and everything.

Highly recommend taking this class!! He just wants to see that you work hard and put in effort and u will get an A! As long as you turn in a decent portfolio that you are proud of, I wouldn't worry too much! Simrill himself is awesome and tells a lot of cool stories. 10/10 would recommend - plus you aren't spending your time reading useless stuff.

The entire class revolved around making a huge family history portfolio. Let me just say this, if you're not passionate about learning and writing about your ancestors or your family story don't take the class. But if you are, then this class should be fun and interesting for you. My annotated bibliography itself had over 8000 words.. So be warned.

The entire class was a family history portfolio that was enjoyable to learn and write about. The entire grade of the class is based on this portfolio os multiple essays and interviews. Overall, the project is spread out over entire semester, so not too much work at one time. I love Dr. Simrill, he is genuinely interested in all his students.

I liked his lectures, our section was comedy so we just watched youtube videos of comedians or skits. However, he is not really clear what his rubric is and isn't the easiest to please in terms of grades. He's funny and a good guy just not the greatest teacher. Still salty about my portfolio haha
ratingTags_Rating: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment_Rating: This course is very easy to do well in. As long as you plan ahead in making your documentary and don't put it off until the last minute, this course should be smooth sailing. Simrill is also obsessed with a YouTuber named Casey Neistat, and he will bring him up every class period.

He is an extremely subjective grader. He would be a great teacher if he was better with feedback and exact for what he wants, you could get 5 points taken off for something but the person next to you could get 15 points off. He gives very little information about what exactly he wants and what you can do to fix it. He is a great person though.
The class is fun and interesting. He doesn't give much feedback or reasoning on why you got the grade you received but he wants all students to succeed.

He wasn't available outside of class and required very specific aspects in our writing. Very rude to students and waste of my time. I feel that he was a subjective grader, but of the rest of English department, take him. He is a great professor, but we just wasted a lot of time on videos and crazy articles. Also, we didn't receive instructions.

He was such a good teacher!!! Very funny. The only thing that was hard for me was that the theme of our class was "Comedy" so writing the essays i struggled at first, but i got much better. He really wants to help you improve so gives really good feedback. We watched a lot of comedian videos so i really did learn a lot about comedy. Take his class!
If you like funny teachers that aren't afraid to curse, this is your guy. He's really laid back but cares about you and your grade.

I can't describe Spenser in 350 characters because this dude is the weirdest, most fun, and most unpredictable guy ever. He makes the class about you and wants you to like what you're writing about. It's a lot of work , but it's so that he can teach it the way he wants, not UGA-style. Genuine guy and super chill--definitely not one to forget.

Professor Simrill's class was one of the best classes I have ever taken. I promise you won't regret your decision. He's not afraid of encouraging you to dig deeper and to show yourself through your work, no matter who you are or what your personality is like, which allows you and everyone else around you to reach your highest levels of creativity.

Simrill is an awesome professor who is very laid back and if you do the work, you will get an A in his class. There is no structure in his class which is pretty cool and it allows you to get creative. He teaches the same class for 1101 and 1102 which is neat.

Simrill is a great professor, and I highly recommend you take his ENG 1101/1102 class. Hes an extremely laid back, and nice guy who challenges his students to think outside of the box. It is not an easy class to do well in, but defiantly feasible if you work hard. I highly recommend you attend all of the lectures and bring a laptop.

Honestly, Spenser Simrill is an awesome guy. I always enjoyed his class because of how funny he was and how he made each day exciting. I have never enjoyed English much, but this class helped me appreciate writing. The class structure is a little disorganized and it is hard to understand his grading expectations. Just do good on final portfolio.

Seriously if you have the chance to take one of his classes, do it. I have never met a teacher as wonderfully brilliant as Professor Simrill. He cares about his students and does his best to make his class fun. Everything he does is to help make you a better writer, and I promise you, you will thoroughly enjoy his class.

Really great guy, he's interesting and really wants you to learn and succeed. But he totally lacks structure. When asked about the length of a project, he replied "Goldilocks--not too long, not too short." He loves wikipedia, and really does want his students to do well and enjoy their work. We used The New Yorker as our "textbook"

Simrill is amazing. You will leave having learned better writing skills, but more importantly, how to be more creative and think different than everyone expects. His class was inspiring, non-traditional, and interactive. Simrill has an amazing way of relating to each student and giving phenomenal feedback that made me want to keep writing.

Excellent Professor! He will challenge your mind to think outside the box. You mostly analyze Quentin Tarantino movies. His expectations are high, so you need to work for an A. There are three essays and one portfolio. Do really well on the Portfolio and you're golden. He deviates from the topic frequently but ties it all together in the end.

The class was focused on Quentin Tarantino movies. If you are looking for a non-traditional English class I would recommend. We usually watched movies during class and analyzed different scenes. He is a tough grader and at times very vague about what he wants. I did not do too well on the essays but did well on the portfolio and received an A-.

Simrill is an awesome teacher. He does everything outside the box, so if you have to have a conventional classroom this is not for you. We did our entire class on an ancestral project. It was a lot of fun, and I learned a lot about my family and made an A at the same time.

Spencer is a great professor. Curious at times, he may tend to drift to different topics during a lecture, but I found this train of thought to be very interesting. The class is easy, as he will always lend a hand or proof read a paper for you. Sometimes, deadlines and required work was unclear, but this was usually due to him pushing dates back.

Dr. Simrill is an amazing guy! Our semester focused on Tarantino films and we got to analyze many of his movies. He is picky about the way you write your essays, but if you adjust to his style, you will be fine. We spent most of the semester watching movies in class and analyzing scenes. It's really interesting and I suggest you take him.

He seemed to pick favorites and seemed wholly uninterested in my work, even though I put a lot of thought into my writing. The whole class was based on family history, which was an awesome topic and I really loved that. Pretty nice guy, extremely laid back. Lacked structure. The class was always confused about what we were supposed to be doing.

Spenser is a great guy and offers a unique English class. No textbook/memorization like high school. You'll find yourself writing essays you care about rather than checking some box. He's a little laid back and worried more about your personal growth as a writer. You'll look forward to going to his class.

If you have the chance to take Simrill, DO IT!!! He is the best professor I've had this semester! He is so helpful and his class is always entertaining. I was genuinely upset on the last day of his class. Not only does he want you to succeed in his class, he wants you to genuinely get something out of it. I always looked forward to going to class!

This was such an easy class. The whole class was centered around finding out your ancestry and writing your portfolio on your family history so it is super interesting! I wrote the essays the night before and got As, he was an easy grader. Show up to class because he notices and called out frequently absent people. By far easiest professor for 1103
Downsides: Non-specific and a bit baffling Upsides: You will learn and lot and it will be incredible. Definitely take him given the option.

Simrill was really fun overall but the course was so sporadic.  We would watch videos all the time and then suddenly he would talk about the next paper that was due.  You'll miss a lot if you don't go to class everyday.  But he's a nice guy who's really interesting and has a big heart I loved the class overall

He's a great guy social wise, but sorta lacks as a professor because of his disorganization and randomness. He constantly changes the syllabus and even dropped one entire paper because we ran out of time. He is very laidback and flexible, which is a good thing. His class structure will freak you out if you're used to a typical, rigid English class.

Simrill kind of makes the class up as he goes and is very laid back. He's pretty quirky and funny, and he helps you if you ask him. He really wants you to develop as a writer and to produce good material. I got an A but I also put a lot of work into the class, but probably would have been fine if I had done less.

Simrill is a "chill" professor. If you're looking for a well-structured class, this isn't it. He doesn't have a set plan, but he is very flexible. He experiments new ways to publishing our essays. Made a B on my first paper & A- on my last 2. Easy to talk to, but make sure to go to his office hours when he has them. Overall good class!

I loved Simrill's class. He's really funny & outgoing so that made class really enjoyable. You'll definitely love his class if you love literature & reading. The reading isn't that bad, you honestly don't have to read all the books. I would definitely take his class again. I learned a lot without taking tedious testsquizzes & I'm a better writer.

Spenser is great. He can give great criticism and assistance if you ask for it. He also has a great sense of humor. He's relatable and interesting even though his class isn't exactly the easiest. He messed up the syllabus and half way through the semester he added a final exam. He cut an entire paper out because we ran out of time. I still dig him.
Not a very conventional guy and if you need a lot of structure he won't provide it, but a great guy to take if you're an English major. Plus he's very handsome

He's an amazing teacher!! I absolutely hate English, but he made me want to major in journalism. Definitely on of the best teachers I've had here and I haven't had a bad one yet! He can be a bit confusing but he's super nice and helpful. He super chill and awesome!!! Take his class, you won't regret it!!

Dr. Simrill is by far the best professor I had this year and because of him, this was my favorite course. He is unorthodox and his class is structured differently, but he pushes you to create pieces that you are proud of. I grew in his class and truly came out of it proud of my portfolio. I'd take him again in a heartbeat.

Simrill is one of the best and most interesting professors here. I always wanted to come to his class, because he was so intriguing. Like other people, I agree that he didn't always tell us what was going on. But his class was way different from other English classes at this school, and I'm very glad I took his class. He helps you grow as a person.

BEST ENGL 1102 PROFESSOR. Take him instead of anyone else. If you just make good content and actually think about what you're writing, you'll get an A. If you're horrible at writing, don't take him. No textbook needed. Attendance is REALLY helpful but not required.

If you like knowing what you're supposed to do and what's expected of you, do NOT take his class.  If you enjoy not having a clue what's going on, take it.  He's lots of fun and very nice, but I never knew what exactly was being graded or how or why or what I could do to get an A.

Simrill is by far the best English teacher I've ever had! With that being said, I'd recommend him to anyone! There's not a lot of busy work involved in his class but he does assign various reading assignments (nothing too boring though). When it comes to papers, READ YOUR SYLLABUS because Simrill doesn't really explain what's expected of you.

I took a video documentary class with Spenser a couple years ago.  He was integral in bridging the gap between pursuing a degree and following ones passion.  He is a fascinating individual with the PIZZAAM PIZZAZZZ and PIZZOOWWW a teacher out to have. Thanks Dr. Spenserius

Simrill is a pretty cool guy. Class was very laid back and thought provoking. That being said, he never told us what we were supposed to do. This teaching style may work for some people but I was completely lost. I asked and never received a clear answer. My grade came from a final portfolio I never received feedback on. Would not recommend.

Just to preface, I have absolutely hated English classes up to this point. Going into class the first day, I was worried about the class. However, I immediately realized how awesome and great of a teacher Simrill is. He is untraditional, funny, passionate about the subject, and really wants your creativity to flow. Best English teacher at UGA.

He is a great passionate teacher. You do nothing in class but watch youtube videos all day. You also never had work. The only bad thing about him is that if you are not a very creative writer his board topics are hard to handle. He never really explains what he wants so if you are used to a structured english class he will be very hard for you
awesome professor! Easy 1 credit hour class! Spenser def has a passion for teaching. Take him! He's cute too!

Overall easy class. He isn't really clear at what to do at first, but the class basically comes down to readings and essays. The readings aren't that hard, and they're pretty much all online. You always discuss what you read in class too, so you can usually get away without reading one every so often. Essays have easy, broad topics. Great class.
This professor is the best professor at UGA. hands down. He is completley interested in what he does. I was actually excited to go to class. Highly reccomended. Extremeley smart man.

At first i was frustrated because we didn't do anything. He never was really clear on things he talked about and was kinda in his own little world. But he tried to make things interesting and was able to help out as much as he could. Meeting outside of class was helpful on papers and clarification. Never used the textbooks. Good teacher. Recommende

Wow! This guy blew my mind. I got frustrated at first because I kept getting Bs on papers, but if you do great on the portfolio, there's a good chance you can get an A like I did. He's not the fastest grader, so don't expect your papers back anytime soon, but if you meet with him, he'll grade it and help you out with it. Highly recommended!!

Not only is he one of the most interesting men that I've ever met, but he's hot too. One on one meetings with Spenser are extremely helpful and class is super fun! All we did was watch youtube videos (pertaining to class,) analyze comedians, and read graphic novels. Loved this class, loved Spenser, and would definitely recommend!

Had him for English 1102M. Awesome teacher. Easily my favorite teacher thus far. Expects good papers. Class discussions are interesting. I definitely became much better at breaking down and analyzing literature. Skills I've learned in his class have helped me immensely in several of my classes since. Would definitely take him again.
I really think he's the best teacher at UGA. Period.

This guy makes class interesting. All the classes are discussions. And now and then you'll read a short story together and discuss as you go. Take him if you want to focus less on grammar and guidelines and more on increasing your love for the art of writing. Plus he's very lenient with grading and topic selection.

Prof Simrill is the man.  I hate english and made a C on the first paper.  Then I found out he likes creative and branching writing and ended up with an B+.  He makes class interesting because he knows about a million random facts about anything.  He really nice and easy to talk to. TAKE HIM

I really enjoyed his class! He was a very thought provoking teacher.  I love to write and english has always been my strongest subject, but in this class, i made a 91 on every paper and finished with an A.  I don't think he gave above a 94 on anything all year.  I would recommend him only if you are a strong writer.

Awesome guy, easy to get along with and very interesting to talk to.  I've always hated english, but he talks about some really interesting things during class and lets you write about almost anything that you can relate to the topic we're discussing.  Requires decent effort to get an A, but very easy to get a B even if you aren't the best writer.

GREAT TEACHER! Esp. if you like to write! He gets you inspired. You will find that your friends in 1102 are doing way different, boring stuff. We watched Borat once and analyzed it.. it was pretty cool.

The man. He expects good writing and only mildly corrects your mistakes, but everything he says is great feedback. He's a little unclear about the papers you write, but his style of teaching is to make you more creative, which does happen. Classes are interesting. He knows a lot of cool stuff. and the suits are sweet. don't hate

Wow, this is one very...unique...guy. I think the 70s shot him to 2000 a while back, yet he's still modern at the same time. Something I think only he can pull off. Class periods aren't just boring lecture, but discussion and debate. If you can write, I think you'll be ok. The only problem I have with him is grading. Not very timely at all!
AWESOME!!! Portfolio saved my grade and he was helpful with the papers we had to write and was very lenient on what you wrote about.

The class itself and the books we read were really interesting. The papers were pretty open to allow for free thought, which was nice. However, if you don't take the paper in the direction he would've, your grade will suffer.

Simrill is one of the best Professors I have ever had. His teaching style in class is relaxed and interesting. As far as grading, he does grades papers with the expectation of them being original and really good. If you have trouble with ideas, see him during his office hours--he's really cool and helpful.  If you can write, then can earn an A :)
No Comments

Simrill might be a little out of it, but he's a good teacher and very interesting.  There are a few pop reading quizes, but they were pretty easy.  He does expect good papers, but this is college, get over it.  It's an easy A if you try.

He's okay. The class was interesting, but he likes to tie science and anthropology into interpretations of the material and doesn't always get his facts correct. Him and I also didn't always see eye to eye in our opinions. However, I still got an A in the class so if you really make an effort in your papers, he'll acknowledge it when grading.

Mixed feelings about Spenser.  The biggest problem with this class is that he is NOT clear about what he expects... EVER.  My best written papers were my worst grades.  He pretty much gives everybody a B, unless you spend extra time researching side items and visiting him in office hours.  If you like babble, you found your teacher.

Simrill is a great guy.  He leads class discussions which keep you involved.  He's tough on grading papers but you don't have much work outside that and the readings.  If you're a good writer take this class.

Took 1102M. He is a great guy that leads the class in discussion about the readings as opposed to lecture. Also, the readings were all very interesting and not typical of your regular english class. Seems like a joke, but he expects good papers. Really great guy, but if you want an A you better be a good writer, or you better take a different class

Very fun class (1102M).  The books were actually interesting.  Spenser is quite entertaining and prefers to have discussions/debates instead of boring lectures, which is cool.  As long as you write decently and try, you will get no lower than a B on your papers, which are most of your grade.

This class has really interesting reading material. Spenser leads interesting conversations and made class fun to go to. I got an A in the class but it is true that you have to be a good writer- it is an Honors English class. Just choose topics for your papers that are interesting to you so they will be interesting to the reader.

Wow. First impressions can be deceiving.  I took this class thinking it would be an easy A but was pretty much proved wrong.  He's pretty laid back but expects GOOD papers.  I'd make sure I was an exceptional writer before taking this class.
Pretty much the coolest guy ever, just ask him. He leads the in-class discussions fairly well. He DOESN'T give C's. Overall, good teacher with unique ideas if you can get over his personality

I didn't think Spenser graded any of the papers fairly. Some of the worst papers I've seen got the A's while the obviously well written ones get the B's. This was supposed to be an easy A for me, but Spenser gave me a B in the end. He's still a great teacher, and probably infamous for his many suits he wears to class.
Spenser is so HOT and makes class fun to go to.  If you go to class everyday and write kick ass papers, you will get an A.  Take the class and enjoy.

Spencer is amusing if nothing else. The most important part of this class is your attendence and your essays. Read the assignments or fake it. For the essays, make connections to outside events, and research a lot. If you do that you'll probably make an A. He really likes nonfiction books. Don't procrastinate on the portfolio.
Very cool.  Very fun.  Very informative.

Please, Spense, tell us one more story that proves how cool you are! Did you really sleep for a while in various classrooms in the English building?  Did you really wear a pinstripe suit with a fly-collar shirt.  Oh, you're so crazy and hip!  Gag!  Vomit!  Hack!

Spense had better be hot after long hours, crafting the hot, tortured poet vibe. C'mon, Spense! You yammered on about sleeping in the English building, & you wear painfully "retro" clothes, making you look like a clown. Maybe focus on skills & talent, not image, to teach us to be poets is the trick?
Spenser is definitely quite the character.  C'mon girls, you all just went to class to stare at his butt.  Take his class- its not that hard and its fun to go to.

biggest cheeseball ever!!!!!  babbles about his own quirkiness, whch makes him, not quirky, but predictable. He's a caricature. Oh, please, Spense! Wear another retro-outfit! Can you grow your hair in an even more absurd 70's fashion?

Dr. Simrill is an awesome teacher! He's extremely intelligent, but he's also young so he keeps a sense of humor. The material itself is very interesting, and he leads great discussions. He expects good papers and basically leaves it up to you on what to write on only giving very general topics
She is very nice and clear in class. She mostly speaks Spanish, but she isn't difficult to understand during class time. Not a tough class.
Great teacher, willing to help as much as she can.  Understands you're in the class to learn spanish, not because you already speak it.  i made an A and am horrible with languages.

She's a great teacher, loved the class.  Nikki is nice and very understanding.  She really tries to help her students out and make good grades on the tests, even offers a study session before Finals.  Definitely a great spanish teacher and would recommend her to anyone!
No Comments

Patrick is basically the best professor ever. I have never had a more interesting or entertaining creative writing instructor in my life, and I wish he was at UTD for more than just one year. Anyone who gets to take a class with him should consider themselves very lucky.

Do well on your papers and you should make a good grade in the class. The portfolio wasnt too hard. The papers are graded hard, but you can make a good grade if you start early and go to him for help (he will tell you which direction to take your paper)
Fairly easy class, the main work are the 3 papers and the portfolio. He is a somewhat hard grader, but he will help you with every part of the writing process.

He is one of the best teachers I've ever had. He knows so much about everything, and he spends most of class sharing his knowledge. Seriously, take this course! You will be grateful you did. The only thing is you have to put in the effort if you expect to make the grade. But loved it!!!

Patrick (he likes to be called that) was the best English professor I?d ever had. His class is extremely interesting-- you?ll freak out sometimes from how much ludicrous amounts of information he knows. He grades fairly and gives you a ton of comments on papers to help you improve. I made a 86, 95, and a 99. A on portfolio. Helped me a lot.

Patrick is awesome and very laid back. His class was a lot of fun, I really enjoyed it. We had 3 papers. Your grade reflects the effort you put in. I'd recommend him to anyone who wants to have an interesting experience in class because it is hardly ever boring. :D

Great teacher. Funny. Laid back. Hard grader. See him during his office hours. E-mail him, he's very helpful. Knows what he is teaching. He almost knows too much that it freaks you out at first. He keeps his students interested and engaged in thinking about the history of the world and the present, future of the world.

Denker is a really cool guy and good teacher. He is very effective in teaching you to think critically and to organize your arguments in a sensible way. Also, he is always approachable and willing to help. Take him for 1101.

He is seriously one of the worst professors I've had. His classes make you think about killing yourself because he never shuts up. He is probably the most liberal man I've ever met, so if you're into that, then you'll like the class more than I did. He revises papers well, but I really didn't learn how to write better.

the book, history of knowledge, was not fun, but class was entertaining most of the time.  I came in thinking I would get a "b" and I got an "a".  I can write better papers after his constructive critcism.  take his class for 1101
I am in love with this man. Head over heels, baby. Take his class at all costs.
he is really funny. If you get the chance you should take his class whatever it may be.
He was fun and helpful and the material is different and fun to learn...he teaches it well
Exhilarating ... Hot Leather Pants ... And he bakes bad ass cookies for the class (I mean, seriously, how many teachers can you say that about?)!!!  TAKE HIS CLASS!
Great teacher. Not too hard and always made class interesting and fun. He's HOT too;)
hot ass...need i say more?
A steamy rebel without (or maybe with) a cause...an intellectual stud...UGA faculty's most eligible bachelor!
He's a sexy beast!! Oh yeah, he can teach too.
I'd have every class with Patrick if I could. WHAT A BABE. And fascinating. And smart. And just all around awesome.
he's really funny and interesting. the class was always fun to go to and he's really interested in what he teaches. definitely a great teacher.

He is a very interesting guy to say the least. Very passionate about climate change and sustainability which makes him interesting to listen to. Attendance is not mandatory but sometimes there are in-class exercises that are graded and cannot be made up. He posts the powerpoint online. One group presentation that's easy.
This man is a living legend. He is the nicest professor I have meet and doesn't have a bad bone in his body will help you if you do what you are suppose to

Dr. Dan is a great person that's slightly unorganized but that's not entirely his fault (if you take his class you'll know why). He's an easy grader and is vague on what he wants because honestly he grades your effort.
ratingTags_Rating: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment_Rating: Dr. Dan is a nice person, but that doesn't mean he's a good teacher. This is one of the worst class I've ever taken in Computer Science. It's relatively easy than other higher level cs classes, but it's just so unorganized nobody knows what they're doing unless they teach the concept themselves.

If I received $1 for every time this man mentioned "Academic Honesty", I would be rich enough to not need to finish my degree.
