He explains concepts by throwing you broken code and making students try to resolve errors without any previous knowledge on the topic. Office hours aren't helpful, you ultimately have no idea where you stand in the class

If you want to pay UGA to put a warm body in a room, call it a lecture, then go home and teach yourself 2010 web dev technology on YouTube take 4300 with Dr. Dan. This class was genuinely insulting to anyone that paid to take it. 0 support in office hours (kicks you out after 5 minutes, regardless of why you're there) trash slides, 2/10 Dont do it.

Dr. Dan is so sweet. He really cares about his students and really loves what he's teaching about. The class is at 8am but you don't have to go; you only have to make a comment in the discussion. There's also recitation once a week but as long as you follow the rubric and look up when you talk, you'll get a good grade. Overall an easy class.

Four individual projects and one group project. One 5-10 page paper, two exams, and then the final exam. The tests are vocab heavy which is probably the hardest part of the class. Start the projects the day that they're assigned and you'll be fine.
ratingTags_Rating: Clear grading criteria--GROUP PROJECTS--Tests are tough

comment_Rating: The lectures aren't mandatory, but online discussions for each class period are. You're only required to make one comment per class so it's not too bad. The recitation periods require participation but it's not hard and you only have to speak for 1-2 mins. Dr. Dan is so sweet too!

For 3030, he is probably the best there is. He honestly cares about the material and has no problem seeing you face to face for help or inquires. Study for the final, write a good paper, and go to the recitations and you will pass this class. Doing poorly in his class is entirely your own fault.

This class is so interesting and honestly it should be an easy A unless you're just beyond lazy. Dr. Dan is very helpful and is one of those professors who genuinely enjoys teaching and cares about his students. I wish I could take this class again. Choose a good breakout class time because you really have to go to every single one.

Dr. Dan is, without a doubt, the most student focused professor I've ever had. I've had him for two classes, and it's clear he really cares about his students and enjoys teaching,  he works hard to make lectures interesting and engaging. He's also very clear about expectations for tests--there really are no trick or gotcha questions.

Awesome professor! Had weekly presentations/papers- do them very easy part of your grade (takes 30 minutes or less). Go to class because slack comments are 15%, so participation is 50%, rest is tests.  Tests are vocab and short answer. Study vocab/info from slides and you should be fine for tests. He lays it out for you well- excellent teacher.
ratingTags_Rating: Gives good feedback--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment_Rating: This class was confusing. While we covered interesting topics in class, they didn't really relate to the test material or the homework.

Easiest class I've ever taken. Weekly participation grades in the form of a recitation/breakout session taught by a TA. Biweekly papers due, less than a page, very easy. Dr. Dan is very laid back as a teacher and wants you to get an A and enjoy the class more than anything else.

More of a philosophy course than a CS course -- I was so appreciative of the break from technicaltheory HW. Because it's a lecture course, participation (and therefore attendance) matters, but if you skip some days it doesn't matter much. He lets you know exactly what's on the test. Most importantly, the topics are SUPER INTERESTING. Great class!

He is a better as a person than a professor.  His exams were extremely difficult, half vocab and half coding.  There were many assignments that you either had to do alone or with a group.  He allowed you to redo assignments you did not do well on for a slightly better grade.  He will answer your questions with questions, which doesn't help.

Dr. Dan is nice but his lectures are unclear and unrelated to any course or test material-his tests are a random assemblage of stuff he finds interesting and the occasional high school definition of a graph If you mess up one project submission you're done, and he's not always available by email

Dr. Dan is awesome! One of my favorite CS professors at UGA. I took both 4300 and 4760 with him this semester and if I had the chance I would take more classes with him. The projects in networks started out super difficult but as the semester went on, it got much better. Also, if you prepare for his tests, you should do just fine.
Good Professor. The class is not easy, but he helps if you ask for help.He is fun, like people thinking outside the box. Highly recommended.
Dr. Dan is a pretty cool guy. I really liked his web programming class. Its really a bit of an intro class to web development. One of the most practical courses I've taken in CS.

Dr Dan is an extremely goofy professor that cares much more about the subject matter that is learned as opposed to the grades.  He is very helpful and will go out of his way to help if you put some effort in.
Dr.Dan is extremely helpful and pretty funny. Ask him what extreme programming! lol

If I had the choice to take this class again, I would NOT. The lecture notes do not match up well with what he teaches, and I attended every single class. The homework assignments are long and for the most part, pointless. I would recommend taking another MATH before taking this class; and the reason I took this was so I could avoid another math!
Dr. Dan seems to enjoy teaching. He lets out class early on most days. I learned mostly everything from the book and went to class for assignments. He assigned partners with every hw assignment.

This class was TERRIBLE. I have no idea why people are saying its easy.. weekly assignments that take 7+ hours to do. homework has NOTHING to do with lectures. he talks about anything but csci in class: ecology, epedimiology, you name it.. nice guy but TERRIBLE class!! take STAT instead for your quantinative reasoning!! be warned!

Excellent teacher. Anything you don't understand in class, he is willing to go over in office hours. Very quirky, fun teacher. If you're a comp sci major, his class should be no problem. Tests are easy, mostly reverse dictionary questions. I learned a lot!

Very funny guy. Posts everything online, but going to class really helps. Is very accessible and enthusiastic to help you individually. Does his best to help people who start to fall behind. Great class!

The lectures are all posted online as powerpoints, but he gives you some rewards for attending. Cool guy, easy (ish) class. Previous tests 1&2 are shown to help you study, as well as a lot of other materials on WebCT. It gets kind of confusing at the end when they touch on Java,CSS, and HTML.

I am not a CSCI major but I will say for those of you who are just taking this class because it seems interesting, beware. It starts out with excel and pwrpt. Then, you get into Javascript and coding websites. It was not an easy class, so just know that going into it. You can manage, but you HAVE to study.

I underestimated this class prior to taking it.It started out fun and the material is interesting, but took over my life. Must learn a bunch of languages on your own and then have a project due just about every Sunday. Dr Dan is a decently entertaining and enthusiastic professor, but this class is one of the most frustrating ones I've ever taken.

OK more CS majors need to to rate these CS professors. He is a great guy will help you a lot but his tests are meant to find out if you know the subject or not meaning they are hard. Had a  90 project average and still came out with a B because of the tests

I got an A on my first test and I still dont know what I have learned in that class.  The only usefull thing you learn in that class is Excel but then close to the end they get really hard and tedious.  A lot of the time they talk about how they feel about random subjects.  The class is not to hard.  The hardest thing is staying awake.

Took Dr. Dan's freshman seminar on Globalization. He makes it more of an open discussion than a lecture. Very interesting, very little work...definitely recommend for all. It's an issue that everyone should have a basic understanding of.
Hard class. Not many A's. Do any extra credit offered in labs. Study the terms in the back of the book.
Awful teacher! Hard tests and boring, boring class. Not helpful at all. He gave us electronic clickers to submit quiz questions in class, but the program hardly ever worked.

Class set up was horrible. Stupid clickers you hafta buy for your attendance and pop quizzes. That sucked. His lectures stink and are BORRRRRING! Ug, but stick with it (I did obviously) and you'll get the A. Lab quizzes, homework, pop quizzes, web page helps. Take advantage of those parts of your grade and you'll do fine. I did NOT like this class!

You got to give him credit. He's got the greatest heart and spirit, but he's definitely not the greatest teacher. If you can teach yourself lots of things, this class shouldnt be a problem. I struggled, but it wasnt a big deal. He's cool. text is used for homeworks only. attendance not mandatory, but clicker scores count as a big part of grade.

Well, the class *is* easy, you just have to do the work and remember a few facts. Its computer science but he taught nothing but ecology, with some compsci facts thrown in. Easy class, but not what I expected.

Everett is a pretty awful teacher. I'm someone who's always been into computers and thought this was an easy class to take. I managed to make an A- but he lacks clarity, forgets to mention important things, marks wrong questions as right..overall he could be much more organized. He's a funny, pleasant guy but teaching just isn't his thing.

I hate doing this beacuse my dad is a teacher at the university, but it has to be said. It seems like Dr. Everitt's lectures and his tests were from two different classes. I made a 62, 73, and an 80 on the Final. I only made a B b/c I didn't miss a lab. Word of advice: Don't assume this class is easy b/c your nerdy friend says it is.

Dr. Dan is a nice, jovial guy. Yes, lecture is boring, but hey, it's computers... do you really EXPECT it to be interesting? Tests are pretty hard but you can still get a B in the class even if you never make a B on a test, based on lab quizzes (which are very reasonable) and online homework. A reasonably fair and easy class with a nice prof.

Dr. Everitt is energetic and fun;he plays music at the beginning of class. But the lectures are boring,tests are hard, no study guide,and labs are so confusing.We and lab TAs would work forever trying to figure out what he was asking just to find out steps were missing.Your better off studying on your own rather than going to his "study sessions".

Everett is not a teacher that cares about his craft. I think he took the education route because he knew it'd be easy for him and he wouldnt have to work or take a sincere interest. With that said, he's pretty complacent and not worth your time. He's easy, but boring to listen to and you don't want to be bothered.

Dr. Dan is a great guy. I'd recomend this class to anyone. Go to the review sessions before the tests, and do not forget the online homework! I went to lab every other week, and currently have a perfect score in there. If you screw up, you're probably gonna get a second chance. Also, he likes music.

Incorporates his knowledge of computers into his extreme love of music.A good bit of online homework, and early morning labs. But a very awsome class, best professor ive had at this university to date.
He was nice, but the lecture is all power point and the tests are pretty hard and each cover tons of material.
best teacher in the entire universe! smart guy! great class!

He loves math.  He's smart as hell.  He knows what he's talking about.  He's a nice guy.  He wants to help you understand the material.  None of this changes the fact that he absolutely cannot teach this class competently.  For the first time in a uni class I felt genuinely stupid because he refused to bridge the gap between theory and application.

DROPPING HIS CLASS AND RETAKING it with another professor was the BEST decision ever. ALL of the reviews on here are true, RUN, RUN! as far as you can from this guy's class. Treats his whole class like they are a bunch of brainless slackers, will not answer questions, is completely rude and unhelpful. WORST professor I've come across at UGA.

Mr. Smith is a really nice guy and he's very enthusiastic about math. Having said that, his class is truly awful. Don't let the first test fool you- I made a 100 on it without trying very hard. But then I got less than 50's on the next two tests, and I put a lot of effort into those. The reviews are not exaggerations at all

PICK ANOTHER TEACHER!  And I use the term TEACHER loosely when referring to Dr. Smith.  He is one of those teachers who believes that only a chosen few can learn and understand math.  In order to validate these beliefs, he makes his lecture incomprehensible and breaks down student confidence by constantly reminding us how stupid we are.  STAY AWAY!

Definately do not take this class! He's a very smart man but completely fails to teach his knowledge to the class in any understandable way. He gave out some curves this year but only because the entire class failed. Hardest professor I've had at UGA by far! If you do get him make sure you study in groups (the book won't help with his tests)

DO NOT TAKE HIM!! i thought people were just exaggerating when they said he was awful: they weren't. his notes are incomprehensible. he refuses to do examples with actual numbers. when you ask a question he usually says it's stupid and ignores you. he wont curve grades even if the entire class fails. he is  a HORRIBLE teacher!!!!!!!!!

He was the worst teacher I have ever had in my life by a longshot. He does not care about the students. He actually talks down to the students like we are all a bunch of idiots. He jumps around with his notes. His tests are beyond ridiculous. Our class started with 40 ppl. Its around 15 now. DO NOT take him. I'm in honors and was failing. Stay away

I love math and have never gotten below an A in any course but it looks like that streak is over because of this idiot. You're on your own with this guy, don't study because what you do study for won't be on the test. Stay away!

DO NOT TAKE THIS TEACHER! All he does is teach theory. Has actually out right refused to do example problems. Tests the theory too. This class was hard, but he made it harder. Plus DOES NOT CURVE AT ALL! Makes class an honors theory class. I don't even know why I continued to go to class. Put stuff on test not in book. Incomprehensible. DON'T TAKE

Dr. Smith is the hardest professor EVER.  He only teaches theory, he doesn't use the book, and he doesn't follow the syllabus.  Also, he WILL NOT CURVE so if you're struggling you'd better drop. By the way, if you do not understand the material and ask him questions in his office he will beat around the bush and make you look stupid for asking.

THIS GUY IS HARD! He does a lot of theory and the what you do in class isn't always in the book. He teaches randomly and is hard to follow. He doesn't curve AT ALL. No extra credit and ALOT OF THEORY! (on the tests too) He does give 5 tests, so that is nice compared to the usual 3 tests teachers give. He really enjoys teaching andwants it to be fun

Yes, he does teach a lot of theory and a lot of weird things.  Yes, he can be a little off the wall since he teaches off of his head.  But he is a nice and awesome professor who is willing to help as long as you put forth the effort.  He keeps you interested and as long as you put forth effort it is a wonderful (and somewhat tough) class.

I found the class to be very difficult. He taught a lot of theories and the tests were very hard to understand. Talks about how he failed Calc his first time so he won't take it easy on  anyone in the class. I would not recommend taking his class unless you have prior experience in Calculus.

His class is pretty hard to get an A. But it is easy to get a passing grade. I recommend him to any one who wants to learn more in-depth about the course. Because his teaching focuses more on theories. And his grading sytle is too. You will get lots credits by showing you understad. Helpful during office hours.

Reading these other reviews, I have to ask myself a philosophical question: is Roy Smith that hard, or am I that smart? Almost made an A in his class, but that doesn't mean he's easy. Far from it! Nevertheless, if you want to know the fundamentals of calculus well enough to recite them out of a dead sleep, then take this guy.
Very hard class.  I mean, VERY hard.  Nice guy, but all he teaches are the theories, and that's all he tests on.  Extremely hard to pass.
No Comments
Worst class ever

his expectations are crazy! all he cares about is proving difficult theorems. i feel like i didn't learn anything that i may need in calc 2. and in the end the grades were VERY VERY  unfair.he doesn't believe in A's.he's a very nice guy and i honestly feel bad saying that i didn't learn anything.

Not about culture at all, but rather a weird philosophical class about writers of Germany. The class makes no sense, no one understands it, and when he tells you to buy the EXACT ISBN number, don't waste your time hunting everywhere, it doesn't matter. You can make it by from the lectures, don't buy all 7 (yes 7) books.

Dr. Reinhart loves his job. He takes it very seriously and loves what he teaches. He was always down to help you after class and explain anything to you. He really wants his students to understand and love German the way he does. Honestly, the subject matter of this class was boring because it was really old classical German literature. Good class.

I took Dr. Reinhart Fall '09 and he is the reason why I plan on minoring in German. He's a very understanding teacher. I found out my grandfather had passed away right before his class, he let me sit in his office and calm down while he taught. He works with you whenever you need help. Take this teacher! He's passionate about what he teaches!

Professor Reinhart is an amazing German professor. He's good at explaining things. Overall, German is just a hard language so it was helpful to have someone who was really NICE, going over things as much as possible. He's used to teaching upper level German classes so I think he was a little frustrated teaching an intro class. Take it with him!

awesome teacher, really funny and laid back. he was serious about attendance but he accepted excuses every once and a while. LOTS of homework but it was doable. overall, i was happy i had him as a professor

While the title of this class is German Culture, it's more like German philosophy, so if you don't like that, then don't take it. Attendance is mandatory (40% of the grade), and you have to have a journal with class notes and personal reflections, as well as a final group presentation. Incredibly easy class, but I didn't understand a word he said.

Reinhart seems to live for all things German. No other professor would have been better equipped to teach a seminar on German Lit & Film. Really helpful and engaging discussions once you get over his... quirks. Great guy and I definitely plan on taking another class with him. Easy A as long as you attendCharacters class and have some input in discu

I had him for a seminar so he may have been easier than in his German classes.  In either case he is both VERY intelligent and extremely helpful and nice.  I highly recommend him as a teacher.  He was my favorite teacher this year.
I've taken several classes with him, and I think he's a great teacher who DEFINITELY knows his material. His classes are not hard either.

Reinhart is an interesting professor to say the least, and he definitely has a wealth of knowledge.  However, he is unorganized and his class was woefully unstructured.  If you need even the slightest smidge of structure from a class I would advise thinking twice.
he's a little nutty, but a nice guy. Sometimes he's not the most organized, but you can tell he's very smart, and he's really nice to all his students.
Really cool for a German prof.

A terrific professor that really cares about his students.  I learned so much in the classes I took with him.  Always available for help when I needed it.  Maybe it's just me, but he's also very sexy!!!
Vast knowledge of the subject and anything else dealing with it! Awesome guy in general.
No Comments
No Comments

He's the department head, which I think keeps him busy enough to not be too critical; he's also a really cool and smart guy - he'll chat after class over a beer and has mastery of the German language. Fun and educational field trips, easy assignments, fair tests. Earned an A in three of his classes.

THE BEST! Helped my writing so much and really goes the extra mile to make sure students understand the material. I was intimidated by the course material at first but her explanations really helped me be able to write the limited writing assignments. I know some people find her to be rude but I think she just has a dry sense of humor! LOVED!
ratingTags_Rating: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment_Rating: Dr. Ballif was by far one of the most intimidating professors I have ever had, but also one of the greatest. This class is fast paced, and what it covers is difficult, but you'll emerge a stronger student as a result of it. She's helpful, engaging, and demanding-- in the best way possible.

Dr. Ballif is a tough grader and she makes the assignments for Literary Theory sound simple but they are far from it. She's very preferential to A students, and her final review sheet had over 100 terms on it. She called us "idiots" near end of semester for forgetting terms, and then proceeded to tell us to be kind to people. What a joke.
ratingTags_Rating: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment_Rating: This is one of those classes that can be tough to adjust to if you're not great at turning things in right on time or getting to class every day. But taking Ballif's class is well worth the butt-kicking. I've never come out of a class feeling so accomplished and evolved as a writer. Take her if you want to go to grad school or just write well.

Like a modern-day socrates, Dr.Ballif loves her students deeply; opening their minds and attending to their well-being are two of her core projects. She is one of the most engaging, entertaining, and caring professors I have ever encountered. I cannot even begin to explain the myriad ways Dr.Ballif has positively affected my life.

If there were a major where Dr. Ballif taught all the courses, I would take it in a heartbeat. The clarity and lucidity of each of her lectures remains a marvel (and a mystery) to me. Brings refreshing pedagogical approaches to teaching (look at her C.V, its all there). Does not allow pontifications!

I actually took Lit Theory and Critical Essay with Dr. Ballif, and she's probably the best professor I've ever had. She's a tough grader but gives out tons of opportunities to revise and resubmit. Super engaged, brilliant, hilarious, and knows exactly what she's talking about. Class never feels like a waste of time-I've learned an incredible amount
She may be hard, but certainly not cold and intolerant. Socialism is sexy!

I've taken Dr. B as a graduate student. I've taken lots of classes over the years, at multiple schools, and I must say that her class was easily in my top 3 of all time. She's brilliant, funny, and expects a LOT out of her students. Not for the faint of heart or the lazy! I've come away a much smarter person thanks to her class.

Dr. Ballif was amazing. A bit intimidating at first, but she explains Literary Theory so well!  Definitely take her class when offered.  It will help with all other ENGL classes because of the immense theory background you acquire.

I can't say enough good things about Dr. Ballif.  Her intelligence and wit are very enjoyable and refreshing.  Prepare to be challenged in every way, but prepare to leave the class a different, better person.  You will learn about writing, English, and even the universe with this brilliant prof.  Take her!!!

I was quite excited about this class, and then I went... Very tedious, and the class description is inaccurate. Cold, hard and intolerant describes her. If you are a socialist/liberal feminist, you'll do well. If you are not, you almost certainly won't do well. Beware - I wasted time and money and learned nothing, save some self-control.

Dr. Ballif is fantastic. I was dreading Literary Theory, but the class turned out to be the best course I've taken at UGA. Dr. Ballif is entertaining, helpful, and probably the smartest person I've ever encountered. I highly recommend taking any course from her.

Prof. Ballif is great- I took two classes from her and enjoyed them both.  I couldn't disagree with her more about politics etc., but I think she is a great professor and learned a lot from both her classes.

Dr. Ballif is one of my all time fav professors. She is smart, funny, and interesting. She knows her subject really well and I looked forward to this class even though it was at the end of a very long day. Her class more philosophically challenging than any I have ever taken before.
Excellent mentor and incredibly insightful and intelligent professor.

Dr. Ballif's grading system is way off.  There was no possible way to accumulate all of the possible points available and she weighted the final at 40%.  For those of us who stress on rediculously hard tests, you might end up with a C like I did. And she says that grades aren't important...then improve your grading scale and we will be happy!
She knows her stuff, demands your best. Not easy, but good for someone who really wants to be a better writer

Dr. Ballif is a very opinionated woman (not a bad thing in and of itself). However if you question, disagree, or otherwise do not share those same assumptions and opinions, be prepared for a long and difficult term. She will subtly attempt to make you feel as though your beliefs are outdated or just plain wrong. Religious-inclined students beware.

I totally disagree with the other poster: Dr. Ballif is a fantastic professor.  (By the way, what's wrong with being a hardcore feminist?)  Initially, I really wasn't all that excited about writing.  At the end of the semester, I had become an enthusiastic writer, armed with tight, unified prose.  Cheers to  Dr. Ballif!

Ballif is a die-hard feminist, and is contempuous of males-look at her Cirriculum Vitae. Unhelpful, nebulous lectures make this a tedious class. Less intelligent students are allowed marathon rants, making it worse. I had very high hopes for this class, but was let down. Don't do this to yourself!

He's a good teacher, he is very funny and you can tell he is passionate about Greek culture. However, my problem with the course is that you never REALLY know whats going to be on your test, but when you do take it, it is extremely specific tid bits from lecture in the class, and he counts the answer wrong if you get one letter mispelled.
ratingTags_Rating: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment_Rating: The sweetest old man EVER! He is so passionate about what hes teaching and very caring toward his students. Only downside is he doesnt tell you how much things are weighted on the syllabus (that he hand writes btw lol). I found this class a bit difficult because Im not interested in Roman history so keep that in mind.
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring--Lecture heavy

comment_Rating: Dr. Harris is so sweet. On the first day of class I was so excited about this semester. But after the first test I should have dropped this and taken it online. He makes you use his wording on test even if your answer is technically right. He is really nit picky and gives no partial credit. Also the final is over almost 2,000 words. Do not take.

Dr. Harris is very sweet and caring and knows a lot about what he teaches. Tests are over the workbook exercises and he can be tough about his grading. He allows a few absences but I went often to stay caught up.
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment_Rating: he's a sweet old man and he plays music for you on fridays. his tests are oral but theyre literally straight from his lectures. dont bother buying the book; you go over everything in class. he's very lecture heavy and speaks very slowly. its an easy class but i'm a classics major so...
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment_Rating: This man is very old fashioned. Our syllabus was HAND WRITTEN. Dr. Harris basically tells stories the whole semester. Then you are supposed to memorize every single one for the 3 tests and comprehensive final. Do NOT buy the book for the class. The book has a website with chapter summaries that is really good to read before each class.
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT--LECTURE HEAVY

comment_Rating: Dr. Harris is a sweet old man who loves myth, but unless you can memorize 60+ pages of information do not take. His exams are oral which just is not fun. He has no grading scale so you literally have no idea where you stand ever. This class caused too much stress for a requirement find something easier. But he really is darling & sweet& plays music
ratingTags_Rating: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment_Rating: Dr. Harris is a very sweet old man that knows a lot about Roman and Greek culture, however, do not take this class unless you are VERY interested in the subjects and can handle A LOT of memorization. Tests come straight from his lectures and include an enormous amount of dates and names. He also uses no technology and can't be reached by email.
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment_Rating: Dr. Harris is a sweet man, but doesn't teach you much of anything. He gets off topic every class. Everyday you go through a workbook that you could be doing on your own. Tests are ridiculous.
ratingTags_Rating: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY

comment_Rating: Robert Harris has an undeniable passion for Latin, having taught for over 50 years at UGA. He is old-fashioned, preferring paper-and-pencil and no technology, but he's easy to follow, recaps information often and happily answers questions. He is personable and encouraging, creating a positive and uplifting atmosphere for students. I love him!

Dr. Harris is a very sweet old man. However, if you have no background in greek culture, I would not recommend taking this class. He lectures the whole entire time. His tests are given orally and are over so much information that it's impossible to memorize it all. He does not use eLC or email. Not the easiest literature credit but not the hardest.

So, he is super cute and funny. However, his class is SUPER boring. The tests were straight up memorization of LOTS LOTS of things. The HW and CW he assigns are not necessary for the test. But, I'm taking him again for LATN 2001.
ratingTags_Rating: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Hilarious--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment_Rating: Dr. Harris is very sweet and loves to talk. His test questions came straight from the lectures, and he usually repeated the important stories.  I personally had the textbook because I could never spell the names in class (SPELLING IS VERY IMPORTANT), but I can imagine someone getting by without it easily. Recommended if you're good at memorization!

Very sweet old man who clearly is passionate about the language he is teaching. Class is a lot of work, homework pretty much every night. Can be an easy grader on the tests, but often the vocab on the test is not the vocab you are familiar with from translations.
ratingTags_Rating: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--TEST HEAVY

comment_Rating: Love him as a person but cannot recommend the class. Class time is spent reading from the book. Tests are completely fill in the blank, with no partial credit,  over at least 600 books words and 50-100 words from the board. Also, the final is cumulative. He is not accessible outside of class, not even through email.
ratingTags_Rating: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment_Rating: This man speaks soooo softly and slowly. I sat in the front row only because I couldn't hear in the the fourth row. He read straight from the textbook every day and only told us a little extra information- none of which was ever on the tests. Prepare for a bunch of words to memorize. Each test covered about 4 chapters each with about 100 words.

I had him for Latin 2 and 3. He is the most sarcastic teacher at UGA, loves to tease people, and clearly has a passion for Latin. He's kind, plays the clavicord, and if you try your best you won't get lower than a B. Be sure to participate in class to impress him, I'm convinced 10% of your grade is subjective. I had him for LATN 1002 and LATN 2001.

He's an adorable, kind older man known by his signature bowties and handwritten syllabus. As a person, he is a great professor, but his class is extremely difficult. Be prepared to spend hours every night translating. He is a kind grader, but this class is a big time commitment.

I found this class very interesting! The textbook (Greek People) is not worth buying unless you want to use it as a source for your final paper. Take notes in class and then use Quizlet. You don't have to read the material, but I did just because I enjoyed it. Only things that he covers in the lectures are on the test. Memorize everything he says.
I didn't really like him.  I found him to be too sarcastic.  Med Terms was super boring and he takes attendance.  It's a useful class if you plan on going into the medical field.
He's a great professor, and knows so much about the subject. You will have to teach yourself at times, but he will help in class if you have questions.

He's adorable.  He dressed up everyday and brought in his clavichord to play on Fridays.  If you listen and take good notes, you're good as gold.  My test average was a 98 and I crammed for a only a few hours the day before.  Sometimes his lectures are boring but it's clear he's passionate about Roman culture.  The Roman People book is irrelevant.
We just did exercises out of the book the entire time. The class was not that hard, but it is a lot of memorizing and self teaching.

Hardest class I've taken at UGA. Tests are not what he says they will be on and ALL on what he discusses in class, plus they're short answer and he reads the questions out loud. Unless you plan to go to class everyday, take notes, and spend multiple hours memorizing useless information do not take this delusional old man. PS- NOTHING is put online
Great prof! He's so sweet and laid back. Lots of memorization but it's interesting. Take lots of notes. Always go to class
Simply the best. You have to take him!!

Dr. Harris is a sweet, older gentleman who pretends to know little of technology. His note sheets are handwritten and he cannot be reached by email. His tests are based directly off lecture, so no need to buy textbooks. I would recommend using Quizlet as a study tool.

Dr. Harris is a really smart, cool person. His class was really boring though. The only grades are 3 quizzes, a research paper, and a final exam. You have to take good notes and study them if you want to do well on the quizzes. The final was pretty tough too. Don't take this class if you can't listen to someone talk for an hour and fifteen minutes.
Do not take this class! it is very hard and the exam is just 25 stupid questions that he talked about in class not in the book. I do not recommend this class unless it is your major.

Dr. Harris is such an awesome professor. My dad had him when he went here so yes, he is very old; but he knows his stuff and he has such a passion for what he teaches. If you read and study you'll get an A in his class easily. He doesn't use power points or any technology as a matter of fact. His tests are solely based off of what he lectures on.

Greek Culture H- very easy!!! You're supposed to read, but I never did and still got an A+. Go to class and pay attention. Take thorough notes and study them when tests are coming up and you should do fine. Be cautious of spelling though! There are 3 tests, 1 paper (its a grade booster), and the final (also a grade booster). Definitely take him!!!!

Seriously the hardest class I've taken at UGA, it might as well have been a 3000+ level class... definitely not an intro class. I put my all into this class. He may be a cute little man, but he's extremely sarcastic. Don't let him fool you, there's SO much memorizing & reading for this class. Never again...

Although this man may seem nice at first he is extremly sarcastic unhelpful and may aswell not even teach. He just read us the book and did not explain the concepts hardly at all. His quizes were very difficult. Take this class with extreme caution.

1020H - Adorable and funny.  Tests come from notes but you need to get spellings from the book. TONS of memorization and spelling.  Lenient grading.  Wants you to do well.  He's so cute and often brings flowers to class.  Sometimes, you can get sick of listening to the same style lecture three days a week.  No email or personal phone line.

Dr. Harris is such a cute little man. He brought flowers for us to class almost everyday. He loves what he does. The only down side is he only lectures and sits down the whole time. The class got really boring sometime.

Dr. Harris is a great teacher! His lectures are a little fast but if you read the chapter assigned before the next class, you'll be good to go. He tells the myths with lots of interest and humor. You can tell he really loves the subject. Keep the myths and names straight and you'll do fine. I'd recommend him to anyone anytime.

Forget all the adorable nonsense. Took this class as an elective due to interest in the subject. What a mistake. Unless you can memorize a couple of hundred multi-syllable Greek names for each test and spell them perfectly, avoid this class at all costs. Don't expect to learn anything meaningful about Greek culture and its influence on western civ.

Adorable, eccentric, funny, and plays piano for you some days. However, you MUST read the book because it's hard to understand him when he's telling stories. Then on the tests, you regurgitate the stories. TONS of memorization and spelling. EXTREMELY difficult to do well on tests with the amount of material covered and no direction for studying.

Dr. Harris is the most adorable professor ever. His stories and personality, and the jambox fridays make the class worth going to every time. You don't translate much every day, which is nice. If you ever have the option to take his class, don't hesitate and DO IT!

I took 2001 after taking his class and I was not prepared for that class. Harris might look adorable but he doesn't give much more than an answer guide to the activities in the textbook could give. He's also rude. No compliments, only sarcastic comments. I would not recommend him if you plan to continue in Latin.

Dr. Harris was an awesome teacher.  he doesnt use powepoints or anything technilogical for that matter, so you have to go to class.  he speaks his lectures and you have to write down all the definitions.  tests arent hard if you go to class and know your stuff.  he likes to bring in pictures and he really loves what he does. take him!!!
Dr. Harris is definitely a knowledgeable professor.  He's also very funny and eccentric.  You definitely have to study to get an A, but it's not terribly difficult.  I like the class.

This class (Classical Mythology) was like being told bedtime stories by my cute little old grandpa! Dr. Harris loves what he is talking about and makes the myths very memorable with his detailed and exciting story-telling. If you keep up with the readings, you will do well on the quizzes. He wants you to do well in his class.

This class is easy if you study. Class consists of going around the room and each student defining one of the terms... it gets boring. Your attendance factors into your grade so go to class. The tests consist of defining 25 out of a possible 200 terms. If you don't care about medical terminology don't take this class because you won't push yourself

Dr. Harris is a nice man but he is not a good teacher. The class consists of him calling on people to read the homework. No real explanations. He isn't hard though so if you are going to take him to fulfill a requirement I would recommend but if you have to go beyond the level he teaches I would caution that you will not be prepared for the next le
I had him for Medical Terminology. He's hilarious and adorable. You'll do fine in this class if you are good a memorizing lots of material.

Harris made mythology amazing!  He is the coolest old man ever!  What's better is that when he tells stories, he adds hilarious inuendo and crazy sexual references that sound so funny coming from a 74 year old guy.  This was my favorite class of the semester!

Nice guy and very funny, but it is not a good professor. Classes consisted of him going around the room and calling on somebody to translate a sentence from our homework. He never actually taught the material. I wouldn't recommend him unless you like teaching things to yourself.

One of the best professors I have had yet at UGA. He's a super nice and obviously really enjoys teaching it. He makes the information exciting. As long as you come to class and take good notes you'll do fine because his tests are entirely from his notes. The term paper was graded pretty easy and the final was a piece of cake.
No Comments

Dr. Harris is awesome! The funniest, most unique teacher I've ever had. Class was always interesting, even when talking about Greek plays! He knows a ton about Classical Lit and always tells great stories. Love his outfits! But my favorite part of the class was the music he played for us every Friday! I would take him again in a heartbeat!
Dr. Harris is great! He does have an attendance policy now, but it's not unreasonable. He is a great teacher, and if you listen, you will do well!

Best teacher at UGA. Period.  Harris walks to class every day, usually with fresh flowers from his garden, plays songs for you at the end of each week, pretends to know nothing about technology and says he's afraid to ride buses!  He's hilarious and knows Latin like he was born speaking it. It's rumored he can recite all of the Anead...in Latin.
If you are taking a classics course, try to get Dr. Harris. He's truly a gem. Don't be fooled by his laid back approach, however, he grades rather arbitrarily.

Absolutely amazing teacher! He is possibly the best storyteller I know. All class long he would tell us (off the top of his head) the many stories of Classical Mythology with his "unique" style and humor. Listen in class; read the text; easy A. Would take him again in a heartbeat.
So awesome! Really funny and really easy! He's always interesting and full of surprises. Like a really cool grandpa!

A great professor! By far the best class I've ever taken.  Class was never boring and was most of the time funny.  All that is required of the student is to go to class to know what's going to be on the assessments.  His exams come straight from his lectures.

Awesome!  I loved the class!  Dr. Harris is a great guy.  He doesn't test over anything not covered in class.  He doesn't give a syllabus so there is no way of knowing for sure how much the quizzes, term paper, and final are worth.  One of my favorite professors!

Dr. Harris is an amazing professor!  He wears bright colored bowties everyday and plays his clavichord for the class every Thursday.  The quizzes are not hard if you pay attention in class and study.  He will make you want to learn more.  He is a very funny old man who is super smart.  I recommend him to everyone!  Excellent!

I had him for medical terminology, which would have been an extremely boring class with another teacher. He wears bow ties every day and plays the clavicord on Fridays at the end of class. Very unique, pretends he doesn't have a clue about the modern world...you'll love him. I also had him for CLAS1020H (mythology).

Excellent!  I wish I could take another class with him. I love his traditions he has: stamps, the jam box, bringing flowers to class, pretending he doesn't know anything about technology.  Challenging class but he is cool.
His pictures and stories make every day of class interesting.  If you pay attention, you'll learn something and easily get an A.

One of the best teacher's ive had at uga. very passionate and involved with what he teaches- great sense of humor-his outfits are even better- will help you if you ask-3 quizzes a final and a term paper- none of them bad at all- go to class he tests over what he has said nothing extra that wasn't covered in class
This guy is great.  I swear he speaks fluent Latin.   Very good teacher.  I love when he talks about computers and other modern things and pretends he has no idea what they are
No Comments
Great old guy.  Very, very passionate about his work.  I think he can speak fluent Latin.

this guy is awesome.  hes the epitome of a little old man.  i want to call him grandpa.  hes funny as hell, and nice.  plus every thursday he plays the clavicord, a guitar/piano thingy.  very passionate about myth but doesnt make you feel bad about not knowing it.

Great guy, funny as hell! He obviously loves Latin, and I learned more than expected. Straight-forward class, not too much homework, and very reasonable tests with ext. cred. No attendance policy, but likes you to show.  Got a B, my girlfriend got an A. He's cool; we're inviting him to our wedding!
Have absolutely no idea what this dude is rambling about.

TAKE THIS CLASS IF YOU WANT AN EASY A! In other sections it is a lot of work, a lot of reading, and a lot of writing. Mengles (he goes by that) is very young and looks like a 19 year old and very chill. Doesn't take attendance, grades very easily, and lets you bring in an entire sheet of paper with anything on it on test day.
he is awesome.
Made this class interesting and easy to understand.  Provided handouts from the book material & also handed out study guides for tests.  I would recommend Engles to anyone majoring in psychology.

Possibly the easiest and most pointless class ever.   Supposedly you can learn all the material in two weeks. Subsequently, we got out early every day and there was no class the last month.  Mengles is entertaining though, to say the least. Just be sure to keep all your assignments/tests because he tends to lose grades.
he is very funny with constant jokes and anecdotes, his class is the highlight of the day, there is homeowork and quizes but if you read his notes, you're good to go! a whole lotta fun!
Really funny to listen to.  I liked his stories and constant jokes. It made a boring class fun. His grading is easy and there wasn't much homework.

You absolutely must attend the breakout sessions with your TA if you want to get extra credit at the end of the semester. Your grade is made up of 5 tests and an optional final. He has a great sense of humor. I was sick during the semester, but he uploads his lecture notes to ELC so you don't fall behind. Just listen to the CDs and you'll be good

This class is easy, but you do have to study especially if you don't already know music. You don't really have to go to class unless you have a breakout. The book comes with the C.D. you use so that's why you need the book. Schiller is really sweet and he loves music so he makes class interesting.

Easy as long as you put the effort in when it comes to test time. He gives you a basic study guide for each test. Go through the lectures and the book and high light stuff that relates to the study guide he gives you. Create your own study guide with that info. Make an itunes playlist from the tracks he gives you. Final was optional. 5 tests + 1 op

Don't take this class for an easy A or for your multicultural credit for Franklin. Wasn't hard but wasn't easy at the same time. Tests have nothing to do with class, all fill in the blank, ended up with a B and I would study for hours.
Worst teacher i have ever had, very scatterbrained, tests are impossible because he doesn't teach, all fill in the blank

Dr. S. is an awesome teacher. He is very passionate about music and teaching. He really cares about his students and makes sure they understand what he is teaching. He is very patient and very nice. There was a lot of little assignments in this class and a presentation, but all very easy if you can just knock them out one by one.

Took writing intensive section of this class for multi-cultural requirement. Absolutely awesome. Dr. S is thoroughly into the subject, really connects with his students and loves what he is doing. If you like music and want a glimpse of its importance and role in the formation of our country and culture, this class and prof are the ticket. Fun too.

I took the small class (36 or so students).  It is writing intensive (four small papers, one 10 page one). Dr. Schiller is sometimes frustrating because he strays off topic, but his excitement for music and his random comments make him a pretty likable guy. Fun class, and you get bonus points for perfect attendance and optional performances.

I LOVED this guy as a teacher! Always in a great mood (esp. Fridays), and just impossible not to love; infectious personality. His tests aren't walks in the park, though, and they should have been. I have more of an issue with his TAs (especially Vanessa Tome) than anything else. He was great, but I found them to be useless.
Nice teacher, passionate about his job. Not too bad of a class. Couldn't find the CD to download on Piratebay as mentioned in another comment though. Anyone know where?

Schiller is a really fun guy. He made class interesting by singing and being really excited about music. Tests are moderately difficult. He gives out study guides that tell you EXACTLY what will be covered, though. Read the Listening Guides for the selections; it is extremely helpful. Made an easy A in the class; only wrote one paper! Loved it.

He is a very interesting teacher.  He makes you laugh because he is so passionate about music.  His tests are a lot harder than I planned on them being.  You do have to study a few days in advance.  Listen to the Music and read the "Listening Guides"  Make sure you can pick out a piece just by hearing a random snippet of 10-15 seconds.

A very strange and cool guy. Probably one of my favorite professors at UGA. Class is pretty easy, he just tends to ask really random questions about songs on tests. Overall pretty easy, though you do need to study the required listening

Don't take his class to fulfill ur  multicultural/Franklin requirement! Schiller's an eccentric guy and going to class can be fun, but it's a hard class. Tests cover about 12-15 songs. Study the history, culture, & meaning of all songs. There was a 50 min group presentation and a research paper. He does give out extra credit opportunities.

Overall a decent class. Go to class and paying attention really helps.  Just get the student notes from the bookstore and study the songs he tells you (10-15 songs).  The cd is the most important though not the book.  The group paper and 1000 word essays are a joke and the grading is really not to bad.
Dr. Schiller is a great prof...He seems to genuinely love what he does, so he makes it interesting. The tests were harder than I expected, but they weren't bad. I'd recommend Dr. Schiller to anyone.

Wierd man, but pretty funny. He really loves music, but his class isn't that great for somebody just trying to fulfill a Franklin req. The grading is pretty easy, but you have to pretend you know something about music in the paper and presentation.

Dr. Schiller is a quirky old guy, but this class is great. TAs are very helpful, especially Joe. Class isn't tricky, just supposed to make you appreciate music more. Tests aren't bad, just know artist, title, and a little background info for about 15-20 songs per test. Group project isn't bad. 1000 word paper. Great class, I highly recommend it.

The syllabus says attendance is mandatory in lectures, but he doen't check. Dr. Schiller is very entertaining, though, so you pretty much want to go to class. The tests are not too hard. As long as you know the songs, the person who wrote and sang them, and the date they were recorded, you know everything you need for the tests. Fun class!
Pretty good professor, make sure go to class. The class is harder than expected (got harder on the tests as the semester went on), but I'd recommend it.

he is so funny!  his tests are harder than you would think, so go to class and listen to what he says.  try to get old tests because it makes it easier to see what he is looking for.  i loved this class even though it was more work than i originally thought.

I adore Dr. Schiller.  He's a little scatter-brained sometimes, but it really makes him loveable.  He's always been fair with my grading and always shows so much interest in how I'm doing.  His TAs are awesome as well.
The class was harder than I thought, but the TA's helped a lot.  Dr. Schiller is pretty goofy, but he is very knowledgeable.  I enjoyed going to class just to watch him.

This  Prof. Schiller is a nice man but the lectures are pretty boring.There are 3 tests including the final. Theres a breakout once a week in which you are put into a groups for a project. The grading is pretty easy. There is also a short research paper over anything you want. I don't recommend it.

I had Chris for my geology lab. If you absolutely have to take a geology lab, I would definitely recommend Chris. He is super chill and laid back. He is always happy to answer any questions his students have. The material is very dull, but Chris is so passionate about what he teaches, and finds a way to make it interesting. Very down to earth guy.

Chris taught my Geology lab and he also subbed in for the regular GEOL1122 lecture professor (who was out for surgery) for half the semester. He made the material far more interesting than the other professor. He is also very understanding and is super clear about his expectations for tests. He is an interesting lecturer. Would recommend.

He is fairly disorganized, but is also very passionate about the topic and leads interesting class discussions.  It is difficult to get an A in his class because of a lack of anything solid to study of off.  He does pace a lot but thats what kept me awake...sometimes he trips and it can wake you up a little bit...

He is vague, unorganized, and way too caffeinated.  His class is only lectures and handouts.  His lectures are difficult to follow because he doesn’t have lesson plans, he rambles about disconnected topics and it easy to become distracted by his incessant pacing.

Chris is extremely disorganized! He's notes just go in circles throughout the entire semester. The tests aren't too bad just have to have the notes. Have to go to class as there is no book and he doesn't post notes online. Overall, would definitely not take his class again!!
always a pleasure to listen to.

Chris is a good man. He's nice and he made a very boring class have some interesting topics and discussions. He is unorganized, but he doesn't expect for his students to be on the ball at all times, which is fair. I would recommend him. Good man.
I think he's kind of funny.  He is just disorganized, but it's almost indeering.  He's like a goofy big brother figure.  I would probably take his class again if I had to.

I came into this class expecting the usual...and got less. He is so unorganaized he makes my roommate look like a neat freak. Amazingly the only thing worse in this class was his slanted view of the world. If you want to learn how to hate "whitey" take Chris if not look somewhere else

Very condescending and somewhat rude to students who haven't perfected their german yet. Daily online homework is extremely specific (some days you must include periods in your answers while other days you don't. It will never tell you one way or another). Avoid taking her if you can.

Do not take her if you can help it. GRMN 2001 is grammar heavy. She assigns daily online homework for a grade and the system requires your grammar to be perfect . She barely teaches in class and basically just reads the textbook to you. The nice thing is she gives you the test layout but grades test super hard and expects flawless German.
ratingTags_Rating: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment_Rating: She expects your German to be grammatically flawless. But she is a quick grader and she may completely look over your mistake.

Made A's in both of her classes (3010&3020). Her German is pretty clear but sometimes she gets off topic. She's definitely a little feisty so I would recommend sucking up to her and getting on her good side. You just have to learn to roll with her teaching style and basically do a lot of studying outside of class. Do EVERY worksheet she gives you

First of all don't be fooled by the class description. This is a literature class which I didn't know beforehand. I hadn't had German in a year and it was difficult to understand and read the material. Gooze is an okay teacher. I learned a lot from her and you can tell she cares but the take home final she gave us was ridiculous.
ratingTags_Rating: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment_Rating: She's the classic example of a university professor, who condescends students for not knowing stuff without actually clarifying or bothering to teach the students about the stuff. Her tests were easier than Dibella's (had her for 3010), but she grades really harshly (0 mercy). Basically I can tell she doesn't care about the students or the class.

She is one of the worst teachers I've ever had. Her study guides don't match the tests, she isn't clear, and there's no partial credit--if you got most of something right, she counts it wrong. Going to her for help is useless. Would not recommend at all.

I can't speak for those of you who took or are looking to take German because I had her for a Holocaust Narrative course. It was very interesting, she waas very passionate and I enjoyed her lectures. Don't let the other comments scare you away; she is a very nice lady and not scary or extremely difficult at all.

If this class wasn't required for my major, I would have dropped it. Her lectures are dry and usually end up off-topic. I thought her class was hard not because of the material, but because of the sheer volume of crap she wanted memorized. Her lectures and study guides didn't correspond well to her tests. Grading is very random. Enjoy!

Horrible teacher, I have been in the GRMN dept fr a while, and have NEVER felt as ridiculed and belittled as in this class.She makes fun of students openly and to profs for not understanding texts or even simple questions and her tests are obscenely detailed oriented and have nothing to do with what was discussed during class.AVOID HER AT ALL COSTS

Hate to say it, but she's one of the worst teachers I've ever had. She brings all the bad comments on herself. She's actually rude. I think she has a good heart, but you wouldn't know it from taking one of her classes. Avoid her if you possibly can.

She really wasn't as bad as portrayed here. She does laugh a lot, but I never felt it was directed at the students. The tests depended on how fast one could use a dictionary and she's a tough grader. I was surprised to receive an A, considering I didn't entirely finish the final. I can read German, and that was the entire point.

Confirming the insulting attitude toward students: on at least one occasion she mocked our papers out loud in the lounge where members of the class were hanging out. Perhaps a bit too fixated on the sexuality of dead poets.
Booring and very unprepared. Not quite ready to teach at University Level, and she does put you down when she knows you know more than she does about some subject.
Makes fun of students

__typename_Rating: Does not use any theory to fundament discussion
Constantly comments on how she does not understand the books we are reading - can somebody like that even be called a professor?

comment_Rating: She is the most sarcastic professor I've ever had! Do not take her classes! She'll laugh at you as she laughs when students don't understand her point!
Wow. Goodluck... dont feel bad if she laughs at you, she laughs at everything.
No Comments
I think she makes this class as hard and as boring as possible. This is the first prof I have had who actually laughs at and makes fun of students who don't understand. Do not take this class!
Avoid at all cost. She is unbearable. Do yourself a favor and never take her class. Just say NO!!! Avoid the Noid!
Grem made this class interesting, and his tests are relatively easy as long as you GO TO EVERY CLASS (or get the notes).

Fantastic teacher, and he really loves what he does. Work load is light considering how bad it could be. If you behave, come to class, and seem interested, he'll work with you. His jokes are subtle, but hilarious. I'd take another one of his courses. He just really seems like an excellent person who is in love with what he does.

I don't get these ratings sometimes...don't believe the haters! He was very helpful and down to earth. he even took the time to go over my notes before the exam. He was better with modern world history but overall he knew his stuff. The exams were very fair and workload ok. Attendance was required but he sometimes forgot to take it..a good prof!

I think that Grem is just a cool guy who wants to teach.  If you don't disrespect him in class then he'll like you.  The work is somewhat hard and I got a B+, but I didn't do all that much work.  I was genuinely interested in every class though. take him

He's a pretty nice guy. I kind of see how someone can see him as arrogant, but it's not insulting. Some of the lectures were a little dull, but most were very interesting. He doesn't assign a paper like the huge classes, but you have to do ten source analyses. They aren't too bad. The tests are mostly short answer, but fair. I'd recommend him.
Prof. Grem wanted a chili pepper so badly that I just couldn't resist...

great teacher! if you do all the assigned work and take good notes in class then you can easily get an A or B. his tests are designed so you can prove how much you know- not so tricky. just make sure that you are well prepared and you'll ace it. very organized structure. interesting and applicable to real life. 1 of the best classes i've had at uga

This class was not particularly hard, but it was extremely dull.  He isn't a bad teacher, but I've had many other history profs. at UGA who were a lot more enthusiastic.  No, he is not necessarily condescending, but he is definitely a little arrogant.  When you get used to it, it's not that bad though.  He's alright, but I wouldn't take him again.

I really, really enjoyed this class and Professor Grem. Make no mistake, the class isn't one that you can slide by with minimal work, but I found Professor Grem very helpful on both the tests and the paper. Additionally, he was pretty clear on the material he taught. I would definitely take him again.
this guy while a some what good teacher is a little full of himself and how he grades is a little hard.

I dont know who said Grem is not helpful or condesending but that is definitely not the case! Grem always had his door open for help for anything papers or source analysis. If you work hard and pay attention the they lectures you will be fine. He was definitely one of my favorite professors at UGA!

Good Teacher, Good Class, If you do the work you will get a good grade... best tip... do the paper as soon as you can... it take a while to do it... oh yeah you have 12 Source Analysis and 1 15 page paper and 3 test.. not bad at all

The work wasn't overly hard. Reading is manageable. 12 Source Analyses, one 15 page final paper, and 3 exams--not cumulative. Thought the class would be interesting but Professor Grem is incredibly condescending and not at all inviting to students who need help. I was so excited after reading other ratings, but was definitely disappointed in class.
Prof. Grem was one of my absolute favorite teachers at Georgia.  He is a teacher who loves to teach and is very passionate about his subject.  If you work hard, a good grade is definitely possible!

Definitely one of my favorite professors so far! All tests are in class essays, and if you screw one up you can read books/take quizzes on them to make up the points. The books I read (even though I didn't have to) quickly became personal favorites. TAKE THIS TEACHER! Even if you don't like history, he's awesome. Easy A- because he was interesting.
Doesn't understand the difference between his graduate work and undergraduate work

TAKE THIS CLASS! Professor Grem is extremely engaging and helpful, and makes the same tired facts we've been hearing since high school really relevant and interesting. I had the lowest expectations for this required class (not being a big fan of history in general) but this ended up being one of my favorites. He also happens to be SMOKING HOT.

AWESOME teacher! I didn't like history before this class, and he made it very interesting. I enjoyed going to class. He is very helpful. Tests are difficult, and you need to study a lot, but you learn a lot too.
He really is a great teacher! The class was tough but fun. His lectures are very thorough and engaging. Tough grader-but it makes you learn from your mistakes. Highly recommend.
He is an amazing professor. Very engaging.
No Comments
Good TA. Cute too. Smart and fun guy.. He sure loves history.  He even gave a lecture one day that was better than any the professor gave all term.  He's hard on your writing but is willing to help.

Really cool guy and good teacher.  Plays good music before his breakouts.  Actually made me look forward to coming to his breakout.  Always puts helpful comments on papers, but sometimes too many.  I learned a lot from his class.
Dr.Medine was a great professor, shes very caring and always accommodates student needs. There are no tests, recommend taking.

This class was very easy. However, this is not a religion class by any means. I expected to take the class with a focus on the religious themes in literature. This is nothing more than a Lord of the Rings fan club disguised as a religion course. If you are a bit LOTR fan, this class is your easy A, for everyone else, this class is not for you.

i love medine sooo much!! this class was interesting and they wanted to give us good grades as long as we did the work. we were encouraged to speak but  not required to. medine would often ask how we were doing and genuinely want to know. one of my favorite professors so far :)
ratingTags_Rating: Get ready to read--So many papers--Caring

comment_Rating: Loved this professor. She was super understanding of everyone's needs and chose not to give us too much work since it was only a seminar course. We just discussed the book we read and wrote a final reflection. Would recommend her for your FYOS.

Professor Medine was fun to listen to, though her lectures can often be somewhat overly long or drawn out. I enjoyed this class, but the TA was a bit overly politically charged, despite this being a Lord of the Rings class...

In any case, the course was well organized and Professor Medine was very helpful and accessible outside class.

Dr. Medine is the nicest person ever and this class is a easy A but you still learn a lot. You read a lot of small books but you really just need to understand a few key passages from each, or skim them enough to write your papers. She cancelled my class a lot if we "looked tired" or just wanted to give us a day off. She is the best!

If you're looking to learn a lot about African American history, this isn't really the class for you. Dr. Medine is a religion professor, and mostly talks about how religion affects history (she lectures for the entire class period everyday). Her TA grades papers really easily and it is an easy A if you show up, but it isn't really Af-Am Studies.
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--So many papers

comment_Rating: 3-4 short papers. VERY relaxed schedule. Sometimes cancelled class just to give herself a break. Lots of readings, but you could probably get by without doing them if you found a way to contribute to the discussion. Class is ALL about the discussion. She just wants to talk to students about religion and Black history, so find a way to participate.

I love Dr. Medine! She is awesome and her class on Lewis and Tolkien was so fun and interesting. She does a great job of imparting knowledge without overloading students on coursework. I would recommend her to any student looking to gain some religion credits, or just looking for a really cool and interesting class to take for fun.

I took Dr. Medine's freshman seminar on St. Augustine and loved her and the class. It was super laid back and as long as you showed up and could contribute to the conversation you were bound to do fine, whether or not you had actually done the reading. She's super sweet and knowledgable.

I took Medine's maymester class and it was so easy.  The great thing is that I learned a lot as well. You just have to go to class and take notes, but you don't have to read the texts at all.  She's really nice and willing to help you in any way. I definitely recommend for people who need to knock out a core requirement.

Literally the best teacher I've ever had, hands down, no contest. If you don't like her class then you're probably a horribly unfriendly troll who just hates everyone and everything, that's how great she is.

Professor Medine is awesome. This class was incredibly relaxed. No tests. We had to write 3 relatively easy papers if you pay attention in class. She's kind of unorganized but recognizes that. Class was easy and interesting. You have to attend class. Highly recommend. She's awesome.
Geat teacher.  Very easy Intro to Religion class.  Just make sure you go to class.  I reviewed my notes twice the entire semester and got an A.
She is an awesome teacher! The class is super easy and pretty interesting. She's really nice and makes the class fun. Take her!
Dr. Medine is the greatest teacher I've ever had. She is passionate, brilliant, and just an all round dynamic teacher and person!

BEST teacher I have ever taken! I really enjoyed her class. Who wouldn't like a class where all you read is Lewis and Tolkien (LORD OF THE RINGS)!? Just go to class and listen to the discussion and you'll get an A. Wish I could take her again!!!

I took this teacher on the notion of everybody's review that she was great. However, I advise agaisnt taking her because the class is ridiculous. Was the class hard? Not really. But the notes had no structure or organization and we skipped from one thing to another. TAs were not helpful and seemed to not care at all. DO NOT TAKE HER in my opinion.

She is one of the Best teachers I've ever had. She is fair to all her students, brilliant, and kind. If you are able to ever take any class of hers DO IT, you'll be a better student and person for it.

GREAT!!!!!!!!!!!!! She is an excellent teacher. Teh class was very informative and my T.A. was soooo awesome. All the T.A.s are great though. She is very passionate about what she does and you can tell. Only three tests and a couple of short papers to earn more points. Test were great if you study the notes. Overall, really good experience.

Absolutely fantastic teacher! She is a bit scatter-rained while lecturing but that does not make the class difficult. Just go and take notes and go to your breakout sessions and you will make an easy A. She tells you everything that will be on the tests ahead of time so definitely go the day before you have a test!

Had a great time in this class, which was much tougher and more challenging than I'd been expecting.  The quality of material covered and the in depth nature she presented it in helped to make the class my favorite of that year.  Great teacher!
YOU HAVE TO TAKE AT LEAST ONE CLASS FROM HER.  I GUARANTEE IF YOU DO, YOU WILL TAKE ANOTHER ONE.
She is awesome! you must take her - its a great experience!

I've taken 5 of her classes, by far one of the most wonderful teachers on campus.  She loves what she does, is passionate about it, and truly cares about her students.  I suggest for anyone to take her before you graduate. Don't worry if you're not religious, it's not overbearing.

great prof and great class.  I thought the concept of using LOTR to help introduce religious thought was very creative.   And anyone ^  who doesn't like to read should maybe reconsider this whole college thing.
Dr. Medine is excellent.

Great class, and I like her style a lot. I also liked how she let her students have their own opinion without making them look stupid. My only knock against the class was that at times the Grad students would dominate the conversation, but overall a great class, espcially if you put in the work.

She wasn't a bad prof, but her class blows. I signed up for RELI1003 and what I got was a class centered around Lord of the Rings and myth, which required tons of reading a week. Just beware that this class has very little to do with various types of religion and a lot to do with hobbits and elves.

This was an IDL course. I found as long as you put effort into the class and did the reading, the answers for the assignments were very easy to find. Know your assignment answers for the final and you are good to go! Very informative, answers graded in a timely manor, good feedback from the professor. Overall, good experience.

Ms. Weber teaches this as a distant learning class, and this is exactly what she is: distant. She is in no hurry to grade assignments or exams. As long as you memorize your lessons you will do well in this class.

Ms. Weber is the worst teacher I've ever had. She teaches this class as Independent Study. Her grading is illogical and horrible. She does not provide one iota of help or guidence/explanations. She is slow and does not respond to questions/e-mails when it comes to grading. Avoid this IDL class!

A very fun professor. Very well known and respected amongst the EHSC department and her recent class she is teaching Public Health Micro was very easy along with you learning alot. Had a couple of guest speakers along with us doing our own projects in the class. Slight disorganization with the schedule but otherwise, I highly recommend
Environmental Micro was great. She explained the material just fine, though she talked out of her nose
On the whole, a pretty decent class, Dr. Lipp is helpful and really knows her subject (lab kinda sucks however).
She talks sort of fast, but you can ask questions when you need to.  The tests are straight from the notes.  A pretty good class, but the lab is poorly structured.

Vacher is an exemplary teacher. He doesn't tell you anything--he shows you everything. For Ancient Philosophy, he demonstrated an utter mastery of the texts taught, and, with the class, he recreated how the ancient's thought. His teaching is something you will not find just anywhere, more than likely nowhere else. He doesn't lecture, he teaches.

He's a great guy and is very intelligent, but as far as teaching goes, he's not the greatest. He's not very clear in his explanations and his slides/lectures in general aren't very organized. However, the class itself was not very difficult and I did enjoy the course material.

Vacher is a really nice guy but he's not the best teacher there is. He has dificulties conveying knowledge to his students and his classes are highly subjective and VERY DIFFICULT. He's pretty goofy (which is really funny) but he gets confused sometimes and ends up getting his students confused too. I honestly don't think he's made for teaching

Nate is a nice guy, but his class is WAY to hard! I took this class as an elective, and it was my hardest by far!! The tests are very complex and long. The lectures are long and extremely confusing! Not bad to look at. Unless you are interested in philosophy then I suggest you make like Forest Gump and RUN.

Vacher is GREAT. I took him for Ancient and Intro to Ethics and I would take him again if he taught other things. He facilitates class discussions while simultaneously teaching. Class was rarely boring. Jokes are an added bonus.

Vacher is way too intelligent to be teaching an Intro Ethics class. The lectures ended up not being over the materials, but rather over obscure questions from one student who monopolized discussion. He is obviously passionate about the subject, he just can't convey the passion to someone else. Don't expect him to email you back. Easy on the eyes.
Really cool and intelligent guy, definitely not his fault that Aristotle is just a little over my head. Great lectures!

So as far as a person, Vacher is pretty great. This transcends into his teaching qualities because he too is a student and is super chill. My  biggest advice is to go out of your way to talk to him. If he knows you are trying, he will work with you and make the class more tolerable. I would not take PHIL again though. Too abstract for this guy.

Nice Guy. Grades in my class consisted of two argument critiques, two essays, and reading quizzes. He's a fairly tough grader, but if you show up and pay attention you should be okay. Getting an A may be difficult if you don't already have skill in constructing and critiquing arguments, but visiting during office hours is sure to help.
Super nice and funny guy. Handsome too. Very intelligent. Super hard class. Don't take this class unless you really enjoy and get philosophy. A lot of reading.
Nice guy, hardest class of my life. Books are semi-interesting but papers/tests are hard
He's hard, the texts are hard, but if you actually spend time before tests and papers working through with him he's awesome and you can't go wrong

He needs a lot of work. He does not teach. Instead, he lets the student (who don't really know what they are talking about) debate each other and only occasionally ATTEMPTS to direct the discussion.  TL;DR His lectures lack direction.

he is awful, boring, and horrible at returning emails....pretty much if you ever need him throughout the semester to answer questions you might as well seek help elsewhere. also, he takes forever to grade assignments.
Great teacher very smart and will explain the material to you. He was never late to class and cancled class twice, all year. Very prepared and very good prof.

I really enjoyed this class! He is a great professor and is obviously interested in what he is teaching. The class is discussion based and he values input and involvement. I would definately suggest taking his classes to any person interested in literature.
