Loved everything about the class. He's always willing to help and is absolutely hilarious most of the time. He is incredibly brilliant, and pretty easy on the eyes ;-)
I loved this class, he's so cute too. He's a really easy grader I wrote all of my papers the night before or the morning they were due and never recieved anything lower than a B.

Vacher is brilliant, and I'm not just saying that. He knows the material backwards and forwards, and can analyze the material with a razor sharp wit. He's funny, with an occasionally wry sense of humor. If you do the reading and pay attention to what he highlights in class, you'll do well. I highly recommend him.

I loved this class, and him! The class was very straightforward; read the material, come to class, and you'll do well on the exams. Some of the material may be a little boring, but he is very helpful if you don't understand. He's VERY cute. :)
The man is soooo boring and constantly paces back and forth. He ALWAYS comes to class and ALWAYS takes attendance.
He takes attendence even though he's out A LOT! It was pretty easy, he like to ramble on about ancient greek stuff.
Nathan sucks.  He's boring as one can be.
Vacher is cool...when he shows up to class. Sometimes he cancels if he's tired. : )
No Comments
No Comments

Most days in class were student-led and we didn't get to cover Homer or Plato until the end of the course, which was odd considering our final exam was over Homer. Still, Dr. Dix genuinely cares about the material and his students, and it was always entertaining to hear him go off on a 10 minute tangent regarding something from the reading.

Dr. Dix is a very sweet, intelligent man. Unfortunately, the positives end there. Dr. Dix's lectures were painfully boring. He didn't abide by the syllabus, nor did he really know what was going on some days. Frequently, he'd cancel class after staring at us in silence for 5-10 minutes. Easy A, but not worth the boredom and frustration.

Great class if you're looking for a very easy A. He canceled class more often than he held it. The days when we had class, he usually let us out 20-30 minutes early. His lectures were just huge passages of the books we were supposed to read, so you don't need to read anything on the syllabus. I learned next to nothing.
ratingTags_Rating: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment_Rating: Dr. Dix is a nice man. However, he did not stick to the syllabus, giving us only one exam worth 60% of our grade, a participation grade worth 20%, and a final worth 20%. He did not give us back our one exam until after the last day of classes. Thankfully, he graded easily. Would not take again because of the ambiguity in the class.

Dr. Dix was a caring and respected professor, and he always kept the concerns of the students in mind. Though he may be absent-minded at times, he tailors the course to fit the students' needs. The simulation of the Roman Senate is a blast and makes the whole class worth it. Regarding the tests, they were easy if you study in groups.
Great Professor. Show up and participate, he will make it worth your time.

At first glance, Dr. Dix may not seem like a great professor, but if you give him an honest chance and be engaged in his lectures then the class will be worthwhile. The Roman senate game runs for about 3 weeks and is extremely fun and things start heat up when you do drastic things like attack Rome. Overall easy class, take him.

Dr. Dix  once you get to know him, he really made my semester worth it! I can tell how much he values me as a student and how passionate and knowledgeable he is! One of my favorite professors! Don't miss the chance to take a class with him!!
I took this Ovid class as a freshman, and Dr. Dix could not have been more helpful. He was more than fair with his tests, and he was a great teacher to learn from.
Dr. Dix is a great guy, but class can be boring. He has a lot of cool stories and facts to share though.

Great professor. There's a ton of complex Greek grammar in the second semester but Dr. Dix makes it much easier to grasp. He often makes hilarious references when explaining various bits of grammar. There are many quizzes and tests but, as many have said, they help to enhance the learning process. You'll learn alot!

Honors section. great great great. an awesome guy, an easy A, a fun class at times. the roman senate simulation you do the second half of the year is a lot of fun. he is an extremely easy grader and a big baseball fan. take his class if you need classics credit.
No Comments
He is not only one of the best professors I have ever had, but actually one of the nicest people i have met. Wonderful treeasure for the University. Take anything he teaches

Prof. Dix managed to make a very difficult language (Ancient Greek) rather easy to grasp. He was always very pleasant and willing to help if you didn't understand something. There were a lot of quizzes, but their use helped to reinforce the lessons and helped me, at least, score better on the tests.

Dr. Jones is really nice. She's pretty clear, and lectures most of the time but is also open to new ideas from students. She doesn't force you to join discussion if you're shy. We wrote two papers and took an in-class mid-term and final in essay form. There is a loneliness about her that strikes you. Take Jones. I made an A.

We only read short stories and write three papers. She will definitely help you with your papers so be sure to let her read them first. She's nice and very open to your opinions in class but doesn't force you to talk. Tough grader, but it's not impossible to make an A. Overall, I would recommend her!!

Pretty straightforward teacher.  Class was mostly discussion, some days it was interesting and other days it was really slow. She cancels class quite a bit, usually at the last minute, which is annoying. But she also doesn't care if you come late, and rarely takes attendance. A very nice person, decent teacher. Pretty tough grader. Oh, and HOT :D

She's a very nice person and very encouraging during discussions- open to different people's opinions. We only read short stories out of a packet she put together. Decently hard grader, but fair. She's usually 5-10 minutes late to class, cancels class a lot! She's definitely willing to meet with you outside of class.I would recommend her class!

For starters, in my 8AM class, she is consistently 5 to 10 minutes late EVERY morning. Which means she tends to go about 5 minutes over at the end of class, when I'm supposed to be rushing to Chemistry next. She also cancels class about once every two weeks or so, and class is EXTREMELY boring!

She is a very nice teacher and very patient during class discussions. Pretty tough grader on papers but will give you all the help you need to make it better. Cancels class alll the time. No novels, just short stories

Ms Jones is a great English teacher. She is very helpful one on one and helped me develope interesting theses for my papers. She has a "bad side" if you show immaturity or disrespect, so be yourself and be honest and you will do fine in her class.
Miss Jones is the hottest teacher I ever had!
PLEASE DONT TAKE THIS CLASS!!! SO NOT WORTH IT... SHE GRADES HARD AND SHE WILL MAKE YOUR LIFE LIVING HELL... OMG
DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  She's a horrible teacher, and she grades harshly.  She does not explain stuff well.  On a scale of 1 to 10, I would give her a -50.

Ouch. She is pretty harsh when it comes to grading papers. I thought I was a decent writer until I had her class. She's a fairly amiable person that tells you what she wants from you, but she still decides that that is not enough. Jones is tough, and sometimes her classes seem monotonous. It's hard to say whether she is a good professor or not.

This teacher was TERRIBLE. Worst lit teacher I ever had. You can do exactly what she tells you to do and she still says your paper is bad. There is no winning with this woman. She seems so nice when you meet her at first but dont be fooled. Get out now unless you want to make a C.

Ms. Schnaiter is a nice teacher but don't expect to be wowed or entertained during her classes. She likes enthusiasm but don't expect to make an A unless you are out of this world. I was decent at writing papers and made a B..... Basically, with a little effort on the papers and showing you have interest to Schnaiter you can make a B.  Okay teacher

She is very down-to-business. Most teachers at least tell a little about themselves, but she doesn't. This makes the class dry and slightly boring. I met with her, and if you show her you want to do well, she will like you. Not the best lit teacher, but not the worst either.

This class was not easy.  She is very helpful and makes herself available to you.  You will put in a lot of effort and the first paper is graded harshly.  She is very picky on grammar, spelling, and punctuation.  The class is kind of boring, but overall she is an average teacher but a really nice person and easy to get along with.

Ms. Schnaiter was a fantastic teacher! She's very interesting, and is always available to help you if you have any questions. She definitely knows what she's talking about, but she doesn't talk down to her students. Don't worry if you dont get an A on the first paper, she grades harder at first than later in the semester.

She tough on the first paper, but don't be alarmed you'll do well as time passes.  See her with appropriate questions, and she'll be willing to help.  Schnaiter is very intelligent and can help improve your writing skills.  Don't be to worried about the much talked about Emma and portfolio.  They're not that bad.

The class is just her standing up there telling you what you need to know about the stories you read, but she grades fairly easy (gets easier as the semester goes on).  She cancels class more than most, I thought.
This class is very boring. It is mostly just her talking about her own opinions. She is really nice though and it would take effort to fail this class.
Engl 1102 was a piece of cake for anyone who remotely knows how to write a decent paper. She's too busy working on her own schooling to take enough time to make this class hard.
No Comments
I strongly recommend his class!! I had NO  interest in any insurance before, but he makes the class so much fun and so easy to understand! Just study hard and PAY attention and you'll be fine!

this guy is the man! awesome class...he has fun teaching and is very entertaining. put in the work he tells you and youll learn a lot and do well in the class. He is not worried about trying to trick you on tests he just wants you to learn the material. take this class

Best professor EVER!!! He's very passionate about teaching. He wants you to learn, whether it's in the curriculum or not. Take him during summer if possible! Tons of real life examples, and he answers all legal questions you present. Fun, energeitc, and personable! MC tests and book helps expand on his notes.
Best professor at UGA!!I never thought I could learn so much in a class. LOVE HIM!!
tests are extremely hard must memorize powerpoint slides and qs come from readings as well. energetic but gets annoying.

the best RMIN4000 professor at uga. requires A LOT of reading. no final, only 4 exams. great professor, one of the best at UGA. pretty funny guy. study hard and you will be fine. the class is very enjoyable

He is truly full of energy every class period and wakes you right up in the morning. However his tests are not as easy as his easy going personality.  The average final grade in the class was a high "C." You MUST read the book YOURSELF to do well on the test. He's more of a great guy than a great professor.

Do not even think of taking anyone but Lankau for any class if you ever get the chance.  To be at such a large institution he is a rare breed and one of a kind.  When you read the comments others have written they are all true he really does care about the students.  Best professor at UGA hands down.
Best professor I had at UGA hands down
Loved this class.

HE IS THE BOMB!!!!i love him, the best professor ever, cares about everything, not only is he a teacher but he is always willing to learn. i cant say enough about him. he truly is superb. you have to study for the class but he makes it all very simple. he is awesome, wont take any other professor if i had a choice.
Great guy, good teacher. Funny, energetic, and always teaching good life lessons. Easy class too!
I loved his class! He is such a great teacher. He makes class fly by with his stories. The tests are not bad, but there is an attendance policy (you can only miss 3).

The best teacher I have ever had at UGA. He makes sure you understand the material and that you enjoy coming to his class. His final is not comprehensive and he teaches his chapters in order. He's knows his material very well and will help you with any legal problems you may have.
I had Prof. Charles for negotiations.  He's fun.  He knows his stuff.  And he's fair.  Highly recommended.
Great teacher, cares about his students.
Very helpful to answer your questions about legal matters.
Nice guy, pretty easy class. Attendance is required, lectures are laid-back. Tests can be confusing so study his powerpoints a lot! Makes class fun!

This professor is fun in class and gives a lot of examples to help you remember concepts. He is totally enamored with the athletes that take his class, which is slightly annoying if you are a "normal" student.  Tests are harder than you would think based on how easy going he is.
Lectures were great. He was very entertaining, but the tests were hard, but they were multiple choice or I should say multiple guess.

If you study, you will make a good grade in this class.  Prof wise, you won't find a nicer man who genuinely care about his students and their well-being on campus.  I would take him every semester if I could.

This class is deceptively hard. The material is way too easy for the difficulty level of the exams. Lankau is a great guy, funny, and truely cares about the students.  If you cant memorize 50 pages of notes to the letter before an exam, you will struggle. But this class has tons of practical application to real-life.
No Comments

Lankau was great for 4000 and 5110. He makes class fun and he is hilarious! Be prepared to study...he is there for help but he is not going to make it an easy A.  You definitely have to work for your grade but he makes it worth your while just listening to him lecture!
Great professor, but tests are NOT easy. You must study to get a good grade, but staying awake in class is not hard.
BEST TEACHER EVER
He is great!  He is vibrant in class and has a great sense of humor. He is always willing to help and cares about his students and their well being.  I would have him for all my classes if I could.

Sr. Wise is easy going and super cool. Most SPAN 3030 classes are strict, but this class was pretty simple. Do the work,get a good grade. I would pick Sr. Wise over most of the Spanish professors in the department.

The class itself is pretty easy. He has a VERY easy-going personality and is willing to help in a second. He is an American so he definitely isn't too strict about accent and such. The class is mostly discussion-based.

He was an EASY teacher. Vocab quizzes are all matching. The main emphasis on the midterms and final is grammar. So basically we learned grammar and vocabulary words plus we read this one short novel. EASIEST class! Studied for the tests for like one hour and got an A on them. Also, he doesn't annoying call on you to participate in class, like some

I freakin LOVE carl! he was a blast. a pretty easy grader. One of my favorite parts was that he speaks castillian for all of you who care about learning spanish and not sounding ignorant lol. he was a ton of fun and i hope to have him more in the future

Carl is an awesome professor and I would definitely recommend him to anyone taking 2002 or 3030. He's very helpful and makes class interesting. Sometimes his classes are a little disorganized, but if you don't understand something he'll go out of his way to help you. Wish he taught 3010, but i'm definitely looking forward to taking 3030 with him!
AMAZING TEACHER!!!!! i could not have gotten an A in SPAN 3030 without him!!!!! GET CARL! HE IS THE BEST SPANISH TEACHER EVEERRRRR!

I love Carl! He's so helpful and really gives great feedback on your papers. I feel so much better prepared coming out of his class. It's a lot of reading but being that it's a req. for the major/minor I would go out of my way for him! Other profs. seem much stricter. Very knowledgeable and passionate. :)

Cool guy. He's so smart and can give detailed answers to almost any question about anything. Even though 3030 is a hard, Carl's class is not stressful. He's clear about his expectations and willing to be flexible.

Carl is FANTASTIC!  The class was so much fun to go to.  His grading was very fair...and by fair, I mean easy.  We had 3 or 4 4-page papers which I did well on (and trust me, I'm not the best writer).  The midterm and final we very straightforward and graded very fairly.  He is fun and understanding... take him if you want a relaxed semester!
One of the nicest teachers at UGA and makes grammar easy to understand. Very helpful -- he'll even help you with papers for other classes.
Super nice and very patient. He’s american so he sympathizes with us trying to learn the language but his Spanish is perfect and sounds native which I think is a great combination.
Nice guy.  Definitely willing to help.  If you are good at Spanish, easy A.  His class is not boring.  He even had review sessions at a Mexican restaurant!

Carl rocks! His teaching method is laid back but his overhead notes are usually structured and comprehensive.  Sometimes you have to make him explain things a little more (He thinks everyone is as smart is he is).  If you ask him for more explanation he always makes the grammar very clear.
Carl is really smart but he's so laid back class isn't stressful at all. Very helpful and very hot!
Classes with Mr. Bellew have been fun. His way of teaching and making difficult things easier so you can understand and remember everything. I recommend him to everyone.
The best! Super nice and always ready to help.
Le professeur is the bomb. He actually helped me to enjoy French. I might minor in it.
He is demanding, but funny.  Online workbook is crap.

Seriously the best teacher ive ever had! I made a B+ but it was because i NEVER talked in class.. if you put forth even a small effort, he will work with you. such a good professor and he is SO funny and has so much personality. i definitely recommend!
Shelton is laid back and really funny. I had Cro and dropped her class instantly.  He has non traditional approach, but I liked it.

He is a cool guy.He makes time to do reviews before the tests and give extra credit.i never went but aced the tests.we sometimes watch a movie or learn slangs for like a whole week and then he tries to cram  everything up before the test which really sucks. Just do your work on time and make him know that you care and you should be fine.

He is a cool guy.He makes time to do reviews before the tests and give extra credit.i never went but aced the tests.we sometimes watch a movie or learn slangs for like a whole week and then he tries to cram  everything up before the test which really sucks. Just do your work on time and make him know that you are care and you should be fine.
Profesor Bellew is a good teacher who cares about his students. Don't be fooled by his laid back approach though.  He can be tough if you don't do the work.

Bellew is very helpful! I had a smaller class, so it was much more personal than a huge class where you never talk to the professor. 5 tests + the final - drops the lowest grade. Lots of other easy grades, like workbook pages and worksheets. Going to class was fun. The textbook is limited, o go to class.

I had him for 3 semesters. A lot of students seem to like him, but I found his classes frustrating. I don't think I learned as much from him as other semesters. Often felt like class time was not used efficiently. After taking him, then having other professors for Italian language, I felt other students in other classes had learned more.
Tough class, but Shelton is laid back about it.  Just be sure to participate and talk in class.  He likes that kind of stuff a lot!
Shelton makes Italian fun!
The class was good.  Il professore likes participation important.  He is much better than the other Italian teachers that I have had.
He's awesome! He makes everything really clear!
Sheltie rocks!  He really made the class fun even though the book sucks.

Nice guy, but not the best teacher. The book for this class was kind of crappy compared to the 1001/1002 book, and he literally types what the book says and puts it on a powerpoint. Not good at reviewing for tests and NO review for the final. I hear Antonelli is better. You MUST study for this class, even if you didn't study in 1001/1002!
He was a great teacher. He really made Italian interesting and fun. I really enjoyed learning about Italy's culture. I really hope I have him again next semester.

Bellew is AWESOME!  He is very helpful and straight forward and makes the class interesting and fun.  We watched movies and played lots of games.  As long as you do your homework and come to class, you'll get an A.
GREAT teacher! uses the book alot. ties in games and movies to make class interesting! take him!
Professor Bellew is great!  Just be sure to participate in class.
This class wasn't too bad. Participation is a big deal to him so be sure to volunteer. I really enjoyed learning about Italian culture as well as the language.
I thought that he was Italian because he knows so much about Italy.  I loved the class, but expect to work.
If you do the homework and participate in class, you will get an A in the class. Don't underestimate his participation and homework!!!!
The class was laid back and fun. I just thought that the book had too much vocabulary words.  Take Shelton's class and you will have fun, but watch out for the vocabulary.
I don't know about his looks, but Professor Bellew uses just the right amoutn of English and Italian.  He knows a lot about Italy, and is really patient with his students.
Yes, he is hot and smart to boot!  He expects a lot from you, but he is always there to help you if you ask. He rocks.  Girls this is the one that you want!!!!

This guy is straight up MOODY. You never know what he's going to be like from one class to the next in his teaching, grading, and attitude in general. Participation is a really big deal to him, so be prepared to answer questions during class. Tests are not very hard if you do the workbook, and though there is homework assigned, he doesn't check it.

Prof Bellew was very helpful whenever you needed it.  He was very interrested in your learning and how you were doing in the class, and pretty much always was available if you had any questions.  His class grade is based somewhat on participation, which makes it easier to learn.

If you check the Key, you'll see that his students make far lower grades than any of the other teachers' students. It's because he doesn't explain the readings well and doesn't grade fairly. Once, I got a low grade on a paper and when I turned it in for a second time, I got a high grade on it although I did not change a single thing. Strange.

First of all, he is NOT that attractive so y'all need to calm down. More importantly though, his class is OK enough. We took quite a few tests and I couldn't seem to squeak out an A to save my life but he is a good teacher and willing to help you as much as possible. Essays are annoying but could boost your grade if you dont suck at grammar...
He is steaming hot, but not easy. He wants to help students to really learn the language. But if Frech is hard for you, it will be hard no matter who you have. He's not bad.

Alright, maybe he IS hott, but his class is as hard as hell.  He definitely knows french, but cannot teach it.  I was a French minor at one time, but he helped me hate French enough to change that.  Don't take Shelton if you want an A, because you won't get it.
Ladies- this prof is HOT! Plus he has a great teaching style. He's not the easiest prof, but you'll learn a lot from his class.

I really loves this class and this teacher.  I don't think that she gives an excessive amount of work and if you just put in effort getting a good grade isn't hard. Also, the online format was really cool-class takes place in a classroom so it's pretty easy to "speak up." I showed up to class, did the work, and came out with a pretty easy A.

She is a nice person, however she is a very strict grader. She believes a C is good work. She also requires an infinite number of daily grades, and many times she doesnt show any regard for the fact that people are taking more than just her class with her due dates.

It's an online class and thats good for lazy people, but it makes it hard to show her the effort you put forth. She is very nice and helpful but she thinks a "C" is a good grade. I came out with a "B" but it was a surprise! Overall, she was pretty good!
I took her online English class. Not only is she extremely helpful, she cares about you and your grade. I will definately take her for other English classes!
She never graded her assignments based on the instructions. She does not want to help her students. She yelled at me for showing up to her office hours.

I took her online. She didn't explain things well, and would often get side tracked by her own rants. Prepare to learn pre-calc by yourself. She's a nice lady, but she isn't the best professor. Will cut you some slack if you have good attendance and decent grades.
Vert tough to take online. Most of the stuff you have to learn on your own. Would not take her online.

This was the worst teacher I have ever had. She genuinely does not know how to form complete sentences. She does not explain material well AT ALL. I had to withdrawal from this class because of her. She doesn't email back, she does not explain tasks, she makes no sense. Would NOT recommend this professor AT ALL!!!!! This was online college algebra.
ratingTags_Rating: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment_Rating: I took Dr. B's course at Gainesville. She is awesome. Explains the material very well, and most of her tests are cut and dry. Homework is not mandatory, but show her you've completed it after the test and you'll find rewards. Great professor.

Dr. Baleuva is a good professor. She was a little hard to understand to begin with, but you get used to it. She likes it when you come to her office with questions. The reviews for the tests are helpful and if you go to her office she is willing to explain things. But she does want you to think too.

She definitely is one crazy Russian, but a real sweetheart. Once you get used to her accent you'll be ok. Definitely go to her office hours, if you have any argument in regards to a test question, she'll just change your grade becuse she doesn't want to argue with you. Nice to find a teacher who actualy wants to help.

Dr. Balueva is one crazy Russian.  Her accent takes some getting used to---but once you do, everything is okay.  She makes jokes out of math to help students remember formulas.  She definitely cares about each one of her students. I'd recommend her to everyone.

she's so nice and wants everyone to do well in her class. her accent is a little hard to understand at first.  go to her office hours to review your JEXAM tests and she will give you half credit, etc.

MUST go to office hours to succeed in this course unless you are a math wiz.  Some of the problems given on our tests could not be calculated by my graduate student friends.  Take her class if you want to really learn calculus, but take someone else if you want an "A."

Dr. Balueva is a wonderful person. Her class is hard and the accent is a little frustrating at 1st, but if u look past that, u'll see that she's a sweetheart. She really tries 2 help her students. Go 2 her office hours. It really helps and she likes it if u go. I highly recommend her.

Dr. Balueva is a wonderful person, but if you don't know Calc already don't take her class... hard to understand.  She definitely will help you if you ask, but help is not always good.  Test are really hard!

Dr. Balueva is a wonderful teacher. She is Russian, so her accent is hard to pick up on..but its easy catch onto quick. She cares about her students and the grade they receive. If you go to her office hours, she will help you with any and everything. I definately reccommend her! :)

We read Plato's Republic and it was a hell of a lot more interesting than I thought it'd be. Bloom is a "just" teacher, but if you don't want to work or participate, stay away from him and philosophy.
Why doesn't he have a million hot points?!  Besides that, he is a notoriously difficult teacher and not for the faint of heart.  Or will.  Or will to power.  Or whatever.

He's one of those instructors that you hate and love at the same time. He's smarmy, and he picks on people, and he tries to be threatening, but it's not particularly effective. He grades quite harshly, but you'll feel like you've learned something important once you're done.

Bloom tells everyone on the first day that things will be hard and he was not joking! He forces you to think like you've never thought before! Also, either he is late for class and office hours or it takes a month for him to grade one assignment (sometimes longer)! If you could find someone better for this class do so, if not...be willing to work!

Interesting class but very challenging.  Perhaps it is the material.  Perhaps it is the Professor.  Overall the course leaves one confused during, but, at least in my case, satisfied in the end.  He is not lying when he says that it is TOUGH.  Do not underestimate that fact.

If you are looking for a challenge then this is the class for you. Do not take this class if you aren't prepared to work a lot and possibly give yourself a headache by thinking so hard. Work hard and go to office hours if you need help. You will have to write and re-write your paper in order to get a decent grade.

WONDERFUL class. What an experience! Prepare to stay up all night thinking, REALLY thinking--I mean using parts of your brain you never knew were there. If you are interested in philosophy or if you want to greatly improve your reading and writing skills, don't miss out on this class. When you finish this course, you'll be proud of yourself.

Bloom starts the first day by telling you to drop because it's "way too hard for a 2200 level class" (his words). Listen to him. He never stays on schedule and things get harder after midterm. An 80 is an A for him because everything is just too hard. It's an interesting topic, but find a different prof. He should be teaching upper level stuff.

This is NOT a good intro class to take. He obviously is good at what he does, but you need to have sincere interest in the subject in order to enjoy it. This class is certainly a challenge, but if you are there for the right reasons, then you will come out better for it. He is confusing most of the time, but helpful if you meet with him later.
i get the feeling he's an awesome ethics teacher but not so good intro teacher. it's a very difficult course but definitely one of the best i've ever taken.

I thought he did a great job explaining some very hard material, especially for a graduate student. The papers are kinda rough, but he is very willing to give help during office hours. Like the others will say, only take his class(es) if you want to get something out of it.

I think that if you recorded this guy into a tape recorder and played the theory he just stated back at him, he’d say you’re wrong because it didn’t come out of his mouth.  Incredibly frustrating.  But, if you kiss his ass constantly, you might do ok.

Very difficult class. Difficult readings. Difficult to make an A. He makes it worth all the work though. He explains the readings well, and while assignments are difficult, they really make you think, and you therefore learn a lot. I would not recommend him if you want an easy A, only if you're up for a challenge.

You'll learn a lot, and he makes the readings (which are very difficult to follow) understandable. However, he basically tells you from the start that every exam is impossible, and it's your job to fail as good as possible. Also, you will be required to write two papers in an attempt to critique and prove wrong some of the greatest philosophers

Do not take this course if you're looking for an easy A (or B for that matter). You WILL work for whatever grade you want. It is not impossible to do well but it takes time. I would only recommend this class to those who are looking to major or minor in philosophy; Bloom will greatly help prepare you for future and harder classes.

The hardest intro course known to man.  Stay away!  Bloom always made everyone feel stupid when they answered questions, except for the 2 total braniacs in class who might as well have been wearing kneepads.

Dr. Whigham has the unique ability to dictate his lectures off the top of his head. His immense experience traveling in Latin America coupled with his Historical knowledge gives him insight that is second to none. It can be tough following along at times, but he makes it fun. Just go to class & pay attention.l
ratingTags_Rating: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment_Rating: Whigham is an interesting lecturer, but his midterm was the worst. It was merely two essay questions that had to be written to perfection in only 75 minutes. I received a D+ and promptly dropped the class. My friend, who took a lot of AP histories in high school, and enjoys history much more than I do, also eventually dropped the class.
ratingTags_Rating: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment_Rating: Midterm and Final are two essays. He expects you to write a 5 star essay in less than an hour and a half for the midterm. 20 page term paper, he would not meet with me to talk about the paper. He would only email me. Whigham knows his history but you have to write his few point or you will do poorly. I will never take him again.
ratingTags_Rating: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment_Rating: Dr. Whigham is very knowledgeable in Latin Amer to 1800. However, he doesn't use powerpoints, and he goes based off his mind/notes to lecture from. It can be hard to follow since he uses a lot of Latin terms that are difficult to understand/spell. His tests are essay based (2 essays chosen to be made out 6 questions). Grading criteria is VERY picky
ratingTags_Rating: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment_Rating: dont buy any books, use wikipedia. ithelped me get an A testHe was the type of proffesor that if you talked to him personally  about the assignments he would tell you he expects from you.  The tests were simple because we had the option to choose what to write about from many topics, and the day before a test he goes over what to expect on a test.

DO NOT take Whigham. All his tests are essay questions that are very subjective, no rubric used. He has taught this class for 30 years so if you don't say it exactly as he wants it, you won't get a good grade. On one essay he left comments all over that said "great, good job" etc, he didn't like when I used the word "easily" in it and gave me a C.
ratingTags_Rating: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment_Rating: I'm a history major, and this was one of the WORST history classes I've taken at UGA. Lecture material was mostly irrelevant because all he wants to do is tell personal stories, which, SURPRISE, he doesn't test you on. Huge waste of time. Made us buy 4 books and we didn't even read one of them. He thinks he knows everything, not a nice guy.

History of Mexico was far more interesting than I anticipated with his personal stories. He has a very unique outlook on history, it was refreshing how he thought many perspectives. I took it in the summer to avoid the 20pg term paper. They key to an A is to approach test essays with interesting arguments rather than regurgitating basic information
The lectures are not the most interesting, but he knows his stuff. He grades really hard and is very unclear about what he wants from you on in class essay test.

Some of his lectures were confusing. It was hard to stay awake. There are only three tests which are all essays. You really have to only know 6 things to pass the class but you have to know them very well. He said he would take attendance one random day in the semester. He never did...

All the lectures come straight from the textbook so if you miss a class it's easy to get caught up. There are two tests a midterm and final that are essay based. They aren't too difficult the prompts are very straightforward. The challenging part of the class is the 15 page term paper.
no comment

Somewhat easy class. Take it in the Summer, so you don't have to write any essay. Really cool guy with many stories to share. Remember this however: don't buy any book in his syllabus. He pretty much explains everything there is to know in his review day, and everything else you can find in wikipedia.
Professor Whigham has extensive knowledge about Latin America, which makes him an effective teacher. He can be a bit arrogant at times, but all in all a good professor
he likes to talk about going to latin america, he has lots of stories

Very interesting lecturer. Knows a lot of random information. The term paper is long (15-20pg) but you choose the topic and he will give you a good head start. The two tests are moderately difficult. Given 6 questions, you have to choose 2 and write an argumentative essay for each. If not intimidated by few grades the I definitely recommend

Dr. Wigham's class is very intimidating. With only 3 grades for the semester, and one of them a 15-20 page term paper, it stressed me out. His lectures are preachy and at times politically incorrect, but his review sessions completely cover the tests he gives. If you dont mind the paper, I would recommend this class,

This guy is AMAZING!!!  He is hilarious, tells the greatest stories, and pretty much walks you through every assignment.  He has three grades: midterm, term paper, and final.  The term paper was a bit intimidating (15-20 pages), but he will help you through the entire thing!  I love this guy!  He is the greatest! TAKE THIS CLASS!!!

He is pretty awesome.  He was been all over Latin America and really knows his stuff.  He makes the class interesting and makes me actually want to go to class.  His test are fairly easy so long as you go to his lectures.  The only downside is a 20 research paper you have to do (Take him in the summer and this gets dropped).

This professor is awesome! He's been to just about everywhere in the Latin America's and has lots of stories about his experiences. The only downside is that you have to type a 20 page paper.However his exams are relatively easy with some studying and class attendence.

I took 4200 (LA/US relations) & 3220... I actually signed up fro 3220, history of Mexico, after taking the first one because I enjoyed his class so much. He is the perfect prof for these subjects because he actually has a background in the subject and can give real insight. US/LA class was more interesting than the Mexico class. still good

Very full of himself sometimes but a smart man with many interesting stories.  The readings are almost useless, since a vast majority of the material is on the tests.  Books better for secondary source documents on papers.  Okay class.

Mexican history is relatively interesting.  If you want an easy A, this is NOT the class for you.  There is a 20 page term paper.  If you communicate with him, attend class, and take notes, a B+ is no problem.  For an A, you'll have to work VERY hard.
He is a sexy beast.

Chief Whigham's History of Mexico is a fairly easy class. I really didn't work that hard and I got a B. He's a really nice guy, his stories are interesting and he's always willing to help. Note: he doesn't help you without adding sarcasm to everything he says. If you don't mind writing a 20 page term paper I highly recommend him.
Avoid History of North American/Latin American Relations.  The lectures were garbled, the exams were difficult (despite extensive studying), and it was impossible to pay attention.

Whigham is a lot of fun and there seems to be no end to his knowledge of Latin American History.  I recommend this guy all the time to friends.  Once you learn to laugh with him when he laughs at you....His class is a LOT of fun.
No Comments
No Comments

Whigham is a great teacher.  He has fascinating stories if you come to class and he's a super nice guy if you drop by the office.  I'm pretty sure he was in the CIA: go to lecture and you'll see what I mean.
Scattered, self-important, and drifts all over the subject matter and even off-topic.  Nice guy, but not one to inspire others.

AVOID. Nicest man, but he is almost always completely off topic (and I mean completely). It is frustrating to attend class every day and learn very little about the actual subject.  When the final came around, was over all the information we should have covered, but didn't. Textbook resource was his own manuscript, which was incomplete.
Truly delightful person - and brilliant.

This class is perhaps one of the best classes I'll ever take in college.  Han's lectures are extremely insightful.  He may seem confusing about what to study.  To do well:  (1) GO TO CLASS (2) Take good notes and study them (3) Don't read the book  (4) For the final, study everything after the midterm.  It's really not comprehensive.

Park is one of the best profs I had at UGA. He does not teach the class according to a lecture outline. He goes off tangent sometimes but it  makes the class more interesting and engaging. His lectures are often inspiring, and it is obvious he loves what he does. I changed my major to international affairs because of this class.

Awesome as an independent study professor. Very informative, though a little skewed in his opinions. Personal opinions aside, he is a respected academic and has much pull around the world. Get to know the man... His TAs do a lot of teaching in his classes.
All he cares about is attendence.  Very disorganized.

The most important thing in this class is to physically go.  He gets upset with those who do not go to class, and he and his TA's keep up with it.  (and coincidently when it comes down to grade time, it matters a lot-- more than normal)  Another prob. was with note-taking; the class was very disorganized, and you did not know what to study.

Prof. Callison is great if you fear public speaking. The class was relatively small (25 maybe) and we got great feedback on each of our 4 speeches from her and classmates. Homework when given was time consuming. The tests come from the online textbook and can be very specific, but she drops the lowest grade making the final optional!
ratingTags_Rating: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--LECTURE HEAVY

comment_Rating: Easy grader on speeches. Test are tricky

She is such a sweet lady! The material from the "textbook: is long and boring, but it is rather easy, which leads to semi-easy tests. You have 4 speeches to give, but she makes them as least stressful as possible.

Interpersonal Comm 1500 with her was way too much trouble for what it was worth. Cool professor, but boring material and a tough grader. Especially with essays and projects. If I had to take either Public Speaking or Interpersonal Comm again, I would take public speaking.

I love this lady and this class. Her classes always have high test averages because she is such a great teacher. Her lectures are very clear and test are multiple choice straight from lecture. You have to come to class but I never mind going, because class usually only last about 35-40 minutes. TAKE HER!!! I wish she taught upper level comm!!!

You can't go wrong with Callison. Classes are pretty much mandatory, but you won't be bored and the subject material is actually interesting/relevant for once in college. You write short papers weekly, and there are 3 tests, including the final, and one big paper. Review for the tests with your textbook and her PPTS and you can make an A.

She is such a nice lady! Her class was really easy, though we did have to write a weekly paper, but as long as you do what she says, you will get a 100 on them. We had two group projects in the class as well, but they are not difficult and she mostly gives 100s.  The tests are also mostly vocabulary and multiple choice.

She's really nice. Her class was just a lot of busy work, but that's prob because i took it this summer. She gives examples for her speeches which really help you with your speech.  group speeches are easier, which we had 3 of. Overall shes a good teacher
She is the bomb dot com!! Honestly one of the best classes I've taken in college. There are no tests, only 3 big speeches, and a lot of fun in class group activities.
She is the bomb dot com!!! Honestly one of the best classes I've taken in college. No tests, only 3 big speeches, and a lot of fun in class group activities. Totally reccommend taking her!
She is amazing! She makes you feel so comfortable and is a very warm person. If you have a speech anxiety then you should definitely take her class.

Take interpersonal comm. with Callison if you get the chance.  It is an easy class, and Callison makes the material interesting through group activities.  Use her study guides for the tests and you should be fine.  She's a nice, fair teacher as she does not try to trick you on exams, etc.
awesome teacher! Very personable and helpful. Classes were on time and acyually a lot of fun.

Dr. Callison is awesome!  Made what could have been a boring class very interesting and fun.  Anyone who has to take a speech class or is interested in interpersonal communication should take 1500 with her.  I'm not going to say the class was an easy A, but you don't have to put forth an exuberant amount of effort to get one.

Take Callison if you have to take SPCM 1500, hands down. All my other friends took another teacher for the same course and struggled and were bored. She is an amazing lady and has the student's best interest in mind. She is fun and easy. Great Great teacher!
Mrs. Callison is the nicest person you will ever meet and the class is easy and pretty fun.  Highly recommended!!
If you have to take speech - you want to take Callison. She's great!!

Yes, this class was an easy A.  However, Marybeth informed us the day before the final that a number of questions (20 out of 100) on the final would relate to a movie and she recommended seeing the movie if we hadn't.  At least watching the movie was more useful than studying for the rest of the final, which took all of 20 minutes.

Ms. Callison is amazing! She's really really nice! I recommend you take this class because the work is not hard AT ALL! You do have to read the textbooks to do the chapter outlines, but it's not that bad. Plus, she's not a hard grader. I loved this class! And plus, ALL the tests (including the final) were OPEN BOOK AND OPEN NOTES!!!! :) ... EASY A!

This class was fun and she is a great professor. i went to class everyday and i had the late class but i enjoyed it u do mostly projects and your papers are little summaries of the chapter nothig serious. i recommend her if you want to take this class it was well worth it. i made an a. she does open book test also

Absolutely AWESOME!! If you plan on actually learning something about interpersonal communication then this isnt your class...the tests were open book, open notes..great teacher nonetheless..always well organized A++

She was absolutely amazing.  Sweetest woman in the world, and extremely fair.  She's really helpful and she genuinely cares about her students. I attended almost every single class BUT she allows 5 absences.  As a SPCM major, she's my favorite of all time.
If you don't like to give long speeches, don't take the class, but she helps you get over your fear of speaking. Tests and finals are mainly common sense.
great teacher. easy class. definitely take her if you can.

Very helpful, very good teacher. Likes to get the class involved by giving very easy assignments that are basically a completion grade in class. There are two papers and 3 tests total. Very easy and actually very interesting...Definitely take this class!

i took spcm 1100 & 1500 with ms callison and enjoyed both classes. she makes the material easy to understand and the tests are fair. study notes, participate, and pay attention in class and you shouldnt have a problem.
An interesting class.  The work is not very demanding.  Three multiple choice tests and two interesting papers (nothing to freak out about)...would recommend to anyone

Callison is the easiest professor I have. She's fun, clear, always late (so less class time), and a very easy grader. She has some fun speech exercises but always take notes and make sure you read. If you don't, she'll throw those pop-quizzes at you like mad. Don't aggravate her. If I could, I'd take another one of her classes. I probably will.

Easy class as long as you attend class. You can miss a few days and still do well however. Speak up in class (she really likes active participation). Very laid back atmosphere and open to suggestions. Class activities do get old but you usually get out early so I guess it works...

Not hard at all. Just go to class and do the group activities. Two papers to write, but one's a group one so it's not very hard. Study lecture notes and you'll be fine. And I didn't buy the book so you can get away without it.
Fun professor who knows this subject well.  Activities in class and lecture notes make this material easy to learn.  Study the lecture notes for the tests and you'll be fine.
She's an easy professor.  She can grade a little tough on your actual speeches though.  But all in all it's an easy A class.  Just don't get on her bad side...definitely suck up, she likes that.

She has a lot of experience and good examples for what she is lecturing on.  I found her class to be a lot of fun and laid back for the most part.  Study for tests by reading the book and using notes from in class.  She is a cool lady too who is easy to talk to about class material.

get on her good side; from day 1 she decides who she does and does not like, and she shows it.  tests were extremely easy if you memorize facts from the notes (got 100s on both of them), BUT she was not so lenient when it came to grading speeches...i tried very hard and got Bs on all; she needs to realize we're not already pros at giving speeches
Get on her good side so when it comes to grades, she will be in your favor. I noticed that occasionly  she would show favortism!

You pretty much copy notes from her overhead all class, they are straight from the book.  B's on all of her test, but she gives so much other easy work that it is so easy to get an A.  She is so nice, she also doesn't mind a lil' sucking up.
She is very nice. Tests are hard. Other easy assignments bring your grade though. Teaches straight from the book.

Most boring class ever. The pop quizzes are nice for grade boosters but I mean its only 20% of your grade. The only other grades are 2 exams and then the final... So not many grades. Questions on exam ARE tricky. Really boring class. Don't recommend.
ratingTags_Rating: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Beware of pop quizzes

comment_Rating: She's definitely not too interesting. She gives 'quizzes' that are just fill-in-the-blank worksheets you fill out while she lectures. They are great grade-boosters. She posts powerpoints on ELC. If you have the time and will-power to memorize all the info on the powerpoints you'll definitely get an A. Questions on exams aren't tricky.
The most boring class you can ever imagine. This class should be prescribed for insomnia patients. Tests are somewhat difficult because the instruction material is hard to comprehend.
Easy class. Download the pdfs and you get an A. She is pretty boring.

Wow SO boring, you can't imagine. Bring your laptop to class & you may be able to leave without falling asleep. Come to class b/c frequent EASY pop quizzes. Don't buy book, all slides online: memorize for test
This is by far the worst professor at UGA. There is a reason that even though the class size is about 15 there are always at least three people sleeping.

Easy A but she is the head of the department and could not care less about her students or the class. I learned nothing and somehow still got an A. Usually I would be happy to take the A, but her class was not worth it.

This is the most boring teacher I have ever had. I have never been in a class of 20 where at any point at least 2 people were sound asleep. She may give a fair amount of As, but they take work and it is not worth going to her class for a whole semester. Geology may interesting, but she is not.

She's great! Has a great sense of humor, so very intelligent, doesn't take things seriously, and genuinely just wants you to learn. You have to read for every class for pop quizzes and class discussion, and her tests are fair. Take this class!

Best class ever! Professor Wilson is just as interesting as her subject matter. She's Austrian, but not difficult to understand at all. Do try to participate in class discussion, ask questions, and absolutely read the material. There are pop quizzes, but everything is graded with generosity and you can exempt the final.

This was the best class I have taken at UGA thus far. Professor Wilson picks interesting things for you to read, and it's actually enjoyable going to class and doing outside work.  This class was so great, it actually caused me to pick up a Comparative Literature major. I highly recommend taking this class!

This class was the jam. While attendance isn't formally mandatory, it's important that you go each day. Professor Wilson is the coolest teacher in the CMLT department, quite literally. There was lots of reading, but it was interesting and fun to do. I highly recommend taking this class! It is SO worth every minute of studying!
I highly recommend Dr. Wilson as a professor. She is def the best in the department.Take any and all the classes she teaches!!!
Dr Wilson is amazing!! She is really cool and so enthusiastic!! She makes class fun and interesting and she grades easy on her tests. I really enjoyed her class and I learned a lot!!

Knows many languagaes, writes books, from Austria. She is incredibly intelligent and insightful. Take her class if you have any electives available. You will walk out with better common logic and expertise.
Very helpful and cute.
She works very diligently with her students.
Her lab was interesting and reasonably fun.  Liked her personally, as she was very willing to help out when you didn't understand aspects of main class projects.
Good teacher, sometimes gets confused. Projects are thrown at you at times, but a very easy class.
He is a great teacher.  He is tough, but he will push you to learn the course content.

I am taking graduate level classes, I took reaction mechanism last sem, and now I am taking synthesis. Hands down, one of the most knowledgeable professors ever.. His tests are really challenging. I have learnt so much in his class.. And he is such a funny guy.. His classes are the highlight of my day..

I had him for my FYOS. The work load wasn't too bad: one presentation every 4 weeks. The problem was he is very unorganized. He never told us any of our grades. Most people were surprised by there grades at the end of the semester. If you take him I would email him or go to office hours and keep up with your grades. He doesn't just give them out

He is a great person to learn from. Not very organized, but he  is incredibly knowledgeable. His classes are a lot of fun and he is humorous and very witty. His tests are very challenging but incredibly stimulating and require you to think a lot. His tests themselves are incredible learning experiences. Every little thing he says in class is useful

Had him for FYOS. George is funny and very nice, but likes to rant. He is very unorganized and doesn't plan or communicate well. This can be very frustrating, especially for an important class (I imagine). Otherwise though, he is funny and his FYOS doesn't require much work, although he does put people on the spot a lot....

Hes a good teacher. He puts people on the spot all the time and is very funny.  His class is hard, but if you pay attention to what he says in class and ask for help you will do fine.  He curves every test dramatically since everybody does bad.  You will end up with a B even if you get a 65% on every test.
Nice professor but very hard course even if you kinda study.

Smart man, unconventional when it comes to teaching style. Very funny! Loved going to his lectures. The chalk REALLY isnt that bad, you'll get used to it and it actually makes you pay attention unlike Hubbard where everything is spoon fed to you. Curves like CRAZY. Tests aren't all that bad either. I would def take him over Hubbard any day!

I was a graduate student 20 years ago.  He is clearly a man with psychological problems. I transferred to a better university and got a PhD with no problem - where he was blocking me at Ga.  Take his courses but don't work for him as a graduate student.
i didnt study for any of the tests and failed ALL of them! so be sure to study if u take with him, otherwise good man. he makes funny jokes but is going bald.

Terrible teacher. All of our grades have been in the 40's and 50's. He still uses the chalk board and its very hard to read in such a large class. You never know what to expect on his tests and they are impossible. Take Hubbard!!!!!!!

George is a great guy. Very humorous and obviously very intelligent. A little disorganized and unclear when it comes to lectures and grading but his class is heavily curved. Which is good considering our test averages have only been in the 40s-50s.
the best on earth
No Comments
Same opinion as the person below.

pretty funny guy.  Though, his lectures are not very organized and often he does not seem ready for class.  He is a procrasitnator.  All exams are based on lecture, so don't dabble too much on the textbook-as the material rarely matches between lecture and the book. Exams are hard.  know all chemical reactions like the back of your hand (hint,hint)

Freaking Hilarious! Its organic chemistry people, its going to be hard. So you might as well laugh your ass off everday in class. There is a nice curve at the end and I can't remember him ever giving out a C. Don't get caught up in your grades.
The class is hard because it is organis chem. He tries to make it easy for you and is quite funny!
Awesome and hilarious
No Comments

He was a great teacher for such a complicated class.   THere is a huge curve at the very end, so dont let the second test determine if you drop the class.  He  is very willing to meet and discuss things. He makes a very hard class easy to sit through and follow

george is a fun teacher but i really did not like his teaching style. he uses chalk in a 300 person class which i found to be arcane and very annoying but he does make class fun sometimes. he is not very helpful when it comes to grading questions, but with material he tries. the class as a whole is ok but graded very hard. STUDY and go to class

He really knows his stuff. Plus, he's kind of hilarious. Classes are interesting and pretty straight forward. Attendance not mandatory. Two papers, three tests (including the final), and that's about it. Not hard to get an A in.

Took his Spring 2010 History of American West, and loved every minute of it. While the topic is my focus, he would be great even if it was not. Papers are creative and tests are straightforward. I am taking his followup class this Spring.

Had him for history of the American West and loved it. Funny, engaging professor who knows a lot about the subject. Must attend class, but the tests are fairly easy. Two papers on two books, but they're not your typical essay--he wants you to use your imagination and create a story!

Awesome teacher.  Really flexible with topics and willing to help you out to make sure you get the paper done. Really interesting with his storys too and he tries to get to know all the students.  If you can, take any of the classes he offers!

I really liked his lectures. He is really sweet, and you can tell he cares when he teaches. He left our class half way through the semester, but the half he taught was much better (in my opinion) than the half he did not teach. I also did not think his tests were that hard.

Dr. Kutal left halfway through the semester, but for the months that he did you could tell he was pretty burnt out. He's a sweet old man, but I think he deserves a happy retirement rather than another semester of dealing with the woes of freshmen chemistry.
IDK if he will ever teach again, but if he does, just dont do it. He should have retired years ago-not mentally fit to teach

Dr. Kutal stopped teaching my class halfway through the semester, leaving the class high and dry to be picked up by another professor. The tests were very unclear, the lectures where slow and not useful, and Kutal was very unresponsive to students questions. Would avoid if possible
ratingTags_Rating: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment_Rating: Dr. Kutal is very nice and understanding however he is not the best professor. He is not entirely sure how to use all the technology that is used in class which makes the class more difficult. However, he hosts review sessions and answers any questions. Also posts all the information online for the students which is great for studying.

Professor Kutal is a very nice man. However, he's not technologically savvy and the class is textbook heavy on an online platform. He's willing to answer questions but he is not very clear and thorough. However, he hosts review sessions and is accessible outside of class. Befriend your peer leaders! Attendance is important for the material & grade.
ratingTags_Rating: Get ready to read--Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment_Rating: This is the most wholesome man. If you want to take CHEM 1210 at any point, take it with him. He is a sweetheart and the class is so easy. My only critique is that sometimes he doesn't teach effectively for the tests, but if you really read TopHat and understand the concepts, you'll do well. This is the most relaxed class.

Great Professor As A Person And Clearly Knows His Stuff But Slow Talker & Doesnt Get To The Point Fast Enough. Very Shallow Class For Not A Shallow Subject. Did Not Explain In Detail & Required A Lot Of Time Outside Of Class To Study For. I Dont Recommend Taking Chemistry At All At UGA . Text Book Is Online And It Wasnt Detailed Enough Either

The Chem department here is overall pretty frustrating but Dr. Kutal is a really nice guy. Everything in the class is pretty structured and the lectures are just what comes from the textbook and powerpoint. He does his best to explain and if you don't understand he'll help you out.
Probably the best professor for Chem 1210. Super sweet, approachable guy who offers ample opportunities for help outside class and genuinely wants students to do well.

Kutal is a great professor and his lectures definitely explain the covered material. Although lectures are informative, they are not always essential to do well, especially if you did well in AP chem. Tests are very similar to past years (go on Koofers), and lab reports are long but not unbearable. Overall, would definitely choose 1312 over 1212.
This class was decent, but SCALE UP classes definitely suck.

Dr. Kutal was very nice and fun to be in class with.  He was clearly knowledgeable about the material and genuinely wanted to help students learn and understand. He was great about helping students prepare for tests; he offered an optional review session prior to each exam and provided practice exams.

Lots of extra credit! Not very hard and way better than normal GENCHEM 2 at UGA. He gives bonus points on the four exams (20 pts) and the 40 points on the final! His tests are easy to prepare for if you pay attention in class, read the book, do the hw, and look over the practice test he gives you and the ones on koofers! A bit easier than CHEM1311H
ratingTags_Rating: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment_Rating: Kutal is very open to feedback, and is an alright guy and professor. Going to lecture is not necessary at all, however. If you read the book and study the old tests on koofers you'll probably get a higher grade than someone who only attends lectures. Also, the Lab is INSANELY difficult!!!  All in all an okay, easy class to take.
ratingTags_Rating: Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment_Rating: Amazing professor. My favorite professor I've taken at UGA. His lectures are clear, engaging, and have real-world examples and applications. Anytime I wanted to set up a meeting, he was readily available and patient with me.
ratingTags_Rating: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment_Rating: Not an "easy" A, but definitely doable! He gives extra credit on EVERYTHING - homework, tests, labs, final. His labs directly relate to the lecture and make you feel like you're doing more realistic experiments than CHEM 1311. Lab reports are LONG (10 pages or more) but you work in partners. If you have a problem, TALK TO HIM.

This man... What a wonderful professor. Our class actually chipped in money to buy him an end-of-the-year present because of how much he cared about us. The subject is Chemistry, so of course its difficult, however Kutal makes the experience so enjoyable. I will definitely miss him next semester. Consider yourself lucky if you get to take his class

Kutal is a wonderful professor. He is very passionate about his students thoroughly understanding the material. He offers extra credit on tests and in labs... Speaking of labs, the reports are very tough (he is also in charge of the lab for this course). Reports are typically 15-20 pages, and pushing them out can be brutal. Still, a great professor

Dr. Kutal is one of my favorite professors at UGA. He is very kind, knowledgable, and approachable. He explains topics in a very easy-to-understand way.  There is an extra credit question on each exam, and a laboratory experiment strictly for extra points. Unlike CHEM 1311H, the lab and lecture are perfectly aligned. Definitely take this class!

Kutal is awesome!  His lectures are so much fun and he is sooo passionate about chemistry!  I truely looked forward to this class every day!  The class is super easy, but I also learned a lot!  He has awesome ties too!

Kutal was one of the best science teachers I have ever had the pleasure of learning from! He is such a sweet, old man and has the coolest ties. His lectures are not super interesting, but they are extremely clear and he will help you outside of class. His tests are pretty easy since he provides  similar practice test to study from and gives bonuses

The lecture part of this class is a breeze. Just look on koofers and you'll find all the test questions. Dr. Kutal is very cool and helpful. The lab is painful (and the only hard part) . Be ready to write at least 20 pg lab reports. The longer the reports,  the higher your grade. Don't be fooled, the final is difficult - look at hard old questions.

Dr. Kutal is the best professor I've had at UGA. He literally wants everyone to not just understand the material but also do well in the class! He goes out of his way on so many occasions to help students, and he makes difficult material seem easy. Such an awesome professor and all around guy!

Kutal makes the subject approachable. I  felt like I had to work a little harder in the class than most people, but the tests were always fair and covered lecture material. This seems to be an elusive concept for most professors, but Kutal nails it on the head. First science class I left feeling confident about actually knowing the material.

Kutal is a great teacher, but you definitely have to work for your grade in this class. The material is difficult, and there are going to be times where you study as much as you can and still don't feel comfortableget the grade you want. He offers many opportunities outside of class for you to get help though and truly cares about his students

Kutal is a great professor for Chem II. He does not go in depth with the material but do expect to do a bit of learning by yourself. He is clear and patient in explaining problems and only tests on things talked about in lecture. All past tests are on Koofers which makes them relatively easy. Lab is a bit rough and tedious though.

He gives extra credit on EVERYTHING (homework, labs, tests) and didn't put anything on the tests he doesn't emphasize in class. Attendance isn't mandatory, but you should really go. Nice guy, willing to help, and actually teaches. Only cons are that the lab sucks and is a lot of work (different from CHEM1212) and homework doesn't match the lecture

Dr. Kutal is an amazing chemistry professor.  His teaching style is very helpful.  He is always willing to help his students if you go to office hours and ask questions in class.  His tests are tough, but if you use your resources then expect to do fine.

Dr. Kutal obviously knows his chemistry and teaches the class well. The lectures can get boring, but hey it's chemistry, not that exciting. Lots of chance for extra credit, and can drop one test. Homework does not correlate with lecture in the slightest, and is not a good representation of what will be on the tests. Lab reports are awful.

Kutal is a great dude, but he is a terrible teacher. In class he touches only on the easy examples, but then choses to test the class on hard, inexperienced problem. DO THE PROBLEMS IN THE TEXTBOOK WITHIN THE ChAPTERS. The only good thing about the class is extra credit, but be prepared to teach yourself everything..
Best chem professor in the department.  Incorporates many real world examples and has you prepared for organic.  Hands down the best professor at UGA that I've had.
Incredibly nice and genuine guy. Helped me get into the class when it was full and loved the class.

Dr. Kutal is a GREAT teacher.  He really cares about his students' understanding of the material and is approachable in office hours.  His tests are very reasonable, especially if you read/study/do the assigned problems.  Do not underestimate his lab reports:  they take time, but they are useful as a study tool and relate well to the class material

This class was pretty hard, especially in the beginning because his exams require much more thought than the 1311 exams did. However, through MUCH hard work and determination an A is possible. It may seem impossible at first, but it's not. You will learn a lot from Dr. Kutal. And he makes class pretty interesting. Plus lab is pretty cool and easy.

Dr. Kutal is an awesome teacher. He teaches the concepts really well and is really helpful if you go to his office hours. The lab is really fun and he teaches it which makes it better. A lot of people complained about the test but they were fair and EXACTLY like the practice tests.

Dr. Kutal's tests were VERY difficult if you are not a chem whiz. His final was next to impossible! He really loves chem and wants to see you succeed but his tests are made for geniuses. His examples in class are much easier than those on the tests. Office Hours are somewhat helpful, but a tutor is def. needed if you are not a great chem student.

Kutal is an amazing teacher! I enjoyed his lectures and he was very interested in making sure all students understood the material. I thought his tests were reasonable. They were very representative of the work assigned and the problems worked in class. A lot of extra credit was available on the tests and the final. The lab was difficult, but I enj

Dr. Kutal is a great teacher.  He knows what he's talking about & wants that for his students.  He is helpful & fair.  The lab requires a lot of time & effort but it corresponds well with lecture.  This class is worth the challenge.

Dr.Kutal is a wonderful teacher. He really cares that his students understand the concepts in this course. His tests are not too difficult as long as you study. The lab reports can be a hassel because they are long, but you learn a lot from it. If you like sciences like me, you will enjoy his class a lot.
The class is pretty difficult, but he really knows his stuff and is always willing to help you. He really cares about how well you do in his class.

His class wasnt too hard (just understand the concepts and you should do fine).  His tests are fair and not too hard.  The most time consuming part of his class is the lab portion.  Get ready to type up long lab reports.

good guy but hard tests. They are fair tests though bc he tests what he says he will; it's just hard. Sadly, you can't really miss class. a lot of his stuff is not in the book so you'll have to sit through class but it's not that bad and it passes by relatively quickly. definitely read in addition to the class though, otherwise you might be screwed

Dr. Kutal was great (like everyone before me said). He does an exceptionally good job teaching and is always willing to help you out if you don't undrestand stuff. His tests were challenging because they make you think. BUT THAT IS A GOOD THING! This chem class was the only one I have ever enjoyed.

__typename_Rating: Very strongly recommend taking it if you can!

comment_Rating: His lectures were intriguing, and I hated missing them. The tests come from mostly classes, but need to read textbook and work ALL problems to understand concepts. Was always concerned about students understanding material. Tests are challenging, but they are fair. Labs line up very well with lecture. I wish he'd teach my other science classes!
He's really good at explaining concepts and giving examples.  He asks for advice from the class, is more than willing to help at office hours, and picks great TA's.  Strongly suggested.
No Comments

Dr. Kutal was the best! His explanations were awesome, and he offered review sessions before every test. Tests were challenging, but the majority of the class did very well! Labs were always closely related to what we were studying in lecture.
Dr. Kutal was a great teacher!  He was always trying his best-doing anything- to help us understand concepts.  I really enjoyed his class.  Plus, he wears funny ties.
Great class. He's awesome.  Beware the final though, it's gonna be harder than the other tests! (Watch for the bad neck ties)
Awesome teacher. Tests are hard but fair.
He is a very good teacher and he cares about his students. The class is hard but not impossible. Makes a great correlation between class and lab.

Hard class, but I think that's the nature of learning a language. He definitely taught to the exams, which was helpful, and you can do well if you put in the effort. He grades pretty leniently on exams, essays, and the final project, but maybe a little harsh on the oral exam, which was really tough.
ratingTags_Rating: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment_Rating: Widgren is a solid professor who is willing to help you learn; however, most learning will be done outside of class by reading the textbook. There is a lot of homework. I definitely felt like I learned, though.

I only had him for a one credit hour conversational Honors French class (at Clemson, by the way), but he really helped me improve my French. That's all we talked in every class. There were a few one-page-or-less papers, but other than that, participation and attendance are the only things that matter.

This class really helped me to increase my knowledge of French and I can read works in French much easier now. The class had only 9 grades which was intimidating but they weren't that bad and the tests required very little studying if you payed attention on class. Participation is key as it will make him like you more and is a chunk of your grade.

Widgren is a really great French teacher if you are actually interested in the language and truly want to improve your skills. He is really knowledgable and willing to help. Yes, he gives work that you have to do,but he grades fairly and takes into account skill level. The only real bad thing is that he takes forever to get grades back

This professor is bad, period!  For starters, you will have tons of work all the time, but he won't hand it back. The guy is boring, has been known to mistreat people he doesn't like, and LOVES TO GIVE BAD GRADES. Enroll only if you want a difficult semester and a D or E.

Kenneth is a pretty good teacher. There are a lot of homework assignments, quizzes, tests, etc. For a beginning level French class, it is very challenging. At the end of the semester, you have to give a 2 min oral presentation to the class. Overall, it was a good class!

HORRIBLE class! Do not take this class with him. You will suffer with countless homework assignments, reading assignments, pop quizzes, vocab quizzes, oral tests, and chapter tests sometimes all in the same week. SO BORING and so much work for a beginner-level class. Also, he is so rude.

Good professor. He knows his stuff and he speaks very clear French. You must attend class or he'll drop your grade like crazy. But he is very knowledgable and helpful and funny. The classes were enjoyable. Make sure you study BEFORE class and talk a lot, he makes a huge deal out of participation and his biggest pet peeve is if you're not prepared.

Really awesome teacher--he's very enjoyable and makes the classes interesting.  The tests include cultural material which makes them more difficult, but they're overall not so bad.  However, it's difficult making an A in the class.  He expects you to speak in French, but he's helpful about it.  He's quite the funny man.
Kenneth doesn not hand back graded papers.

One of the two best French teachers I've had at UGA. Very funny and freakishly knowledgeable. Sometimes inconsistent with grading, but his class drastically improved my understanding of French.  He also picks fun reading assignments.
He is easy to understand when he  speaks French and he grades fairly. He is a good teacher for a language class. He does make you work for your participation grade.

He is one of the better French teachers I have had. He has an American accent when speaking French which makes it easier to understand. He also speaks some English during class so you are not obligated to, like, ask him questions only in French. He follows the book and reviews grammar in class. I'd say he's a pretty good teacher.
decent enough class. Just went right out of the book and followed that along.  Took forever to hand stuff back if he ever did.

Nice enough guy, but i felt like i learned absolutely nothing!  He took forever to give us our papers and graded assignments back (if we ever got them back), and in order to grade us on our participation, everytime we spoke up, he would mark it down in his gradebook... except, he wasn't very consistent...
