Best professor I have ever had and no competition in the accounting dept. He knew the material inside and out and you couldn't learn half of what he taught from a book. A phenomenal teacher who genuinely cared. The Intermediate series is hard either way, but taking a class from Smith makes it much easier.
If doubt there is a better accounting professor on the face of the planet.  Extremely difficult class, but an amazing professor, both as a man and as an instructor.
Hands down is the best prof. I've had in 5 years at UGA.

Intermediate 3 was hard but GREAT with Dr. Smith- He has to be the best teacher I've had at UGA.  His tests are really hard but he will help you make it through-  I would recommend him for any accounting class!

Dr. Smith is hands-down the BEST professor I have ever had.  He is good at making very complex accounting issues understandable.  He is also very helpful and patient during office hours.  At first he can seem a little intimidating, but get to know him and you'll see that he's a very intelligent, helpful, nice guy with a great sense of humor.
Fantastic teacher!!! Get to know him. He's a very nice man.  The class is hard and the tests are long and demanding, but he explains things very clearly and is willing to help.

Dr. Smith is a very demanding professor. Just make sure you know EVERYTHING he says, because he will test you on it. Try not to ask stupid questions because he will call you on it. Stay up to date on the homework, and you'll do ok.

Dr. Smith teaches you what you need to know, but he also tells you a lot of stories so you have to pay attention.  It is hard to follow sometimes in class, but he has a good sense of humor. He tells you what to expect and his exams are very comprehensive and challenging.
Great class, excellent professor!!!
Excellent Class!!! Excellent Teacher!!!
No Comments

He's incredibly challenging and expects a lot out of his students but you will get SO much in return. He's incredibly knowledgeable, approachable, and genuinely wants you to learn. If you're willing to participate a lot and put in effort, take his class, you'll be heavily rewarded.I got a B minus and would still happily take another class with him.
He is a really really nice professor, and he's also extremely knowledgeable.  Sometimes the content is confusing, but he is happy to clear anything up during office hours.  I learned a lot.

Dr. Allen is a very good professor however he tends to be very strict on his grading. If you are going to take him make sure you have the time to do everything perfectly...because that is how he expects it

I enjoy Dr. Allen's classes because of his fondness for polemic statements. However, don't take him more than once.  His content is always the same. He welcomes people who agree with him and those who are directly oppose, but there isn't much room to stay in the middle and still succeed.

I have had Professor Allen before and specifically requested this course, it was not as good, but still worth it.  A note - Prof. Allen has very strong liberal views, I disagree with him on almost every level, politically.  If you work hard and participate your political views don't matter.  I received high A's from him despite our disagreeing.

I like Dr.Allen...but as for the actual class, I didn't really enjoy it much.  Much rather would have taken a different Comp Politics class for the credit.  If you're not much of a talker like me, then you're screwed - participation required.  Class is basically just a bunch of discussion sessions which get old quickly and run together.

This man is a fantastic professor, cares about his students more than anyone I know, and bends over backwards for you if you are willing to work hard in his class. I have been lucky enough to have him as a professor 4 times, and each class has been stimulating, interesting, and always my favorite of the semester.
A great teacher who heavily stimulates discussion and participation.  He really encourages teachers to look outside the box of the United States.  Definitely recommended if you like open debates.

I am a hardcore conservative and I did not think he was that bad. Yes, he loves socialism, but it didn't affect me at all. He has a very unique view of American Politics and I welcomed his opinion, even though I did disagree. He does not give exams, just two papers. He's tough, but fair and did not mark me down when I disagreed with his opinions.

If it is at all possible avoid him.  He is so scattered with his lectures.  There isn't any real teaching involved.  He has a tendency to choose favorites and the use of Webct is ridiculous, who has the time for that? I do not enjoy hearing the conservative opinions of my peers, it only angered me and made me realize how ignorant they are.
He's a fun professor, but he's a socialist.  If you're a hard-core conservative, no, you probably shouldn't take his class.  Likes talking about Sweden.  Personally, I love him.
Very deep, interesting lectures.  He is passionate about the subject.  The tests and papers were pretty difficult.  Class participation is important for a good grade.

Allen is a great Prof.  Dry sense of humor, very thorough in his lectures, WEBCT discussion is a part of your grade, so be active. Papers might seem to be a lot of work, but just ask him for guidance and he is MORE than HAPPY to help you.  Best if you take his Maymester i think.

Took Politics, Film, and Literature from him. Definitely does not favor a conservative viewpoint and grades accordingly. Interesting guy, can be rather humorous, but I don't recommend him due to his bias.
Best professor and mentor a student could hope for!
Dr. Allen is amazing but his class requires a lot of time spent on WebCT.  He really cares about all his students and is a great resource for recommendations and advice.
He's one of my favorite professors at UGA- I learned so much from his classes.  Don't hesitate to take his class.
Too liberal for my taste and it seemed all the conservatives didn't do as well, but he makes it interesting
No Comments

dr. allen makes the class very interesting. although, the papers and tests are pretty difficult as long as you study and keep up with the readings then any student should be able to achieve their goal.
No Comments
No Comments
He is an outstanding teacher!!! Really wants you to learn.

Majel is a very good teacher- clear and to the point. She doesn't seem overwhelmingly interested in associating with her students outside of  direct education but will respect you if you work hard and show interest in her subject. She is very willing to help if asked. The course I took was two and a half hours and time always passed very quickly.
No Comments
She's a great teacher and very nice.
Good teacher, really nice. Learned a lot and really enjoyed it.
Made an easy class way harder than it should have been
ratingTags_Rating: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Tests? Not many--LECTURE HEAVY

comment_Rating: This class is not easy. You definitely have to go to class and pay attention to what he's saying, not necessarily whats on the powerpoint. He posts previous tests which help with tests a little, but they're still hard because they over a lot of information. The lecture isn't always the most interesting, but he is really passionate about the subject
ratingTags_Rating: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Tests are tough--LECTURE HEAVY

comment_Rating: really practical guy for non-science majors. He uploads past tests and reuses some questions. Drops 1 test and 2 quizzes if you dont miss any. You can also exempt the final if you have an A. I suck at science and I ended up with an A (after making a C on the first test) so you might have to work for it but its def doable.
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Would take again

comment_Rating: Great easy science class to take for non-majors. Tests are a little challenging, but he gives you old quizzes/exams to study which are almost exactly like the new test. Pop quizzes about once a week to check attendance, you can work together. He struggles with technology, so you need to get material from lecture. Very friendly guy, dry humor.

Easiest class ever. One quiz a week to check attendance. All his lectures are online and he puts past exams online too. Definitely recommend this class and professor. Super nice guy and pretty funny. 10/10
ratingTags_Rating: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment_Rating: This man is the OG of them all, no hw, few quizzes, and gives you old test to study before hand easiest class ever.

What a nice guy. He loves answering questions after class, even if they're dumb. He is the only person I know who has been an educator for this long and kept up the enthusiasm for his subject and students.

I expected this class to be a lot easier than it was. Pros: drops 1/3 tests, final is optional (if you get an A), drops 2 quizzes (there's at least 1 a week), posts previous tests on eLC, tests are MC, he's snarky. Cons: topics are very dry, he's kind of rude, makes you read 5+ current events for each test & asks specific questions about them.

Lectures are really dry and boring if you're not into Geology, but Roden is a great professor.  10 open-note/open-friend pop quizzes usually on Fridays, drops the lowest 2. 3 exams, drops the lowest one, and if you have an average of a 94+ you don't have to take the final. Definitely don't need the text book, he posts all of his powerpoints on eLC.

Didn't touch the textbook once. The lectures aren't enthralling.. but I definitely didn't mind attending. The prev. exams posted online are basically the same as the exams. Pop quizzes over that day's lecture will determine if you're absent (expect them on Mon & Fri; also he drops 2 lowest). If you show up and study a little you'll make an A.

His lectures were kind of boring and kind of all over the place, but he posts past exams to study for that are almost identical to our exams. We have a pop quiz once a week, and they're open book/friend. 4 exams including final and he drops the lowest and he drops the 2 lowest quizzes. If you have a better option, pick that. TAKE THE LAB THOUGH!!
Very boring, near impossible to stay awake during class. Helpful when asked questions, very knowledgeable.

His lectures are pretty straightforward and so are the quizzes and tests. He gives a quiz about once a week, but you do it with your friends and you can basically ask him for the answer. Also, there are three tests before the final and if you have an A (93) average on the tests and quizzes, you can exempt. He's always there to answer questions.

Class ins't the most interesting, but very easy. Random open note/open friend quizzes for attendance. Drops 2 lowest grades. 3 tests. Drops lowest. Posts previous exams online and uses many of same questions. Exempted from final if you have an A in the class. Don't buy the text book, completely unnecessary.

Go to class cause there are quizzes that are used to take attendance. You can use your notes, computer, other students... he doesn't care. He's a nice guy, kinda quiet and gets mad when people are talking when he's lecturing so pay attention and you'll do fine. Easy class. Review old tests he gives and online to study.

Class is boring. Has like 10 quizzes that are open note and open friend (drops 2 lowest). Then has 3 tests and drops the lowest. If you have an A in the class after the 3rd test, you are exempt from the final. You'll like the class depending on if you get good grades on the tests or not.

Not too bad of a class. Pop quizzes every so often which are open book and friend (drops 2 lowest). If you have A going into final, then you're exempted. Powerpoints are very scattered and hard to understand. If you can get a better professor, then take someone else but he's not terrible. Don't buy the textbook!!!!

A good teacher that is willing to help you out.  It is a fairly diffucult class but he does everything he can to prepare you for the tests.  Just have to study the powerpoints and past tests very hard

Great teacher! Knows his stuff and teaches it well. If you have an A in the class you don't have to take the final. Drops lowest test grade. Don't buy the book. Everything comes from his power points. He does have attendance quizzes occasionally but they are super easy and you can use your notes. Drops a couple quizzes. One of my favorite teachers!

Very easy intro class. I remembered most of what we learned from watching the Magic School Bus. Don't need the textbook. Come to class for the easy open-notes quizzes. Tests are straight from the powerpoints. Roden is knowledgeable, if a rather dry lecturer.
Really smart and knows his stuff, but his lectures can be confusing. Really nice person and willing to help you. Best way to study is to review the previous year's tests like crazy.

Roden's a cool guy, but he's not the most effective lecturer. He knows his stuff though, and he brings up a lot of current events, which is neat. The material's not that hard, but his test questions were pretty tricky. He posts the powerpoints on his website, so go over those a lot before the tests and you should do okay.

very openly liberal even if he doesnt intend to be. doesnt use the textbook, slides are pretty confusing, not very helpful via email. look elsewhere if you can. also is the department head so any problems with him are irreconcilable if your passed withdrawal period.

Easy physical science. Pop quizzes are open note and a breeze. Tests gome straight from his (awful) powerpoints and you don't really have to do any studying except a bit of cramming before the tests. Lowest test grade is dropped and it was an easy A

Easy A. Don't buy the book. Tests come straight from the powerpoint. If you have an A average going into the final, you're exempted from it. I never took notes or paid attention in class; just crammed a few hours before each test and made over a 100 on each one. He curves them big time. Go to class though; does have pop quizzes. Easy physical sci.

Professor Roden is a great guy. He does read slide after slide but he used current events a lot to try and relate to what we are learning. He tries to throw in one-liners too which make everyone smile! You should go to class to take the pop quizzes and tests are ok but he normally curves them. I would take this class for a good science!

Science is not my thing at all & so this was a difficult class for me, but he was very kind to me & willing to help me with my grade after I was in a car accident & that's something most professors just won't do. I have more respect for him than probably any of my teachers at UGA and I'm a junior.

Not a bad teacher but could be more organized. Sometimes it's hard to know where he's coming from. He flips through the power points before you have a chance to write anything down and doesn't post the lectures for like a week. The tests are tricky because they only have 30 questions and he never seems to word things the same way he does in class.

I have more respect for Roden than any of my other teachers. It was an interesting class, the labs were fun and he is a good guy. Also, if you get an A average in all areas then you dont have to take the final!

Prof. Roden has my utmost respect. He is the definition of "tough but fair". The material is voluminous but if you read the book and attend lecture you should do well. We had a really good TA, Sheldon Skaggs and the labs went well with the lecture material. Very essential stuff.

Mr. Roden uses power point during his lectures and it was perfect for me because i'm a very visual learner. He also ties things in with current events so it was easier to understand the material. He has a sense of humor, but you have to go everyday and take the quizzes. The tests can be a bit tricky.
I made a's on every test, but ended up missing a few quizzes and made a c in the class.  Go to class for this one, guys.  It's not a hard class, he takes you on field trips!  ;)
No Comments
roden was a great and very interesting teacher.  his slides and lectures were very detailed and helped me learn a lot and also increased my interst in geology.

There are 3 tests (lowest is dropped) & the final is cumulative. This class is NOT an easy A. You must study for the tests because they are somewhat tricky. Attendence is not required, but there are daily quizzes (open book) & field trips. The teacher is nice & refers to power points for lectures.
Office hours were always constructive.
ratingTags_Rating: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment_Rating: Although I've only had one semester here, I took his FYO and he is by far the most interesting, engaging, helpful, and amazing professor that I have had. He takes time to teach you about the subject and helps explain it to you. He is also very knowledgeable of the programs offered at UGA. Take this class!So fun to learn about and grow tasty crops!
His FYOS Organic Gardening course is awesome. Easy Class and awesome professor. I would recommend this class it's super fun and very chill. He made me enjoy Organic Gardening!
Super fun FYOS for organic gardening; I'm not in agriculture just was taking the FYOS for fun and it's a great one. Really easy, just hang out in the UGardens and eat vegetables every week.
Dr. Knauft is awesome! His Freshman Year Orientation Seminar on Organic Gardening was so much fun! He's a great professor and really knows what he's talking about. Really helpful.
Very good proffesor, very helpful. Take the course, you will not regret it.
Great professor.  I now enjoy organic gardening!

Buckle in for a little, old man with a LOT of spirit and experience. This is a professor you WANT to take! His lectures and the readings can be a bit dense at times, however, he is SO thorough, and wants the best for ALL of his students. Regardless of the class, he wants everyone to grow, learn, and succeed. TAKE HIM
ratingTags_Rating: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Gives good feedback

comment_Rating: The freaking best. Dr. Artelt is so kind and encouraging. He does everything in his power to make his students feel valued and capable. Seriously a rockstar of a human being. Love that man.
He is such a wonderful teacher who truly loves his job! He is so nice and will go out of his way to help you! Please take him! You wont regret it! He also has way cool stories.

Dr. Artelt is by far the best professor I have had since being at Georgia Regents. He is extremely charismatic and loves to have class participation. I would highly recommend his class to ANYONE at Georgia Regents.
One of my favorite professors of all time, but I'm not sure if he is teaching anymore. If you see his name come up though, TAKE HIM. Best Professor Ever!
I LOVE Artelt! I'm not sure if he's still teaching, but if you have him, you're in good hands. It's extremely helpful and enjoys his job very much.

you can basically not pay attention, just do good on the papers. you only really need the book to do study guides unless you really like reading about the subject...it's a good text though. if you do the study guide you'll pass the test, no cumulative tests. nice guy/on the graduate admissions board if you want to suck up.
Great class! He is so nice and helpful! I would recommend this class to anyone! If you do the work, you will make an A.

Dr. Artelt is very passionate about helping people. He's very warm and funny in class, and he does group exercises that lead you to make lots of friends. His class is a lot of fun, and the work is not hard at all.
Very easy class. Its boring at times, but its and easy A. He gives you the power points and a study guide. Tests are exactly like the study guide. And he's extra nice.
No Comments

Basically this class was an easy A, but there was homework almost everyday and only two tests. Granted, the tests are take home and just to give you a heads up, my midterm was an 8 page paper and my final was an 18 page paper. Nevertheless, it was still very easy. Also, his classes are usually smaller and more engaging than other UNIVs.

Dr. Scalise is a nice guy, is willing to work with his students, and will help you learn several things you might have no otherwise.If you're taking the FreshCo course, you won't have to read the book past the first week. He does assign much writing. Follow his guidelines and you'll do well.

Scalise's class is seemingly easy, but his grading is extremely subjective. I attended class every day, made low to mid-range A's on my papers, completed all homework, and somehow wound up with a B+ in the class. I did not find the content of the class helpful, and would definitely discourage you from taking this class if you want a GPA booster.

Scalise is one of those professors that cuts slack to only those students who he likes! The class is very easy, however, his grading method is questionable! The guidelines he follows when grading are not clear!  Needless to say my GPA was lowered because of taking this class.

Scalise is a nice guy; as long as you show somewhat of an interest in his class, he will treat you fairly. He assigns a lot of busy work, though. He gave us the option of either taking a final test or doing a final project. Make sure you take this as the 10 week TR class!

Seriously not a hard class unless you make it to be. He explains everything. He will repeat himself if needed. Get on his good side, his bad side isn't great. I sort of took notes in his class, but they paid off for the final. He gives/tells you everything you need to know if there is work due. The best teacher I have had so far.
THE MAN.

Scalise's class is easy, I took it hearing from others that univ classes are an easy A. He goes a little extreme when it comes to grading and writing papers tho. We did not ever do anything in the actual class, but we had to write a lot of papers. He's really nice but takes his class seriously.

Dr. Scalise is a nice man, but he takes Freshmen success very seriously, and let's be honest, its meant to be an easy A.  No one takes the class to learn how to be successful, they take it for the GPA boost.  He gets off topic a lot which is good since the material is boring in the first place

Fairly easy class, but a lot of work and class isn't very interesting at all. It's sad when you spend more time doing work for a freshman success than for your other classes.  Scalise takes himself and this class way too seriously, and I'm pretty sure the information hasn't been crucial to my success. I wouldn't reccomend taking this class.
so i took freshmen success and let's just say i got a freakin' B in the class like 30% of the other kids. what is that nonsense?!
No Comments
Just complete the work and remotely pay attention to get a good grade
EASY A!!!
She is very helpful when it comes to students. If you don't understand the material she's happy to tutor you. The class is very fast paced so be ready to learn! Her class is fun and interactive!
I loved this professor. She was always on time, and she really made you laugh in class. I learned so much French because of her, and I really am thankful. She was great! TAKE HER.

She's really chill, which makes class nice. You just have to participate if you expect to learn, as is the case with any language class. And if you're participating, you'll probably land a good grade. Tests were really easy for me. I studied a little, but not an incredible amount. 5 tests, 2 "temas" and a final.

I love professor Goldoni!  She's very organized and will clearly outline class expectations.  The workload is consistent, but reasonable, and while she gives a test about every 2-3 weeks, she drops one off of the final grade.  Very funny and nice, always makes class interesting.
I hate her pronunciation in English! Is she doing that on purpose? Very inappropriate as a higher education foreign language teacher but it just IRRIATED ME!
No Comments
not that easy but i really enjoyed her as a teacher, she made me laugh
She basically made the class much more difficult than all of the other Spanish professors for 2001 level.

Sra. Goldoni speaks no English, and moves very fast. Extra points always available to help Participation grade, but it doesn't seem to really help the final score. Sra. is veeery picky about the exact answer and doesn't give partial credit. Take her class if you're willing to work very hard or are a native speaker.

I absolutely loved Dr. Emmelhainz. She is a bit strict, as she requires everyone to turn off cell phones and laptops. Still, I loved her lectures and she was available via office hours a ton. I would definitely take her again!! Definitely go to class as she does assignments in class, and if you're there, you get extra credit on the next test.

She doesn't require attendance, but gives little assignments in class pretty regularly that are used for extra credit on the exams. As long as you study a lot, you'll do fine, but her exams are not easy. Definitely requires a lot of studying but she provides everything you need and posts her powerpoints on ELC.

Makes an easy marketing class more difficult than it needs to be. Constantly tries to trick her students on tests and doesn't even allow students to take notes on their laptops during class. Oh and if she does see you with a phone or laptop she takes one total point off of your final grade and thats just the first warning. This woman is the worst.

Professor Emmelheinz is one of the best professors I have had at UGA. She is very knowledgeable and provides all of her slides on elc. Her tests are hard but if you study that material you should easily pass. She has multiple extra credit opportunities and that really helps. I would definitely recommend her.

Worst teacher at UGA, arguably in the world. Don't take this class. Take it online or over a summer semester.  The tests are made so that even if I had the textbook in front of me I still wouldn't be able to answer certain intentionally tricky questions. The subject material was the easiest of any of my classes yet was graded harder than any other.
Monotone teacher with unnecessarily difficult tests. I'm an Honors student with a 3.9 GPA and I'm struggling because she asks random details on tests. Good luck! Grantham is enthusiastic, at least.
Not bad over all. I got a pretty high grade. Do the extra credit and follow a disciplined study schedule and you should do fine.

This teacher so incredibly hard, and it makes no sense for an intro class. She told me not to even bother staying in the class after I failed the first test. She told me in order for me to pass the class pigs would have to start fly. Incredibly rude and hard beyond belief.

Her tests are hard, so you will have to study, but Professor Emmelhainz is more than happy to sit down and answer any questions you have. Just don't expect a very high grade unless you have no life or a photographic memory.

RIDICULOUS PROFESSOR EVER! She grades test harder than it shouldn't be. Her lectures are non-stop train. She lectures fast, it almost seems like she's trying to crunch in everything in one day. NEVER recommend her!

Dr. Emmelhainz is horrible professor ever! Her grading system does not benefit students & she grades them harder for no reason. I study hard for her tests yet I failed all of her tests. Intro to Marketing class shouldn't be this hard for all students NEVER EVER take her class. She knows how to teach but she doesn't know how to grade tests fairly.

Hands down the best teacher I have had yet at Georgia. Not only does she have a passion for the material, but she comes to class with a fun-loving attitude every day. Go to class, skim the book for new key terms, and you will do great. She comes across as strict, but she's really a sweetheart and even brought us cookies one day!

Read the book and go to class. Best advice I can give you. She tests on very minute details, but if you go to class she gives extra credit for attendance and curves the tests a few points occasionally. Just be prepared to read a lot and memorize!

This was the worst class i have taken at UGA. She turns the easiest material into impossible tests. Avoid this teacher, and take Grantham instead. She gives you assigned seats, and only allows the first three rows to use laptops! What is this high school? She also takes off points of your final grade for having your cell phone out.. Ridiculous.

This was not a good class. Tests took forever to grade (one test was pushed back 2 weeks - ridiculous, considering I had other tests around that time it was rescheduled to) and the lectures were just horrendously boring and unengaging. Tests were over nitpicky material and were graded very harshly. Only good thing about the class was guest speakers
Tests Over Her lectures, Slides and The book so she can ask about anything on tests, tests are challenging,Class is kinda boring and She takes forever when grading tests.

Generally speaking, Peggy was a great teacher.  She was organized, fair, and cared for her students and wanted everyone to do well and succeed.  She gives a ton of extra credit and curves the exams.  However, she does tend to ask nit-picky questions, so it's obnoxious studying for her tests because you must remember all the little details.

Although her tests are difficult, there is no denying that she knows her stuff. Guest lecturers are almost always very interesting. Attendance is not mandatory, but you get tons of extra credit by being there for the extra assignments. If you take notes on her slides and read the book, you should be just fine on the tests!

Mixed feelings. She does a great job getting interesting speakers for the class and she is full of cool real-world examples and stories. But her tests and unnecessarily detailed and she is way too uptight with the little things. All in all- great lecturer, but the class experience as a whole wasn't great.
Most boring teacher in Terry by far. Her tests are unnecessarily complicated and her lectures put you to sleep faster than Nyquil.

I enjoyed this class! She is very clear, concise, and organized. I think the made the material interesting and used a lot of examples. I used the book a lot because her tests have info she did not cover in class. Her exams were a little difficult, read the book carefully to make A's! Attendance is not mandatory but she gives assignments for EC.

She makes the class way harder than it should be and takes the fun out of marketing. however it is a required course and i heard she's a better prof than grantham. you have to study to pass, thats for sure
you have to come to class for a weekly pop quiz and some random assigned work that she gives you. the class was pretty easy but the tests were too detailed and tricky.

The material in this class isn't difficult, but she makes tests harder than they should be.  She likes to use tricky questions, so be sure to thoroughly read the chapters and go through student notes.  Also, she likes to give alot of assignments that equal one test grade.  She is strict as stated below.  Good luck.

If you are able to remember a lot of what you read, you should do fine. She doesn't go over some of the test material in class, so you have to read the book. Go to class regularly as she gives assignments and clicker quizzes. It was one of my easier classes, but she definately adheres to the plus/minus system in grading. You could do worse.

Go to class for clicker quizzes, kind of difficult to study for because she is kind of meticulous. She always seemed irritated when I had problems to ask her about, try for another teacher b/c material isn't that hard, she is tooooo detailed.

HARD... you have 3 essay exams all memorization. It sucks that a professor cannot find any other way to make a class interesting for a student. If you can avoid her do so, because the amount of reading is out of control, and the test are not fair, specially when she takes lots of points for missing a word. No matter how much you study
Lots of memorization, but the class is well organized and she is very knowledgeable. Go to class and read the book and you will do fine.

Class was hard. Lots of reading. She does not let you ask questions during test. You better have a good memory because the class is all memorization. Go to class to get extra quiz points. Final has lots of material. Overall did not like her or the class. Lots of SPECIFIC questions from the book. STUDY A LOT!
You better study the book even you took good notes.
Very Good Professor. Explained concepts with clarity and made class useful. Watch out on the tests, because she gets highly detailed info from textbook.

She is very well organized and some people thought it was annoying but I can see how it could be required for a class of 300.  However, her tests baffle me.  I am an A student and the best I could do was an 85...she asks random questions that are nothing to do with major points.  READ THE BOOK!
This class sucked.  It didn't seem like I was learning anything in class, then the tests had all these ambibuous questions.  Some people did okay, I just couldn't figure this lady out.

Her tests are very difficult. She tests over minute points from lecture and the book, you MUST read, 30% of tests are from text only. The tests also cover tons of material, way too much for each exam. She does hint at whats on them, but its like memorizing an encyclopedia. Aside from that, she is very nice, helpful, available, and easy to talk to.

Her lectures are BORING.  You take an ungodly amount of notes--it's impossible to study everything effectively for the tests.  Her test questions are very tricky.  She asks questions from the book that she never went over in class.  It's just too much info!  I don't recommend this class.  I'm a Marketing major and it makes me want to change.

I cannot believe how forgiving the other comments are. She is a very militant and uncaring teacher. She picks apart the text book seeking minute points that anyone would gloss over, and then asks that in a test question. Studying six hours for a test got me (a straigh A student) a low B. I know a good teacher when I see one, and she is not it.
So freaking easy. Take this class, but please don't bother going. You'll probably get a better grade if you don't go. Class is too boring for words.

Very boring class, but not too hard. I went to class once every 2 weeks (TR class) or so. All the notes are on WebCT so you can fill them out and study on your own. Tests are straight from those notes except for one or two questions that are from the book. Also have essay and short answer on her tests but not too hard.
She is very helpful, I missed a week of class for medical reasons, and she was very understanding.  However, her class is very boring.

Great Teacher!  She is well organized and really wants to help students.  For ex. if you have 3 tests in 1 day or back-to-back tests she will let you take her test early. She does in-class exercises [super easy] to reward those who come to class and you get 1 point usually and it goes toward extra credit on tests.  I recommend taking her!
She's specific and organized. Go to class, take good notes, read the text for what wasn't discussed in class, then you'll do well on the tests.

Buy the notes at the bookstore.  They're basically the same every semester and it helps studying for tests.  She definitely takes attendance, so show up, but if you have the notes you can still sleep :)
Very organized class.  Uses Bel-Jean packet to fill in notes which is great.  Come to class to get bonus points and to see videos that will be on test.  Tests are very fair.  Great Teacher!!

Dr. Emmelhainz tries to make the lecture interesting and give you incentive to come to class by having class activities.  Her tests are challenging and about 15% of the material is from the book and never covered in class (but she tells you that up front).  Good prof. for foundations of marketing.

Not a bad class for online. The final was worth 50% of final grade but the questions were taken from previous quizzes. There is a lot of reading and terms to learn. I used Quizlet and really learned the material.
ratingTags_Rating: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment_Rating: DO NOT TAKE THIS COURSE!!! I am a Pre-PA student who is most likely losing my 4.0 GPA because of the absurdity of this course... (and this is coming from someone who made a 103 in organic chemistry). Final is worth 50% of your grade and is on over 1,000 terms (spelling counts). She is the most inconsiderate woman I have ever met.
ratingTags_Rating: Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment_Rating: Very helpful outside of class. Notecards helps and so does reading the textbook, but the tests are passable without reading the textbook as long as you go to class and pay attention, as she goes over everything in a more engaging way.

Dr. Corrigan is amazing! Basically, this class is just an hour of story time, but it's very engaging. I will admit that if you don't put in the effort to make flashcards to learn the correct spelling of Greek/Roman names, you will NOT do well on tests! Tests are easy as long as you know who is who, the stories, and correct spelling.

This class in itself is difficult; there is a lot to memorize and if you didn't have 1002 down you are in trouble. However, she is a great teacher and if you do ALL of your homework and ask questions you will do well. She is very helpful if you go and talk to her directly. She will tell you some guidelines for tests. Plus she is funny and nice.

She definitely knows what she's talking about, but this class is not easy. Tests aren't cumulative but you have to know hundreds of names with correct spelling for each test. She focuses way more on names rather than concepts and the breakout sessions were useless.

This class isn't easy, but I definitely recommend taking it. If you read the book before lecture, take detailed notes, & discipline yourself to make notecards (outside of class) AS YOU GO (not the night before the test), then you should receive no less than an A. This class taught me to study well & even infuenced my study habits for other classes.

If there's something to know about Roman Culture, Corrigan knows it. She peppers her lectures with interesting  and humorous facts you wouldn't get otherwise--Catullus' "sparrow" is a good example. She is very good about explaining texts and their context. Tests involve some memorization (all those latin names!) but match her study guide.

Started out boring, but after the first few weeks, really seemed to get excited about the class. Really knows her material. There's a TON of reading every night but if you read and show up you're pretty much guaranteed an A. Great professor!

Lots of reading and powerpoint notes. The first test was an easy A, then the next two, what she said would be on the test versus what actually was, was completely different. What she said not to worry about made it on the test. Study EVERYTHING if you chose to take her.

I can not say enough about Dr. Corrigan. She is an amazing teacher with a fantastic sense of humor and an incredible wealth of knowledge over the subjects she teaches. Her tests are very fair. She gives fantastic notes in class, and if you show up every day and take good notes you are guaranteed to do well on the tests. Incredible teacher / class!

Over-all relaxed feel to the class. Come to class with your translation. Tests aren't hard, but you need to know you grammar/usage very well as those questions are half the test. She's willing to help you if you're struggling; wants you to do well.

Awesome teacher. Corrigan really knows her stuff and has a great sense of humor. The class involved a lot of reading and the tests sometime don't follow what she says will be on it, but overall i enjoyed this course. If you go to class and take good notes, you should be fine.

VERY HARD CLASS! gives decent notes. A LOT of reading! A LOT of memorization! if you are not very interested in the subject it is not a good class to take. i found the lectures to be very boring. only 4 tests which are all really hard. you basically have to memorize every little detail to pass the tests! ):
Easy and fun.  Make sure you know every bullet on her powerpoints and you'll do fine.  Lecture is fun and interesting.

Avoid this class! Corrigan has changed. The first test was an easy 100. Each one after that was impossible. I understand that all of these lower Classics classes require tons of memorization, but you'll need to read and memorize the smallest details and specifics (such as numbers). Only recommended for those w/ unlimited time.

very interesting class and thorough teacher. she tells you everything you need to know for the test, so make sure you go to class. don't buy the book because you can access most of it online. definitely the best myth teacher to take if you don't want to deal with papers or projects since there are only 4 objective tests.

I started the semester off rocky, but ended up with a solid B. The class requires you to memorize a lot of names. A LOT OF NAMES. Attendance is mandatory and her storytelling is fun. She talks fast and I would definitely recommend bringing a laptop for notes. Tests are fill in the blank with no word bank. Do NOT wait until the last minute to study!

She's extremely knowledgeable about the course material. Everything you need to know comes from the notes and the powerpoints. The tests are usually fill in the blank and short answer, but it's all pure memorization. There is alot to learn, but it's very interesting stuff. She is a good storyteller and she relates the myths well.

Good teacher, knows her stuff. Tons and tons of notes. Tests are all writing/fill-in-blank, no multiple choice- they can be difficult if you don't read the literary works (textbook not necessary). Likes putting Greek terms on tests, so memorization is required. I got a B. Don't expect it to be a slack class.

She was extraordinarily knowledgable about the field. While she can come across as boring and disinterested, her sense of humor and passion for the subject made it much better. GO TO CLASS and do the readings. The class is based almost solely off readings. Also, be prepared to take a lot of notes. And I mean a lot.

Holy crap. Corrigan is my favorite teacher I ever had at UGA. These people who commented negatively are probably losers who are in college for their Misses Degrees or your class-skipping x-box fiend. Corrigan knows everything, and I mean everything.

Roman Culture is not what I expected...this class is based off Latin Literature and interpretations of that. If you don't like to read, do not take this class. Although Dr. Corrigan is knowledgeable, she is pretty boring and dry. Her notes are posted online, but the tests are hard and there is a ton of reading.

Dr. Corrigan was quite possibly the most boring professor I've had. She made an interesting subject absolutely revolting. Be prepared for an insane amount of notes; you will be required to remember minor details from the lecture and from the reading. Her sour expression makes going to class a torture session. Avoid her at all costs!

Professor Corrigan is extremely straightforward.  Don't bother buying the textbooks, her notes cover everything you need to know!  I put 80% effort into this class and got a B.  GO TO CLASS, attendance isn't really a factor in your grade but you don't want to miss the lecture.  I would recommend this class to anyone, if you try you'll get an A.

I love Dr. Corrigan! She is the funniest teacher ever. This class is like story time for me, and I enjoy every minute of it! Her tests are very easy and to the point. She might overwhelm you with people and places, but As long as you go to class, you will do fine on the test! She also offers a lot of bonus points. Overall, this is a really fun clas

Awesome professor who knows her materials and keeps my interest with stories. She gives a lot of notes and the tests mirror the notes. Don't buy the book. It's an easy A if you put in a little effort studying the notes.

Not the most interesting professor, but makes up for it with good attitude. Take this prof if you are in it for a latin credit and don't want a rough ride (such as Curtis) and lots of being hounded for not knowing exactly how something should be read.
Had her for Latin and Classics, and she's very easy going in both.  Very open to extra credit.  She's made me very interested in Roman Culture, and I'll be taking the Greek class with Poss next year.
She tells you in class exactly what you need to know; her tests are not tricky. There are a lot of notes, and there is a lot of reading.

corrigan is pretty laid-back,... grade is determined by 4 tests. theres lots of reading assignments but i never opened the book and made a B.  The tests come from 95% of the notes. nice leader with sense of humor, I'd reccomend her.

Nice lady but man she gives a lot of notes. Remember the names and the details that go along with them and you will do fine. I never used the book and I got an A in the class and all I did was study the notes that I took in class. The final was a pain: don't blow it off! The rest of the tests are decent; all fill in the blanks and no word bank!
Best Latin professor I've had so far.  Very easy going and willing to help her students out.  Tests aren't extremely difficult, and she is open to considering extra credit.  Highly recommended!

Amazing LATIN prof. Don't know about CLAS, but she teaches Latin amazingly well. She always has outside readings to suggest. A must take for a LATN major or someone interested. The whole grade was from 4 easy tests. Easy workload, laid back classroom atmosphere. She doesn't always stay on task, but it's always interesting or beneficial.

I was very interested in the material before taking this class; however, this class requires you to go to every class and take impeccable notes.  i hardly ever read, except the stuff the was interesting and still got A s on all the tests.  she gives a lot of extra credit and has a weird dry sense of humor. i highly recommend it though

Ok, I was really interested in this material before taking the class.  However, the way it was presented made me loose interest very quickly.  WARNING: THIS CLASS REQUIRES A LOT OF READING!!  I had to read almost 100 pgs a night.  It can be very confusing and time consuming.  She's very nice, and willing to help though! Just be prepared for reading
SOOOO many notes.  This class was much less interesting than I thought it would be.  If you aren't good at remembering names, DO NOT take this class.

This class was quite interesting, as she has a strange sense of humor.  The class was all lecture (I had to bring my laptop b/c there were so many notes and she talks fast). Tests were fairly easy as long as you study and you HAVE to go to class or you'll be lost.  Discusses the test before she gives it but that doesn't mean it's easy. I got a B.

LOVE her!!  She is truly an amazing professor with a a wealth of knowledge and a heart for teaching.  Yes the syllabus may change, but part of being a social worker is about learning how to be flexible!  Besides, the changes are usually to the students' advantage.  Take her class - she is an intelligent, insightful, caring lady.

Dr. R is a wonderful professor.  Yes, she cancels classes at times; however, she is extremely knowledgeable in her area of practice, and you can go to her with absolutely any problem you are having and she goes above and beyond to help.  She is truly one of my favorite professors in the dept.  and it's nearly impossible to not do well in her class.
Very disorganized, changed the sylabus almost weekly, her opinion is what ultimately counted, missed multiple days of class, expected much but gave little to professional development
Difficult to follow, doesn't come prepared to class, and is very hard to get in contact with. I would not recommend this prof. for a senior level class if you want to gain knowledge.
Confusing, doesn't stick to syllabus, flaky.
No Comments

The hardest class I took for my PhD. I read a novel a week, plus 3 scholarly articles, plus write written responses to each. He graded hard, but read every word I wrote, gave helpful feedback, and really pushed me to think deeper. This class made me into a doctoral student.
Hardest class I ever took but the most rewarding experience of my educational life.

Dr. Taxel is the best professor I've ever had. He was extremely helpful, generous with his time, and willing to listen. I learned more from him in two courses than I've learned from anyone else in my entire life. While the subject matter was challenging and the course demanding, Dr. Taxel was gifted in his ability to scaffold instruction. The best!

In such a short time I have learned so much from Dr. Taxel. You will be enlightened and challenged. Prepare to work hard, but know the results will be worth it! Open your mind and jump right in to this amazing class!

Was my advisor for my specialist degree. Had no time for me. Never remembered me whenever we met. Did not do his part and asked me two semesters in a row to put off my graduation. Worst advisor I had. I did my part and had to force him to do his part. Shouldn't take on more than he can handle. Nearly ruined my chances for graduation. Never again!
No Comments
No Comments

I had never gotten less than an A- at UGA until this class. Centner is very well-informed in his field, but he doesn't seem too invested in the success of his students. I tried to ask questions during office hours and most of the time he answered my questions dismissively or in a way that was so vague it was clear that I had just wasted my time.

Centner is really interesting and will often show you his travels for a little break during lecture time. A really nice guy once the semester gets going and he includes everyone in the discussion (sometimes this can be bad though if you haven't read the assigned chapter for the day and are out of the loop). Don't be scared to ask questions!

He is so dry - I wanted to fall asleep in class everyday. He calls on people randomly so you have to pay attention (and most of the time he asks questions that you haven't learned in class yet). I just did not enjoy this class. Very boring and I barely made an A - he grades way harder than he should.

really nice guy. take good lecture notes. buy the book- he expects a chapter to be read before every class and a case study done on it. then he calls on people randomly throughout class. he doesn't take attendance but if your not there when he calls your name he takes points off your overall participation grade

Great professor, he's super knowledgeable and nice. Reading is pretty necessary, he calls on people randomly in class for answers. For tests, I recommend taking notes in class with a laptop so that you can make sure to get EVERYTHING down. It helps a lot for the tests. Q's from the textbook will be on the test. Super interesting content!

Dr. Centner is a cool teacher with a unique personality! He keeps you focused in class by calling on students at random (which is how he takes attendance), which really helps you learn to understand legal terms and the law. Also, he loves sharing pics of his travels. He curves the tests! Make sure to keep up with your readings every day!

I had him as my FYOS teacher for the class "Going Green." This class is easy but you do have to do some work for it. You have to participate in activities, write weekly paragraphs, and do a group project. Centner is a nice guy but can be stubborn at times if you ask for something. If you don't have another choice you should be fine with this class.
He keeps you involved and interested in the class.
Great teacher! Tough tests; all short answer and must answer specifically.
Great guy, great teacher... definitely a difficult class if you are not into the material. Tests are hard, but there are nice curves.

Centner is probably one of the better teachers I have ever had.  DO NOT MISS CLASS.  Lectures are in-depth and cover a TON of material, but he breaks them up with slideshows of his travels and Q&A sessions.  Very interesting stuff.
Centner is the man. Guy is goofy, but enjoyable.  "RRRIIIIIIGGGGHHHHTTTT"
Very funny and a little kooky, but good.

You will definitely want to slit your wrists in this class. The lectures are painfully boring and no new material is covered from previous classes. His slides are awful, sad when you consider it's a class about design, which he doesn't teach but expects you to know anyway. Tests are difficult and many students complain that they do poorly on them.
not what i like in a professor. others may find differently

Before taking him i had came on here and read what other people were saying about his class so i was freaked out about taking him for summer but he is very great professor i never liked geography in my life and he made the course so interesting and not boring at all he is very helpful just go to him after class.Good professor.

HORRIABLE! Worst class experience of my LIFE! The guy can't teach and is not very helpful at all. I am an A student and had a very hard time doing well on his exams. Your grade is made up of 4 tests and thats it. So if you bomb one, you are pretty much in trouble. If possible, take another class!

You have to go to the lectures and take good notes. While it can be a lot of information, he is very willing to clear anything up during class. It is not an easy A. I studied very hard for 1-2 nights before the test and would end up with mid/high B's after he put a 10 point curve on the test. 4 out of 5 tests without a cumulative final.

I feel bad sayin this but don't take this class. Dr. Hodler is a very nice man but I'm afraid he's not a very good teacher. I'm usually an A student but I had a really hard time with this class. Do yourself a favor and avoid this class.
hodler is really bad plain and simple, just get another professor, one that actually sounds somewhat enthusiastic about teaching

As long as you pay attention, take notes (he gives you the powerpoints online), and use the book right before the test, you'll be fine and get an A.  He's not hard at all as long as you study one or two nights before the test.

Unless you're just enthusiatic about Geography, the material is really dry.  Test cover both lectures and book, and questions can be very tricky.  If you pay attention though and do the reading a couple of times...you should be fine.
I droppped this class because the tests were impossible. He was not very clear about what would or would not be on the test, so I would spend days studying and still get a C or D
If you plan on doing GIS at UGA, take this and any other class he teaches.  He can be hard, but he's also the most understanding and helpful professor I've had in the Geography Department.
AHHHHHHHHHHHH DOON'T DO IT!!!!!!!!! Not only will you do HORRIBLE on the tests after studying for hours, you will also want to shoot yourself during lectures!!!!!!!
Go to class and take notes and pay attention. Skim the book for bold words. Its not that bad.
Awful, horrible, terrible.  Don't do it!
No Comments

I love Mrs. Rumely. She is the best math teacher I have ever had. It is truly a loss that she is retiring. There is really no point in me reviewing her, but I just had to state how good of a teacher she was. Pre-Calc is not an easy class, especially at UGA, but she made it very easy (comparatively) to learn.
Truly cares about her students and an amazing teacher! Happy retirement!!!!
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Caring

comment_Rating: Although I've always been terrible at math, Prof. Rumely made a hard class tolerable. She is very accessable to students and will make sure you pass if you go to her office hours. She has review sessions before every test. Make sure you know how to do the homework and webquizzes and you'll do fine on the tests
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--Caring

comment_Rating: The best teacher ever! Would recommend to anyone, she saved my grade when I switched in from a grad student. Go to office hours which are all the time and she will help you through anything. Precalc is so hard, but she does everything she can to help and works through all the awful WebAssign assignments. Tests are hard because they are on web assign.
WEBASSIGN SUCKS! you have to be very repetitive with the problems until you know your stuff. study hard. it's a hard class at UGA.

Professor Rumely is definitely the best precalculus professor at UGA! She is always going out of her way to help her students! Tough at times, pay attention and study the web assign and you will do well.

Professor Rumely was amazing! She is incredibly thorough and always willing to answer questions.  She stresses the importance of showing up to class and doesn't want phones or other electronics out. She's one of the best math teachers I've ever had.

As long as you come to class and do the suggested practice problems you will be fine.  Don't text in class and be on time and she will love you. The tests are almost identical to the problems in the book.  I had a very good experience with Rumely.

Precalc is a hard class at UGA no matter who your professor is, but Rumely is willing to help you as long as you are willing to put in the effort. Her office hours are ok, but I found the free campus tutoring at the DAE more helpful. Rumely is blunt but does care about her students. Probably one of the better math professors at UGA.

She takes attendance every day. No electronics. She gives good examples and goes into detail, but I found the homework on WebAssign hard because there were a lot of things on there that we didn't really learn in class. Keeping up with the homework is going to help you because otherwise it's kind of hard. Tests are similar to the quizzes.

She is a great, fair teacher. Her examples are very helpful, and tend to show up on the tests/final exam. Going to office hours is helpful. And it is necessary to keep up with homework. Over all not hard to make a good grade if you keep up with your work
Great teacher. She really cares about her students. Go to office hours. Tests are very difficult but she goes over examples that could possibly be on the test.

Her tests are pretty tricky and she is EXTREMELY particular about the way you solve problems. If you pay attention to the way she does them, you'll be fine. She explains and teaches very thoroughly and well. She's a very nice and fair woman. However, you have to be willing to put in the study time!

Rumley tries to make the course as easy as possible but MATH 1113 at UGA is ridiculous. Online computer tests are very difficult but Rumley's examples prep you more than other teacher's examples do for the tests. The ONLY to pass this class is to meet daily with this professor. She is very blunt but has a heart for her students!

Mrs. Rumely is an amazing professor! She clearly explains everything and answers every question you ask until you understand a problem thoroughly! She makes math fun by adding little sarcastic comments and jokes into her lectures. She is an awesome professor so TAKE HER! :)
Very helpful! I hated this class and it was hard! I don't recommend this class to anyone...but if you have to take it, take it with her!

BEST teacher I have ever had in math, and my favorite professor this year. Extremely nice and helpful, makes the work pretty easy, goes as slow as you need. Drops lowest test grade with decent attendance. Take her if you have the option!
very helpful and has plenty of office hours opportunities
She can make sarcastic comments to students, but overall is very clear and helpful.  I would recommend her as a teacher.

She is a tough teacher but means well for her students. she is slightly sarcastic so dont take her somewhat harsh comments to heart. If you struggle with precalculus id definitely recommend you taking this ladies class. the best one id recommend is the INTENSIVE 5 day course.

Mrs. Rumely seem extremely nice at first. Giving the speech of being christian which impress me but by the end I was not. She had mood swings and could be snappy at times. She somewhat knew the material. She made math not really that interesting for me. I would recommend her if your not heavy in other classes.
Classroom setting was comparable to High School. Always willing to help and clear up any misunderstandings. Highly recommended.

She did not know the subject well, especially when you asked her a question outside of what she answered in her previous classes she had no clue. She was very unfair and called students out often. Avoid taking her as much as possible.
I had her for Calculus 1 and she was a wonderful professor! She was very helpful and nice! The class was informative and she made sure everyone understood the material.
very good teacher. always willing to help.  tests are pretty much just like the webquizzes.
She is a fantastic teacher, makes the concepts easy to understand and is always willing to help. Tests are very fair, if you know what you're doing you should be fine. Definitely take her class.

She is very nice and helpful. The quizzes were really easy. Majority of stuff is on webassign. Don;t be afraid to ask for help, she will help you. Tests aren't too bad. you get two chances and they;re on computer. I highly recommend her

Extremely awesome, best math teacher ever, always patient and available to help. She explains things very slowly and clearly. The tests are not as bad as you think they will be, quizzes and homeworks are harder.

Very nice woman! She was awesome in the beginning of the semester, but not as good on the harder stuff at the end. Drops 2 in class quizzes, 3 webquizzes,and 3 homeworks and replaces lowest test with final exam grade. She is always available for help, especially right before tests. great teacher and awesome person. love her.

I Love Mrs Rumely. She is the sweetest lady and is extremely helpful. She loves teaching and will slow things down to make sure everyone understands what is going on. She gives easy quizzes and will go over the material right before the quiz. Tests on computer, but i liked having 3 chances per question. I Highly recommend taking her.

Best teacher EVER! She makes everything easy to understand. She's also very willing to help. Don't be afraid to go to her office hours! She'll answer any questions and it'll probably win you some brownie points. She's super nice and very caring about her students. Tests are on the computer which sucks, but she can't help that. Gives easy quizzes.

She is an awesome teacher.  I have not had a good record for previous math classes, but she teaches in a way that I understand.  Ms Rumely is VERY fair, and most of all she is one of the nicest teachers I have had at UGA.  I would recommend her for everyone.
The best math teacher I have EVER had. She is willing to help and grandmother-like. The course moves quickly, but if you put in the work and go to her office hours you should be fine.
Great teacher, really stresses herself offering help to her students. Extremely nice.

Mrs. Rumley was very clear in her teaching, and ALWAYS was there to help anyone who needed it. I am really bad at math and Mrs. Rumley really explained everything. Her quizes are just like the tests, so you are prepared on test day! I would reccomend you sign up for her class if you have to take Pre-Calc.

This class was a breeze, considering I got an A in Calculus, but that's besides the point. Rumely knows what she's talking about. At times she may seem condescending and all, but she truly means well. Do the practice tests and homework. If you are having problems with the class, do the book assignments or just go talk to her. She is very helpful.

Mrs. Rumely was the best precal teacher i have had. my high school teacher was good..but mrs rumely helped me out alot and helped me understand it better. she also teaches by jexam so it helps out on test and homeworks...her quizes are really easy..i only studied right before class and did well on of them..i'd recommend her over anyone..

She is a wonderful teacher. I struggle with math, but she made everything perfectly clear. Take her class if possible. She even understands JExam, and if it messes up, she will gladly give you your points back (that goes for tests too).

Mrs. Rumely is awesome! Don't bother buying the book. She covers everything you'll need in her notes/examples. Very helpful. Go to her office hours for help. She wants you to. Never went into a test feeling unprepared. I've heard horror stories from other 1113 classes . . . not Mrs. Rumely's.

You don't need to buy the book, she covers everything in class.  For the tests, just do the JExam practice tests a few times and you will see samples of all of the problems that will be on the test.  That is all I did to study and it got me an A.

Great teacher!! Goes over exactly what you'll need for tests on J Exam, and she always makes sense while teaching. Very prepared. I've gone to her office multiple times and she's always been extreme helpful and reasonable. Even if you're bad at math like me, you can still do well in this class. My advice is to do memorize jexam practice tests!!

BEST MATH TEACHER I HAVE EVER HAD!!! if u actually pays attention to her, u will pass this class with flying colors, she explains things very well when asked, she is extemely nice no doubt, i feel asleep in her class everyday, and i sat in the front row, and she would still answer questions i had that she had already answered! love her!

I would recommend her. She is one of those old ladies but she attempts to make jokes and make class interesting. Her teaching is very straight forward and their are no bad surprises on her quizzes and tests. She cares for her students and their personal needs and always accomodates to everyone equally!

Half the time she can't even explain her material and the students correct her frequently.  She isn't very kind, she claims she is very religious (which isn't relevant) but she seems like she doesn't even care about anyone's feelings and will comment on someone if they do badly on a test.  Do no take her, boring and uninformative.

One of the best teachers I've ever had.  Thoroughly explains the material, rather than just spewing a bunch of formulas at you.  Quizzes are short and sweet, covering key concepts, not silly details.  Take her!

Probably the easiest math class I've ever had. Rumely is an easy teacher, but not one who is able to make the class interesting. If you go to class, you really don't even have to study because she goes over the subject matter alot. A nice lady, but seems a little airy at times. If you want an easy A, take this class.

FREAKIN' AMAZING INSTRUCTOR...GREAT TEACHER, WELL PREPARED, AND EXPLAINS EVERYTHING REALLY WELL!  ON TOP OF IT ALL, SHE IS ONE OF THE SWEETEST PEOPLE YOU'LL EVER MEET...AN INSTRUCTOR WHO CARES MORE ABOUT HER PUPILS THAN HER PAYCHECK!
She's very nice, and she explains things really well. I think the material itself is pretty easy to understand, too. Take her!
horrible dont even think of taking this clas DROP now awful!!

Attendance policy existed, but was not enforced.  Pretty EZ class. Didn't read any works, just took notes on everything. Passed with flying colors. Tests r difficult n can seem overwhelming, but if u study the material, it's not a problem.  Sometimes, she has a tendancy to go off on random tangents, but it's just a product of her infinite knowledge

Great class... I didn't know just how cool early English literature could be until I took that class. You HAVE to pay attention during class and take notes (and read the material) to do well on the tests! If you do, they are a breeze!

She's a really great,fun teacher.But there's a lot of work to do in this class,way more than any other Shakespeare and probably more than any other single undergraduate course.We had two 5p papers (1 could be replaced with a monologue),a 7p paper over a critical book,a 15p term paper,and a Final Exam.Plus reading a play a week.Nice,fun,but a lot.
Very helpful and understanding.

I thought Anderson was really easy, as long as you do the reading.  She was really interesting and funny, and we talked alot about everything we read.  Compared to alot of other teachers I've had here, she's not difficult.

A very challenging, but extremely insightful professor. She has a passion for the subject and her enthusiasm is evident. If you want to be exposed in a scholarly way to Shakespeare, the difficulty of this course will hardly keep you from the grade you deserve.

Hard, hard, hard. Only 2 or 3 tests.. and they're killer. She just pulls out like 10 quotes from the works and makes you identify them and explain the significance. Tough to do in 50 min. She treats it like it's an upper level course. She's pretty cool though, and she tries to make old British lit seem interesting.
rather easy teacher, just can go off onto random tangents at times. but overall, a very good teacher.
she is very nice!! The class is incredibly boaring...and u'll know exactly what is going to be in the test! its an easy A.

Dr. Hardaway cares not only for your involvement in her class but, also how you preform in your other classes. Attendance is mandatory and the class mainly consists of 2 tests, 3 projects, and a bunch of workbook homework pages. This class can be an easy A just make sure to the do the work and study at least 30 minutes for the tests.

Beth is a very sweet lady. The class 0is an easy A. The only problem is listening to her talk. She is extremely boring and attendance is mandatory. She gives study guides before the test, do them and you will be fine.

Greatest teacher ever. One of the best people on campus to get on the good side off. Sweetest and most understanding person ever and has a lot of "connections." Become her friend and you'll be fine for the rest of your time on campus.
very very nice teacher. class could be boring but very easy A.
She's the sweetest person ever.  She really does care how you do.  Easiest freaking A on campus.
Bro caps a lot then wonders why he in the situation he in
He needs to put on deodorant because what even was that fr

0/10 professor who practices what they preach!

10/10 sus! 

has a huge ego and is a professional player lol good luck

bro L I E S and C H E A T S on every W O M A N he interacts with, dates like 407274738 at a time then B L A M E S them

no wonder the ratings are so low

beware, the truth speaks for itself
What a mean, rude man.  Stay away from him.

This class wouldn't be anywhere near as interesting if a different professor taught it. Riedl is an expert- you can't talk your way out of a question. His teaching style may be considered unorthodox by many, but its very effective and adds a lot of depth. Plus, he's really cool if you get to know him. Take this class to learn, not to get credit!
Must go to class and read the material. Completely discussion based. Speak up in class and ask questions. Study for the tests and you can do well.

Kai is very interesting, if you can call it that. If you don't read the material (MAYBE 20-30 pgs/class perio)and he calls on you he will basically call you stupid in front of everyone. This class is an easy A (he really doesnt care about grades), as long as you contribute to the class. Attendance is pretty much mandatory.
I really enjoyed the class. If you have an interest in religion you will also like the class. Some of the things you learn will blow your mind!
One of the worst teachers I have ever had.  He is rude, and completely pointless.  I have never been as offended as I have been in his class and I do not plan to ever go back to him.

Great class if you love discussion and learning. If you're in it for the grade, don't bother. He can read you like a book - so don't come to class without having read and think you can act like you read it. Tests aren't hard but sometimes he'll throw you curveballs. Definitely recommend the class if you're not lazy or a whiner like some folks.

Worst teacher I have this semester. Class is boring, unstructured, and unorganized. Nothing you learn or discuss in class will be on the tests and most test preparation will be on your own. This class is perfect for people who enjoy being mocked and ridiculed.
Though scattered a bit for this class, he's probably better in a more defined class structure. And yeah, that tidy artist look works for him.

He is too intense and very in your face - the only professor I have had an issue with at UGA.  I have always loved religion, but I am sorry to say I will not be taking any other class he teaches...  I really do not recommend...

I LOVE Kai! He is by far my favorite teacher and as long as you think about the material and discuss it with him, he will be very helpful and fun. Just make sure that you re open minded and don't take everything that he says too seriously!

FABULOUS PROFESSOR!!!! He is very intense and maybe a bit scary, but he really knows what he is talking about and you can learn soo much! I personally loved the material. but it is VERY important to keep up in the readings. If you don't he will call you out and remember it. But TAKE THE CLASS IT IS AMAZING BUT NOT SO MUCH ABOUT THE GRADE

Kai is an interesting professor, but he expects you to be just as interested in the material as he is. He has a bit of an ego, but it is an enjoyable class if you understand his humor. I recommend giving it a try, and don't be scared off by the first day.
AMAZING! i really enjoyed this class. it was very interesting and as long as you speak up in class you will do just fine! You really should take this class you if you get a chance

He's terrifying. He's incredibly intelligent and great at debate/discussion, but he is very in your face about whether or not he likes you/wants you to do well or not. The reading is intense, but if you do it, you'll learn a lot. But if you don't participate many times each lecture, you won't do well.
He's a really cool and cooperative person. Very laid-back yet insightful.

i think kai's a good teacher.  the quizzes and tests are good.. fairly easy with a few tricks.  could be sort of harsh to some people, but if you do the readings on time, pay attention, and actually think, you'll do well.  also really interesting to talk to outside of class
Horrible teacher, very rude, I'm never taking religion again. Easy, but the worst teacher I've ever had.
No Comments
learn so much from this class..focuses on learning not grades. very easy as long as you participate
No Comments
No Comments

Dr. Rapp is one of my favorite professors at UGA, although his classes should be approached with caution. He is incredibly knowledgeable about his subject matter and he tries to make his students interested in the subject, although at times it doesn't seem to work. He really doesn't pay attention to attendance. Evaluations are all essays.

Rapp assigns a lot of readings and expects students to do a lot of conceptual mapping of those assignments on their own, serving only to illuminate (often in long-winded enthusiastic rambling) issues he or other students find interesting.  He doesn't do the work for you, but is extremely knowledgeable and willing to help.  Tests are all essay.

Rapp is sooo boring.  I hated all the readings he chose for us; post 1700 has some great literature, but he managed to pick out really boring pieces.  Maybe the works would have been better if he hadn't droned on about them for so long, interrupting or talking over any student who attempted to join in the discussion.

Dr. Rapp is extremely intelligent and knowledgable, but, during his lectures, he goes off on insane tangents.  He takes 30 minutes to answer a student's question, and then it's more muddled than before.  He doesn't write anything on the board, he just literally talks for the entire time, and what should you write down?  No telling.  Monotone, too.

I really wish I could say Dr. Rapp was good. He knows TONS about british literature, and is really enthusiastic about it, but shows no enthusiasm whatsoever to students personally. By the end of the course, he knew none of our names and had never had individual conversations with us. He's not engaging enough to be a good professor.

Freeman-Lynde is inaccessible by email. I have not gotten a single response from him all semester regarding the assignments not being posted when they are supposed to be, leading us to not be able to do them. I have had to reach out to the department head several times regarding this matter to have him contact Freeman-Lynda directly.
If you think this is an easy A, think again. The class is difficult due to having to learn the bones and structure. It's a detailed history class. I despised it.

Just don't take the online class. tests are extreeemly hard and you have to memorize every slight detail of the anatomy. unless you love dinosaurs, take an easier elective. This is a class where you work hard just for a B

Dinosaurs sounds like a cool class but don't expect it to be a breeze. The lectures are BORING & no one ever pays attention to them. Professor Freedman-Lynde isn't the most approachable guy either. He does put the powerpoints online & you'll need them to pass. You also have to use TopHat. Mostly, you'll have to learn everything outside of class.

Dr. Freeman made us buy Top Hat but instead of using it for attendance, he made our 150-person lecture sit in assigned seats to take attendance. We took online quizzes on Top Hat which he could have made for free on ELC. Although his quizzes were insanely easy, I would never recommend him because class is SO incredibly boring.

I took both the dinosaurs and sea monsters courses over the summer with Freeman. Class is straightforward. 4 tests consisting of true and false, multiple choice, and a fill in geological time scale portion. You also have top hat questions to do. He is gracious enough to provide the text only versions of his power points. Study and you'll do well.

He reads off the PowerPoint's which are just paraphrases of the sections in the book. Lectures can be pretty boring and tedious. Attendance is mandatory. You can't miss more than 3 times before the withdrawal deadline and no more than 9 or you get an F. Seats are assigned, so I recommend sitting in the back. Tests are really easy, he shows videos.

This guy is the man. A lot of my class thought that since it was an elective about dinosaurs, they'd get an easy A. So therefore a lot of them slacked off and didn't like him. But it was awesome! He's a really passionate professor and it's cute how excited he gets about dinosaurs. Take the class if you like dinosaurs, but otherwise you'll be bored.

I love this man. He's just wonderful. He's extremely knowledgeable and clearly passionate about the subject. He uses really, really dry humor, but I appreciated it. Take this class with a friend, and it will easily become one of your favorite courses at UGA. Movies, dino toys, and a glorious beardy professor. What more could you want?

I love this man. Yes, lectures are pretty dry, but he jokes around and is extremely knowledgeable. This class takes very little effort. You don't even have to go, but if you miss less than 4 classes you get extra points on your final grade. Tests aren't hard at all if you look over the power points. Plus, dino class is a great conversation starter!
