Pros: bonus points on quizzes and for perfect attendance, no outside work other than studying for quizzes, the final is a quiz and not cumulative, don't need to buy the book. Cons: very boring, strict attendance policy, quizzes cover a ton of info, didn't answer my e-mails, messed up my grades and never fixed them. In all, I would avoid this class.

This was literally the most disorganized class I've ever experienced. You don't need the book, the quizzes come from the notes. The lectures are insanely boring, and the quiz distribution and administration is about the least efficient procedure I've ever witnessed. Avoid, there are more interesting easy electives.

Must go to class and get 3 points added to final grade for attendance. Test cover a ton of material. Straight memorization. If you put in time with extra credit u should get at least an A-. Test straight from notes. Don't buy book.

I finished with an A-, never missed a class, and studied ALOT.  He knows EVERYTHING about Geology and if you listen you will too.  I always made 90's on the tests because of the curves, but they are VERY hard.  Don't buy the book and bring a laptop to class. Make sure you take the lab with the class and get Max Christie, he's the best TA EVER!

TAKE AT YOUR OWN RISK!!! it is one thing for the subject to be a bit dry, but this teacher will truly put you to sleep. He is a nice guy and he knows the information, he just doesn't know how to teach it without being insufferably boring. Some say the tests are easy, but I did not think so, plus the final is 38% of the grade.

Great guy, very knowledgeable about his subject, but the lectures are insufferably boring. For the geology portion of the HONS sequence, it wasn't particularly difficult. It's a class about rocks. You kinda know what you're getting into.

Nice guy, but a horrible teacher. Lectures bored me to tears, literally. He often made students feel extremely unintelligent, even when they were asking legitimate questions. His grading scale and style makes no sense and is entirely overcomplicated. There is little point in reading, as the only way to succeed is to be able to read his mind. Avoid!

Extremely fair guy and a cool class. He'll be impressed if you read the notes online before and answer questions in class. Go to class and get 3 points on your average. 7 quizzes, two of which are dropped. The final is a quiz. Cool guy, just don't disrupt his class (basic concept of respect) and you'll be fine. Great material and textbook too!

The most reasonable professor I've ever had. Really wants students to do well. Tests are very fair-no surprises. 3 point bonus on final grade if you come to class. Notes all online with detailed study guides. He's so nice and understanding. If you're a non-science major and need to fill the credit, definitely take this class with RFL!

This class really is painful to sit through. However, the tests are pretty easy, and the built in bonus points are definitely helpful. The attendance policy is kind of strict, but you can just show up and zone out for lecture. It's an easy A, but if you actually want to learn something then pick another class.

FL, great person, but honestly this was my WORST class. The first test sprung up on me.. and I got a C. But the next two I really studied for and got no higher than a 79 1/2. Learn the Geological Time Scale, its on every test. Nice guy, wants to help you, but he's just to smart for his own good. Come to every class he gives 3 extra points to grade.

I cannot put into words how boring this class is. F-L is a nice guy and some days I feel bad for him because without fail 75% of the students sleep during every lecture. All he does is put up power points and then read them, word for word. If you memorize the pps you will do fine but I honestly don't think I have retained one iota of info.

The class is really boring but if you have one absence or less you get extra points added to your average at the end of the semester. The tests come straight come the powerpoints (which he puts online), and it's not even necessary to use your book. It's easy if you don't mind droning lectures.

Freedman-Lynn is a nice guy who knows a ton about DinoSARS, but this class is painfully boring.  It's an easy A if you try and he gives you the notes on powerpoint, but sitting through his lectures is really unbearable. It's NOT worth it, trust me.

Huge passion for Pterosaurs from what I have seen. I know more about Pterosaurs than my own family thanks to him. The class is not the most interesting but you can tell he loves it. Tests are take-home if class desires. He can grade hard so make sure to do bonus and you will definitely get an A. One presentation is done as well.

F-L was a cool cat. His tests come straight from the notes, you won't need to study anything from the book. (I didn't and I got an A) He also let us drop one of the 4 tests (3 tests, 1 final) so only like half the class was present for the final.  Take it and don't miss more than 3 classes.  And you can sleep in class.

He seems to really enjoy what he does! he is clear and easy to understand becuase he forces you to understand topics. If you listen in class and find a way to consolidate his slide shows you will do great in this class. I got a 95 and I don't like geology

I thought that Dinosaurs would be interesting, but he doesn't really do a lot for the subject.  The class mostly consists of you listening to him talk through his slides the entire time.  Never used my book.  Tests are straight from the slides and movie study guides, and he gives example test questions to study by.  Strict attendance policy.

The only thing that keeps him from a horrible rating is that he knows his stuff.  One of the most boring classes I have ever taken.  All power-points, you don't even need your book. He is a really nice guy who is willing to help out, but he's just a bad teacher.

Take class as elective if you are interested in geology. He pays attention to who actually wants to learn. Attendance policy isn't bad and you can bring your laptop to class if you're bored. Study the powerpoint's word-for-word and you can get A's. Extra credit points offered on every test. Stuff he talks about is confusing, pay attention to slides

I wouldn't suggest taking him. The class is pretty boring and he is very particular about details on his exams. You have 3 exams and a final. The final is 38% of your grade and can pretty much ruin your A that you made before going into the final.

Absolutely knows the subject matter! He's the guy to go to. There were an incredible amount of graphs that had to do with the subject, but not at our level.... But, he's really nice, and never failed to be willing to help us if we asked. Tests can be a bit hard because of the way he words questions, but A in the course is definitely possible.

This was one of the easiest classes I have taken yet also one of the most boring.  He would always yell at students for random things and was pretty anal about little stuff.  Overall, couldn't stand the guy.

Dinosaurs. THE MOST BORING CLASS! I really improved on my crossword abilities though. Attendance is mandatory, but it's pointless because 85% of the class is either asleep, on the internet, or doing the crossword. You can print his notes and study guides from webct and that's the test. the tests are pretty easy and he drops one.

Officially the most boring class I've ever taken. He's really nice and knows his stuff, but maybe a bit too much. He has the tendency to label everything on a map (ie: every single plate tectonic or mountain on earth). Tests are moderately hard. I haven't gotten an A yet, but it's definitely possible. Book is so dry though...

He is a nice guy. This class is sort of boring but overall if you read the book and pay attention it's pretty straight forward. Ask questions because he totally takes notice of who is participating and who is sleeping even though he never says anything.

The man taught a class on dinosaurs.  What can you say to that?  Presented in detail that made it a bit dry, but excellent examples.  The giant bones are cool, too.  And you gotta love the video animations.
Amazingly boring and I like dinos. It is easy though.
has attendance policy but exempts one test grade, study his notes- easy A

Lots of visual aids, lots of videos.  Has an attendance policy, and will give lots of quizzes.  A really nice guy and a pushover.  Be careful visiting his office, it looks like a bomb exploded papers everywhere.

Lots of visual aids, lots of videos.  Has an attendance policy, and will give lots of quizzes.  A really nice guy and a pushover.  Be careful visiting his office, it looks like a bomb exploded papers everywhere.

Dinosaurs is an awesome and easy A class.  Dr. Freeman Lynde teaches you most of what you need to know, the textbook is useless, and his practice test questions are kind of confusing w/o answers and explanations.
There isn't much dialogue in class, but out of class he can be helpful.

Dr. Lootens is such a nice person. She is super understanding and very willing to listen and discuss your ideas. The one downside to her class was that the way she worded her questions (essays specifically) could be really confusing, but she's pretty forgiving.
ratingTags_Rating: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment_Rating: Professor Lootens is the most caring professor. She is so nice and super smart. This is my second semester taking her. Her class is pretty easy, in my opinion. All you have to do is write response papers a couple of times a week and there's an ID test (which is super easy) and a few papers. She works around your schedule and is understanding!!
ratingTags_Rating: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Participation matters

comment_Rating: Dr. Lootens's class certainly stands out as one of my favorites at UGA. She has a clear passion for the subject--and wishes the same passion for her students. Some students occasionally complained that she seemed disorganized, but I personally never had an issue; rather, I found her to be easy to contact and helpful on assignments.

Professors Lootens is a great and well-respected professor. She is a hard grader, but gives great feedback on papers. Class discussions were always interesting, but she did not force you to participate. She wrote me two different recommendation letters, but I did have to remind her to do so. All in all, take her!
ratingTags_Rating: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment_Rating: This class was really difficult as someone who isn't good at writing. Lootens is really sweet and very passionate about what she teaches, but she's not very good about remembering to tell you deadlines or other useful information. Office hours are either really helpful or really confusing.

She's interesting and I learned a lot, but when it comes to grading, she's the worst (I'm an honor's student). I know she gave a couple people incompletes for no reason, and she's unreliable in terms of doing what she says she will (don't ask her to write a letter of rec!). She makes you re-write your paper to match *her* reading of the text.

Dr. Lootens is a very kind person who obviously loves her subject matter a lot. I wouldn't recommend her classes to anyone who's not a serious English major, but she's really worth it if you're ready to work -- she offered me invaluable advice on my essays that will last me through my college career. Bonus: she's also very LGBT-friendly!

One of my more memorable professors. Dr. Lootens really cares about her students and is very helpful. I've never had a professor before who is willing to negotiate what will appear on the exams. The    workload was manageable and the grading was fair. This was one of the few classes that I hated to see come to an end. You won't regret taking her.

Disorganized. The class was confusing and we changed the syllabus a good seven to eight times. She was very nice and really loved what she was doing. She's very intelligent but I think she has an unrealistic expectation of the quality of work - she'll tell you to write a one-page response then say you didn't go deep enough. Hectic-paced class.

Her grading scale was confusing; even she seemed unable to explain it. She did not communicate grades well until the end of the semester (when it was too late). Extremely high reading load. Would not recommend.

All serious scholars should avoid at all costs. When in graduate school, she didn't like that I had ended a paper with certain conclusions about the effectiveness of second wave rhetoric--even thoush scholars in my field agreed. She told me to change the ending and I refused, so I got my only B in grad school. Unethical & uninformed.
No Comments
No Comments

I LOVED Lootens! She is so nice and interesting. She knows everything about every author, especially British writers. She basically just wants you to become interested in the readings and write about and discuss them. I would recommend her class to anyone, and I hope to take her again.

I like Lootens, she's very helpful and willing to discuss issues and problems with students.  She appreciates that people get sick and is merciful.  She's interesting and really loves her subject, and helps others learn to like it too.  I would take her again and suggest her to all my friends.
Very knowledgeable

Dr. Wong is my absolute favorite professor.  He is the wisest man I know, seriously.  His background and studies (and age!) allow him to be extremely knowledgable about all aspects of Asian American Literature.  This was one of my favorite classes.  Dr. Wong also really cares about his students.  He is always willing to help.
I also took CMLT with him. Not very easy. Grades unpredictably. Chinese sucks.
dr. Wong is a great guy.. class isnt hard, make a good effort and youll get a good grade. readings are actually pretty good and interesting.

Grade made up of papers and final exam. Gives virtually NO instructions or guidelines for papers but grades them harshly. Incredibly hard to understand and follow in class. I was completely lost the entire semester.  First class I ever made a 'D' in.  Nice guy and very smart, but has difficulty in conveying the message.  Would recommend NOT taking.

pretty fun class for a non-lit major. the readings are gargantuan but you only need to read about a third of them to keep up for the open book final and know a couple themes for the papers. Laid back class and guy. Turned my final paper in 2 weeks late and still got a b+.
Very intellegent teacher and very easy going.

Strage little man, stupid readings, could've been a good class with a different teacher. I couldn't stand to listen to him, he speaks perfect English, but the things he says don't make sense AT ALL. I understand that it's a lit class and they often are a little weird, but I think that it would've made more sense if I was always **** in that class.

This class is miserably boring. Mauldin's lectures are unbearable but thankfully, you don't have to go to class often. The only classes you need to attend are the ones when there are assessments. Overall, the class isn't too hard but it sure isn't fun.

Was not a big fan of her class. She posts hour long video lecture to eLC per topic. There are 7 topics in the semester. Online quizzes are an annoyance to say the least. She makes you download a lockdown browser just to be able to take them. Class itself is painfully boring. Her voice drones on and on. Wish UGA offered another professor for this cl

Worst professor I've ever had. No matter what the material is you're supposed to be learning, somehow her classes always turn into women's studies. She takes attendance and will kick you out if you miss a certain amount of days. Lectures are horrible and unbearable. Feels like a really poorly lead hs class. Good luck trying to make eye contact.

By far the worst teacher I ever had. She has an awful teaching style. And therefore doesn't care if your grade suffers from it. She also makes you stay all 3 hours of the final. Who does that? If the dept knew what was good for them they would get rid of her.  Just don't take her. You don't want to hear her voice all semester anyway
Absolutely terrible. Worst teacher I've had here. Assignments are pointless and time consuming and you have no idea what to do. TERRIBLE

She's nice, definitely isn't as bad as the rest of the comments from people in her 2100 class. She & TA are always available to help outside class. Gives extra credit. Announces quizzes. Imperative to buy book! Class notes on slides & available on ELC, you fill in the blanks. 3 Tests (multiple choice, graphs). NO homework. NO ELC assessments.

I took this as a freshman during the summer and found the class to be simple as long as you ask questions and review notes.  We did have reading assignments but I did not read very much of them and still did very well in the class.  Just ask questions and understand the how to solve the problems and you will do just fine.

Do not take a class with this teacher! She does not help you understand the problems at ALL and they are normally worth have your test grade! Be prepared to teach yourself and memorize her notes. The packet was useless except for one test. Class could have been way better with someone differnt! "Kayyyy" (this becomes your least favorite phrase!

DO NOT TAKE THIS TEACHER!!!! She is absolutely the worst teacher I've ever had. Doesn't explain anything to students. Changes subjects mid-sentence when lecturing. SO FRUSTRATING! Not willing to help. The class is manageable if you are willing to study and figure out the problems completely on your own.

Awful teacher cant teacher worth a flip. complete feminist onl talks about he life stories. And please ppl keep complaining about the grading system unlike the wack job talking about self entitlement. recieving an A- for anyting above a 92.5 is absolutely absurd.

I took her in the summer and glad I did.  Let me remind you this is a 3 week class for 2 hours and 45 min.. We talked about how women were better than men 95% of the time.  She's teaching the wrong subject.  Class is easy yes... teaching is good at all.  Thankfully I took FINA 3000 so I knew what I was doing and what she was doing wrong.

Dr. Mauldin is very nice, the class is easy. All you have to do is learn the problems (not hard) and study your notes; you will do well.  In addition she gives extra credit quizzes(we had 47 possible extra points added on to our TOTAL points) RE:complaining about getting an A-, get over your sense of entitlement the grading structure was stated.

Total idiot. Doesnt have a clue about anything that she talks about. Seems like she just goes and picks up the latest something made easy for retards. She gave me an A- when I had a 92.9. Also told me to see the syllabus when I complained. Join me in trying to get her fired.

Mauldin is known for being the worst HACE teacher. Avoid taking her class at all costs! She doesn't explain the problems and makes the curriculum much more difficult and elaborate than need be. She doesn't give thorough notes and her tests are over material she doesn't cover in class (and are not in the Bel-Jean packet either). Overall, terrible.

Dr. Mauldin has great potential. She is nice and gives good examples for the material. But she refrains from going over key concepts in class if it's going to be on the test. She has also banned laptop use in class due to a few people getting on facebook - it's their grade anyway. Dont buy the book - its practically unused. Be prepared to work.

Fabulous! Mauldin is always very passionate and excited about what she teaches! She also seems very experienced. I have never been interested in economics, but after this class I have much more of an understanding, a lot which has to do with Mauldin's teaching! Challenging class.

She seems very nice when you get into the class but she can't teach this lower level class at all. For 2100 she can't stop talking about her personal life. There are a lot of trick questions on the exam and the practice problems are always way easier than the ones on the exam. DO all the extra credit! It is your only saving grace

Dr. Mauldin is a very good professor. She's perhaps the most experienced and published in the department, even if the coursework is sometimes boring. She never minds re-explaining any concept and is always giving very liberal extra credit. Moreover she has a TA in the class this semester (Jason) who is also very helpful.
took during summer was not easy did not really teach, took her about 45mins to go through 4 slides of powerpoint were it would take any other teacher 5mins, i would not take her again

I felt like I was being taught by a maiden aunt who had information, but was unable to impart it effectively.  Openly bitter about her inability to have children when the topic was discussed in the course of the class, too busy trying to impress with her life experience to be effective.  Don't like her at all, wouldn't take her again.

Is fluent in Japanese, and it's obvious he loves the language and culture as well as teaching. The way he teaches makes even the trickier parts pretty clear, and he's always been helpful whenever I had questions. Great, enthusiastic guy.

This class was my first real exposure to Japanese besides some anime I had watched. Tony-sensee does certainly go off on tangets; however, those tangents have only hindered one class. If you make sure you keep up with the class(dont fall behind) You will be fine. He also posts online lectures which just add another teaching apparatus to the class.

It's obvious that he can speak Japanese. His class was boring, and I hated when he would go off on random tangents unrelated to the course. We finished class early pretty often but he wouldn't let us out early. Instead we had to stick around and listen to him talk about video games. No thanks.

First off, I have no idea how in the world he is allowed to teach the 3000-level course. I was with Sasaki but the class got full and was "forced" to be in his class. The class is totally useless. All he makes us do is translation of Japanese manga. He just does it and hates anyone that doesn't like it.He made me hate the language. Should be fired.
No attendance policy - talks too much in English. expected to hear Japanese. Native assistants were way more helpful.

Tony-sensei will expect you to know more and try harder than the other professors will. He also assumes you have some exposure coming in. If you have no real interest in the language and just want an A, his isn't the class for you. The best thing: he wants you to learn and wants to help. The worst: he expects you to work for it. Seems fair to me.

Tony is the best teacher ever. I wish he taught every class at UGA. He was very helpful and knew a great deal of japanese. Attendance is not mandatory in fact yu dont have to come if you dont want to. But YOU REALLY SHOULD! you wont pass his test if you dont. but if you come to class the test are pretty easy. oh and the textbook is a must. sorry

I think the problem is that he has not taught Japanese before? He speaks Japanese very well, but he seems to be very narrow minded because he imposes his ways of learning onto us. I  also think he needs to speak Japanese in class more. The Spanish course I took last semester taught me more, but I didn't get much out of Tony's class.

He thinks he is a good teacher because he lived in Japan so many years - blah blah blah. I learned nothing in class because the class is too easy. I mean, he doesn't speak Japanese, so we don't get to practice it. It was obvious that he just wants to show off his Japanese ability. His assistants were really helpful tho.

Tony is a GREAT teacher!  His is easily my favorite class. He's fabulous at explaining/teaching and makes class entertaining.  As others have said, don't be fooled by his name. (I wish he was teaching second year too!!)

Tony is awesome. I feel like I have learned a lot of useful Japanese in his class. Don't be fooled by the last name, he may be American but his Japanese is impeccable (the exchange students say he sounds native). His tests are tricky so make sure you study and DO NOT miss class if you don't have to.  You can make an A if you try hard and study.
Incredibly fun professor with a great sense of humor.  Knows lots of interesting trivia and his tests are a breeze if you just study and pay attention in class.  Easy A!

Very funny. He really loves the subject and you can tell he knows what he's talking about. He's an American so it's easy to understand him, and if you go to class EVERYDAY than you will be more than ok.

He's obviously not Japanese. He's American, so it's an interesting learning experience. He has stories to go w/ Kanji and he's pretty helpful. He's definitely better than Fu. You'll actually learn stuff in this class. Oh, his tests are not that easy, so study.
Smart, educated, helpful and funny.  Easy Class if you pay attention.  Teaches cultural tangents as well as the material.
EASY CLASS! You can do whatever you want in class as long as you sit there and pretend you are listening. Japanese freak. Bad breath.

Brewer is not a helpful teacher. He has powerpoints that are packed and he flips through them before you can copy them. He does not post notes online, or anything else online for that matter. He curves the final grades, but I did not know what my final grade would be until after classes ended (70ish  A). He reuses old test questions. Class is hard
Don't show up. Read the book and old tests. Showing up will only overwhelm you. Study at least a week in advance before the test. Lots of structures. SO. MANY. STRUCTURES.

What a joke of a class. He's more of a researcher than professor. Notes don't help at all, just read the book and teach yourself. Only perk: HUGE curve at the end. I literally FAILED every exam except the first (I got a 60 something on that one) and I know I bombed the final, yet I somehow ended up with a C! RECOMMENDED PROF. ONLY BECAUSE OF CURVE!

One of the worst professors I've had. He's boring, his notes are incomprehensible, and so far have been lists and diagrams of half-scribbled words. The tests are mostly fair, but the matching section is kind of arbitrary. The book is little help, since most of what he focuses on is hidden in globs of text and poorly explained.

The man is the professor however he does not teach in the class. His notes are all done by hand and his handwriting is bad, he is not very helpful when you ask questions. The information is presented in a random fashion and I found myself taking notes and not knowing what I was taking notes on. Tests are not that difficult, just memorize, memorize.

He's just a terrible teacher. Absolutely awful probably because he doesn't want to teach. Handwritten lecture notes are way too messy, never really explains concepts, and he's so dull you have to intravenously inject stimulants to stay awake in class. If you study from his notes expect to memorize everything and not understand.

One of the worst professors I have ever had! Avoid taking him! Our class average for one of our tests was a 52. However,there is a major curve at the end of the semester depending upon how well the class does.

RUN!! nah just kidding. He's not that bad. Took this in the summer, but just study old test and know concepts = A. He is really boring though and his hand writings are very hard to read. Writes his notes very fast and when he draws diagrams, you will get lost. Good luck

I don't know what people are complaining about. He is not that bad. Just read the book and compare it with his notes. If you didn't learn anything, then you obviously didn't study. His questions are completely fair. It helps to test yourself with old tests but do not depend on it. Study hard and anyone can get an A even without the curve.
He has changed the version of his exams so the old ones won't help at all, not even from the previous year.  His handwriting is awful and is very rude.

I was curved 35 points. Memorize test 1 for an A on that, that won't help for test 2. Incomprehensible, kind of rude, but has a kind of funny, dry sense of humor. Closes eyes when he talks. Wears a fedora.

I don't know what others are thinking. Brewer is the man. Definitely one of the easier BCMB professors out there. His homework assignments(only 2 of them) contain questions that are similar to ones on the test. Don't miss class since he gives many sample test questions and pretty good notes. His handwriting is pretty awful though. Easy A.

Not a bad professor. Attendance to all lectures is required and recommend going to review sessions. Tests are hard but he gives out old tests and if you look hard enough there are several old tests online. (google him: brewer uga) When studying old tests learn concepts and what he is getting at. Just memorizing the answers will not help.

Brewer is the worst professor I have ever had. He squints like all of the students are shiny, he mumbles during lectures, and his handwriting is incomprehensible. The tests are pretty difficult; the only option is to memorize old tests. He curves the class a lot (like atleast 25 pts). The book is dry and contains lots of useless info. Take Dalton!
Worst teacher I've ever had. He is a walking corpse with no interest in teaching.
He was a horrible teacher. His notes were messy, he mumbled quietly, and his tests were all just memorizing lots of material. You don't learn anything. Don't take him if you can help it!!
Took this in the summer. His notes are hard to follow, but its best to study from them since the book is really detailed. You need the book for pictures though. 81 was an A, which is easy to get.

Saying this guy gives bad notes is putting it mildly. You tend to get more info from the textbook really. But the review sessions and old tests are helpful, since he'll give you example test questions. And there is a generous curve. But if you prefer notes, you're better off with another professor

Hard to follow his lecture, but the book helps a lot.  His tests are really straight forward and are basically spit back.  I thought he was an ass at first, but after talking with him a few times, I think he just has communication problems and a dry sense of humor that people don't get.  Don't be afraid of him and ask what you need AFTER class.

Worst teacher I've ever had. His notes are impossible to follow, and he's so dull in lecture you might as well plan on this class being nap time. To get a C on the tests you need to extensively study his old tests. About his only saving grace is he gives very generous curve. My final average was a 75 which in ended up being an A-.

He is the WORST professor at UGA. Going to class is pointless because his notes dont make sense at all. He hates when people ask questions and never opens his eyes. He hates life in general. To do good on tests, you just have to memorize old tests but you end up not learning anything at all. AWFUL class and AWFUL man. Take a different professor.

This class is boring! To get an A in this class, all you need are the past tests. Just know thoes tests. You don't even need to come to class. The notes are useless. The tests are not too difficult, but there is a HUGE curve. I went in the final with a D avg. and ended up with a B. If you really want to learn Biochem, take the other professors.

Terrible!!!! I am sure that he is a very intelligent man, but he is a horrible teacher.  His handwriting is awful and all of his lecture notes are on an overhead so it is impossible to decipher them.  I wouldn't recommend this class or professor to my worst enemy!!

The most useless sac of flesh ever.  He curves the class at the end (1 77 was an A), but he is terrible.  He hates when people ask questions and doesn't open his eyes (take the course too see what i mean!)

Brewer gives a ton of notes without ever really explaining them; instead, you're required to simply memorize a lot of pointless stuff. Doesn't like being challenged regarding test questions (even if you have support for the answer; there's a "most correct" answer according to him). Study the old tests, or take the other biochem class if you can!

I managed to get an A in the class, but I spent an average of about 30 hours studying old test questions before every exam.  It was a tough class, and the lectures are hard to follow (especially Mendicino's), but if you study the old exams and REALLY understand that stuff you should be okay.  He curves the class at the end which helps out a lot.

He is really hard to follow in class, and his tests are vague. You can make an A if you are able to teach yourself complex material, but a lot of people dropped after the second test. He is not the most helpful person either... but he does curve the final grade a lot (although you have no idea how much he will curve until the end of the class)

this class was miserable. i thought brewer was as bad as it could get, but mendecino took over split semester and was even harder to follow. i dropped the class after the 2nd test. if possible, don't take it from these guys.
I managed to get an A but I studied night and day for 2 days straight before every test and never missed a lecture. Fair class and tests, study the old tests he reuses a lot of questions.

The class was split between working on the "dawgspeak" UGA slang dictionary (which was fun and interesting) and actual linguistic information. The material wasn't difficult, but the text he assigned was difficult to interpret and his teaching didn't clarify anything. Our final involved poorly photocopied dictionary pages that could barely be read.

This class was the best I've taken at UGA. Dr. Mccreary is extremely knowledgeable. He is a little odd, but he's very helpful, flexible, and really nice. I've had him for five classes and I really like him, and have never had any problem with him.

Very disorganized in his teaching. I don't mind teaching myself somewhat, but it was very frustrating when no one could even figure out how the terms on the study guide related at all to the class. Some of the material could be a bit boring, but some was really interesting. Overall, not a terrible class, but just not super clearly taught.

This was a terrible class. Avoid McCreary if possible; he's really boring and it's extremely hard to learn from lectures. You have to teach yourself everything for tests, which often have random, undiscussed questions. Homework is pointless, except to cushion grade. The material isn't hard, but is unorganized and scattered.

He is not honest and is duplicitous. He does not know anything about current linguistic theory and is lazy in his thinking. He slavishly follows others (who are also old-fashioned) instead of thinking for himself. He seems to have hostility towards women.

He is ok.  Everyone is right that he is obviously VERY smart and knows alot about ling but VERY boring.  Notes are scatered but his reviews help to clear things up.  Likes to ask random random random questions on tests.  Way too many HW assignments that are more busy work than educating. Not hard just slightly time consuming.
Boring and his notes are so scattered. He is kind of ****y for no reason.
This guy is awesome. I'm not sure why people dislike him so much. I think he's hilarious, and he's clearly very knowledgeable.

UGH I dreaded this class. He is very smart but boring. He knows his stuff but it's hard to learn it through his awkward teaching style and lectures that make you want to go to sleep. Tests & quizzes are a piece of cake if you can pay attention in class, but HW every week which I found excessive & unnecessary for a 4000 level class. hated it!

McCreary is very knowledgeable in linguistics however a lot of it gets lost in the notes he gives. He mostly gives examples of situations rather than explicitly defining what things mean. As an instructor, this is his greatest fault and it sometimes causes you to miss the big picture. But he's fair. Tests aren't hard and papers are very flexible.
He is a teacher that has a distinct personality. He is super nice, and willing to help. His teaching style isn't the greatest, but he is fair. I learned a lot from that class.
Sarcastic and arrogant attitude
No Comments
Such a easy exam. EASIEST A EVER !

Personally, I like him.  Course content was probably boring to some, but we played games which involved winning money (which was nice).  He moves at a very fast pace, I took the class over the summer and we got out a week early.  Put in the effort, and it's a pretty easy A.

The material was pretty boring but he tried his best to make it fun, overall he is a really good teacher. He was always available for extra help and graded fair. The tests can be hard because of the multiple choice though. You'll get the grade you earn.

Overall, this class not hard.  Come to class, do the homework, and it's an easy A.  Ragan is a nice, fun professor.  But, try to avoid him in the mornings.  He was never at his best when teaching our 8AM class.  Also, be careful on tests.  The models that you spend 90% of class covering, only make up about 50% of the exams. Overall, I recommend.

I thought he was a pretty good professor, the subject matter is very boring but he makes it the best that he possible can.  The tests can be slightly hard, especially the multiple choice questions with more than five choices. Recommended though.
Cool guy, the class is an easy B as long as you go to most of the classes. He keeps it short and as interesting as he can. Recommended

Good Guy, but he gives no sympathy, a true economist. If you dont care about the subject you will get a B or C. He tailors to the kids who actually care and come to class everyday. The tests are ridiculous, roughly 20% A's . He cant spell, but neither can I. He is computer savvy. I know he will see this post... Consider getting rid of Aplia

Average.  Not the most articulate professor I've ever had, and also can't do arithmetic very well.  He covers everything well enough, but you could get it all out of the textbook and never go to class.  His notes and examples come straight from there.  A nice guy overall, but not the greatest teacher.  You get out of the class what you put in it.

This class is an easy B. I only studied the night before each test,and rarely went to class. If I would have done my homework and showed up for class, I would have definitely had an A. I have taken other econ classes at uga, and this was by far the best and most interesting. I would defnitely recommend taking this class to anyone.

The lectures aren't too boring but the tests are rather difficult. Robi is really nice but not very helpful during office hours. All of the assignments are online, which I hated, but others really liked it. I would recommend this class but be prepared to study a lot.

She is a very intelligent teacher who is always kind and respectful of all students and their ideas. Must put forth critical thinking in her classes to receive above average grades. Lectures are awesome and insightful and she clearly knows what she is talking about. I've taken two classes with her and they've both been great!

Knowledgeable, enthusiastic.  One class with her made me want to take another.  She incorporates outside sources into the class to help students understand the material.  Expectations are clear from the beginning. Always willing to help you understand the material better. Only hard thing was reading middle english! A great teacher!

She'll be awesome soon; she's just green yet. Underconfident and overly focused on time management in class, making sure everything is covered, rather than focusing on the quality of coverage. Nice, and smart, but nothing to write home about.

Dr. Shutters was a great professor.  She was incredibly knowledgable about the subject material and her interest in the texts helped in getting us excited.  No tests.  Just essays.  She is a fairly difficult grader.  The best part about her class are the discussions.  Everyone is allowed to express their ideas.  Minimal lecturing.

Dr. Shutters actually got me interested in Women's Role in Chaucer's Literature (ENGL 4330) so by default she must be a fantastic teacher. She is young enough to be enthusiatic about teaching and flexible in her mindset. An overall good teacher.

Dr. Karnok is an incredibly kind and honest person, and that helps make his lectures interesting. Unfortunately, most of the content he talks about is relatively self explanatory, and he spends so much time cracking jokes that it doesn't leave much time for helpful information. Still, he makes up for it by doing magic tricks and really caring.

His FYOS seminar of "The Do's and Dont's of Setting a Professional Image" is a practical class to take and is good for any major, not just business students. What he tells you may seem like common sense, but they are things we tend to forget. Super nice, and great resources like bringing in speakers and took us out to a fancy restaurant!

The biggest waste of time I've had this semester. This class has the opportunity to be useful, but the way he presents it is not. He never requires any work to be done. He just gives quizzes which are fairly easy but so pointless. Also, he makes you buy an ebook he wrote purely for the money.
Class is pointless, gives 2 "quizzes" which are actually test like (50+ questions). Loves to hear himself talk. Homework assignments are a joke. Regret taking this class
Great Professor! Really goes out of his way to help students with whatever they need help with. Animated guy. Attendance does become mandatory in the second half of the semester.
Karnok is the most animated professor I have had at UGA. No regret taking this class.

Really useful material! Professor keeps students engaged. He is really funny, fun, and sweet - even does some magic tricks. The assignments are really easy. only 2 quizzes and true/false and very easy

The class is very easy and helpful, but sometimes boring. Attendance was not taken until a noticeable lack of class attendance. Majority of students were upperclassmen, but I recommend to take class as a freshman (very helpful). Also, Professor Karnok is very nice and funny; he likes to keep the class involved and asking questions. Lecture style.

This class is definitely beneficial when looking to become a professional. If you go to class, read the text, pay attention- you will make an A. As an added bonus, Karnok is a big goofball and keeps class interesting.
Very helpful course.It's an easy A. two quizzes, maybe three mini assignements that are super easy! and great guest speakers. take it!
Great teacher

1 hr class. It is very easy, but can be very helpful in a job search (especially if you have little experience). He is a nice guy and can make you laugh. Easy class. 2 tests, but lots of little quick assignments.

Karnok is a goofball. But hes a great guy. He has a great sense of humor and finds ways to make even the most boring subject lively. After all, it is a class about grass. He has a great time teaching and has a passion. The tests are easy if you study, only 3 and no final. Shows videos and things that have nothing to do with grass, but hilarious!!!!

Dr. Karnok is fantastic. The subject of grass is a bit boring, but he is very passionate and does well to make it interesting. There is only 3 tests, so you must study notes and do well. The book was never used. The fun trips to the football and baseball fields were neat, too. Very good use of a 1 hour elective credit.

best prof ive had at georgia! i love him! he is really passionate about turf grass and makes all his students passionate too. Absolutely hilarious, he kept me laughing allll semester! just make sure not to ask if bermuda grass grows in the shade!
Really GREAT professor :) he cracked me up all the time and thanks to him, I'm now minoring in turfgrass management because I liked the course so much!
Awesome guy...he is hilarious....fairly easy class, keeps it very interesting great teacher.
He is awesome, take him!
Glad it's over

Constantly picked on me (what grade are we in?!).  Has an air of superiority, which crosses the line of being arrogant.  Made my semester a living hell.  The whole point of wanting to teach is to pass along knowledge, allow students to see things in a different light, etc.  Did not of these things, just belittled me constantly.
Personally made it her job to pick on me in class even though I was simply sitting in my chair, listening to the lecture.
I loved her.  She was very clear, very interesting.  Mostly reading novels, no major papers or essays. Midterm worth 20%, Final worth 30%. I got an A in her class.

Hilarious teacher! It's true, he likes to say demeaning things to his students, but they are very funny! Studying is rewuired for this class, but if you're a CS major (which you should be if you're taking this class), it shouldn't be a problem. Writes notes on a projector in class and hands them out as copies the next day. Great teacher!

Dr. Smith is unable to admit when he has made a mistake.  Instead, he tries to belittle the student who inquires about it / points it out. He is EXTREMELY condescending, and has no respect for students. He is also very lazy. There is no reason for it to take a month to get the first assignment up when it is unavailable because of errors on his end.

Good teacher, very helpful. Pretty condescending but in a funny way if you don't take it seriously. Lots of homework that isn't explained well, but that's the book's fault and not his. Attendance not required, but pop quizzes are given that don't count much but will help for test prep. He gives a copy of each day's notes to the class.

Awesome guy, and hilarious.  No books, easy projects (projects built off of each other), and he will give so much extra credits (even chance to skip part of tests + final).  Very laid back. If you fail, you suck at life.  He just reads off of Wikipedia though.  Final project, people that showed SOMETHING got good grades (like, 95).

Smith is AMAZING.  If you can't take a professor calling you an idiot, do the reading or keep your mouth shut.  He doesn't coddle students but he is extremely clear about what needs to be done.  Imagine Red Forman from That 70's Show teaching Architecture.
He's an idiot.  He is a poor professor with no ability to teach.  I passed his class easily, but it was really awful.

Dr. Smith is an amazing professor, because he can make any class interesting. However, the classes themselves are really hard if you don't attend or don't do the reading, so you can't slack off. Also, he'll grade tough, but curve everything at the end. Some exam Qs will come from readings that aren't covered in class, so do them.

This "Associate Professor" gave me the worst experience I have had to date in any school.  He was rude during office hours (asking why students would "come to my office while I'm eating!"), rude in class ("Either you are all idiots, or I can't teach), and condescending after class. He doubled the points on a project most students did not do well on

Dr. Patino Douce has a great personality and heart for the kids he works with. He is extremely passionate about his subject which makes him very likely to find your mistakes. He is a very tough grader and we had a quiz every class. The homework also takes a fair amount of time. No phones in class and you have to show up.
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment_Rating: Probably the nicest professor i have encountered and truly passionate about his area of study. This guy is very humorous, can brighten your day, and has easy to follow material, just be on time and don't text in class.

Patino is knowledgeable. However, this geology class had more trigonometry than I could have EVER imagined. He expects so much math and without a calculator. Hes passionate though, so if math doesnt scare you then take him. But if youre a liberal arts major, steer clear. Theres graded work each day and no book, so you cant even teach yourself.
Loved taking this class with him. He is extremely knowledgeable and really cares about his students understanding the material. 10/10 would take again!

Don't be scared by the syllabus. Dr. Patino-Douce is a fantastic professor and lecturer. However, get ready to LEARN. Come to every lecture and pay attention. His tests are in-depth and each question requires several layers of understanding. Don't be scared though. All I really did was pay attention and got a 104 in the course.
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--Beware of pop quizzes--Amazing lectures

comment_Rating: I did not take this teacher for geology, but for my freshman odyssey. But I figured I would give my input. He is a very knowledgable and explained everything very thoroughly. I really enjoy how passionate he is. I think overall he is a very good guy, but since this class was an odyssey class a I never got to experience his grading criteria or test

If you skip class a lot, don't take this guy. If you go to class a pay attention it is an easy class. His classes are small (15-20 students) and he will get to know you. He is funny and explains concepts very well. If you asks questions he will do everything to help you understand. Don't use your phone and if you read the syllabus dont get scared.
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Hilarious

comment_Rating: I'm not quite sure why he isn't getting better reviews on here! He is very passionate about this subject and provides easy to understand analogies that will help you grasp some of the geological concepts that he lectures about. Awesome teacher, awesome class.

I cannot stress enough that this is an EXTREMELY difficult course. He really knows his stuff, but you have to really be able to think the way he wants you to. No amount of studying I did helped. The plus is that if you have perfect attendance he will add 5 points to your total grade. Be wary of taking this class. The 5 extra points won't save you.

He is an amazing teacher with amazing lectures that really leave you wanting to know more but HE IS TOUGH. This will not be an easy A class. It is not "rocks for jocks".. Hardest class I've  taken. He has pop quizzes and gives you a chance for an extra 5 points on your final grade IF you have perfect attendance. You will leave knowing geology.

This is an extremely hard class but on the bright side, you will leave it knowing Geology. His tests are ridiculous and you could study for years and still fail. However, he knows his class is ridiculously hard and has chances for students that work their butts off to pass, and you WILL need to work to pass. Overall, interesting but challenging.

It is clear that he understands the subject matter from hands-on experiences. I studied, recorded quality notes, went to every class, and I failed 2/3 tests. To do well, you must apply the concepts. Extra credit, a research paper, and the lab saved my tail from failing! By the grace of God, I ended-up with a B-. NOT an easy A, by any means!

An A is not easy.  He WILL challenge you, and it WILL be hard.  But very worthwhile.  You need to know CONCEPTS from lectures and how to apply them.  Don't get the textbooks- really unnecessary.  He is a genius, and a funny guy, and I really enjoyed his class.  Made me love geology!  Best class I ever took, and I am a fashion merchandising major!

WORST TEACHER EVER!!! If you get to choose between him & another professor.. CHOOSDE THE OTHER PROFESSOR. His test are IMPOSSIBLE. I took very good notes and only missed one class and I have failed almost EVRY SINGLE TEST! After studying hours and hours, i promise he loves to see his students fail! DONT  He is not helpful, & made me hate geology!

Never opened my book. Tests based solely on concepts from lectures, so attendance is important. i can't begin to express his wealth of knowledge or his amazing ability to teach and instruct. VERY fair. very neat and humorous sense of humor. i'd take the class all over again- he's THAT good.

Funny guy. Some ppl thought he came off as a jerk, but I liked him.  Quotes Monty Python in a weird voice a lot.  Class is an easy B if you take notes.  An A is attainable, but you won't be able to coast along for it.Go on the field trip offered at beginning.  I didn't, and it was the exact amount of pts I needed for an A.Gives random pop quizzes.

Best professor I've ever had. Information is very interesting and he is very passionate about it. For tests, must understand how to apply concepts, not really definitions. Go to his office hours and ask questions and he'll point you in the right directions as to what will be on the tests!

Professor Patino-Douce is awesome.  Although the course is not an "easy A" I still recommend taking him.  He is so passionate in his area which makes you really interested no matter what.  Tests can be tricky and you will need to study!!!  I think an A is possible but you will need to work pretty hard.  Definetly recommended!

He is very pasionate about the subject and knows his stuff well.  The class is interesting but you have to take notes, they aren't posted online.  Go to class and pay attention and it'll be an easy B.  If you study really hard its very possible to get an A.  If there is an extra credit field trip do it, its worth it

EPSY8180-good content on how mind works. Good instructor-enthusiastic, cares about students.I liked it that there were no guessing games or tricks about test content. I studied, came to class regularly, and got a good grade-what I deserved. Good textbook, DVDs. Instructor wrote me a good letter for teaching job application too.

This course might be the easiest I've had, undergrad or grad. Follow the presentation rules and you'll be fine. The two tests are all about memorization. He will ask things from class slides, so take notes while eating the cookies. There's not much learning, but it's an easy requirement filler.

He's very nice and firm. He tries to nurture important professional skills that other professors are not concerned like presentation skills and peer review skills. He greets students outside the door after class.

EPSY 6800 , good course and prof. Really enthusiastic and nice. Liked lectures and videos. Students give short presentations, too, with constructive feedback from everyone. Helped me develop my presentation & teaching skills. Ok to use computers for notes but not facebook or e-mail during class. Good cookies, too.

comments from '05 - '08 were so good. 3 years have passed, and I'm afraid to say that his teaching style must have flipped or something. Course content is very interesting, but nothing you can't get out of reading. Presentations felt sloppy and unprepared, but he randomly uses it on tests. The kicker is he doesn't like u taking notes on computers
Very good prof!
One of the most helpful profs at the school.  And cookies in class are yummy.
Friendly and kind professor.  Interested in what you have to say and offers suggestions.  He brings cookies to class, too!  Take his class if you can.

Best class I have ever had so far.  Dr. Glynn is an angel.  He has the kindest heart of any professor I have ever met.  And his classes are so interesting plus he brings cookies!  Take this professor...you will enjoy every minute.
On of the best and most friendly Profs at UGA and probably the entire world.  Take any course he offers.

Dr. Voekel is really nice, the kind of person you'd want to be friends with outside of class. There's a lot of reading, but you can get away with not really doing it. It definitely isn't a lecture style class, a lot of group work/debates/etc. She is also kind of a tough grader on essays.

I love Voekel! She's the coolest person, and I think that anyone who takes her will love her too. She's so nice, extremely helpful, and she's a great professor. She's a liberal socialist, and while she challenges us to think outside of the box through debates, she won't make you compromise on your values. She's amazing. Take her!

Dr. Voekel keeps the class pumped up with a fine mixture of debates, multimedia, and more debates. The class is interactive and students are required to participate. Dr. Voekel grades papers strictly, but she also offers great writing advice and you will see your writing improve tremendously.

She is excited! She gets so into it she walks around and jumps up and down... her classes are always interesting, but she is more interested in the social aspects of history and indigenous movements in Latin America.  Participate! and you'll do well.  Also there are in-class debates scheduled so you really do get into it even when you didn't read.

This professor likes to seem like the class is a breeze them slams you with a ton of work at once. He grades strict and does not explain what he expects from you. He is also lazy, my essays had 0 comments just a grade...

Great Class. So easy. You don't have to go but you should because the class is so funny. He usually lets you out of class at least twenty minutes early. Let your TA know who you are, they are the ones giving the grade.

Grubbs' class was hard for me to follow since it did not have concrete notes.  The tests we all essays which required you to memorize an entire essay and write it down.  This didn't really work for me, but for others it works great. Although I did not like this method, I still managed to get a good grade.

his lectures are very interesting. he really focus more on the big picture of the history topics instead of small details like who's the president during 1795 and stuff. the TAs are really nice and easy. this class is probably the easiest history class in UGA.
I really dont like history, but his lectures were interesting. His tests arent hard and he gives you a study guide, but your grade depends on what TA you get

He really made this class so interesting. He is lecture was a lot of fun. Eventhough your grade depends on you TA, you should defintaly take him because even if you don't like HIST you will like this class.

I had professor grubbs on ecore for us history. he was a great teacher and explained things very well and made the whole ecore experience worth it... i absolutely hated ecore, but he was a great professor!

Professor Grubbs is one of the best professors I have had at UGA. His lectures are clear, concise, and I absolutely loved that he gave us a study guide. As long as you prepare for the short answers and essays in advance, it is easy to get an A. Although, your TA will determine your ultimate grade so make sure you know what they expect of you.

Grubbs is a great professor. He keeps the lecture interesting with his humor. You don't have to attend class or read the book..just make sure you attend the breakout sessions, which is where the majority of your grade comes from. All the TA's grade differently. The tests are pretty straightforward and he always gives a study guide first.

I DESPISED history before this class, but he is SO interesting and hilarious.  Seriously, take this class.  You don't need the book, and you can skip basically every class as long as you go to breakout session.  All tests are essays so if you know it, you can get an A.  I studied about 2 hours the day before every test and made an A every time...

I absolutely loved Grubbs. He makes history extremely interesting - I hated missing class, it was /that/ fun. He gives study guides which tell you what will be covered (essays/short answer). He's very liberal, and this filters into his discussions, so if you're a conservative without a sense of humor, you might not like him nearly as much as I did.

An AMAZING lecturer!  Class flies by.  Watch out for the TA's, they all grade differently, and it can be frustrating sometimes.  Need to read for the breakout sessions but not always for class.  Sort of a younger guy so jokes around sometimes...in a cool way.

He's hilarious. He's also brilliant. Possibly also crazy, but I love him, and am reallly glad I took his class. I've never had more fun in a history class and I'm so glad its not based on memorization but in understanding and being able to write about general and sometimes vaguely important concepts :)

His lectures are fun to listen to and he's a really nice guy and tries to get to know the students who make an effort to know him. Ge tells you exactly whats on the test 2 weeks ebfore and the TAs tell you exactly what they expect your essays to say. If you don't listen then you wont do well, but if you do then it's really easy
It all depends on your TA in this class. Grubbs is fun to listen to sometimes but he doesn't really matter at all.  You can make an A if your TA is good basically

The lectures were always absorbing even if he didn't lecture for the full 50 minutes. I like the different perspective he gives on history; it's refreshing. T.A.s grade all of your work, so it's best if you go to all break out sessions and PARTICIPATE so they know who you are. The tests are all essay; I used notecards to study and outlined the essays.

he is by far the best lecture professor i have had.  you dont have to go to class b/c there is no attendance policy but he makes you want to come b/c he is an great speaker-he is funny and his class is never boring! i recommend this class-his essay tests are hard b/c you dont have much time but you get the topics in advance which makes it easier!

very cool professor.  He makes jokes and makes learning interesting.  The lectures go by very fast, but you discussion group might be boring depending on you teaching assistant.  the tests are slightly difficult, but if you study you will do fine.  I suggest you take this course, it is fun and you satisfy your history requirement.

VERY FUNNY GUY WHO JUST TALKS ON THE MIKE, BUT NOT VERY INFORMATIVE.  I DON'T KNOW WHAT HE DOES BUT APPARENTLY HE DOESN'T GRADE ANYTHING OR TAKE ATTENDENCE.  YOU BARELY HAVE ANYTIME TO FINISH THE ESSAY FORMATTED EXAM, AND THE TA ARE VERY DIFFERENT.  ITS NOT FAIR THAT ONE TA GIVES QUIZZES AND PAPERS AND OTHERS JUST GIVE AWAY GRADES BY ATTENDENCE.

i highly recommend taking this class especially if you dont like history, because he makes this required class painless with very little work. i never went to the classes after the first test and still got an a!

He is a great professor. He gives study guides before the test, so you know what to expect--no surprises. His lectures are entertaining, and I actually liked going to class. He's also really friendly and open to his students. There is a lot of reading, but it is explained in lecture.

Grubbs was a very easy teacher.  He gives you a study guide for every test so that's all the info you need to know. I would still go to the lecture though because then you know exactly what he wants for the test.  And you have to go to break out or else it could really hurt your grade.

I hate history and didn't want to take this class. But Dr. Grubbs was a great professor and I actually enjoyed it. He's so smart. He knows so much. And his vast knowledge helps you on your tests. He's really interesting too. So class isn't bad at all. I'm making a 98 in there. It's easy if you do the study guide and go to class.

This is a great class that takes a discussion, primary source based approach to American History.  Dr. Grubbs assumes that you have at least a decent knowledge of history; if you do, and want a different class than lecture, this is the one.  Grade is based solely on papers, participation, and worksheets on movies.  No tests at all.

Dr. Grubbs definitely knows his history and he makes it interesting because of his vast knowledge of history.  Make sure you attend all of the breakout sessions and try to make all of the lectures and you'll do fine.  Study groups help too.  Use the study guide.
cool to listen to and fun, not too hard

straight up history class. you read, we'll talk a little, write me a paper about it.  There are a few discussions about the books, but mostly it's listening.  Which is fine because listening to him is pretty interesting anyway.  And he's very nice

Absolutely useless, half the class didn't even bother going to the lecture. He gives you handouts that have questions about the new material but doesn't bother explaining them. And this was a Chemistry 2 class so most people didn't know much about chemistry and were just taking the class because it's a requirement. He also assigns to much HW!

He's pretentious and rude. He arbitrarily assigns work and does not teach it- every day, the supposed "lectures" are his examinations on the ethics of green science. Easily the textbook example of ineffectual professor. He does not deserve the title of "teacher," for he does not teach.

Dr. Dore was listed as the professor, but it really should have said "Self-taught," because that is how he "instructs." He puts you into groups to self-teach and refuses to answer questions. The only way I passed this class was the curve at the end. I studied constantly, but it was extremely surprising that I got a C. DO NOT TAKE HIM. EVER.

Dr. Dore is extremely condescending and rude. He seemed aggravated when we asked questions, and he stifled discussion. The tests were impossibly hard, even though the class was for non-science majors. He assumed that we knew certain chemistry from high school, and he wouldn't reteach, even if we were clearly confused.

The guy below me is a loser.  He only liked Dore because of his curve. In class you'll work on organic in groups from a workbook. On test you'll get pissed at Dore for pulling half the problems out of thin air.  He does curve the final grade, but you won't learn as much as the regular class. Tip: Don't waste your time studying for his tests.

Yes, they want to make honors organic very rigorous, but Dore was horrible. Had some stupid lecture method, so he really wouldn't teach us. Gave insane tests that did not reflect work, was a totally unhelpful in office hours and nasty over email, and really degraded the class overall. Lab was insane. AVOID DORE take Morrison or Majetich.

I love Chemistry, I'm a chem major, and I was in the honor organic class... but when our teacher got switched to Dore, I HAD to drop and switch to regular organic. He said he wouldn't lecture and wanted us to learn in some new format his BFF from grad school designed. It involved only group work and raising your hand to get quiet. (like in pre-K)
While his class is difficult, and he does not expressly lecture, I can say that he knows his stuff.  He may expect too much of his students, but if you're willing to work, his curves are friendly.

The largest a**hole I've ever met.  I spoke to him directly only a few times.  And each time he acted pissed to entertain my questions, such as 'May I borrow your stapler?'.  I learned nothing about the organic, I dont think many did.  And it was an honors class full of some of the smartest science people I've ever met.

By far the worst prof I've ever had.  Flies through material and seemingly attempts to make students feel stupid by making himself seem smarter.  Has a bitter grudge against doctors; likes soccer.  It's a hard subject, but it's no good to have a hard prof.
No Comments

He doesn't make chemistry very easy to understand at all, but just make sure to do a ton of practice problems (if you run out, just use study edge's stuff) and you should be fine in the class. Be ready for a really boring class with a teacher reading slides verbatim.

You can't expect to do well just by going to class; you must do as many practice problems in the book as possible (plus J-exam homework of course). He does give a lot of quizzes in class, which helped buffer my grade. He answered every question posed by students on eLc. What other professor does that?

Teaches the wrong information, doesn't use a microphone most of the time, goes off on random tangents that don't mean anything and them rushes through the slides and doesn't work the problem fully, gets behind the other professors so he doesn't complete the chapter.
Very sweet man. This was my second time taking 1212 and I did 2 letter grades better than with the other teacher I had. The only way you can get a good grade is if you go to class and study though
He's a very smart man but he can't teach at all. He knows what he's talking about but can't relay the information clearly. Makes everything very complicated. But very nice and helpful on ELC.
Very helpful professor.. On eLC.

Anderson is one of the better CHEM professors in the chem department. However, the only drawback is that his class is from 6:30 - 7:45. :( BUT!!! he is extrememly helpful and very nice. Also on ELC you will see that he is the only professor that answers almost every question posed dealing with HW or any general questions. Overall, good teacher.

Very nice in person and his study sessions are extremely helpful. But when he's lecturing, it's hard to tell what he's saying. He sounds like he has a microphone in his mouth.So most of the class(including me)was asleep for half the semester. Heck once a girl snored so loud that the whole auditorium shook.He's better than other CHEM professors IMO.

He's knows how to teach and make many side jokes to make class more manageable. The only real drawback to his class is the time (630 pm-745).  If you really want the A, like I needed, you'll go to the tutorials and study the HWs right. PRAY you don't get his TA (MOODY) for chem lab.
Nice man. Boring lecture but all CHEM classes are. Clicker questions given for extra credit like all other CHEM classes. NOT INTIMIDATING NOR MEAN like some other prof. Very cute, nerdy prof! :)

Anderson's class is just like any other Chem class. He pretty much just reads straight off the slides and does not bring in much outside info to make it interesting (not really his fault because the slides are from the dept). He knows what he talking about and is very smart. He is extremely helpful on ELC discussion boards, but not much IN class.

Anderson is extremely nice and helpful, but the class itself is hard, and lab is impossible. All of the sections have the same tests, which Atwood, the biggest jerk ever makes. In case you live under a rock, DO NOT TAKE FRESHMAN CHEM UNLESS YOU HAVE TO. It takes a lot of work just to make a B.
Not the clearest during class, but very helpful on WEBCT and after class.  Make sure you do the questions at the end of each chapter and understand the JEXAM homework %120 and the "A" is yours.
great teacher, very helpful- not a jerk like ATWOOD

Horrible teacher! He's incredibly smart and understands chemistry but is absolutely useless when it comes to teaching. He just reads off the slides and if you ask for clarification he'll just restate what he said in the first place. Unless you want learn the history of elements or spend every class wondering what's in his fanny pack, TAKE ATWOOD.
Awful...useless. He was never helpful after class, just on WebCT. Just good for drinking Diet Cokes and explaining where each element was discovered.

Anderson was great! Sure, he isn't always helpful in class, but he posts on WebCT and answers emails right away. He will help so much during office hours, and he also will schedule other times to meet if office hours aren't good for you. In his office, he is so much more helpful and will go over every problem you need Overall he was a great teacher
useless... i mean i can read powerpoint slides too

Brilliant scientist, but no teacher. Literally takes simple two line algebra problems and turns them into a page and a half of advanced physics jargon. Class time spent translating into useful formulas. Helpful? Willing but responses are unintelligible, post on web-ct for student translation. Nice guy though. You'll be teaching yourself. Got an A.

TAKE THIS CLASS WITH HIM!! he is a great professor who really wants you to do well!! he does a ton of help sessions and is always available for help. HOWEVER, the material is not easy; so study A LOT! he is soooo intellingent that sometimes he has a hard time explaining simple things, but go to his office hrs! he is great one-on-one!!
really great professor who rocks a leather fanny pack.

He is such a great guy, but he doesn't teach very well. I quit going to class after 3 weeks and resigned to reading the book before exams. and pulled out an A. If you ever need help outside class, he'll be there in a heartbeat, but if you're expecting to learn a lot, you'll have to do it on your own.

I had Anderson for both gen. chems. He's one of those professors who is too brilliant to be a good teacher. I like him, though, because he really cares about his students and will help you when you need it. The tests are hard but not impossible. I made A's on all the tests with moderate studying, but it definitely will be time-consuming.

Best Chemistry professor available at UGA - but that's not very hard.  He REALLY wants to be fair and cares about his students.  He does 2 help sessions prior to test.  His class is boring but it's chemistry so what do you expect?  I wish I could've taken him for Chem1211 as well ; I'm sure I would've done a lot better.  TAKE HIM!

Anderson is probably the most caring teacher I have ever had! He truly wants his students to understand and do well! However, Chemistry is tough and alot of work will be required! If you work hard you can do well!

Um, correction to the kid that said he doesn't go over Jexam. That's what the Thursday night review sessions were for. They wer EXTREMELY helpful, and he can't go over h/w in class because there's not enough time. He has no control over that. I think he's great. His fanny pack is amazing btw, and let's face it, chem  difficult no matter who teaches

i actually preferred stanton's class- he's kind of a jerk but he teaches better than anderson. anderson is for all the world a nice guy but not the best teacher. i worked incredibly hard and got my fist B, lowest grade so far in college.

Anderson is very underrated.  He tries really hard to make people understand.  Yes, he is boring.  Yes, he wears a fanny pack to class every day.  Anybody who thinks they're going to walk into this class and grab an A is sadly mistaken.  It takes countless hours of studying and adderall tabs to rock the A in gen-chem, any teacher.
The worst teacher ever. Chemistry is already hard, and it doesn't help if you get someone like Anderson to teach it to you. Avoid this teacher as best that you can!!
He doesn't go over the material that's on Jexam.  He wastes a lot of time talking about useless material. The power points are useless and the book is useless.  Take Atwood.

I liked him. This subject is hard, and he understands that. He does not waste time in class making jokes, but he cares about students and does not make anyone feel dumb. He is rather old, but a nice guy!

hes not a terrible teacher but all of what has been said is true he goes overthings either way too fast or hel do something like explain the history of lithium of 20 mins iv heard allen is much better but whatever you do dont take stanton anyone is better then stanton

Pretty bad teacher. Doesn't really teach simply reads out lecture notes and when I talked to him about my problems he kinda just beat around the bush and doesn't really give chances like Allen to boost your grade. Don't take him, it's really annoying to be taught like that,I stopped goin to class and just read the book and lecture notes. D+ teacher

Horrible "teacher." He went through several dozen power-point slides per lecture, taking no time to explain or clarify concepts. His class was very dull, and his "teaching" style is very insipid. I would advise you no to take him--just stay home and read the power-point notes/book.
Very hard to understand.  Does not explain or teach things clearly/thoroughly.  Do not go to his class.  Book is a better teacher.
No Comments
Sucks. Just flat out sucks.
he made this class very hard to understand.his tests are not easy, very conceptual.

He's a tough grader but people posting about him forget to mention that he explains his grading is tough in order to make us improve.  I know that I did better than I thought I would and I left learning more than I thought I would.  Oh yeah, he also tells us up front that he knows 18th c. English lit the best, so it makes sense he covers it.

The midterm and final focus on specific details and little analysis is involved, like a reading quiz, and we had only a week for both of the two papers assigned. Due to Root's teaching style and different editions of books, nobody knew what exactly he was talking about most of the time, and so the class was quiet and not engaged.

Root is tough but fair in his grading and even instituted a system where he gave us feedback before assigning grades and allowed us to question and comment on his comments.  He challenged us to become better and although it was frustrating and difficult at times, he put aside extra office hours and time to meet with him.  I got a lot from it.

Root's class IS tough, that much is true.  But I think the guy tried pretty hard to improve his students as writers.  I say that mostly because in peer editing groups, most of the papers were not exactly good.  Having to read a class full of papers that were as bad as a lot of the ones I read is probably enough to try anyone's patience.

This guy does not know how to engage with a text in a literary sense. He often turns situations into a conservative political argument. He seems to have anger issues. He has no structure to his lectures. He is at uga for research and can't teach for a damn. Please do not take his course. he cancelled class a lot, that was the only plus of the class

Unquestionably not an easy grader, but is an exceptional professor.  Be at least grammatically correct for an 80 and have an original thesis for an 85.  I finished with a B+, never missed a class, and talked everyday in discussions.  He makes really helpful comments on the compositions, but just never EXPECT an A if you don't participate.

After reading the comments, I was concerned about signing up for this professor's class, but I didn't want to mess up my schedule, so I went for it. The comments about him were accurate. He's probably not the worst available teacher, but he's a rough grader and fairly impatient when it comes to helping students. Would not recommend.
He is the worst professor I have ever had. The grades are only essays and attendance and if you don't write what he wants your not going to get an A guaranteed. TAKE ANY OTHER PROF if possible!!!

Professor Root is the most vulgar professor I have ever had. He vocabulary towards females is offensive which is strong coming from me because I'm a guy. His opinion is the only thing that matters so if you write a paper that isn't based on his opinion you are screwed. If you have an opinion that is different than his you will not make an A.

Horrible professor. Do yourself a favor and try to get a different section. I'm a pretty decent writer. He says he grades harsh to shock you, not because your bad. He is not helpful at all. I went to his office hours for each of my papers, and he wouldn't meet with me on my portfolio because I had met with him 2 or or more times during the year.

Root is definitely not the best professor to take! He is very rude and does not have a filter at all! He barely gives out good grades, and his lectures can be confusing. My grades were all across the board too. I had A's in all my other classes, but this guy was just way too picky!!
He can be very rude.
