This professor is the stereotypical college english professor. He believes that his students do not know how to write and is quite difficult to get a hold of. He even denied to meet me during his assigned office hours! Grading methods are subjective and rude. Get out of this class while you can.

Seems mean at first, but really isn't! His advice and criticism really helped me improve my writing skills. I made a C on the first paper, but made higher than 85 on the rest of them. He doesn't give a lot of As, but it is very possible to receive one.

He was very intimidating but his lectures were interesting. He picks favorites and I felt that whatever I said was stupid, I ended up with a B+ in the class, but struggled and was surprised with that high of a grade. He grades the papers really hard, and when you do the portfolio, I followed the guidelines from other professors, not his.
Douglas Root is not a nice teacher.  He is rude, arrogant, and unfair.  There are so many other better English teachers to take!

Hands down the worst teacher I have ever had in college (And thats through 2 schools and 90 hours). Comes across as a total jerk, and he truly is. Misleading on what he says he wants out of your papers and how he actually grades them.  Will grade according to how he likes you. Could go on, but bottom line: don't take him!

Honestly, if he likes you--you'll get a good grade. so go back to fourth grade and brown nose the crap out of the class. he wants you to have the same opinions as him, but if you reword his opinions, he gets mad and claims you're copying him? He really expects too much out of a first level english class, and i wouldnt wish this class upon anyone

Mr. Root is very rude and beyond unhelpful.  He expects a lot without facilitating his students with the opportunity to please him.  He was constantly disappointed, yet would not listen to his students.  He wants you to have the exact same opinion as he does.  He thinks he's being reasonable, but he really isn't.
Really Big on Attendance!!! Even if you have a doctors excuse.

Professor Root is not a teacher I would recommend for freshman English. He displays strong vulgarity in the classroom, and the course curriculum is all works of literature by ancient writers. He grades based on his opinion, and if your paper doesn't follow it, you won't get an A.
He is a horrible teacher who bases his grades based on whether or not you agree with his opinion and if he likes you or not.
Great teacher. really enjoyed the class. Some essays can be tricky but hes a fair teacher and the class goes by quickly.
Great teacher. really enjoyed the class. Some essays can be tricky but hes a fair teacher and the class goes by quickly.

This dude is hilarious! yea he grade hard as crap and yea he only gave out 1 A but i still liked him. get on his good side RIGHT AWAY! it will help out later, and just smile and take into consideration what he wants you to write and a B is easy.
Not a teacher that I would recommend to other students
He is a good teacher.  He made class interesting and had a very open atmosphere in class.  I attedened every day and liked to listen to his views on what we said about the readings
No Comments

He's different that he grades on content not on grammar so much and being a writer who can EASILY write about anything it was a plus for me. I did manage to get a "B" but thought I should've gotten an "A" for the work I put in.
No Comments

Root.  Extremely unhelpful would be too nice a description.  His comments on papers, such as, "It really just doesn't have that something I like," truly help you to improve.  Basically write what he wants you to in order to get an A.  Screw your own voice in papers.  Yeah, you can really tell he has talent when people come out of his office crying.

Basically turn in all your work ontime and dont ever ask him for any extensions or anything like that because he is very sarcastic to the point of heartlessness sometimes.  He can be a JERK... but no matter how mean he may be to you... be nice 2 him because he has admitted that if he dislikes a student, it affects the way he grades them!!!!

complete jerk. didnt learn anything really. all we do is sit around and listen to him bash the essays in our book. and he will tell you straight up that if he doesnt like you he will grade your paper accordingly, and o yea... he give about 5 A's per semester b/w 2 classes. so good luck

Dr. Kastner is nice and very smart. However, the class is ridiculously boring and definitely difficult. Tests are open note and most problems come from the book or in class examples. Tests were hard, but he grades pretty fairly and gives partial credit. Design project at the end of the class was pretty absurd and unbelievably time consuming...

He is so smart and a really nice guy. The material is pretty difficult so coming to class is a must. He posts everything online but seeing it explained is so much better. The final and project count for so much so make sure you do well.
ratingTags_Rating: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment_Rating: All of his tests are open note open book (but I hear he is changing that for next year). Go to class because you will want his notes. Most test questions come from the book or in class examples. His homework will take forever to do but he is really helpful so just go ask him. The design project at the end of the course is super time consuming
ratingTags_Rating: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment_Rating: Easy class but very boring, as expected from an intro engr class. Kastner is really genuinely interested in the topic and likes to have the class ask questions but the lectures are boring. One assignment every week; really easy don't take it lightly. 80% of the grade is based on a technical report due on the last day. Basically do it or you fail.
ratingTags_Rating: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment_Rating: Dr. Kastner is a nice guy, and not the worst teacher out there. Sometimes he can get kind of boring but he teaches classes that would be hard to make interesting. Not the easiest class in the world but he was pretty helpful whenever I asked for help.

Awesome class!  He did a pretty good job in teaching, explained the subject pretty well.  Lectures could have been more organized. Always helped you if you came to his office. Graded fairly easy, probably b/c it's a SR level class-if you didn't have a B, then something was wrong with you!  The class was ALOT of work, especially the design project!

Hard class.  If you can teach yourself the material, then pick this guy, otherwise, forget it.  All EXAM QUESTIONS COME STRAIGHT OUT OF THE BOOK, in some cases out of your notes.  The paper due at end of the semester is an easy A.  ask upperclass men for study manual--it really helps.
No Comments

Dr. McClendon is by far the best teacher I have ever had and I have over 100 credit hours. He does go a little fast and never does a problem start to finish but it's not really problem. You do need to do all the homework on your own though because if you don't his tests will get you. It is a hard, work intensive class but that's engineering for ya.

McClendon is an excellent teacher. The class is definitely work intensive, but it should be. If you do EVERY homework problem he assigns, you will be ready for the tests and pretty much not need to study for them. This class basically has a direct relationship between how hard you work and the grade you receive. Definitely take McClendon.

Don't go into this class expecting that it will be difficult. If you pay attention in class every day and do all of the homework problems he assigns, you will be fine.  It really isn't that difficult of a class unless you make it like that.  McClendon does a great job of making confusing material easy to understand.  Couldnt ask for better.
Good friendly professor who wants the best for his students. Unfortunately his test are almost impossible to finish accurately within the time limit.

Not really a hard class IF you do all of your HW and have old tests so you can get an idea of what his tests are like.  I got a C because I blew off the final.  McClendon is just a geniunely nice guy, and he really wants his students to learn.

Excellent professor.  Best one have had so far.  Explains material very clearly.  His repeatition during lecture is highly effective.  ask upper classmen for old exams, as his exams are very similar each semester.  Final exam is almost the same as third exam.  Makes a hard class fun.
No Comments

Tests are open notes and not too difficult. But still prepare for them by coming over the notes during class. Basically pay attention and following along during lecture, so you know how to use Excel correctly.

The way his class works teaches you about the concepts, but doesn't really prepare you for the FE if you care about that sort of thing. You do learn the concepts in and use them in the same way that you would in a real world application; which is telling of how effective the FE actually is.

I would go to class if I were you even though its not mandatory. He's a super fun teacher, but the subject is a little dry. Lectures consist of example problems. Only have tests in his class but they're open note, book and computer.

Dr. Sellers is hilarious and tells awesome stories. Some people may say this class is hard, but if you somewhat pay attention in class and know how to use the Excel formulas, there's literally no reason (and honestly no excuse) for you not to get an A
He has humorous stories and knows his material. As long as you pay attention in class, its easy to get an A in his class. No studying required.

Sellers is the man!!!  He is the nicest guy in the eng dept, and really cares about his students.  His stories are hilarious.  Lectures weren't the most exciting, everyone surfed the net during lecture.  Was the easist class in eng, got an A with minimal effort.  If you don't get an A or B in this class, you have no business becoming an engineer!
Unique sense of humor and just a really nice guy. The material he teaches is fairly easy as long as you pay attention.
No Comments
This prof was on fleek. she my girl. luv her. rlly recommend. she like, super kewl. love dis woman. for life.
I truly enjoyed this class as a whole. Dr. Baer-Wallis does a great job of drawing the class into the discussion, and it seems more like conversation than lecture. GO TO CLASS!! trust me.

One of my favorite professors, very intelligent, has an interesting approach to history.  Encourages discussion and open expression of opinions.  She does expect you to read and pay attention, if you put in effort you will do well.  Assigned a very interesting project/research paper that I actually enjoyed doing. I plan to take 4070H with her too.
Dr. Baer-Wallis is the truth like Sojourner!!!
Very nice and made the class pretty interesting (coming from someone who doesn't like history).  There's a lot of reading but it's doable.  Seems like she really enjoys teaching this class.
If you read, pay attention, and participate, there is no reason you can't smoke this class.

I really enjoyed Dr. B-W's class. She is very professional and does a nice job of promoting fair and open discussions. I did find some of the reading to be dull, however. Additionally, I think that she needs to use different formats occassionally. I consider her to be one of the better History Profs. I've had at UGA.
She's nice and really not at all demanding in the amount of reading she requires, considering it's a history class. Not a tough grader at all.
She's a good professor.

This class was supposed to be an easy course, but there was tons of work outside of class. I would have given a higher rating if we knew our grades throughout the semester. I thought I was at an A the whole semester but somehow received a B in the course. He was really difficult to understand and wasn't really helpful.
ratingTags_Rating: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment_Rating: This Odyssey course was very easy but super boring. We just read scientific papers the entire semester and wrote summaries on them to discuss in class. However, Arnold is a very nice man. He took us on a tour of the genetics labs on the last day of class, which was neat. If you are looking for an easy odyssey course then this one is perfect for you
ratingTags_Rating: Get ready to read--Participation matters--SO MANY PAPERS

comment_Rating: Dr. Arnold is a nice and easy to joke with. The class is once a week and the homework is fairly simple, just a one page bullet-point analysis of a scientific paper. He spends class going over the homework and the paper, although he talks to us as if we have any idea of what he's saying, but we don't because we're first-years.
ratingTags_Rating: Respected--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment_Rating: His lectures do no make sense. Hope that the other teacher that he is paired up with is nice.
You basically spend time learning how to do problems, when you never really learn the significance of what you're doing
Tests were pretty fair, some were tough, but he was really nice and wanted to help you out

One of the worst teachers I have ever had. Does not explain what he teaches and his tests have questions that I have never seen before. Has best interest at heart but would not recommend because I learned nothing.

Professor Kazez is such a great professor! He really knows what he is talking about and is capable of explaining topics in more than one way which was so helpful in Calc 3. His tests are almost identical to the practice exams he provides so if you study those and go to class then you are good to go!
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment_Rating: Funny guy, acknowledges the difficulty of calc 3. Homework is a bit ridiculous and much harder than the tests, but dept tutoring and classmate collaboration helps. His old tests are good study tools. Final was much harder than expected, dropped my grade from an A, but not the end of the world. Kazez is a must take.

Great teacher. I took him again for MATH 2270 the following semester, and both of his classes were comparable in terms of workload and grading. Pro-tip: he grades to the median, meaning the median for each test becomes a "B", and then he distributes grades around them, which really helps considering the median was usually below an 80.
ratingTags_Rating: Gives good feedback--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment_Rating: Truly Engaging Teacher! Considering that I took this class before in high school, I would still say anyone should take him as the way he explains new (to me) and old topics is fantastic and he's really helpful when doing test review/hw review to answer all of your questions.

Dr. Kazez has a really awkward but good sense of humor, and he really incorporates it into his teaching style. It takes a little while to get used to, but if you try to participate in class and follow along, you'll be fine. The course material is pretty challenging though, and if you don't seek additional help, it's pretty easy to get lost.

This class was horrible for some but if you're good at math you won't have too many problems. I read the book a few times for clarity but the professor is fairly good at explaining material. If you do all the homework and study to understand, you'll do fine. I got a 5 on AP calc AB and did fine in this class. We had 3 tests, a final, and weekly hw.
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment_Rating: Really scattered brained in his lectures, when I went to office hours he was very unhelpful and actually asked me how I had tested out of pre calc when I got a 5 on my AP calc exam in high school. I wouldn't recommend taking calc 2 honors as he is currently the only honors professor.

Really interesting lectures. Homework is exceedingly difficult and long (around 10 hours/week) on webwork but it has unlimited attempts so you know when you get it. Tests are much easier than the homework and very similar to the old tests he gives you. TOUGH, but pay attention in class and do the  homework and you'll be fine.
This class moves really fast.  The only problem I had this semester was to keep up with both chemistry and calc at the same time.  Beware, the homework will take a considerable amount of time.

Will is fantastic - he teaches a great Calculus III. The course moves very fast, but if you take plenty of notes you'll be fine (I went through a whole spiral notebook in one semester, back and front!) Tests given in class are way easier than the homework, which is online. Guy is awkwardly funny, but is a genius at explaining things. A must-take.

He is a very nice guy and always willing to help and explain. The webwork homework is weekly, difficult, and nothing like his tests. He gives and goes over previous tests to help. There was a lot of work, but he curved at the end. The book was not used. I would really recommend taking him.

The course in general has way too much material crammed into it, and seemed kind of scattered the way it was presented. There is a ton of homework, but tutoring offered mon-thurs & study groups also recommended. Tests are pretty difficult but he gives a lot of partial credit. He curves the class at the end (not sure of how but it helped A LOT!)

Kazez is the best math teacher I've had at UGA. Very clear, effective teaching style. Extremely nice guy, and always willing to help during office hours. Strongly recommend him. Tests were very fair and not hard at all if you go to class and do the homework.

Kazez was a pretty good professor. He was awkwardly funny and made the class entertaining. Although he teaches fast, you acclimate to it. We never used the textbook but had weekly homework (it was a lot different than the tests). His tests aren't too bad, but I definitely recommend studying for them with the previous tests he gave to other classes.

Dr. Kazez is a great teacher. He is very helpful if you go to office hours. Homework is on webwork and usually his problmes are challenging but not impossible. His tests are an easier version of hw and notes so make sure you know the concept well enough. Overall, I can say he is the best teacher Ive had at uga
Great professor. Explained things thoroughly and you were prepared for tests from the homework.

Dr. Kazez really helped me to understand calculus. He was easy to access for help on the homework; all I had to do was come in early. His tests are difficult but if you do problems from the book then you should be able to pass the tests relatively easily. I would recommend his class.
Easy to follow and understand, knows material well and can relate it well. It is a hard course, no changing that. But overall, he's pretty solid.

I cannot stress this enough: DO THE HOMEWORK! You can go to Milledge Hall (I think that's the location) to get homework help, so GO! There's really no reason not to do well on it. I kind of slacked off on hwk, and even though I made 2 A's and one B on tests I got a C+ in the class! And the final is hellacious (made a B).

KAZEZ IS A HARD TEACHER. OTHER TEACHERS ARE BETTER. HE MOVES EXTREMELY FAST, AND AT THE END OF THE SEMESTER OF CALC I , HE WILL TEACH A LITTLE CALC II. HE ALSO DOESN'T EXPLAIN WELL. ONLY, GET HIS CLASS IF YOU ARE WILLING TO PUT IN LONG HOURS OF STUDYING. TRUTHFULLY, I COMPLETELY STUDIED 24 HOURS A DAY! SO, BEWARE!

Kazez is a really nice man. He explains things pretty well but moves really fast. His tests are  kind of hard but he does give partial credit. Attendance is not mandatory and the book is not used at all so don't buy it unless you think you will need it for reference

Kazez is a really good teacher.  He explains material and answers questions very thoroughly. If you understand the basic concepts and review your notes real well the test are fairly easy.  Homework is a help too so do it! Math is never fun, but Kazez really gets excited about it sometimes.

Very effective teacher.  lectures are clear and interesting.  Approach to teaching is very effective.  Exams are a little hard, but not impossible.  Highly recommended. Make sure you know your notes well, as exams will reflect them.

Very clear in lectures, helpful in office hours. If you put in some effort, you will get a lot out of the class - he's not very difficult. Tests reflect material that was reviewed so studying for tests wasn't hard. I really enjoyed his class.

Mrs. Mary Ruth is a wonderful teacher! Pinhole Photography is now one of my favorite techniques. She teaches you everything there is to know, from building your own camera to working in the darkroom. She loves to share stories with you and brought us peppermints every class! She is such a joy to be around and I highly recommend taking this class.
Not only did I learn how to visualize I learned new vocabulary words such as cattywompus!  I had Ms. Moore's class many years ago 1991.

I'm even older, 44.  I took Photography at the J-school and hated it.  Then took Moore's class starting with pin hole and she awakened me. She's great! Take her class(es) and go to Italy, because working, bills and a lack of time when you get older and have kids sux

I'm old, 42, buy came to this site for curiousity.  When I saw Mary Ruth Moore's name I had to add my comments.  I tookher classes from 1989-90 and she is about the only Prof. I remember.  She is absolutely outstanding, TAKE HER CLASS!!!  I regret I didn't go to Italy.
Mary Ruth is the sweetest person!  She's very helpful.  And she loves Georgia Football!!!
Mary Ruth is awesome. She's super kind and helpful and absolutely knows the field. She also tells great stories :D
Had him for 4700 and 4900---best professor I had all 4 years! Come to class and read the book and the class is pretty easy. Lectures and interesting and entertaining! Definitely recommend!!!

He's a really cool guy and funny too. Most personable professor I've ever had that really cares for his students. Doesn't lecture and must read book on your own. Frequently calls people out in class, but if you don't get embarrassed that easily and not uptight, he's a really great professor who likes to keep the class upbeat. Definitely recommended

One of the best professors I have ever had, and THE best marketing professor on campus.  Take him if you can, but be prepared to be made fun of!!! he likes to pick on people, but it is all in good fun :)
Cool guy. He's very in your face and makes the lectures fun. His lectures don't relate that much to the tests, so the best way to study is to read the book in detail.
awesome

This guy is incredible, knows everything. Funny as hell, makes fun of people especially you. Read the book you'll get at least a B+. First class in college i loved going to and if i could have him for all 120 collegiate hours I would in a heartbeat. Even wrote him a thank you note.

Great prof.  Dr. Friedmann has lots of real world experience in Int'l Marketing and it shows.  He's very blunt, but he knows the material and really does a good job of drawing the big picture.  READ THE BOOK!  Not a hard class as long as you read.
Very entertaining and knowledgable
No Comments
No Comments
The best professor in Athens. I have never been more excited about a class day after day.  He has no mental filter; if he thinks it he says it.
I took Dr. Fallow's freshman seminar. He's a really sweet guy and I would love to take another class with him. A great character with tons of personality and fantastic humor!

Mr. Fallows is one of the most up-beat teachers I've ever met. His sense of humor and positive attitude make his lectures interesting. I took him for a Maymester class and while these are usually tedious and tiring, Mr. Fallows made time fly by. Quizzes & tests weren't too bad either. I would definitely take a class with him again if I could.
Take this calss if you can.  He is GREAT!  Funny and entertaining, and he explains things very well.  I enjoyed the class and learned a lot.

fair amount of homework and assignments to do but it all helps improve your french. he's really nice and patient; makes it easy to participate in class. 10/10 recommend for people wanting to continue taking french classes

Krell gives a lot of compositions, but as long as you don't rush it and look over your work, you'll do well on them. Honestly the hardest test was the midterm because of the grammar. Make sure you read the textbook and the stories. He gives quizzes on the stories and discussions on passages from both. He's very kind and helpful with questions
ratingTags_Rating: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment_Rating: Took him for 3010. He's nice but very boring; the kids made it exciting. Grades very harshly for grammar. We did poorly on most quizzes, & the midterm review sheet was vague (study 6 vocab lists when there's only 1 on). Some rules were taught the day of the quiz. Has difficulty explaining some rules. He's not terrible, but I'd choose someone else.

This class is fairly straightforward. There is a midterm and a final, and of course, a few compositions. Verbal participation matters quite a bit. There are mountains of busy work assigned every week, which can get tedious, and Krell is a tough grader. I didn't relish the thought of going to class every day, but it's tolerable.

Most of the class is papers and class participation (duh, because it's a conversation and composition french class). He's pretty forgiving as far as grammar goes on the papers, but the tests are a crapshoot as to what's on them. He's really mean about people forgetting stuff, and and altogether not the worst professor ever but not the greatest.
ratingTags_Rating: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--SO MANY PAPERS

comment_Rating: He teaches nothing but boredom.
ratingTags_Rating: Tough Grader--Participation matters--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment_Rating: I just had to come on here to say how much I loved this professor . He cares, classes are entertaining and you learn a lot  . He doesn't check homework but there are some pop quizes .However, if you do what you're supposed to do you can get an A no problem . I hope I get to be in one of his classes again.
ratingTags_Rating: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment_Rating: Dr. Krell has these weird days where he can get frustrated and be a bit passive-aggressive, but overall his class is great. He's very easy to talk to and takes the time to answer questions and explain everything. Homework load varies day-to-day but isn't bad. If you took 3010 here, it's basically the same.
ratingTags_Rating: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Clear grading criteria

comment_Rating: 4 compositions that are 750-words each in specific structures, but he grades fairly. Only midterm and final as tests. TONS OF HOMEWORK AND READING (busy work)!!!!! Pop quizzes on readings that are weirdly specific. Gotta read and come to class to pass!

AWESOME teacher. The homework came with the answers in the back of the book. One presentation, one project, 5 short compositions. Very nice, sincere, guy. The tests were a bit irrelevant to the material we studied, but they were easy. Just pay attention and try and you'll be fine. Great teacher.
took the business french class. krell is okay, but his exams have very little to do with the study guides or what is being said in class.
I wasn't really interested in business French and only took it because I needed another French class, but he made it interesting.
Great professor, I learned a lot in his business and especially modern French lit classes. Good guy, good classes. If you're a dick he will deal with you, but you deserve it, yo.
No Comments
Dr. Krell is a sexy beast.

Dr. Langston is awesome! I took his morphology class which is a really dense branch of linguistics. Its a pretty painful subject to get through but he was super clear about everything and made it the most painless possible. Definitely would take him again!

Langston himself isn't tough but Russian is tough. He gives great lectures and explains things very clearly. There is only so much more he can offer in his office hours. Tests are tough. You just gotta know your stuff.
Professor Langston is very helpful but he grades harshly on the written graded homework. If you do the work and go to class, it's not bad and he makes class fun and interesting.

Dr. Langston was an incredible professor and obviously very passionate about what he teaches, but he expects a lot out of his students. Be prepared to study more than you did in in the 1000 level classes and participate more in class!

Old Church Slavonic is very difficult, even if you know Russian. Dr. Langston does a good job presenting the language but expects alot in return. Quizzes can be hard but the exams aren't that bad. You'll also learn about Slavic languages in general. Overall, an interesting course but one that demands your full attention.

The class may have been the hardest, I've ever taken.  But, it was worth it to have Dr. Langston as a professor.  I missed a lot, so that was part of the reason for my slow and awful progress, but Dr. Langston was always helpful.  He might truly be the smartest professor on campus.  He knows a lot about a lot.

Extremely helpfu professor who will always be willing to help you. His course is tough, so you actually need to work and study, but that isn't all bad. He is extremely friendly, and he wants you to perform well. He's also among the smartest professors on campus without the pompous attitude that permeates academia today.
I wish he could have been my professor for every class.
No Comments
One of the best professors I've ever had.

I have taken a few classes with her and she is the smartest lady I know. She is a very inspirational and strong lady for what she went through in Russia. Has a great sense of humor also. She loves her students like they're her children.
painfully boring. but you can learn so much from her. so suck up or leave

LOL what to say what to say...well she expects a lot of things from her native speakers. for 4270 there are a total of 4 essays that you turn in to her. each has to be in russian and about 3-5 pages of ANALYSIS. (on the readings) otherwise that class was very fun and entertaining.
No Comments
Her classes are worth taking just to experience listening to a crazy Russian lady.
A little nuts, but entertaining
She's great giving lessons. The activities she does in studio time are always interesting. She's also great at teaching and playing the horn.

Dr. M-W is a fantastic private horn teacher. She strives to help you achieve every goal you want to reach, whether it be a specific aspect of your horn playing or improving your general musicality.  Due to her dedication, my horn playing has already improved drastically since entering college.

Dr. Martin-Williams is not an easy horn professor in the least.  But I can definitely say that she cares and works with you to achieve your goals.  Be sure to tell her what your goals are, though--if you don't plan on playing horn for a living, tell her so (and vice versa)!  She'll adjust the expectations accordingly.
She was not helpful in the least.  She was so critical and cold to me.  I will never play horn again.

She is one of the best Portuguese teachers ever!! She really wants to help you succeed in the language... and she gives a different perspective from the  common Brazilian dialect. Portuguese is not the easiest language to learn & I think that is why others are saying its hard and boring. She makes it interesting and fun. I WOULD RECOMMEND HER!!!
Nice lady, but the class was torture to go to, just doing boring exercises out of the book and reading together as a class.

I've always had Portuguese teachers from Brazil, and Mrs. Hutchinson is from Portugal. Her accent is definitely something to get used to if you've never heard it before. Personal bias aside, she was a really understanding, lenient teacher who really wants you to do well.

One word to explain her class: DISORGANIZED! all in all the class is semi-tough, but if you stick to doing the workbook and practice, you should do ok however she is really disorganized, she'll say something is due in the next two days and it wont be picked up for another month, trust me its not as great as it sounds, at times we were very behind.

Amelia is a great woman...if she was your grandmother. As a teacher, she expects you to know way more Portuguese than you actually know (trust me, 1001 and 1002 at UGA will not prepare you well for this class!). However, she grades easily and makes tests and compositions not too difficult. Overall, great woman and moderately difficult class.
Tough class, but she tries to make it as easy to pass as possible.  Peculiar grading system, but if you do your homework and turn it in, you should pass pretty easily.

She is a fantastic woman, sincerely interested in the subject. She is very cute and endearing and the classwork is not challenging at all. She truly wants everyone to learn something. I think the other person rated her boring because it's easy to stop paying attention and then you drift away - but if you participate in class you get a lot out of it

I also had him at U of M this past semester. Wonderful professor, really understands that students have lives and conflicts beyond the classroom. Pretty easy grader, just make an effort in class to participate & he will make sure you do well! & he really is hilarious too; total goof.

He now teaches at the University of Minnesota. He's a great teacher and really funny. I know a lot of the girls enjoy looking at him everyday. He can be a hard grader, but if you get to know him and joke around with him you'll be fine. His homework is easy and his stories are hilarious. One of the best spanish teachers I've had!

David Jons is the best teacher at UGA by far. He loves what he does and makes the class fun and interesting. I actually looked forward to going to class. Ask him to sing and play the guitar. Its amazing. Hes very young and very helpful. I highly recommend taking this class with David Jons. It will be the best decision of your life!

I'm a spanish major and while I didn't necessarily learn much out of the book (we had reading assignments but they didn't really follow the class) it really helped my speaking confidence. Not to mention he is younger and relates well to his classes. (& he's hot!) Attendance is mandatory but it's not one of those you'll fail if you miss 3.
AWESOME Teacher he does care about his students and I enjoyed being in his class. Learning a new language is very complicated but he made it bearable. I didn't receive an A but I learned something!
He makes me really want to come to class each day!
David Jons is a great teacher!

Absolutely amazing.  The best professor I have ever had.  I hated Spanish in high school and came to UGA and absolutely love it.  He makes learning fun and interesting.  I recommend taking Professor Jons if you are taking Spanish.

David is a great teacher. He really cares about the students and does his absolute best to make sure they understand what he is teaching. The class is not easy, but his teaching style definitely makes it much easier to do well. You have to pay attention, but if you listen, do your homework, and study, you are sure to succeed in his class.

He's a really good teacher. You do a lot of discussions which make the class not as boring. He's young, too, so he doesn't expect you to know everything. Attendance isn't mandatory but you get daily participation grades so it's good to go
I had this class at 8am 4 days a week, but didn't mind going as much because David Jons made the class fun and relatively easily. Tests were so easy if you knew vocab and studied the night before.
You must take David Jons. He'll change your life. Ask him to sing and play guitar.
David is hot, nice, and a great teacher. He's really laidback. You'll make an A on his tests if you study a little and pay attention in class.
Professor Jons is not only hot, but very interesting and he keeps you motivated. he is very understanding, and he is also a great spanish teacher.
It was easy but a little boring but hes a young guy and he trys to keep things fun. I even saw him downtown on tuesday nights.
too easy and boring -
David is a wonderful teacher and his class definitely makes you want to go to class.
Very helpful and always made class fun. Tests are by curriculum but pretty straight-forward.

He's the man. I thought the class was easier than High School, but it all depends on how much spanish you have had in the past. David's got some soul...he's awesome, I'd take his class again in a second.

David Jons is an excellent teacher.  He's nice, understanding, and very willing to help in any way he can.  Not only is he a very fun and knowledgeable teacher, he is very hot, which definitely kept attendance up.  The class was of medium difficulty, but David Jons was eager to help and make the lessons fun and entertaining.

This class isn't hard but it isn't easy. Some effort is envolved. Professor Jons is really young and understanding. He tries to help everyone do their best. The tests aren't too bad if you study. He tries to make the class fun and will bring his guitar and sing in Spanish every now and then. I recommend taking his class.
Professor Jons keeps everything very clear and understandable for you, and as a freshman I find him very easy!

Very nice guy, wants to help, but sometimes he gets caught up in forgetting that we're not fluent. I recommend his class b/c he knows his stuff, you just have to remind him of how much you're capable of doing.

The Class is hard, but at least David makes it somewhat interesting.  He seems to get the point that most people that are in his class, don't want to be there.  The fact that he's hat makes it way more appealing.
What kind of comment was that??? he's a really NICE person! The class was fun, i kinda look forward for this class every week.
He's hot, but the class gets very redundant. The guy who rated him is a very bitter man. He has a great sense of humor. Basically, he's hot and funny, but not the best of teachers.
guys love him.
very monotone. her class is very boring but really easy. basically if you read the book then you will get an A!

She is extremely disorganized and confusing. Read the book; don't worry about going to lectures, boring. Be prepared to either have an incorrect grade on WebCT or not have one at all until the end of the semester. Lots of extra credit. Drops lowest test grade and gives 100. Don't get too excited; you will need it.  If you can, get another teather.

Dr. Yanchus is one of the easiest teachers at Georgia. She's entirely disorganized and has the most pointless lectures. Truthfully if you read the book you'll understand the material better than if you go to lecture and you'll do better on tests. Be ready to deal with losts tests and the like. If you talk to her though seh'll fix the problem.

I highly recommend taking Dr. Yanchus for psyc 1101. Her tests are tricky, and require studying (reading the book), but the extra credit she gives makes up for lost points. She is always willing to help outside of class as well.

Dr. Yanchus's lecture and test where right out of the book. I never went, unless it was a test day, and made a 100 in the class. She offers a lot of extra credit also. The tests are a little tricky because they require you to apply what you know rather than just spit back the facts. I highly recommend taking this class. Very Easy!
This was the easiest class ever.  No doubt

This class is so easy. I have been to class like 2 times other than test days and still have an A right not. If you just read the book and look over the study guides and do the homework you will be fine. TAKE THIS CLASS !!!!!!!
No Comments

This was an easy class.  I never went to class but still made an A. Just read the book and study it. Some of the test questions can be tricky. Dr. Yanchus is very nice and is willing to help if you need it.

She is kind of entertaining with her random dog stories and such... but lecture is worthless to you. Read the book, don't go to lecture... do your homework and study well for tests... and you've got yourself an A.

this class is incredibly easy. if you need a credit in social science and don't want alot of added work in your schedule take this professor. however, if you're majoring psychology and want to actually learn from this course, i would not advise taking this professor.

It's a pretty easy class. As long as you read and study the book as well as do the study guide the tests will be a breeze. The hw is easy also and the project was even easier. I never went to class and made an A.
Reads off of lecture notes and assigns a medium amount of work which is not extremely hard rather it is time consuming.
lectures are pointless, no one ever came to class. do the homework and required research participation and its an easy a, although tests are sometimes difficult.

Her lectures are completely worthless, but this class is incredibly easy.  All you have to do is do the homework and read the book and you'll get an A.  She doesn't know how to teach, but she makes it easy.

I would suggest this class on the premise that it is incredibly easy.  I have went to class a total of less than 10 times this semester and have an A.  If you read the textbook and keep up with the homework you will make an A.  The tests are simple and they cover only the material in the textbook.  Take this class!

doesn't know how to teach and doesn't cover any of the material.  i would rather not go to class and teach myself.  will cancel class if her microphone won't work, most of her classes last less than 45 minutes on tues. thurs

She is VERY disoriented and seems confused a lot... Half the class never shows up for class since she doesn't take attendance.. the tests were okay, but a lot of people did really bad on them.. overall i would suggest NOT taking psyc 1101 at all.. everyone i talked to had the same problems.. that classes were REALLY boring & its not an easy A

Avoid!  Hard to track down, doesn't show up to scheduled office hour appts, lectures are scattered and unorganized and don't even cover test material, and as a whole she pretty much just seems completely confused and disoriented.  On other hand, class is canceled a lot and attendance isn't required, so just depends on what you're looking for.

If you're looking for a professor who engages you, and gives helpful lectures, this class is not for you. I mostly had to just read the entire chapters myself and take my own notes b/c hers were so sporadic and she didn't cover all of the material that showed up on the tests. Yeah, and she's also a little boring...she reads from her own slideshow a

She is not very good at engaging the students. She reads from her power points. She constantly seems nervous. She doesn't get to know her students. She is never very up to talking with people after class. Her TAs do all the work. I would not suggest this teacher.

She is really easy and gives you so many opportunities for extra credit. This class is incredibly boring but so freakin' easy. And she does keep it a little interesting by telling stories of her life. She likes to cancel classes too.

The class was organized so that each assignment we did will be gathered at the end to make the final (if that makes any sense). There is a good amount of reading in the class but besides that it is pretty easy.

This professor loves researching more than teaching. As a teacher she’s awful. She doesn’t reply to emails, and don't give you feedback.I heard that she complains about L2 learners in her classes not meeting her expectations.

Sadly, a professor with such a reputation seems uninterested in teaching.  Does not engage with English language students despite the fact that this is her field.  Another example of a professor who cares little for teaching despite being in a college of education.  I am convinced she did not read a wits I submitted.
Knows subject but doesn't provide feedback. Defers much of the class to student presentations.
Incomprehensible, useless, a real waste of time.
A useless class!
Awful professor. Not helpful, rarely deviated from textbook, paid more attention to her watch than to her students. Completely ignored students who were speakers of English as a second language.
No Comments
No Comments

Professional and methodical, Takae sensei is the quintessential Japanese teacher. His exlanations are comprehensive and clear.  His anecdotes about life in Japan are always interesting and often funny and keep class from getting boring.  Smart, good sense of humour, charming, very Japanese.  He's wrong about history though. (Fall 2004, 2nd period)
She's a great and understanding professor! As long as you participate and try, you will absolutely pass!
ratingTags_Rating: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment_Rating: Get ready to spend all of your time ONLY on the textbook. Her teaching is very orthodox and after a while the classes can get very uninteresting. Sasaki's bubbly and charming personality ends up carrying the class towards the end and she's a very kind, fair and friendly professor that has little tolerance for BS.
ratingTags_Rating: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lots of homework

comment_Rating: Sasaki-sensei is one of the best Japanese professors at UGA. There are many tests and there's homework due almost every section, but the tests all follow the same format and can be easily studied for. It is really important not to skip class, as she goes over the translations for readings that will be referenced in the tests.
ratingTags_Rating: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment_Rating: Fantastic professor! I have had her for 4 consecutive semesters now and am currently taking JPNS4010. She is always very clear about what is expected. Although, the class is challenging and has a steady workload, you will become much better at Japanese. Sensei always comes to class with a cheery attitude and every class is enjoyable and amusing.

Sasaki Sensei teaches many of the upper-level Japanese courses at UGA. Her class is a nice easy class to show up to, and she is a fun professor to have. Tests basically force you to learn the material, but they always have the same format so there is no curveballs. Sad I can't take her next semester due to my major-related classes. Love her.

Easily the best Japanese professor at UGA. If you've made it this far and want to keep pursuing Japanese, don't hesitate to take Sasaki Sensei. 4-5 tests depending on whether you are taking 3001 or 3002 and 5 homework assignments for each unit. In-class reading of the Tobira textbook and occasional activities.

Sasaki-Sensei is by far the best JPNS professor at UGA. She is extraordinarily nice and cheerful, but will definitely criticize you when you have done something wrong, as a teacher should. There's a lot of homework (usually one worksheet per class period), and you need to self study A LOT, but it's still the best class I've taken at UGA.

Honestly the best JPNS teacher you can get at this school. Always nice, energetic, and makes a difficult language easy. There is lots of homework, but they're only a page long so it's never hard to put down. Self-study, don't skip class and participate in class and you will know intermediate Japanese by the time you leave, along with an easy A.
ratingTags_Rating: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment_Rating: Sasaki-sensei is a great, bubbly person, but personally, I felt like she didn't really teach the course. We read a lot, and she expected a lot of self-study when it came to grammar, vocab, and kanji. The tests are VERY comprehensive and can be difficult. Definitely not something you can cram for.

Let me tell you about Sasaki-Sensei. You will have a lot of mixed feelings because she's spunky and hilarious, but sometimes, her tests make you feel like you re the lowest of the low. Her grading is pretty harsh, but honestly, if you want to learn a language, take her. Thanks to her, I learned how to read more efficiently in Japanese.
Funny and engaging! Keep up with the homework and DO NOT SKIP.
Best Japanese teacher at UGA!

She is spunky and I love her (sometimes dark) sense of humor! Her grading is very nitpicky on quizzes/tests, but the material isn't very hard.It's mostly spelling mistakes that I messed up on. She tells lots of funny tidbits about Japan and herself that keep the class interesting; we end up laughing every day. Her class isn't easy but it's do-able!

Energetic, witty, no-nonsense professor. She's a native speaker so her explanations are a little briefer than I'd like, but she's easy to understand & more than willing to answer questions. Grading is a little nitpicky & gives quizzes over writing kanji, which is pointless. Overall a good professor though.

Amazing! Japanese is very hard for me and she was very helpful. She is nice about it too as long as you show real interest and are trying. On occasion, she'll give easy extra credit and loves to play games. My favorite class, though it was rather challenging.

You can't go wrong with Sasaki sensei! She has crystal clear lectures, is very energetic, and is very nice. She'll call you out randomly on a question but they're never hard. Tests are very fair. Had I not been taking Organic Chemistry and Biology at the same time I would've gotten a high A. Decently easy class, but it does require some studying.

a rotten professor.  she is nasty to her students and cuts people down in class.  if you're not already fluent in japanese before you take her class, don't expect to do very well, and don't expect her to be nice to you.

Had her for JPNS 2001, 2002, and 3010.  Lessons stick to the book, so there's a good bit of reading.  However she'll often take time out in class to have open discussions (questions about the language, Japan,etc.) If the class shows interest, she's really quite kind and engaging.  Just be prepared to study hard if you want an A.

She is very awesome as a teacher. She is also very understanding if issues arise. one of my friends in my class has had hell to deal with this year and she has been very understanding and has let him turn things in quite late and has excused him for his missing class for ligitimate reasons. Also, she will take off on tests because they are not hard
Some students complained about Sasaki-sensei because she had a quick tongue and almost no patience for slackers. So if you complain about her mocking you, what does that tell you about yourself?

Sasaki can be pretty tough, and is usually *very* tough when grading.  Otherwise, she has a very snarky sense of humor and made classes interesting and fun.  I found her to be pretty accommodating and friendly.

I was a new transfer student and had problems because what I learned at my last school didn't match up with the curriculum at UGA.  She was not very helpful or accomodating with this, even when I asked for help.  Takes points off for every possible error, offers no bonus or extra credit even if you have a bad grade and you ask.  "Distant".

Great class. Definetely a lot of work (really just studying), but that's what you get for learning a foreign language. I think the work load and grading were very fair, and it wasn't too demanding, so I could still do work from other classes. She's very sweet, too.

Overall, class isn't that bad...she takes off points for extremely little things on quizzes/tests, but overall you'll be doing better in the class than you may think.  Not that hard, and while I would say that i'm not as skilled with the language as I want to be after taking it, I know a fair amount.  An OK teacher.

I really enjoyed this class, and I learned a *lot* for never having studied Japanese before. There are daily quizzes (as in every Japanese class at UGA), but if you study a little, they're easy, and they help you learn more. Do the homework and study some, and it'll be great. Sasaki was really helpful at explaining things to me when I asked.

It's not a horrible class by any means, and she's not a bad teacher.  But her harsh grading is enough to incite some frustration.  She also seems anxious to just get class over with sometimes, and she cancels class more often than i've seen with other professors.
Sasaki is a harsh grader and gives tricky quizes and tests. She does not give much help and is very distant. Furthermore, she expects you to know things not given in the textbook or even gone over.

Dr. Mori is a kind professor who grades a little tough but provides excellent feedback and extra credit opportunities. The course involves a lot of reading on a fast-paced schedule, which is a little hard to maintain sometimes. Attendance is mandatory and participation is worth a large % of the overall grade. Put in the effort and you will be fine.

Dr. Mori is a gem. He provided a couple of opportunities to earn extra credit points on our papers. Most of the readings, discussions, and films we watched were also interesting and insightful. He's a lovely professor who genuinely cares about his students! I would recommend taking his class.

You're expected to watch the films outside of class and prepare for discussion with a different student facilitating it every week. Participation is a chunk of your grade, so attendance is required. He assigns 3 papers overall and is a fair grader. He gives great feedback after each one as well. I wouldn't retake cause I can watch films on my own.

He lectures a lot and it can be a little repetitive, but there are some interesting and worthwhile things that can be learned. In assigning his short papers, he gives very clear instructions.  When you get the paper back, he has great feedback for you.
ratingTags_Rating: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment_Rating: He is so little adorable Japanese professor. so helpful if you are well prepared. really nice professor. I highly recommend you to take his class ! ! !

The most boring teacher I've ever had. You must read the materials for class discussion (the less prepared you look, the more likely he'll call on you) or he'll embarrass you. His lectures are hardly relevant to the two essays that make the majority of your grade. He takes attendance every day and always starts class 5 minutes early.

He is very knowledgeable but wow is he boring. He lectures the entire time and asks questions. He tried to get group discussions going but those lasted for like 5 min. He shifts from side to side and it gets boring. Make it interesting for yourself by participating hardcore; you will get away with a lot more. Still figuring out how he grades...

This class ate my soul... This is such a hard class. It is true that there is a bunch of extra credit, but the class will depress you. Tests are pretty hard with kanji you have never seen before and he talks all in Japanese and he talks fast! Attendance and participation is a must! Go to Japan first before taking this class or you will be miserable

Mori is the most pathetic teacher I've ever taken a class with. HE does NOT HELP you at all. He just read books in Japanese and does boring stuff in class. WHy is he teaching a foreign language? Sad that I had only Mori as a teacher in the 4000 level. I hated it!

Do not go into class thinking it will be a cakewalk/easy elective grade - requires a lot of your time and lots of reading.  I like Dr.Mori, but his class was fairly boring, as he lectures the whole time kinda droning, and you most likely will fall asleep.  Very...tedious.  Lucky for me I liked the readings overall.
Very knowledgeable.
No Comments

Not a good teacher by any means but an extremely fun class. You have to write a paper every week. That is about it but some kids just would not go to class and your grade drops if you miss one. I got an A but just because I went to every class

Dr. Preston is an angel. You are only graded on 3 essays and 2 discussion posts, but she is very specific about what she looks for. You also get to rewrite one of your first two essays, and that helped me jump from a B to an A in the class. The readings can be confusing at times, but she does a great job explaining everything.

I LOVE Dr. Preston!! She is literally the sweetest professor ever. Class can sometimes be boring if you are uninterested in the topic/philosopher for that week but most of the time it was pretty interesting. She gives great feedback & wants her students to succeed. 3 papers & 2 discussion posts; you can rewrite one of the papers.
ratingTags_Rating: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment_Rating: Loved philosophy with her! Class was discussion heavy which made for interesting lectures. You are only graded on three papers and two discussion posts all semester (and you get to rewrite the first two papers if you need to).
ratingTags_Rating: Respected--Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment_Rating: Dr. Preston is a really good teacher; she explains things really clearly and makes the readings a lot easier. You dont need to read the homework she gives you because you go over it the next class. The class is kind of boring, but if you take notes on what she says and put them into the essays you should do fine. You get to redo one of three essays

For each class you read a philosopher, come into class, and are lectured over the reading. 3 papers: 2 throughout the semester (1 that you can rewrite for a higher grade), and a final that is the 3rd paper. No tests/quizzes, but discussions every Friday- you lead discussion 2x/semester. Not hard if you can write well and don't mind boring lectures

Dr. Preston was fantastic. Lecture heavy, can be a little monotonous at times, but the simplicity of the class and the patience of the teacher made the class a fantastic elective. I recommend the class to anyone interested in philosophy. Papers were graded fairly, always available for help, fantastic.

Dr. Preston was great. She's very kind and helpful, and explained everything so well that the class was quite easy. Every third class period was discussion based, which was extremely fun, and she did a great job of  guiding and moderating. Grade was based on essays (3, 5 pages each) and presenting and leading a discussion topic.

Dr. Preston is a phenomenal professor. She explains the arguments and concepts extremely thoroughly. She allows you to rewrite two of the three papers for a higher grade. During office hours, she is provides excellent feedback for discussion topics and for the essays. She made philosophy very interesting. One of my favorite professors at UGA!

Awesome lady! I loved the way she ran her class and highly recommend her to anyone else, even if you are not a huge philosophy person. Lets you rewrite papers and her feedback is very helpful. So nice and funny!
She is an awesome professor. I considered changing my major to philosophy after her class!
She's the best. Go to class, listen, and you'll make an A, easy. Also, don't buy the book. All of the readings are available online.

An extremely pleasant person, easily approachable and very knowledgeable.  She strides the fine line between being too lenient and too strict.  Answer the proposed questions DIRECTLY with evidence to support you from the text and you will get an A.  Extremely open minded to different interpretations of the philosophies (love it!)

Dr. Preston is laid back and willing to help. She seemed a bit scattered for a moment but would always make sure we stayed on topic. Her lectures were helpful, not always exciting, but wkly discussion days kept the class engaged. I liked her a lot, not too challenging but interesting so if you're looking for great stimulation, probably not for you.

Honors section. easy class. intro to philosophy is easy. well intro to anything is easy. it can get kind of boring, but philosophy is boring. who cares what a bunch of unemployed bums high on opium thought 500 years ago? still, an easy class and an easy grade. also, don't buy the book.
Dr. Preston knows what's up. She is interesting and interested. Willing to help if asked. Fun class discussions. She also is a black belt. Awesome person. We used novels but no textbooks.
I LOVE HER!!! She's so quirky. If you study, you'll do well.
Lectures were clear and useful. Breakout sessions were boring and not useful. Dr. Preston is an interesting lady but the class ends up being more about political philosophy than anything else.

You don't really have to read the books, because you spend all class period summarizing what we were supposed to have read. Overall, the class was quite easy, but kind of boring for the same reason. I thought the material was interesting, but I'm not really that into philosophy.

Preston is an awesome teacher! The material is really confusing but she does a very good job of explaining it in class. I didn't buy any of the books and made an A but you have to study hard. The breakout Fridays is pointless and extra help is always available.
Good teacher.  Very willing to help you or work with you on due dates.  Tests easy if studied for and gone over before hand.  Understanding and interested in student's success. Very nice lady.

nice lady.  pretty good teacher.  not that hard of a grader.  QUIRKY.  shes pretty lenient about due dates and attendance.  paper topics always applicable.  nothing extremly positive or negative to say about her.  iw ould take her class again.  very clear about the material one should know.
Class was pretty easy, boring at times though.  Makes you think about life.

The Honors version of this course was great. You definitely need to keep up with the readings, but by doing so, you really won't have to study much for the tests, which have pretty basic questions if you do the work required. We just did one one-page paper each so not much outside work. He also lets you exempt the final, but won't tell you that.

Dr.E is the best. He is engaging, respectful, and incredibly knowledgeable. He is incredibly patient, understanding, and open minded. Go in open minded and take advantage of everything he has to offer; His class is not very demanding, but don't be tempted to slack off. You will learn so much from him; I feel like I left his class a better person.

A MUST take class and teacher! A bit of reading, but is very engaging. Do the reading & participate in discussions & you'll alright. If you're shy try breaking out of your shell abit, this class & Dr. E are totally worth it. Piece a cake one page weekly papers. Just a Mid-Term & Final.

Honors section of introductory-level religion.  Fairly easy course with little work involved besides a weekly one-page paper.  Dr. E is an interesting fellow but can often be frustrating with his vagueness and frequent tangents about his beliefs.  However, his tests are extremely straightforward (multiple choice and a couple of short answers).
took him for intro to religion, honors. easy A. Tests are like 4 questions long and then a one-on-one conversation. buy the book. weekly papers that are g
Dr. E is the best!
One of the Best!  Great Prof!

Dr. E. is one of the best. He is really knowledgeable, but just a really gentle teacher. Very respectful... but also really hilarious, in a subtle way (he'll say something funny in the middle of a sentence and you'll catch on and laugh. A lot). Loves his students and enjoys discussion with them. SO EASY. Tests and weekly papers = piece of cake.
Fantasic Prof!  His lectures are great.  If you go to class, you'll get an A, and you will learn a lot.  Great class!
the information is really interesting and the class is easy.  He is a really good teacher and funny too.  Get into his class!
awesome teacher! he is so funny and nice and awesome and the homework is so easy. also, the class is really interesting! take him! ^^

I took this course for an easy A, and it was that, but I learned a lot more than I thought I would have in the process.  3 non-cumulative exams that he gives you great study guides for and weekly 1 page papers that are completion graded.  Just read the powerpoints and you will make A's on the tests.  Great professor!
Dr. E really knows his stuff, but his class was boring. Lecture, lecture, lecture. Reflection papers due every week, but they are pass/fail. Tests are easy, but do require studying.
Dr. E is a great professor! I recommend taking this class even if you aren't a religion major. This was my elective for this semester and it was definitely my easiest and most interesting class.
Great class, great professor
really nice guy. Interested in wht he teaches. The class was fun and easy!
Absolutely great guy.  Smart, funny, well spoken.  He loves to teach almost as much as he loves religion.  Eye opening class, but easy as well.  TAKE IT.
Really great prof, he makes each class fun

He is funny and makes corny but awesome jokes. He is also helpful outside of class. Advertising is my major and when I asked him for advice he was really helpful. He does have pop quizzes and in class assignments but they're interesting and fun. A lot of extra credit opportunities. Good class.

His Intro class is pretty interesting. He does quite a bit of in class work that is randomly given out to make up your attendance grade. You watch a lot of commercials. The textbook is REALLY detail oriented and his tests are pretty hard.
He's so funny, his class is interesting, we watch a ton of awesome commercials, and he is soooo Cute!
There's a ton of reading covered on the tests, which is annoying, but you can't even be mad at him... He is just sooo CUTE.

Best class ever! Dr. Reichert is hilarious! Lectures are really interesting, and you watch lots of commercials. He offers tons of extra credit. Tests are not too hard if you read the books in detail and review lecture notes.

Reichert is awesome! Such a great guy. You watch a lot of cool commercials and he does a big lecture. Attendance isn't mandatory, but there are pop reading quizzes and groupwork for class points that he does randomly, especially Fridays or days before holiday breaks! This guy is the best though. Seriously, take him.

Really great teacher. He made class interesting and we watched lots of commercials. You MUST read the textbook. It's long and extremely dry but the info is on the tests. Also, go to class as often as possible. He gives easy activity/quiz grades that can really help boost your grade. Overall, fun (but not easy) class and great professor!

if you are looking for a fun not too bad class DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS, the tests are SUPER HARD he knows its an intro class and he's very clever so he makes the tests very tricky, you HAVE to read the book, you HAVE to go to class for quizzes, in class notes very important, tons of reading but he is a VERY sexy man, class is very enjoyable

Its a super interesting class and its a lot of fun. He is really nice too. The tests are a lot harder than you'd expect though because they focus a lot on details from the book and the lecture and there is a LOT of reading that is really important to do.

Reichert keeps class interesting. We watched a lot of commercials. He's a cool guy, really nice, really good-looking, helpful, etc. No final, but 3 tests, which draw heavily from the books, so keep up with your reading. Go to the speaker meetings for extra credit. All you have to do is listen to cool ppl talk about their jobs, and you get points.

You MUST read the book. Notes are important but he draws from the book for tests. Attend class because there are in-class assignments sometimes, and a project you will only learn about in class (not on the syllabus). DO go to the extra credit sessions. Okay class but if you just need an upper-level elective see if there are easier ones available.
fun class, great teacher. tests were somewhat difficult though. you have to read every word of the book and lecture notes. he gives you stupid/easy quizzes to help your grade though.

Ignoring the fact that if you're taking this class you don't have any other choice of teachers, he is wonderful! Really funny, get ready to watch lots of commercials, always lets you out early. Go to class, it's fun and there are easy free 100 pop quizzes.  Read the book for the test and go to the review, it gets tricky. All in all, I loved it!!

Since everyone else's class he has made easier tests, done extra cedit assignments (percentage points!- as in to add to your final grade) and also had study sessions with TAs for the test. Don't be discouraged. I didn't do well on the first 2 tests but I went to class and got extra credit so you should be fine. and there's no final, just 4 tests

Reichert is a wonderful teacher- he's very experienced and teaches a lot through youtube which is fun, but his tests are really unpredictable-none of us really figured out a system as to what he wanted. to like a subject and not do as well as you think is discouraging, but you will learn alot!

Attendance is 20% of final grade and attendance assignments are random. DO THESE and it will help out your grade tremendously. Tests basically consist of memorizing 100 pages of material from the book and all of the notes from class. Pay special attention to visitors and videos - take notes!!Plan to study a week before class if you want a B

He really did make class interesting...he was very funny and upbeat (and pretty hot). The 1st test was easy, & I studied the same way for the 2nd test, & got a significantly lower grade...so did lots of other people. That was annoying--he needs to be a little more predictable with his tests. He does offer extra credit. I would take from him again.

His lectures are great. Very interesting and fun! He is quite attractive, funny, and trys to relate with students and put things in a context that is appealing to our age group. However his tests were very unpredictable and more challenging than expected. I enjoyed him and his class and recommend it!

Laid back teacher. Knows a lot about advertising and sometimes seems a little to high and mighty to be teaching the intro class, but seems to genuinely want to help you understand the material. Some days it seemed as though our TA could have taken over the class and done fine.
Great teacher, very laid-back, it was an honors class though.  Made the material interesting, and you can tell he's interested in his work, I would take a class from him again.
I've learned nothing...
No Comments

Prof. Crabtree is a great lady and really knows what she is talking about when it comes to the English language, but her one downfall is that she seemingly has no perception of time, and would give us 20 minutes for quizzes that needed at least 45 minutes unless you didn't need time to think whatsoever. She did give retakes online however.
This professor was interesting and available for help at all times.  She was organized.  The only critique is that she was a bit stringent on attendance.

I don't know what these people are talking abt Ms. Crabtree being unfair. I took her class last year it was wonderful!!! the material is very interesting and so is she. if you do the work---which isn't boring or difficult---then you can very easily make an A. there were abt 8 people in the class and i think half made an A and the other half got a B
She was not a good teacher! Her grading is so subjective depending on the student! She is unfair and partial to only certain students! If you have the option, don't take English from her!

She can be unclear in her grading sysytem and her sylabus.  Although, she is easy if you do exactly what she says and show up to class every day.  Also, she reaches out to the Multi-cultures by saying thins like "give props to my peeps" and  "i feel ya".  I find her personality amusing
She is very humorous and she makes it easier for you to put your ideas on paper. She embraces uniqueness

Limehouse was absolutely fantastic.  I had him two years ago and STILL remember things he taught.  Sense of humor is awesome, he doesn't BS you, he's very fair.  Makes you learn but it's great.  UGA lost a great prof when he left.  If you ever get to take his class somewhere, do it!!!

Class moved a bit slow, but Limehouse has a good sense of humor. Attendance isnt really important bc the lecture mostly parallels the text, which is easy to comprehend. He was a good teacher, and is really available to students.  This was his last semester at UGA.
Great teacher....especially if you hate econ. He makes it interesting

If it wasn't for Limehouse, I prob. would have had a low B or high C in the class...but because of him I got an A-...for the tests, make sure you go over practice HW problems, practice exam questions, and make sure you know how to apply the notes DON'T JUST MEMORIZE...he is leaving next semester but he should be back...take him!

Ok, so he's gone for a semester, but for when he gets back, take him. Best TEACHER I've had in college. Tests are exactly what we do in class. Essays, if he gives them, are simple. I just threw some random stuff together and got top scores. You learn more in class than you do from the book, so make sure you go (you might not even need the book).

Frank's class rarely uses the textbooks, tests come almost straight from his notes, and he lets class out early almost every day.  This has definitely been the least stressful business class I've had.  He's a good teacher and cuts a lot of the BS out of the class.  Plus he's nice and makes class fun.  I'd definitely recommend him.
He is leaving after this semester to work in Washington.  That is a huge loss to UGA.

Limehouse is an awesome teacher. He definitely makes class interesting. He even gives money away! and a copy of Freakonomics... the tests have stuff that will be discussed in class that isn't necessarily in notes so although you don't have to go to class, it'd be wise to.

Best micro teacher in all of terry.  His lectures were fun, interesting, and pertinent.  His non-mandatory homeworks are great study guides for the 3 test he gives.  only requires a normal amount of work to get an A
This class was straight forward and interesting, not hard to sit through.  Exams are old tests so get those.  Love the teacher, am taking again.
I loved his class and his teaching style... always making dry jokes.  Warning:  he hates slack students who don't come to class and he even says that.  This guy knows his stuff...awesome teacher!
If you are retarded, take this class.

This guy, Flimeho is the best prof in the econ department, probably in the whole university.  I am an econ major and had him for sports economics.  he stresses applications and concepts rather than tedious equations and algebra like the other econ professors.  TAKE HIM.  He will write a book called Frankonomics one day.

Flimeho is a straight up good teacher. His lectures are engaging and very clear. His class notes before the test are a huge help alongside with the homework assignments. His tests are very fair and he drops your lower test grade. Take him, you will not be disappointed.
if you go to class or at least get the notes, its very easy to understnd. he gives good examples and his tests come directly from the notes.

Flimeho was a great teacher.  Tried his best to make boring econ class enjoyable.  No need to buy the book.  Tests are MC and straight from the notes. Old tests are also easy to find to help you study.

Great class. I've had Flimeho for Micro and now Environmental Econ, and I'd love to take him again! Wonderful teacher, very laid back and funny. His tests are straight from his notes, so you don't even need to buy the book. Just go to class (or wait until he posts the notes in their entirety before the test) and you'll do fine.

Awesome teacher, his jokes make class go by a lot faster.  Subject material isn't easy but he clarifies everything.  Don't bother buying the book, as long as you go to class everyday and take notes, you'll make an A.  Use homework and sample exams to study for tests.   Tests are very straight forward, not tricky.  Great teacher!  Highly recommend!
Professor Limehouse is a great techer.  I personally struggled with applying the lesson material to the tests, but he is very clear and very willing to help.

aka Flimeho. his lectures are very clear. a few short hw assignments are given. tests perfectly reflect the lectures and hw. don't even buy the book, but don't skip class much. class is interesting with his random jokes and inspiration for econ. he knows his stuff. not hard to make B.

I absolutely loved him! He's a great teacher and explains things very well. The notes are clear and he keeps your attention. There are plenty of study questions and also has a review session before each test so it's easy to do well.

He is awesome!  He explains everything really well and he has a great sense of humor.  He is very knowledgeable about the material.  Go to class, listen to his lectures, and you'll do fine (reading the book is a good supplement to his notes.)

THis class is very easy if you pay attention in lecture and know your notes. No need to get book. Test are multiple choice and you can replace your lowest with the final.  Limehouse is an awesome teacher and gets extremely excited sometimes...he's hilarious!
Easy A. Take notes and go to class and youll do great!!! No need to read a book.

The difference between Mangel (my macro prof.) and Flimeho (micro) is like the difference between Spam (an inferior good) and a nice juicy fillet steak.  If you show up and take good notes, Flimeho is a breeze.  He's a bit goofy, but he does that on purpose.  He's really sharp and knows his stuff.  We love flimeho!
I had him for environmental econ (2100) and enjoyed his class very much.  Take Econ 2100, NOT 2200.

Very helpful teacher.  He is a professor who cares about his students and lectures clearly.  Tests can be difficult if you dont study for them, but they are really not bad if you have an idea about what the material is about.  Great guy and I wish he would teach econ 2200!
Excellent professor. Dont buy the book, tests are all from lecture and he covers material so well that you will never need it anyway. He's funny and always available. I highly recommend him.
His class could not be anymore straightforward.  I hope to get him again b/c he is an awesome prof!  Oh yeah... call him FLIMEHO

His class is fairly easy if you show up and understand your notes.  You never know what kind of weird and funny comments he will make and he admits to being kinda crazy.  He makes boring material really interesting.  We love Frank!

this guy is hilarious. he has trivia once a week, he's always cracking jokes, and he presents the material in such a clear way. his tests are usually 30-40 multiple choice, which stinks because if you miss one you lose like 3 points. but still, i don't really like econ, and his class isn't that bad.

Limehouse is a great professor.  He makes the material as interesting as he can by making jokes and being goofy in class.  Tests are pretty straight  forward.  He is very nice and very willing to help.

I really can't complain. His class is SO easy it's ridiculous. I personally found myself struggling to stay awake in his class because his pace is very slow.
