Better slow than fast I guess, but it was boring. He is very fair and knows what he's doing. At first there were class control issues and there still are minor ones. Overall a good class.recc.
Don’t let his youthful appearance fool you.  This guy knows his stuff.  If you go to class and keep up, it’s really not that hard at all.
Great Teacher. Tests come straight for his notes. Always willing to help. Go to class and it is easy to do well.
He's really cute :) Easy teacher, tests are straight from the notes. Just go to class and take notes and you'll do fine.
Willing to help during office hours.  Very clear.  It's an 8am class but he keeps things interesting by being funny.  Go to class and you should get a B.
A great teacher.  He makes the most off the wall comments and jokes in class, but that keeps things interesting.
Pretty straightford on tests if you go to class.

She demands a lot, but if you show up regularly, pay attention, you can easily get a B or A-. She's helpful and very straight forward. She gives review probs before each test and prints out notes prior to every class session. Not easy, but manageable. Also, English is her first language, so that's a plus for the math department professors!
Her tests are rough. Don't even think about checking your work because you won't finish the test. At least she hands out colorful handouts.

She is very helpful. Teaches at a pace that everyone can keep up with. Doesn't make you buy a text book. Prints out notes for you prior to class. Class is easy as long as you go and pay attention. She lets you use notes on the test. No final, just a project. She's great!
Really awesome teacher! She explains things very well, hands out notes, and is very willing to help!
No Comments

Dr. Tucker such a great professor. I've taken a few of his classes and never regret it. He does not have required textbooks and provides the readings, his exams are take home and gives you several days to complete them. He's super understanding and wants to see you succeed/understand the content.
Easy and interesting class. If you pay attention during lectures you will get an A on the tests.

Bram Tucker is an absolute gem. He is such a kind person and an amazing professor. He tries to make the content interesting and engages with the class. The exams are super easy and it was an easy A. His class was great and you should take him!!
Dr. Tucker is one of the best UGA professors. Take him for Anthropology no matter what. Dont buy the book.

Bram Tucker is an absolute gem at UGA. His lectures are amazing, and even though he is pretty nerdy he embraces it and cracks a lot of jokes. There are 3 tests making up 25% of your grade each, and 15 random tophat questions making up the other 25% (lowest 5 are dropped and are super easy). Extra credit on last 2 tests and I never made below a 90.

I really enjoyed ANTH 1102 with Dr. Tucker. Certain lectures were definitely more interesting than others, but overall I learned something, and it was an easy A as long as you take good notes. The textbook is NOT necessary. He will tell you to buy it but all test questions and TopHat questions come directly from lecture, so don't waste your money!!
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Caring

comment_Rating: He is a super nice and goofy guy and I did like the class. He just really only pulled grades from the test and top hat. I really struggled on the written parts of the tests and TA's gave absolutely no feedback on the short answers. I would almost get a 100 on the multiple choice every time though. He is very passionate and has a lot of experience.

Take good notes and use the study guide he gives you. The lectures are pretty boring, but Prof Tucker is obviously passionate about this subject and his field work. The tests are easy if you use the study guide. This class is an easy A if you put in some effort.

Loved Dr Tucker! He talks about his field studies during lectures & really tries to keep students engaged and interested in the topics that were learned. 3 tests (includes final) & tophat questions in class for accuracy (only need to get 10/15 correct). Tests were easy and straight out of lectures, even gave extra credit on last 2 tests.

Dr. Tucker truly makes Anthropology a fun subject and it makes you want to actually go to class. There are 3 tests (and the final is NOT cumulative)! His lectures and his style of teaching is enticing for those that seem to fall asleep in lecture-heavy courses. His stories about Madagascar are legendary!

Prof Tucker is a great teacher and I have enjoyed his class. I recommend and only put class as mandatory because you have tophats in random classes that end up being worth a test grade and honestly he is entertaining so it is worth going to. Much to learn from him

Dr. Tucker is such a sweet man and a great teacher. He is very passionate and energetic, so his lectures aren't boring. His class is only 3 tests w a multiple choice and free response part, which is usually harder, so try to do well on MC so FR won't bring your grade down. He also does random tophats, so make sure to attend! He is very helpful!

Dr. Tucker was a fantastic Intro to Anthropology professor. His class is lecture heavy and there is attendance taken through the form of TopHat questions randomly, so show up. Three tests and TopHats are the only grades. Super funny and interesting person. He's very kind and explains the material very well.

Dr. Tucker is a true gem. He cares about his students and loves what he teaches. Highly recommend taking ANTH 1102 with Tucker. You need to go to class for TopHats, but attendance isn't mandatory. Make sure you take notes from his slides and use the guides he gives you.

Anyone who says this class wasn't easy just didn't show up to pay attention. Dr. Tucker is an extremely knowledgeable and passionate, his lectures are clear and he explains things well. Show up to class for the tophats, take notes, and look at the study guides before the tests (study for at least an hour)... and you'll do well.

The only grades in the class are 3 tests and topmast given randomly. There are 15 tophats throughout the semester but 5 of your lowest grade are dropped. Thought this class would be an easy A but it's not. The multiple choice on the tests aren't bad but the TA's are extremely harsh when grading the free response which tanks your grade.
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment_Rating: Professor Tucker was an average professor. His tests were fairly easy and did not require a lot of studying. His class is over-simplified in my opinion.

Dr. Tucker is an amazing professor who clearly loves what he does. He gives detailed lectures everyday but they are always interesting. YOU DONT NEED THE TEXTBOOK show up to class and take good notes and you'll do perfectly fine. Grades are based on three tests and tophats, so you DO need to be in class to get those participation points.

Sounded easy but the TA's tear apart your test on the free response questions. Definitely too hard to be an Intro class. Multiple choice of the test is usually not bad but the free response tears your grade up. Don't recommend. Nothing bad to say about his character though, seems like a nice guy.

Tucker is amazing! It does get boring but he is funny and makes jokes during lecture. There are 3 tests and around 15 Tophat questions which count as a test grade. I never did the readings but you do have to come to class in order to understand the material. Test questions come from lectures but if you put in the time it's an easy A!
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Hilarious

comment_Rating: This class was definitely an easier one. His tests are very straightforward and if you pay attention during lecture then you will do good on his tests. He keeps the class interesting and he wants you to do good! He also does random top hats that count as an extra grade which really helps out because they're normally pretty easy.

Bram is very passionate about what he teaches and it makes the class definitely more interesting! He was really funny and made a 9:30 am class go by pretty quickly. The only grades in the class are 3 tests and TopHat, but the tests are easy to comprehend and are pretty straight forward. He wants you to pass his class. Highly recommend!
Dr. Tucker makes a boring subject interesting. He really likes anthro and you can tell. If you go to class and take notes you will get an A. I never touched the book.

Bram Tucker is the most passionate professor at UGA and it shows in his class. take really good notes on the powerpoints he lectures from because specific examples from them will show up on the exam. Do the assigned readings on ELC and brush up on them before the exam.

Mr. Tucker is awesome. He has first hand field experience to the material taught throughout the class. Your grade consists of 3 test and a grade for top hat. He drops 5 top hat assignments out of 15. His test are all scenario based and not too difficult. He gives also gives chances for extra credit on the last 2 tests.

Bram was an amazing professor: subtle humor and interesting lectures. 2 tests and a non cumulative final. 15 tophats given randomly, and you're allowed to miss 5. DONT BUY THE BOOK! Take good notes during lecture and study them. MC is easy, but be thorough on short answers. Extra credit MC offered on last 2 tests. I genuinely learned a lot. Easy A.
GREAT PROFESSOR! He is an awesome lecturer and he really cares about his students. He genuinely wants you to succeed and he does not expect you to know anything past what he talks about in class.
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Hilarious

comment_Rating: Literally show up, get the TopHat question write, and study 6 or so hours before every exam. Nearly guaranteed an A. Dr. Tucker is an amazing professor with amazing experiences in the field. He tries to make class interesting and puts a lot of himself into his work. Only gripe is the classroom itself. So tight I got claustrophobic.

Dr. Tucker is very kind, but there are only 3 tests the whole class which makes it very difficult. I did everything I could to study and still did not get an A. Would recommend a different teacher if this class is a mandatory one for you.
ratingTags_Rating: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment_Rating: Dr. Tucker is an amazing prof who makes his lectures very interesting and informative. He gives study guides for each test and is always available to answer questions. He doesn't take attendance but he will give tophat quizzes on random days, and you really don't learn anything unless you attend class, so I'd recommend showing up as much as you can

Fantastic professor. Bram is obviously passionate about anthropology and it makes for extremely interesting lectures. He doesn't try to trick you on exams and gives obvious hints in class about what he will ask. There are TopHat quizzes randomly in class, but he hints about what days to expect them. Don't need textbook - just take lecture notes.

Great lectures. You do not need the textbook. I promise. He is hilarious and passionate about the material. Tests aren't built to trip you up which makes them straightforward and easy if you went to class. I would take him again.

Bram Tucker is by far the best professor I have ever had! His exams are just like the study guides he posts. He is very passionate during lecture and always keeps it interesting. If I wasn't a third year already, I'd be considering majoring in anthropology- HES THAT GOOD. He does give a Tophat randomly during some lectures so go to class!
ratingTags_Rating: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment_Rating: There are only 2 tests and the final plus tophat that go into the grade so you have little room for error. It is important to go to class so you get tophat points. Not doing the reading did not impact my grade, as long as you take decent notes and understand the concepts it shouldn't be too hard.
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment_Rating: Bram is a good guy. Extremely lecture based but if you take good notes and go to class it should be an easy A in my opinion. Very interesting material.
take the class. you learn a lot and easy A
ratingTags_Rating: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment_Rating: Tucker is a really understanding professor. I took this class for fun, but I found the exam to be really difficult to prepare for because I felt like he expected me to know more than what was taught in lecture. Perhaps the assigned readings help, but they are very difficult to comprehend. He gives the same exams to undergrads and grad students.

If you go to class, take notes and pay attention, you will get a 100. His tests are directly off of his lectures and he uses in class examples for his short answers. He is hilarious and gets your attention during every lecture. YOU DO NOT NEED TO BUY THE BOOK!! Take him for an easy A
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Amazing lectures

comment_Rating: I took Dr. Tucker for ANTH 1102, and I absolutely loved him. The class was fun and extremely interesting. The tests have essay portions, but he and the TAs grade very fairly. As long as you study for the tests, you should be fine. There are some pop quizzes, but they are one question and are normally super easy, but 5 are dropped so don't worry.
ratingTags_Rating: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment_Rating: His top hat questions are 25% of your grade, with 2 tests and 1 final making up the rest of the grade. Top hat questions are really easy if you attend lecture! He makes anthropology super appealing and has a passion for his job. He cares about the students and the tests get progressively easier.

This man was my favorite teacher I have ever had. He is so funny and very excited about the material. Don't miss class though because all of the information on the test is basically given to you in class. The book is not helpful at all. Lots of extra credit and very easy class.
ratingTags_Rating: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment_Rating: Take Dr. Tucker. At the beginning of the course, he made his class sound difficult, but it is do able if you do what he says. Attendance is not mandatory, but he does do random tophat questions that are for a grade. There are 3 tests including the final and there are extra credit on the last two. Easy and manageable course.
ratingTags_Rating: GRADED BY FEW THINGS--EXTRA CREDIT--LECTURE HEAVY

comment_Rating: Dr. Tucker is quite a character! I really enjoyed his lectures and learned a lot. He says you need the book, but I hardly ever did the readings and ended up with an A.

Originally was going to be a negative review but he really is a professor who wants nothing but the best. Overall I had a full schedule and didnt devote all of the time I needed to this course and my grade reflected that. The tests are tough and will make sure you know the material rather than spitting out definitions and other facts.
Dr. Tucker is the best! Tests come right from the lectures which means you need to come to class. Didn't really use the textbook! Even rounded up my 89 to an A-. Def take him for ANTH1102
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--EXTRA CREDIT

comment_Rating: He's very passionate and discusses many real life examples to aid comprehension. The test is about 25 multiple choice questions with 4 short answers. There are bonus points after the first test. Everything can be easily identified in his lectures, which he doesn't post online. Sometimes the short answers can be very specific due to the TAs grading
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tests? Not many--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment_Rating: He's entertaining and doesn't mind being dorky. He gives you study guides with terms/topics you should know and they usually cover all that is on the test. Tests are short answer and multiple choice. You have to be very specific on short answer, but he doesn't grade them his TAs do. I never read the book and did just fine, just take good notes
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment_Rating: He is a very interesting teacher and it makes class for the most part interesting too. Make sure you stay off your phones in this class. Also make sure you're very specific in your short answer responses. Honestly the class wasnt too hard and as long as you put in the work and studied the study guides you should be able to get a grade.

Professor Tucker is an amazing guy with tons of experience in anthropology. He is very passionate about his teachings and is also very patient, fair, and understanding. Although his TAs are the ones who grade tests, he provided us with study guides (lists of terms) for every exam and was always available to answer questions about anything.

Tucker is a great professor and you can tell he is passionate about what he teachers. It is important to attend lectures, but they are always engaging and he is a funny guy. There is an occasional tophat but he drops the lowest 5. If you read sometimes and show up to class you will be able to make an A.

Not a bad professor. He makes his tests where you have to fully understand and be able to apply the material, but it's doable if you go to class and take notes. You don't have to read the textbook if you show up to class. He does tophats every once in a while on the previous class or some article he tells you to read before the next day.

Great professor. if you need to take this class you HAVE to take tucker because he's the best. He makes things interesting and if you show up, take good notes, and study you're going to make an A. Best class I took first semester freshman year. Highly recommend
ratingTags_Rating: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment_Rating: This professor changed the class on purpose to make it harder than he normally does. i would not take him. He's unreliable in what is said about his class. Intentionally wanted our class to do bad! Choose another class and professor! He could hurt your GPA!

Tucker is a really nice guy and is really passionate about anthro. You must go to class bc he does TopHat for attendance and the tests are straight from the class notes but they are application not memorization. Take notes on what he says. The first test was hard but the other two were easy and he gave extra credit. Class will never get cancelled
ratingTags_Rating: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment_Rating: Tucker was a really good teacher and definitely was passionate about anthropology. It's not my thing but he makes it easy to get an A if you put the work in.
ratingTags_Rating: Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment_Rating: Overall the class isn't that hard but however you do need to go to class everyday beacuse he uses a system called "Top Hat" where you enter pop quiz anwsers from your phone. He assigns readings which you should read and his test questions are different as you actually have to apply the readings and he gives a lot of extra credit.

Overall, it's an easy class. If you put in the work, the tests are very simple. The first test was extremely hard. Class average in the 70's. He turns around next test and has a 103 test average. Not a hard A to get but requires work. 3 Tests and tophats all count equally. Extra credit on all but the first tests. Easy questions.
He was a very interesting professor and kept my attention during class. The tests were easy if you attended class and studied. Funny and enjoyed this class!!!

Bram was a very good teacher. His tests and top hat quizzes were fair. I won't lie, the man is not afraid to get political, and I found myself getting incredibly frustrated by that  in class. With that said, if you go to class, take good notes, and study those well, there's no reason you shouldn't be able to make at least an A-.

Dr. Tucker's humor is the best and his lectures are usually extremely interesting and thought provoking. This class made me want to learn more about Anthropology and inspired me to pick up an Anthro double major. Reading from the book was not necessary, but his online reading assignments were necessary because of random top hat questions.

Lots of reading but most of it is on ELC not in the textbook. Attendance is mandatory because of random top hat questions. Dr. Tucker can be an interesting lecturer but puts to much personal opinion in the lectures which creates a difficult learning environment. Multiple choice questions can be tricky but if you study the syllabus and notes not bad
ratingTags_Rating: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment_Rating: Dr. Tucker gives great lectures for this introductory class. He gives 3 tests, a combination of multiple choice and free response. He also gives easy top hat questions some classes. His lectures are solid but grading on the free response can be a little tough. He gives extra credit on the 2nd and 3rd exam. (Final is non cumulative) just the third
ratingTags_Rating: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment_Rating: Bram is one of the greatest teachers I have ever had. Anthropology is historically a pretty dull subject, but Bram made is very interesting and appealing. His lectures are funny and thought-provoking, and he often talks about his travel adventures. His tests are very straightforward and come directly from the notes, and he offers extra credit.
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--EXTRA CREDIT

comment_Rating: Tests are extremely flukey. One will be insanely hard then the next a preschooler could pass. Very test heavy class. Tophat is taken so attendance in mandatory. Often let's his own opinions take over class. Overall not the worst but wouldn't take again.

Dr. Tucker is really cool and makes anthropology interesting! His lectures are easy to follow and very easy to take notes from. Make sure you attend class because there's random top hat questions which also counts for attendance. We have a reading assignment before every lecture but it's not very bad, it's like an introduction to the lecture.

Tucker is a great but he relies on TA's a lot. Attendance is required because he uses top hat and it counts 25% of your grade. The other 75% is from three tests. Multiple choice is a breeze but the short answer is graded super hard.

He gives really interesting lectures, i really enjoyed going to his class.  If you pay attention in class and do the readings, you should be fine.  There was a a lot of material for an intro level class, but it was do-able.  He offers extra credit.  random attendance checks using TopHat so show up to class.

Tucker lets his personal opinions cloud his lectures. He also makes this class unnecessarily hard. If you go to class and take good notes you'll be fine. Also, his short answers on the test are abnormally difficult
ratingTags_Rating: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment_Rating: Dr. Tucker is AWESOME!!! He gives amazing lectures with his experiences in Madagascar. His classes are very inspiring even for non-major students

Dr. Tucker is an excellent professor. He's super excited and really loves anthropology. That being said, his tests can be pretty difficult because their concept-based. Don't expect to breeze through without reading and fully comprehending the material assigned. TA's are harsh graders so make sure your answers are THOROUGH. Good luck.

His lectures are interesting and I found that just taking notes in class will suffice as long as you have a good grip on the information. It is helpful to read but I made it by rather easily in one unit without. His multiple choice aren't that hard and if you pay attention in lecture the short answer should be a breeze. Study the thesis.
Tucker is very scatter brained in class. Attendance is mandatory and he will only say certain topics once. Short answers are graded ridiculously hard and don't think his tests will be an easy A

Dr. Tucker is awesome!! He is so passionate about Anthropology and has so much experience that he's able to tell stories that can help you relate to the material. You must go to every class because he takes random attendance and the tests all come from his lectures but his hilarious personality will make you want to be there! He made me enjoy it.

Dr. Tucker is very excited about Anthropology. That being said, he takes it way too seriously for an intro class and he thinks every student should love it as much as he does. So his test questions can be tricky and involve a LOT of thought. He constantly gives extra credit though so you have plenty of opportunities to fix your test grades.

The class was a rollercoaster. I ended with an A somehow, but you NEED to read the articles & go over notes. LISTEN in class, since he might only go over certain material once. Free response on exams graded HARD, but M/C a not too bad. The wording may trick you! Extra credit will SAVE final grade. Two exams & noncumulative final along with paper.

Overall, Professor Tucker was a pretty solid professor. His lectures are long and boring and he does random attendance checks,  but the material is not difficult. His tests have a free response section, which could sometimes be tough, but overall they were not too difficult. Tucker also gives extra credit on tests so you can improve your grade.

Love this professor! He makes all the lectures engaging and fun with his sense of humor and amazing anecdotes. People come in expecting anthro to be an easy A though, and it is IF you actually understand the concepts and not just mindlessly memorize stuff. Go to the TA's for help. All the tests so far have come with free points, so that's a plus.

really interesting lecturer, gives 3 tests with extra credit to get back on 2 of them, if you take notes its an easy A, loved going to listen to Tucker's lectures even though I could care less about anthropology

Mr. Tucker was one of the coolest professors I have ever taken! He always has cool stories to tell, and he is so funny. The class itself is a little difficult, but if you put forth effort you can make an A. I would highly encourage taking Mr. Tucker, as he truly cares about the student, as well as the subject.

Dr. Tucker is a great professor and overall a really nice guy. The lectures can sometimes get a little dry but most of the time they are really interesting. He gives a lot of real life examples, which you should be somewhat familiar with for the tests. The annotated bib assignment is simple. Go to class, its worth it.

He was honestly an amazing teacher and I would definitely take a class of his again. We had 2 big tests worth 30%, extra credit quizzes to make back 5 points on each test, an easy annotate bibliography, and a noncumulative final. Oh, and he takes 10 attendance checks worth 1 point each. He was super funny, helpful, and gave back points when unfair.

Tucker's tests come straight from the notes, and he takes attendance randomly throughout the semester. The class itself is kind of boring, so I don't recommend taking it on a Tuesday/Thursday schedule if you can help it. But overall if you go to class, take notes, and study even a little bit for his tests you can't go wrong.

Hysterical. Reminds me of Will Ferrell + Fred Armisen. Powerpoints and explanations were very helpful. Class necessary. No book. Read the articles. Use the TA's, they tried SO hard to help me. It was surprisingly difficult, fewer questions on test than I'd like, but I really loved this class.

Dr. Tucker was an amazing teacher and the topics discussed in class were so interesting. Class was more like debate/social hour between student and teacher because the subject material was so interesting and all the students were quick to participate. Best teacher I've had at UGA.  No textbook, just articles! But he's going away for research next y

Tucker is amazing! If you ever have a chance to take an Anthro class with him-- do it! He makes class incredibly interesting, even if you don't actually like Anthropology. No textbook! Big plus. As long as you pay attention to his lectures and take notes (DO IT), then you should get an A in this class. He offers tons of extra credit on tests too!

Dr. Tucker is pretty interesting and funny but he uses every last minute of the class and usually makes you stay after class. His tests are really hard and since there is no text book, you really have to take extra notes and go to every class. Otherwise, you will have no idea what is going on.

Tucker is funny and entertaining. He has a lot of clarity problems though, and jumps around a lot. It's unclear what you need to know for the test and the TA's are hard graders on the essay portions. Easy A if you study.

Dr. Tucker is amazing! I had him for African Ethnography. He explains the material beautifully, the exams are extremely straightforward (even fun), every lecture is a truly a gift. I look forward to his classes immensely -- he will make you love anthropology. If you do what you are supposed to, an easy and ENJOYABLE A!

Phenomenal phenomenal! I had to take this class to meet requirements for my major and I am so glad I took it with Dr. Tucker. Although the material was extremely dry, I always enjoyed coming to class. Dr. Tucker was an excellent professor and if you have the opportunity to take this class with him, I highly recommend it!

Dr. Tucker is one of the best teachers I have ever had. He has a passion that is really rare among professors. His lectures were never dull and the tests were pretty easy. He even offers extra credit on two of the three tests. Plus, there is no textbook.

I looked forward to this class. The lectures can be long at times, Dr. Tucker teaches from bell to bell and you take a lot of notes.  He uses fun stories that help you remember.  THIS IS ONE OF THE MOST FULFILLING CLASSES I TOOK. Dont expect an easy A though. If you show up to class Id expect a B-

First,Tucker can keep a crowd going like Dane Cook. However, the class isn't as easy as you would think. He doesn't like to talk to students at all, so expect a TA to do all the responding. The TA's grade like you are graduating with an Anthropology degree. SO, if you are a student who works or has a lot of out school work. This class may fail you.

Hands down, the best teacher at UGA. I am not a big school buff, but I actually looked forward to this class. He's hilarious and he is NEVER boring. He is very clear in his lectures. Fair grading as well. It's very easy to make an A in this class!

There was no textbook for this class. Instead, Bram made a cd of texts (which were for the most part good reads). The big plus of this class is that Bram is an excellent orator- he really encourages interest in the subject. a+

This is not the easiet class at UGA and the tests are challenging. However, if you go to all the classes the tests only cover the lecture notes so you should be good to go. I made a 97 in the class by going to all the classes and sudying 2 hours before each test. However, you should take this prof because he is simply amazing. Best prof at UGA.

As a senior, I can honestly say that Tucker's Economic ANTH course is the best I've ever taken. I had it at 9am and actually looked forward to this class! Fascinating material, fair grading, super awesome teacher. It's certainly not easy (I had to work hard for a B) but it was so worth it. This class changed how I look at the world!

Bram was an amazing teacher. I'm an Anthro major so I already loved it before I took it. He was very engaging and very humorous. I recommend this class to anyone who is even moderately interested in Anthro.

I really liked this class, and Dr. Tucker. Very well prepared, incredibly enthusiastic...he uses a lot of stories and examples to get his point across, which are all very interesting. I would recommend this class esp. to science majors who need a humanity.

I enjoyed this class because he explained everything so well. His love for the subject was evident and made the class very interesting.  He had a good sense of humor and presented his topics well. I would recommend this class to anyone interested in learning about anthropology.

Tucker was my favorite professor. He has very well prepared slides and goes into detail to explain what could be the harder topics. He keeps things interesting with his fun sense of humor and great stories. He definitely knows his topic and is passionate about it. I recommend trying to get him and to make sure to study for the tests with the notes!

Awesome professor. Has a great sense of humor, gets really excited about the material and makes it interesting. Go to class, he'll mention things that you will be tested on and wont be able to find in the textbook, plus its fun! He has plenty of neat personal experiences from the field that he ties in. Highly recommended.

Dr. Tucker is a anthropological stud. He definitely loves his subject and goes to great lengths in lectures to truly explain the subject being taught and give numerous examples. I think anthropology can be a boring subject if taught by the wrong professor, but with him teaching it, it became really funny (great, wacky humor) and applicable.
great professor, very helpful and made the class interesting. Really enjoyed taking the course. I recommend him for anyone who has to take anthropology.

Best teacher Ive had so far. He and the TA's overprepare you for the tests and they are very easy as long as you study your notes. Dont buy the book because you dont need it at all. He is very passionate, fun and down to earth and his class is very interesting!

Dr. Tucker is by far one of the most interesting professors I have hard thus far. His lectures always pertain to real life situations and he is very passionate about what he does. Tests are almost always right from the notes, so go to class. However, the tests are not exactly easy either, you really need to understand the information to do well.

My favorite class this semester. Dr. Tucker is amazing! He makes the material enjoyable and funny at times, and really knows what he's talking about. Just make sure you go to class, notes will make much more sense than if you get them from someone else!

I really enjoyed Dr. Tucker's class. He is really interesting, even if you're not an anthropology major, and the information he teaches is pertinent to real life. His tests aren't too bad and are mostly from the lecture notes. Class isn't mandatory, but I would recommend going. Also, he's really funny!

Professor Tucker really has a passion for anthropology. He did field study in Madagascar and has some very funny stories from his studies there. He also really gets into lectures and knows how to make them fun. Can be a little boring at times, but overall very fun and interesting.

Excellent teacher.  You have to go to class, even if attendence isn't mandatory, because his tests are almost strictly from notes.  Tests aren't difficult if you study some.  Hilarious at times.  If you need an elective, I suggest taking this one.

I had Dr. Tucker for Economic Anthropology.  Excellent lecture style and experience, cares about the subject material.  Since the course was a synthesis of research in the field, our readings were research papers provided for us.  Consistent and fair grading, excellent speaker, encourages class participation and discussion.  Highly reccomended.

Awesome professor!! Although some subjects were very boring, Dr. Tucker's enthusiam for Anthropology made me look forward to some of the lectures.  He is extremely knowledgable and good at explaining. The tests aren't too bad, but can't be crammed because they are based mostly on understanding concepts and application, not just memorization.
Dr. Tucker's class was very enjoyable. The notes were very easy to understand and the outline format made studying easier. The in class discussions were also very interesting.

Great teacher!! Very interesting and knows a lot about what hes teaching. Don't use the book much but he does give articles to read which are used on the tests. Tests are ok. Not too hard but not a piece of cake either. Highly recommend this class though! Very fun!!

This class wavered between extremely boring and extremely interesting. He doesn't post his notes online, however, so attendance is important, since his tests (which are rather easy) come from the notes (not from the book). Don't ever expect to get out early; he teaches from the beginning of class to the very last minute.

Mr. Tucker made anthropology so interesting. He used great examples and explains things clearly so you can understand the concepts. I don't know how people say this class is boring, I never got bored. Test material comes from study guides and notes. I definitely recommend him!
Easu Class. The guy's a bit of a dork, but he is an Anthropology professor. Anyway, I went to most of his classes. I studied about 5 or so hours the days before the tests. I made an A. That simple.
He really seems to take an interest in the class.

His class was very boring. His test were very hard. There were only two or three test in his class. This class is only good for people who enjoy anthropology. He loved talking about evolution and it drove me crazy. Overall I didn't enjoy this class and slept throughout most of his lectures.
Love him.  One of the best professors I've had.  Excellent lectures, examples, anecdotes.  It was really sad when he cut off all his hair.

The lectures were interesting because he obviously loves anthropology. Unfortunately the tests did not follow the lecture notes very well. You are expected to take basic information and make it much more difficult. This is too difficult for an intro class and basically combines different upper level classes of anthropology all into the intro class.

Bram is an amazing teacher! He is enthusiastic about his subject and relays that in his lectures! If you show up to class the tests will be a breeze! His passion for the subject made every lecture interesting! And the guy really knows his stuff

Bram seems to be a fantastic guy, just not so much when it comes to teaching. He lectures like hell, so be prepared to come to class--EVERYDAY or you WILL screw up. Tests are a serious ****! In my opinion, too hard for an intro class. Kinda hot in a weird geeky kinda way.

This class was easy if you came everyday. The tests came from the notes with few questions on the outside questions. I never studied and I made an A. Some of his lectures were boring but jsut as many were really interesting. He is a very passionate teacher.

Tucker's notes are unorganized and hard to follow sometimes.  His tests are not memorization but rather applied information, which ends up being a lot harder than most other intro classes. If you take this class, be prepared to come to class every day and you'll have to study hard to make a good grade.

Bram really loves anthropology and he makes you kind of want to love it, too, but it is so boring that i almost fall asleep every class. the tests are kind of hard and you have to study a lot for them.
Make sure you show up to class to get the notes.  The tests are mostly made up of material covered in the class.  It's rare that you have to know something from the reading assignments.

He was my professor for the Quantum World FYO. He did get to know us personally. Also, it was clear that he knew the material but didn't know how to convey it to new learners. The quizzes were also difficult and unnecessarily specific into the topic. It seemed like he expected us to understand the topic at a higher level than any of us expected.
ratingTags_Rating: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment_Rating: Allen is incredibly smart but it wasn't helpful to any of his students. His lectures were boring, hard to follow, and ended up not being that beneficial for the tests. He barely did practice problems. There was a lot of homework and progress checks, but luckily the progress checks were pretty similar to the tests.
ratingTags_Rating: Tough Grader--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment_Rating: Definitely the best choice for general chemistry 1. He genuinely cares about his students and made an effort to get to know everyone individually. While I did not attend office hours personally, Dr. Allen had ample time slots for everyone. The class is graded with a scale, meaning that the top 20ish % get an A. Lecture based with clicker questions.
ratingTags_Rating: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment_Rating: Allen is a stand-up guy and quite possibly one of the smartest people I've come across on campus. But he's so intelligent that it comes at the sacrifice of him not getting that most students don't get chemistry as easily as him. And that just leads to pretty useless attempts at office hours and impossible quizes/tests. AVOID AT ALL COSTS
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--TEST HEAVY

comment_Rating: Dr. Allen was a very poor teacher. He's a very smart person, however knowing something and being able to teach others about that something at two very different things and I believe the professor falls into the former. Everything was graded by a computer with zero partial credit. I swear he made the class as hard as possible. Stay away from this.
ratingTags_Rating: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY

comment_Rating: He really wants to be close to his students, and his office hours is somewhat helpful. The tests are extremely hard. The best way to study is the progress checks and old tests because past questions are on every test. The final was horrible with a lot of "choose all that apply". It was different from regular tests. He does curve the test grades.

I believe Dr. Allen was an extremely poor professor to the point I don't think he should even be teaching. I found him extremely condescending. Whatever you do do not take this class ever. You know how people say the presidency ages you? I feel like this class took years off life. The stress and hours I spent studying never paid off.
ratingTags_Rating: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment_Rating: Dr. Allen is very knowledgeable, but clearly shows disdain for Chem 1 students. Progress checks and tests are impossible to do well on by design, if for no other reason than the lack of partial credit and the ease with which you can make multiple formatting errors. The curve at the end of the semester is your only hope. Avoid this professor.

Dr. Allen is a nice man, but his teaching was sub-par. You know it's tough when the average test grade for most tests hovered around the 50s consistently. The lectures cover more general concepts while the test questions are very specific and detail oriented. Only saving grace is the end-of-semester curve. Very hard class, avoid taking if possible.

For an extremely important class for most students, Dr. Allen makes his class overly difficult. His progress checks and tests are designed to make sure students fail. His lectures are too shallow for the information covered on his exams. If you take this class make sure to be prepared for overly specific test questions and a heavy homework load.

He is a super smart guy but too smart for our good. He expects a lot forgetting that this is sometimes the first time hearing material. He cares but only about certain students. His lectures were so boring and useless. I would not recommend him to my enemy!
ratingTags_Rating: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY

comment_Rating: I detested this class. Allen may act like he cares, but actions speak louder than words. Chemistry is now my least favorite subject because of this course.
ratingTags_Rating: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment_Rating: The class was easily the hardest one that I've taken at UGA, and was usually stressful. While there was a pretty hefty curve, you still never really knew where you stood. Allen seemed like a pretty nice guy, but his tests and progress checks were intensly difficult and the homework was time consuming. While the class is doable, it won't be fun.

Dr Allen is a great and caring guy who really cares about chemistry. Students who show a similar interest would probably enjoy this class but the rest of us seem to be on the wayside. Assignments and tests are super hard, but there is a fair curve at the end of class.
ratingTags_Rating: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY

comment_Rating: if you like busy work, boring lectures, progress checks, and horrific tests, this class is for you! in all honesty, Allen's class was absolutely dreadful. sure, he's a sweet guy. but, this was, beyond reasonable doubt, the most awful class I have taken at uga
ratingTags_Rating: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment_Rating: Our grading system for the class involved a curve that would give a proportional amount of each grade. This is lazy and shows unwillingness to make tests reflective of actual knowledge of the material. When the average for the final is near a 50 it is obvious that he cant teach the material effectively. He is also very arrogant. Dont recommend.

this is such an annoying class and unnecessarily hard. I like being challenged, but not like this. wish we were tested on things we learn in class. also wish the tests weren't online so that the teacher can see our thought process but thats more an issue of the complacency of uga chem dept. hey @chemdept you really deadened chemistry for me!

Don't take Allen if you want to pass this class. His lectures are not helpful and tests are just computational. He's a nice guy and he cares but is horrible at explaining concepts and tests you on things he never even lectured on. If you're stuck with him, study the homework and progress checks. But try not to get stuck with him.
ratingTags_Rating: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment_Rating: He seemed to care a lot about his students. I never went but I heard his office hours were very helpful. He wants to get to know his students. The tests were graded by a computer and there was never partial credit. This was an extremely hard class but he curved everyone's grades in the end.

Dr. Allen cares about the success of his students. He said in class that he challenges students in order to master the material completely and gave us a generous curve (76A) because of the difficulty of the exams. This class was probably the most difficult class I've ever taken, but I also learned a ton. GO TO OFFICE HOURS! They help so much.
ratingTags_Rating: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment_Rating: This class is designed to make you fail and will consume your life. Be prepared to have lots of online homework and progress checks. The exams do not reflect the material and are graded based on a curve he makes at the end of the year. It can be helpful, though, to study the progress checks as some questions are repeated.
ratingTags_Rating: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--TEST HEAVY--Tests are tough

comment_Rating: Dr. Allen will definitely help you in office hours if you need it. However, homework serves little purpose for tests where passing is considered a huge accomplishment. Although the curve is generous, you are basically competing for an A since the curve revolves around how others are doing in the class. Take Robinson for honors chem, not Allen.
ratingTags_Rating: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Tests are tough

comment_Rating: He's a nice guy but this class is impossible. If you go to office hours he'll answer your questions, but honestly it doesn't help. The lectures move insanely fast but are oversimplified and the amount of homework is overwhelming to the point that I don't have time to dedicate to other classes. Chem has consumed my life and I'll be lucky if I pass.
ratingTags_Rating: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment_Rating: Dr. Allen is so nice do not get me wrong he learned many people's names quickly and is available at office hours and easy to talk to but he makes his lectures way simpler than the test. His tests are nearly impossible and although he curves a lot (76 is an A) that shows something is wrong in my opinion.
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment_Rating: If you are planning on taking Allen's Chem class you better come into the class with a strong background in Chemistry. Tests and quizzes are extremely hard despite them being curved, and most students would consider getting a B in this class quite an accomplishment. By taking this class you are definitely sacrificing your GPA and scholarships
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment_Rating: Super great guy! But tests and quizzes are super hard (although they are curved) ! And a normal amount of homework
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Caring

comment_Rating: STUDENT BE AWARE! sign up and risk a sucker punch to your GPA. Sign up for this guy an your putting Zell, Hope, Honors and GPA in jeopardy. REMEMBER the low 2.3 GPA he averages does not include all those that drop the class or it would be much lower. As others state he may be have a sound knowledge of the topic but lacks the ability to teach
ratingTags_Rating: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment_Rating: Here's the thing: its freshman Chem at UGA. Its NOT going to be easy. However, if you are going to take Dr. Allen: His lectures are more on the boring side, but GO TO HIS OFFICE HOURS FROM THE START. He WILL help you. He may seem intimidating in lecture, but absorb what you can understand and ask him about stuff you don't.
ratingTags_Rating: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment_Rating: His lectures were rarely interesting, and most of what we learned in class or online didn't prepare us for tests and online quizzes. He likes to turn off the lights and lecture along with a power point which doesn't engage the class. He's a nice guy and will help you outside of class, but if you only have time for in class help, you're in trouble.

Dr Allen is very good at chemistry but expects intro students to know everything. Lectures were boring and the notes were not helpful. Tests are ALL application and half the stuff you have never seen/learned before. Super hard but wouldn't really help with another teacher as all the classes were the same. Progress checks were hard just like tests
ratingTags_Rating: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria--TEST HEAVY

comment_Rating: CHEM 1211 is incredibly hard here in general, but Dr. Allen definitely knows his material. His lectures are boring (avoid 8AM), but if you meet with him during his office hours, it's easier to understand in a smaller setting. Go to every class, do all your homework, and work together on progress checks. Don't get discouraged with a bad test grade.
ratingTags_Rating: Get ready to read--Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment_Rating: CHEM 1211 just sucks because of the tests, which are designed to make you fail. But Dr. Allen was alright. His lectures were boring tangents about the history of Chemistry that seemed irrelevant for the tests, but he made up for that with helpful clicker questions and lots of availability in office hours.
ratingTags_Rating: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--TEST HEAVY

comment_Rating: I feel like he is a better teacher to take for the subject. He makes it easy to see him after class, and he truly cares about his student. He knows his subject well, so if you need help then GO TO HIS OFFICE HOURS. But, chemistry is hard and you will always have to work for a good grade no matter what teacher you have.
ratingTags_Rating: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment_Rating: Dr. Allen is really helpful outside of class. Go to his office hours!! He will help you with your homework and explain concepts in more detail. He will even bring his chicken to class :) Chem at UGA is hard but just keep up with JExam and attend class for the clickers.

Allen seems genuinely interested in his students doing well in the course. I would recommend to go to class (clicker questions), read the book, and do your JEXAM people! He is a really nice guy, so go and meet with him if you can.

Allen is a pretty good professor, obviously knows his material. Clicker questions were never unfair and he is genuinely interested in his students. However, he didn't make our tests, another professor did, and they weren't too nice.

I mean, it's a UGA Chem class, so it's not easy, and there really aren't any fantastic professors. Dr. Allen is nice and one time brought in his pet chicken named Jessica, but he is boring. His voice is pretty much the equivalent to a lullaby; both put me to sleep. I've skipped class more than I should b/c I hate the class.

I would say Dr. Allen is the nicest of all the Chem professors but probably also the most boring one, too. He isnt blatantly rude like Atwood but his lectures put me to sleep. He also uses the chalkboard, like the 50's, which means if your sitting past the 5th row, you cant see what hes writing. CHEM is a hard class tho period, despite who teaches.

If you plan on taking Chemistry 1211 or 1212, TAKE DR. ALLENS LECTURE! I've had two other teacher, Atwood and Anderson. Dr. Atwood is a huge **** with the biggest ego. Dr. Anderson is old as dirt, I cant read his writing, and he is boring as hell. Dr. Allen os very knowledgeable and he is the VERY best at expaining chemistry, which is very hard.

Dr. Allen is a brilliant professor.  He is incredibly intelligent and kind.  It's obvious that he truly cares about his students and wants them to succeed.  His lectures are usually accompanied by an interesting demonstration, which keeps the class exciting.  I wholeheartedly recommend Dr. Allen as a general chemistry professor.

Although this is a very tough class, he was a great teacher. Most people tend to blame the professor for their poor grade, but Allen is always open for questions. I am taking him again for 1212. He is a great professor!

Chemistry in itself is hard, so it is not the professor's fault. He is VERY knowledgeable on anything Chemistry and knows how to explain it.  He is always very helpful and open for any questions. He has reasonable office hours and will help on ELC. Would definitely recommend this professor.
He's brilliant, and he knows how to share it.  I hated chemistry before coming into his class; he's completely changed my attitude toward chemistry.

Dr. Allen is the best general chemistry professor.  I've been to all of the professors' review sessions, and it's obvious that Dr. Allen is the most clear, precise, and helpful.  He's such a nice guy, and he's always willing to help.  I would definitely recommend Dr. Allen.
He's a little pompous but at least he tries.

the tests are not determined by him but rather atwood so it doesn't matter which professor you take really except for lecture. I got bored because he really doesn't draw you in but he is incredibly smart and is willing to help outside of class.

He was helpful at all. Whenever i had questions or needed help i would go to Dr. Atward, because i just hated him, he wouldn't listen, woundn't help, i hated when he said "for the fairness of all the students, you need to deal with it."

If you have a background in chemistry, the class isn't that bad.  For those of us who came in with no idea what we were doing, the class was pointless.  Dr. Allen was a wonderful guy, but he didn't spend enough time on the material.  Don't bother going to class.  Study the powerpoint, read the book, and go to his help session to learn the material.

I thought Dr. Allen was a very nice man, but in class he tended to go a bit too fast and just read off the slides.  It was hard to keep up with him at times because after everyone grasped one idea he would immediately jump to another.  Very helpful, weekly help sessions.

He's not that bad. The class is awful because of the way it's run which is not his fault it's the department's. He kind of read off the powerpoints and didn't explain much, but he was available for extra help. If you have trouble just read the book.
He's almost too smart for the subject. His help sessions are almost no help at all. If it's in your control, get Schepler!!! the class is not easy regardless of who you have, but he is no extra help!
He was very boring. I had a really hard time staying awake. His class is pretty much him playing with his mac laptop.
really nice, but boring.
zzzzzzzz

Very good lecturer, in the sense that I DIDN'T always want to peel my skin off while in class. Sometimes lectures are still hard to follow, but thats probably because I suck at Chemistry.  Overall he's about as good a lecturer as they come, so chose him.  He's very helpful outside of class too.  BUY THE LECTURE OUTLINE AND USE IT!! Its a lifesaver.
Very helpful!  You must listen and pay attention in class----good attendance doesn't hurt either!
disaster; arrogant towards students.
No Comments
He's a nice guy and very willing to help you outside of class, but he's hard to follow during lecture so if chemistry isn't your strong point this class will be a hard.
Stimulating, supportive and and extremely knowledgable!

The class was History of the Samurai. Friday knows everything Japan related. He is a leader in the field, so there are often differences between what old texts say and what he says (usually in his own more recent text) but in my experience he made it clear. His take home essay testing is intense but fair and means attendance is truly optional.

Awful class and awful instructor.  He has no problem getting political in class, which I find rather difficult considering this class was about pre-modern Japan.  I almost got my first C in this class but managed to pull out a B, probably b/c I bashed President Bush on our final (I had no idea what the material covered).  I also rarely wne to class

Very nice guy and knowledgable, but very hard material and teaching method. Class consists of 3-essay midterm, 4-essay final, and 5pg term paper, each weighted equally. I was confused many times because he would explain something for 15m then say, "That's what a lot of books have, but it's not really correct." Also, lectures and textbooks conflict.

This class consists of the most random Japanese information.  While he wants you to understand processes and methods, you will inevitably not follow as he jumps all over the place.  He also grades very difficultly.
She is very good, is eager to help, and is a fair grader!

I took this back in the summer, and it was one of the best classes I've ever taken.  She is really approachable and fair with her grading.  I liked the way she set up our essay prompts for Adv. Comp.  If you ever take this class, hope for Jill.  Class act.
Ms. Parrott was an awesome teacher. She is extremely helpful and gives you plenty of time to get your papers done. I would definitely recommend her!

Ms. Parrott is a great choice for this mandatory class. Not much reading. Only 4 essays and the portfolio, but there are about 10 journal entries throughout the semester that help your grade. She is definitely not a hard grader and is more than willing to help you out. Plus, she's pretty cute

Awesome teacher! She is extremely dedicated and loves when students go to office hours. She is very willing to help. I went to her office hours and she let me edit my paper for extra points. I didn't hear of anyone getting over a 94 on her papers, but its not that hard to get an A. You just have to try hard!

I took the multicultural session. i was very interesting, bu Ms. Parrott was ok. She wasn;t mean but she was very sarcastic all the time. I still don't understand her grading methods. I personally don't think that they are fair at all. Don't take her if you want to get an A.
She's cool, enjoys her subject and teachs with interest. She is a very helpful person, and overall would just be a fun person to hang out with... class is full of freshman but she's fun.

TAKE HER! She's fair on grades, and you don't have much work to do. There are only 3 papers and a portfolio, and she gives you plenty of time to do it...even some class time. She's willing to help if you need it. She's kinda sarcastic, but it helps to make the class go by faster.

I hate writing and reading so I was not to happy about taking english, but Ms. Parrott made this class fun and interestating because she is passionate about the subject. She grades paper fairly and as long as you try on a paper you will do well. When I actually tried on my papers I made better grades then I thought I would. Very Helpful!!!

Awesome teacher!  Very dedicated, grades a little tough, but if you like the subject matter, and writing comes easy to you, you will do fine.  She is extremely helpful, even if you aren't a great writer, you can at least pull a B.  Is very understanding about the demands of college, so her workload is a lot but nothing too over zealous.  Take her !
Kind of a ****, but she comes from aubrun so she cant expect that much. Seems cool if you saw her at a bar, but would grade you hard.

Shes really nice and her class is fun but you really have to enjoy writing papers or you are going to struggle. Seems like she goes easy on you but in reality, you have to write like a champ to pull an A.
I would reccomend taking Ms.Parrott in any class you are able to!  She is awesome!

Mr. Reynolds is a really nice guy and really loves what he does. Class is always a little boring, but he tries to make it interesting. He even lets you out early a lot of the time. If you go to him to get help on a paper, he will basically tell you exactly what you need to do to get an A on the paperGet help from him on the side and it is an easy A

Mr. Reynolds was a pretty nice guy. Attendance was mandatory but class would often be just like 20 minutes. We only wrote 3 papers and the IRE. The quizzes and journals are really easy. He kind of let the portfolio sneak up on us though. If you take him, make sure to have him look over your paper before you turn it in.

Don't waste your time with this class. He gets lost in his  own world and has little insight into the readings. His grading style is ridiculous and focuses on MLA rather than content and grammer. While attendance is mandatory, it is a big waste of time. However, he is a huge push over, allowing for late papers and made up assignments.
Teaches only what he enjoys, which makes the class enjoyable. Pretty funny, and the classes are an absolute pleasure to attend.  Always fun.

He's a likeable guy. He is flexible with due dates, but he grades essays oddly. For example, very poorly written essays may still receive a C, while essays that are much, much better may only receive a B. Overall, the work load and content is easy, but the grading practices make an A more difficult to come by than one might expect.

This was a good class. Professor Reynolds is interesting and cool. He's really flexible with due dates, but he does grade somewhat tough. Overall, a good class and a good teacher. I would take him again.

This has been one of my favorite classes. Sometimes he would keep us in class for only 15 minutes. We had only short readings every once and a while. And we would take daily quizzes on the readings that where very easy. He grades a little tough on essays though.

He's a decent teacher. His grading is kinda strange. He takes off major points for things like MLA formatting errors. He gives out quizzes everyday so make sure you read. We only had 3 essays to write instead of the 4 we were supposed to have. I don't recommend him. Try to find a better teacher.

Great Guy, can be a bit boring at times but definitely has a sense of humor. Will do his best to help you. I let a paper  slide so I got a B, if you actually put effort into the course you can easily get an A.

the nicest guy ever, really a great teacher. definately take him if you get the chance. really laid back and fun, but definately knows what he is talking about. you can tell he really loves english/literature.
He's a very funny, laid back kind of guy. Very flexible with due dates. Daily quizzes on reading are not bad if you actually read, but they are usually only 4 questions. Take this teacher!!

Really, really nice guy.  Allows for conference time for essays.  Daily grades on quizzes over the readings.  Gives plenty of time for the essays and it is really helpful to go in and conference with him.
Hates EMMA, so you hardly have to use it. We had one less essay than all the other 1102 classes. You can turn in papers a week late with no penalty. He constantly cancelled class.
he was so sweet and as long as you did pretty well on your papers you were guaranteed an A!!!
Decent, laid-back professor.  Sometimes his laid-back attitude left students with the burden of catching up on assignments not done during scheduled  time.
Very willing to work with students about due dates on papers...
Professor Gunter was one of the best professors in my history.

AREC310 In all my 6 years as an undergraduate, this was the one class I found  impossible to sleep in.   His brilliant lectures kept me awake and attentive in spite of being hung over. I found myself writing down his economist jokes so I could use them again. I do not understand why he left UGA right after teaching that class? Go Dawgs.
He's an insanely hard grader. Worked my tail off and still didn't do as well as I hoped in this class.
Excellent, You will know the material before the end of class

Dr. Dustman is the best! I am in nursing school now and I am missing her teaching style so much right now. She does interactive learning in the class while expecting us to review her youtube videos or "podcasts" before class. I wish other teachers had such an innovative approach to teaching. Love you, Dr. Dustman!

Has a gamified class setting- she will explain and it is not as confusing as it sounds. Tries to make class fun. You can work on projects ahead of time which I loved. You do do alot of outside work but is probably the better option out of other teachers tbh. You teach yourself with podcasts she has on youtube she provides link so book optional

Dr Dustman's class is not a traditional lecture style course. Most of class time is spent on class activities and lab skills. The course is designed in a clear manner and as long as you stay up to date on her podcasts you should be fine. Tests can be difficult but there are many projects that act as grade buffers.

She's super nice and willing to help you. Buttttt her tests especially the MC can be tricky. She does podcasts which is nice but sometimes it runs over the 1hr 15mn mark which gets annoying. Upside is you only have to go to class once a week. She he gives lots of extra credit so not too hard to make a good grade even if you do bad on her tests

Great professor! Tests are challenging, but she gives a lot of extra credit opportunities. Lectures are given through podcasts so you can watch them on your own time. You only have to go to class once a week for group activities. I'm not sure if she does this every year though. Also, don't buy the book because you don't need it.

Dr. Dustman is a great professor, one of the best I have had at UGA. This is also a great course overall at UGA because you learn a lot but it is not extremely difficult. Do not bother buying the book, you do not need it. Take MIBO 3510L with it, the lab class is great too!

Great teacher who genuinely cares about students.  Tests are very easy and predictable if you pay attention to her way of thinking and what she focuses on in class.  Gives plenty of bonus through in class quizzes.  If you have a good grade through 3 tests, then you do not have to take the final exam.
LOVED this lab! Dr. Dustman has created an easy to understand and fun hands on lab experience with this one.
Loved this class! She provided great analogies, which helped with understanding the more complicated material. Know the power points and you will do well!!

She gives very clear notes. You do not need to buy the textbook. The only thing tricky about this class is her short answer questions on the tests. For the short answer questions you need to say as much as you can in about 2 to 3 sentences.

Had her for the Micro lab. It's a fun class, and she does a good job of trying to keep the tests fair. She'll also give extra credit throughout the semester. She keeps the lectures easy to understand, and the labs aren't that hard.

I too her MIBO3500 and MIBO3510L. I liked both the classes, especially the lab. Labs were interesting, fun and easy to do. Maybe I liked the lab so much because I had the best TA ever(his name is Tye, MUST take him!) Labs are all about the TAs. as for the lecture, it was straight forward and made it easy to understand. take her :)

BORING! She keeps lights off in class, speaks in monotone, and reads directly off the slides. Her test questions are tricky, vague, and very ambiguous - she even said that. the good thing is she gives lots of extra credit. the information is interesting, her teaching and testing style are not.

Wonderful professor, however, her tests are super hard.  That being said, all you have to study are the notes... but you really have to know the notes.  Don't buy the book.  She was fair and really tried hard to make sure everyone was on the same page.  I made an A- without going to class, but barely so attending class is a plus.

As far as labs go, this was pretty easy. I took the lab and the 3500 lecture at the same time which helped a lot. She offers extra credit so go to class. The only down side is that the majority of your grade comes from the midterm and final, so study!
As long as you study the slides the class is pretty easy, I rarely went to class and pulled an A-. The tests are difficult, but she more than compensates with extra credit.

This class isn't as easy as it seems, but it's not too bad. Dr. Dustman does a great job of explaining the material. The multiple choice can be tricky, but manageable if you know your stuff. Dustman gives a good amount of extra credit to help you out.
don't be fooled. i was told this class is the easier science classes, but it is NOT!

This class was not as easy as people said it was. The tests can be tricky, but they aren't hard. There's a massive amount of bonus so you don't need to do that well on the tests to get an A. Dr. Dustman was really nice and you could tell she cared about our grades because she did a lot to help us out.
Great teacher. Easy class. All notes are on powerpoint. Don't have to go to class to do well on the tests but it helps.
She is a nice woman but she is very lazy and does not give feedback quickly.  Go to class she does give extra credit and sample questions.
Wonderful teacher!  Very helpful and quick to respond to questions/emails.  I would definitely recommend her as a teacher!
She's a very sweet woman. her tests can be tricky sometimes, but as long as you memorize the notes, you don'te even need to go to class.
Great teacher! Easy to talk to and actually wants students to understand and do well. Even gives extra credit!!

DeLuca is now at the U of U. He has a unique way of teaching, that really challenges current lines of thinking. He provides great applicable examples during his lectures and he more strives to get you to evaluate your current thinking, rather than just wanting you to agree with what he is presenting. He is so far my favorite professor at the U.
ratingTags_Rating: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment_Rating: Eccentric, hysterical, knows exactly what he's talking about. I think I had a good giggle in about 95% of his lectures. Not very clear on grading, though, so if that's what you're after I wouldn't recommend. If you want to learn a lot in an enjoyable class and don't mind being made fun of when you make a stupid comment, take take take!
He looks like Ray Romano, but acts like Chelsea Handler and that mean Hell's Kitchen guy.

Great Lecturer, but the worst teacher I've ever had. He has absolutely no interest in the success of his students. You'd better like being treated like a moron and that your psychic because he'll give no instruction and grade w/out mercy.
I think this guy now teaches at the University of Utah.  Kind of an eccentric proffesor, rather funny, pretty hard grader and tons upon tons of reading.

What an asshat. This guy had a jaded sense of reality. He thought he was the smartest person on the planet. Any **** that uses the word draconian regularly to describe others is a grade A jack ass. Good Riddance Deluca
Only 2 absences allowed. Hilarious, he is the Dr. House of the Speech Communication Department
DeLuca is very eccentric and extremely cenacle.  If you can laugh that off, he is a fun professor.  His grading is very arbitrary; so don’t take him if you are looking for a specific grade.

Environmental Comm.  Really nice and interesting guy.  Was pretty unclear about how the grade was composed the whole semester so my grade was a surprise at the end.  Interesting class, lots of reading.  I would recommend it just because he really knows a lot and class was always entertaining. HUGE coursepack to buy!

She is amazing and very approchable! Carla will take the time to help you during off hours if you need it. She really does get it. I loved working with her and felt that having her as a professor and trainer gave me a huge advantage.
No Comments
BEST INSTRUCTOR EVER!! This lady has done it all, knows everbody. Not only does she know everything about Western, she has also been a poor young rider, and is very sympathetic.

This guy LOVES math! His lectures are really boring and trying to take notes is  near impossible, because he moves around so much. You basically have to teach yourself everything. You aren't required to take the final so make sure to have a good quiz average. The exams are easy, but don't use just the quizes to study or you'll fail. Study book.

He is indeed a little scattered, but overall a great guy and teacher.  Office hours were helpful for a further explanation.  Not much homework, but gives optional assigned problems to practice- do them! They are good examples for the test and sometimes are even the same as the test.  Use those to study and you'll be fine!

I hated Varley. I went to office hours, where he wasn't that helpful. He teaches from examples rather than general concepts, so when the questions on tests/quizzes differ from the examples he gave in class, you're probably going to get them wrong. There's also no homework, which makes it very difficult to prepare for assessments.

had him for Calc 3, got an A after getting a B in Calc 2 with Rothstein.  He is a great teacher for thinkers proficient in abstract 3D thought, like I think I am. Like any good teacher he will get you more interested in the subject matter.

Varley is a cool guy, but he is SO scatter brained, like everyone has said. But, I'd take his class again bc attendance is not mandatory and he tells you when you have a quiz, exams aren't hard if you study a little. Ending up with a B+ probably but i skip class at least once a week. Go to class, easy A

Mr. Varley is good math teacher. He knows what he is talking about; however, he can get off track very easily and takes forever to grade tests and quizzes. He teaches by showing examples. GO TO OFFICE HOURS for help! I got an A- in the class so it is very doable

Varley is such a cool guy! His passion for math made me more excited to learn the material. He is a little scatter-brained, but he definitely knows his material. Office hours are very helpful. Tests usually take a while to get back. Overall, great class!

Dr. Varley loves math and gets really energized about it, but can sometimes get off track or not make sense.  If you put in a good amount of time outside of class and do the suggested problems you will be fine.  Make sure to go to his office hours too because they really help and otherwise you'll never get your graded papers back.
tough class but a great teacher...he gets very excited about math and its pretty entertaining....put in the effort and you'll get the grade you want

He is a nice person, and enthusiastic about math, however, he doesn't explain stuff all that well. I went from a 100 math average, in all ap/honors classes, to a low c or possibly d. Another problem is he takes forever to grade papers. I still don't know what I made on the last 2 tests and its almost a week before finals! Sorry, but don't take him.

Dr. Varley was kind of long-winded, but very willing to help.  If you take this class, do the assigned problems and those that you have trouble with GO TO OFFICE HOURS!  If you haven't previously taken calculus (in high school) I would suggest getting a different teacher because Dr. Varley doesn't go in depth about basic things.
The class was easy untill we got to the final. He didnt grade 2 of our tests, a quiz, and a homework so I had no idea what my grade was going into the final. I never got a response from my emails.

He is very enthusiastic and excited about math. He is always willing to help students and answers any questions. My class didn't have required homework. Instead, he gave us suggested problems to practice with. I liked that class a lot!

Extremely hard class!! Do not take this class unless you are willing to put in the time. Dr. Varley is a good prof, however he likes explaining why you are doing stuff when you would rather just know why you're doing it. I did bad on a couple tests and it was an uphill battle the rest of the semester but he does help out a little (I got a B+).

well he writes stuff on the board, but nobody really knows where is going with the stuff. Its kinda hard to understand him and sometimes he does not finish what he started. He is a really nice and he lets you retake any test(he averages them).It takes him a month to grade anything(no joke). If you can avoid him for 2250 then do it. he is hard!no hw

I just got my grades for his class. I got an A-! He does have problems "finishing" a problem, but he is very nice! He enjoys math and everyone can tell! Overall, his class was fun and he cares about his students! Thanks Varley for a great freshman year!

Mr. Varley is very passionate and nerdy about math, but he really doesn't finish problems he starts. On his review ws for tests, he puts stuff that don't really make sense. Especially for word problems, make sure he starts and FINISHES. Overall, he's nice and allowed us to re-take a test of our choice. He averaged the two (if the retake was higher)

I took AP calc AB and BC during high school and could never really grasp it, so I won't blame my lack of understanding on Varley. He's a great guy with tons of energy, but he never really just tells you the way to do something. He gives hints and you have to figure the rest out. Lectures are somewhat confusing; use the book! Very fair test grader.
