Varley is very hard to understand and starts problems, but does not finish them. This, despite leading you in the correct direction, is NOT helpful. Nor does he explicitly state what needs to be known. Lots of memorization of definitions.

Dr. Varley is very entergetic and excited about math. When you have questions for him, he doesn't give you the answer, but tries to lead you in the right direction which can be somewhat confusing. The information in the class isn't that difficult, but the way he taught or explained things can be hard to understand.

Dr. Varley is a great professor.  He is very open to any question on any math field you may have.  When you're doing something wrong, he doesnt just blatantly tell you that you're wrong, he reasons with you and leads you to seeing why you're wrong.  I doubt that I could have passed the algebra prelim without his help.
The best professor.
Wonderful teacher.  Grades incredibly fair. Extremely helpful and interested in helping you achieve a good grade.
One of my favorite teachers ever! Very nice, funny, helpful. Variety of projects to allow you to experiment with equipment, ideas, materials. Grades fairly easy. Gladly take his class again!
my favorite teacher so far at uga. very demanding, but firmly believes that by pushing you, you learn. its not about what you make, but what you learn. i would take him again in a heartbeat.
Very good, demanding of quality from students.
Very giving, caring prof who expects you to take your art seriously.  Expects you to be enthusiastic, you will work hard in his class.  Lot of fun, though.
absolutely the best! demanding but fair, ties to get you to relate class to your  future.  Take him for a class, now!
SHE IS AMAZING
She is wonderful!
Ms. Kennedy is one of the best professors I ever had!
Prof. K is a great professor.  She really cares about her students.  She knows a lot about the subject that she teaches and it doesn't hurt that she's cute.  I haven't missed a class all semester.

Janet is such a sweet sweet lady, and it's hard to be negative. Yes, I got an A+ in her class, but the tests were difficult and the study guides didn't help much. You really have to read the book. The dance reports were easy. I just didn't care much for the structure of the class, and she would often come in late. All we did was watch videos.

She is a nice person.  The tests can be hard in certain spots, but as long as you study, they are easy to get an A on.  There are also dance reports, which she grades pretty hard, so make sure you are very thorough when writing them.  She takes attendance, which factors into your final course grade. We never started class on time.

The class consists of two main grades: that's the dance reports (which are extremely easy to BS) and the test which are ridiculously difficult. She takes attendance even though it's a lecture class but all she does in class anyways is show videos so you could really watch Netflix or catch up on other homework.

She is such a nice lady, has a really good heart & really wants everyone to succeed. Overall this class was easy EXCEPT the tests. They were the hardest tests I have ever taken in my life. I would not depend on the study guides she gives. Take notes in class even though they are hard to follow since she see talks fast & doesn't use powerpoints.

there aren't many tests, and for the dance event reports, you can literally put whatever you want (aka make up "social dance" experiences dt). she's the cutest teacher out there & she's so fun during lectures, dances during videos, and narrates ballet pieces. have to study for the test but it's not too bad. bound to get a good grade if you try

Took Danc 2010: Dance Appreciation with her. We don't have a final and her tests have study guides on ELC. You have three dance reports, which is basically the hardest part where you simply have to go to a dance event outside of class and write about it. It's called an easy A class though. Definitely a great pick for electives. Take Janet.

Oh, Mrs. Robertson. What a case. Her outfits and tangents alone make it worth going to class. I wish she had corrected me more, but there were a lot of kids in Found2 so it was hard for her to watch everyone, understandably. My only real complaint is that she was always 5-15 minutes late, so class was cut short. An oblivious but happy soul, she is.

Ridiculously easy A class but SO incredibly boring to sit through. You watch tons of mundane dance vids every class, and she talks nonsense a lot. You're required to do 3 dance reports too. She takes off points for every little thing.

I took her for dance appreciation. She shows movies the entire class. The day b4 the test she goes over the study guide with you so reading the textbook becomes unnecessary. Class attendance is mandatory & you have to write 3 'dance reports'- go to some event related to dance & write about it. Easy class, take it! But she can be annoying as hell.
She is so nice and loves what she does. The only complaint is that she doesn't give students enough time to change into ballet clothes before/after class so I'm always late!

Very passionate about ballet and helping dancers improve as the semester progresses. I loved the random tangents she went off on in class and the way she dresses. If you actually listen to what she says, she can be very inspirational. She's so out-there. I love her.

Ms. Robertson's dance appreciation class is easy and fun. She is so passionate about dance and you get to see so many cool types of dance. One of the best art appreciation classes you can take. She's very gentle and very nice, and sometimes goes off on tangents, but she's an easy grader and makes the subject interesting.
This class is so easy. No final exam and she gives you the answers to the study guides for all 4 tests. Attendance is mandatory, but it's not a hard class to sit through. You watch movies EVERY DAY!

Janet is a great teacher, her dance appreciation class is  REALLY easy!!! Just do the study guide and make sure you know it before tests and do your dance reports and you should get an A. It's definitely an easy A, but it's also a really fun class!
She is passionate about the subject matter and her class in always interesting. I love her!!!
Her Ballet Foundations II class is excellent. She truly enjoys her work and loves seeing a student improve their technique.
She is an excellent teacher and will help you with any problems you have in class and out of class. Her class is tough but she appreciates hard work.

Wonderful professor that makes you think deeply and engage in your world. His classes have changed my life! Take this professor if you enjoy to read about interesting things and you want to make a difference in the world and in yourself. It will be the best course of your academic career! It will be challenging but well worth the effort for an A!

Be prepared to meditate, read poetry and be quizzed harshly over it but in the end you get a really good grade he just tests your resolve. I love his class it really changed my life and helped me relax and meditation is wonderful. Take him for a life changing experience!!!! If you work hard and extra credit u get an A but u must work!

Run away there is no hope if you are not dropping, was the 1st thing he told us. Stay if you really enjoy reading about significant topics, global warming, factory farms, and lots of other stuff about the environment. He has changed my life, I eat healthier, I am happier and just wonderful after his class. He changed me for the better!

I've taken two of Cal's classes and they are the best! I absolutely LOVE Cal's classes, and he is defenitely one of the most interesting people I have ever met! There is even a facebook group dedicated to him, take a look! I really recommend taking his classes!

THis was by far the best class that I've taken @ UGA!  He makes Ancient World Literature so fun and interesting, as impossible as that may seem.  You do have to read a lot, but the class discussions make it well worth it! TAKE THIS CLASS!! You will be SO glad you did!!!
Very creative, enthusiastic teacher. Comparative Literature could easily be a boring class, but Cal did an excellent job of selecting books and making discussions interesting.

Very enthusiastic teacher who makes class really enjoyable. While his class in pretty easy, you learn a lot and think about the topics outside of class. Readings are usually interesting and the group discussions make the classtime pass quickly. Tons of quizzes, but they aren't that hard.

Class mainly centers around group discussions, with some various other activities thrown in.  Random quizzes on the reading are given mainly as a way to both check attendance and reading...as long as you read the books and attend class, it's a very easy class, and Cal's a great professor.

Loved this class. Lectures were important, but so were the breakout sessions that happened on Fridays. Tests weren't that hard, but don't underestimate them. If you stay on top of all of your work and spend time reviewing, you should do just fine. Class teaches you a lot about yourself!
ratingTags_Rating: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment_Rating: Very confusing and dysfunctional class. She means well but half the time she does not come to class having read the material she has assigned the class. There is a massive group project and groups are randomly assigned, which is not good for your grade. The tests are very specific and often are poorly worded, therefore the questions are confusing.

Dr. Harris is a GEM! She really cares about what her students have to say, and what you cover in class is very relevant to today's society! Participation is very important to her, so make sure to go to class! There is a large group project, and if you have a bad group, good luck because it is a lot of work! Also, do the readings!

She tries to make class very interesting and to relate to students so that they show up. Lectures are important because she puts random things from them like her dogs name on the test. The tests are tricky sometimes too. I thought it would be an easy A, but it wasn't. She is very nice though.

She didn't seem to know the material very well and wouldn't put defs on the board but would read them word for word 5-6 times until everyone got it (waste of time). She also made us come to a 9:05 class to do the Cha Cha Slide and then dismissed us... should've just canceled. One time she sang in front us for no reason. The actual info is very easy
ratingTags_Rating: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment_Rating: Dr. Harris was a great teacher. The whole class bonded and we ended the semester by going out to dinner with her. The class is truly great to take eapecially with everythig going on in the world today.

Dr. Harris is great. Mass lectures are interesting if you listen and she is super funny. She can sing and will sing to the class a few times. She's sassy and knows her stuff, so listen and participate in class. Take good notes on paper; she's not about laptops and will call you on texting. I would take her again for anything.

She is okay, but she is nothing special. Attendance is not mandatory for the lectures, but showing up helps because she will put random questions from the lecture on her tests. We had the name of her dog and the dance we did in class as questions on our tests.

This class is full of lecture and tests that do not apply to the lecture. YOU DO NOT want to take this class!!!! If you are just trying to fill a credit this is not an easy A. I studied a lot for this class and never could make an A on the test bc the test are not applicable to material. Take something else!!!!!
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment_Rating: Dr. Harris cares a lot about her students, and she made a 9am class entertaining and fun. If you show up to lecture and breakout sections and read the book before the test, you should make an A with no problem. She is very funny and approachable. Overall a great choice for COMM1500!

I thought this class was easy and enjoyed it for the most part. All of the TAs seemed great; I really liked mine. There are three tests, a paper, and a group project. The project is easy, the paper has very clear instructions, and the tests are pretty easy (I made notecards using the book). Also Dr. Harris is hilarious and awesome

BEST TEACHER EVER. She makes coming to lecture worth it. Always have a good time . It is important to go to lecture because she will not post the power points on line, but she also expects you to read the textbook. Easy class, just do well on the paper and you will be fine!
Really cares about her students and is hilarious to talk with

Dr. Harris is a great professor! She really wants you to strive and is always willing to help. This class does require a lot more work than any other class I have, which is saying something. Besides tests, there is a paper at the beginning of the semester and a group project at the end. She requires a lot more than others.

I really wanted to love Dr. Harris. She's a nice person and she cares about her students, but she is more disorganized than anyone I have ever met. The structure of the class was all over and she never met grading deadlines that she would promise. Probably would be cool outside of class, but definitely wouldn't put myself through this again.

Tina's class by definition was mediocre. The topics of the class at first seem very basic at first, but she then finds to make them tricky on the test. The lectures are usually pretty dull, and the book covers them in good detail. She puts the occasional random question on the test which she tells the answer to at lecture. Easy A-. But hard A.
ratingTags_Rating: Clear grading criteria--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment_Rating: The material of the class was not that hard and she is a great teacher. However the test are extremely tricky. Make sure to know everything she says in the lecture.

Dr. Harris made lectures fun with jokes and funny stories. She truly cares about students and wants everyone to succeed. If you don't go to class sometimes, make sure you have a friend in class because some notes are not in the textbook.

Great professor, somewhat stupid class content. GO TO EVERY CLASS. Her test questions are rooted in the examples she gives in class, so write down every example. There is no homework, but read the book study ALL notes before tests. I suggest not taking an early class so it will be easy to go. I had a 9am and showed up still drunk 50% of the time.
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Amazing lectures

comment_Rating: I made the mistake of skipping 75% of class, but people who didn't do that made A's. Tina is funny, but tells A LOT of anecdotes. Tests are tough to compensate for the fact that the material isn't

Dr. Harris is a good choice to take as a professor. She is very funny, and you can tell she enjoys what she does and teaches. Her lectures are informative and lively. Don't really have to attend lectures, but make sure to attend break-out sessions. Tests are deceptively hard, but she is a fair grader with tons of chances to do well in this class.

Dr. Harris is alright. She's a good lecturer (and singer), but her tests weigh heavily and are usually much harder than what you'd expect, given that the lectures are so simplistic. If you take her, show up for EVERY class (there are test questions asking for specific details about the lectures, which is dumb) and skim the textbook. Not a bad class
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--GROUP PROJECTS

comment_Rating: Dr. Harris is literally the best. She is the nicest professor ever, and her objectives for the course are clear. Attendance isn't mandatory, but make sure you go anyway because lecture notes will be on the tests. 1 project and 1 paper--both easy As. I wish I could retake her class. Make sure you participate in and go to all breakout sessions!
ratingTags_Rating: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment_Rating: Dr. Harris is a great professor! She loves her students and loves what she does. The lectures weren't mandatory, but she refers to stuff she says in lecture on her tests, so its best to go. Only 1 paper which was an easy A if you follow the rubric and 1 project. Breakout sessions are pointless, but easy grades. Tests can be hard; study notes & book
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment_Rating: I loved Dr. Harris! She kept the class really interesting, funny, and interactive. She also made a point for you to attend lecture though. The tests were harder than what was gone over in class, just because missing one question made a big difference, but the content was simple to understand.

I had Dr. Harris for my FYOS class, and I loved her. She is a tough grader, but we had great discussions in class. She is very personable, and cares a lot about her students and the subjects that she teaches. She is very passionate about communication, and makes you appreciate it. I'd definitely recommend her!

Tina was an amazing professor, but her TA's were horrible. The TA for the class definitely matters. Tina's lectures were amazing, but she let her TA's teach some lectures and I honestly hated sitting through those. The tests were hit or miss.
ratingTags_Rating: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment_Rating: Tina is the best! This class is SO easy if you show up for large lecture. She gives you so many questions right off the test in class because so many people skip. She gives study guides that make studying for the test so easy, but she doesn't curve. All the material is very straightforward and she is a pretty easy grader. Super interactive too!

Dr. Harris is great. The class seems like a lot with three papers, three tests, and a big group project but she's really helpful and as long as you write something related to the class you'll be fine with the papers. The tests are tough only because the material is so easy she has to make them tough.

Professor Harris was very communicative with us. There was a lot of busy work. The exams were straightforward, so as long you read the textbook you should be fine. The essays aren't difficult, just remember to follow her guidelines.

The tests were difficult to get used to, but she is very friendly and always accessible to her students.  She sometimes gives extra credit for attendance. Go to her office to review your tests/papers; sometimes she makes grading errors. The information seems like common sense, but study anyway because some questions are nit-picky.

If you plan on actually attending this class (many students skip it for good reason) then be prepared to listen to her stories and her opinions all day.  Babbles a lot about her personal life and isn't willing to go out of her way for much.  Luckily enough its speech so most of the terms and material is self-defining- probably why she teaches it..

Maybe she's a decent lower level teacher, but if you want to think critically about things, and want to have trick multiple choice questions, and ridiculous iqs, then take Tina Harris' class. By far the most difficult professor that I have known. She designs the course to suit  her convenience, when you are the one PAYING to take her class.

try to get a seat in the front of the room. she has a mike, but she speaks softly. pay attention in class and you'll pick up on the material. read the book to learn the jargon because the test uses the book's definitions. overall great teacher. lecture is very engaging.

Dr. Harris is a great professor who really cares about her students and their learning.  She constantly asks for feedback - if she is talking too fast, if concepts need additional clarification, if students have examples.  She tells a lot of personal stories to illustrate concepts.  Work load is minimal. Only 2 papers and 3 tests + final.

She was a GREAT teacher!! She really knew her stuff and would engage the class with fun activities! She was very funny and would use real life examples that fit perfectly with the topic we were discussing. Her papers were not hard at all and the tests were easy if you took notes AND read the chapters. I would definitely take another class of hers!

Professor Harris is really funny. She likes to share a lot of personal stories and sometimes includes test questions about them. Break out included a lot of fun activities. The tests & papers were challenging. I often felt like I did better on them than I actually did. However, the class is really interesting and an A is not unattainable.

Dr. Harris is a fun and engaging speaker.  Her lectures were interesting and highly applicable into everyday life.  The breakout sections included fun activities! The only downfall to this course is attendance to the lectures are not required but she doesn't post them online.  Also the tests are very hard and few people actually do well on them.

Lecture not mandatory and un helpful. Breakout sessions are a huge waste of time. The papers were bologna, and the grades depended strictly on your TA. Pretty impossible to get an A without dedicating your whole life to this class. I would advise to take a different professor with a normal class size (25-30) as opposed to this style class.

I liked her lectures, but her tests were unfair. For our first test, not a single person out of a 165 person class got above an 88 (she curved 2 points). She would even start tests with a disclaimer: "Many of the following questions have multiple right answers. Your job is to choose the best." Extremely frustrating.

Dr. Harris is one of the most interesting and engaging professors I have had in my entire college/schooling experience! I would recommend her classes to anyone. She really knows how to make the topic accessible.
such an easy and INTERESTING class- dr. harris is awesome, take it with her if you can!!!
No Comments
Not very interesting nor helpful.
No Comments
Great guy and professor.  Very helpful, very clear--- if you don't like him, you don't come to class.  His attendance policy is pretty strict.  He  offers extra credit.

Dr. Camastra is a fantastic professor and I am sad to see her go. She always helped me when I needed it and was available when she said she would be. I feel that my writing has gotten significantly better after this class.

She is a really tough grader but sweet. She does a great job at setting up deadlines for you papers so you dont cram it all at the end. Also listens to class whether or not deadlines are achievable. Hard to get a over an A- unless an English class is your thing but she worth it for the required english credits.

pretty hard class, getting an A means having a flawless thesis on all ur papers, and she's very specific about what she wants, so its important to ask her about ur thesis, otherwise u will get at most a 90 each paper. other than that, shes a good professor and not boring, and sometimes funny

Professor Camastra is a great teacher, I bombed my first essay but after taking reading her feedback and talking to her I got A's on everything else. English 1102 is a hard course but I enjoyed having her.
ratingTags_Rating: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment_Rating: Camastra was a wonderful teacher that you can really express yourself around. She's from the Northeast, so she's really blunt, but hilarious. GO TO HER OFFICE HOURS! She will help you lots with organizing your ideas and the overall flow of your paper. If you participate in class and get to know her, she will really care about your success.

English has always been my favorite subject, and I'm willing to say Dr. Camastra is the worst English teacher I've ever had. She really does't teach anything about good writing, though she expects masterpieces. She is unclear about pretty much everything, from the prompt to the grading. The class wasn't really difficult, just boring and dreadful.
ratingTags_Rating: Tough Grader--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment_Rating: She's an excellent teacher, but this really was a tough class. Also English exams are virtually unheard of, but camastra gave one that dropped my final grade from an A to an A-. Awesome teacher, but be ready to work hard!
ratingTags_Rating: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment_Rating: Although she is a tough grader Professor Camastra is an awesome teacher and I felt my writing really improved from taking this class. Plus she has a very sarcastic sense of humor which I found hilarious, but can come off a little harsh to some people. She can sometimes be a little vague but overall good teacher.

Dr. Camastra was a great fit for me personally as a student and I really enjoyed her class. No journals (!) and the reading is pretty minimal and interesting. She's funny in a cynical way and also lenient on deadlines. Go to office hours at least once to work through an essay because her feedback can be vague. Definitely recommend.
So boring
ratingTags_Rating: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment_Rating: She's a really hard grader. She's an amazing paper, but if you want English to be a class you want to put on the back burner then you should take someone easier. This class takes a lot of time and effort.

this is a discussion based class. the readings are very interesting but if you don't like talking do not take. as a professor Dr. Camastra is alright--she doesn't give clear grading criteria and is kinda confusing but she's a great facilitator of discussion. as a person, she is awesome. she is so cool and really friendly. i want to be friends.

I want to say that she is an amazing English professor. She is a tough grader but they are fair. I didn't as well because I didn't ty my best. She is willing to help improve your writing. Also, her lectures are very entertaining and interesting. Some really deep questions& discussion come up. Heads up, there is a group project at the end.

Honestly, I really liked this teacher. I made a bad grade because I was too lazy to try, but a lot of my classmates did really well! If you want to make a good grade on your essay, please go to office hours. Also, she doesn't make you write arduous journal entries that a lot of other teachers require.

Dr. Camastra is seriously the best!! Love her. She may be a tough grader, but she will definitely improve your writing over the semester. Her class was my favorite of the semester. Her lectures are always interesting, and she's hilarious! Take her!
Very wonderful teacher would definitely recommend if taking an introduction course especially if you aren't much for english.

She is so smart and her class was really enjoyable. Her sense of humor is really sarcastic, which is highly entertaining. I would definitely take her class again because I learned so much. You definitely have to put in the effort in order to get a good grade, but it is so worth it. She rocks.
Tough grader but fair, and always has a good explanation for why you got the grade you did. Class is enjoyable: she's a fun person and her class feels welcoming.

Really cool and relaxed. Easy to talk to, but her grading is confusing. I wish i would've taken another teacher.  HARD grader that doesn't match up with comments. It's not worth it.  If you have other options, take them. She's very intelligent

Nicole was a great teacher. She was very sarcastic and funny which in some teachers I don't like but loved it in her. She gives really good feedback on your essays and is always there to help. If you want to go over your essay before the due date email her and she will make time for you.
This was one of the worst teachers I have ever taken. I did better in organic chemistry than this class. She thinks that a C is a good grade. Avoid at all costs.

I was incredibly pleased with how structured the class was. Every day I knew what reading or assignment was expected of me, and she always reminded us of what was to come. She was a tough grader. However, her grades made me realize that I wouldn't be able to get away with writing a paper the night before like I did in high school.

Camastra loves English, but isn't a great teacher. You do a LOT of reading and a lot of class discussion only to see a few quotes on the midterm and final. It's REALLY hard to get a good grade on her papers. Take the class seriously and show up to class.

This english class has significantly improved my writing. Although Dr. Camastra is a very tough grader, she has reasoning behind every grade that she gives and is always willing to help you outside of class. Her classes were interesting & although i made a B in the class, I learned the most within this class this semester!
She was a very hard grader. Yeah, she's a little condecending with her comments on your paper but whatever. She's super willing to help you outside of class which is great.

Professor Camastra's class was very entertaining. She managed to keep our attention and there was a very carefree atmosphere. Although she tends to be a tough grader, she has good reasoning behind every grade she gives. She is always willing to help/give advice after class or during her office hours. I would recommend.

She is very picky about what she wants and is looking for with your writing. If she doesn't like your writing style, you're done for the semester. She if very helpful if you come see her in office hours, however I still never felt that my writing improved. Maybe look for a different professor seeing that this is an entrance level class.

Professor Camastra is by far one of the toughest teachers I have ever had. She announced at the beginning that the average grade she gives is a C, and this was true. However she will meet with students often and try to help, and will ultimitately help improve your writing. She is also pretty funny, but can be blunt as well

Dr. Camastra has stated that she gives out 2 As per class of roughly 24 students and her grading reflects this. She is probably tougher than my hard small private school AP English teacher, but is not unfair. She can however be quite unpleasant if she does not like you and is rather frank with students when their opinion disagrees with her own.

Nicole was my TA. The whole class was pretty tough, but in breakout sessions she was pretty cool. She puts kind of condescending comments on essays, but I'm choosing to believe she's not intentionally being mean. I made a B in the course after working pretty darn hard.

Ms. Camastra is so nice and helpful. She was my TA for ENGL 4000, and she made the overall experience of that class much more pleasant. Provides helpful feedback on papers and tests, and really wants to help her students succeed.

She is a really great teacher! She keeps the amount of writing and reading very reasonable. She will help you improve your writing a lot, especially if you go to her office hours to get help on your essays. The grading is very fair. I was not a very good writer at the beginning of the semester, but I improved a lot and received a B in the class.

She is the best professor in the English department, hands down. She is hilarious and always keeps class discussion interesting. She knows A LOT about all course material. If you visit her during office hours to go over your essay, it is not hard to make an A. After this course, you will be a better writer and reader!
She is very understanding and relatable, and doesn't screw around with unimportant details/assignments. She's also highly intelligent and will work with the schedules of students. Great experience !!
vERY HELPFUL AND VERY DIRECT. lETS YOU KNOW HOW YOU SHOULD WRITE AND IS A LITTLE TOUGH ON THE GRADING BUT VERY FAIR.

She has to be one of the best in English Dept. No busy work or journals. Very coordinated in her discussions and literary knowledge. Discussions were interesting. No group work. Very acceptable to class input. If you put solid effort into your essays and work to improve, its not hard to make A. She'll help you to improve in many areas of lit.

I think Nicole Camastra was a really good teacher for English 1102. She knew most of us were only taking it because we had to, so she kept the class interesting. She is hilarious and easy to talk to. She does not believe in grade inflation so it is very hard to get an A unless your a talented writer. Most people got B's I think, which isn't bad.

Ms. Camastra is a great teacher!  She makes class fun, and is easy to talk to.  She wants to help you improve, and does what she can to help you.  I definitely would take her class again.  She can be a little tough on the grading, but it is fair.  If you work hard and put in a lot of effort, you'll do fine. Conversations are fun!

Her grading is hard, but fair. She makes class interesting and cuts out unnecessary busywork. Everything you do in this class is for a reason. Overall, she helped me A LOT with my writing, but her class is a challenge

Ms. Camastra is one of the best prodessors I have had at the university. While still being able to teach her lesson, she makes class interesting in fun. Nicole is funny and sarcastic and because of that (and many other reasons) she is awesome. I came out with and A it was because she taught me SO well. You earn grades but she is fair. SHE ROCKS!
moderately strict on grading (most kids around same grade) but you will improve your writing as a result of her.

This class was fairly easy as long as you read the notes for tests> Reading the book does not matter except for answering the questions he gives you in class the tests are medium they are consistent of multiple choice and short answer, which helps to boost your grade and he gives a lot of chances for extra credit! this class is not an easy A though

Interesting subject matter. Boring class, didn't really pay attention but still did fine. Hard tests, require a LOT of studying and you only have 25 minutes to take them, and questions are tricky. 1-2 homework assignments a month that are extremely easy. In class weekly group assignment also very easy. Extra credit opportunities.

This class was awful. Although he seems a nice enough guy, his 'choices' were pointless (most not having a definitive answer), most topics in class seemed unrelated to the course. The book was terribly written. If you want to take this class, do yourself a favor and find a different professor.

Interesting class. He gives you practice tests, which are NOT the same questions that will be on the actual test. They are structured the same way and are pretty random. Read the notes inside and out. He gives many opportunities for extra credit, which will add 1pt to your final grade. Go to class and do all the assignments and extra credit.

Everyone i knew said this was a good class to take---pretty easy. The class is actually a little interesting but the tests are NITPICKY and tricky. In-class work is graded a little arbitrarily but there is a lot of extra credit opportunity. Not REALLY hard and attendance isnt exactly "a must"

Dr. Shewfelt is a nice guy, but the class seemed boring and pointless. If you're really into science, you might want to consider a different class than FDST2010. It's a pretty easy class that requires little actual work but a lot of studying for tests. There are a few assignments, but they are all pretty quick and easy.
nice guy, boring class.

I loved his class! He is extremely interesting and hilarious! This tests are not easy, but if you study and pay close attention in class, they are not impossible to do well on. The assignments for class are easy to do well on so they help. Extra Credit is given all the time. Information is useful. I would recommend him to anybody!
very helpful

Dr. Shewfelt is a man who knows what he's talking about.  He is a great teacher in whatever subject it may be, but chocolate science is especially fun.  He brings chocolate weekly, and you have to answer questions from the book a week in advance to each class, so it isn't that hard.  This class was very easy and fun.  Take it if you can!
Tests are VERY hard and tricky. He is a very funny guy and gives you lots of extra credit to help boost your grade. Very interesting material.
Very hard! I studied for 2 days straight and got a low B on his tests. Don't take it because you think it will be an easy A. You will learn useful info, but the tests are super specific!
A very interesting freshman seminar. You do have readings and questions to answer for every week, but they are not difficult. Plus he brings candy samples weekly!
He sucks! Do not take this class for easy credits! He makes his tests hard on purpose and he makes an interesting class very, very boring!

Lisa is an okay professor. It was a super easy class (all multiple choice tests), but nothing special. She does let the class help create the syllabus at the beginning, which can be good or bad since it's a 300 person class.

Had for 4130, 5100, lab, directed read Lisa is amazing! She is so fun, helpful, and wants you to succeed. Her class is difficult-ish but the tests are really fair (but still tough). Her 5100 is hard to get into but oh so worth it. Make this professor your friend. Goes leaps and bounds for you. Was in her lab too. She helped with grad school apps.

The class creates the syllabus for the class and the format of tests and how much each test is worth. She is a great lecturer and extremely nice. She is a great professor, but the tests are actually hard. You have to actually study for Psych 1101 if you take it with Liza, she is tougher than any other Psych teacher. I struggled to get an A-

Lisa is an all-around awesome human being, BUT, her class is tough. Don't be fooled!  I expected this class to be one of my easier ones, and I was fighting to end up with a B. She tries her best to help you and is so enjoyable to talk to, but her tests are no joke. Study hard for them and still only get an average, at best, outcome.

I LOVE HER SO MUCH. She is seriously the best and is a joy to take. If you go through her study guides and sit in the front of the class (that's important) you'll do well. She is seriously the reason I switched majors. Just make sure that you don't forget to take the quizzes--the sneak up on you!

Very great professor, very understanding of student workloads, will always find a way to work with you. Lets the class pick its own exam format but she will try to trip you up on the exam to make sure you know your knowledge and aren't just memorizing//recalling.
I really enjoyed this class. She does a great job of teaching you how to learn.  Definitely a really good teacher for introductory psychology.
Lisa is so cool and knowledgeable 10/10 would recommend. Our grade was made up of 20% attendance, tiny reaction papers, and a final statement of what we learned. Super easy. Got to dissect an eye.

One of the best professors I've ever had. Fantastic lecturer, very engaging and respectful. Lets class choose format for each test & how many you have. Tests were very difficult- you have to really know the material in depth. Still, a wonderful teacher and great resource outside the class too. Would take her for every psych class if I could!
ratingTags_Rating: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment_Rating: Dr. Renzi is the best and honestly her class is fantastic. Take her if possible.

My biggest complaint about this class is that it ended too soon. If you can take her TAKE HER! She is amazing! If you get her seminar, there are no tests either, which is amazing! She's so interesting so class is never boring. Probably my favorite professor!

Great teacher. So open to helping students. Really wants students to learn. Made the material interesting. I didn't mind going to class at all, also she wrote me a recommendation which was really nice

Great teacher! Class material is sometimes tough especially if science isn't your strength, but Dr. Renzi is very helpful in clearing up concepts. Slides don't have all the info you need to know on them so take notes on what she lectures. Not an easy A, but getting a good grade is doable if you go to class and put the time into studying for tests.

I am a third year student and Lisa is probably the best professor I've had. She is very enthusiastic when it comes to teaching. She is very laid back and easily approachable for help. I highly recommend taking her if you have the choice!

Dr. Renzi loves answering questions that she knows a lot about, but beware, if you ask her a question that she doesn't know, she will make stuff up.  I found out later in other classes that some of the stuff that she had taught was just flat out wrong.  Don't take her class unless you already know the material well and just need the credit.

Lisa was a GREAT teacher! She kept class interesting and always was willing to help you if you need it. Attendance isn't mandatory but it helps for some of the test questions. Also, I went anyways because I thought class was fun. There is homework due every week, but that was very easy. Overall its is a very laid back class
She's an awesome teacher and definitely keeps things interesting. Tests are super easy if you at least skim through the textbook and attend class. TAKE HER.

GREAT teacher!Not only is she funny and entertaining, but she relates the information clearly and makes it interesting.WARNING:she cusses a lot, so if this offends you, you might want to switch out. She is fair somewhat on presenting controversial topics fairly, although on several sections her personal biased was clear. But overall she is awesome!

She's alright...it takes a LONG time for her to actually start teaching PSYCH. She tries to be funny when she teaches and sometimes it's just not there. ALWAYS GOES OFF ON TANGENTS, then if she doesn't cover the necessary material on the next test, she rushes straight through the material and it's hard to catch on. She's good,she gets one thumb up!

If Lisa is teaching 1101, TAKE HER. She is great and completely teaching out of passion. She cares for her students and is willing to work with the class. She can go off on tangents, but they are interesting and psyc-related. Textbook is actually my favorite text of school thus far, helpful and easy to read. Read, study, and attend = getting an A.

Amazing teacher! Very passionate about psychology ! Attendance isn't mandatory, but sometimes theres extra credit on tests that you could only know if you were in class! If you have the chance, TAKE HER CLASS ! :)

YES. Take Lisa. She is very helpful because she cares about her students. She normally doesn't teach intro psyc, but if she does: get this class. The textbook is used, but it is actually a really helpful text. She gives extra credit opportunities, and the tests are not hard as long as you pay attention in class and study.

Dr. Renzi is the best professor at UGA, in my opinion. She makes class interesting and fun and actually cares about her students. You need to study if you want to make a good grade on her tests. I only used my textbook twice, so you may not want to purchase it. She gives 4 tests and drops the lowest one. AWESOME PROFESSOR!

Dr. Renzi is awesome, particularly if you like the subject. She's really passionate about what she studies, and I learned tons of fascinating info about sensation and perception. The class material wasn't simple, but Renzi's friendliness and liveliness made it a really enjoyable class.

Lisa is probably the best professor I've ever had.  I actually enjoyed going to class. will answer a question you have about ANYTHING whether it's related or not, she knows tons of random crap.  She really cares about students - she lets the class decide the format of the class.  We had 3 exams, final, and random attendance.  Take her for anything!

Very nice,uses bad language frequently, shows up to class about half the time, very thorough on subject, knows her stuff, dismisses early almost every class. two exams +attendance makes up whole grade. didn't use book.
LOVED her. Seriously, take any class she teaches.

The class was held at a local Elementary School. Attendance was mandatory for every class because the majority of the grade was based off of tutoring a child from the school. There were only 3 grades for the entire class, 2 10-page papers and 1 2-page report. Don't let that sway you from the class, as long as you follow the rubric its an easy 100.
Class was extremely boring. Most of the research articles and examples were at least 15 years old. Seemed very disorganized.

I took her class as honors and it was a lot of fun. The class discussions made us all get to know each other and it was a comfortable environment.  She's a tough grader on the tutoring reports though.

She is perhaps the best honors professor I have ever had. She was very willing to help students, and genuinely cared about helping them to reach their potential. She also seemed to put a lot into making her class a great experience, and conveyed the material very well. I reccomend her to anyone interested in science.
No Comments
She can be abrasive at times and doesn't always understand exactly what people are asking, but if you do all the work, it's an A.

Rosaria was one of the best Spanish teachers I ever had. Not only did she challenge us to better our Spanish speaking ability, but she always took a genuine interest in her students. Her class was an easy A if you put forth effort. You are lucky if you get to take her class!

I absolutely LOVE Rosaria. I have her right now for Ital 2001. She is an amazing teacher and she absolutely loves her students. Attendance is mandatory, but to succeed in a foreign language you need to go to class anyways. She is VERY fair and she loves what she does. By far one of the best professors I've ever had at UGA. Wonderful lady.

Rosaria was my favorite professor at UGA. If you put forth effort you will make a good grade. She is extremely helpful, and is a very fair grader. She makes class so much fun, and I love all her stories about Italy! Take her, you will not be disappointed!
Extremely helpful. If you show interest and make an effort in class she will make an effort for you. She's also very funny and makes learning Italian very natural and fun.

Rosaria is a great teacher. I hate talking in class. Hate it. I dreaded it class sometimes, but it always ended up being fun and I think the Italian might stick. (Two more classes to make sure.) I hope that I can take her class again... even if she doesn't believe that the guy on the cover of the book looks like he's going to get hit by the bus.
She is one of my favorite professors. She was always helpful, kept the class laughing and I really learned a lot!
definitely my favorite class so far, wonderful teacher easy to enjoy the class if you put forth the effort

Rosaria is a great teacher! Take her class, she makes it worth it! The tests are fairly easy, but attendance is required. You do have to put in a little time to study. She goes over the test the day before..... And she is SUPER HOT!

She is THE best language teacher I've ever had & the one of the best teachers period. She was funny, nice & passionate about teaching & her enthusiasm was winning. I really hope she teaches 1002 because I know no other teacher will be able to match her abilities as a teacher. The class wasn't too hard. Isa.
Awesome teacher! Such a fun and easy class with her that you need to take it! Hopefully the rest of the italian teachers are as good as her otherwise I have been spoiled!

I really learned a lot in Rosaria's class, much more than I thought I would! She was really interesting but hard to understand sometimes. You do have to really study and it shows if you don't but it's not that bad.

She is awesome! If you try in her class, she will help you, but if you slack off she notices and calls you out. She really cares about the students and wants to help. Her style of teaching is very fun and engaging. I would recommend her 1000x again!
she rocked! she really helped... i think she is doing her thesis now but if she starts teaching again or if she still is teaching you should totally take her class!!!!

Rosaria did talk about herself a lot, but she also encouraged the students to talk about themselves (in italian) and that was why the class was so fun.  She does expect you to do the work outside of class, so have some self-motivation.  Her class was one I looked forward to attending and she made me WANT to learn the language.

She talks about herself all the time. I wanted to learn Italian, not about how awesome she was as a child and about what a genius she is now. She is really vague and doesn't tell you what you were supposed to do but expects you to just do everything on your own. Hard to get a good grade on papers unless you are born fluent.

Rosaria isn't intimidating she just has a lot of energy! Our class was pretty hard, but I took 1 + 2 combined with no prior knowledge and she was a lot of fun, plus because she's Italian you learn some culture too. Definitely recommended, smartest lady I've ever met and even won an award for best teacher or something during honors.
I love her, Best Italian teacher at University of Georgia! Everyone loves her, makes class fun and she is so helpful.
She is really fun and seems to enjoy it. So long as you participate and put forth effort you should do well. She is great!

You'd be crazy not to take a class taught by Rosaria! Participation is definitely key, although you do not have to be right, just say something and be willing to try. She will just correct you and its no big! I crammed before the tests and made good grades. A def. plus that is is  from Italy.

Rosaria is a great teacher! I loved her! She not only teaches the language well, but she makes class fun. She is from Italy so she will tell you a little about the culture as well. I really enjoyed her class and wish I had her for the next italian.

Rosaria is a great teacher.  I learned a lot in her class.  She was great at teaching in both English and Italian and really cared about the students.  The tests are difficult, but if you study it's not too bad.
Yeah! She's the best!

Rosaria is absolutely amazing. I think people underestimate how helpful it is to have a native Italian speaker teaching Italian. She was very laidback and her class was very fun. She IS intimidating at first and you will have to speak Italian in her class, but after awhile you'll get used to it. Tests aren't bad at all. And she's really hot.

She makes the class fun, but is completely intimidating. The tests weren't hard because the Italian department made them, but you do have to do a lot of studying on your own time. She definitely expects you to come prepared and if you do the class is really fun.

Rosaria was a fun italian teacher to have, because she actually pushed you to do well. I was, and still am, incredibly intimidated by her, but I ended up learning more italian than I expected that I would.
Rosaria is wierd.  I definently would not take her class ever again!

Rosaria is fantastic! She expects a lot out of her students, which scared me a little at the beginning of the semester, but I knew so much when I was done! I would sign up for another one of her classes in a heartbeat. She is so fun and her enthusiasm is contagious. One of the best Italian teachers out there, hands down.

She is an amazing teacher!  I think half of our class considered majoring in Italian after our semester was done.  Then when we all registered for Ital1002 and nobody got her as their teacher, the majority dropped out of the class.  I would love nothing more than to spend a week in Italy with Rosaria; or even spend a day here in Athens with her!

Rosaria is lots of fun and the tests weren't hard because the Ital. department writes them. However, I made high As on tests, and turned in all my work at the end of each chapter but still made an A-. I'm pretty sure my participation grade got in the way of my A (an A in any Italian class is a 94) so watch out for that if you want a 4.0 not a 3.7
She was fun to have as a professor.  As an extra plus, Tuesday and Thursday classes were only as long as MWF classes.

Rosaria is really laidback and makes learning the language fun. I really enjoyed her as a professor. She brought in new ways to learn-- such as through Italian songs and games and whatnot. She is a great teacher if you want a laidback atmosphere that is fun to learn in.
Great teacher!! Fun class!!

She is amazing! The class was so much more interesting b/c she taught it. She is from Sicily so you'll definitly learn about the culture in her class but at times she can mess up on her english, but it's just funny, not confusing. Overall she's fun but she can fall behind and then we have to hurry (just a little) to catch back up.

She is incredible! The class is so chill and fun. She is hilarious and always willing to answer questions, and always responds to emails. A lot of the material you may have to learn on your own, but she is still completely awesome.

Rosaria was really sweet and tries really hard to teach the subject. She's still relatively new to the US and sometimes has a hard time with our language, & she's not the best at getting her point across, so I recommend her only if you can grasp foreign languages easily or don't mind teaching yourself from the book. She was a wonderful lady though.

This was the hardest class I have ever taken but I paid attention in class and studied my notes a lot and did well. Lyall explains things fairly well and posts answers to hw and practice tests online to study. Homework took me hours every week and sometimes we were asked about material yet to be covered in class, but not all problems were graded.
ratingTags_Rating: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment_Rating: Considering our class initially had a different professor who was banned from campus, I couldn't possibly have asked for a better replacement. Lyall was clear, concise and to the point in his lectures. He made the class way easier to understand than the former teacher. And he really cares about his students. Probably the best professor I've had yet

Dr. Lyall got assigned to our calc 3 class half way through the semester out of no where and managed to make sure we all did well and got all the help we needed. One of the best math lecturers I've ever had, with great handwriting and excellent explanations. The material is pretty tough and he does a great job of making it as clear as possible.

Lyall was by far my favorite prof of this year. His accent makes everything more interesting, and he made analysis of sequences and series actually fun. He gives grades back fast, and he's super lenient on hw grades. He'll also change the final grade breakdown to give you the highest grade possible. Would absolutely take him again

Dr. Lyall is one of the best professors in the Math Department. He responds quickly to emails and gives very clear feedback on questions. All of his lectures are incredibly clear - which is important in Calc 3. Honestly one of the best experiences. He doesn't give graded homework, but instead gives quizzes over the recommended problems. 10/10 !!!
ratingTags_Rating: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment_Rating: He is a great teacher and uses homework as a learning tool rather than another grade. He does grade his tests pretty hard and doesn't give extra credit, but if you go to class, take notes and do the homework you will get an A.
ratingTags_Rating: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment_Rating: Real analysis is really hard. He's always available in his office, but I felt like the tests and the homework were just way harder than they needed to be. Or maybe I was just really bad at it, that is possible too. I've never gotten anything below a B before, but this class had me begging for a C. It's hard, and you get little feedback on tests.
ratingTags_Rating: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment_Rating: Neil is awesome. Great communicator and all around nice guy. He made Calc III VERY accessible without watering it down- he knows how to explain it to people without baffling them. On top of that, I had to leave school last year and he has worked with me the whole time to finish the incomplete. Deinitely one of my favorite professors at Georgia.
ratingTags_Rating: Gives good feedback--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Amazing lectures

comment_Rating: Lyall is an all around a good guy. This was the second course I've taken with him and he was essentially the same both times. His tests can be pretty difficult and he grades them pretty hard, but he tends to have a very generous grading scale. Very few people failed test in either Calc III or Sequences and Series.
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment_Rating: Lyall was an incredible teacher for the hardest class I've taken to date. You will have to study hard and dedicate hours to the homework each week, but Lyall is always available to help. Lyall genuinely cares about his students and loves it when his students try hard. I would take him again!

I took him for his calc 3 class, and wow, it was hard. Homework was optional, but not really necessary (too hard to be actual exam questions). If you study what he gives you in class, you will be fine, his exams and quizzes look like the questions from his notes. So if you go to class, pay attention, and do his study guides, you will alright.

He is a great teacher and this is by far one of the best classes I have taken so far. Tests are a bit tough (especially the final!!!) but over all he is a fantastic teacher. If you get the chance to take him then definitely do so because he is really passionate about what he teaches and he really tries to help you as much as he can.

Hardest Class I've taken in my life, I'm also a Math Major. He has sky high expectations. His test are not easy by any means. Go to his office hours and make sure that he knows that you are trying your absolute best.

Dr. Lyall is a nice guy. He understands the material and does a great job at teaching it. That being said, he expects a lot of the students. Homework and tests are VERY difficult. He likes giving hard tests and readjusts the grading scale after the fact. He knows his stuff, but I would avoid taking him unless you are willing to work a lot.
Great Instructor. He knows the material really well and knows how to explain it thoroughly. I highly recommend the class. The material is not easy, but he does explain it very well

Pretty much my favorite professor ever.  His class is hard, but he makes everything very clear, and is very helpful in office hours.  He explains why you do everything, instead of just making you memorize formulas.  The tests are hard and you need to put in a lot of work, but he is an amazing professor!

He is definitely one of my favorite professors at UGA. He gives quizzes twice a week, and collects homework to make sure you are understanding the material. He has office hours a few times a week. His teaching style is wonderful, and I found him much easier to follow than other professors. I did find his tests to be rather difficult though.

I've never had calculus in my life before and really struggled with this class.  He lectured a little quickly, and it was hard for me to ask questions during office hours because he always gave me this look that said 'you're really stupid.'  He didn't really help increase my calculus knowledge as I feel like I know just as little now as I did befor

He's an amazing professor, really. He's interesting, and he really knows what he's teaching. If you don't understand a topic, he's got office hours and appointments. Even if you haven't taken calc before, you can still get an A in the class if you don't miss class a lot and study for the quizzes and exams. I'd recommend him to anyone.

This is not a good class if you're just starting on calculus, but it is great if you already know what calculus is.  He is a great instructor, but sometimes it is hard for him to tell how much the class does or does not understand.  The tests are not bad.  You will not run out of time unless you don't understand the material really well.

Prof Lyall is literally one of the best math teachers I've every had - ever! If you struggled in your AP Calc class in high school, fear no more because Calc is made easy in his class. Lyall makes you understand why you are doing a particular method when solving a problem. It was a great class with an awesome teacher!

Overall, this class is difficult if you have never taken calculus before and his teaching style is hard to comprehend what hes getting at. The material he teaches is purely conceptual so if you take his class make sure to attend every class and office hour for more help. He is always available and focuses on helping the students.

I wouldn't recommend this class for anyone who hasn't already had calculus.  I took AP in high school but still had difficulty understanding how Neil teaches.  If you do happen to take his class then try not to miss an classes.  His favorite students are the ones who attend class and go to his office hours for help or those who make an effort.

One of the best professors I have ever had! He is a great teacher, cares about his students, and is always open for questions.  He explains things very well, so I am not sure where the last comment is coming from....

95% of the time, I walked out of the class completely fustrated.  Somtimes he doesn't finish the example problems in class and constantly skips steps with the problems he DOES do.  I've spent most of the time teaching myself or going to Milledge because he's not much help.  Wouldn't say he's completely terrible, but definitly not for beginners.

Great teacher.  Is not your typical boring, impossible to understand calculus teacher.  He probably is in his late twenties and gives an interesting presentation of an boring topic.  Is more concerned about your progress than trying to fail you.  So, while the material is hard, he'll do whatever he can to be fair, as long as he sees you trying.

Excellent teacher.  He makes calculus easier than it really should be.  He really cares to make sure that everybody knows everything.  He gives fairly hard tests, but nothing that he didnt emphasize during class.  I don't think there is a better calc2 teacher at UGA.
Very awesome teacher. He really cares about you learning and will help a lot outside of class. He's so cool too... and young... and hot.
he's hot, he helps you as much as he can everyday before class he has study sessions in his office.  every week there is a study session.  there are enough tests and quizes to get a good grade
Very good teacher, young, scottish and not boring. Just take lots of notes and you'll be fine

He is a great teacher. Very laid back and willing to answer your questions. Always had review sessions before a test. If you took Calc in High school and had a decent teacher, go ahead and take this class - its not over your head if your comfortable with what you already learned.

I love this class - it was just so fun! It's totally seminar-style, and each person is assigned an ethnography (all available in the lib) per era w/ certain q's to answer, 5 eras for the course. All discussion and making connections, a rotation of jobs that everybody has to do (scribe, moderator, etc). Super fun, changes thinking on humanity.

He taught this class seminar style. Each person was assigned a different book for each time period (maybe 5 for the semester) and all we did in class was discuss the books and the patterns we saw. All the books were available in the library and easy to get. Work load was low and he was really nice and just wanted us to enjoy anthropology. Cool guy
ratingTags_Rating: Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Would take again

comment_Rating: Steve is so nice and knows his stuff. In this course we had 6 essay tests, and attendance was not taken. The tests were mostly concept based where you applied what you learned to a problem- not super hard but the grading could be kind of tough, but I always got lots of feedback. I would definitely recommend taking one of his classes if you can!

Everything on his tests come straight from his lectures or the books you have to read. I thought his class was really straight forward and while it required a lot of studying leading up to tests, if you do badly then its because you didn't take good notes or read the material beforehand. I enjoyed his class overall.
ratingTags_Rating: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment_Rating: He's passionate about anthropology, but not so much in teaching. He rambles for entire lectures & none of it makes sense. The TAs can't even help you bc they have no idea what's going on in the class or on tests. The tests are ID terms, which he could have muttered 2 words about in lecture & then it'd be on the test, & 2 essays.  4 tests only.

Professor Kowaleski is the sweetest man who is very passionate about anthropology and genuinely cares how his students do.  The class writings are difficult, but your grade is dependent on your TA and their mood that day

I was an Anthropology major before entering this class. No longer! Your grade is entirely based on in class writings every week that are nearly impossible to get As on. I got Cs on most, & I am generally a straight A student. Only reason I pulled out a B is because the final's A LOT easier than weekly writings. Passionate professor, terrible class.

Although Steve is very passionate about this subject, his teaching skills are subpar. Reading the books is a must and even those don't prepare you for the writings each week. The final was also very difficult. I recommend not taking this course with him if you are not prepared to put forth many hours outside of class. It is not an easy A.

Very good teacher. Loves his subject and is still active in his field and Loves his job.  The class lectures are kind of boring but can be interesting at times.  Must read the 4 books required and answer essay questions on them but not to difficult.  No test just answering the questions and final at end of semester
Honors section is pretty easy. He's super helpful and really enthusiastic about the subject. Loves to ramble but completely lovable. 4 papers, cancelled final

He's such a nice man!  He can ramble a bit, and we never had tests, only four papers.  He even cancelled the final.  You have to read the books he gives you to write the papers, but he's MORE than willing to help you if you have trouble.  We didn't really do anything during classtime, though.  It can be a bit boring, but if you try, you'll get an A

Dr. Kowalewski is so excited about what he teaches, but he often ends up rambling for the entire class. Lots of classes were reserved as shows of pictures from one of his many trips to Mexico (boring). His tests aren't too bad, and they're taken mostly from the books.  Paying attention isn't necessary, but attendance is mandatory.

Read the texts. Pay attention to his ramblings for test time. This is not a good elective for non-majors. And in all seriousness, anthro major who thinks the rest of us are grady-tards: don't be such a tool.

Great Teacher. Pay attention and take notes. He knows his material and takes it serious. If you are not interested in Archaeology go back to the business school and leave the class open for someone who does.

New World Archaeology was difficult just because it's so much information to cram into your head, but he does a great job explaining things, and is very nice and helpful. And so entertaining!  Will walk around pretending to be a woolly mammoth - AWESOME.

I've had Kowaleski before, and he's one of the most excited profs I've met. Study your notes and attend the lectures. He's engaging because he's so enthusiastic, and he is willing to help if you ask. Aztecs & the Maya (4460) is probably a better class because it's less broad and he's a little clearer. Overall, I'd say that he's a good prof.
I hate archaeology but I loved him as a professor.  He is passionate about the subject and tries to make it as interesting as possible.  Highly recommended if you are into archaeology or history.

I had him for archeology of the southwest, it was absolutely horrible.  The books do not cover the same as he does in class.  He is a nice man but seems to think everyone is an anthropology major and expects you to know every tiny detail about every single thing he has mentioned in class. Do not take him!
very intersting class. a little too broad for me, but it was an intro. books are great, but know the notes inside out (and show up for class). got an A
GREAT professor. The entire class absolutly loved him. Study the notes, read the books (which are actually pretty interesting), and you should be able to pull off an A
No Comments

Dr. Kowaleski is a really nice guy, he's really...quirky. He makes class really interesting by demonstrating things like how cave men used to walk. The first test is the hardest but after that they're easy. Go to the T.A review sessions and you'll make an A

Professor van der Veen is one of the smartest men I know. He truly does know his stuff and is super passionate about Government. There are a lot of reading that you should probably do, but he does help out those who try in class. I throughly enjoyed his class and I was always excited to go! He's a real gem
Very bright and qualified professor. The class is challenging. Do all of the readings and take good notes for the exams, and you'll do well.  Definitely recommend this class and teacher!
Very interesting lecture style. Lots of anecdotes. Expensive textbook, though.

It is a credit to UGA to have him on staff. Very smart man, no fluff in this class. Expect to read for hours and go to class. But he's fair and helpful. Never met an INTL student who wasn't glad they had him.
Although Maurits assigns a sizable amount of reading, he's very intelligent, and easy to understand.  He's also more than willing to help if you have any questions.  A++

Good Professor who obviously knows his stuff...really well.  Assigns a good deal of reading, and attending class regularly is a must, but otherwise a very interesting class.  Not a cupcake class, you have to do real work and preparation.

very intelligent and obviously knows his stuff. you MUST attend lectures to suceed in this class; there is a lot of reading but it's (mostly) interesting and the concepts on the test are discussed in class. His website is really helpful too-he posts outlines. on T/Th he gets a little sleep inducing but a very nice man

He assigns a lot of reading but the tests deal more with concepts discussed in class, so reading will mostly help to provide examples and material for exam essays. A very intelligent and unbiased professor who really knows his stuff.

Classes were extremely boring. Nobody seemed to care about the class so she got angry when where was lack of participation. She makes the tests moderately hard and she doesn't do a good job of explaining things.

From a teaching standpoint she's pretty average. It's her unnecessary criticism, passive aggressiveness, and opinionated grading that are painful. If she doesn't like what you say, she'll let you know and give you a poor grade. Also expect a lecture about how your class is disappointing with participation and she is not afraid to fail all of you.

Your grade in this class depends on one thing: her opinion of you. She will determine how she grades your papers, participation, etc, mainly through the opinion she gets of you the first week classes. Do not slip up. After our midterm, she sat the three students who got A's in one corner, & everyone else in another, & asked us if "we were ashamed".

She is the most helpful professor I've ever had; however, I felt like the class was very hard. She is extremely fair in her grading though, so you know what to expect. If you are looking for an easy A then this is not the class for you. I did feel like I learned a ton though! She's super hard, but I definitely recommend her!
Okay teacher. Attendance is crucial and there is a good amount of homework.

Profesora Mata was the best professor I have had at UGA. She works hard to ensure that you understand everything that she teaches. She always explained further if someone even LOOKED confused. She is willing to work with you if you have a tough week & she really wants you to do well in the class. Wonderful person, wonderful instructor. LOVE MATA!!

I will admit I'm rating because I'm mad about the grade I made. Her grading is completely subjective to how much she likes you. There is no rubric or guideline. She will read your paper, give you a grade, and then not explain why. If you're unhappy with it, there isn't anything you can do. I know it's cliche, but she doesn't fairly grade you.

I really enjoyed Mata's class and thought it was much easier than my 3010 section.  Participation is a must  Definitely talk a lot in class not just for points but because it makes her like you better.  Overall, really nice professor and helped improve my Spanish.

She is a great teacher and I recommend taking her for honors. She really wants her students to understand the grammar and she is willing to help after class. The grade you get in this class reflects the work you do. If you put in the effort it's easy.

I took the honors version of this class. This class definitely made me a better writer and speaker of the Spanish language. If you don't talk in class, your final grade will definitely reflect that...same with if you don't try on your essays. But with effort, you can get an A and Dra. Mata is always willing to help you out!

I took her Honors Spanish 3010 class, and I thought it was pretty good. Her class was a decent amount of work, but nothing unmanageable. However, one thing I didn't like about her is that she gets ideas about certain people and concepts. In the end, I made the grade I wanted, but it took a lot of work to get there. Overall, she's a good teacher.

I would not recommend taking Mata for this course.  From the very beginning she gets an idea in her head about your ability, and continues to grade based on that idea regardless of any obvious improvements.  She is not clear and unorganized much of the time.

I took SPAN 3010H with Mata. Overall, I liked her. There is a lot of class discussion because she really wants you to practice speaking. We didn't have any tests per say, but essays, presentations, participation, and vocab exercises made up our grades. This class was not a breeze but was not bad, either. Mata is a solid teacher!

Don't take Mata. I read the reviews on here and thought to myself, "I will be fine." I'm not. Mata rushes through everything, her tests' short answer are impossible and I have been teaching myself all semester still not learning a thing.

She is nice, and really wants to make a difference in the world through teaching students about being better people. She's sooo picky though, and she is not the fairest grader! The smallest thing will tick her off. Ask her for help anytime you are confused, and practice your grammar b/c it's important to her. She's not bad.
BEST TEACHER EVER!!!

Interesting class, some of the subject matter was pretty difficult but Mata was very nice and helpful. as long as you pay attention in class and study prior to the tests you can do well in the class..

Mata seemed like a very nice and sweet lady at first, but she seemed to be in an eternal bad mood after midterm. This class is not easy by any means - it requires much studying for very tough tests. I would advise finding another professor for this class, she made a possibly enjoyable class anything but enjoyable.

HORRIBLE teacher.  Nice lady and all, but does not know the first thing about teaching. Her tests are horribly difficult, too.  She expects you to understand the material as well as she does, and she does very little to help you understand it that well.  NO extra credit opportunites or ways to redeem bad grades.  Avoid her.

I will be completely honest with you. I am good at linguistics.Mata is a very nice lady and she knows a lot about the subject, but she is not an objective grader at all.Get a different teacher. I hear Ruiz is good. She told someone "This class is like the accounting of Spanish, you might just have to accept a C." She gives bad grades for no reason.

Dra. Mata is nice and makes lectures as interesting as possible. Be prepared for very long, complicated tests that require a ton of writing, no mult. choice or short questions. She is very picky when she grades these tests. The tests cover too much material and are hard to study for. I would advise looking for another 3050 professor if possible.
A very good teacher. She has a good sense of humor so she tries to make class as fun as it can be. She is also very understanding if you need help with anything.

Mata is an excellent teacher. She makes the class as fun as it can be considering that it is linguistics. He makes good charts of what you need to know and between the notes and the book, you will be well prepared for the test. She's really understanding and works with her students. Take her!
Doesn't sound like much has changed in ten years. Painfully slow. Realizes you haven't learned half the material with a week to go in the semester and then tests you on it. Teach yourself.
He grades too harshly and he is very disorganized. His class is really boring and never gives materials in a timely manner. Avoid at all costs.
My experience has been quite different and actually a lot better than what others have expressed here.
Worst Teacher I have ever had
He obviously does not want to be teaching and it shows. Notes are hand written in chalk straight out of the book, and his tests do not cover the same material as in class.

Her classes are great if you are an undergraduate student. But when you become a PhD student under her, it all changes. She seems to get irritated if you want to express your opinion during class. She wants to do all the talking. She only like PhD students who will do what she says, and she is directly insulting to students who differ from her.

Class was not as great as I hoped it to be. She gives a ton of reading (2 textbooks on top of multiple weekly articles), 3 presentations throughout the class, and 3 papers due at the end (15-30pg research, 7 pg final, and 1 pg book review). Way too much work for a class. Very strict about class attendance. Likes to start on time but keeps you late.

I love Dr. Napier!  I would totally take another class that I have no interest in just to have her again.  She is very passionate about what she teaches, and can truly open your eyes to things you may have never considered before.  If you have the opportunity, take her class!
very nice and helpful, passionate about what she teaches.  very easy to understand

Dr. D rocks!  She is so clear and always willing to help...she picks great TA's and the class was fun.  I worked moderately hard in her class and made an A.  She really cares about her students and is one of the best teachers I have had at UGA.  She is so understanding and funny...I just can't say enough good things about her.
