I really enjoyed her class.  She makes material that could be painfully boring very interesting.  She gives good advice and is willing to help students out with papers and things.  I would definately reccomend her
Lastrapes is a good soul. I dropped a meatball on my computer keyboard while taking a test and it logged me out. Luckily, Lastrapes is an understanding person and let me retake the test.

This class was pretty easy in the beginning. Your only grades are 8 tests and a final. The tests are all open note so its very easy to get an A on almost all of the. He puts practice tests out that are almost identical to the unit tests. The final is what hurts your grade. It is 40% of your grade and a lot harder than unit tests.
ratingTags_Rating: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Clear grading criteria

comment_Rating: He's very clear. Got a great enthusiasm for the subject. Brilliant man.
Solid class, make sure to read up on the models well ahead of tests.
can be a bit tough
Good course, not many options to improve grades though
There are not a lot of grades, but the material is intriguing
ratingTags_Rating: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment_Rating: Great guy, the material can be difficult so start studying early!
Good prof - tests are difficult so start studying early.
ratingTags_Rating: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment_Rating: Dr. Lastrapes is an awesome professor who really knows what he is doing. He gives pop quizzes so don't skip class that often. Know the study guide well because it will help you immensely on the midterm and final. Use the article summaries as a grade booster. Would highly recommend this class
ratingTags_Rating: Respected--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment_Rating: class isn't mandatory but he does give pop quizzes that are graded for accuracy.  He said he was only going to give 6, and ended up giving 8.  I missed most of them and got around a 60 avg for my quiz grade.  Gave an article summary to boost your grade.  Tests are super easy if you know the study guide BY HEART because he asks the opposite. loved
awesome and very hot!!!!!!!
Nice guy, interesting class.  Really knows the material well, so class discussions are good, and is actually useful during office hours.  Tests are a tad tricky, but doable.
No Comments

Rojek is awesome, best professor yet! Four exams and one paper but she guides you in everything. Class is mandatory because exams are both based from book and lectures and power points arent posted but she always makes lecture super interesting. Go to class, study the review from the book and your lecture notes and can easily get an A. Super funny
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Amazing lectures

comment_Rating: One of the best professors Ive had at UGA. Extremely interesting and entertaining. His tests are not easy, you have to go to class and take good notes and also read the book. Very helpful.

Interesting class, but he will focus more on the law and justice than the sociological aspects of it. Very interesting professor who made class funny and interesting to listen to (despite an 8am Maymester). Be careful though, he tests from both the substantial readings (which he helped write) and his lectures, which don't always coincide.

This class was one of the easiest A's I have made at UGA.  Do all the reading, because not all test questions come from the notes.  I really found the class to be very interesting, even at 8 in the morning.  Dr. Rojek is just a real nice person, down to earth.
He plays favorites...if you are a hot girl he will be extremely helpful...if not then you are out of luck
No Comments

Really cool guy.  Helps you to think out of the box, and uses crude examples in every explanation.  He is funny, interesting; a definitely great professor.  Make sure you do the reading though.  His tests are more difficult than you would think.  They are 3/4 multiple choice, and the rest are short answer.
Class is easy.  3 test and a group project.  Rojek who is like 70 flirts with all the girls in the class

Got an A by paying attention in his research assistant's review sessions. 3 simple book reports and 2 tests made up our grade, and even though the syllabus said 20 percent was based on attendance, he gave no attendance quizzes and removed it from the grading scale by the time the course finished. Decent professor with a quirky sense of humor.

The class is very reading intensive, though not particularly difficult. If you can write well, you will do well in the course. However, don't count on participation to increase your grade. His syllabus says it will count for 20% of your grade, but he doesn't take regular attendance, administer quizzes, or encourage discussion so he just cut it out.

Dr. Wiara is awesome. If you want a career in foreign policy, this class is a must. Just his experience alone/stories about DC are extremely helpful. He also gives a lot of good tips about what kind of jobs are available. Beyond that, the class is pretty interesting. Good overview. 3 book reports, 2 exams. Not that hard.

Dr. Wiarda is a quintessential Cold War warrior with outdated views and an arrogance unmatched by any professor that I have had at UGA. I learned a lot in his class (mostly about how to land a job in DC), but given the fact that his lectures and readings were identical, I could have easily skipped class all semester and gained the same knowledge.
No Comments

I had him for two classes, Amer. Foreign Policy and a sp. topics class.  The AFP was great.  He was really funny, and interesting, but somehow that attitude didn't translate well into the SP. Topics class.  There is a lot of reading. We had to read an entire text book for the midterm for both classes. He is also kind of arrogant.
Donald Wood rocks! There are some difficult concepts to grasp in this course and he will work with you until you get them. He's fun, energetic, and personable.

This guy is awesome. Seriously is still to this day one of my favorite teachers at UGA. He made the class so fun and interesting. Was extremely understanding. It's a language, so you obviously have to do the assignments and study to do well - but it is worth it. I loved him!

I had him for summer session, and I really liked him. He is helpful and supportive. He keeps class fun and interesting. His tests and quizzes are challenging enough to help you grasp the language but not demoralizing and hard. Solid teacher that rocks some pretty sweet yamikas.

Spanish is definitely not my forte, and I really dont like the language. However, Sr. Wood made class very enjoyable and explained things very well. I found myself learning a lot while having a good time in class. He's funny and very energetic and really cares about his classes. If you can take him, definitely do!!!

Funny, really nice and great teacher. Mr. Wood is very easy to get along with and an awesome teacher. He goes slowly and fully explains the material. The quizzes and tests can sometimes be difficult but if you study you should be fine.

I really enjoyed him as a teacher. He's fun & not serious all the time. The tests were easy if you study and he never gave hard homework. Make sure you do the Quia. It's the only thing he was a stickler for deadlines about. For the most part you can turn in your homework a day late or wait to take a test if you were unprepared b/c of an absence

I had him for SPAN 3030 and he was useless.  He is a smart guy and has learned several languages but Spanish is definitely not his forte.  His "lectures" are a waste of time.  The tests aren't hard, but you're much better off taking someone else.  I honestly feel like my knowledge of the Spanish language was lessened during his class.
Awesome, hilarious guy. Had him 4 days a week at 8AM, and he made it enjoyable. Got an A in the class.
Great guy, great teacher, great personality, but I felt his tests (only 2--midterm and final) were unfair.

Such a great teacher. So helpful, kinda, funny, and sweet. Sadly, I was a slacker and did not do well, but it was completely my fault--he was way willing to help me--near the end of the semester I got my act together and did better. GREAT teacher!
Best spanish professor I have had here yet. He always explains things until everyone understands it, and it very fair in grading policies. Take him if you can!!

It's safe to say that I hate Spanish more than any other class offered at the University, but Prof Wood was so cool and reasonable. He was flexible with work/internship schedules, and really taught the material well. For a grad assistant, I thought he was a super teacher. Very willing to help outside of class, too. TAKE his Spanish classes!

The best damn Spanish Professor you would have! I wish I could have him every year! He is clear, concise, and is willing to help. He basically tells you the answer during a test. Againn TAKE HIM IF AT ALL POSSIBLE!
I struggled a lot in his class and barely made a B-.....

He's a great teacher.  Very funny and in touch with the students.  He is always willing to help you with anything and is fairly lenient with his grading.  Consider yourself lucky if you end up in his class, because I doubt there is a better spanish teacher at UGA.

If you're willing to just pay attention in class, he's alot of fun. Every day he tries to do things alittle differently. You'll forget you're in a college classroom but you're still learning. No reason anyone shouldn't do well.
He is extremely nice.  He will do anything to help you anytime you need the help.  It's kinda hard but if he knows you are trying he is more lenient.

I agree with the above. He is one of the harder graders of span 1001 but it dosen;t matter much because everyone takes the same tests. TAKE HIM. Hes really nice and funny. I enjoyed every day in his class. Hes very non-intimidating too.
Awesome prof. He is energetic and a lot of fun. But there is some work required.

I took his online class of Public Speaking, and I loved it! He is very helpful, gives clear instructions, always responds to emails the same day, mostly right away! He wants you to study hard and try your best,  but is not a tough grader.

One of the best teachers I have ever had, in terms of clear instructions and availability to help. He genuinely wants you to do well and is extremely helpful, considerate and encouraging. He is fair, entertaining, and responds quickly to questions. If you simply follow instructions and show effort, you will get very good grades. Great instructor.

I took his class for interpersonal communication. Overall he is a pretty cool teacher but somedays you will feel like there was no point in going to class because he just talk about nothing. If you read the book you should do well on the tests.

He is absolutely useless as a teacher. You have to read/learn everything for yourself before going to class. And when class is in session all you do is have coffee shop conversations. It's a waste of time. He is very proud of himself.

I would recommend Huff to everyone!!! He is awesome!! I loved going to class, we would always talk about interesting stuff and he always had good stories to tell. He really wants everyone to do well, but you need to do what is required. The tests are kinda hard but if you study the study guide you will have no problems! Take this class!!!

I loved Huff!!!!! I thought the tests were kinda hard but if you read the book you will have no problems what so ever with this class. I thought Huff was awesome, he is really funny and the class was really interesting!! I loved going to this class..it was actually fun! I would really recommend taking him!

For public speaking, take any other professor. During class, he will ramble on about football and various other subjects which can be interesting, but stops being amusing when you take his tests. His book (that he wrote) is completely devoid  of content and will not help you become a better public speaker. I learned nothing from this class.

Likes to hear himself talk. Horrible instructor. Get out of his class if you are looking to make a good grade. He has his favorites, so laugh at his lame jokes and suck up to him and he'll like you, but getting an A is a real challenge with the way he does his tests that count for most of your grade

Dr.Huff is a really interesting guy who likes to hear himself talk, but it is pretty entertaining. The class is fun enough, but there are only 2 tests that count for most of your grade, even if you make an A on all of your speeches, you probably won't end up with an A unless you do well on the tests, which you're on your own studying for.I got a B.
Not gonna blast the guy, but I wouldn't recommend him as a professor.

This guy is a joke.  If you kiss his ass your looking at a good grade, otherwise, don't count on it.  He is hostile and will sooner or later get fired, for he does not teach really anything. If you are looking for a class to learn nothing, take this.  I wasted three hours every week coming to this class,
This guy is so useless.  He will pick favorites in class and give them the good grades.  Try to get another teacher if you can.  Its easy, but you won't learn anything.
This class was supposed to be a joke but you better read his stupid book if youre planning on getting an A.  the man is useless

I had to bite my tongue so in this class. He is so full of himself and his books that he has written. I was there everyday, made a A on every speech and ended up with a B in the class. He does not go thru the book and let you know what you need to know, all he does is belittle the book the school is using and take it out on us when he test.

Dr. Huff is very...odd. He does talk alot about useless stuff. More than that he LOVES to argue with students in an attempt to make them feel stupid.  He does grade very easily though. Part of each speech is the visual presentation. I sat mine up and started and completely forgot to incorporate it. After heavy ridiculing he still gave me an A.
The reviews are true. Easy class, arrogant teacher. Doesn't take criticism too well. Listen to him talk and laugh at his jokes.

Class was great. Dr. Huff is a pretty funny guy. Coming to class is pointless most days. He grades very fairly on speeches, but adhere to the deadlines! He doesn't grant much amnesty. Read the book and study for the tests. They are hard. He also cancels a lot of Friday classes so that's good too.

Well, I def can see where a student could dislike Dr. Huff. Sure he comes off as a bit arrogant b/c he shares stories in class, although, I believe the purpose of a speech class would be missed if he didn't. The point is to learn communication skills, and I think he does a great job in that area. Just read the key words and show up. You'll be fine.

Very easy class with easy tests. His grading in terms of the actual speeches were a bit weird. He checked all the highest boxes and gave me a B... Never understood that.  Learn to ignore his rude comments/opinions and you'll do fine. He has a weird...almost hatred for honors students... beware.

Great teacher, easy material just read the book and understand the key terms as well as what he talks about in class.  Not much note taking, very fun class, mostly discussion (mostly not related to class) great way to end the day! =]

If you have the choice, drop this class! He's been teaching too long, he needs to get out before he crosses the line with his students. He will use the class time to gab about useless dribble the majority of the time and if you don't go, you fail!

Never did anything constructive (hear me out). We had an arm wrestling tournament once, held classroom elections and spent the whole week giving speeches and finally electing students to meaningless positions he made up. Played the truth or lie game for literally 2 solid weeks until everyone had played. Great class to end your Fridays with.

This would be good a class if it weren't for the lack of useful information and a coherent professor. Dr. Huff spends the entire class talking about nonsensical topics such as how good one fast food restaurant's burritos were. He is arrogant, egotistical, and never admits being wrong. If you have a brain in your body, avoid this class at all costs.
His class is interesting, but his tests are extremely unfair.  I wouldn't recommend him.

You're lucky if you get Dr. Huff... Just read the book, memorize the study guide, and take practice tests on the textbook's website (almost all of the practice ?s are on the test). He's a funny guy that is very entertaining! Attendance is mandatory.

Dr. Huff's class was one of the easiest and most unique I've taken at the University. Basically, all you do in class is sit around and talk about whatever you want. It is necessary to read the book and study the terms to pass his tests. If you do this, you will get an A! Take this class, especially if you like to talk about football.  :-)

this was the funnest class ive had so far.  i had him once a week for 3 hours, but we never stayed the full time.  Basically all we did was swap stories with each other and played games (our class was really active) and debated football.  The hardness factor these other people are talking about is way overrated.. read the book and you can get an A

All he does is swap stories with students about the most ridiculous crap and will sometimes slip some information that's actually relevant in by mistake. He's very much in love with himself and tries to capture his "glory days" by acting like a college "dude." Terrible class, terrible teacher.
Dr. Huff is a great teacher.  He will go off topic in class, but he is always willing to answer questions.

He likes to just talk about stuff during class and doesnt really teach anything, but if you just go through the study guide he puts online before the tests theyre easy since its all like definitions straight from the book. I got an A no problem and all i did was the study guides the night before the test

Get out of this class now!!! Especially if you are honors.  He hates honors kids.  He seems cool at first but then he becomes the most ignorant and annoying proffessor you will ever have.  His class is a waste of time and you can't get an A. don't believe the key!  There are no A's.  Everyone in my class got a B or below!!!

The class appears easy during drop/add and the actual class room part is. You don't do anything in class except talk about random crap, cuss, and talk about obscene topics. However, the class starts to drive you crazy to go to because it becomes a waste of time and he is strick w/ attendance and turning things in at the beginning of class. BEWARE!
Dr. Huff is one of the most awesome professors I've ever had.  He is a difficult grader, but he does a wonderful job at creating an open class atmosphere.

Thought this class would be an easy A--turns out that the class is easy, but his tests are hard to crack. They're not hard, they're just 100 question multiple choice tests, and he won't let you see what you did wrong because he doesnt like to argue with students about grades.  Basically, this man teaches lazily. Use Key to pick an easier teacher

Took her at Tech. You can ask lots of questions to clarify the instructions; she won't be annoyed. She'll happily give you feedback on your papers.  Not a good writer, but I worked pretty hard & got mid As on all (had a friend who got a 100 once. She claims to be a bad writer ;) Put in effort, stay focused on the central argument & you'll be fine.

I had Dr. Lovatt for my first english class in college. The topic was Modernism in the Modern World and it's so boring. But Dr. Lovatt realizes this and tries and makes it as interesting as possible. No tests, have (bi) weekly blogs that aren't hard and if you do the work and go to class (mandatory participation) you'll do well.

There's class attendance. She always seems genuinely interested in the topic she's discussing even if she admits it to be dull. You'll make an A if you go to class and do all the assignments relatively well. I didn't read the book we had to read (300+ pages) and I managed to do well.

I love you so much. You are fantastic and care about what you are teaching and are hilarious. I love you. You are fantastic. Would take again (I actually did take her again because she rocked my soxs off the first time)

Dr. Lovatt's class this past semester on the rise of science fiction and the Gothic horror novel has undoubtedly been one of the most eye opening classes that I've ever taken in my life. She cares deeply for her students and her class has been overall very enjoyable - something I thought I could never say for another required English course.

She's very energetic and funny, while making excellent points at the same time. The books we read were interesting and she was helpful when you needed her. She splits up when parts of essays are due to keep you from procrastinating, which is great. Overall, I recommend her

TAKE HER! she is one of the best teachers i've ever had! extremely interesting and helps ease you into very complex works.  her class has helped me think differently about literature and the world. very enlightening teacher.

I had her for the 1102 Multicultural class.  She seems like an interesting person to get to know however I felt as if she was inconsistent with her grading.  She expects people to have deep insight into things that weren't ever discussed in class.  Also most class time feels like a waste cause we weren't productive.  She grades papers hard.

I really liked Gabriel (first name) as my TA for 3000. She's open to other people's interpretations and spent a lot of time answering questions about grades, essays, etc. She's interesting and gives extra info on what you get from the lecture. She's nice and approachable, I felt comfortable asking her questions. (3000 is a hard class, though.)

She is an awesome teacher! She is really smart and cultured. However, she is unorganized and unstructured; she fits the liberal art stereotype. She loves English and it shows. I enjoyed the class because I too love English and reading. Awesome class. I had fun!

I took her for 1102 Multicultural. Overall she is a good teacher. She is very smart and it shows. However, she never graded anything on time, never handed back our papers on time and made herself very available by giving us her cell number but never answered when we would call or responded to emails.
No Comments
Wonderful Teacher! Makes class interesting and fun!

Gabriel(yes she does ask you to call her by her first name, to ease you into the class) made english enlightening here at UGA. Everyone says its hard, but definitely not with her. She is interesting, funny, and has a general motherly attitude towards her students. She cares more about students than due dates. TAKE HER CLASS!!!

gabriel was really helpful, always extending deadlines if you needed them. sometimes, she can be a little disorganized and takes a long time grading essays. she is really interesting because she had lived like everywhere and has so many stories to tell. not a bad choice for engl 1101.
One of the best teachers I have ever had. Always willing to help and is extremely understanding. Class is fun. She is very interesting and entertaining! I highly recommend to take her class!
Ms. Lovatt was the best teacher I had this semester. She is very understanding and sooooooo interesting!! TAKE HER CLASS!!

She was literally the nicest teacher I have had at UGA and the class was really easy. She assigned homework but you can get away without doing it and all the tests are very fair. Easy A for sure. Definitely would recommend her!

She works really hard to make sure her students understand the material, especially because the quizzes are department-wide, not specific to her class. However, she doesn't put in as much effort if you clearly aren't trying/doing homework. Just make sure you do all the homework and show some interest.
This professor saved my neck. Very willing to help you out in whatever way possible. I am very bad with languages so I struggled, but do the homework (not just centro) and it'll pay off.

Very good Spanish teacher. Fun, and obviously wants you to understand the material. She helps by explaining some Spanish concepts that you've already learned in an easier way to remember it. You've got to do your homework, but it definitely pays off at quiz-time.

She is incredibly kind and helpful.  She cares a lot about what she teaches, and her enthusiasm spreads in the classroom.  She also does not take any BS from students who just list off excuses for missed work or plagiarism.  Awesome.

Senora Grem is an extremely nice lady and her positive attitude made it a little easier to get up for her 8 am class.  She's also a fair grader.  The class was interesting and interactive, which was helpful for me.

This was a great and interesting class. She sometiems overexplained the matierial (I like to read into it.. especially when it's literary works) but she spells stuff out and is really easy to understand. She really wants you to participate and overall is a great teacher. This class was not challenging to me at all ( I think i'll end with a 98)...

Sra. Grem is a great teacher but you really do need to do the homework and study for the quizzes (vocab and grammar)...she actually wants to help you learn the material, not simply see how quickly you can learn 20 vocab words.  This was not a slack class by any means, but she was great, always had a smile and was helpful and encouraging.

The department demands a lot, but she explains things very carefully and is very understanding. Study some and participate in class and you'll do fine even if you are just taking the class as a requirement.

Grem is a great professor.  I only took Spanish because it is a requirement and she really helped to lower my hate for the language.  She is always willing to give you help and the time spent in class is interactive.  There are study guides for the tests and she is a very fair grader.  Definately recommend her.

Sra. Grem is a great teacher. She is extremely helpful, and willing to spend more time on a section if the class needs help with it. Tests are graded fairly leniently and if you participate in class (hard not to) then you should be fine.
Class is very clear cut, she speaks in English enough so that you always know what is going on. I've taken 8 years of Spanish and she has been one of my best teachers. Definitely reccommend.
I think Sra. Grem is a great  professor.

Grem is a very helpful teacher, who understands what it's like to be a college student.  She goes about teaching in a fair and very clear manner, and there were no surprises come test time.  She is very thorough and makes sure that all her students understand what they are learning

For other review looks up Mason, she recently got married. She's a great teacher and you'll actually understand spanish- a first for me! The class is pretty easy and she is always willing to help you. She grades you pretty fairly. Def take this class!

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS WITH HIM. His lectures consist of him pacing back and forth in front of the classroom while you try not to fall asleep. He initially tells you that you will have to complete 10 discussion questions per chapter. ...45 questions (in one chapter) later I was ready to die. Tests are extremely long, but not overly hard.STUDY A LOT

Awesome prof. He approached most if not all subject matter very objectively. He is challenging because there are not many chances for grades. There were only 3 tests with one homework assignment that went along with each test. The HW really helped me to understand the material outside of Prof. Cotton.

If all professors were like this guy - we'd actually have college graduates who actually knew a thing or two.  He expects a lot but only so you actually retain the information.  He's extremely intelligent, enjoys his work, helpful - and not too bad on the eyes for me :o)  He's got my vote.

Though the previous commenter stated that Prof Cotton is easy, I'd like to warn you that he has totally changed his PHIL 1500 class. There are no tests or quizzes, and there is reading every night (aka HW). The only graded assignments were 2 essays- a midterm and final. Great teacher, but you have to work hard for a good grade.

My first Philosophy teacher for Intro to Logic. The topic was very interesting, and he did a pretty decent job of keeping everyone on the same page.  Not much to say - he gets the job done, and getting an A is a piece of cake for this class.  Quizzes are simple and not so frequent.  Homework is almost never. Boring lectures sometimes.

Good teacher. Very willing to help, especially on the papers. He likes things short and to the point on papers and tests.  It's not the class for you if you don't want to think but if you do, Make sure you do the reading and you'll learn a lot more from what he says.
I loved this class, and the topics were all interesting.  I think Cotton does a great job with the lectures.  You really have to read (and read again) and take good notes.

If you have a tough schedule, then don't take this class.  However, if you enjoy philosophy and profound themes, this is the class for you.  He is enthusiastic about his work and available for concerns and questions.  So, don't be hesitant if you need help.  It'll be to your advantage in the end.  Be sure to do the READINGS!!!

His class was horrible and ridiculously hard. He was very helpful, however. Sometimes he was interesting, but that was rare. You would probably enjoy him if you're a philosophy major, but other wise don't take him.

It's simple, if you want a really easy A do not take Cotton, because you obviously do not want to put work into a class. If you want to learn and earn something then take Cotton. You will actually have a good concept of ethical theory and their underlying arguments. He will also lead you to try to form your own theories about the good life.

great class -- i learned more than i could say. cotton really knows his stuff. readings and discussions were mostly (but very close to always) interesting. if you are interested in philosophy, looking to learn something eye-opening, AND willing to work, then i suggest this prof.

Very hard material for an entry level class. But with a little bit of effort it's easy. I rarely took notes or read and managed to get an A. Participate in the discussion and web group. His test grades tend to be low, but my final grade was much higher than my tests. If you have any trouble go by his office he's very helpful.

way too hard for an entry level, but if you are a phil major, it would be great! he really knows his stuff and will beat you over the head with it. you'll have to work really really hard, so make sure this is something you're willing to invest in. also, he does hold you late so... dont have a class right after it! he's a good guy and funny...
Incredibly hard for an entry level class, but Cotton seems like a good guy.  He's always helped when asked, but he thinks that a C is a pretty good grade.
hard teacher, has no concept of time.  he holds you over at least 10 minutes every class period.  doesnt care how you are doing in the class.

Prof Kapust is a great lecturer, but the homework is a drag. You have to do a weekly discussion based on readings. The books themselves are extremely dense and boring, so if you don't care for theory, don't take this class. Other than that, papers are graded relatively fair and attendance is mandatory (worth about 20pts).

I took poli sci 160 as a gen ed and I had no interest in this class. There were 2 papers, a final paper, and 1 discussion post every week. Overall, it was super easy and as long as you get a good TA (they do most of the grading) you're good.
ratingTags_Rating: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment_Rating: I really enjoyed Dr. Kapust's theory class (this section was theory and film). The class was a good mix of lecture and discussion, and his lectures are quite clear. You obviously have to do the readings and come to class, but if you do, your grade will thank you. Definitely recommend Dr. Kapust.

I took a polisci theory class he taught. It was pretty good. We did a lot of reading from various different books, and class consisted mainly of him lecturing unceasingly. He's nice and occasionally funny. You have to keep up with the lectures and read the material, but if you do that it's not hard.
This guy knows what he is talking about.  Excellent professor; come to class, take good notes and you will do great on tests.

Kapust is my favorite teacher at UGA! I had NO interest of pol theory before his class but he makes it interesting. His enthusiasm and passion for the material comes out STRONGLY! Would definetly recommend taking him!

Really one of my favorite professors ever. Had no real interest in the subject matter before, but I was genuinely interested in going to class to hear what he had to say. He knows what he wants, but he's very fair. Of the theory classes, this has to be one of the best. Above all, though, you MUST go to class to get a good grade.
Go to class everyday. Pay attention; take very good notes. 2 Essays and 2 Exams. Definitely recommend this class for your theory requirement! Kapust is overall good and willing to work with students!

He makes complicated material accessible and he truly enjoys discussing and teaching this subject matter.  If you have a good grounding in pop culture you'll definitely appreciate his humor!  Not an easy class but not impossible - attendance is important and studying is a must.

This is the 2nd class I’ve taken with Dr. Kapust and I find it just as enjoyable and challenging as the first.  Highly recommended if you enjoy politics and philosophy or you want to learn more about it.
I heard a rumor that he was getting married, and I spent the day in bed with depression.

A great teacher... makes intensely complicated material clear. Very funny. The class is hard work, but his notes are so good if you go that if youre a bit familiar with basic philosophy at all you'll have no trouble w/ the tests. But be prepared. The guy is so smart you probably will WANT to do well for him. One of the smartest profs I've ever had.
Dr. Kapust is a great teacher.  He has a great sense of humor.

biggest waste of time ever. the only saving grace was how easy the class is if you want an easy A, take this class, if you want to learn, don't bother. they'll let any idiot teach a music class at this school.
I Loved Camille! She made the class so much fun, and she was so nice and laid back! I would definitely recommend her to anyone!

Camille is quite cool. Laid back doesnt even begin to describe her. She is from australia, so her accent is pretty cool. It's not overbearing, dont worry, you can understand her perfectly. I would recommend her to anyone.
I took this History of Pop Music Class not knowing what to expect.  Camille is a great teacher and makes the class fun and easy.  I would recommend her to anyone.

Stocker wasn't super hard but at times the class was super annoying. She was late to class many times and would have us go around the room and read a paragraph at a time from the reading assignment like in 5th grade. It's hard to know what she expects on papers but once you figure out her style it's not too difficult.

A lot of people complain about her, but she was not that bad at all. She helped enormously with my papers. She does not just "hand out" A's, you have to work for them but if she knows you're trying, she'll help you. I got an A in the class and I'm not an English major. Never keeps you the whole time, and there is very limited work involved.

She is really nice but not a very good teacher at all. She shows up late everyday and lets you leave class after like 20 min on most days which is nice, but no matter how long you spend re-writing and fixing your papers, she WILL NOT GIVE A! Wont learn ONE thing the entire semester about how tot write better.  STAY AWAY IF YOU WANT AN A!

Horrible class. Luckily, she never kept us the whole time, which was definitely a plus. This woman is crazy. On the first day, she was 20 minutes late and didn't even explain why when she came in. She is decently friendly, but is a VERY tough grader and this class could very well kill your GPA if you aren't careful. PICK ANOTHER TEACHER!

If you're only taking english because you have to then I highly recommend Stocker.  She was willing to stay late to help with essays and we never stayed the whole time. She told you to read, but you can definitely get by without it. Didn't really need half the books she told you to get though.

A lot of people in my class (1102) seem to dislike this woman. If you know what the heck you're talking about in class discussions, though, she'll love you. I would probably hate her if I wasn't an English major though.

Do NOT take this class. She is quite possibly the worst teacher I have ever had. All you do in class is go around the room and read the 30 page long poems/stories out loud. Also she doesn't clarify what needs to be accomplished for the portfolio. She can be nice, but she chooses who she likes to be nice to. Don't get on her bad side!

if you like story time and don't care about grades or gpa this is a good class for you. she is easily the worst teacher i have ever had, not just in college but ever! she has no idea what she is doing. trying to talk to her about a paper is like talking to a brick wall. AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!!

Unquestionably the worst teacher I have ever had.Late every day,horrible grader,censors work,cancels class,sometimes doesn't even show up,you read out loud in class,graded on participation forcing people to express worthless opinions for points.Avoid her at all costs.Has no idea how to teach,knows nothing about literature,do not take class with her
WORST CLASS I HAVE EVER TAKEN WITH THE WORST TEACHER I HAVE EVER HAD!!!!

At first, she's really hard and really rude. But once she warms up to you, she's a lot more helpful and nicer. She sometimes contradicts herself, so you might have to figure things out on your own. With adequate preparation and time spent on papers, you'd be fine with grades.

Although she seems rough at first, as the semester progressed, she became nicer and more friendly.  Don't take her unless you are willing to be patient.  Plus, despite what other students may say about her grading, if you put forth REASONABLE time and effort for a paper, you should at least make a B.

Do not take english with this teacher!  She never teaches us anything, and all we do in class is read things out loud.  She takes forever to grades things and then only gives out C's and D's.  Terrible teacher.

Wow.  Whatever you do, do NOT take this class with this teacher.  Seriously, we read out loud every day, wrote 2 papers where everyone else has wrote 4, and got bad grades on them.  Maybe not as much work at first, but when it comes portfolio time...uh oh.  But just dont take her.  Do like the other kid said....GET OUT!

This lady is CRAZY!!! Get out...! She is on crack! Not only does she fall asleep during class but she takes about four weeks to grade papers. She has no idea what she is doing and has only given C's and D's on papers. DO NOT TAKE HER!!!

This man is now at KSU and depriving a village in Columbia of their idiot by his presence in Kennesaw.  Everything said below is true except that he is only a nice guy if you don't ask questions.  If you ask questions he gets mad and it WILL affect your grades.  Never take this man for any course. Get a course substitution or take another prof.

This is one of those professors that teach one thing AND gives you a study guide, then DOESN'T test on the same thing. He totally sucks at making tests. ALso, If you have a hard time understanding someone with an accent don't take this class, although you do get used to it. He is really nice but his tests are ridiculous...
I wanted to take geography 1111, but I had to drop this class before it ruined my gpa. Don't take Giraldo's class, he's a nice guy, but the class is very unclear.

This class was rather easy to pass. As long as you actually make an effort when you write papers your grade should be fine. I would advise speaking up in class though. Participation points can really mess with your overall grade.
Cool guy, good professor. As long as you do the readings, speak up at least some in class, and pay attention to what he says, you can do well in the class.

Greatest english class I have ever taken.  Incredibly bright guy who is passionate about the subject. Wasn't too hard, you just have to be willing to think critically and read regularly.  The class inspired me.

Terrible professor. His grading was ridiculous and didn't even follow his own rubric. His class discussions moved far too fast for anyone to really have any input, but participation was 20% of his grade. If your own views did not mirror his own, they normally weren't correct. There are definitely better english professors, so don't waste your time.

Overall a good professor. Gave me my only B of freshman year, but it was because I rarely spoke up in class.  Grades a little hard but fair. I went to one day of Camp's class, dropped it, and Clark was much more interesting.  You can make an A if you take your time on the papers and participate. Nobody does worse than a B unless you just don't try.

I felt that he graded harshly.  I have always done well on AP exams and in class, and I am doing well in my current English class.  I was crushed when I got a 74 on my first paper, then a 82 on my second, finally able to please him with my third and grasp a 92.  There are many more easier professors.  Take someone else!
Readings and discussions were straightforward. He pretty much just states ideas that you can write about on your papers. He's a cool guy with a good sense of humor and an overall good teacher.

Mr. Clark is a very engaging professor and really gets the class interested in the literary work. Very much enjoyed his class! Grades a bit hard but is reasonable. I have definitely learned a lot form him and strongly recommend him!
My high school AP teacher said that 1101 would be too many papers, which sounded dreary. Bob Clark makes this class fun, though, and I recommend him for incoming freshmen.
Grades pretty hard. Even when I went in for help, and thought i had a great grasp on the paper, I still only got an 84... frustrating grading.

Whoever wrote the first comment is an A**! I liked Mr. Clark. Being a Minority, its good when a professor cares about NOT OFFENDING You! DUH! He made what would have usually been boring stories interesting and gave a different perspective which was appreciated. He also helped me with my papers and I pulled a 'B' after workin my butt off for it.

While whoever wrote that other comment is correct about him being a stickler on being politically correct, I still think he's a good teacher.  He was helpful during office hours when I wanted to know what I did wrong on my papers as well.  Overall, he's a smart guy and is rather laid back.  I've always found English boring, but he taught well.

He sucks. He thinks he knows everything and everyone should see things his way. He is always concerned with finding a negative approach on everything but at the same time his views in class can't offend ANYONE. He is like a big powder puff and everything must be politically correct. Class is boring and he has the personality of a brick.

Intro. to Stochastic Processes is the hardest undergraduate statistics class at UGA.  It requires a knowledge of multivariable calculus, linear algebra, and probability theory.  Without these tools you will most certainly fail.  However, Dr. McCormick does a great job of preparing you for tests and helping with homework.  Highly recommended!!

Dr. McCormick is an excellent proffessor(A++). His lectures are always clear and organize. If you have any trouble, just go to his office hours because he is VERY helpful and cares about his students as well.
He was very helpful in office hours and he grades are what is best for his students. He is an excellent teacher, you do have to put forth effort and study but overall an easier class.

He is the best statistics teacher I have ever had. He is the living example of how to teach statistics. Very helpful and likeable. Very clear. Perfect use of the board. He is not only a statistician, but also a very good teacher. I recommend him for any stat class he is teaching. Take him. He is very willing to help you in office hours.

Such an awesome professor!!!!! VERY helpful in office hours, really nice guy!! He reviews you pretty well for his tests which don't cover a whole lot of material anyways. He gives a LOT of partial credit which helps out your grade. A little effort goes a really long way in his class.

Honestly a very easy FYOS as long as you put in effort in writing the one pagers. Make sure you talk about the virus in the majority of your essay, cause thats basically the only thing he looks at. Easy presentation that he literal gives a 100 for unless you really mess up. You write 6 one pagers other than super easy FYOS, super chill guy.

The fyos was Viruses and Man and it was very straight forward. You had a one-page paper due a week on the previous virus. He gives tons resources to help you so the papers aren't hard. I wouldn't recommend this class if you don't know some biology basics but you can manage without just fine. He drops one of the papers and class is super laid back.
ratingTags_Rating: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment_Rating: I had Dr. Deom for my Odyssey Seminar-- Viruses and Man. He definitely knows his material, but sometimes he forgets how little Freshmen know about how viruses work.  Class was very thought-provoking and very fun. Participation in class discussion is a must to get an A! Papers and presentations aren't bad-- they definitely help you learn, though!
She is incarnation of Mozart...I love he very much...

Check this out:"On March 1st, Mitos Andaya, associate director of choral activities, was honored at the UGA Student Government Association Annual Professor Recognition Ceremony & presented an award for outstanding commitment to students & academic excellence at the University of Georgia....selected...out of the 60 professors nominated by students."

I have sung under her direction once or twice, but as I was a student in the 1970's, I can compare then to now clearly and say that regardless of whether you get along with Dr. Andaya or not, the repertoire she is bringing to UGA is of the highest calibre--in fact, this is the only chance you'll get to work with such classics of early music. Kudos!
She's fine. I only worked with her at the Christmas concert this year in Concert Choir and although she was not particularly clear or fun, she was a satisfactory conductor.

If you have problems with attendance, do not take this class. I was sick with the flu and I had to attend the concert as well as rehearsals even though I was contagious. Ridiculous. Dr. Andaya is okay; she does the same warm ups every rehearsal and her choice in music is weird, but the class wasn't bad.

The WORST music teacher i have EVER have. She takes all of the love out of music. She is very impersonable. If you attend, you will get an A, but it is NOT worth it. She does not know how to make good music. DO NOT TAKE!!!

Having graduated from UGA with a music degree, it is my contention that Mitos couldn't conduct electricity.  Her methodology is awful and the finished product is as pleasant as a screaming child.  Keep in mind that she doesn't teach all music majors, so take some of the better ratings with a grain of salt.  She is easy on the eyes, but a huge snob.
She's really, really, really hot. She's passionate about music, but a horrible teacher. Really, really, really hot though, especially in jeans.

She treats undergrads, grads, and professors as if they were all 13 year olds. She doesn't trust you or respect you. She's never responded to an email in a timely manner (within a month). She takes herself far too seriously. These classes are TORTURE. Whether or not you like music, she kills it for you. She should NOT be teaching.
Clearly she knows her stuff she just has a bad taste in music and doesn't really care how the group does come performance time.

Andaya is one of the worst chorus teachers ever. If you are looking for a good choir to join at UGA, DO NOT JOIN THIS ONE! Not only is the quality of singing poor, but the teaching methods and music choice is offensive. She thinks that the choir is MUCH better than what they really are, and so do the members of the choir. I dreaded this class.

I think people are too hrad on Dr. Andaya. It is true that she doesn't always correct all the chorus' mistakes and still expects us to be perfect. But she is a good person and I enjoyed chorus a lot thanks to her. Don't take her class if you expect a strict, mean teacher like Cedel was to us. Take it if you want to have fun...!

Chorus was my favorite class in high school but not at UGA.  Dr. Andaya actually laughs at the chorus when we make mistakes and rarely fixes them.   Sometimes I wonder if she even hears them.  I am used to a much stricter director, and I hate how chorus doesn't seem as serious with her as it was in high school.

Andaya is overly technical, she knows the mechanics but is a machine in her interpretation. Her saccharinely bitter demeanor doesn't help either. Expect her to talk to you like a kindergartener and treat you like shes a prison warden.
Horrible HORRIBLE class! She never gave us a rubric for how projects would be graded. Completely subjective and unfair, but completely impossible to contest the grade. Avoid at all costs....

Dr. Andaya is more mean than anything else. She will quickly jump on you in a VERY overly sweet and sarcastic sort of way for just about anything. I had a bad situation come up during her class and she wasn't even mildly empathetic to my situation.
She freaks out about a lot of things that shouldn't be freaked out about.  Our Women's Glee concert in spring 07 was absolutely terrible.
She's is so freaking hot that it's worth going to her class just to see her conduct :-D That being said, she's a hard ass with no emphasis on music. . it's all pitches. . no music at all :-(

Not much to say to her, the class is pretty easy, all u have to be there to get an A and not ever be absent more then 3 times  i believe, she's an okay teacher, didnt talk to her much, she was alrite i guess

I agree with the comments above; she is not helpful or considerate at all, especially if you're not a music major. She might seem nice and even funny at first, but when you deal with her one-on-one she is very rude, has no manners... she just doesn't care about her students.
Dr. Andaya has resurected a dead entity, bringing UGA's Chorus back to the levels of high recognition. Thanks to Dr. A- for coming to GA and shedding light on all she encounters.

Dr. Andaya may seem cool, but trust me, she doesn't care about her students. If you aren't a voice nerd, then she doesn't care about you. She has been absolutely rude and unsympathetic to me on several occasions, I wish I didn't have to take this damn class.
Thinks Chorus is the only class her students are taking and doesn't care to help them out at all.
Dr. Andaya is a wonderful instructor, and I really enjoyed taking this class.  I wish all of my professors were as knowledgeable and enthusiastic as she is.
Basically, you don't do anything all semester. Then she pulls out a final from hell and screws you over! Be warned!
Class was useless. Do not recommend it. It was boring and a waste of time.

Mrs. Glauser is an extremely nice teacher with a kind heart, but I did not really learn much in the class, and it was pointless. We only had one test which was multiple choice and difficult but the final was all essays that we made up in class. Need the book for worksheets. Other assignments were very easy. Not an easy A but not impossible.
Perhaps the biggest waste of time ever. I learned absolutely nothing from this seminar. The material is dry and useless. Be warned.

Dr. Glauser is a great teacher! Make sure to attend class and actively participate. It helps to get to know her by sitting in the front or asking for help outside of class. She really cares about her students. The class is an easy A, as long as you are willing to do the work.
ughh.... shes annoying.. thats all there is to it
Dr. Glauser was an extremely nice and helpful professor. As long as you do your work and have it on time this class should be an easy A.
She is an awesome teacher, very nice, very helpful with classes (even other than her own)

By far the rudest professor I have ever had at UGA. Never taught in a real classroom yet is teaching you how to be a "better" teacher. Unclear on assignments, refuses to answer questions if she thinks you should know the information. Will embarrass her students and hold a grudge for the semester. Unorganized and frankly will teach you nothing.

Professor Wilder was an amazing professor! She really cares about her students and wants us all to do well in the class. She uses PowerPoint that you will take notes from, a small book that you read each night for homework, and one group project. The project is presenting a book chapter. Her tests are online and the final is just another test.

Worst professor I have ever had. Do not expect help or tests that are based off of lectures nor general parts of the reading. Do not take this class. It will make for a miserable and stressful semester.

Dr. Wilder is an okay professor. She knows her subject but her people skills are lacking. If you complain about her tests too much she will change them into a lot harder than they should be. And she can make snarky comments about students during class. She is strict on having your book and syllabus for every class. If you do the work you pass.

Wilder is the absolute WORST professor I've ever had... Yes, she's knowledgable of the content she teaches, but she's horrible at staying on topic, and is HIGHLY opinionated and rude. If she doesn't like you, she won't grade fairly, and even if she does, she still doesn't grade fairly. Avoid this professor, please.

Worst professor I have ever had. I am obsessed with early childhood education and she has made me completely second guess what I want to do with my life. She is so un-motivating, and she basically told us that we will never become adequate teachers. She is the source of my entire semester's worth of stress, and I am SO glad to be done with her.

She is  one of the worst professors I have ever had. She picks favorites in her class and bases EVERYTHING on attendance and participation. Her grading policy is very unclear and she has no problem with being completely rude and making her students feel stupid. You have to agree with everything she says to get a good grade. Do NOT take her class.

Wilder is the rudest professor I have taken. She is unorganized and never able to tell you what she wants exactly. Attendance is mandatory and graded upon that, as well as how much she likes you. i would suggest getting another teacher or waiting for one another professor.

Dr. Wilder was a terrible teacher. She is normally a doctoral teacher so she is extremely hard with her "grading system". She bases EVERYTHING on attendance. I missed class because I was sick and she didn't care. Did all the work and she didn't care. Not clear on anything. Won't hesitate to fuss you out either. Do not not not take her.

Dr. Wilder bases much of her grading on whether she likes you or not.  Her instructions are vague and she seems to change her mind on the assignment once you have turned it in.  I would not recommend taking her courses if you do not have to.

This teacher is one that i would recommend not getting. She based everything on attendance, and although that was the only true grade given throughout the semester, it seemed to me like a big waste of time. If you are looking for a class to just fill space, that would be the only reason to take her.

Dr. Wilder is one of the best teachers I have had at UGA so far. She normally only teaches grad school and doctoral students, but I was lucky enough to have her. Although we never really covered anything specific, I learned a lot about teaching from her.

Professor Amoss is awesome! I was not interested in art at all but he make it interesting. He's a funny guy and his class is not hard whatsoever, just make sure you go to class because attendance is mandatory. No test, strickly quizzes (15 quest each) would take again in a heartbeat.
FANTASTIC TEACHER!!! SUCH A NICE GUY, I WISH HE WERE STAYING;(
very good and fun teacher.

I think she may have been going through some stuff in her personal life when I had her, but she was absolutely crazy! I learned absolutely nothing in the class, and she never gave me constructive criticism on my pieces. I hated this class!

Jenn was the nicest teacher I had this semester. You need to go to class or else you'll miss a lot, but she was very lenient with students being late. She's a great teacher, and I learned so much from her. She's always willing to help in or out of class. I didn't use my book at all, though. I would take another class from her.
The projects are very interesting and the class isn't boring often.   I don't think she's too demanding and she's very nice.  Easy to get a good grade if you produce good quality work.
He made the subject interesting and fun.  He was more than generous with his tests and help if you need it.

He is a fun professor and easy to get along with! You don't use a book, he takes the time to find suitable course material for the class to use.OWL Purdue will be your friend. He happily goes over all your work and encourages visits during office hours (take advantage of this!). I will take him again in the future.
super cool dude, he has a awesome pet eagle he brings to class every once in awhile.  Probably one of the best teachers ever.
Great Prof. #1 recommendation!

Wonderful class! Quizzes are easy so long as you actually read the material, & I felt he graded the essays fairly, as well as providing ample help. Relaxed environment, fair amount of work, and interesting books.
really great teacher and great class.

It's not terribly difficult, although it is a lot of work.Pearson is funny and entertaining.If you do all the work and do well, then around finals time, you'll have to do virtually nothing!Great class!You become anaytical and appreciate literature in a way you may not have known.It's nothing like ENGL 1101-1102!

Easy B! All you have to do is read and show up and you will make a B. He is really funny too! He understands if stuff happens. Lots of papers but he explains everything and you have a chance to revise. Also gives out extra points just for turning stuff in! I highly recommend!

A lot of reading, but easy as breathing. All you have to do is read, write the simple papers, and be there for quizes. Very, very easy to make an A if you have no problem reading. He is a fun teacher, and grades very fairly.

this class is not that hard but it's a ton of work. way too much if you ask me, he has all of these papers due all around the same time and no matter what he says about your essays he will grade them just as tough as a normal paper. oh and his grading system for the quizzes suck. easy B, hard A. interesting books though, not boring reads!

I took a course where she came in every now and then to give her two cents worth. She definably knows what she is talking about, but has a terrible personality. She interrupts everyone and corrects in a way the is more destructive than instructive. Did not like her. At all.
Horrible professor, horrible tester.
I hated this woman. She does know her stuff but is boring as hell and a pain in the ass to meet personally. Kind of a "I'm smarter than you and I know it" attitude.

She knows her stuff incredibly well, but it's frustrating to have every single class be exactly the same, especially in an honors course.  I learned the material, because I studied my butt off, but come test time if you make the slightest error she counts off an incredible amount of points.  My grade does not reflect my ability because the grading

Dr. Darvill is one of the best professors at UGA. Super knowledgeable and successful and just wants everyone to succeed in his class. Go to class, take good notes, and read the textbook and you should be able to do pretty decently on the tests. The tests are typically four long answer questions but they may have multiple parts.
An amazing professor! He really cares about his students. If you are considering taking honors bio 1 with him, do it! I paid attention in class and studied my notes and passed both of his tests.

Dr. Darvill is amazing! Class consists of power point lectures. He moves very fast to get through all the material, but it is pretty much word for word from the text book. His tests are short answer and somewhat challenging but very manageable. Would definitely recommend this class over regular BIOL 1107.

Dr. Darvill is awesome! There is 4 tests in the class and that makes up your grade. His tests are all short answer, but they are pretty broad questions so you can show what you know. He definitely knows his stuff and is a caring professor!

He is really cool. His voice has an English accent and is very calming, which did make it somewhat hard to pay attention. The tests are only on his slides, but they can be a bit vague and open ended. Only about 5-6 questions, each worth ton of points. He is extremely nice and goes around to talk to us before class. Really good guy.

Dr. Darvill is without a doubt the sexiest man around Georgia. I'm not gay, but I would be for this man. If you take this class and don't develop a massive amount of respect for glycoproteins and carbohydrates, then you're doing it wrong. And by it, I mean life. The end.

I am absolutely, utterly in love with Dr. Darvill. His accent is incredible and makes the course work even more interesting than it already is. TAKE THIS CLASS; changed my life. Made me fall in love with glycoproteins and complex carbs.

He has a cool accent, but the material is super boring. I struggled to pay attention in class and didn't put forth much effort. I wish I would have because I didn't do well on the first test, but did well on the rest and my grade wasn't where I wanted it to be.
Dr. Darvill is absolutely amazing! I loved his class and lectures! He's also very helpful if you need help outside of class.
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment_Rating: Dr. Darvill is awesome and he has a great British accent.  He really knows the material, and you need to understand it to do well on the tests.  If you go to lecture and read along in the book, you will do fine.  Really try to understand the material to do well.  I would highly recommend him! He is funny and REALLY knowledgeable.
ratingTags_Rating: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment_Rating: No attendance but notes aren't on eLC so you have to come to class to get them. Moves fast through slides but he knows that and you can just ask him to slow down. Slightly more boring than Burke and material was harder, but what you needed to know for tests was straightforward. I didn't use the textbook but some people thought it helped.
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment_Rating: Dr. Darvill genuinely cares about his students. He's a really big deal in research (Google him) but doesn't name drop. He definitely knows what he's talking about and can tie it into the real world. Tests are hard as the TA grades short answers for key words (so write everything you know). He tests only on his PowerPoints (the book isn't essential)
He is a really nice guy. If you go to lectures and study and UNDERSTAND the material, you'll do well on the tests. Don't underestimate the tests, but just know that they aren't hard.

His British accent is hilarious. Only memorize structures for 3 different amino acids, not all of the structures he tells you to for the first test - that'll save you a lot of time. Our TA (Ethan) graded very generously. Def. better option than regular bio. I went to class, but you could just read the book if needed. He breezes thru slides
My favorite teacher at UGA so far!

Knows his stuff, but it gets pretty boring when he teaches with diagrams straight from the book.  It was almost unnecessary to go to class unless you didn't understand the reading, because he just summarizes everything.  Great guy who is really nice!!

Very nice man, and lenient. The subject is dry, but as long as you do the readings (and actually understand them!) you'll be good. He tends to skip attendance sometimes and usually tells you when you'll have a pop quiz. Cool dude.

He is a very nice man, but his focus on Russian Literature was not interesting for me.  Do go to class and do the readings cause there are pop quizzes on the readings.  He does drop your lowest.  He absolutely loves his topic, and you'll miss funny remarks if you're not paying attention.  Always talk to him bout your paper, it will be so helpful
Easy teacher!! If go you to office hours and write "okay" papers, then you will definitely get a B, if not an A.

Awesome teacher, I would definitely recommend to anyone.  If you want to learn from the class you can learn ALOT from him.  If you could careless about English, you can still make an A if you can write halfway decent.

Easy class. Attendence would not be neccessary, but he does take attendence. Go get help on papers, he will tell you everything you need to do. Class doesn't have much to do with what you write about, there is total freedom to write about whatever. TAKE THIS CLASS!

>>HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!<< He's a very very nice guy! Go to his office hours! He will critique your whole paper - pretty much a guaranteed A if you do what he suggests. Very good English teacher. You NEED to get into his class! I got an A
Best Engl professor you can find. He is extremely helpful when it comes to giving advices on your papers.
Class was fun and easy. Professor McGinn is a fairly easy grader. Participate in class, show effort and go to office hours with a rough draft of your paper and you'll do fine.
i really enjoyed going to class. he is extremely funny and easy to get along with.  the reading material in interesting and he is very intellegent
McGinn is a very nice guy and is very easy to talk to. He will give you help when you need it. I recommend him.

He's grades a little hard on essays, but is pretty easy when with participation.  As long as he knows you're trying you'll get an A for participation.  I recommend trying to find another professor, but he's not horrible if there's no other option.  Seems to like students who participate the best and gives them the best grades, so make sure to read

Very good teacher. 20% of grade is participation and you don't even have to talk in class, you can post things on Webct. Gives interesting readings and doesn't grade ridiculously on papers. Take this guy- he's fabulous! :)

He's incredibly helpful and he really makes an effort to pick interesting works to read.  He really makes it easy to participate, so if you read the works and go to class, you'll do great in the class.  He'll even throw in a couple of movies to break up the readings!  He's awesome!
He's great, what more can I say.

He's genuinely so thoughtful and understanding. He cares deeply about his students and about the class he's teaching. No matter what the subject matter, he makes it interesting. Very clear about class expectations and day-by-day assignments and schedules. Would definitely take again!
Callahan is easily one of the best professors at UGA. He is so kind and caring and genuinely wants all of his students to succeed.
I loved Mark so much! He was so kind and accommodating and is the kind of professor that learns and remembers your name. Would absolutely take him again.

Mark always interprets/dovetails/elaborates on student responses--he's a thoughtful listener and facilitator. There are 2 or 3 weeks of lecture, but much of the learning is discussion-based. The course is like an Net Art/history sampler tray--lots of glimpses into the larger history, but not many deep dives. Made me want to study the topic further.

Mark is an acquired taste, but once you get used to his teaching style he's wonderful. This class wasn't focused on projects but heavy on lecture/readings/discussion, though always very interesting and generative. I had zero expectations for Net Art going in and left feeling like I'd been exposed to a completely new outlook on art and society.
I loved this class. Mark is incredibly smart and wonderful to listen to during lectures. I've never heard somewhat talk about the internet the way he does. Take his classes! You won't be sorry!

I recommend this class to anyone interested in learning the basics about photoshop, illustrator, flash, and html. He is flexible to help students no matter what level they are at or what project they are working on. He's nice, smart, interesting, and helpful. Why can't all professors be so normal?

His tests are pretty hard, but he curves rather generously.  His grade cut-offs are higher than average, which may cause some stress. I never attended class, because he taught the book verbatim, but I would suggest going anyway, as one may miss out on what he thinks is important. In past classes with him, however, he did not teach from the book.

Fertig is a good teacher. He makes class fun and interesting. Class is not mandatory except for the clicker questions which are ridiculously easy. We did have a lot of reading and online homework (A LOT) but you will actually learn the material, unlike the class who had Geller (including my roommate). Tests are curved heavily and not that bad.

it was easier than trig based and the workload was nothing. the homework answers can be found using google because the same program is used through out the country. go to class cuz participation is a big part of ur grade. tests werent bad just pay attn in class. he made our final 100% of our grade if it helped you

Fertig is a good teacher and really tried to  make sure everyone understood. Their was alot of different HWS due and i had tons if hw from Mastering Physics on the internet. I spent many hours doing it. You have to be self motivated because he doesn't realy teach the info you have to read. The tests weren't bad. The hws were really hard. Do the HW.

Not THAT bad.  Class is sometimes boring but he's VERY helpful with his office hours. Online homework is from one of two books and not that bad. My favorite thing about him though is the HUGE partial credit and curves he gives on tests. If you don't know how to do a problem, just write random stuff and you'll get partial credit.
Can't understand anything

I am currently a 3rd year, and he's the BEST professor I've ever had. EXTREMELY articulate and EASY to understand. I had trouble in high school physics, but ended up with a 95.7 in the class. AWESOME professor from STANFORD and YALE!!! W00T!

Fertig is a very very smart man.  He went to Stanford and Yale, which you can tell when he start's teaching.  But his method to teach it is difficult to understand.  I was so confused, and going to his office hours only helped out somewhat.  Test problems are completely different than what you run into on the homework probs in the book. Huge curve.

I never had physics before and suffered miserably for it. YOu really need to either know physics already or devote a lot of time to learning it. YOu aren't taught phys in class, just concepts and very few examples. Fertig is awesome but it's a tough course to learn in.

Fertig has difficulty relating the material that he knows to the class.  Obviously a bright man, not necessarily the best professor.  Given that, his grading system is redicuolously easy - MASSIVE CURVE.  Still, it would be a good idea to have a physics background if youre going to take this class.

Greenman is a good professor, but he's long winded and likes the sound of his own voice. Loves to waste time writing all over the board  and making pointless analysis that don't lead to anything at all. He's passionate, but doesn't understand what is important and what's not. He reminds me of a grandfather blabbering on and on about god knows what.

I took Greenman for entrepreneurial jour, and he was one of the kindest and most helpful people I've ever met. He would send me emails about things I was interested in just because, and was extremely encouraging. You can tell this man has true jour passion. He gives students tons of freedom and teaches with experience instead of just lecture.

He is so kind and willing to help. He never puts anyone down, even when they're dead wrong. Pretty much spells out how to make a good grade. Variety of teaching tactics- lectures, group work, papers, exercises. No tests but much reading. Attendance is not required, but the first few weeks involve in-class exercises that you won't want to miss.
Greenman is awesome.  The class itself is pretty simple & entertaining/interesting.  If you follow the guidelines he gives you, you will excel.  Very willing to work with students.

One of the best journalism professors you could ask for.  I've taken two classes with him.  He offers real-world knowledge and is willing to help you with anything!  If you're a serious journalism student, he's a must-take!  I love Dr. Greenman!
he's a very helpful teacher.  explains everything in detail and is very passionate about his topics of discussion

Best GRMN teacher I have had so far at UGA, he makes topics more interesting and it was a special topics course he has awesome discussions/speakers/events to go to. The tests are easy and come straight from homework/discussion, minimal homework and 2 papers (2 pgs). I enjoyed this class, I would take another special topics if he offered it!
Kagel is AWESOME!  Encouraging and intelligent and sort of a difficult teacher.  But in a good way.  I wish I had way more classes with him.
He's very difficult, but such a great teacher.  I wouldn't recommend taking him multiple semesters in a row, but you should definitely have him as a teacher at some point.

Professor Kagel is an excellent teacher.  He does a good job of promoting discussion and clarifying any questions you may have, whether it's grammar or culture.  He's open to talk outside of class if needed, too.
horrible
He is very interesting, he likes to make a lot of jokes during class.
Oh Steve, he goes on a lot of random rants but they are pretty interesting. He is really nice but sometimes what he does doesn't make a lot since. Go to office hours and he is super nice.
Hard to follow in class, great for office help.
Should teach highschool except for the outrageous side conversations.
Should teach highschool.

A great person, just not the best teacher. I'm sure many students enjoy him, but for myself and several others in my class, we did not mesh. I came into this class never receiving below an A in any math class and I came out of here with a C after studying by butt off all year. He is very thorough and will help you after class,but he is just unclear

Very honest and funny, you can tell he's a real person teaching the class as opposed to some "robotic lecturer." Sometimes he gets a little carried away with personal stories and distractions, but it only makes what would normally be a boring class actually enjoyable. He loves getting to know all his students too. He's awesome

Steve is WONDERFUL! If you have the opportunity to take his class you definitely should. He can be a little ADD at times but charming nonetheless. He is probably the most helpful teacher I've come across in my three years here.

He tries to be clear, but calculus is just tough for most people. If you have a class right after his, you'll be at a disadvantage when it comes to quizzes. He gives them at the end of class and will stick around as long as you need to help you (like up to 45 minutes late), but if you can't stay, then you're screwed. Others get help, but you can't.
i loved this class! i usually hate math but he made the class interesting! very funny teacher. i definately recommend him!!!!

Steve's great! He tends to write a lot of notes, but you only need to take down the main points. Go to class, do your [easy] homework, and study a little before the test and you'll easily make a B, if not an A. He cares about his students, has a great sense of humor, and will make an effort to help you out if you need it!
If you need calculus to graduate, then take Steve, go to class, do the homework, and pass. Great teacher!

Steve is an amazing teacher. I hadn't taken math in 3 years, and I was able to understand concepts and get a b+ by going to class, doing the homework, and getting some tutoring on the side. He really cares about his students, is available almost everyday for office hours, makes math fun! and gives credit for effort. TAKE HIM!!!! You won't regret it

Steve made calculus rather fun in a way. His tests are difficult but always fair. He always finds ways to give us credit. He also has a lot of office hours. Probably one of the coolest math teachers on campus.
probably the coolest guy i ever met. awesome teacher, i still go get help from him even though i am not in his class anymore. winburn rocks.
Great teacher and a really cool and funny person!
great teacher and so cute
I like him.  He's funny.
Nice guy, not a very good teacher though. The ratings were very one sided
No Comments

Great guy... doesn't mind explaining things 83523 times for deaf and/or dense individuals. Makes sure you get an A in class, lets you work ahead and then skip class if you do it right. Totally nuts or totally funny ... not sure which... but definitely totally THE BEST.
The best pre-calc teacher, compared to what I've heard from other people about their professors. I mean, come on, he posts homework and quiz dates on Facebook.

Take him if you can.  He'll pretty much give you an A if you turn in all of your projects.  He's very funny and always cracks jokes.  Though many times the projects you do will be hard, he will help you with them.
He is the best teacher.  The work is fair and he is willing to help. He is good in explaining projects.
Dude, he rocks, the end.

He is really great...really easy...really funny...really nice... knows a lot about calculus and can explain it. And he likes to talk about Desperate Housewives and Grey's Anatomy. Who wouldn't love him?
Awesome teacher.  He gets sidetracked a lot, but he knows a lot of math.  Good luck studying for that prelim.  -PB
Fantastic professor, taught me everything i know about quantum hydraulics and thermodynamics. a real blessing.
Keenum was awesome!  What a cool guy!  I recommend him to anyone looking to take calculus!
Keenum is a great teacher.  He is willing to help anyone who needs extra help, and he is VERY patient.

Keenum...what can I say?!  DON'T TAKE HIM!! He is extremely difficult...his exams are ridiculously hard!
