If he is the only teacher available to teach Calc...put it off till another semester...trust me, that will save you the heartache AND YOUR GPA!!!That class in comparison to others is way difficult...we have 2 memorize things others didn't...!!!

So laid back. We did not have to attend lab unless a project is due. When we attended, we were out within 20 minutes. We were only there long enough to turn it in, and find out what our next assignment was. We never had to write lab reports, or do an entire project. We had 2 to 3 weeks to do projects that usually took less than an hour to complete.
it's impossible to pass his test or quizzes.
his test are ridiculous.  DON"T TAKE HIM!  He's brilliant and knows his stuff, but he's just way too hard.

Keenum is a VERY DIFFICULT teacher!  Dont get me wrong, he teaches in a very organized manner,but when it comes to his exams, it is impossible.  He requires his students to learn for his exams what most other professors don't.  If at all possible, avoid his class by all means!  Trust me, you will save both your GPA and your life!!! Im so serious!

so he is a nice guy and all, but his tests suck. he explains it the best he can, but gives impossible tests and quizzes. grades VERY VERY VERY unfairly, and thinks everyone can do it because he thinks everyone is a math major. WRONG! great 2200 lab teacher though...very laid back!
very good lab instructor, veryyyyyyyy laid back and kind. Not there to make you suffer.

I found him very engaging. I did know the topic matter a little before going in, so that might have helped. But I found him to be extremely helpful there was something I did not understand. Personally I would recommend him as a teacher. He makes the subject fun and interesting.

If you know how to write a decent paper you can easily get an A. He is a pretty chill and mildly funny guy. Overall I think college english is a waste of time, but since you have to take it I would recommend him. He isnt the best teacher for improving your writing skills, but keeps the class entertaining. He generally doesnt teach the whole period.

One word: AMAZING. He is EXTREMELY nice! He looks like Adam Sandler! And he's just as funny too! If you can get him, GET HIM. He's very lenient and understanding. Let's you do whatever poem you want to even if he didn't assign it. VERY helpful. Sooooo nice. Easy to relate to. SOOOO COOL!!!!

He is not funny nor interesting. I spent the entire class wondering why I was wasting my college career in this pointless class watching youtube. I had never gotten anything lower than an A and due to his poor teaching methods recieved a B+ in his class. You can take him and be ok, but there are better/more interesting teachers for English out ther

Grubbs is THE BEST! Go to the conferences as much as posssible, they will help your grade. Ask him anything. Go to class, but if you miss a few it doesn't matter at all. He's really nice. And HILARIOUS. AND AWESOME. TAKE HIS CLASS, end of story.
One word: Awesome.

Had him for 1102M. Definately one of my favorite teachers. He reminds me of Adam Sandler (looks and humor). He chose interesting stories to read and he was thorough in his explanations. He's very leaniant to let you write about any story in the book whether assigned in class or not.
Mr. Grubbs is awesome. A really nice guy, who is super understanding and not to mention funny. HE often will let you leave early if you even have class. GET HIM!

Mr. Grubbs is a great TA to get for 1101. The class is great. When you have an essay due you usually don't have class. He only makes you write 3 essays and the portfolio instead of 4. He helps you out with the essays whhen you need it. Not hard at all I would definitly recommend him! I'm taking him for 1102 next semester!

A nice and funny guy. He's realistic about the idiotic constraints of 1102 and treats them as they should be. You have class for about 20 minutes a day, he'll vigorously help you work through your paper outside of class, and typically he's an easy grader. This is not to say you can walk all over him but he's a lot better than any other 1102 teacher
i had him for both engl1101 and 1102 and i thoroughly enjoyed him. he is helpful in his feedback on essays and a very lenient grader. i recommend taking him.

Very enjoyable class. Classes rarely last the entire 50 minutes. Professor is very laid back and funny, but kind of nerdy. However, he is very helpful in the essays he assigns. Go to the conferences! They helped me out so much! If he is available, take his class. You won't regret it.

Very easy going and understanding. Classes usually last about 20 mins. so you don't have to worry about sitting in the room bored the entire time. When he runs out of things to say he lets you go. Fairly easy when grading your essays.

Grades papers pretty easily. He's a Grad Student so he knows that most people don't care about English 1101 and 1102, so he makes it as painless as possible.  Doesn't keep you in class longer than he has to.  Most of the time we were out within 15 minutes.  Good class to have, easy A

Grubbs was an awesome teacher. He made the lectures interesting and he knew his stuff. He was willing to answer any questions we had and enjoyed his job. He also lets class out early a lot. Take him- he's great!

Professor Grubbs is an excellent teacher who is passionate about what he is teaching. He was always willing to answer any questions we had. He made learning fun and class went by fast because of his enthusiasm.
No Comments

She has turned an enjoyable subject into a nightmare of a class. If you want to learn about the classic mythological stories, just buy The Odyssey and Metamorphoses and read them. Don't waste your time fulfilling a literature credit with her. She is unclear in every instruction she gives and has unrealistic expectations of a 1000 level class.

Workload is INSANE! professor expects way too much from a 1000 level class! there is no structure to class lectures and she hardly covers the topics she tests on. the final project is ridiculously hard and does not apply to the rest of the class, its just a waste of time. tests are also difficult and no matter how hard you try, you wont get an A.
ratingTags_Rating: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment_Rating: If you don't like to read and you don't already know myth stories, do not take this class. There is an intense amount of reading required to do well in this class because the professor just blows through the stories once then you wont hear about them until it's on the test. The stories are so detailed and she expects you to know it all.
ratingTags_Rating: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment_Rating: While this class requires a good amount reading, she is clear in her expectations. Doing the reading & contributing minimally in this class will get you a good grade. She can be a tough grader, admitted it herself. Her passion & knowledge makes this class really enjoyable, especially since most stories are interesting. Just pay attention.
ratingTags_Rating: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational

comment_Rating: The majority is reading myths and history so you'll have to buy/rent several books. If you don't read the books she'll summarize them and give important details. If you never read but come to class you can still pass. She also tells the stories very well and will occasionally ask questions about the story to the class.
ratingTags_Rating: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment_Rating: This class was a lot more difficult than it needed to be because the professor was unapproachable and she is a perfectionist when it comes to latin. If you translate a single word wrong- she will tell you you don't respect the language and make you cry. Her lectures were her yelling at us that we did not understand the language.. take someone else.

She thinks everyone is a Latin major (not). Not approachable, berates you when you are wrong or don't answer fast enough. Assigns 3+passages for hw every day+ usually 3 take home quizzes and expects you to have it all done. Never posts any grades. If she thinks your test translation was that bad, she doesn't finish reading it and gives you an F.

If you miss class, you miss a quiz. Thats not too serious though; we were only allowed to miss 4 classes & I missed 7 (which means seven 0s) and still got an A in the class. So much homework she expects you to come with the topic learned & shell go over hmwk in class. She will be very mean if people dont answer her so speak up & dont be wrong
ratingTags_Rating: Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment_Rating: She doesn't put any grades on eLc. I asked for a list of recommended private tutors from her and didn't get any. She acts like everyone is a Latin major and expects everyone to understand, know, and love Latin. Try to take a different teacher if possible.

Shes really caring and willing to work with students, but shes also a hard teacher. You teach yourself for the most part and all you do in class is go over homework (which is a substantial amount). Out of all my classes I had to spend the most time outside of class on this one.
ratingTags_Rating: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment_Rating: Professor Bianchelli is great, and if you're into Classics, is a good bridge to get into higher courses. I did the Rome study abroad with her and I highly recommend it. Bianchelli is very very nice and caring, and is overall a great lecturer and teacher, however you are graded by few things so you need to go to class!
ratingTags_Rating: Gives good feedback--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Caring

comment_Rating: Bianchelli's class usually have a ton of readings but if you follow along in class and read the sparknotes before, you'll do fine. There are weekly quizzes but they're pretty basic and she drops your lowest two. You have two test, two projects, and a final. Test are very straight forward. Projects are a little difficult but she's wiling to help you
ratingTags_Rating: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment_Rating: Dr. Bianchelli is one of my favorite professors I've had. As long as you read the material you should definitely good. She likes for people to participate in class discussions and that is a part of your grade. Only cons are she has a pretty thick Italian accent that can make it hard to understand her and sometimes it is hard to know your grade.

Professor Bianchelli is a very nice, very passionate instructor. She loves what she teaches. However, she'll often go off topic and sometimes it's difficult to follow what we'll need to know. The class is by no means easy, and there is A TON of reading + the exams are hard. You will have a lot of studying for this class.
ratingTags_Rating: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment_Rating: Dr. Bianchelli is an extremly passionate and informative teacher. Her lectures can sometimes be a bit boring, but overall super interesting class. There are only two tests, one project, and one final so make sure to not blow off studying for those exams.

Dr. Bianchelli is a passionate professor who knows every detail of what she is teaching. She goes off on tangents often and you never really know what you should know until you've taken a test. GET READY TO READ. It's not just something you can skip to do well. If you do read though, it should be an easy A. Tests require a lot of studying as well.

You can that Bianchelli loves what she teaches. She assigns a fair amount  of reading each week, but the information she gives during her lectures is more important. The weekly quizzes are easy if you pay attention in class,  but her tests do require a bit of studying.

She is extremely passionate about all things Roman culture, and has lots of interesting facts and side stories to liven up her lectures. She likes to focus a lot on the art of the time periods covered, so be sure to pay attention to what she seems to give special attention to and make sure you can explain its significance for the tests. Take her!

Bianchelli is a very sweet lady and is extremely passionate about Roman Culture. In class she often goes on tangents about random stories rather than teaching what actually ends up on the tests. You have to teach yourself the history and there is a lot of reading. If you ware willing to put in a lot of time studying you are guaranteed an A.

Bianchelli was very knowledgeable on what she was teaching, but you could hardly understand a word she was saying her accent was so thick. Tests were pretty easy, provided you constantly took notes on basically every word from every lecture. The semester-long project where you catalogue art was extremely time-consuming and difficult.

Dr. Bianchelli is a very sweet woman who knows her mythology, but her Italian accent makes her slightly unclear at times. She spends class time telling stories and discussing pictures, which is not the bulk of the tests. The final was two papers totaling 3,000 words and was very tedious. Would recommend taking if you have previous myth background.

While Dr. Bianchelli has an accent, you get used to it after the first couple days. She loves teaching about mythology and gets very excited about the subject. Only 2 tests, but weekly quizzes based on the reading that are super easy if you actually read. No homework, except for 2 projects that do not take much time.

Bianchelli makes you teach yourself and LATN 2001 is all translation. Class time is spent going over the translations of the homework. Tests are pretty difficult and super long. It's hard to finish the tests in time. She also tests you over things you did not go over in class. However, she's a pretty easy grader. She assigns SO much homework.

Dr. Bianchelli is super adorable and a magnificent professor! She does have an accent, but she's not really that hard to understand. Just talking with her will brighten your day! She does give a lot of reading, but you'll learn so many interesting things in her class. Definitely take her any chance you get! She is my absolute favorite professor!
Do not take her for latin 2001, She is awful. Worst professor I have had at UGA

Professor Bianchelli has an accent so if you can't pay attention well with those this might not be a good class. We have breakout sessions every friday in which you take a "pop quiz" that they tell you about. The breakout session teachers are extremely helpful and as long as you read the text the pop quizzes are self explanatory as are the tests

Do not take this class if you are not willing to read. It is A LOT of reading. However, Dr. Bianchelli is really passionate about the subject matter and she makes the class as easy as possible - if you read. Also, she really loves people who participate and attending class is important because a lot of information on the exams come from lecture.

She is a great professor but her mythology class demands A LOT of reading. Weekly quizzes could be based off a few chapters from a book in addition to side stories. She is very passionate in her subject and is willing to help. Be ready for a lot of memorization and Sparknotes.

Dr. Bianchelli is a sweet person. At first, it was difficult to understand her accent but you get used to it. She uses top hat for attendance. She lectures and the TA's do the rest. They give us our weekly quizzes and etc. It's easy if you read the assigned readings.  Bianchelli's very enthusiastic about the subject.

I would recommend Dr Bianchelli to anyone who prefers to teach themselves. She is nice and enthusiastic about her subject. However she isn't the best at teaching new concepts, and I relied heavily on the department's tutors. The workload was also crazy at times, and most students had to turn to answers online to keep up.

She has a pretty thick accent and her voice doesn't carry well, but being a front-row student I found here to be a pretty solid teacher. She definitely knew what she was talking about and tried to keep things interesting with references to modern film adaptations etc. Also, the class is pretty weasy as long as you do the reading.

Prof. Bianchelli is a confusing woman. She is never clear about what she is looking for in papers, and she grades based off her own opinions when you disagree with her in an essay. She is very passionate about the subject and readings which made them interesting. Would not recommend.

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS. The work load is overwhelming for a 1000 level class. Even if you pay attention, read the text book and read the books assigned it is still difficult to get an A. She has no concept of the amount of work that is assigned. Although she is flexible with deadlines, there is no consideration of the extreme work load.

I adore this woman! Dr. Bianchelli really cares.  She can be slightly difficult to understand with her accent, but after about a class you'll be used to it.  Papers are very easy.  3 tests, all general knowledge.  Easy quizzes every Friday, so just read the myths (or summaries of them) and you'll be fine.  This was an easy and very enjoyable class!

I took this class with the intention of getting an overview of Classical mythology, and that's exactly what I got. I felt enriched and inspired by the material. And Dr. Bianchelli was fantastic; she was incredibly sweet and frequently went out of her way for her students. I could not have asked for anything more. Favorite class of the semester!

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS! I could not understand a word she said. She just talks and has powerpoints with pictures on them and no information. She talks about whatever she feels like and has no direction or no outline of how she is going through the material. The test was not to hard but I had no idea what to study to do well on it. I had to drop!

Dont take her.You can not understand her.She changes the syllabus at the end of the semester. I got a B on most test but she got pissed I did so well without doing the hw or participating so she changed syllabus at the end of year to include participation,didnt let me retake a test even though i had a doctors note,original syllabus said you could.

She's wonderful to outgoing people, I suppose, but being very shy and not raising my hand for every question, she assumed I didn't do my homework. Nowhere on her syllabus does it state that she factors participation into grading, but at the end of the year she explicitly told me my grade would be lowered because of it. I don't recommend her at all.

She clearly knows a lot about mythology, but this class is painfully boring. She lectures what's in the book, but if you want to get higher than a C on tests, you MUST read the textbook and pay close attention to detail. If you aren't already interested in mythology, don't take this class. Quizes every Friday, two tests, a paper (3pg) and a final.

This class was interesting and extremely easy! 3 exams and a research paper(3-5pp,did my research night before it was due,got an A.) Her lectures aren't exactly linear, but the TA did a great job of clearing things up(Yeah Ludi!) Just read the myths she covers and skim the actual chapters, and you will do fine. If you didn't make an A, you a fool!

Class should have been easy, but I couldn't follow her lectures at all. She can be hard to understand and she doesn't use ppts, just rambles and often gets sidetracked. To me, the class was not worth the effort I had to put in to practically self-study, even though the info was interesting. Take another teacher, in my opinion.

Dr. Bianchelli seemed very passionate about Mythology but she was sometimes difficult to understand. She does not use notes when she lectures, so she often bounced around as new thoughts popped into her head. Her slides with artwork were basically useless unless they showed up as bonus on tests. Honestly, I'd recommend another teacher and class.
She isn't interesting.  There.. I said it.  I'm a history major, so I like some of this stuff, but dang, her class is soul-crushingly dull.  Very easy, but I would say that it isn't worth it.

Very very interesting class! Overall a pretty good teacher and a very down-to-earth person. Her lectures were engaging and she used artwork to break up the monotony of the lectures. She was clearly knowledgeable and passionate about mythology, but did ramble a little too much at times. Only 3 tests and a research paper. Go to class and read because

She is very nice. It's hard not to like her. :) I don't love Latin, so I was bound to hate the class no matter what. But she is very helpful with students who struggle. For those who don't enjoy the subject, take her class. Her positive energy helps.

Nice, very passionate about the subject, but unclear when it came to tests. She goes off on tangents during class that make you think they'll be on the tests-sometimes they are, sometimes not. She'll have random questions about readings that she never once mentioned. class has a curve though. Might give extra credit if you ask, probably not though.

Professor Bianchelli is a great professor who is immensely passionate about her subject area and it shows through in her teaching and made Roman Culture very interesting. There was some outside reading, but tests were mainly over what she talked about in class.

She's very passionate about Roman history- the class is very interesting. It was hard to understand her sometimes because of her accent, but she wants to help you understand and learn the culture. I took notes from what she said verbatim and got an A from reading what was assigned and studying. There's a PPT presentation, 3 quizzes, midterm, final.

Outstanding instructor... of all my Latin professors, she was the one that was able to impart the subject best, even to sleepy students.  Very animated... it is her personal mission to teach you Latin!

She is very excited about Latin. She emphasizes pronunciation and reading with meter. The tests were translating her adaptations of what we read in class. If you come to class prepared, you'll be on her good side, and you shouldn't have a problem. Nice prof and good teacher.
Very interesting class!

She thinks we're some type of machines that can memorize everything, every single detail in the book, and her tests are really hard. She can grade harshly or leniently, which I don't like because you never know what mood she'll be in. It was hard to pass the class but she was kind of helpful.

Sra. Pollard is really nice, but she barely teaches.  I think she lectures for about 5-10 minutes each class and then lets students work on classwork.  I didn't learn anything new in this course; Span 1110 was harder.  Her method is to make the class so easy that anyone can pass, but honestly, you won't learn anything.  At least the class was easy.

She is a GREAT teacher! This class requires A LOT of reading and understanding. The homework is a lot but she just wants you to learn a lot and if you need any help she is willing to give it to you. Her tests are easy and she grades easily (if you know the information of course) but they are not tricky!

This was by far the best spanish class I have ever taken! Spanish Lit is a hard class, but Sra. Pollard makes it so incredible. It is a lot of work, but her tests and quizzes are graded VERY fairly (and easily). She truly cares about her students and is more than willing to help you. I wish I could take more classes from her!
Sra Pollard was awesome.  She is very approachable and is willing to do whatever necessary to help her students do well.  I would definetely recommend her.  Plus she is pretty hot.

Take her class!  She really wants her students to do well, and she actually cares!  She grades very leniently - and always is willing to help you.  She is funny and I did not dread going to Spanish everyday because of her.
This class was very easy. Senora Pollard was a lot of fun. I would recommend it.
Sña Pollard was the best Spanish teacher I've ever had. Her class is challenging but in a way that makes you want to rise to the occasion.

Sra. Pollard is the best Spanish teacher I've had. If you don't learn anything else in this class, you will improve your speaking and writing skills in Spanish. She makes you talk, so be prepared for that. I recommend big time. As a plus, she might be the best looking professor at UGA.

She's an amazing teacher. She's funny and loves to be on the same level as her students. Really helpful when you need her, but I don't feel like I learned a lot of new material. Overall, a good experience, but not very conducive to learning the language more in depth (though that could have been due to the students in the class also). I recommend.
Great teacher, just a hard class in general. She helps tremendously and wants you to make a good great, and thus is a condusive teacher to a good grade

She is an amazing professor-- very nice, very understanding.  She starts off trying to be strict and sticking to the rules but has been known to bend them. Her goal is for everyone to earn an A in her class. Attendance is a must. Participation is a must.

She is by far the nicest teacher I have ever had at the University.  She was very willing to work with students and was very approachable.  She graded fairly, even leniently.  Overall...you are lucky to get her!

Sra. Pollard is nice and funny, but still prepares you for the department-issued tests.  She will take the time to go over things if the class does not understand and won't make you use your span dictionary just to know what is going on in class.  I wish i could have her for all my span classes.

Attendance is mandatory for this class, but the lectures were quite enjoyable and I had found the material to be interesting. The homework can be easily finished in 5 minutes, and for exams just read the textbook. Professor responded to emails in a timely manner and was extremely helpful. Overall fantastic teacher, one of my favorites so far.
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Caring

comment_Rating: Dr. Schaller is very approachable and willing to help her students. Papers are graded a bit tough, but tests are reasonable. Attendance is important- lectures in class, but also had group activities to change it up. I enjoyed hearing her life stories and would recommend her as a professor.
Tests are hard, and papers are graded harshly. Not a easy class. Mandatory Attendance but does not count towards grade if you are there, only takes away if you arent.
Dr. Schaller is a great professor. If you get her, you are lucky! She's very understanding, funny, and laid back. She doesn't make the class harder than necessary.

Super easy class. Only grades were group projects/student-led presentations, attendance, and daily participation. Discussion-based; we often went off topic though. She rants about her life a lot. Overall easy and enjoyable class.

Dr. Schaller is a wonderful teacher and just an awesome person. She's laid-back and open-minded. We had several group activities, so it wasn't always lectures. She has lots of stories to tell that go along with what's being studied. I highly recommend her! Tests are multiple choice and not difficult (as long as you read or pay attention!).

She makes speeches very comfortable. Although she makes you speak a lot it really does help. Tests are easy but have a few tricky questions. Lecture can be boring but she doesn't lecture everyday. A lot of test material comes from the book. Not too much from lecture that I remember. Not too hard to get an A if you go to class. Take this class!!! :D
Really easy class. Mostly student led presentations so not very interesting. GROUP PROJECT for the final that includes 10 hours of service work.
Not a bad teacher

Speech can be a very scary class, but Dr. Schaller really puts you at ease.  Sometimes the timing on the speeches is rushed, but Dr. Schaller is very willing to work with you.  She grades fairly, and is funny in class. She is strict on the attendance policy, so you have to show up.

She grades speeches easily and stupid stuff like peer evaluation very harshly.  Most of our speeches were group speeches.  The tests come straight from the book.  All of the speeches are really close together in the second half of the semester.  She is very picky about attendance.

I had her for the honors course. I found the material interesting, although at times lecture is boring. She is a very nice person, but grades pretty hard, but fairly. As long as you work hard an A should not be difficult. Only a final and a midterm, essay form, but they each average about 25 written pages. Likes class participation and group work.

Subject is extrememly boring. She doesn't introduce any new information, simply recites what the book covers. However, since it's a required class for Terry majors, take it, as it's probably the easiest class you'll ever attend. The midterm and finals are take-home. She gave us the opportunity for extra credit, though no one needed it. Easy A.
She is my favorite teacher at UGA thus far. She has made Speech Comm my favorite class this semester!

She is a very nice teacher. Take her class. Mandatory attendence, group work, class presentations, 10 pages papers (it's not hard as your think). She has a dry sense of humor and her class is interesting. It's the only class where I didnt fall asleep! lol

A lot of the material is common-sense, but adding on names to what you know. If you want the A, you'll have to study a bit, read, put effort into the papers, and follow instructions exactly on tests (if she says to write out "true," do it). It's not a free A, but it's not incredibly hard, either. And she's really nice. :-)
She grades very harshly, I thought it would be an easy A, man was I wrong!!!

I liked Dr. Schaller.  As far as her grading, she was definitely too tough on the papers and she could be kind of random on her tests.  In general the exams were not too hard but every once in awhile there would be some really nitpicky questions.  Definitely don't take the class if you dislike acting.  Overall, not a bad class.

I like her as a person. the only problem with the class was that you couldnt miss more than 20 points total and still get an A. that said we only had 3 test and two papers. She does have an attendence policy (can only miss 3 classes without a note). And beware if you do not like working in groups or doing just a little acting in front of the class.
The test were challenging, but not too difficult.  I think he will be better the longer he teaches. He is a good teacher and I would recommend him.

I had him for sociology of sports. lots of people don't like him, but I think that it is a cool class and he is not a bad teacher.  people are way harsh b/c they didn't do well.  he does expect a lot, but, you know, it's college.  it was actually one of my fave classes ever.  grades aren't posted yet. It was hard and I do hope an get an A.

Buffington has no personal concern for his students.  He grades FAR to difficult for a sociology class. It is nearly impossible to correctly answer any of his short answer questions and to meet his ridiculously high standards.  His lectures are mostly uninteresting and the readings he assigns are time consuming and pointless.  He is NOT a nice man.
Horrible, very boring teacher.  Knows nothing about teaching and****almost all of the male students in the class. Very disappointed
Very nice guy, easy going and laid back. Will explain things perfectly. Has a good style of teaching

This guy is the bees knees. Very quiet but has great/hilarious stories once he gets going. Talk to him about Denney's and you will be his best friend. He is good at giving criticism without making you feel about or discouraged.

This guy is awesome. He's pretty quite most of the time...but when he does chit chat, he has the most hilarious, dry sense of humor. His class is easy as long as you do the work, and he is very helpful.

Ken is an extremely nice and talented artist. He is very quiet, almost muted, but speaks for way too long about the in class assignment prior to it. He is a huge fan of going to class and drawing an extremely random still life for 3 hours. It gets very tiring, but the class is very easy and he is very helpful.

Really really nice professor.  He doesn't say much but he is always extremely helpful.  I was terrible at drawing when I started and now I'm actually pretty good, and I came out with a solid B.  He will definitely teach you how to draw and his projects are mostly pretty interesting.

I do not exaggerate when I say that I would trade literally any member of my family for Martijn. His class taught me how to bend the fabric of time and space, as well as actual fabric, and his glorious hair horn would rival the very gods themselves. If David Bowie were to mate with a unicorn, they would produce Martijn van Wagtendonk.

Very nice and passionate about his job. Makes assignments very interesting and clear while leaving room for interpretation. My one critique is that in his quest to have you find your own solutions he often doesn't give a lot of feedback on work in progress. This is frustrating when you keep getting B's

Martijn is really nice and I loved all of the projects he came up with.  However, he is kind of hard to get an A out of.  Even so, I'm still taking him for 1080 because I enjoyed his projects so much and he is so nice.  Love hearing about his new baby Max!

I had Dr. Loftis at Morehouse and she was one of the best professors I had. She is a tough grader when it comes to essays but she will help you if you go to office hours. My writing improved so much in her class not to mention the discussions we had with her were life altering. Highly recommended.
Great professor! She's a self-proclaimed "mad-dog" grader, but she really knows her stuff. I really grew in appreciation for Bernard Shaw by the end of the semester.
Extremely difficult essay grader, with no apparent resoning. Will fail your paper for two grammer errors, while giving a person with a poor thesis an A.

Mrs. Loftis is an amazing teacher. However, she expects you to work for your grade. Trust me, I know. I ended up with an A- that I worked for. GO TO OFFICE HOURS! She wants to help you become a better writer. Wish I'd had her for 1101. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.
I liked her class overall.  The discussions over readings were always interesting.  She was a very hard essay grader though.

HARD. If you go to her office hours and SUCK UP nonstop- you will do fine. She tries to help you out at office hours and tells you what to change, but then usually marks what she tells you to change as an error when shes grading it- so its pointless to go. Will give you a 50 on a paper but not explain why. Very caring, however wouldn't recommend.

She was pretty friendly but definitely liked to play favorites.  The almost daily quizzes were very easy and helped boost my grade. However, if you do not go to her office hours you are doomed for failure. Many times I went to her hours and she still didn't help me.  I wouldn't recommend her.

Interesting class and readings, but extremely unfair grader. If you feel like working your butt off in a class, i.e. taking your paper to her office hours 4 TIMES in order to get comments and suggestions, and still making a crap grade, then take this course. Am I bitter? Heck yes.

She's a really great teacher. short readings for every class and easy quizzes. GO TO OFFICE HOURS! if you take your rough draft of your paper she will tell you what you would make on it and how to make it an A. This class wasn't really hard at all. I definitely recommend her class. She's really interesting and takes into consideration what the clas

Immediately she warns her classes that she will be tough, and on essays she is strict on grading.  However, by going to office hours (which are not scary) and basically using what she tells you, it's not too hard to do well on the essays and in the class.  Almost daily (very easy) quizzes boost grade and give chance for only source of extra credit.

She warned the class she would be hard, but for the smart kids, no offense, she wasn't that hard.  The essays combined are half your grade, so they take time, but her office hourse are essential!  She tells you want you wants and keeps the class interesting.  If you put any effort you will see lots of results.  I think anyone who tried can make a B
She was VERY wishy-washy on grading. I made anywhere from a high C to a high A on the essays and I never changed my writing style. She is also very unfriendly to most people.

She was a horrible teacher.  She would tell you one thing to change about your writing style, and then count off points for it.  I have always made A's without any trouble in all English classes and I bearly got a C in hers.  I would not suggest taking her class.

Very tough grading on essays - extremely hard to make an A on them. Participation and quiz grades boost your average. Always willing to meet to go over essays, giving helpful pointers. She also gives lots of class time for portfolio work which was a huge plus!!

Grades papers kinda hard.  It's pretty easy to get a B out of the class but very hard to make an A on a paper.  Quizzes everyday over short readings.  Willing to help during office hours when she is asked
Pretty nice teacher, the class is an easy B. A bit harsh on grading essays, but you'll manage if you just put a little effort in.

Marty (who is also my advisor) is the best teacher you will ever have. He really is like a second father and cares so much. He's quirky and hilarious too. I would take him for every class if I could. He's also the only advisor I have that knows what he's talking about.

Marty is the best person you'll ever meet at this university. He's my advisor too and he's absolutely incredible. He is hilarious, knows a ton, and will shoot you straight. He's like a dad. If you're under his supervision, you're going to be ok. He'll always be there for you.
I am absolutely in love with this man! he was incredibly interested and super cute! If you get a chance.... Take him!!!

I had this class for Drama.  He was so interesting, and quirky.  However, there are tons of notes, and don't even think about missing a class or you'll be behind.  Reading is ULTRA important.  Tests were easy if you took the time to go to class.  Work hard on the paper.  Overall, you'll never watch movies the same again.
He was really qwirky cute. The papers were difficult, but class was insanly intresting. I really enjoyed attending class.
Excellent teacher, had a pretty interesting class. I'm not a big fan of English, but I'd highly recommend his class. Just make sure to do the work and you'll be fine.

Marty was my favorite T.A. I took him in 2001, wonder if he's still there, but I had a slight drug problem and still passed his class with flying colors. He's hip, cool and helpful. I'd take as many classes as he offered.

Marty was an exceptional English teacher! I thoroughly enjoyed his class--it was the only one I had perfect attendance in. Prior to this class, I had no idea what to do for a major, but he swayed me toward English. Excellent structure and grading. I highly recommend him.
One of this nicest people I have ever met! An easy A!
Sweet Lady! Easy class

Great class! I learned so much applicable material and I truly enjoyed being there. I not only came out with an A, but I learned a lot of valuable things about myself. She is extremely willing to help her students whenever necessary.
Great class, nicest lady I have ever met. Take this class for an easy Area B fulfiller
Dr. Larson's class was incredible
Dr. Larson is a great professor to get to know as a freshman.
Great class

Dr. Larson is a wonderful teacher. She takes a genuine interest in each student and makes it clear that the graded work in the class is not as important as the student learning to understand themselves and what it takes to be successful in college and in their career. The assignments are simple, but require a little work sometimes. Great professor.

I love Dr. Larson! She's such a great teacher and her class is a great class to take as a freshman! If you do the assignments (which aren't difficult) you'll make an A. It's also a great class because it  helps you look at yourself and what you are doing and where you are going. She's so sweet and really cares about her students and their neeed!

She is very enthusiastic about her students and her class.She actually cares about how you are doing, and openly asks you to ask about your schedule, etc.Her being a counselor helps alot, and I definatly asked her to help me on a few occassions.If you do the few workbook assignments which are easy, you will succeed.  Good class to take. that is all

Dr. Larson is an incredible teacher and counselor! Her class was the highlight of my Mondays and Wednesdays, and she helped me tremendously. I took Freshman Success with her, and she definitely did everything in her power to help me succeed. She loves her students, and I recommend this class!
I thought she was a really good teacher. Shes not strict on attendance so I never went to class which reflected in my grade. She was a really good teacher for pre calc

worst math teacher I've ever taken! She goes too fast and does not care if you comprehended or not. Calculus is a hard topic, trust me you don't want her to teach it to you. she gets frustrated when you ask questions and if she acknowledges your question, she will never give you an answer, but reply "review your notes" avoid her class!!

I don't know why so many people gave her such bad ratings. I thought this class was fairly easy, but you'll have to study hard for the word problems. I made a B+, but it would have been an A-, or even an A if I didn't slack off or make careless mistakes.

Bad teacher.  She gets easily frustrated when you ask questions.  A lot of time she is incomprehensible and she makes a lot of mistakes on the board.  On tests she'll often make problems that we barely covered in class worth a lot of points.  Generally just and unqualified teacher.
No Comments

i thought she was a very good teacher! she explained everything step by step so people could understand the concepts of what she was teaching. shes willing to work with you outside the class. a really nice and good teacher!

Explains everything really well, she knows what she is teaching, so just ask and she will explain anything! math 106 is pretty easy, so if you have any problems understanding she can and will help you! overall, good teacher!
No Comments

Dr. Grant is extremely nice and a great teacher. She has great connections to medical schools and will use them for you. The medical soci class is very informative. If you're pre-med, I definitely recommend taking this class as an elective. No homework, a few easy papers, and tests that are straight form the book/articles. Take it, its an easy A!!

I love Dr.Grant. She is not for everyone, and she doesn't have much charisma, but she is intelligent, has so many connections, and is very willing to help you. I would recommend this class if you are interested in gender; use her office hours to talk about your interests and the tests. If you're taking this as an elective, you may be disappointed.

Went to the 1st day of Sociology of Gender. Sat in the back. Her voice was so monotone that I simply had to get up and leave so I wouldn't fall asleep. Maybe I was tired, maybe my attention span is limited, but I couldn't do that for an entire semester.
Boring!!! Going to class was painful at times. Read and use the textbook and you will get a good grade. Take if you are interesting in gender but only the readings will teach you anything.

This professor is HORRIBLE. All she does the entire semester is go through powerpoint after powerpoint. Her voice is so monotonous that I cannot even pay attention. I am a 3.8 student and made a B in here class because of a stupid class project we had. She grades WAY too hard and her tests are RIDICULOUS. There is WAY too much outside reading. BEWA

Most boring class I have ever taken. I didn't do as well as I would have liked because it is so hard to listen in class. Excessive reading outside of the text book that is unrelated and outdated. I personally wouldn't recommend this class.

Dr Grant is very knowledgeable and does a good job prepping for her classes.  Her TA Kimberly Kelley was amazing and will make a superb professor.  Sometimes Dr Grant was hard to hear.  She was clear about expectations, allowed room for personal creativity and allowed us to work with topics that we found most interesting. Thank you!

This class was so boring and long. the readings that were required for the class were impossible, i never finished them because there were so many. Also a hard grader and tests were hard, had hard MC questions. overall it was okay but grades a little too strict.

Very nice woman, easy grader, just a little boring. The reserve and text readings are monotonous and long, but the reader is terrific! I only read that and got an A. Be prepared, she's not too tech saavy and has a tendancy to skip slides by mistake in PowerPoint. Point out her mistake and she goes back w/o a problem.

Dr. Grant knows what she's talking about, but sadly (in my Gender class) had to pander to unreceptive students and chose some boring topics--she made a potentially awesome class very boring and hard to sit through.  Monotonous lecture, easy tests, medium amounts of reading.

he is a very good teacher, and although he is Haitian when speaking French he has a French accent, not Haitian. If you do what you are told to do and listen to his instruction you will find his class very easy.

he does not give enough grades so your tests and compositions are the only thing factored into your grade also gives pop quizzes randomly also is a fluent french speaker so he explains concepts in french overall not good also is a 3000 level teacher and doesnt know how to teach an intro french class

LenerGay is a Grad Student and his French is definitely not perfect. He forgets how to spell things and I even fixed his mistakes plenty of times. His grades are terrible and everyone in my class failed at least one test. You HAVE to participate in class/group work too. Avoid!!

Jean is from Haiti so he has an accent most French students aren't used to hearing. We did interesting activites in class, like hear him play a song on his guitar, but it was very work intensive. There was extremely difficult homework for every class period.

People say his accent is hard to understand, but I felt like I could understand everything he said. He definitely sticks to the rules and syllabus that the department sets up for this class, which is what all teachers for 1001-2002 have to do. But he's a really nice guy, and it was interesting to have exposure to a different francophone culture.

Wasn't really prepared for this class...Total immersion in French. Doesn't really teach...you must learn yourself through the book. If you're fluent, then you'll be fine. Hard to understand too. Grades difficult.
he's extremely nice and will help you when he can. just be careful because his first language is creole, so his french is far from perfect. good guy, easy class

He is kind of spacey; he forgets graded tests and compositions. He is very nice and has the best intentions, and the tests are extremely easy. However, if you don't show up to class, he's not very lenient on subjective grades: compositions, oral exam, etc. Also, his haitian accent is difficult to get used to, but not too bad later.

Dr. Parker is incredible. She's mostly really nonbiased and really cares about her students. There's not much homework and only a few papers, no tests. She makes the class super interesting and is always open to opposing opinions or viewpoints, and she only ever uses evidence, studies, and facts and never just her opinions on subjects.

LOVED this class. Took it as an elective credit. Blaize is so cool and one of my favorite professors. You're assigned a lot of current articles and she keeps the class super interesting. Participation is key to success in her class. She's super respectful of all opinions, and makes the class really enjoyable.

I'm so lucky to have had Dr. Parker for her last semester here at UGA.  She was amazing.  We were so open to share our opinions and thoughts on the material, and she highly encouraged us to express our opinion.  She is truly inspirational, and I am sad that she won't be here.

Just finished our last class today, and I would like to say she is an inspirational professor. She is no longer at the University of Georgia, and I feel bad for the people who are no longer able to experience her. I always learned something new, and the class was always engaged. We will miss Dr. Parker.   UGA's loss.

Dr. Paker is amazing! She really care about what she is teaching which makes her class very interesting. No tests just essays and blog posts. The class is very relaxed consiting of only group disscuions. If you do your work and really put your best foot forward in your essays this class should be no problem.

Dr. Parker is amazing! You have no tests or pop quizzes, just  4papers and discussion posts spread that you get As on for explaining your opinions on the topics well. Discussion class & no participation grade. I didnt buy the books but you NEED THEM for the papers. Find a friend to lend u theirs to find a random quote. Got away with all As
She wants her students to truly look at the material and understand it and discuss it together. She's an amazing professor.

The class is mainly discussion and no tests. You have online posts that are 300 words long that are due every couple of weeks. No quizzes too. You don't have to read the articles for homework to do well, and she doesn't grade on participation during discussions. Attendance is mandatory though, but the class is pretty easy with relatable material.

For the most part it is a participation/attendance class with a few essays and short essays to write. There are assigned readings everyday that you then discuss in class, but there were definitely times I forgot to read and it was still easy to get into the discussion. You watch a lot of good documentaries. Great professor, learned a lot!

Definitely enjoyed this class more than I expected - truly an eye opening experience and I would take it again in a heartbeat. Class consists of writing assignments but they're not too difficult provided you keep up with the reading material. Dr. Parker is awesome - very engaging professor.
Fun class. Does not give an easy A, but if you show up you will pass.
BEST professor at UGA! Love her! She is very knowledgable and points out when the curriculum is bias. She knows her stuff! Recommend her for sure!! Easy A!
Dr. Parker is awesome! Class was discussion-based. Assignments were online posts. I recommend her ! :)
WONDERFUL professor. Discussion based courses for WMST 2010. Lots of wiggle room.

Dr. Parker is one of the best professors at UGA. She's honest and open, very willing to listen to every student. She shares her opinions and wants to hear from students who disagree with her. She completely changed my view on feminism. This class was eye-opening and put women's issues in a new perspective. Highly recommend.

Honestly think I'm in love with this woman. Favorite class I have taken at UGA. Assigned articles are current and extremely interesting. Discussion based class, but talking isn't required. If you care about feminist issues, midterm, final, and opinion posts are actually fun to write. If you don't, this class might just open your mind to new ideas.

Dr Parker is really cool and opinionated. Class is fun and open for discussion, really good atmosphere. She is surprisingly a harsh grader, but the midterm and final are take home, which is nice. Overall great class! Never boring and attendence IS mandatory. She assigns a lot of reading but it is interesting. Take her!

Dr. Parker is amazing! I enjoyed her class so much and was always  eager to attend! I enjoyed it so much that it hardly felt like going to school but instead learning so much from a good friend who engaged in conversation. Amazing amazing class! I'm not even a Women's studies major but try to get her class every semester.

She was a great an engaging teacher, probably the best I've taken at UGA so far. I really enjoyed her class. The only cons were that her attendance policy was strict. I got sick and had a doctor's note but still got points taken off. But she does state this in the syllabus so it didn't surprise me. The class was great. I definitely recommend it.

I thought she was a nice person and great teacher who looked out for her students. Unfortunately I was wrong. Her strict attendance policy was ridiculous. I was down with the flu and still got points taken off despite my doctor's note. And she is strict on turning things in on time, despite the fact that it takes her forever to grade our essays. :(

She is a nice person and cool to talk to, and the class discussions are interesting. I liked that she didn't force us to talk in front of the class because I hate talking in class. Your grades consist of papers, ELC posts, and attendance. You should be able to get at least an A- if you spend a fair amount of time on your essays. I'd recommend her.
It is easy, but she grades papers hard. She has favorites and it is very obvious. Overall, it's easy and not much work but spend extra time on your papers.

I loved having this class and Blaise as a professor. I never found her or her ideas offensive, however some of the videos were too much for me to watch. Fun class, full of discussion. I loved the take home mid term and final. We did a Zine that was fun and easy and a few in class writings that were mostly opinion and 4 online posts. Awesome class!

Easy class but really boring. Aside from the days we watched movies, the teacher talks too much and it gets annoying listening to her rant about her left-wing opinions every single class. I'd take a different teacher if you can

This was more of a black history class instead of women history. In class all we did was argue about race/class issues which got very old. The grades were an autobiography, self assessment, a written midterm and final- sounds easy but her grading is very subjective so you better hope she likes you. She gave me an A- when I should've gotten an A.
I took her course this spring and hated it. She was not clear about her expectations and she was so scatterbrained. The class was very disorganized and the assigned texts were so dull.

I can't believe that students have actually COMPLAINED about Dr. Parker on here?! Yes, she speaks her mind.. um, what is wrong with that? Great Great class, Dr. Parker is very knowledgable and informed. I wouldn't necessarily call her class "easy". A lot of students think it is "easy" because they are unaware of her tolerance of their perspectives

Interesting class that consisted mainly of discussion. Very free form and very little note taking. Grades consisted of take home midterm and final, group project, and a few other short papers(2-4pp). Attendance is mandatory, and you are only allowed five absences before points are taken off. Readings are important for midterm/final. Easy overall.

Best. Class. Ever. Blaise is so fun, and encourages questions, no matter how "dumb" the person asking may think it is. She encourages differing opinions in class and offers us the opportunity to go off on tangents, explore new ideas, and generally have fantastic class discussions.
Fun Class

Not only is Blaise fine. as. hell., she has real passion for her subject and, while she is clearly very knowledgeable, she's always willing to step back and learn from her students. If you read what's assigned, then you should do well. She's incredibly fair, but not a pushover. In a word, AMAZING!

I hate this class. She doesn't know what she's doing half the time, and it's sooo boring. Not very helpful and attendance quizzes were hard(so even if u read your stuff, you still get a 0)! You will receive a bad grade if you don't speak in class. A waste of time.

This is a fun class if you like to talk and discuss things.  Don't expect to get out early.  She will hold you until the last minute of the class.  Overall this was a fun class.  Easy A.  I didn't really read, but I passed the in class essays because I pay attention to the discussions. There will be lots of films.

I really didn't know what to expect coming into this class, but I ended up loving it. I thought that Dr. Parker was a great, informed, and unbiased teacher. The only tests that we had were take home. She is just an all over nice person, a litle bit eccentric, but that just adds to the class!! This ended up being my favorite class of the semester.

Great class! There are no tests to take, only take-home essays to write.  Parker is  knowledgeable, fair, and attempts to remain unbiased. This class was so informative and enlightening. Parker doesn't grade harshly either. My only one complaint is that there is too much reading, but not unbearable.

I liked Blaise a lot as a person, she was really sweet and pleasant. But she is a little annoying as a teacher. She will speak her mind like it's the only possible truth, and she interrupts everyone like crazy when they try to speak. Just come to class and you will be fine. I never cracked a page of reading and still got an A.

I'm a senior, and this is the EASIEST class I've ever taken.  HATED the class discussions though, she says some pretty ridiculous things, and I'm fairly liberal.  If you can't put up with her BS, don't take the class.  If you can, then do it and you'll get an A.

Dr. Parker is one of those teachers you hope for in college. The class discussions are actually thought provoking and enjoyable. This is one of the only classes I actually looked forward to going to. She is very fair in her grading and has fun readings. Attendance was taken periodically so it is important to go to class. Take this class!
I loved Dr. Parker. She is one of the coolest professors here at UGA. :)

SUPER EASY!!! TAKE HER!!! Discussions are interesting, she curses and is very laid back. I probably went to class 13 times throughout the semester and still managed to pull an A. Def among the easiest classes I've ever taken! There 11 1-2 page papers due throughout the sem, a mid-term and final. I turned in all 11 in like the 4th week and was done.

I loved Dr. Parker! She taught this class in a way that was non-intimidating to students from majors outside of Women's Studies and Psychology. I learned a lot from Dr. Parker, and I appreciate having the opportunity to take her class and express my perspective toward the course material.

Valuable class. Discussion questions were due each week on the readings and they were expected to be about a paragraph. The final assignment was 10 page paper on the topic of your choice. The class never lacked interesting discussion although sometimes I'm still blurry on a few feminist theory concepts.
Trys not to take sides, careful with her language, do the work and you'll be fine. Very interesting topics and brings current events into play. Sharp dressor as well=).

Blaise is absolutely amazing. She's a good teacher, promotes healthy discussions, always nice to EVERYONE. The grading in this class was always fair and the assignments encourage you to talk about your thoughts on different subjects, so it's hard to make a "bad" grade...
keeps subject matter interesting, has GREAT relationships with ALL of her students, is understanding of different personality types in the classroom (i.e. participation!)... PERFECT!
I've never had Blaise as a teacher but she is my advisor (and a wonderful one at that).  Without Blaise I believe that I would never had graduated and gotten into graduate school
Blaise is the best teacher i've had at UGA so far. She always engages the class in lively debates and discussion, and she grades really fair.
I love Ms Barrow!  She is beautiful and very nice but she's serious about attendence and doing the work.

Heed my admonitions, O you Seeking Souls! I have your best interest at heart! Do not make the same miserable mistake I made by taking Barrow's class! Don't use same word TWICE in a paragraph. If you've exempted 1101, she'll be harder on  you. Her essay grading is awfully harsh and hardly warrented. Arduous readings (and terrible

Super sweet professor!  Always willing to help and encourages students to go to office hours for paper writing help.  She tries really hard and makes class interesting!  She let us out early almost every day and cancelled class a couple times.  Papers were graded a little harshly but she is always willing to help.  DEFINITELY RECOMMEND.

I had her for multicultural lit & I really enjoyed the selection of stories we read. There were some papers, in-class journals, and test (in class essays). Her lecture consists of reading and discussion. Go to her office hours to discuss your paper to know what she is looking for in a paper. I made an A in the class.

She is really nice, and always willing to help, but not necessarily easy. Her standards for writing papers are unlike any other college-level English classes I have taken. She wants very specific things, but doesn't really tell you them before turning in your paper. There's a lot of reading to do. If I'd known I would have taken another professor.

We are at the end of the semester, and as a business major, I am really surprised how much I liked this class!!! I feel like Ms. Barrow is a little harder than other teachers of English at UGA but if you go to her office hours she is really helpful!!!  The first paper she marks up a lot, but then it is so obvious to see what you need to improve

She's a decent teacher, but expects a lot. The three papers are pretty tough, especially the first one. I'm hoping to get a B in the class. She is VERY very nice, however, very helpful, and a very fair grader. It is by no means an easy class though. One last thing: Do your readings!
She's nice, but not necessarily an easy A

Mrs. Barrow was so nice and unbelievably helpful! She is more than willing to sit down with you and discuss a paper. There are two readings each week, one journal each week, and three papers a semester. She is tough but a fair grader. Do the journals, they will really help your grade. Overall, it was a good class and you can get an A if you work.
I am a stronger writer after taking this course. She is tough but fair as a grader, but her comments are very useful. Would recommend.

Her class is not that hard as long as you show up to class and read well. If you need help she has no problem giving some pointers and actually is very helpful when you go to her about an essay. She does mark up essays a good bit if you read closely the essays are not that bad. I would not say her class is very easy but an A is not out of reach.

Highly recommend. She's tough, but a great teacher, relates to the students, funny, very nice and always willing to help. I took AP Literature and AP Language in high school, might get a high B low A in Barrow's class, but I felt very prepared for it.
She is freaking HARD this class will be the death of me ! Dont take it!

The class is all about deeply analyzing little stories that you read out of a textbook, and making strong arguments about connections you see, etc. Very tough grader on papers, but incorporates a lot of in-class easy quizzes to boost grade. Definitely intimidating if you're not an English person. My advice = go to class!

on the first paper especially mrs. barrow really marks it up and it was kind of shocking to see so much red ink.  but she really wants us to be better writers which is obvious by the end of the semester.  good class overall but kind of intimidating if you are not a major
She's a sweet woman who takes into consideration that a person is taking more classes than just hers!
I think she is a cool teacher who really likes English.  She is a hard grader especially on the first paper but if you read her comments you can really become a great writer.

Some of these comments are misleading... I'm a fairly good English student and I got a C on my first paper. She is not an easy grader, but she is nice and willing to help. However, I felt that her what she told me in office hours didn't actually help much. Not the easiest A.

Barrow is a great instructor! She knows her stuff and always has very well planned out lessons. Great class structure. She is super easy to approach and very willing to help. She grades papers fairly tough, but you will become a better writer because of it. Good class overall.

Wonderful. Took the class to meet a degree requirement and very fortunate that I did. Mrs. Barrow is genuinely interested in students, challenged us to think and learn instead of just being lectured to. She is VERY bright and insightful...and helpful. I had no idea I'd learn so much in a lit class, disappointed I don't need another class from her.

She is a great teacher, and she really enjoys her field.  Her grades are not proportionate to effort, so it takes more than just talking to her during office hours to get a good grade.  The readings are short and relevant to college students.  It is not a difficult class overall, but it is very interesting.  I learned a lot.
I think Ms. Barrow is a great teacher who wants us to do well.  I never liked English before but she makes it interesting and fun. Take her!
She's really nice and you will definitely be a better writer after this class, but it's challenging. There's homework every class and many quizzes- it's not an easy A but is more like an easy B+

Her class was incredibly interesting. She is a wonderful teacher and clearly has an interest in what she teaches. Her expectations are not unreasonable as far as reading and her grading is fairly easy. I never made a B on anything. I would highly recommend her to anyone-especially someone who enjoys English anyway.

I think  mrs barrow is an awesome teacher who is really interested in her students ideas.  I wish that I got an A on every paper, but if you read her comments (she leaves alot of notes) you can really improve.  She is great!!!!

Don't understand how you can't get an A in this class. Explicitly tells you how to write your paper and the readings are all short and fairly interesting. The only time I didn't get an A on a paper was when I completely forgot to put in a bibliography (and even then I got a B+).

A GREAT teacher! She is very passionate about English and reading, which is clear in the classroom. She is extremely helpful and fair. I didn't like English prior to her class, but came to love this course. I recommend her to everyone!
You have to work really hard and do A LOT of reading in her class but she is an awesome teacher and really smart and intersting. Take her!
the nicest lady.  the class was not easy, but she helped with everything.  she made class fun and really cares about her students.  take her if you can.

Good teacher, but a lot of work.  She gives lots of extra credit and a lot of reading.  But if you put forth a little effort you can definitely get an A.  An overall good teacher...just be prepared to read and be challenged!
She is so nice and helpful! The class is interesting and she is just a sweet woman. You should try to get her if you can!!

I would not recommend this class if you did not take calculus in high school. He moves really fast and is unclear. Attendance is not mandatory, each day you take notes. The recession is extremely helpful, you get all the answers to your homework due each Friday. Only 2 mid-terms and a final. No quizzes. He is a really easy grader.
Dr. Nakano is super easy in grading. His tests come straight from the homework. An easy A.

He was clear with his lectures but lacked interest in helping students. If you need to see him outside of class and have issues with his office hours, you can forget it. No quizzes but he grades the homework.

I took ap calc AB in highschool... so the class was pretty easy. however, if i had not already taken calc i would have been lost. he went pretty fast, but his tests were fair. there are only two tests and a final. homework is due every week, but you can go over all of the problems in breakout.

It was extremely EASY if you took Calculus in high school, which is what I did. Do not take this if you're not good at math. He tends to go fast and if you don't know some of the material beforehand, it can be confusing. I got an A. The hwmk assignments come from the book. Go to recitation session to get answers on problems you didn't get before

I dropped the class after failing the 2nd test! he was totally cool with it and he is available to help. i would not take it if u didnt take calc in high school cuz he moves pretty fast. and there is mandatory homework but you do it as a class so its an easy A on that. class is pretty hard though

Fair teacher. Not the easiest but not the hardest. Class was boring but what math class isn't. He did a good job teaching but you need to do a little work outside of class. Tests were fair. Good teacher overall.

If you don't understand Math right away and usually need someone to explain things in greater detail...then don't take Nakano. He speaks Math..and not English. Does one example in book for every 20 HW problems just like it. Moves very fast-I usually understand Math very well and felt so lost in his class.

His tests are very straight forward, sometimes directly from the homework.  He teaches in a simple manner, but some might say he's boring.  He doesn't relate math to the real world much.  I took calc AB in high school before his class, and I felt like we went over a lot of stuff I already knew.
he is a nice enough person and I think he is willing to help (if you make the effort to get help) but class is boring

If you are interested in leadership, take this class with Dr. C. She is incredibly present and wise. If you are willing to put the time in, you will learn a ton. Lack of motivation and discipline, however, will ruin this class for you.
Easy, but you have no idea of grade til end of semester
She is a very nice woman, but her great downfall is her utter inability to organize. You never know what's going on in this class, and your grade is a complete mystery until the very end.

Very laid back. Grades were based on participation and two exams (no final). Participation was based on our in class work, which we never had to complete, so everyone got an A for that portion. For the exams, if you can answer the questions on the study guide, you should do well! Also, you do not need to buy the textbook and there was no homework.

This is the easiest A youll get in college. There are two tests, and he gives you study guides that closely resemble them. He assigns projects in class but never grades them and never gives homework. He really just wants you not to stress about your grade so you are free to just learn.
ratingTags_Rating: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment_Rating: Dr. Wright was awesome this semester. He cares a lot about geology and the issues affecting the earth today. He's got good stories and is funny. Go to class, it is interesting and participation is encouraged. There were only two tests. Would definitely take him again.

Professor Wright is a character. He's really funny and easygoing. He lets class out early nine out of 10 times. A large portion of the class is graded on in-class projects that we usually don't finish and never turn in. He's very laid back. The two total grades come from two tests, so I'd say study and do well on the two things that are graded.

I LOVE Dr. Wright- you just have to get used to his character/know what to expect. He's like the awesome, older uncle that has great and funny stories about buying reindeer meat in remote Russia (true story) and gives lectures about the problems of cellphone use. The class is almost COMPLETELY participation and it is SO important to sit up front!!
ratingTags_Rating: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment_Rating: Dr. Wright is a funny guy. I think he'd rather be doing other things at least keeps class interesting since he has to be there. We did some group work and lots of lectures. He likes to interact with students. I'm not really sure how he calculates grades but I think he gets flexible with them as long as you've been engaged. We didn't have a final.

The first test is difficult, but he's a generous grader. I walked out expecting a 70 and got an 89. The second test is much easier and he implied he would put more weight on it/ignore a bad first test if you improved. Attendance isn't mandatory but he doesn't put anything online and it can be hard to catch up if you miss class. Don't buy the book.
The class was extremely easy, and he is very passionate about geology. there are only two tests in the class, and he basically gives you the questions before the tests. It's so easy.
He's obviously cares deeply about geology and teaching his students. The class was interesting and not difficult at all. It's true that there are no tests. Great guy and professor.
Worst professor and human that I've ever met.
I had him for Honors Geology, and loved him! He obviously loves geology and the environment and it shows in his teaching. We had NO tests and NO final. No joke. Take his class!

I've only ever had her for the Spanish Language Community, but she is amazing. Fun, helpful, likes to see you learning and thinking in Spanish. Overall a wonderful teacher and person. If you have a chance to take her, do it.

Let me begin by saying I have a POWERFUL dislike of Spanish. With that in mind, Snra. Garnes is actually really cool. She's young (and dresses it- ripped jeans, band t-shirts, etc), funny, and a good teacher. She's very understanding. She makes class fun, even at 3 on a Friday when no one wants to be there. Be happy if you get her.

She's so much fun! Her class is pretty easy if you learn the vocab for the quizzes. Really lenient and very little work outside of class participation. For quizzes she reuses passages from the book. She's a really "hip" teacher so it makes espanol so much fun! And she has this new way of explaining grammar we've been doing for years but makes sense
She is really nice and very understanding! Her class is not hard at all, it is an easy A nad there is very little work outside of class

Inma is GREAT! She is very kind and down to earth. I really enjoyed her as a teacher. Class is all in spanish but is taught at a reasonable pace. Tests are somewhat difficult but not too bad. Class focuses mostly on grammar and vocab. Book isn't used too much but fair amount of online tasks. I definitely recommend Inma for any level!
Inma is an awesome teacher!  Nice, funny, and always tries to make the class enjoyable.  If you are lucky enough to get it, take her class for sure!
Senora Garnes is awesome!  She's so nice and always makes class fun and interesting.  If she comes back from Spain, you should definitely take this class.
Best Spanish Linguistics teacher. I actually learned something in this class. If you get a chance, take it.
I love Inma...and her class as well.
Inma is the bomb.com
Inma is DEFINITELY one of my favorite professors. She really tries to help you understand all the concepts we go over in class.
No Comments
No Comments

IF YOU ARE LOOKING FOR A GREAT SPANISH TEACHER INMA IS IT! I cannot say enough good things about her.She is really fun and always made class interesting.She's very helpful and she makes sure that everyone understands the material. She will answer any question. She gave us lots of practice with the material so that we would be prepared for the test.
Was very difficult to learn from and refused to show slides because of "plagiarism". The attendance system was always messed up and counted me as absent 5 times even though I was only absent once.

Worst professor I have ever had. Every word she speaks has "UM" in it, which is really unprofessional and obnoxious. There are no study guides and she does not help in any way for the exam. video and web ass. are easy As and the only upside. If you're good at this subject and can do everything on your own than go for it because she is helpless.

A few people in my class even changed their major because she was so ridiculous they were worried the rest of their political science classes would be that awful too. She has no knowledge of the subject. She is quite possibly one of the dumbest people I've ever met. Whoever rated her as hot must have been way in the back and unable to see properly.

Granted, my grammer may be bad, but her ratings don't lie and neither do her percentages on the Key. I'm not the only one arguing that her lectures, readings, and notes don't coincide with her tets. If you don't believe me, then take the class for yourself and judge for yourself. I'm not complaining that the material is hard, but the teacher sucks!

As a person, she is fun and lively, and generally laid back.  But personality and attitude in class made me view her as more like a classmate, less like a professor.  As a professor, she is very poor.  The lectures are absolutely mind-numbing, and any discussions are zero help at test time.  Avoid her if at all possible!

Ignore the jerks. I think Prof. Bekafigo did a good job teaching this class, especially for a new professor. Yes, it was a challenging course, but it was a good course if you are a SERIOUS student. If not change over to physical education. Like this genius, "she is of no help if you go office hours..literally she is dumb!" Nice grammar.
No Comments

The tests cover the lecture slides as well as what she says in class.  It is imperative that you go to class everyday and that she knows you are interested and concerned about your performance in the class!  Don't waste your time reading the text.  She is also available for office hours and appointments.  Take advantage of that!!

Exams did not reflect what we learned in class. She seemed as if she had little knowledge of the political research and had trouble answering questions from students. The material is pretty easy, but her tests are difficult because you never know what to study, even with the study guide. Run, do not walk, in the other direction.

Though she is a nice person, the class itself was horrible and her teaching did nothing to make it better. The material is not interesting or helpful. She doesn't do a good job lecturing, her tests are inconsistent, and she shows no creativity and stimulates no interest in the subject. All majors have to take this, so try to find someone else.

THE ABSOLUTE WORST TEACHER IN THE WORLD!!! i mean.. this lady could not teach if her life depended on it. Her lectures are HORRIFIC! her test are RIDICULOUSLY DIFFICULT! and her grading sucks! she is of no help if you go office hours..literally she is dumb! i corrected her like 5 times on my test! DO NOT TAKE HER! YOU WILL REGRET IT I PROMISE YOU!
I think she's a great professor. I enjoy her lectures and her spontaneity. AND HOT.
The absolute worst Political Science Teacher I have ever had.  She cannot teach to save her life.  Do not take this class unless you ABSOLUTELY have to.
