Professors grading is VERY subjective.  NOT well organized, be sure to keep in ask for clarity on topics, does not use any outlines or organized lectures.  Definitely favors those who talk a lot in class. Overall incredibly scattered and "plays favorites."
No Comments

Shen was very hard to understand and attendance was mandatory. Most of his lecture material was very confusing, and he was not very helpful in clearing the material up. He often seemed irritated when students would ask questions about the topics. Would recommend taking a different class or teacher.
LJ is a nice guy and he keeps class time entertaining. However, his tests are very difficult, so don't take if you're looking for an easy class. Weekly essay responses help pad your grade some.

I'm currently taking this class and I was very excited about it but I'm very disappointed. How can any person who can't speak proper English, teach a communication class? I feel as though you don';t learn anything from class. The most you learn is when he plays videos (wink, wink, bc you can understand what they're saying!) Worried about his test:(
Keep in mind: short essay response questions weekly, tests were fairly difficult, but he allows extra credit and it helped greatly! Funny guy. Lots of theory based material.

Dr. Shen has one thing going for him and that is he is a very fair teacher. I got a B+ in this class with two C- tests and a B. Speaks poor english, uses a points scale and offers extra credit which also helps you. If your taking this because your interested in persuasion dont, it's not relative. Overall not worth the stress I went through for a B+
The teaching methods for this class were not as a persuasion class should be. Not what you would expect when you're coming in.
avoid.avoid.avoid.

I took this class Maymester and it wasnt bad at all. He was very reasonable with assignments and grading and was happy to explain things we did not understand. It is work intensive, but not particularly difficult. If you remember the experiment process part of science in elementary school, you'll be fine. Go to class, take notes and ask questions.

YES, AVOID AT ALL COSTS! Ironic that it's a "communication" class but he doesn't speak English well (he's Chinese). He teaches the course like a statistics course. You will have a bunch of vague, unclear but hard assignments that force you to learn a lot about statistics but nothing about communication. One of the worst classes I've taken at UGA.

AVOID AT ALL COSTS. He doesn't make anything easy. All of his assignments are unclear and he always gives low grades because of stupid little things he never mentioned needed to be included in the first place. Impossible to get an A and you learn nothing
His class is fairly dull.  Though he is smart, he doesn't articulate what he wants in assignments, which results in unexplainable low grades.  Even meeting with him in office hours didn't help.
He likes to contradict himself.
Extremely BORING! Do whatever you want to do in class and you will get an A. Be prepared for little grades.

This class was very easy but VERY boring. Nothing new was learned. She liked me, but for the people she didn't like, she was REALLY mean to them! I liked this class after I was done with it, but was BORED all the way through. The projects are easy, but she counts off for everything on tests & essays (which you have a lot of)
This class was really easy, but I didn't learn anything new. I would recommend it if you are looking for an easy A. It's a lot like a high school class, though. Be prepared for lots of little grades.

Mrs. Picas is possibly my favorite teacher ever. She is so sweet, not difficult to understand, enthusiastic, and really seems to care about students. She gives a lot of work but she is not a hard grader. The tests a little bit difficult if you don't study. She gives extra credit for any extra work. I would definitely recommend her.
This lady should retire! The level of the class is a middle school level. I did not learn anything new.
The best prof. so far at UGA!! Take her if you need 3010

Easy A, she loves projects and anything that looks pretty in general. Her tests are hard, but she tells you what will be on them. She does like to pick on people, and can be a little too excited, but overall it's at least interesting.
If you need an A, definitely take this class. She accepts cut and paste projects and give you A- anyway!

She's really nice and the class is pretty easy.  The only thing to worry about is her tests because they are really hard.  She also gives out a lot of work which can be really annoying.  Overall she was nice and understandable.

The class is definitely pretty easy. she's a funny old lady who says things like "ay caramba!" allll the time. She gives A's like they're nothing. direct quote from her- "you didn't do well on this at all...you got a 92". You'll get an A without too much effort and most certainly find her very amusing.

I would say this class is easy, because certain parts of it are--she doesn't grade grammar and so on too harshly (I made a 94 and above on almost everything), however, the tests are very hard; almost ruining your chance for an A. She is really picky about the smallest things, I feel like I didn't really learn anything new. It's pretty easy, though

Pretty easy class.  Doesn't focus much on grammar.  Most of your grades come from projects and as long as you put time into doing them and make them look good, she doesn't grade the written/spoken spanish harshly.  She is picky, but usually it doesn't affect your grade.  Tests are hard.  Class time was alright.  She mixed class activities up.

sweet old lady, but incredibly picky and slow.  She points out every mistake you make in front of the whole class on an assignment no matter how pointless it seems. its not hard to get an A, but the class is extremely difficult to sit through.

Easiest class at UGA. There wasn't even a syllabus for the class. You show up and drum. There was a paper for the midterm and final, both of which length didn't matter(never saw a grade). He may take attendance randomly, but I skipped every single class where he did and still got an A. You won't see a grade until your transcript, but it'll be an A.
Dr. Scott is a truly amazing professor. You can tell he is passionate about drumming. All he asks is that you attend class and participate. If you do that, you will get an A in a fun class.
I rarely went to class, but when I did, it was fun.

I LOVE DR. SCOTT. Seriously he is so sweet and interesting, and he truly believes in the power of music and drums. Literally show up to class and at least try to drum and you'll get an A. All you do is drum in class, midterm/final, and a project, all of which he grades so easily. What a great prof. Take this class if you can.

What a cool class.  Dr. Scott is so passionate about drumming and really wants others to feel the same.  He expects nothing in terms of musical ability.  There's a midterm, final, and final project, all incredibly easy.  Definitely honors option this class if you're in honors.  Would definitely recommend!

Scott is the BEST! His midterm/final are essentially pass/fail and if you show up and write something down you're basically guaranteed to do well. Class is fun every day and the man very clearly loves his work. If you're in Honors, honors-option this class and enjoy the easiest credit you've ever gotten in your life.

This is one of the easiest classes at UGA, but it still counts for a lot of major requirements (ie culture, fine arts, honors). Dr. Scott is really cool, and he does a good job of inspiring students. He can take someone with no musical inclination and make them into a decent drummer. Participate, and make sure to study for midterm and final.

His class was a lot of fun!The class is very easy. No homework. Midterm and final are the tests and are exactly what he talks about in class. Group or individual presentations are given at the end of the semester and can be anything you want to do that relates to the class. The only down side is he never answered my e-mails. Take him if you can!

Hands down, ranks in the top 2 of my favorite classes ever! Dr. Scott is amazingly talented (he played drums with Widespread Panic, opened up for James Brown). He is fun, helpful, has a great sense of humor and genuinely cares about music and his students experiencing it in a new and exciting way. One of the best at UGA!

Dr. Scott is an amazing percussionist. His knowledge of hand-drumming and the drumset are completely amazing. He is a great teacher and really knows how to reach out to his students. Not only are his classes very informative, but they are fun! You can tell he really enjoys teaching.

Dr. Scott is probably one of the greatest teachers this University has to offer. It is a shame that not everyone can experience how great this man really is. I wish more teachers were as positive as he was. I leave his class everyday with a smile on my face.

Dr. Scott's African American Percussive Music class is a delightful one. As a drummer, I have gained skills in hand-drumming I never thought I could find. It's also a great way to learn a musical instrument for people who have never played before. He's a master of drums and percussion and a true heavyweight for the UGA music school.
Dr. Pollard's class is difficult but I learned a lot. She is passionate about what she teaches. BONUS: She has a super dope service dog that wanders the classroom.
ratingTags_Rating: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment_Rating: I absolutely loved taking Dr. Pollard's class. It was interesting, enjoyable, and I learned so much. However, if you are not prepared to read a full novel for a single class period (on multiple occasions), this class can be extremely challenging. Pollard requires a lot from you, but if you stick with it and try really hard, it's worth it.
ratingTags_Rating: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Tough grader

comment_Rating: Dr. Pollard is super unorganized and not that enjoyable of a lecturer. She grades very few things and I didnt learn anything new from her. The lectures are scattered and she complains about modern politics more than actually teaches.
ratingTags_Rating: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Get ready to read

comment_Rating: I loved Dr. Pollard and her class. The only take back is the amount of reading required. I felt I was just able to skim through the books on time if even that and she would only discuss them for one class and expect you to have done a detailed reading of it. I would of enjoyed the class more if she cut back on the amount and talked about them more.
ratingTags_Rating: Get ready to read--Participation matters--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment_Rating: My only complaint about Dr. Pollard is her expectations for readings. She assigns more than any other professor I've had - often a whole book that will only be discussed on one day of class. Otherwise though, she's great. I learned a ton and this class and she's hilarious. I'm taking her again next semester.
ratingTags_Rating: Get ready to read--Hilarious--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment_Rating: There is SO much reading assigned, including several books that must be procured that are NOT listed in the syllabus. Dr. Pollard is extremely passionate about her subject, but there is way too much material covered in the class--there's no way to retain it all. It's also heavily discussion-based, with a few other major grades.
ratingTags_Rating: Get ready to read--Participation matters--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment_Rating: Dr. Pollard's class was difficult, but I learned a lot and it was definitely worth it. We had a 15-page research paper for our final but she is willing to work with you and help you on it. We had pop quizzes over the readings so make sure you stay on top of them. She really connects history with current events well and makes the class interesting.
ratingTags_Rating: Participation matters--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Amazing lectures

comment_Rating: So many books for one semester. 8 books that I managed to get used for about $80, plus a large packet that she got printed which cost $75. One of the books was 600 pages. Many quizzes. Research paper at end of semester. Too much imo
ratingTags_Rating: Get ready to read--Participation matters--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment_Rating: Dr. Pollard was great! I took her for a maymester (RIP). The quizzes every day were tough, but the paper wasn't too bad, and neither was the presentation. She's really funny, especially if your political views match hers (mine do). Long lectures are usually hard for me to pay attention to, but I loved her lectures and had no issues staying engaged.
ratingTags_Rating: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment_Rating: Dr. Pollard was really smart and knew the material very well but she would lecture the entire class without stopping and it was difficult to take notes. Pop quizzes were over minute details from lecture and the reading. Her tests were 2 8 page papers that were assigned on Thursday and due Tuesday.
ratingTags_Rating: Tough Grader--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--LECTURE HEAVY

comment_Rating: Dr. Pollard is tough but knows her stuff. There are two papers and several pop quizzes (no final!), so be sure to always do the required reading she assigns to you and don't slack on the papers. Participation plays a huge part in the final grade so be sure to speak up whenever you can. If you're looking for an easy A, this isn't the class for you.
ratingTags_Rating: Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment_Rating: Dr. Pollard is incredibly knowledgable on her subject and very passionate about her students actually learning the material. There's quite a bit of reading and discussing in class is probably the most important thing in the course. Her quizzes are hard but she's lenient on grading. She's a wonderful human and professor. You'll be glad you took her!

Not my favorite Professor. The quizzes are difficult and are over material that is very specific. She did round up the grades for our class quite a bit. Lectures are a huge hit or a miss. She is hilarious, though, and her dog Cara is just the best.
ratingTags_Rating: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment_Rating: Dr. Pollard can seem like she is tough, but this is because she  just wants you to read and engage in class participation because she really is passionate about the subject. While classes could be a bit nerve wracking because you never knew if there would be a pop quiz, I was never once bored, and I learned a ton. I would definitely take her again.
ratingTags_Rating: Get ready to read--Participation matters--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment_Rating: Dr. Pollard is tough but genuinely cares about her students. I thought she was a fascinating professor and easy to talk to. She is funny and sarcastic. She knows her stuff

Dr. Pollard's FYO, while far more work intensive than most freshman odysseys, was interesting and funny. I actually learned a fair amount in the course, which says a fair amount about an FYO. The course required I read a small book, several articles, write a ten page paper, take several quizzes, and watch videos. A lot of work, but a good course.

While Dr. Pollard definitely was knowledgeable about this subject, her teaching methods weren't always as good. She was not always a very good communicator and we were often unsure what quizzes would be over. Also, I felt that when expressing her own political views/opinions, she would heavily criticize and make fun of other views besides her own.
ratingTags_Rating: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment_Rating: Dr. Pollard is a great professor. She is Irish so her humor tends to be very sarcastic, if you can't take a joke this class isn't for you. It is an upper level history course readings and papers are part of it! While the schedule can change she will not penalize you, and her due dates are flexible, if there are issues TALK to her!!!!!

I personally always enjoyed Dr. Pollard's classes. I always found her lectures entertaining and she often related past events to current issues. Make sure you can take a joke. You can tell she loves and is really knowledgable in her area of study and she brought out the best in me.

Awesome woman. She is really passionate and knowledgeable about the subjects she teaches. Funny, also likes to incorporate real world events into our discussions. Decent amount of reading and writing, but idk what else you would expect from an upper-level history class. She's even got a dog. 10/10!

Dr. Pollard probably isn't for everyone, but she's really an amazing woman, and incredibly knowledgeable in her field. Yes, you'll have to read books, yes you'll have to show up, but it's interesting stuff, and in today's world it's incredibly relevant too. This is upper level history...a couple papers and a final shouldn't be unexpected.

This class has an interesting subject matter and if you take the class seriously, you could actually have fun during discussions. I enjoyed the exposure to comedy, but I found myself frustrated with the lack of communication between professor and students. As for the paper, you can opt out and do a creative project if you think ahead and ask her.
ratingTags_Rating: Get ready to read--Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT

comment_Rating: I thought this class would be an interesting course where you actually learn about British humor but for the most part you watch videos and write papers. Sounds like fun when you watch videos but thats where I was fooled. She makes us finish the class writing a 15 page essay with a small topic that we aren't allowed to broaden whatsoever.

I took my FYOS is Dr. Pollard, thinking that the class would be enjoyable. I was incorrect. Every class she lit into us about how horrid our generation was and essentially how much we sucked. After a class that met maybe 5 times she assigns a 15 paged paper for our final grade. She is very intelligent and witty but overall did not click with her.
Worst professor I have ever had in college. Not helpful. Sure she knows her stuff not challenging that aspect by any means but she rarely teaches or outlines what is expected. 0% helpful AVOID!

Don't do it. I took History of Holocausts because I'm deeply interested in the subject, but she's unreasonably disorganized and intimidating. We had two extremely long essays and a final (which was horrifying). She's very knowledgeable, but she didn't return a single grade to me until the semester was over. Just don't do it.

I had her for History of Euro. Sexuality.  She is such an amazing prof!  So passionate about her job and cares a lot about her students!!  I know she doesn't have the best ratings, but ask yourself what you want from your time at UGA.  If you want to be able to participate in intellectual, analytical debate, she's the best!

I don't even know how to describe how awesome Dr.Pollard is! She may be the only professor who pushes you to think for yourself instead of mindless memorization.   She is always there for her students after class and I have literally spent hours in her office talking about politics, history, and life in general. I HIGHLY recommend her!!!

I can see where these comments are coming from,especially her liberal views, but don't be afraid to challenge her opinions.. She may actually respect you for it.  Have a sense of humor to match hers and don't get offended especially by the f-bomb at 8 am. She makes you think.

Dr Pollard thinks her opinion is the only correct one. She got huffy w/ me several times, and I genuinely feel as though she grades based on her opinion of you, NOT your work. She's unprofessional -- she cusses beyond belief (every other word). Once, she brought her dog into class, and when it had to vomit she asked a student to walk it. Horrible.

Took Dr. Pollard's class on the Holocaust.  I will say that she is very in your face liberal and as a conservative I took issue with her in the beginning.  But after we had it out over some issues, she seemed to love me.  I did well in the class by participating and being engaged.  Great professor and is accommodating if you put in equal effort

I should have listened to the comments on here before I signed up for this class. She never shows up for office hours, never returns emails, and there is no definite schedule.  I really did not like this class or this professor.

One of the best professors I've had at UGA. I took her June short session class about European Pop Culture and actually enjoyed and looked forward to attending class! Dr. Pollard is passionate and involved- we had great class discussions and took field trips to The Globe to watch some of the World Cup games. Definitely would recommend her class!

Worst teacher at UGA. I'm wondering if she creates names to give herself positive reviews. I have not met a single person who likes her (in person). Everyone I know HATED this class and hated her. She's not just in your face liberal, she is obnoxious with it and an extremist. She needs therapy.
Worst teacher I've ever had. I took her several semesters ago and HATED this class.

This class is absolutely amazing!  She is probably the best teacher I have had in college and I am planning on having her every semester until I graduate! She is hilarious, knows her**** and grades with a lot of empathy.  Yes, the class is really hard and you have to attend and do the reading, but it is life-changing and sooo much fun!

I have always love learning about the Holocaust and WWII. I took this course in Maymester. It was ALOT of reading, but doable. Class was really interesting and we watch movies and discussed alot of the time which made the class easier to sit. I would highly recommend this class. The teacher was HILARIOUS! Take this if you can!

She was definitely a nut, hilarious but a nut. She knew her stuff but her class was not organised I did not know a clue about my grade going into the final. She asks ridiculous questions from the readings that most felt were very unfair and gave huge quizzes with no time to finish. She knows she is tough so she doesnt grade hard but she IS crazy.

Alright, she is open in your face liberal. Big deal, I know plenty of convservatives who are the same way. I found it fascinating to listing to her go off on political tangents. As far as teaching goes. She knows her subject, she makes you look at history in a different way. My class only had a paper. She canceled the final, we turned in questions
Awful awful awful.  Hands down the most unethical prof. I've had in 6 years of grad school.  She is a disgrace.
Really toug,  but knew what she was talking about. Really eye opening.

This was a GLBT theory class back in 2005...I've never worked this hard, or gotten so much out of class. Dr. Pollard turns everything on its ear, and you have to learn to put it back together. When it's all said and done, you know that stuff COLD. Great discussion. Very accessible outside of class, not at all the norm at UGA.

Professor Pollard is a really challenging teacher, but freaking brilliant. She demands a lot in terms of amount and difficulty of work, and she pushes you to think about things in new ways. She can be inconsistent about getting tests, papers, etc back to you, but if you make an appointment to see her one-on-one, you gets lots of helpful feedback.
awesome!

Dr. Pollard is very intolerant of any opinion other than her own.  She rarely shows up to her office hours.  (I've stopped by three or four times during her posted hours and she was never there.)  She also doesn't return all of your papers.

Worst of the worst.  Miserable lady who uses her position as a bully-pulpit for her far (WAY far) left views.  Blows off office hours on whim, and may or may not show for class.  Little tolerance for any view that is not her own, and will blow her top if challenged.  Best advice for her class:  AVOID IT!
Worst. Teacher. Ever.
No Comments

worst experience of my life. Definently chooses favorites..and if she likes you one day it DOES NOT mean she will like you tomorrow. Will try to make you conform to her extreme whack-job-liberal views and if you dont - watch out. She will most definently attempt to tell you what is wrong with you and how to "fix it". Avoid at all costs. BAD PROF.

Nice lady but a bad Prof. She never is in her office when she tells you to come by. Never has a plan for lecture. Rambles on about things unrelated to the course for forty or fifty minutes a class period. Is always late. Oh and she lost every single assignment that we students turned in! So she has decided to give everyone an 'A' up till the final!

Interesting to know Dr. Pollard is still around, pulling the same tactics. I had her for Gay and Lesbian Studies back in 1995- I made an A in the class, and learned nothing. I don't think she is at all interested in whether her students think for themselves; she wants everyone to regurgitate her view. Easy A, if you can stomach how to get it.

For students interested in 20th Century European history, Dr. Pollard is a must-have. She has a talent for motivating students to invest serious interest in the topics of study. Reading material is manageable and attentiveness during class discussions will enable students to obtain an A without much outside study. She's got a great sense of humor!

What a joke. My friends warned me about her and they were right.  If you do not conform to her p-o-v, she gets extremely angry and punitive.  The woman misses class like crazy and forget about office hours.  She is by far the worst professor I ever had.  How does she manage to keep her job?

This professor missed nearly 1/3 of her classes with little or no warning.  She stood up students during scheduled individual meeting times, as well.  I'm in WMST because I take the area seriously - obviously she does not take teaching about it seriously at all.  Classes were more like conversation hours than academic pursuits.  What a pointless A.
No Comments

Great teacher!  Miranda was always willing to me with me after class to talk.  The classes were loads of fun and I learned a great deal without having to worry about my grade all the time like some classes
Dr. Pollard is a hard teacher, but she gets you really interested in the subject and challenges you to think in new ways. She's very funny.
Love Professor Weinburg!So friendly he invited our class to his house once and cooked a great meal for us! Engineering is a breeze if you just go to class and listen :)
Work hard, go to class on time,and you will understand the material, and warrant help outside of class if you need it. Professor Weinberg is tough but fair.
No Comments
A teacher who is very stubborn and not willing to help out students in need.

Overall a ok class. During class it just them going over the lecture, at first it was not posted on elc but because the class did so bad on the first exam they started putting the lectures on elc. Also some of the test question are specific and random. However your lowest exam score is drop, so that this nice.
ratingTags_Rating: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment_Rating: Dr. Giraudo was an extremely sweet woman and I enjoyed being in her class. Her lectures were a bit boring but if you took notes and studied, the three tests weren't too bad. Random attendance checks for and three easy assignments help boost grades.
ratingTags_Rating: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment_Rating: Dr. Giraudo is a good professor, but her lectures and slides can be disorganized and hard to understand. For the most part, she reads straight off the slides. The class is made up of 3 (easy) assignments, 3 tests (one is dropped), a cumulative final, and 10 random attendance checks. Not a hard class, but can be a bit boring at times.
ratingTags_Rating: Clear grading criteria--Caring--Graded by few things

comment_Rating: Was one of the worst professors I have ever had. Read straight off the slides and was hard to understand because her mic was never turned up. I went to her to ask for help since I was not doing the best in her class and she would not help me. Be prepared to study a lot for her exams unless you are a good guesser.

The class was just a little boring since Dr. Giraudo just read off the slides, which she posted, but the exams were better than I thought they would be. I really did not enjoy the case studies, but the SDPs were not bad. Dr. Giraudo is really sweet overall, I just don't think she's the best professor!
ratingTags_Rating: Group projects--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment_Rating: lectures do not equate to the test material. lectures are messy and unorganized and she just reads right off the slides

Dr. Giraudo is overall a solid professor. Class material is somewhat difficult because its a lot of memorization of pretty specific things. Moves a little fast in lecture so make sure to pay attention. She is caring to circumstances you may have. 3 assignments (not hard), 3 exams (one dropped) and final. Random attendance checks.
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Caring

comment_Rating: FDNS 2100 is a difficult as Dr. Giraudo does not post lecture slides and she does not review before tests. Her 3 tests are over way too much material and if you do not get it the first time she does not like to go back and help you. The course is also heavy in biology, which is not a prerequisite for the course. The final is cumulative :(
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment_Rating: Each class is a heavy lecture and her PowerPoints are somewhat unorganized. However, she is good with responding to students and knows what she is talking about. She has an accent but you can still understand her; the hardest part is that the tests cover a ton of material but if you study enough, you will be fine. Attendance is extra credit!

Her accent is extremely hard to understand, especially over a zoom class. The tests are easy if you listen to the lectures, but this class is pretty much 100% lecture based. Dont buy the textbook, it is useless. She is a nice person, but I will not take her again because I felt like I was teaching myself in this class.

Professor Giraudo is so sweet, and this class will be lecture and note heavy no matter who your professor is. BUT, the way she presents her notes is very unorganized, you will discuss a topic, leave it, then go back 20 minutes later. Makes for taking quality notes very difficult, which is a huge disadvantage for such a note-heavy class.
ratingTags_Rating: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Get ready to read

comment_Rating: Her lectures are extremely boring. The tests are hard. She randomly takes attendance for extra credit so it is important to go to class. I would not recommend.
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment_Rating: Boring lectures . Tests are hard. A lot of information. Would not recommend for this course.

Ok professor. Accent not a problem for me. Tests kind of all over the place, and a lots of notes to sort through. No specification of what specifically going to be on the exams, just a jumble of lots of lecture notes and videos. Wouldn't reccomend if you had a really full schedule, because the exams require a lot of studying. Attendance is EC.
ratingTags_Rating: TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment_Rating: I definitely recommended taking this class with Dr. Giraudo. You mostly just have to go to class and take notes, the tests are straight forward, and attendance gives you lots extra credit. There's also only a handful of easy reading assignments. Dr. Giraudo is so sweet and very laid back and makes this class easy.
ratingTags_Rating: GRADED BY FEW THINGS--EXTRA CREDIT--LECTURE HEAVY

comment_Rating: Professor Giraudo is a very sweet professor and she has always been understanding and attentive anytime I have had questions after class. She doesn't post her PPs online so make sure you go to class to get the notes. She flies fast through notes so taking pictures of the slides then filling in notes later has been helpful for me.

There is a lot of unnecessary material in the textbook, and you are really only tested over what is lectured. Slides are not posted, so attendance helps a lot and gives you extra credit. Online homework was a big portion of the grade and due on random days. She is knowledgeable and the tests were fair. She was also easy to email and understanding.

Dr. Giraudo has an accent and It can be hard to understand her at times, but she is a very sweet teacher who cares about all her students. The tests are pretty much based off the lectures, so it's heavy memorization!!!

She is a good professor. The lectures are interesting, but her accent can lead to some confusion in the notes. She takes attendance 10 random days, but these only count as bonus points. There is 3 test and a final for pretty much all of your grades, which is what made the class a little more difficult.
ratingTags_Rating: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment_Rating: Lectures were pretty boring overall, but the tests are based 100% on the lectures so make sure your notes are thorough. She also does not upload her ppt's onto ELC so it makes it hard to review for tests if your notes are not the best. Not a hard class as long as you put forth minimum effort. Will do random attendance only for bonus points.

Show up to all the classes and take down the notes and you'll do fine. She takes attendance occasionally, but it's best to go to class because at the end of the semester the attendance counts towards extra credit points! Tests are based off of notes during class so if you don't go to class one day, make sure you get the notes from a friend.

Case studies are easy A's. Tests are hard, but you get to drop one. Attendance is extra credit. Class is taking notes from power points with occasional guest speakers. I never used my text book. You do need to know everything in the notes. Going to class is very important to get all the notes.

She doesn't speak English well.  Her power points are disorganized.  She doesn't answer questions in class well.  Her tests are very hard and she asks application questions when she doesn't teach us how to apply the knowledge she teaches us.  It was the hardest class I took this semester and I dreaded going to her class.
Great teacher. Take notes over power points and study those for test. Not an easy A, but certainly possible.
She basically creates power Pts aNd reads from then. Don't buy the book you never open it once. Not a hard class. Just memorizing

The class is really easy for the most part. We finally convinced her to give us the powerpoints so we didn't have to copy all of them by hand. Tests pretty much come from them but sometimes you can't understand her so I would still recommend reading the book for clarity. Gives three "projects" which are easy to get full points to boost your grade.

It's the most boring class ever, but it's not terribly difficult.  However, the tests are somewhat hard because some of the questions are worded very ambiguously/grammatically incorrect, so it's confusing.  And some of the stuff on her tests are not in the notes, only the textbook, which no one bothers reading.

Notes are copied from powerpoint, tests are straight from notes but there is definitely a LOTTT to memorize for each test- a LOT. so start studying early. if you know anyone who has taken the class, def borrow their old exams- will help tons. her projects are really easy & the final is from the old tests! i found this class very interesting!

Class consists of copying down powerpoints. Study your notes and you will do fineon test... tests are 50 questions all multiple choice. Seems like a lot of material to memorize but i start studying 2-3 days before and memorize it all easily. easy projects.. taking notes on laptop is helpful. easy A or B class! did not use textbook so dont waste $$
Uses power points, but doesn't post them on webct.  It was kind of interesting, but really the only reason I went to class was because I had to get the notes.

Do not take this class if you are looking for an "easy a". Her tests are too specific; you practically have to memorize about 200 lecture slides for one test. Its ridiculous! Her lectures are very boring too,she justs reads off and no one listens i only went b/c she randomly gives 2pts extra credit. the material is pretty interesting though.

Her accent can be difficult to understand. This class is not bad at all. She gives you 20 points for random attendance. The projects are easy and you dont have to take notes because she puts them on webct.
Not hard, heavy accent. Just bring something to do in class and take all the notes and you will be fine. Very nice teacher though!
She has an annoying thick accent, but class is not hard.

She's a sweet woman, but she doesn't make a whole lot of sense. I wouldn't recommend her. She's not a hard teacher, but she doesn't explain things very well, and that's kind of important in math. Math is my favorite subject so I usually understand it, but not with her.

I thought she was a decent teacher. She doesn't really know the English language that well, but she tries hard, and if you go to class, pay attention to the example problems, and don't half-ass your homework, you'll do fine.

Very sweet, I agree she does not speak very good English but she does help you if you ask and does not hestitate to answer any questions during class or at her office hours. She really wants to help her students.
she is nice, and lets you go to her office to correct your quizzes... for full points... and gives you basically the exact problems as the tests, but she NO SPEAKEY DA ENGLISH !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

I love math but this teacher made it one of my least favorite subjects. Not only can she not speak English, she often goes a whole class without looking at the students to see if they understand. (Most of the time everyone in the class had the confused look on their face.) I recommend to everyone stay for away from this teacher.
No Comments
If you speak English, do not take this class.  It is extremely hard to understand her; however, she is very sweet, and she does make an effort to help her students.

OK she basically doesn't speak English. Very difficult to understand but the class is fairly easy if you get help from the Calculus OPEN LAB.  I only go to class to turn in lab reports because as I said she can't speak English.
Take this class! Dr. Gold is a great professor and really cared about the students. His tests were very straightforward and if you go to class (and his review sessions), then you will be fine.

Professor Gold is an amazing person. He is a very easy teacher who is very clear in what he expects from his students. Classroom environment is always very focused in discussion and you definitely do not wanna miss class as TurningPoint questions happen every class. He does not assign too much work either. Definitely take him if you can!!!

This man is by far one of the most sweetest, caring professor I have ever had. Due to the class being moved online, he was very thoughtful and truly cared about our well being. The class is not hard, study the powerpoints and you'll be fine tbh. Turningpoint is used everyday. If you get the chance to take this class with him, go for it!
He genuinely cares about his students. The class is really informative and interesting. Dr. Gold, I hope you're doing well and staying healthy. I am so sad the class is moved online :(
easy BUT it doesn't mean that you don't have to study STUDY and it is going to be an easy A
Dr. Gold is awesome. He is always helpful and very laid-back. Loves to crack jokes and make doing the actual lab work tons of fun. Great personality and very intelligent guy.

Gold is a great professor, laid back with fairly easy tests. He really makes fungi interesting and fun and I learned so much about something I had little knowledge of prior to his class. If you need a science elective, Gold is the way to go! Attendance is not mandatory but he does have 6 attendance quizzes of which he counts 5.

Love love love Dr. Gold! His test are on the easy side and really fair. He makes fungi interesting. This class is an enjoyable easy A. Also, if you are interested in research he will set you up if you just ask.

Gold is the best!! Before this class I had no interest in mushrooms or fungi in general, but now I find all of it so interesting! The class is really laid back, attendance is optional but he does give five random attendance grades. Tests aren't bad  just make sure to study the powerpoint. loved this class
He is extremely funny and helpful. Class is very laid back but you do have to study for test a good bit. Still, a great teacher!
Very funny and laid back in class
Fun class. There were some curveballs on tests, but it was not a hard course. If you go to class you will do fine.

He is very organized and friendly. You don't need textbook, he has powerpoint class notes. If you attend his class regularly and study his notes, you will be fine. He makes his class more interesting by bringing in movies and fungi specimens. His test are easy if u study notes and attend class regularly. I would recommend taking him for this class.

I really enjoyed what could have been another bland lab class thanks to Dr. Gold.  While there wasn't a text book, he provided power point slides that covered everything you needed to know for exams.  He kept he material up to date and lighthearted, and he was helpful in and out of class.  Overall, I thought he was a great professor.

he's really disorganized and that makes his tests difficult to prepare for.  lectures sometimes interesting but he gets on lots of tangents. no book to purchase.  very specific on his tests about what he said in lecture.  i hope you really like fungi if you take this class

Scott Gold was one of the top five WORST professors I have ever had in my life. He was totally unclear and hardly ever came to class, yet tested us over tricky material. Advice, take this class with Dr. Mims or someone else.
He's quite wacky, but a nice guy and very willing to help if you are willing to listen.

Brad is a really good prof. His class on terrorism is fantastic! It's a good deal of reading, his tests are detailed and the final paper is grueling. But, there is no book and he makes his finals optional. He is very funny and makes his class enjoyable. Take 4410 if you can!
Easy going guy, easy to talk to. You won't feel scrutinized for sharing your opinion. Turns out, easy grader too. Also, pretty hot.
Great teacher...keeps you entertained...I would take another class with him...just watch out for the pop quizes

This was a really great class. I learned a lot and the class was never boring; the tests weren't too hard and the paper wasn't bad to write. He's really funny and easy to relate to - the best of the intl profs I've had so far.
GO TO CLASS, READ THE READINGS, LISTEN TO LECTURE, PARTICIPATE, TAKE NOTES ON LECTURE, GET AN A.  BRAD IS ONE COOL DUDE.
No Comments
No Comments
Great guy!  He's very easy going and approachable.  I learned so much from this class and highly recommend this professor.

Goen is great professor.I took Comm. 122, Interpersonal. He throughly explains things and is willing to go into detail when asked.  His test are designed to be complicated, however if you really study hard for them, you will do just fine. He gives pop quizzes so you always have to be up to date with the readings

I really enjoyed attending classes; Goen is a great lecturer. The tests were extremely difficult. His tests cover a lot of application questions, so knowing definitions is not enough to do well. It's important to read the book assignments because he usually will give pop quizzes over the material, and those quiz grades add up!

His lectures are interesting, but the exams are so hard and specific. Half the stuff that is on the test isn't even in the lectures. Instead, you have to read the textbook word for word. The TAs also graded the paper really hard. This was the class I stressed the most in, and I would recommend a different professor.
Dont take him anybody else?

I'm a senior spcm major and had to backtrack to take this class and WISH I'd taken it with someone else! I have A's in all my other SPCM classes and a C in this one! His lectures are interesting, but his tests are INCREDIBLY difficult. I don't expect easy at UGA, but I do expect my intro level classes to be easier than my 4000 level classes!
His class is tough but fair.  He is very helpful.  If you make the effort, you'll get a lot out of his class.

good teacher. not easy though, but if you want easy go to a community college. Knows his stuff and will be very helpful especially if you go to class and do what you are supposed to. very personable and even though the class is challenging its interesting stuff and very useful.
pretty good teacher--  his test questions come directly from the small amt of notes taken in class which makes it pretty simple.  he wants you to do well in his class---
Grades way to hard on papers!!  Also, looks for very specific answers with short answer test questions.  Multiple Choice could be tricky.  I'd pick someone else

Dr. Hamilton is probably one of the most knowledgeable professors in the entire department, and really does a great job with lectures. However, he can personally be belittling at times. He is a tough, but fair grader & does a good job of introducing you to subject matter. Just lacks any personal touch.
ratingTags_Rating: Beware of pop quizzes--Amazing lectures--Tough grader

comment_Rating: Pray you get a good TA!!! GO TO CLASS! No attendance but 5 pop quizzes given to the semester. 2 papers, not too bad but make sure you understand the prompt and put in effort! Lectures can be boring but if you attend and pay the least bit of attention you should pass the 3 unit tests + final which is matching, mc, and two "short" answers

Do not take! I know this class is required, but take it elsewhere! This class is way too hard for a history class! If I can make A's on all english essays, there is NO REASON why I should be struggling to make a passing grade on the essays in this class. He takes extremely too long to release grades also. Steer clear and take someone else!
Grades harder on the writing than any Lit. class i have taken especially since most people take it because it is required.

Really engaging lecturer, but TOUGH grader. He has high expectations for writing- you have to put in a LOT of effort for an A. B is definitely manageable if you study hard and put a lot of effort into your work. It would be hard to pass this class if you don't regularly attend.

His lectures are easy to follow. Only 3 tests including the final and none of them are cumulative. He gives random lecture quizzes so attendance is pretty important. Discussion sections are nice. 2 papers and he gives study guides for the tests.

I am literally trying my hardest to pull out a C in this class. He changed the tests and they are five times harder than what is on here. Our first test average for a 300 person class was a C-. Our second test average was a C. Not an easy class and so much information.

I loved Dr. Hamilton's class (an Honors Seminar on the History of the American Dream.)  There was a fair amount of reading, but it was all interesting and it's an upper-level history class so what else are you expecting?  Fair grader, gives lots of feedback on essays, and very organized.  Definitely take his class if you like this kind of history!

I loved Hamilton. He gives you a outline of notes that you have to fill in while he lectures. He has pop quizzes in class and every week over the documents in the breakout. The papers are graded hard because he cares most about that but if you make a google doc for the test you should do very well on the test (MC, matching, & 5 SA). Take Hamilton.

Take Hamilton if you're bad a history!!!! He gives you a study guide to fill out for each exam, absolutely no surprises. Make a google doc of the study guide and share it with the entire class. Ask everyone to contribute here and there and before you know it, you've got a complete study guide. Know the answers and you'll get an A.

At the beginning I didn't love this class, but by the end I have to say it was my favorite this semester. He cares about you learning and appears enthusiastic about subject matter. I learned so much and now feel competent in any US history since 1865-related argument. HIGHLY recommend!

His lectures are very interesting! He has a lot of passion and tries to make class fun. Tests are hard but fair- he gives a list of 30 terms to study and 15 are on the exam. Papers can be challenging, but office hours with your TA can be very helpful. The readings for discussion are sometimes long but the quizzes each week are pretty basic.

One of the most intellectual professors on campus who makes history exciting. He's structured, passionate, and devoted to seeing his students succeed. His tests are relatively straining, but if you read the assignment material and study in advance you will succeed.

The most amazing prof I've had in the past 2 years at college. Highly intelligent and also entertaining/funny. Lectures were absolutely fascinating. Like you're in the story. Reading is necessary, but going to class is even more important, b/c his lectures are so chock full of info you should know. 5 random attendance checks; you can miss 1.
Hamilton is a great lecturer, easy to listen to and take notes on. A lot of how easy the class is will depend on your TA. The tests are easy as long as you study, and the papers aren't bad.

Professor Hamilton's class is the big lecture hall class you hear about before college. The tests are straightfoward and require you to study for about 3-4 hours the night before to memorize all the terms. The papers are strictly graded and my TA didn't provide any feedback. Hamilton is very interesting and tells you what you should know.

A very interesting lecturer. You need to get a good T.A. If you don't the class won't do you well. He posts study guides a week before the tes which are very helpful! I enjoyed this class overall but was graded hard on my writing assignments.

I hated American History UNTIL I took this class with Hamilton. Lectures were interesting and he throws in a few good jokes to keep you awake. Tests are easy IF you do his study guides. There are 3 papers which could be either easy or hard depending on the TA you have. Hamilton is one of the best professors I have ever had!

Had him for both History of Technology & Modern American History (both upperlevel). Really makes you think about thinks, and just not memorize terms. Really great teacher, but can be rude at times (but i dont think its intentional)

I had absolutely no interest in history until I took this class. Hamilton really enjoys what he teaches and it makes it more interesting. He gives study guides so the tests are easier than most other classes and I barely even looked at my textbook and made an A. He is by far the best teacher I have had in college.

I always looked forward to class because Hamilton is fantastic lecturer. However, this isn't an easy class--it really helps to read the text book, put effort into the response papers, and complete the study guides.

Hamilton was a great lecturer but spoke very fast, the outlines were helpful. His study guides were clear as to what was going to be on the exam and easy but only if you STUDY. This wasn't an awful course but if don't like history it could be.

Hamilton is amazing. He is a wonderful lecturer and makes history incredibly interesting. Not to mention he's pretty easy on the eyes. He is very clear about what he wants from you for assignments (which is my preferred teaching style). Very humorous jokes. Not afraid to speak his mind or share his political views through use of wit and sarcasm.

The class was what I expected of a college history course: challenging. Very helpful posts, great lectures/notes, textbooks & outside books great reads. Dr. Hamilton was not 'pretentious', he knew what he was talking about and wasn't afraid to share his opinions. Tests EASY if you STUDY. Papers graded hard. He's easy on the eyes too...

This class wasn't easy.  Dr. Hamilton gives clear instructions for what he wants and if you follow them, you will make an A. You have to go to class because there are pop quizzes but they are simple. If you went to class the day before you will easily answer the questions.  There is a study guide that tells you EXACTLY what is on the tests.

Hamilton can be a jerk, but the problem with this class is the TA's. You can be a traditionally good writer like myself, take this class, and get 80's on all your essays because you're not doing what the TA's WANT. Argh

AVOID!!! This guy is rude when you visit him, he gives pop quizzes and if you get one question wrong, its a 33. My TA was clueless and the writing assignments are based on what HE wants you to think not your own thoughts. TRASH!!

very fair. gives you a study guide with EXACTLY what you need to know, if you've had IDs before, you'll do well in this class. Papers are difficult though... I never used the history text book but we used the reader every week.

The most pretentious teacher I've ever had. He makes snide remarks when you ask questions and writes that the purpose of footnotes is to "democratize the process of doing history." What the heck does that even mean?

He definitely knows what the he's talking about & is funny at times. It's a lecture class so attendance isn't mandatory, but I would recommend going if you don't want to fail pop quizzes and want to pass the tests (so..you should go). Pay attention, take notes, and use his study guides and the tests aren't bad.

It really isn't as bad as i thought... there's a ton of notes every day but just go to lecture and take notes and read the assigned reading every week. He gives a study guide for every test- know that and you'll be fine.

Very good lecturer who clearly knows his material. Good sense of humor. Make sure you attend lecture because he does not lecture from the book and there will be info on the tests. Breakout sections are useless. TA's grade unfairly. Good overall experience.

Very arrogant teacher. Has the nerve to post "How to Read" and "How to Write" sections on WebCT, like we're all 10 year olds with no experience writing. On top of that, those postings are useless as well. The writing are graded unfairly and unclearly. This guy has an air of confidence about himself that can't be ignored

Great lecturer with easy to follow outlines always posted on WebCT, but don't skip. His lectures always include info not in the book or on his outlines. Breakout is terrible, don't miss and make sure you do all the reading because there are pop quizzes. KNOW the study guides for tests and  you'll do great! Enjoyable class, and I hate history.

Good professor. Lectures were boring but definately necessary to get a good grade in the class. That said, the test study guides are very thorough and give all of the vocabulary that would be used on the exams. I would recommend taking this class to anyone interested in history because Hamilton gives alot of interesting extra information.
very boring, lectures useless. my ta (ben) was very good and interesting. dr hamilton tried to be funny but he wasnt, tests werent easy.

He gives very interesting lectures that made me somewhat interested in U.S. history. There are two major writing assigments and two tests plus a final exam. You can get by without going to class because most of the tests are text book derived, but some terms are only mentioned in class. Overall, there is alot of work but its not too difficult.
Class lectures are useless--the tests contain terms found mainly in the text. Otherwise, if you read, you should be fine.
He is an amazing teacher. Can be rather rude towards lazy students but he respects students who work hard. His tests are hard but gives good study guides. He's very funny also.

He is a great lecturer, and does come out as pretencious sometimes because he is smart and knows it. He kows his stuff and teaches it very well. His test are quite demanding since they were all essays, but he gave detailled study guides which were helpful and could get you an A if you actually do them.
BORING. . very lame class. . this MIT grad expects ALOT. . the tests are fairly difficult. . alot depends on the T.A. that you get.  I didnt like the class :(

I'll give him credit - he's an AMAZING lecturer. However, tests are NOTHING but essays, and he's pretty strict on grading. Study guides are always given, and are very helpful. And discussion sections are gold (well, I guess if you have a good TA)...

This man is pretentious and thinks much too highly of himself.  Yes, his lectures were easy to listen to and follow, however, he's definitely NOT hot and definitely has a lot to learn about teaching.  He says ridiculous things in class as well.  This course required a good deal of work, although it wasn't always incredibly difficult.

He is a great lecturer...makes history interesting. His tests are quite difficult especially if you aren't a writer. This class requires a lot of writing (about once a week)...but you do learn a lot from it.

Hamilton is definitely the very best professor in the UGA History Department.  Not only is he entertaining but also very knowledgeable. He may seem at first to be intimidatingly smart, but he is surprisingly down to earth during his office hours. The man has earned everything he's got.  Do not pass up taking one of his classes.
Was a really good teacher, made me more interested in history.
Dr. Hamilton is truly an amazing lecturer, and he definitely knows what he is talking about.

Professor Hamilton is an up and coming teacher, fresh out of college. His lectures are excellent and really keep your attention. The class, however, is insane in terms of writing( at least once a week). His tests are incredibly lengthy and difficult, but I pulled an A-. Try him if you can do the work, cause he really is fair.

Dr. Hamilton is a great professor and very good looking. His lectures are interesting. your grade depends a lot on your TA. His exams are all essay. he gives out an identification sheet before each test and if you know the IDs you should be able to make a B on the test. reading responses each week, but they're really easy.
Dr. Hamilton is an AMAZING lecturer... very witty and holds your interest. However, sometimes the tests essays can be difficult... this class requires a LOT of writing.
No Comments

The best professor I've had so far. Very chill, laid back and lectures are very fun. Willing to help with assignments and understands difficulties outside of class. As long as you do the work, you're set.

I love this guy, he's funny and makes lectures very interesting. Many online pair projects but easy to get 100s on them. Prepare for class every day and study beforehand and you're set. Take him take him take him!

Span 1110 is a high-rigor course in itself, but Omar did his best to make the material palatable and engaging. I felt that he sometimes singled out people who did not perform well in the class, but other than that he was a good professor. He gives good feedback and has clear expectations. Accessible and helpful. Don't be afraid to ask questions

Omar is great. He really cares about his students and is willing to listen and work with you with any questions you have - he wants you to succeed. The Spanish curriculum itself is just the same for UGA across the board, so he doesn't have a lot of say in what to teach, but he does a good job of trying to make lectures interesting/engaging.
He's a cool guy that cares about helping you learn. This class is really easy and if you at least try to learn some spanish you'll be great.

Prof Omar was a great guy, pretty funny and was clearly passionate about teaching. His class was definitely tough and he was a harsh grader, but it helps you learn more and the class is still manageable if you get your stuff done.

Overall a solid choice for Spanish. He keeps you engaged by calling on people and doing small activities. The McGraw Connect HW is a little tedious, but it is the same with all 1110 sections. He grades fairly and is pretty moderate with taking off points. Solid pick for SPAN 1110.
Do all the assignments and speak up in class, and you should get an A. He's an awesome professor but his class requires some participation and interest.

Average. A stickler for grading. The class isn't that challenging but he does EVERYTHING by the book so it's very monotonous. I wouldn't necessarily say don't take him. The course is just repetitive. I didn't learn many new things. He's a pretty harsh grader. Hard to make an A.
WORST GRADER EVER! helps you in class a little but does not know anything about teacher and student relationships. Will not tell you anything about upcoming grades or anything!

Grades very, very harsh.  Everyone in class struggled.  Can't understand us when we ask questions in english about our grades or assignments.  Goes straight by the book, so you learn nothing except some grammar.
VERY hard grader, goes on irrelevant tangents, doesn't explain things well, thinks he's funny, TERRIBLE TEACHER

Omar is so great! I had taken AP Spanish in high school so I may have had a slight advantage in this class, but I found it pretty easy. He's definitely a funny and entertaining guy. Class time is chill and very conversation-oriented. Read the lecturas, do the Quia, and don't be afraid to ask for help. He's a good guy.

Really REALLY tough grader.  I struggled all semester and the midterm did me in.  He just goes over activities in class and doesn't exactly teach the material to where you are comfortable with it for the tests.  I know a lot of people in my class struggled. Unless this is your major, DONT take Omar, too much stress over a class that i dont enjoy.

I enjoyed Gil-Perez! He pries into people's lives a bit in order to get the class talking. He's funny and very approachable. I recommend him! The only tough parts of the class are the many reading quizzes. My average on these quizzes were LOW..but they only take up 5% of your final grade don't worry :)

Omar was so great- he's such a nice guy and really funny. Like everyone said, he's a tough grader, but he lets you correct your compositions for a higher grade. Make sure you read the lecturas because he does pop quizzes VERY specific questions. I would recommend him as long as you're willing to study.

Omar is a great guy, really understanding, funny and sweet. But he does not understand the level of this course. It is FAR TOO DIFFICULT the way he grades it. Reading quizzes are miserable. I got an A- but was surprised I managed that. He's tough and a harsh grader. I wouldn't reccomend him..
He's a very funny guy.  But for 3010 he's by far the hardest grader, DO NOT TAKE HIM. Look at UGA KEY and see for yourself... but like i said he is very funny and pretty cool

Omar is a very funny guy, but he grades very hard.  He abides by the "class average must be a C" philosophy so the exams and presentations are graded very harshly. IF YOU NEED AN A in spanish 3010, DO NOT TAKE HIM, in fact go ahead and drop out of his class, Thats what i did when i realized i was doomed for a B in there

It was a difficult class and somewhat challenging, but Omar is a great teacher. It takes a while to get warmed up to him, but he's an awesome teacher. He gives pop quizzes on the readings, so read up on them, but otherwise, he's an awesome teacher.
Funny guy, but extremely hard grader. This class requires lots of effort. If you're not fluent or near fluent in Spanish, don't take him. Way too difficult.

Omar is a really funny guy and his class is usually pretty interesting. We do a lot of exercises in class that aren't really that helpful, though. He's a good guy that seems pretty willing to help if you need it. I would recommend him, but he is kind of a hard grader, so be prepared to work for your A.

Omar is a very fun teacher who gives hardly any homework.  His grading is very fair.  He is very organized and goes straight from his day-by-day syllabus - no surprises.  He does speak almost all in Spanish, so some people have a hard time understanding him.  Omar has a great sense of humor and loves to inquire about everyone's love life.

Omar is very funny, in a slightly off-centered way, but definetly funny. He keeps you on your toes. The workload is pretty easy, though QUIA is frustrating. The class is very conversational which keeps things fun. He grades tough on essays and oral exams, but is fair. Very helpful. Overall I very much recommend him!

Omar is hilarious. He made 8AM MWF worth it. He grades very harshly on tests, compositions, and oral presentations but is not unfair in any way. He is extremely goofy and even though there is homework every night the class is conversation based to say the least which makes it fun. Loved his class and did fairly well, you'll be fine if you do work.
I loved taking Omar's class! He is funny, entertaining, and a great teacher! Follow the syllabus to learn the material and you'll make an A!

Omar is great! I really enjoyed coming to his class. He's a little weird, but it's entertaining, and his class is very relaxed and conversation based. And he is hilarious! He grades tough, but not unfairly. I would HIGHLY recommend taking him. You will be more than prepared for future Spanish classes!

While Omar is an entertaining in-class teacher, his class is extremely hard for this level.  He gives many random quizzes on homework and readings, and his attendance policy is very strict.  Do not expect any lenience on oral grading, or any lenience on late assignments.  I would highly recommend taking a different teacher if you want an A.

This is one of the best teachers I have had. Not only is he a great teacher, but he is really funny and made going to Spanish at 8am on Monday, Wednesday, and Friday bearable. You get about 4 excused absences, but he makes you want to go to class, so it really is no problem. Get him! He is great!
He is amazing. GET HIM!!
I love this guy!  Got him first thing at 8am in the morning ( i know, Im nuts).  Attendance is important.  He is hilarious and puts me in a great mood for the day
If you want to take a quiz EVERY week, take him... He is very VERY punctual, so he wants his students to do the same.I really DON'T recommend him at all.

Omar's a good teacher but I had a hard time understanding his Spanish and I'm pretty good at it! He is so ANAL about attendance! He'll count you absent even if you're a few minutes tardy! There are pop quizzes every week! I made an A- but if you DO NOT have time to worry about his Spanish class every second of the semester, DON'T TAKE HIS CLASS.

He's a very fair teacher. Young and tries to Americanize himself but happy to tell stories about Peru. I would have gotten a much better grade if I had studied more/harder. Just pay attention, keep up, study and ask questions and you'll be fine. Not an easy A but not hard either.

I think the every person in my class (except those with bad attendence) recieved an A with hardly any effort.  He is extremely laidback, and had no issue with moving test dates or paper due dates around at our request.  GET OMAR!!

the last person does not know what they are talking about he gives you a study guide on webct that you review in class which happens to be the exact quiz. the tests are simply a review of these quizzes which you have. a really nice guy who makes spanish a fun class by asking questions and trying to fit in as an American. little work required

He's really apathetic about his students and his students' grades.  Overall the class was boring and his grading was too harsh.  I was planning on minoring in Spanish but he made me hate it so much.  Don't take him!

He was a great teacher & very helpful--Just study and you'll be fine.   I would have definitely gotten an A if I had just worked a little harder on studying for the tests/compositions...so, as long as you keep up, you'll be fine.

Dr. Lessel was very knowledgeable, but he was very boring. When it comes to grades, 5 quizzes, two speeches, and a HUGE packet at the end due. It really wasn't a bad class, just very drawn out since he was boring.
Had him for comm 2150H. Very good talker, funny, and care about his students!

Dr. Lessl is by far my favorite professor I've had at UGA. He cares so much about Comm and his students and has improved my writing and speaking exponentially. This class will be WORTH YOUR TIME 100%. I had it at 3:30 on TR and literally never minded going. Two speech proposals, two speech drafts, two speeches. Best class, best teacher. TAKE him.

Dr. Lessl, obviously, is a smart guy. He is also sort of funny and a super nice person. However, if you are looking for an A to raise your GPA, or an easy A to keep your 4.0 like I was, THEN RUN THE OTHER WAY AND DON'T LOOK BACK. You must have access to technology to pass. This has been the absolute worst college experience I have ever had. RUNNNN!
ratingTags_Rating: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment_Rating: Lessl's class was interesting. You don't really have to pay attention to his lectures to be able to handle this class, as it is a public speaking class basically. I enjoyed his rants, and he genuinely made an effort to connect with students. The tests were just revising paragraphs. He is particular about speech topics, however.
Lessl's lectures are so interesting but they are the whole class period. Type everything he says and do not miss anything. Pay attention and study, I learned so much. 1010 would take again

Lessl was a great teacher! His tests ARE hard, but he was very accommodating and actually gave us a choice of a multiple choice or essay test for the final. If he gives you this choice, TAKE THE ESSAY! If you know the material, then the essay will be MUCH easier (no tricky multiple choice). He is VERY intelligent and knows what he's talking about.

Not easy. He lectures every class and he talks for so long its hard to pay attention.  Lectures are ur only source for notes too so if u miss or dont pay attention u are screwed.  Has quizes over his lectures every week.  Tests were very hard. a lot of times i knew what each option was but didnt know what the question was asking. Nice guy though.

Lessl is one of the most intelligent professors I've ever had. Very interesting material and he is helpful and very sweet! I recommend! I pride myself on good note taking, which is a must in this class! Go to class, write down everything, and study hard! Glad I took this class!

I thought this class was really interesting, its a little difficult taking notes because he doesnt really write anything but just talks. Quizes are super easy , tests are a lttle more difficult- more applying the concepts. He doesnt take attendance, I dont recomend skipping or you wont know whats going on. He is a good teacher, but must put effort.

The class was really interesting and I enjoyed his lectures a lot. They're just not always organized neatly so your best bet is to type literally everything he says to make sure you're getting it right. He had a lot of examples & outside information that made it really interesting.

He is okay. His lectures can be very boring but the stuff is very interesting. His exams are only easy if u take good notes, I got A's but most people got C's because they didnt go to lecture. His lectures are crucial, dont skip them if u really want an A out of this class.

I took the honors option with Lessl and BARELY got an A. You definitely won't be below a B in this class, but getting an A is extremely hard since you almost always get 90s on your speeches. The book is a waste of time so don't buy it, we didn't use it. Attendance is mandatory and he is very strict about it. I would take interpersonal if possible.

Pretty easy class. He demands little; tests were easy, and papers were not bad at all. Also, probably the most wholesome professor I have ever had. Likes to talk about his church and his wife. I recommend.

Awesome and funny guy buy class was hard as anything. quizzes are random facts from the book and besides that all u have is 4 papers. but he grades them really hard, and once you get a bad grade there is no coming back. classes are boring but he makes them bearable with his humor and stories

For a subject that can be dry, Dr. Lessl is really great. He's interested in the students' speeches and he takes the concepts about public rhetoric and applies them well to practical settings. If you have to do a speech communications class, or if you just want to, take something from him.
Such a sweet professor, and always strived for her class to participate in activities. You HAVE to go to class, but it was a very easy class.

Best FYOS, sweetest professor. She is so talented, interesting, and caring. She shared many great stories and I learned a lot about the evolution of dance and its cultural impact. She used articles, movies, and diverse resources to teach. She even took us on field trips, like to see Rent as a class, and treated everyone to dinner. Great experience!

Love Dr. Fusillo her FYOS changes every year but just take her. She cares for her students & the fyos is easy. you only have to write 2 sentence reflections. She has connections so she pays for the FYOS events you have to go to & also during finals you have an easy presentation at a restaurant and she will buy you food. such a cool and sweet person

As a dance minor, I took Ballet III with Dr. Fusillo, and she's great! Her class always challenged me in new ways that ballet hadn't before. She could be tough at times, but it was to promote our technique while dancing. There is barely any outside work. Sometimes she makes us write down combinations that we work on in class. Overall, I enjoyed it.
She is really knowledgable about dance history and knows a lot about different ballets. Her class is fun and challenging.

You have to go because he takes role but he always lets you out early and he even canceled class indefinitely on Fridays. He mostly just talks about words and latin roots, he really funny too. We had a reading project and some other random stuff but it was all super easy. Definitely a slacker class.

Montgomery is the easiest UNIV professor EVER! The book is not required and he lets class out after 15 minutes tops! This class will really boost your GPA. If you need something simple take his class!
Super easy class, pretty straight forward. Attendance is necessary, the book is not. Just borrow it when you need to. He lets you out pretty early too.
One of the most interesting teachers I've had so far. Take this class as an elective, you won't regret it. Don't bother buying the $70 book, we rarely used it. Just borrow from somebody.

Easiest class I've taken at UGA and very interesting as well.  We were never in class for more than 20 minutes, yet those were hilarious and entertaining 20 minutes.  It may not seem like you are doing good in the class.  But in the words of Prof. Montgomery, "The curve is on the move!"  That means you pretty much get an A if you just do the work.
Awsome teacher. Ghandi like wisdom. Teaches you random things, but its a great class
STILL an easy professor!  Though the class is random and you don't know what's going on half the time (lol), you'd have to never come to class and give little effort on assignments not to get an A!!!
GREAT GUY!  BEST COLLEGE COURSE EVER!  you ALWAYS get out an hour early and he teaches you the most random things.  class was pure fun.
really good guy, easy class, lets you out real early, take if at all possible
Awesome guy, take this class if AT ALL possible. Lets you out in 20 minutes, an easy A if there ever was one.

Dr. Eberle is a great professor. While I didn't get the grade I wanted I only have good things to say about her. She cares about each student and is always available for office hours. She truly makes you earn your grade. I think someone who is majoring in English should take her class. I'm not an English major, but I gained a lot from her.
ratingTags_Rating: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment_Rating: Professor Eberle is one of the sweetest professors I have ever had. She cares so much about her students. She is also extremely knowledgable and has a clear passion for what she teaches. The workload is a normal amount. She gives great feedback on essays and gives extra credit as well. I highly recommend taking any class with her. She's awesome!
ratingTags_Rating: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment_Rating: Dr. Eberle is a very knowledgeable instructor. Her class is difficult if you arent an English major, but it is still enjoyable. I had a B+ at the end of the class, but she worked with me and helped me get it up to an A through extra credit and essay revisions. If you put in the work, she will reward you! I am a better writer after this class.
ratingTags_Rating: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment_Rating: Dr. Eberle is one of my favorite professors at UGA, truly. She is incredibly knowledgable about what she is talking about without seeming like her interpretation is the only way. This class is very discussion-based, and you should take advantage of that! She really listens to what each student has to offer. Very sweet and smart!

Dr. Eberle gives great lectures and makes sure to go back over what her students need more time on, and she doesn't waste time on things that everyone understands. She says that she's "ambitious" when making the syllabus, but she will adjust the amount of reading according to how class is going. She's super considerate, helpful, and knowledgeable!
ratingTags_Rating: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment_Rating: I have no idea why Dr. Eberle doesn't have a perfect 5.0! She is so, so, so amazing. She genuinely cares about every single one of her students, and she is accessible outside of class. Our class had two papers, two exams, and a final, along with mini-assignments in class. The material is amazing, and she has so much knowledge to impart. TAKE HER!!!

One of my favorite profs I've had so far. She genuinely cares about not only the subject but also her students and really wants to see them succeed and enjoy the class. The tests can be challenging but as long as you do the reading you'll be fine. She also lets you rewrite the essays. A great prof and I already can't wait to take her again!
ratingTags_Rating: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment_Rating: Really intelligent woman who knows her stuff. Very respectful with students and a great lecturer
ratingTags_Rating: Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Amazing lectures

comment_Rating: She is a good lecturer and is very passionate about the subject matter. However, be prepared to spend a huge amount of time reading for this class, and the exams cover a lot of material. The class itself is mostly discussion based. Take it if you love the subject, otherwise it's not worth the amount of time required.
ratingTags_Rating: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK
