comment_Rating: Eberle has been my absolute favorite teacher at UGA thus far. She's always animated during her lectures and it's obvious how high her level of competency is on all things English. She genuinely cares to hear what students have to contribute to the discussion, and she'll meet you half way if you make the effort to do well. 10/10 would take again.

Dr. Eberle was my favorite professor this semester, hands down! She is enthusiastic and just really fun. The past comments about your grade being set in stone were not true for me, because on my first paper I made a not so great grade, but I visited her office hours and my grades significantly improved afterward. I highly recommend her!

Very helpful. Gives chances to redo a lot of assignments (and, I always received a higher grade the second time). MUST buy required texts. Great preparation for English majors, as she emphasizes how to read poetry. Interesting text selection, and she tries "not to make it your hardest class." Fair grader and VERY approachable and funny.

She is an amazing lecturer and a lot of fun but her grading style is weird. I went back and talked with her after every paper, followed her suggestions and made her changes and she still would give me the same grade despite making improvements. Once she locks you in to a grade on your first paper there's no geting out of it. Same happened to others

Eberle's great! She's not easy, but that's really important if you want to learn to be a good English major. She'll make you work hard, but you will learn a LOT. Plus she's really friendly and bubbly, and always interested in helping you with your ideas.

As was said before, 3000 is a weedout class regardless of who you have. That being said, I took Romantic Lit. from Dr. Eberle and really enjoyed it. Two papers, six poetry reports. Was willing to work with students about paper dates, etc. You can't expect to avoid the readings, though-- every few classes, she assigns writing prompts.

Dr. Eberle was a fantastic teacher. Her teaching style helped me learn how to read novels and poetry for patterns and themes, and I'm a better student for it. I'm taking 4590 with her now and really like it, though we have a lot of reading. She's demanding, but it's totally worth it to take her classes.

Took this class, and I must say I was disappointed in the grades I got back. Eberle is a nice person, but I think she has too much on her plate for her to teach this class because it came through her teaching, causing her to easily get frustrated, effecting her grading. Just as a heads up, don't have too high of expectations b/c they will be dashed

Most of the bad comments here exist because of Engl3000, which I've taken 3 times. I only passed this **** course /because/ I took it under Eberle. Other profs will work you silly and fail you here. Difference is Eberle will pass you. I purchased and read none of the assigned texts and passed the class, but again it was my 3rd time.

She was enthusiastic and made the lectures pretty interesting.   But she treated the class like we were in 3rd grade with pop-quizzes, lectures on how to grow up and blah blah--if people are slacking, they'll get a bad grade, we don't need to be talked at.   The class wasn't as bad as I thought it would be, though.

Dr. Eberle...she was funny and loud and enthusiastic, loves her subject and teaching, BUT I agree with the comment that this was a weed out class. This class singlehandedly took up more time and effort than the rest of mine combined. Frequently I felt like she was being nebulous on purpose. She didn't explain herself well at all. HOURS of reading.

Most of these ratings are distinctly unfair, b/c they are criticisms of the course itself & of TAs, not E.She's an amazing prof, & the class was good.Yes, it's intentionally designed so you learn to LEARN on your own w/o being spoon-fed by your prof - the pt of an intro to major course.E is fair & cares that you learn enough to continue into 4000s.

Can't believe Dr. Eberle has bad reviews on here! 3000 is notoriously hard so I wouldn't blame her. Absolutely LOVED the class I had with her (not 3000) & can't wait to take another w/her. She's amazing, intelligent, funny, kind. Probably hands down my favorite prof. Don't listen to the nay-sayers. If you like literature, you'll love Eberle.
She spends class time to criticize the lack of effectiveness in your ability to teach yourself instead of actually teaching you. A weed-out class. Not as bad as some.

Not easy, but very interesting and funny. Her lectures were sometimes a bit boring, but with a smaller class, they'd probably be great. I'm not sure how hard a grader she is because we had TA's. Papers were graded harshly, a bit of a weed-out class.

Lots of irrelevant "busy work." Difficult, vague in grading of papers. Repeatedly keeps class late after wasting time earlier. Puts people on the spot. Reading load disproportionate to class time during poetry unit.  I’ve heard her other classes are better.

About 1/3 of what is read is actually discussed in class.  You are expected to teach yourself the terms and devices.  She CONSISTENTLY went over on time, but will not allow students to enter her class late.  Not as bad as some of the other 3000 teachers.

We read 9 novels for this class, plus had 6 papers and two long essay tests. She is very vague about instructions and notes and expects you to already know everything about the books. I found her intimidating and the class very hard and a waste of time.

Interesting lectures, no "homework" assignments besides reading some great books, 1 project, 2 essays. Tests were straightforward & fair. Gave good feedback and commentary on essays & did not grade them too harshly. Really enjoyed the class overall and would recommend it to anyone who doesn't mind doing a good bit of reading & is a decent writer.

Dr. Stancil is probably the worst professor I've had at UGA. I changed my major from physics because of him. Literally sucked the joy out of something I liked. His lectures are all over the classroom (literally), illegible, and just bad. He's nice, but very stubborn and literally tried to stop me from using my DRC accommodations. Don't recommend.

His lectures are all over the place and hard to follow. He's an easy grader, but you have to study up before the tests for sure. He's available to review before tests. With no background in math/code/phys, this class is tough. Never got my grades back for any of the coding labs. Do your homework and skim through the textbook and you should be fine.
Lots of homework and coding projects. In class problems that you have to be present for. Assignments are doable but tests are hard.

Professor Stancil is a good guy, but it has been impossible to learn in his class. There are whiteboards everywhere and you have to follow him to even see what he is doing. He spends too much time on irrelevant examples and not enough on actually teaching content. He breezes past the basics so you're lost the whole time.

Dr. Stancil is a kind and funny professor and he's a good, not great, lecturer. Tests weren't bad and he gives a lot of partial credit. Need a 95 for an A but he gives some extra credit. Biggest complaint is that the lab is only 15% of the total grade, which is annoying because that's where we apply physics concepts. Final exam was really hard.
ratingTags_Rating: Accessible outside class--Test heavy--Clear grading criteria

comment_Rating: Professor Stancil comes across as intelligent and kind. Attend lecture and take notes, as some questions he goes over in class will show up on tests. All tests are free response, and very lenient on partial credit. Study the practice tests he gives. Go to office hours if you have questions on the online homework, and he'll help. Good extra credit.
ratingTags_Rating: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment_Rating: Professor Stancil reads straight off of his slides in class. Interacts with the class well, but is the most scatter-brained professor I've ever taken. He can't follow his own notes. There was not a single class I attended that I understood what he was doing on the board, but he does give bonus points in class if you attend.

Compared to Dr. G, who gave an ONLINE, MULTIPLE CHANCES final, I think its completely unfair to give a final exam in person, thats way harder and majority of his students made worse grades than their average test score. Dont take his class.

He becomes very off topic during lectures and lectures did not make sense most of the time. It was a waste of time but you must attend class in order to receive the extra credit. There is barely any extra credit provided. The tests are brutal and all free response. Everything is in person.
ratingTags_Rating: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Beware of pop quizzes

comment_Rating: Stancil isn't really a bad lecturer, physics is hard anyways. He reads straight off slides and will work through a few probs in class. i recommend reading the textbook and doing the extra probs he assigns

Dr. Stancil teaches off a PowerPoint yet is extremely unorganized. He is an extremely nice person but doesn't know how to teach an introductory course. I absolutely dreaded going to class. Most of the time I had no idea what was going on. I would have done better if I could have studied on my own but he does worksheets and pop quizzes for credit.
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment_Rating: Approachable and willing to help. Homework was reasonable and tests followed material well. Attendance not mandatory, but you should go its not the easiest of material to learn by textbook. Is willing to extend some homework deadlines and work with students. Would take any class with him again.

Went through material fairly quickly and often moved on to a different subject before completely explaining the first one. His lectures were scattered between 5 different whiteboards which made it very confusing. The book helps to make his lectures clearer. He drops the lowest test grade though! He is a really nice guy too. Overall not too bad.

Dr. Stancil is really knowledgeable and a good professor. The lectures were a bit boring at times, but he always tried to make them interesting. He is a kind man and a fairly easy grader, especially if you know what you're doing.
ratingTags_Rating: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--TEST HEAVY

comment_Rating: Stancil knows his stuff, but I found I had trouble following his lectures and often got bored. By the end of the semester I found it more beneficial to skip class and just practice the problems he assigns, as similar ones make up the tests.
ratingTags_Rating: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment_Rating: He's great! If you are interested in pursuing a career in physics, take Stancil. He knows so much not just about the curriculum, but will give you interesting (surprisingly relevant) news about actual scientific discoveries in the physics field. 10/10 best physics Prof. I've ever had.
ratingTags_Rating: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--Tests are tough

comment_Rating: Stencil's class is very difficult but he gives a lot of partial credit/extra credit and curves fairly. There are a lot of proofs that are confusing. Office hours can be helpful but be prepared to stay the entire hour while he tries to figure out what his own notes mean. Need to study a lot and do way more practice problems than he assigns to pass.
ratingTags_Rating: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment_Rating: I heard he was good for 1111 but I didn't see it in 1211...

Easy homework but has nothing to do with tests. He gives random pop quizzes that go toward extra credit. Sometimes he works out problems that may actually help with tests but he usually wont unless you ask and if he agrees to go in depth with them.

Honestly, Stancil knows his information but teaching is not his thing. He displays class averages for tests after each one and the average is usually 70-75%. Lectures consist of him reading directly from power-points and going over proofs of formulas. I did better in class when I started reading the book but to each his own.

He is a really sweet guy and tries really hard but he just cannot teach. The tests are 3 word problems and 3 true false, the word problems are a collection of everything you've learned about physics ever. They're ridiculous. Lectures are terrible. I read the book, did practice problems, but in the end I still felt so lost.

Math and science are not my strengths at ALL - I got too freaked out about this class and then started giving up/halfway trying and I made a C. I did 1 homework out of 10 and went to every class. I say this to mean that if you put in a decent effort at all (like more than I did), you can expect to do OK in the class. Multiple choice tests help too!

He was overall a good teacher. The class was boring, but you really don't have to pay attention much to do well, just go to class for the bonus points. You can learn everything from the notes posted online, the homework, and the book. Not the most exciting lecturer but he is a really nice guy and very fair with his grading- overall recommended!

He goes too fast and skips steps in his notes. I went to every class but literally NEVER listened and made an A. Just read the book and do the homework and you'll be fine. The tests are multiple choice and he offers up to ten points extra credit on each.
A nice guy who is willing to answer questions, but does so with very math heavy terminology. Difficult for the no math/science major. Tests have trick conceptual questions, be careful.
His tests are so hard!  The conceptual questions are so tricky.  However, he is a nice guy who is enthusiastic to help.

I'm suprised at the negative reviews for Dr. Stancil.  It's true he's not the most exciting lecturer, but he is a native English speaker, and he was very helpful in his office hours.  There are many math & science professors can't do either of those things.  If you read the book and do the practice problems, you'll do fine in his class.
Definately could be worse, but still pretty boring

I could not learn ANYTHING from him!  I found that I did better on tests when I stayed home and read the book instead of going to class. Makes everything more confusing than it needs to be, and what's up with the lectures after the tests? Made me never want to hear the word "physics" ever again!

Horrible teacher!!  Answers your questions with a formula and flies over subject matter.  Drones on continuously the whole class period, and is even known to give lectures after the tests.  Don't take him...EVER!

Friendly guy but puts most lectures on already typed up powerpoints which made it difficult to follow along when he has already worked a problem. Hard to concentrate in the long Tuesday Thursday classes.

Dr. Thompson is great! Very kind, interesting, and occasionally even funny. Assignments are straight forward and easy to do well on if you try. Quizzes cover exactly what lectures are about and grading is fair.
ratingTags_Rating: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Respected

comment_Rating: Lectures were awful and the PowerPoints looked as though they were made in the hour leading up to class. Rambled off-topic about his own research and would ask pointless questions. Assigned multiple extremely tedious assignments throughout the semester on top of readings that were upwards of 100 pages. It was clear he didn't care about the class.
ratingTags_Rating: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment_Rating: This professor gave the impression of not caring about the class he was being paid to teach. His lectures were incredibly dull, full of errors, and hardly on topic for the supposed subject matter of the class (ethnohistory). Instead, they seemed to focus more on his specific research and ego rather than teaching the method of performing research.
ratingTags_Rating: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lots of homework

comment_Rating: I took Dr. Thompson for Ethnohistory, and he is my favorite professor so far! He does a great job connecting with students and helping them succeed if they want to. Sometimes lectures are boring, but you'll always learn something new. He is super nice and such a gem for an anthropology class. Your grade depends on you! 10/10 recommend!

I took this class as an elective for the summer and was so glad I did! The modules were asynchronous and each was relatively quick and easy. His video lectures were well-made and informative, and the information was actually interesting and fun. No final, only four simple projects split up throughout the course. A fun, easy course for the summer!
for an FYOS class, he was very easy and had very few actual assignments. interesting stuff but he never really went into depth

I really recommend this as an online course. It was super easy and actually really interesting. We had 14 modules with a lecture, usually a podcast, and a little reading. All modules ended with a short and easy quiz that acted as 70% of your final grade. The final was really easy as well. If you need a general elective credit, take this!

Very disorganized and behind schedule. Semester timeline given to class very inaccurate. 2 days behind already 1st week of classes, so he posts lectures for the class to do on the weekends as he is too busy during the week for his class. Also schedules modules for university holidays, again, I guess he's too busy to teach Monday to Friday.

Vic is awesome.  He's super easy going, offers a ton of extra credit, and makes his class as interesting as possible.  Attendance is stated to be mandatory, but he never checks it.  But you really want to show up to this class.  It's the highlight of my day sometimes.

Dr. Thompson has high expectations for his seminar classes, but he pushes you to think critically and really engage with the class material. Grades are based on attendance/participation (discussion), critiques of readings, and a major research paper. Dr. Thompson's classes have really prepared me in my field. Definitely one of the best professors.

One of the worst decisions I made was taking this professor. I wanted a easy A but this was not the case. The guy rambles on and is so hard to  follow. He also doesn't post any power points. He does drop a test but that still doesn't change what I think. Luckily he doesn't give papers
He did his best to make a fairly boring subject as entertaining as possible. The class was easy, and he drops the lowest test grade.

I took the class to get an easy A, but he made it harder this semester. The book and his lectures tend to contradict, and his test questions are very vague. I would not suggest this class. The averages on our tests were 68-70.

He is a nice guy and jokes with his class, but his lectures are very boring and he tends to ramble. Also, test questions were often vauge which could be very frustrating. Thankfully he drops the lowest test grade. As long as you go to the review sessions and show up every once in a while, you should at least make a B

This class is super easy as long as you read the chapters. Sometimes he tends to ramble in the lectures, but overall he is very interesting. Your grade is based on 4 out of 5 tests. At first there was an essay question on the test, but by the last couple, they were all multiple choice.

The class was easy. You get 5 tests and your lowest test score is dropped. If you pay attention to the lectures then you'll do fine. This is a huge 200 person class. Students weren't interested in the material and people talked too much. I had more of a problem with the annoying students than the teacher.

Even though hes a nice guy, for someone who isnt interested in the material, its not that great of a class. I hardly showed up but as logn as youre there for attendance and you go over the study guide a lot, and do your paper, youre good to go with a solid B.

Super nice professor. Sometimes a harsh grader, but gives you plenty of feedback before you turn in projects in order to raise your grade if you take his advice. Allows you to fix paintings even after critiques in order to take in his feedback. Super funny and made class interesting.

I was nervous after reading some reviews. And hes not the easiest professor, but he certainly helped me the most! He grades tough but fair. He is super accessible and always willing to help if you ask. Its not an easy A but its possibly if you work hard and with him! I would take him again in a heartbeat
ratingTags_Rating: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Tough grader

comment_Rating: If you want an easy A, then do not take him. His feedback that is strangely vague and oddly specific. The outside assignments we get take forever and he is very detailed about what he wants from you. His class requires a lot of time, and if you have other classes that are more important try to get another professor. Also its an expensive elective.

Nice guy but super harsh grader. I dreaded going to this class every MWF. Pay attention to the certain art style he likes or you won't pass. Was helpful but sometimes made things even more confusing. Acted entitled sometimes which made things awkward for everyone. Do not take this class unless you have to.

Nice guy but loves to talk. Took up the whole three hours of our drawing class by talking for most of it. I dreaded going every time. Take this class if you know how to draw and follow directions. Has a very specific taste so pay attention to that. Uses ELC a lot.
demanding but absolutely helpful!
Would give a zero if I could. Dreaded this class every week. Pointless projects and everything he said was super confusing. Save yourself!

The assignments were absolute wastes of time and materials. Didn't learn anything useful, and stayed confused at his expectations/pointlessly complex projects. The more he lectured and explained the more I was confused. At least half the class dropped within the first two weeks and the remainder stayed only because they couldn't afford to drop.
He's the bestest teacher I really ever had had !!!
He gives a lot of useless assignments, but is helpful

Hocking gives a lot of assignments and you often find yourself working really hard both inside and outside of class on different projects. He is always willing to help you but hes never much help either way. His grades super hard. All in all hes a nice guy.
I totally love those earrings, o my god!! you guys!! spikey retro eighties hair o my god you guys!! Really sweet ok.
Very passionate about his students and extremely helpful professor!!
great proff. demanding but clear and extremely helpful. Super Proff
No Comments
This is her last year, and she barely paid any attention to us…boring lecture from the textbook.

I may be biased because I love directing and want to do it professionally, but this class was excellent. She rambles a lot in lectures and was very critical of our final directing projects, but it was just good constructive advice for the future - she'll give you a good grade if you work hard. Talk a lot in class, too.

Much easier class than I thought it would be. I prepared for her exams by using the study guides she prepared and googled the people on it to see who they were and put together my own study guide. I worked hard on it, and it worked well for me. Exam format is open ended, so make sure you know who the people are. There are a few papers in the class.

Funny lady but really hard tests. Lectures are pointless because she just summaries the chapters in random order. Nice lady  but boring class. Also,there is a research paper. (Take home final: essays)

I had Prof. Giles at another university and she is without a doubt the best prof. I've evre had. She takes complex theories & ideas and explains them in real, understandable terms. I learned more from her than anyone else in my college career! Sure, she expects work from students, but has tremendous respect for those who actually work. BRAVA!

Expected more from lectures than got. Not much discussion about movies, but they were intriguing to watch. Make sure know exactly what to do for essays otherwise expect a poor grade. Was very understanding about grades if you proved self on later assignments. Often uninteresting, but films studied did subject me to the horrors of Hollywood film.

Spent too much time lecturing; wasn't able to generate a lot of interest through class (yay for doodling!). The selection of movies she chose was good; they and class discussion (when we had it) helped illustrate the key concepts of American Ethnic Cinema. Too much emphasis on projects and tests; also used class's evaluations for project grades.

Tests are pretty easy, because he gives you a mock exam and study sheet before hand. If you know those you will be fine. WEBWORK IS NOT AN OPTION (plus it counts for an entire test grade). He really tries to help you, but he can come off like he's annoyed with your unintelligence.

Dr. Rumely is someone I would highly recommend taking. He's always willing to work with you inside and outside of class and genuinely cares about how you're doing, which is rare. He's smart, but isn't arrogant, and will work a million problems if you don't understand a topic.

Dr. Rumely is a  nice man. He is kind of like your grandpa; old, timid and tells a cheesy joke every once in awhile. His issue is he is stuck in the 70s. He uses VERY old ways of doing Calc. He feels the need to prove almost everything taking up precious class time. You will have to teach yourself a lot. Not worth the time, take someone else.

Very helpful. He grades things quickly and is very helpful during office hours. Going to office hours is almost required if you want a chance at an A. He is not a difficult teacher the content itself is what makes the class challenging

Dr. Rumely was an incredibly fair teacher. His classes were well regimented and productive. Calc. II is not an easy subject and requires out of class work. No matter which way you slice it, you have to put in a sincere effort outside of class. Dr. Rumely was incredibly fair in terms of grading, and he got assignments back in a timely manner.

Requires fast note-taking, I averaged around 3 pages of notes per class.  His explanations are clear and he always provides multiple examples.  He'll stop to answer any question.  In his office hours, he'll take the time to work with you and clear up any problems you may have with the material.  Also weaves intriguing math history  into lessons!

Rumely offered test corrections for half credit back. He wrote 4-5 blackboards of notes everyday but he explained Calc III well. If you are struggling, GO TO HIS OFFICE HOURS. They are super helpful and you will score better. I would take him again.

Rumely is an unnecessarily strict teacher when it comes to grading. Through MATH4000 I feel as though I earned about a B, but I got a C+ due to his grading. He often corrected my grammar (with his own improper grammar might I add) on my test and marked off an insane amount of points. He even disagreed with my choice of words.

Very difficult teacher. We worked over 500 homework problems and homework is online so it has to be completed accurately. Don't buy the book, didn't use it once. If you have never taken calculus before, this class would be very hard. His office hours are very helpful though.

Dr. Rumely is frustrating in class.  Lectures are often pointless.  He gives a good idea of what will be on the test, and tests are not unreasonable.  Possible to make a good grade. But he passes around attendance sheet, HW is dumb, and he conducts class in a boring and inefficient way.  Writes about 4 full blackboards per day.

Nice old man. He knows what he teaches & never uses the textbook:don't buy one. No help in class, given outside of class. Forgetful about quizes. We were supposed to have 10& we had 4 and he gave us 4 more AFTER the last test before the final. I recommend him b/c of this. See him in his office before class or see his wife, she's helpfull too.
uGH

Dr. Rumely is quirky and dorky, but I'd say is a good teacher.  Our class was in group 1 for the testing, so we always had to rush through the material to finish in time. I felt like he went too fast sometimes and left us students confused. The tests are not easy, so you will have to do the homework and study to do well. Overall, I'd recommend him.

someone else has said spot on. he is really set in his ways when it comes to teaching. not the best personality. knows his stuff, but doesn't teach very well. the worst thing about this teach is that he'll give you your grades based on how much he likes you. attendance is not "mandatory" but if you want him to like you, then it is.

Rumely is a very intelligent teacher but his teaching methods are not always clear and often leave students confused. His tests can also be very tricky. I thought this class was hard and i already had taken calc. Homeworks due daily. Tricky tests with tricky problems. if you need calc for your science major i recommend you take 2200 instead of 2250

Outside of class, pretty helpful. Will help you out if you're having trouble with something. However, in class, very set in his ways. Does not appear to like students to participate in lecture. Sometimes snapped at students who did. Also got bogged down in pedantic details of proofs instead of focusing on the big picture.
Hard and unfair

She is a knowledgeable professor with a lot of enthusiasm for PR. Class is usually pretty interesting but material can be kind of dry. Just go to class, pay attention, and read the book and you should do well on the tests. Do the Press kit project option, it will help your grade a lot.

I took her honors class and I was pretty excited since public relations is my major and I had heard great things about her but I was disappointed. I don't feel that I learned anything. However, I have to say she is an amazing person with lots of energy and just about the sweetest person I know. She would be an excellent grandma but not professor.

She is really annoying. She gets off track really easily and talks about random stuff rather than discussing the material on the test. I still don't even have a clear view about what PR really is. She forgets what she's saying in the middle of saying it. You don't learn any real PR skills like how to write press releases. The TA was awesome though.

I agree with the most recent comment. She is very clear about telling you which slides are on the test and which are not. Also, there was plenty of extra credit opportunities that were not time consuming or difficult. The tests were fairly easy and I never read the textbook.

I don't agree with these other comments.  I thought her tests covered what she taught and the chapters in the book.  She cares very much about her students, and wants to help you.  She told us exactly which slides were and were not on the test.  I enjoyed this class.  Lots of extra credit, and choices on how you are graded.

This class was not helpful.  She got sick halfway through the semester and didn't attend the second half.  I understand if she couldn't come to class because of illness, but she expected too much of us, considering we didn't even have a teacher.  There was little to no direction.  We didn't learn a thing.  This class is a waste of time.
this was the worst class ever-tests were a joke!she would tell us to study certain chapters and then test on something completely different!

This class was awful.  She screwed the entire class over with the tests and when everyone complained she acted as though she could care less.  She was hardly ever there, didn't keep us informed, and barely ended up teaching us anything.  To top it off, anyone who took the final now has their entire grade messed up in Oasis.

If you like guessing what's going to be on the tests, take her class. If you genuinely haven an interest in PR but want to learn about everything BUT PR, take her class. If you like having guest speakers who have no relevance to the class, take her class.

She's  very nice, but often off subject, wasting your time. Her tests are quite unfair, as they cover material not covered in class or text and ask for puny details one could not possibly memorize. I'm sure she'd be great in a small class, but avoid in large classes. Research project helped my grade.

This class can lick one. The tests never were over a single one of the useless things we did in class. When we asked what we were supposed to study, we were told to just read all four of the chapters and memorize everything. Then the test wasn't even on the assigned material. I'd rather gargle a bucket of diarrhea than ever take this class again.

Take the honors section if you can. She is a very nice woman and knows a lot. She gets off track a lot and we didn't really talk about the book at all. Most of what we learned was through projects and presentations. It was a good class...interesting speakers and I learned a lot about PR. Take her. Don't listen to the bad comments!

This class is a lot harder than I expected. I have done well on the tests (due to many hours of intense studying) but many others haven't. There are more speakers than actual lecture which don't really help out for the test. You get to choose how you are graded and I would def. recommend doing the group project.

Boo, Lariscy. She's crazy. She would much rather talk about her political campaigns and/or the state of "Missoura" than public relations. She was a poor representation of what I feel Grady is, and I was less than thrilled with her class. Avoid her!

Hands down one of the best teachers i've ever had. Though the class was harder than i expected, I learned a lot about PR and she really cares about her students. If you study, you'll make an A. And going to class was actually fun for me with Dr. Lariscy...
She knows what she is talking about and she genuinely cares about her students.

This is a great class to take. Some people do not like her style of teaching. She goes by her on notes and sometimes skips things. Sometimes its not clear what will be on the test and what won't. There is a group project, it's fun to do, but not needed to get an A or B. If you study for the test you should do fine in the class

I thought this class was great. There is an optional  project, and I recommend doing it if you don't have a super busy schedule. Dr. Lariscy is pationate and knowledgable about PR. The tests aren't too bad if you go to class and actually pay attention. You can do well if you put some effort into the class.

i loved Mrs. Lariscy. but even though it may seem like an easy class, make sure you know the information inside and out. the tests are tricky! she really cares about each of her students and wants y'all to succeed! there are many extra credit opportunities, and do the group projects! its an easy 100 test grade, although time consuming its worth it!

The class itself is interesting, but the tests are kind of tricky.  They're just multiple choice, but sometimes she doesn't give you all the info.  There are lots of ways to get your grade.  You can do a group project, but I wouldn't suggest it.  I did it, and I really didn't get a lot out of it.  I liked the class better at the beginning.
Don't take him! It's not as easy as other 1110 Spanish classes. Take anyone but him. He is a very tough grader compared to other professors.
Brandon was a great teacher, and really showed a lot of enthusiasm for Spanish. He incorporated the lessons into everyday conversations, so time flew in the class. He is also a really nice guy.

Brandon is a pretty good teacher, definitely one of the nicest I've had at UGA. You have to go to class for participation points and you HAVE to take notes on everything he says in class. There are also 3 research papers, plus a final paper that is 5-6 pages. He's not bad, but I've heard other 3030 teachers are way easier.

I thought it was challenging but not bad if you put in effort. I loved his enthusiasm and did actually enjoy class. Quizzes are hard but he gives you a chance to make up low grades. Overall, it was worthwile.

I got A's in both 1001 and 1002.  2001 is structured a lot differently and it's a lot harder to do well. Brandon is young so he understands where all his students are coming from and he definitely is really knowledgeable. His quizzes can be difficult. The spanish dept. just structures the 2001 course really badly. The final was really hard!!

He is a really good teacher. He is young and really understands if you aren't the best at Spanish. I honestly think he liked the ones who struggled more and did what he could to help. I suggest taking his class! He is a great teacher.
Not the best instructor, but class is pretty easy. Go to class. Pay attention. Write whatever he writes on board. Participate.  If follow these suggestions, you should do fine. Good luck!

Nice enough guy... Its a spanish lit course so the material we had to read was really difficult.  Tests and quizzes were hard, papers were really annoying and the final paper was torturous the week before finals...I literally couldn't write it

Do not take his class, this is the worst Spanish class I have taken in my life.  Tests are impossible, and he grades rediculously.  For our presentation, he gave me a B and didn't even tell me why, just handed me a slip of paper with only the grade on it.  Oh, and he lets calss out late almost everyday!  Basically, he's annoying and hard!
Brandon is a great teacher. He is extremely knowledgeable and he makes sure all of his students are prepared for each test. This was a great class.

Brandon did an excellent job of laying the foundations of Spanish for me. He's very helpful and really wants all his students to do well. We had a very fun environment (he brought us food a couple times). He's only like 24 or 25, so class was pretty laid back.
He is a wonderful professor!

Damron seemed very intimidating at first, but he turned out to be a wonderful teacher!  He organized the class in a very attention-grabbing way.  I loved going to class and learned so much while having great in class discussions.  Take his class if you can!

If you want another stat class with boring lectures and the same black clothers everyday, have at it. He doesn't know how to teach or even make up a test. Good luck, my advice if you get stuck.... Take your B and go. Just another Grad student who doesn't care about students' GPAs
Fantastic professor. Brilliant and hilarious. Much more engaging and thoughtful than a base-level history class has any right to be.
No Comments

The class was not very challenging, but it is important to attend class. She is a very nice teacher but you do get homework that she collects sometimes. Overall I enjoyed this class and it wasn't hard to get an A

I don't know why people keep saying she's arrogant. It's true her class is demanding (due to homework and essays) and you must be willing to work hard to get an A. However, she's a kind person and a fair grader. She gives students ample time and clear instructions for their work. If you don't mind working hard and improving your French, take her.

Hard class in the sense that its like taking a high school class with college work. Too much emphasis on attendance, participation, and homework. UGA's Romance Language department is not very good, take Greek or Latin.

Mme. Garet is a gifted teacher who challenges you to do your best in French.  She gives tons of saasignments which end up helping you in the long run with your grade.  Make sure you site your sources for every paper

She is nice and really wants students to learn the language, but also expects them to put forth the effort to do so.  Gives plenty of assignments, but explains them all and they're all relevant to the material.  She's challenging for most students, but if you really want to learn and care about French, you will appreciate her.

Dont' take her class unless you're really good at French grammar. She's a typical French woman with a lot of pride in the language; she knows the culture very well, though. Blunt. Participate lots. Gives tons of homework, loves having something due every week. Gives lab work, book work, essays, tests. An A is possible, but wide student GPA range.
Don't take this class if you don't really have an interest in French. It's hard and time intensive.

Excellent teacher. If you go to class, do the homework and simply pay attention you can easily get a B. If you put some effort into it then you can come away with an A. She is from Paris therefore you have the opportunity to learn from a native. Don't worry, she speaks good english so if you are really struggling she is willingly open to help you.

HARD.  She is from Paris and expects you to know what she is saying, even if you have only had one semester of French.  I suggest studying.  Homeworks are numerous and never ending.  Her class is better for people majoring in French.
great t.a., very helpful and knowledgable, too cool to be a physicist

Seriously. He's amazing. He's got a gigantic ego, but he knows what he is talking about is preparing you for what you're wanting to do. It's worth taking what he says in regards to your journalism career, to heart. He's not easy as far as assignments and grading, but he is very fair, and can be generous at times. Bottom line, he's great.
I learned so much in his class! I would recommend his class to anyone interested in broadcast.

This professor is amazing. He teaches you journalism the way it should be. It may seem intimidating in the beginning but if you actually listen to what he says and use him as a resource, you will get an A.

David Hazinski is a God among Journalism teachers. He is honestly, the most engaging, enthusiastic man I've ever had as a teacher. I highly recommend this class, also go to Newsource to better comprehend what he is teaching.

Proud egomaniac, so much so its funny.  Because he's like an aged mentor who knows everything you'll ever need to know about the field, you should listen. He'll give you grades that don't matter, and then assign you whatever grade he wants to in the end.  Fun class, enjoy it, don't let him scare you into switching majors.

Such a great professor! He has all the experience a student could ask for in a professor and knows the material (reporting/news) since it was his job and still is. I loved going to his class because it was always interesting. He treats you like professionals and gives you responsibilities as such.
He did a compelling piece on Eddie Robinson back in the late 80's.  Go to NBC's headquarters in New York, ask for the film archives, and check it out.
You will learn to love Hazinski. He's seems like an intimadating monster at first, but he's a great guy once you know him. One of the most helpful professors I've ever had
No Comments
i have already posted a review here, but i am feeling painful spasms of nostalgia for my downs class. miss u dude. yall: take this class if he is still teaching.

Great professor! He takes attendance randomly during the start of the semester and as long as you are there everytime he checks you will get a free 100 test grade, and he only gives 3 regular tests. Easy A, but a lot of notes. He mentioned though at the end of the spring '09 semester that he might not be teaching anymore so you'll just have to see.

Downs is eager to help you if you ask. Tests are straight from class lectures. Take good notes and you will get a good grade. He wants you to do well. Gave extra credit, and an optional test to boost grade. Also very funny. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND!
Easy class as long as you show up and take notes everyday. NO assignments, only 3 tests. Tests are easy with no essays. If you want an easy A take B-Downs. Awesome and funny guy too!
Amazing teacher, mixture of Mitch Hedburg and Alexander the Great. (may peace be upon him)
am in concord with previous reviewer. for real, downs. you like italian? we could eat at depalma's.

BODOWNS!!!!!!!!!!! Pretty much love Brad Downs's class. He's a great communicator and seems really passionate about teaching religion. He's also really ridiculously awesome and funny and maybe a little crazy. I would totally let him buy me dinner and never call me again.

He proposes interesting theories with some backing. However, mant of his theories are outdated and proven false, such as the JEPD theory. If this is a topic that effects your everyday life, be sure to take everything he says with a grain of salt and do your homework on things you are not sure about.

Great teacher! Downs is by far one of the best teachers I have ever had in terms of evaluating my pre conceived notions of religion. He is a great guy, and his tests are easy if you go to class and take notes. The only people that don't like him are closed minded ones that require an extreme amount of structure in a class.

B Downs is the man. He's funny and semi-grungy but don't let that fool you because he's brilliant. I met him at nowhere before taking his class, and I can vouch for the man's coolness. I definately recommend him unless you cannot handle the possibility of alternate truths on the subject of religion.

Obviously, a BAMF teacher. He will challenge what your faith (last day of class last semester, i saw a girl cry after his class because her world had been changed). Easy test if you attend class. Anyone who doesn't like his class is close minded and doesn't deserve his time, hes brilliant!
downs is really great.. a lot of people dont like him cuz he challenges beliefs.. but if you take what he says and consider it he is great and hes gorgeous (or he used to be gorgeous)

Downs is definitely one of those professors who likes to toot his own horn and let you know he knows a lot about philosophy. The class was overall entertaining but way to daunting for a 1000 level class. He is also anti-Christian and the subject matter is rather boring and irrelevant the way it is presented. Do not take.

At first I thought he was simply going to bash all organized religions and schools of thought, but he just led you to a point where you'd have to think about things yourself and evaluate on your own. You definitely leave class still thinking about his teaching, which is the best kind in my opinion. EASY if you take notes, read, & attend

Favorite class at UGA so far. Bradford is amazingly knowledgable, and you really will think differently about religion after taking this class. Attendance and three tests make up your grade, though the 3rd test was optional. Go to class, absorb what he says, give it back on the essay test and you get an A. He bartends at Nowhere Bar; amazing guy!

He's a different type of professor. Lectures mostly from his notes and although sometimes they're hard to get through, if you go to class and take decent notes the class is easy. Tests are essay format, that sucked but he's leniant on the grading. Got and A without any problem. Cool teacher.

Brad is extremely knowlegable of religion and the best lecturer Ive seen so far. This class was very interesting so I recommend taking it. Its not the easiest class, but make sure you go to class every day because he takes attendance.
Arrogant teacher. He just talks about what he thinks. He includes his opinions all the time which is not very professional. Acts like he knows a lot when he really doesn't.
Genius.
No Comments

this was the most enjoyable class i have ever taken. downs forces you to think about life in new ways. he's hilarious; that and the topics of discussion made me want to come to this class everyday. if you just show up you will do fine. don't buy the books, just study your notes.
I took RELI 1003 & 1001....He is a great teacher, if you are going to take religion get it with Downs.  If you need the books I still have them....espett@uga.edu
No Comments
Best instructor at UGA.

If you go to class almost everyday, you will have a guaranteed A in the course.  However, you are allowed to miss 3 classes (unexcused).  After you're third absence, you drop one letter grade.  Only had to take 1 exam, and 2 were optional papers.  Don't even buy the book.  He's a great professor if  you need an easy A.

Very knowledgable of his subject. You can easily skate through this class if you just accept everything you're told. The tests are not hard. However, it is advisable to learn the material on your own and use your own judgement, especially in this type of class. Can twist scripture to his own ideas so if you are a religion he teaches, be smart.

He's the best looking teacher I've ever had the pleasure of staring at. This was my favorite class, not only because of the aforementioned hotness, but because it is relevant to life. He will change your views of religion in a very *enlightening* and positive way. TAKE THIS CLASS! You'll pretty much make an A if you show up and listen.

I totally enjoyed coming to this class to hear his lecture.  He doesn't worry about grades and encourages you to just listen and learn.  This is a class that will impact your life, and I hope I have other classes like it.  He's also really adorable.

Easily the best, easiest, most fun, most important, and most enlightening class I've ever taken.  You will learn things that will completely change the way you look at religion and your own faith.  He's a very funny guy who makes the class extremely enjoyable.  As long as you came most of the time, you'll get an A or a B.  I highly recommended him

Absolutely brilliant professor who made me look at the subject with a new perspective and opened up my mind. Probably the best class I'll take over the next 3 years. He's really smart, funny, and will really hold your interest in the subject matter.

Awful class and professor. Tests are arbitrary and inconsistent with the chapters. Questions for the tests come from all the chapters and not the ones specifically mentioned. I.E, it may be a test over chap. 1,2, and 3 but expect questions from chap. 15... If you have to take this class, may the odds be ever in your favor.
Worst professor I have ever had. Hated every second of this class. It was painful. I will never take another of his classes. AVOID THIS GUY AT ALL COSTS..

Tests are 100 multiple choice and he gives you 30 before the test to answer and those are word for word. However beware that questions do not come from the book or the power point they just come out of thin air. I very upset that i studied hours and questions were crazy. I still got an -A but work hard. Only three tests in the whole class.

Ever had a class that was so pointless that you didn't spend any time studying for it and then you didn't do very well? Well, that was this class for me. Parker was someone who joked around and stuff and then it came to the exam and you were like, "I needed to know that?" The exams are long and multiple choice and scantron, so beware.

I dont know what everybody else is saying but this guy is amazing. Took him for this and SOCI 3740 and there is no attendance and everything is online. 3 tests, 100 multiple choice questions and he gives you like 40 before the exam. I only went on exam days and made an A. HIGHLY RECOMMEND him for an easy class.
There were three tests; each covered 100s of pages of text, and there were 100 questions on each test... all random facts.

I would not advise to take Parker. He's a nice guy, but all he does is read the powerpoints and go off on tangents that DO NOT MATTER. All you need to do is read the book to pass his tests, but they are so nit-picky it's not even funny. Super boring, and not worth it. Pick something else.

I had him for Social Problems. Stay away from that class. His "lectures" consist of randomly reciting fact after fact from the book and summing it all up with an insightful, "this is a big problem." His tests have little to do with anything you read or heard. Like someone else said, either memorize the chapter or don't even bother. Aweful. Boring.

Terrible. His test are focused on rote memorization of useless facts and to pass his class, you must memorize his study guides (he did not give us a study guide on the final so everyone did horribly). Attendance is not mandatory nor does it help to come. If it were not for the intro with Krohn, I would have rethought this major. Stay away. Abysmal.
Don't bother to take notes, because you just have to memorize the book. About 5 chapters per test, and each chapter is 40 pages. Hard tests. Not an easy A. Avoid his class if you need a good grade!
Dr. Parker's tests are hard! This class is not an easy A. His tests are over 100's of pages of readings and his notes are not used on the test. Don't take this class!

dont be deceived by the class title. this class has nothing to do with sociology at all. in actuality, its memorizing the history of sports (including exact dates) from the 1800s on. you dont need to go to class if you read on your own but his tests just have random questions that are not in the book. i do not recommend this class.

This professor is awful!  Tests contained random questions that were not in lecture and not in our book.  I had an A in this class until the final.  He usually gave a study guide forewarning you of the random questions you had to go online to find, but didn't give us a study guide for the final.  I flunked it and ended up with an A-.
He made the class very interesting and you had to pay attention in class and read all of the chapters. Easy "A" if you give some effort.

This class was stupid. I came in interested in social problems, and now hate even attending class. During lecture he reads notes off the board and then goes into rambling anecdotes that barely apply and rarely make sense. Don't try to disagree and or correct one of his points. He blatantly refuses to listen to students. Stay away from his classes!

This should have been a really interesting class but he just taught straight from the book. Basicly you learn the history of sports and that is it. You really dont have to come to class if you just read the book.

Class was so boring. Notes were straight from wikipedia and the book. It was a memorization class and was pretty much the history of sports (dates, people) not the sociology of sports. You didn't need to go to class if you could have someone get the notes for you.

If you wanna take a class because you are interesting in African American history/sociology, STOP! I was so excited to take this class til I went to class and met this guy. He sucks! He recited the book which was mostly history and we didnt even have class discussions! He talk talk straight and his notes are RETARDED! EXTREMELY DISAPPOINTING!

Rote memorization course. Tested dates of legislation passed; never asked about concepts or theories. Lecture was a joke. Last 2 weeks of course only 5 ppl showed up to lecture. Very uninspiring. Be prepared to memorize, not learn.
lacks any ability to lead engaging discussions then treats students as slackers for not speaking up.

I took the honors section of this class, under the impression that she'd be a good teacher. She's completely bias against non-Art History majors, doesn't give a clear overview of what is to be expected on her tests, and refuses to provide any sound recommendations or advice. She also makes students feel stupid when she poses questions to the class.
Dr Pritchard Puts the Habenero In Art History! I recommend sitting up front!

definitely easier than my 2300 teacher Less material and slide ID's. Come to class, take good notes, and study all of that for the test. test layout: slide ID's, multiple choice/fill in the blank, and comparison essay. she is very particular about her essays, she wants a well written/thought out essay. I recommend her if your a foundation art major

not very difficult, dont really need the book much. quizzes are a lot easier than the tests. take VERY detailed notes. Shes annoying, she seems kind of stuck up or prissy in how she talks. she gets annoyed with students easily.
As long as you take good notes-- and i mean really writing down what she's saying- you'll be fine.. her tests are all based on the notes.  Easy class- honestly.

*TONS* of material on the tests. Tests are fill in the blank with a compare/contrast essay at the end. She knows her stuff very well. Attendance is mandatory. Don't bother buying the $1XX book; she only used it once or twice. Class is basically memorization. The building is in East Campus. I do not recommend this class unless you REALLY like art.

this class isn't hard if you can take good notes. there is no need to ever look at the book- just study your notes and know the dates and artists and stuff. she's straight-forward and tests are detailed, but it's all stuff she goes over in class.

Class was pretty difficult in my opinion. Pay attention in class and take detailed notes because some of the questions on the tests are pretty obscure. She definitely knows her stuff though and is very informative.

Great teacher. Take her. The tests aren't really easy, but they come directly from her notes. No need to buy the 70 dollar book. The quizzes and assignments are all very easy and there aren't even that many. She gives lots of extra credit chances that boost the grade a lot. She's also very helpful and willing to meet with you to improve your grade.

Great class.  She is an awesome teacher who is actually cool. This class is an easy A.  If you do not get an A in this class you must have absolutely no incentive to do any work whatsoever. I highly recommend taking her.  She needs to teach more classes at UGA.
She is leaving after this year. but she was the coolest teacher in the UGA. Easy A if you actually do some work.
I like her as my 1101 teacher!

She makes the class interesting, gives quite a few days off, and eventually makes attendance optional.  The tests aren't very hard at all if you go to class.  She doesn't ask too much from students: papers are fairly short and homework is optional.  Good class.

don't expect to learn a thing in this class. very bad teacher that does not care about her students at all. all she cares about is her own education when she is in her 50's still in school! don't take her

She is really boring. Class starts off really interesting and then gets really really boring. No work is required for the class except taking a few tests and quizzes. No homework at all. After W deadline you don't even have to go to class.

Falling in love with french! I never enjoyed spanish back in high school so I didn't expect to enjoy french. He's helpful and dedicated to his work. I BETTER GET HIS CLASS NEXT SEMESTER! He also wants you to succeed.

Diaby is the reason I stayed in French (it wasn't my major).  I went on to work in Montreal, and I'd have never been able to do that if I hadn't 'fallen in love' w/ French, which was due to Diaby's influence.  His easy-going nature and friendliness makes you always feel welcome to ask questions if you have them.

He's a funny guy. I laughed at him in about every class. He's often ambiguous on what's due and what you need to do. But he's a very easy grader and you're able to correct your tests to get partial credit back. He makes it easy to get an A or at least an A-.

Mr. Diaby is a very friendly guy and he'll do all he can to help you get an A. Sometimes he's not very clear as to what you're supposed to be doing, but he's very patient and willing to help. Easy class and you learn a lot from him, I would definitely take his classes again!

French is thickly accented and difficult to understand.  Uses lots of idiomatic expressions you don't know.  Gives unclear and incomplete directions, so you're always a little confused as to what's going on.

The assignments in this class are often ambiguous & you won't have a clear idea on what you're supposed to be doing & when it's due. Diaby is a nice guy though, and is willing to work with you if you put in the effort.
Diaby will make you love LEARNING French, not just TAKING it.  He's a jovial guy from Burkina Faso who will go well out of his way to make you comfortable with the material.  A+ guy!

He's a really funny guy and will make class as much fun as it can be. No real work is required and his tests are pretty easy.  Not a class where you will learn a heck of a lot or improve your French a lot, either.

Julia is super nice and can be helpful but overall this class is pretty boring and saturated with tons of 3rd grade level reading.  Despite sometimes reading 80+ pages in a night, the tests are relatively easy and if you take good notes during class (despite how much you read), the tests shouldn't be so bad.
Julia is a great teacher and available for help in and out of the classroom. Do your work and you should do well!
Very sweet and nice teacher.  Attendence is mandatory but every foreign lang class is.  You do need your text book and you will use it daily.  Participate in class and you'll be fine
She's a wonderful teacher! Very helpful and willing to stay after class.
Great Professor!Makes lessons interesting and fun.She is extremely helpful and more lenient on grading than most professors. It's very difficult to fail her class.Take her!

I have earned close to 300 hours of college credit and four college degrees, and I'm pretty certain that Julia is the best all-around teacher (considering everything that makes a teacher exceptional) that I have ever had. Attention UGA Romance Languages Department: If Julia hasn't earned a teaching award yet, she should! Outstanding class! Take her

Outstanding teacher!!! I wish every subject had a teacher like her.  She is beyond helpful.  She is probably the best teacher I have ever had in highschool or college!  If she is your teacher, you are lucky!  She is very fair and always goes above and beyond.  She makes class very fun also.

I LOVED this class! Julia really cares about her students and is always available to help. One of the nicest teachers I've ever had. She does expect you to work, but is realistic about expectations for intro language classes. Awesome class, made me want to be a ROML major!
Great class.. she loves her course and her students.
julia class was great.  she was accessible and always helpful.  i got an A

julia was a great teacher. she knew our names by the second week of class and really tried to make it fun and interesting. she was very helpful and gave us a few additional opportunities to make better grades. another plus- she's american and is much easier to understand than native spanish speakers.

I loved Dr. Franklin! Although I have no love for statistics, she was always really supportive of both my in-class success and of my personal life. She really cares about all of her students and wants everyone to do well in her class while still learning the material.

Professor Franklin is one of the sweetest and most genuine people you will ever meet. She is so passionate about statistics and makes the class very interesting. I cannot express how awesome she is. Don't pass up taking her class.

Dr. Franklin was the sweetest professor I've ever had. Her top priority was ensuring that all of her students succeeded. Attendance is necessary, for participation is 25% of your grade, but group work was easy. Tests were also easy and had no surprises if you've done all the homework. Reading the textbook makes the homework very easy too.

Dr. Franklin is awesome! Even at 8 am she was energetic and always smiling. Do he assignments, pay attention in class, and you'll make an A. There is a good bit of group work, but it's not difficult. Quizzes are straight forward. Final is take home. I really enjoyed this class. (Also, she rights great recommendations for her students!)

Dr. Franklin is wonderful. She's really good at explaining everything and makes the class interesting. She's a pretty easy grader for the most part (on homework she only subtracts .1 pts for a wrong answer). As long as you try, it's not difficult to get an A.

A wonderful teacher.  She truly looks out for her students and will do anything to help them succeed.  I was not at all interested in statistics, but Dr. Franklin made the class interesting and opened my eyes to how much it is used in the world.  I recommend taking her class if you need Stat. credit

Really enthusiastic and friendly. She makes you learn the material, but doesn't give out too much homework and lets you use a "cheat sheet" of your own design on the tests. A good teacher, and one of the nicest I've had. Recommended.

Dr. Franklin is precious. She is the fairest teacher I have ever encountered, and she still manages to challenge her students to fully learn the material. She cares about her students and does a great job relating stat to real life. Tests are fine, final is take-home, hw is regular but not too difficult. TAKE HER! You'll love it!

Though I had little interest in taking a Statistics course, Dr. Franklin's passion and preparedness made the class both enjoyable and educational. There are weekly homework assignments and several quizzes; however, they are not overly difficult. She takes a great deal of interest in her students and is always there to help you succeed.

Though I had little interest in taking a Statistics course, Dr. Franklin's passion and preparedness made the class both enjoyable and educational. There are weekly homework assignments and several quizzes; however, they are not overly difficult. She takes a great deal of interest in her students and is always there to help you succeed.

Dr Franklin is truly amazing!  She was my favorite teacher at UGA and she loves (and knows) her subject better than anyone.  She allows cheat sheets on all quizzes and mid-term, final is take home, and homework is short.  Read the book OR pay attention in class and its an easy A.
She is an excellent teacher who is very helpful. She always allows a "cheat sheet" for her tests and quizzes.

Unlike many professors, Professor Franklin clearly enjoys teaching.  She's really caring and will always take some time out of class just to talk about football or other stuff on campus.  Oh yeah, she wrote the book she uses and she's incredibly smart.  Plus, you have every opportunity to make an A.  If you need a stat class, take Prof. Franklin
Pretty easy class. She's very helpful and enthusiastic about statistics.

Dr. Franklin was great. I took this to fill a math requirement and she made the class a breeze. Do the homework (she comments on it extensively) and you know exactly what she wants for her tests, which she lets you bring in a "cheat sheet" for anyways.
She loves to teach and it shows during her lectures.  Her grading system is fair and her class is pretty easy.  There is homework due almost every week but it usually isnt too hard.  Take her class!
She is always happy! She's more than willing to help you whenever you need it. Assigns homework just about every week, but it helps you stay on track. Tests and quizes are similar to homework.

Very easy class and good way to get an extra credit hour. Galvin is very talkative and friendly, a little long-winded at times but his class is all about discussion. It's a relaxed environment. No tests/quizzes just one book report and some assigned readings. I learned a lot about UGA and Georgia that I didn't know before.
Kind of boring, but you can tell Dr. Galvin loves what he does. Besides, the class is an easy A and occasionally he is pretty funny.
great guy, he tells lots of stories and he loves teaching. lots of readings to keep up with but if you do you'll be fine
One of he best professors I've ever had.  Never a dull moment in class.  Lots of reading but well worth it.

She's from Uruguay, which is interesting because she has a unique dialect and is able to share her culture. Sometimes her english is a little bad, but it's endearing. Unbelievably nice and always willing to help students out if they have ANY questions. She wants everyone to do well in the class, too. I learned a lot. Take her!
I liked her, I learned a lot of south american culture from her. Her accent is amazing. She makes spanish very interesting, because she is so passionate about the subject.

I love the Wilinski. She is very helpful when you need it. She has just enough accent (Uruguay) to make it easier to learn, because it's all athentic and sutff. Seriously though, I'm not good at Spanish and she will help you alot and she is really fun at the same time. You are making a good decision taking this class.
a very good teacher.  she's really nice and funny and makes class interesting.  as long as you go to class and study the chapter summaries for the tests, you will easily make an A.
Monica was very excited about Spanish. She tried really hard to make class comfortable and to help her students learn. Tests were pretty easy if you study.
I loved Senora! She is a really nice person even though she doesnt speak english too well but he is really helpful in class and encouages a lot of Spanish Convo. which helps.
She was always there to help, and was very sympathetic to her students' grades. Lenient also, and made class fun.

Had her for an Italian Culture class. It was an easy class but she was very informative and helpful. She grades fair and kept the class interesting with lots of different types of work. She's a good teacher and that was a really fun, engaging class.

I don't agree with most of these entries... Professor Cro may have read this because this semester she has treated her students as if they were in college not elementary school. She gives a lot of work but thats true of any 1000 level language class. As long as you do the work it's fairly easy and you'll get an A. She really not mean at all.

Do NOT Take this class.  She can be very helpful outside of the classroom but she will not help you during class.  Gives a stupid amount of busy work, grades extremely hard, and is quite mean in class, often lecturing students like we were in middle schoolers, in Italian and then in English to make us feel bad.

She is really demanding and has extremely high standards, but that should be expected when you decide to attend college. Most people complained her standards were impossible and unfair, but I think it is reasonable. I wouldn't want to hang out with her, but I think she is a great teacher.

Cro is very helpful ourside of class but other than that is extremely hard and non-helpful.  Lots of busy work in class. Grades essays extremely hard.  Could be quite mean in class and often lectured us like middle schoolers in Italian then English just to make us feel worse.  If possible, don't take her class

I didn't think she was bad. Yeah, she's strict but that's needed when learning a foreign language. She really wants to make sure you're learning the material and that you're ready for 2001. She was much better than my 1001 prof.
The only reason any does well is because of the department, if it were up to her the class would be completely impossible.  Too much work and too high of standards.

Very hard. You will hate coming to class everyday, but in the end, you will probably get a good grade. She is very mean and people are afraid to talk in class. She grades very harshly on the temas. Overall she is a good teacher but I would not recommend her.
Was late on returning work, but overall very helpful and receptive to student questions.  Made class interesting and fun, even if scrutinizing at the same time.  Beautiful accent.

Very Hard! She seems nice in the beginning but is fake. She makes everyone stand up for the whole hr is they aren't as perky as her. Makes fun of students in class. So everyone is scared to ask questions or make comments. Tests are easy but class is awful! Don't take this class!!!
Her class is almost impossible.  I do not know why the French department has to be so fussy about work.

She will help you if you go to office hours, but communication outside of class is awful. Lots of busy work and larger assignments, but she does a poor job of establishing what should be the most important.

I also had her for 2002 and in both classes there is a lot of busy work, but her enthusiasm for the subject makes the class fun and interesting. She grades extremely hard on compositions but the tests are doable, and she goes to extreme lengths to make herself available outside of class. Not an easy A (or B), but an enjoyable class.

she is charming at the beginning of the semester and then becomes increasingly annoying and frustrating to the point of wanting to rip your hair out. especially when you see that she grades like she's teaching at the sorbonne! impossible to get a's, work your ass off to get b's and be happy with your c.
She is very difficult especially when grading essays
Her class has way too much busy work, and even if you do it, you won't do well in her class.  It is extremely difficult to communicate with her also.
don't take her class
I learned a lot in this class, but the homework and busy work are crazy. If you want to put in time and effort take her...you probably still won't get an A.

She's absolutely wonderful! She's the best french teacher (she's a TA) I've ever had...I learned more in that class than in all of my other classes combined You definitely have to study and do your homework, but going to class was a pleasure!

At first, this class seemed like it could be pretty interesting, but as the semester progressed, I realized how weird this lady is. She is very well read (as a lit teacher should be) but she gets distracted easily, does not lead discussions well at ALL, and only wants to hear responses that align with hers. She picks favorites- her grading shows it

Maiorini is very eccentric, goes off on tangents, and is unorganized. There is a weekly short essay, one midterm, a group project, and a final. Most of the class is spent discussing the books/films. Lots of extra credit for attending events outside of class. Participate and it's an easy A if she likes you. Heavy reading and focus on explication.

At first she seemed like an awesome teacher that I would love, but as the semester progressed everyone in the class started to notice how crazy she is. If you don't answer one of her questions in the way she wants you to she makes you feel dumb. I don't like the way she teaches because she'll just go off in a tangent, and she's a hard grader.

Ned is the most amazing teacher I have ever had!  She is so encouraging and extremly brilliant!  She truly cares whether students learn or not, which is rare with professors.  She's quirky, fun, intense, and deeply intelligent about all things literature.  Her passion for teaching truly shines!  I highly recommend her and anything she teaches!
Thought she hated me at first, but she was just getting me interested in her class.  Final grade was a huge surprise and she is kinda sexy/hot.

She's a little bit crazy...and definitely unorthodox, but she is definitely entertaining.  She can run off on tangents frequently, but overall, she really does care.  The class isn't difficult as long as you participate!  That's the one thing that will make or break you in her courses.  I have had her twice.  So speak up!

At first, I was very hesitant to take her class, but I learned so much. She challenges you, but it is not possible. you're grade comes as a suprise, but if you attend class, try your hardest and participate, it will be a very pleasant surprise! She also gives lots of projects and presentations!

The grades I just gave do not give her justice.  Believe me it is a great class, and she is a wonderful teach.  It is not easy, but that does not mean it would be hard to get an A.  I was not interested when I signed up but she draws you in, and I ended up with an A, she is a great person and one of the best professors I have ever had.

She has the passion for and knowledge of her subject, however she lacks clarity and picks favorites.  She's very willing to meet with you out of class, but still doesn't offer much advice or help.  She's eccentric and hard to follow and lacks direction with lectures.  She commonly goes off on random tangents.
best teacher ive had at UGA so far... is enthusiastic and very easy to level with.. is fair.. cares more about teaching than grades.. and who doesnt like a sexy english professor?

I enrolled in this class to fill the multicult. req. & was thrilled. Enjoyed her class so much that I took another one of her comp lits for an elective. Yr final grade is a surprise, but participate actively and respectfully & she'll like you. Read texts v closely--she's detail-oriented. Her passion & knowledge of lit is impressive and inspiring.

Took this class as a multicultural requirement, and was pleasantly surprised. Ms. Maiorino cares more about her students learning and actually becoming involved in the material and class than dishing out grades. She teaches the class like a college class shoulg be taught.
No Comments

She is not very helpful. Tells students not to worry about grades. Doesn't return quizzes and assignments in time to fix your grade. Very unclear about her expectations. Doesn't make class very interesting. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS!!

He's a funny guy! Definitely passionate about biotech. The class is not bad, mostly just lectures. We have presentations at the end of the semester and they're very interesting to see what other's talk about! Would take again!

Dr. Adang and Dr. Pierce are both awesome professors that clearly have a love for biotechnology. Others accurately describe the class as mostly a trivia-based biotechnology class, but you end up learning much more about the biotech industry as a result. Advice, START THE ESSAYS EARLY because they are a real pain to finish up and know the ppts.
ratingTags_Rating: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--So many papers

comment_Rating: Dr. Adang is a great guy. Really caring, nice, and personable. The class itself is pretty disorganized and all over the place, but I liked the guest lecturers. Learning about such different sides of the biotechnology industry was super interesting. The MC sections of the exams can be hard. Like someone else said, they're mostly trivia questions.

My dislikes with Biotechnology are the poorly organized ppts, the long essays, and the not-so-easy exams. Exams aren't truly take home. The multiple choice portion is taken in class and they're difficult to study for because their based out of ppts that are mainly trivia. The essays are take home, and I wish they posted essay prompts earlier.

Pros: Seminar-style classroom (20 people) Very approachable Few assignments during the semester Final project is a powerpoint and essay of your choice Scheduled class block is 2 hours, but he often ends it within 30 minutes Cons: Tends to get sidetracked during his lectures Powerpoint slides are sometimes cluttered/poorly formatted

Adang is super cool and funny, but the class is mainly taught as a seminar with guest lectures. Hard to understand what is important for MC part of exams (ppts are scattered), and the essay portion of the exam is always graded pretty subjectively. Class focuses more on business of biotech, which I didn't find that interesting - wish I took human 2.

Dr. Adang and Dr. Pierce are quite the duo, with very dry senses of humor that compliment well to the class.  Mainly guest speaker based lectures with a group project and 3 take home tests (START THEM AS SOON AS YOU GET THEM - this is why I got a B in the class) I thought the material was interesting (except the scientific patent info)
No Comments
No Comments
