Dr. Promislow is a very nice guy, but expect you to keep up with the class and lectures! Gives optional homework and vocab at the end of each lecture. DO IT! These terms and questions make up the content of the exams.

I like him. A little nerdy, but in a good way, always plays music before class starts. I found his tests pretty easy and got As, but I definitely studied and did better than most. He puts homework at the end of each lecture- do it! He gives vocab terms, which will be on the test, and questions- some of his questions he asks will show up on the test

Dr. Promislow is a great lecturer- it's obvious that he's passionate about his work. Tests are somewhat difficult- do the homework (questions are often pulled directly from there) and ask questions. Also, take detailed notes in class- he posts his powerpoints online but purposefully leaves things out that are discussed in class. Study old tests.

Dr. Promislow is a great lecturer- it's obvious that he's passionate about his work. Tests are somewhat difficult- do the homework (questions are often pulled directly from there) and ask questions. Also, take detailed notes in class- he posts his powerpoints online but purposefully leaves things out that are discussed in class. Study old tests.

Way better than most science teachers I've had at Georgia.  His lectures are a little bit unclear, so make sure you go to class and do the homework.  However, his tests are pretty fair, and a lot easier to understand than other genetics teachers.

Dr. Promislow is easily one of my favorite professors I've had at UGA.  He's very enthusiastic about what he's teaching.  His tests are on the difficult side, but as long as you study the book and the notes well you should be fine.

Professor McCaskill is very passionate about her lectures. We did tend to not really follow the syllabus but that wasn't a problem for me. Her class if very much discussion based so you have to read in order to be able to gain your participation points. She's willing to help you redo your essay's if you want to get a better grade.
ratingTags_Rating: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Accessible outside class

comment_Rating: An amazing teacher who gave constructive feedback while also offering words of encouragement! Easy to talk to and always gave great advice. Loves to teach and her lectures were always engaging. There is a 15 page final paper, but she allows you to turn it in in intervals for feedback, which makes it less intimidating. Would take her again!

Dr. McCaskill is a great professor when she choose to be. However, she often cancels class, shows up late, or leaves early (she rarely will give a heads up). 

When she talks about the chosen text, her passion is palpable and her lectures will be engaging. Those lectures are too far and few between. 

I would avoid taking her if you have the choice

I loved taking Dr McCaskills class! She is really passionate and all the books she assigned are very interesting. She is a tough grader, but if you meet with her, she will allow you to do corrections on the first paper. Participation is important. There are 2 papers and a group project. Take her if you can!!
ratingTags_Rating: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment_Rating: Dr. McCaskill was a fantastic professor. Despite it being her first online class, she executed the online format very well and managed to still make her 'lectures' engaging and interesting. She used a wide variety of media (documentaries, graphic novels, etc.) which I really appreciated. I only wish I had more classes with her!
ratingTags_Rating: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Caring

comment_Rating: Dr. Mccaskill is very smart and seems to enjoy what she teaches. She picked great readings for the semester and allowed the class to choose the final readings. She is hilarious and engages the class in very important matters.

Dr. McCaskill was a professor I enjoyed taking once but only took once because I dont think that at the time I understood quite what she wanted. Professors want humility, sincere effort and hard work into their classes. I would definitely take her again in the future. A kind hearted woman w a gung-ho interest in her subject. Go Dr. McCaskill!

Loved her. Left class feeling so open minded. Class discussions are amazing and leave you feeling inspired. She is so smart. She helps you learn how to think intellectually. Not a hard grader. There is about 2 papers, one test, and a group project. Would 100% recommend for everybody. I would take her again. One of my favorite professors at UGA.

She is very nice. We had two papers (one research) and a presentation, attendance also counts for a large portion of the grade. She is very knowledgeable in her field but is very easy to get off topic. She adjusted the readings halfway through class. I recommend buying the books one at a time, since she may exclude them later. Would take her again!
Pretty easy A. Dr. McCaskill talks a lot though. For the first month or so we were still going over the syllabus. She also changes the schedule often.

McCaskill is a very sweet woman. She means well and is very helpful to anyone who she knows is trying. Work load was very manageable and she even let the class adjust the rubric so we didn't have a final. Her lectures stray off topic regularly but if you go along with her and her viewpoints it's a very easy and really interesting class.

Dr. McCaskill loves to hear herself talk. Honestly, I think she is a very nice woman and means well, but because of her endless, slow, and redundant speaking, we never stayed on task. She would ruin students' presentations by interrupting and speaking for them instead. This class was extremeley frustrating, esp. with mandatory attendandance.

There were three essays and a role playing game that seems horrible, but is actually really easy. She graded harshly on the first essay, and REALLY easily on the second, and the last is just a critique of the "game" you play the last month of class. She cancels class a LOT. We skipped a total of 3 weeks of class, and the last week was canceled.

If you're looking for a class that has a lenient attendance policy (you can miss 5) and a teacher that always cancels class, this is the class for you. If you're looking for a class that has meaningful discussion, I would look elsewhere. This is not an English class, it's more like a modern African American history class,

Dr. McCaskill is awesome!! she's really passionate about the subject she's teaching.  she cancels classes alot, which is nice.. for this class, we only have to write 2 papers and do a group project. it's really not that hard or time-consuming.

Dr. McCaskill is a really pleasant professor.  She is very willing to make time for students, and she always make sure she has room for every student during office hours to help revise papers.  She finished grading my first paper late, so she let me extend my due date for the second paper since I wasn't able to write it with her feedback.  Her rese

Dr. McCaskill is nice and easy to deal with, and very responsive to the needs of her students. She quite often pushes back due dates, and cancels class. She's pretty distracted by her research, but she does make the class interesting for the most part. Talk in class and she'll like you.

Her FYO class was about business and ethics. It was super easy, just reading articles and writing a 100-word reflection every week and one group project. It was kinda slow and at times boring, but an easy pass. Prof Pagnattaro is super sweet and a great role model and friend to have at the university
I had Dr. P for my FYOS, and she is AMAZING. Honestly, the kindest most caring professor ever. I wish I was a business major so I could take another one of her classes

Dr. P was an awesome teacher who is so knowledgable in the subject. Tests were a little tough, but she lets you use a sheet of paper with notes during all tests. As long as your review sheet is detailed, tests aren't bad. She truly cares about her students and wants them to enjoy the material.

Dr. P is such a great professor. Possibly the best I've had yet at UGA. Her class is by no means easy though; the Honors test is pretty long and difficult. Her class could have been so boring, but she takes the subject matter and makes interesting just by her being the great teacher she is. On top of that, she will do anything to help a student.

Dr. P is one of the best teacher's I have had during my two years at UGA. She will work with you, she is clear in her expectations and lectures, and she is good at explaining the material to everyone. She is also a really cool person. Spent some time with her out of class, and she's easy and fun to talk to. I would take her again in a heart beat.

Clear and relevant material. Expectations and grading are very fair and clear. Really interesting and current discussions. She gives a review before each test that cuts the amount you need to know for the test in half. Take her.

This site wasn't around when I took her ENG101 class 20 years ago.  In fact, I had a uga email address I didn't know what to do with... anyway, I remember Ms. P being a great professor.  I was high most of the time, which explains my C in the class, but I do remember enjoying the it...
Dr. P is a wonderful professor! it is rare to find a professor who actually cares about her students and she definitely does! I loved the class but you definitely have to study.

Dr. Pagnattaro was very enthusiastic about the subject and taught all the material while still making it easy to do well in the class if you put in the required work. While she was sometimes hard to understand, she really helped me learn to love this subject.

think twice before taking this class during summer. Tests are hard and tricky. A lot of material, we went through 3 ch. the day before the test. Take her during regular semesters, maymester is torture!
I took this class during maymester. Material not is not that hard but you have to study for test because its kind of tricky, but she willing do go beyond measure for you to pass the class!!

Dr. Pagnattaro is a great teacher, but the subject itself is very difficult. Red the book, come to class, and go to her office hours whenever you don't understand something. Recommended, but come prepared to work.

Dr. P is the best professor I have had at UGA. She is very smart and obviously cares a great deal about what she is teaching. I would definitely recommend her class, but come prepared, it is not a cakewalk.
Her class was very laid back and organized. Her outlines come straight from the book. She really loves the subject and wants everyone to love it too! And she is always avail for help. Take her class!
My favorite professor I've ever had! Very interesting. Tests are pretty straightforward, and she gives outlines, which are really helpful.

Very nice, helpful teacher with a genuine concern for students. I struggled with the tests although they are generally very strait forward. She makes class interesting through use of current events and discussions.
By far my favorite professor I had at UGA.  I wish her the best.  Incredibly interesting and really has a way of making you so involved.  She is also kinda hot.

GREAT TEACHER! very compassionate and very nice person. great assignments and tests, while long and challenging, are quite fair and once you get the hang of them should not be too bad. highly recommended!
Dr. Pagnattaro is very helpful and a good teacher. The class is a little hard, butI really enjoyed her as a teacher. Make sure to read the book!
No Comments
She is by far one of my favorite teachers. Extremely helpful. Class is primarily discussion of current events in relation to what you're studying. I highly recommend Dr. P.

This class was more difficult and stressful than it should have been. The tests were over material that wasn't covered very thoroughly, if at all. It is literally impossible to decipher what is important material to learn- or at least what's "important" from her standpoint. Avoid this class if possible.

I thought this class was going to be fun and easy but she made it miserable. Her final "review" was the most worthless thing I have ever seen, she gives us the outline of the final an says oh its cumulative that is literally it, we ask if can narrow it down an her response is she cant feed us the info in other words she cant be a teacher sorry.
DONT TAKE THIS CLASS, YOU ARE SIGNING YOURSELF UP FOR FAILURE
she's the best.  nuff said.  she is th coolest teacher ever.  she is so smart too.

I took her Classical Mythology class, and the only complaint I have is that she didn't explain her methods of grading before we took the Midterm exam. Therefore, the whole class did much worse than expected, and it made it almost impossible to get an A. I got an A-, but only after attending several extra credit lectures. Not an easy A!!
Marilyn is a great teacher.  She's got an awesome personality, and makes learning fun.  Really laid back.  I learned so much in her class.
No Comments
She is an awesome teacher!  Very pleasant.  Makes class interesting and enjoyable.  One of my favorite teachers so far.  I love this class and the teacher.
Dr. Watkins is really thorough. You really need to have great memory skills if you want to pass her tests. She communicates well for a online class. I wouldn't take her again though, tbh.

Nice woman, but the class is made for pre-med kids. The quizzes are tough, but she drops your 3 lowest grades (and you have a quiz almost every week). Her papers seem daunting, but she's an easy grader. It also helps to go see a TA.

She is the worst teacher I have ever had. Nothing that comes out of her mouth makes sense. No one knows whats going on because she always talks about extraneous material. Its so annoying. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS.
great teacher, enthusiastic

This class was so boring for me. I am not an art major but I have enjoyed other art classes I have taken with different profs. First, it may have been that it was ancient art which starts with cave paintings. She also sounds like the teacher from Peanuts. It was awful. I dropped at midpoint and picked up a  half-summer class instead.

dr. van keuren is great! she has a lot of enthusiasm for  the subject and is almost always cheerful (as long as you're not late). i'd definitely recommend taking her class. don't bother buying the textbook b/c the tests are all based on the notes.

Dr. Van Keuren is the best professor the Art History department has. She is helpful, nice, cheerful, and promotes discussion and debate. Her tests are extremely easy. I made over a 100% in her class due to all the extra credit opportunities. Great class!
Love this lady, she is so helpful. She is way too happy and perky in the morning, which makes it fun
Great teacher, great lecturer!  Love her! Definitely take her class she is very straightforwad and very fair.

I will admit, I was kinda terrified of Dr. Kim towards the beginning of the semester, but she ended up being one of the sweetest professors I've ever had! So smart and knowledgeable. The final ended up being open-note and not cumulative, which was amazing. Study hard for tests and make sure you listen to what she emphasizes in lectures.

This class is pure memorization. It's not difficult, but you must know everything on the handouts she gives you, which makes it arduous. This class was my first B. It's NOT as easy as you might expect. The book is useful but the chapters are very long.

If you're really interested in a high level linguistics course, Dr. Kim is an excellent instructor. Really knowledgeable, professional, and interesting. But it's not an easy-A type, low work  course--be prepared to work. So take it only if you're really interested in linguistics.

I had her for phonetics and for Langs. Of the world. Would not take her again for phonetics, but i loved her in the other class. She isn't very receptive to questions or questioning her grading, but is very sweet otherwise. Made high B's in both classes.

I've had her for 3 classes now... and if you don't love Dr. Kim, try wathing any Mrs. Swan lip, then go to class. Makes it that much better to go to class. And I say that lovingly, she' brilliant and is very well known in the linguistic community as one of the top acoustic phoneticians in the U.S.
Dr. Kim is friendly but serious. Her helpfulness and clarity of explanation is moderate. But that was not a problem for me in the intro linguistics course, because the material was easy.
I loved her class. I'm a Linguistics major, so my interest level was high to begin with. It's definitely not a class for people who aren't willing to notice small details, but overall pretty easy.
she is so hard to understand! linguistics is not the class to teach if you have a heavy accent! the class was not very interesting either.

Had her for two classes. Tests come straight from the notes, and she usually tells you almost exactly what will be on the test if you listen during lectures. She is kind of snappy sometimes when you ask a question but she's usually pretty funny.  I made A's in both classes with just studying a few hours the night before the test.

LING 2100H was a pretty good class. Dr. Kim is reasonable, and I did pretty well with a minimal amount of studying. She can be quite funny, and she is interested in and knowledgeable about linguistics. If the subject doesn't interest you, the lectures may be boring, but I found them helpful.

She got angry with students who looked at their textbooks during class because she felt like what she had was more important. She should have relied more heavily on the book because she simply was not that great at explaining things. She is a nice person but I would never take a class from her again. Her reviews are not helpful at all.

For the guy who's complaining about extra credit. She said if you attended class EVERYDAY then she would give you credit. Obviously, u weren't in class EVERYDAY to catch that. Get your facts straight before you complain and give misconceptions to others. Dr. Kim takes her question directly from her notes and she curves on tests! She's great

This was 2100H. I found her to be a nice, amusing lady, but she is extremely reluctant to answer questions, even in an honors course, that are relevant to the course but perhaps not explicitly in the curriculum. Her teaching methods were so boring they drove me to tears, but it's still a nice A for honors credit.

Kept my interest and can be pretty funny at times. She gave us handouts for each chapter that we filled out together during class. The tests are not very difficult, but don't wait until the last minute and make sure you know everything on the handouts. The only thing is she gets really upset if you question or try to argue something.
I enjoyed the class.  Do make sure you start studying before the night before the test.  If you really want to get on her good side be prepared by review day and ask some random questions.

Dr. Kim was a pretty good teacher. She tries to keep things simple, although she is at times hard to understand due to her accent (Korean). But beware: she flat out lied to the entire class about 4 extra credit points she promised to us at the beginning of the class. Make sure to get her to clarify and get her to write her policies down.
Don't wait until the night before a test to study; there is too much information to memorize in one night.  Pace yourself and you can easily get an A.

She's a very nice lady and she is actually interested in getting to know her students. However, tests are hard, she isn't very helpful on review days, and gets angry if you question your test grade. This class was pretty easy for an honors course, so if you need one don't be afraid to take Ling 2100H. It could be better, but is doable.

Tom's class is one of the easiest I have taken in college. I learned a fair bit about AP style from him and made an A with almost no effort. It was highly, highly unusual for him to keep us in class for the entire class period - he often canceled class or let us out 20-30 minutes early (for a MWF class). Very sweet man with a wealth of knowledge.

Tom is a gem of a man. He truly wants to see his students learn and succeed. He gives genuine feedback to all of the writing assignments you do. I do not have enough good things to say about Tom. Take his class. It is a little difficult to get an A, but not impossible.

Dr. Hudson is an wonderful man who wants only to see his students succeed. All tests are open note, and he gives great feedback on in class assignments. He is very personable and makes an effort to get to know his students. If you want an A though, you should get published in some way, and Hudson helps out with this. Overall, a great prof to have.

Professor Hudson was an amazing teacher. He's super laid back and always has something funny to say. His tests are all open-book/ open notes., and he doesn't make us do a lot of assignments. He really helps you learn and get used to writing like a journalist.

Hudson was great and I definitely recommend taking him! There are only a few assignments and he guides you throughout the entire thing (and plus it's all open book). Rarely ever had to stay the entire time in class. Out of all of the JOUR 3410L teachers, he is definitely the best.
He gave very few assignments and what he did give was open book or with his guidance. He's funny and classes rarely take the entire time, plus you can miss labs and not have it count against you.

I had Professor Hudson for my news writing lab. He is so kind and cute. If you want an A, you have to get published and attend a speech to write about. It's nice to have someone encourage you to do that, and he helps the best he can. You'll also write a few practice articles and do a buttload of AP style exercises. AP test is hard, not impossible.

Professor Hudson is one of the nicest teachers I've ever had...but that didn't make him a good one.  His grading had absolutely NO rhyme or reason.  One day he would give the class 100s and the next class every person would get a 50.  You never knew what was required to get a good grade, it was just luck of the draw.  Nice guy, not so good teacher.

Tom was very encouraging and extremely friendly! He got to know his students well and actually gives out extra credit to be published. The tests were fair and easy. He's a very fair grader and is willing to work with students. Probably one of my most favorite professors at UGA.

Awesome professor. Tests weren't bad at all as long as you did the practice work. Getting published counted as extra credit. He really encouraged me to get out in the world and get my writing published. I learned a lot from him this semester. I would DEFINITELY recommend him to anyone!

Hudson was the best teacher I've had at UGA. I was not happy when he told us on the first day that we had to be published to make a good grade in his class, but now I'm completely grateful that someone pushed me to do it. He actually cares about what becomes of his students after they leave the classroom, something hard to find in most teachers.

One of the best classes I've taken at UGA. He is an enthusiastic professor, and he is a very fair grader. The class is very easy, but requires a lot of group work. 2 tests and 3 group projects including a lesson. I learned a lot about teaching and classroom management from this class than any other education class. Take McCullick!
He's alright. Makes lecture interesting, labs are fun, but you DO HAVE TO STUDY. Grades harshly for the kind of class that it is. NOT an easy A, gotta work for it!
Tests and quizzes can be a little tricky. Gives options for extra credit. It's not a bad class.
Amazing teacher! He really understands what college students go through and tries to help you through it. He's really down to earth and cares about his students. Take anything he teaches!!!
Keck is awesome. You will LOVE him.

Loves his job and it shows! He is fair and empathizes with the Redcoat marching band. Showed his true colors in China and gained a lot of respect.  He stuck through everything with us and worked day and night to make things work. Great guy.
KECK IS THE MAN!!!

Yes, Laplante is a good teacher but she is intimidating with cold calling, & I didn't feel as I could go ask her for help. I felt as if there was nothing I could do to improve in the class. I didn't feel that she wanted us all to pass, and almost half of the class dropped after Test 1 grades. I wish I would have taken Schwab.

Dr. Laplante has 5 years experience and through trial and error has learned that some students need to be scared into studying. She follows the academic honesty code to a tee and will not give any student a break nor will she take crap from students. I personally adore her and I got her back for all those clueless haters. Dr Laplante for Prez!

She is a great professor. The material is tough and she really pushes you, but she is always willing to help. She seems really intimidating at first but she is honestly very nice and approachable. This class is hard, no doubt but you will learn a ton.
Great professor.. the textbook, however, is the biggest waste of trees imaginable.

Dr. Laplante is a great professor and she doesn't get the credit she deserves. Tax is not an easy subject but you really learn a lot in this class and she will help you out if you go to her office hours. She will challenge you to take it to the next level and I think she is doing us all a favor because of this.
Dr. Laplante is a great professor.  All accounting classes are hard, and her class is not one of them.  It's just seems that way because it's the first one you'll have to take.

Material is very hard, and she just makes it harder. She prides herself on making the class average on the tests very low (our class average was a 56 on the first test). Even reading and doing all the homework didn't help. Don't take her if you don't have to, maybe take Managerial and wait for the next semester to see if someone else teaches.
Very difficult class. Don't take it unless it is required. The professor is very hard and she will call on you, so be prepared every day. Expect to spend a lot of time studying.

Very nice instructor. But MAcc students in tax, come to class prepared -- she'll call on you at random. Just read through her notes before class, work through the examples,  and you'll participate better. Terrific teacher.

If you are NOT a spanish major, choose another course! You read tons of books and discuss the topics and watch some movies. But exams are tough short answer/essays over material. If you don't like english lit, you won't like spanish lit! I wanted to learn more vocab and improve my speaking skills, instead I learned about 1930's authors in the Spain
Not an interesting subject, but she's knowledgeable

Although the subject matter is fairly boring, she does a good job of making it somewhat interesting. If you go to class, take notes, and read the assignments, making an A is pretty easy. Her tests are very straightforward and based almost solely on her lectures.
No Comments
Quite possibly the best teacher I've had in college.  She's incredibly helpful and kind and funny.  She makes a kind of scary subject really interesting.

He is the most adorable man ever! He literally makes psychology super interesting and fun. He doesn't teach at this school anymore, he Teaches at Middlesex Community College in Lowell, no matter this guy is brilliant and hansom, if you have the chance TAKE HIM! the work isn't hard and it's interesting. Super nice guy! <3
makes the most boring class funny because of his self hating sense of humor
Best tuba professor ever

He's really just a cool guy that inspires me to do well on tuba-euphonium. He's a great tuba player but an even better teacher. Keeps you interested in tuba-euph ensemble with cool music, and always gives great lessons. Highly recommend!!!

DZ is an awesome tuba-euphonium teacher!! He really knows how to get down and understand students, and he explains things simply and easily. Not only is he a respectable musician, but an amazing teacher. Every lesson has at least 20 quotables. He gives music majors Tune of the Weeks in which you have to write 10 blurbs on prominent pieces of music.

Zerkel is one of the best tuba/euphonium professors in the country without a doubt. He is a great human being and has really impacted me in an extremely positive way. I wouldn't be half the musician I am today if it wasn't for him. Go Dawgs.
best teacher i have

David Zerkel is by far the best euphonium teacher I've ever had.  He is laid-back, but still expects a lot and expects you to produce when it's lesson time.  He always has a positive outlook on things and is, simply put, a decent human being.  For any tuba/euphonium players thinking about UGA, you could not walk into a better situation.
No Comments
You should see him handle a Bass Guitar.  El Chewbaka!

Takes a lot of effort to teach effectively.  Accent is light and pronunciation is very clear.  Practical about expectations of spoken and written German appropriate to the skill level of the class.  Favors a lot of written homework, since practice is very important for a foreign language.  Cares about the subject.
Good
No Comments

Ms. Clay is fantastic! She is so warm and friendly, and she can be hilarious, too. She spoke a lot of English in my class, which made it easier but maybe not as helpful. Unfortunately, I had to get the newest edition of the book which was really expensive. No other complaints! She is a wonderful teacher and person, and you will love this class.

Ms. Clay is a sweetheart. Currently taking Spanish 1002 summer course with her and I have nothing negative to say. She has renewed my interest in Spanish and definitely has a talent for teaching! Try and get her as a professor. You won't be disappointed!

AWESOME TEACHER!! She cares so much about her students & is available to help if you just ask. There's alot of assignments, but it's good because you have alot of grades that can help you overall. One of the best teachers I've ever had... I DEFINITELY would take her again!! :)

Senorita Clay is AMAZING!  I'm confident she's the best Spanish professor at UGA.  She really wants everyone to make an A and you learn so much.  I never missed a class, am terrible at other languages, but I finished with an A. Class work is easy if you listen and so is the online work.  Make sure you do the homework. The final was horrible though.
Senorita Clay is fantastic! I couldn't have asked for a better teacher for this class. She is by far the most helpful professor I've ever had, and I highly recommend her.

She is a wonderful teacher! Very helpful and she really wants you to do well in the class. She gives a ton of extra credit and activities to help you understand the material and do well in the class. Make sure to participate often in class!!
She was very nice, and very patient with the students.  I liked her a lot.
I agree, I think she's a great teacher also.  I hope I get her for a higher level course.

The other post is totally off.  I had no knowledge of Spanish before and I did very well in the class.  If you study and actually use your brain, you'll do great in this course.  This teacher is by far the best teacher I've had.  She is patient, and she makes the course very easy to understand.  Highly recommended for beginners! :)

Excellent Teacher!!  She is incredibly sweet, fair, and she goes out of her way to help her students.  I recommend this teacher to anyone who is a total beginner, like I was, in Spanish.  If anyone has anything negative to say about her, they're probably just holding a grudge because they made a bad grade in the course.  Very fun class!
Horrible teacher. She didn't do anything and basically just sat there and expected everyone to already know everything. Never take her course unless you already know Spanish.
